comment: Mark's class can be challenging, but staying engaged and using resources like Unstuck study for study prep goes a long way. He has a traditional teaching style, so attending lectures and asking questions is key. With effort, you can do well in this class.

I took his class my second semester, by far one of the worst professors I have ever had to deal with. His class still haunts me despite me despite being a 3rd year who will never touch chemistry again. I'm so glad I'm in engineering and not chemistry so that I would never have to deal with him gain.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Very difficult class, you really need to study.
Honestly, just pick someone else...
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I loved the fact that he sent out his lecture slides but hated the fact that he only read the lecture slides and think that is enough. You have to be very specific about your questions or he won't help you. He's very strict on how he grades and tests feel impossible. Harsh grader and won't give you half points if you missed the answer by a digit.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: I believe that Mark is not terrible at lecturing overall as I did attend lectures and learned a good amount, but the problem is that his pop quizzes are targeting the slackers which is unnecessary in my opinion, and the miscommunication that happened with his TAs which made it much more difficult for them to run the labs and discussions.
He doesn't care about students also only responds to select emails. I don't think the material was very challenging, but he definitely made it so.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
I once went to office hours  to ask for clarification on what I did wrong on a spectrometry question. His response to my question was that I deserved less points than I initially received and if I were to ask again, he would personally deduct points from my lab.
Lovely experience.
Still have no idea what I did wrong

Everyone says Mark is a horrible prof, but its because they did poorly in the class. Mark is a very traditional professor, if you study, go to lectures and ask ques, u will be fine. Quizzes and Midterms are all based on the lecture slides. People say he does not teach, but he always stops for questions, but no one raises their hand, so its ur fault
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He doesn't teach. Just reads off PowerPoint slides and doesn't explain anything. You'd be better off taking it at community college than deal with him. He also wants more respect than what he gives. Plus he wants a paper proof for almost everything if your missing class, exams, and quizzes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment:
Before every midterm he looks at the test and tells the class exactly what to expect. 
Take notes on this day and maybe he'll give you 1 or 2 answers. Cause he does that. 
Quizzes 1 a week, (no heads up on the content) for full/partial credit. 
TA's are absolutely amazing. Make friends and study on the weekend.  
A is possible. 1 standardized final
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: This was my second time having him unfortunately. He focuses most of his energy on the people who don't show up than the ones who are sitting right in front of him. Does not allocate his time wisely when lecturing at the beginning at the semester which leaves us cramming at the end. very difficult to communicate with bc he is never straightforward.

My grade in the class fluctuated a lot as coursework in the class is heavily weighted. If there is low attendance in lecture, he will give pop quizzes. There was also a problem where labs were ahead of lecture, so you had to self-learn the material before going into the experiment which was an overall stressful experience.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This guy runs off of his morning pepsi and if he doesn't have it, he has a nasty attitude. Often degrades his students and constantly threatens us. Also gives pop quizzes to get back at us for not showing up to lecture. Lectures don't help and he always gets behind and ends up cramming quizzes and exams at the end of the semester. Don't recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: You're gonna regret this

This man did not give us scratch paper for out final made us choose between cheat sheet or scratch paper. Keep in mind that he didn't tell us directly and this was not clear in the sent email late at night. The TA is the only reason why I'm surviving this class. It's bad. Trust me. Go take class at a city college, it's not worth the pain.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Mark is very kind when you first meet him but as the semester rolls on you come to realize that he often demands more respect from you than what he gives back to you. He can be strict during lectures and has threatened suspension for students who don't attend them. Even after dropping a midterm score, more than 60% of students failed the class.

he's one of the only options for lower level chemistry courses, which stinks. he's not an incredible lecturer, but his lecture slides are available online and all the information can be found in the textbook. as long as you have a decent understanding of the material, the tests and quizzes will be fairly straightforward.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Chemistry is not hard but Mark makes it hard because his explanations are horrible and very excessive. There is no homework and only quizzes and three midterms. The discussion that comes with the class is very helpful, should definitely take advantage. My advice would be to make a study group because it will help you be on tract to pass the class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: one word. Rude. You want to pass this class? go teach yourself and the rest of your classmates. If he wasn't even teaching it might even help the students. Went to the hospital? that's tough is what he would say. He gives no second chances no matter what happened. so good luck!!!
Super test heavy, there is nothing in the gradebook so beware of getting anything less than perfect on the midterms.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I wouldn't say the content in this class is difficult but he makes it difficult for no reason. To be successful, I would say attend lecture as much as you can and utilize your discussion time to ask questions. My only complaint is Mark himself. He treats us with no respect and belittles us. That is not how you treat your students. Avoid him.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Mark is a great professor. By far the best one in the chemistry department. To succeed in his class go to discussion and ask questions! He builds his quizzes on discussion worksheets, & the exams on his quizzes. I'm a visual learner so his lectures weren't very helpful for me, but the slides he would upload would guide me very well! Very caring!

Professor Mark is a great professor and treats all of his students like adults. Many of his students dislike this because they have to put in a lot of effort and have to be independent. If you prepare for his tests often and effectively, you will excel in this class. Homework is not required but is extremely helpful to do well in Chem 001.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: I wanted to like this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: For an introduction class this was hell on earth. You are better off learning off the textbook and watching YouTube video's than attend his lectures. Chemistry itself isn't difficult but Mark made everything 10x harder. If you don't pass the 3 midterms forget about passing the class. AWFUL.

He needs to use three microphones. If you don't care about his class, just be there and do other work from other class so that the likelihood of receiving a pop quiz is less possible when there are lots of people. Although sometimes he does say important stuff once in a while.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Grading is unfair. Ive seen bright classmates in his class that lost many points because of trick questions he never taught in lectures and for small mistakes in quizzes. He doesnt provide extra credit or curves when nearly the majority is failing the class. Also unprofessional for not announcing quizzes to students because of lack of attendance
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: never wore his mask. his childish behavior of not allowing benefits he previously gave has affected us all ,bc of no-shows . he has plainly told us he hates our class and is taking it out on all instead of the few students that behave bad. he does not care for his students. he didn't put an effort to help students as the class average is a 55%

The most unprofessional professor I have had the displeasure of having. Makes a point to always remind you that he dislikes the classes he teaches and how he was a better grader before us. He constantly belittles us in lecture, and seems to take pride and glee on the fact we are breaking down and failing. Honestly makes you feel really discouraged.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Mark has to be one of the most insufferable professors Ive ever had, Chemistry by itself isnt too difficult to grasp, but this guy made it 10x more difficult. On multiple occasions he insulted and yelled at students in his class and made very little effort to support the vast majority of the students who were struggling. Avoid him at all costs.

You're graded just based on quizzes and exams. Quizzes were difficult and you aren't allowed to have a cheat sheet for any exam or quiz. The class average for any quiz or exam was either an F, D, or a C.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He doesnt allow cheat sheets and is super strict on grades
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He has a 50 slide lecture for a 50 minute class, refuses to use the microphone and talks decently quiet, can't be heard everywhere in the lecture hall. He gave us lectures on how bad of a class we were. He gave us a multiple choice question on a quiz and expected us to write in the actual correct answer because the real correct answer wasn't given.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Unnecessarily strict and counterintuitive regarding attendance for lectures. Worst professor I've had. His TA's feel like the real professors compared to him because all he does is read slides and get angry at everyone during stressful exam days. Needs to be looked at by the school honestly.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Honestly, Chem 001 isn't super difficult. The problem is with the way Mark teaches and runs this class. It's absurd that the only way to even get points is through exams/quizzes. You can't catch a break even once. Get ready to sell your soul to chemistry if you take this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Mark said to my class point blank that he hated us and wouldn't allow us a "cheat sheet" for the final. This was hurtful and unprofessional as he allowed every class the years before to have one. His main reason for saying he hated us was due to people missing the 8am lecture... don't punish the good students who attend lecture based off the bad 1
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: This class is honestly the hardest class I have ever taken. The class is based only on quizzes, midterms and finals. He can be really negative towards people who don't show up to lecture or are even a minute late to a lecture. He says lecture attendance doesn't matter but then talks mad stuff about people who don't go. In short terrible class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Mark really doesn't care if you fail the class. Each Midterm was 150 points and the final was 300 points, and on top of that, the only things that go into the grade books are the weekly quizzes which are worth 25 points. If you fail any of the midterms, and ace all the weekly quizzes, you'll at least have a D in the class. No extra credit either.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: So first of all, this man usually talks in front of 200 people without the mic provided by the school, so if you are not at the front row, good luck. And there was one time I missed the mid term because one of my family was in hospital and he didn't let me make up for it. Don't take this dude. PLEASE DON'T

Possibly the toughest and the most stressful class anyone can deal with throughout the semester. Tas are much more helpful when it comes teaching. Mark basically just reads off the slides and hardly projects his voice so even if you do attend lecture, its hard to hear. This class just consists of quizzes and exams so good luck :/
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Honestly, attendance isn't necessary for lectures since the slides were on canvas. Mark just reads off the slides word for word, and when he does explain a concept he overcomplicates how to solve it. The TAs do a much better job at teaching. Class is only based on quizzes and exams, no other assignments. Needed more assignment opportunities.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Vidensek became threatening/testy. He insulted the class for not asking questions and used his busy weekend to prove he was more productive and apt to teach Chemistry than we were to ask Q's. He threatened us that he could fail us if we sustained from asking questions. Lastly, he mocked us in another class for how we didnt ask questions.

The quizzes are way more difficult than the practice problems he goes over during lecture although he is willing to answer as many questions as students have in order to assure they understand the material.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Mark's a pretty nice guy. He's understanding and clear about instructions. I had him online, so our tests were all multiple choice and relatively easy as long as you did well on the discussion quizzes and discussion worksheets. He didn't assign any homework at all, practice problems are up to you to do if you feel the need to. Overall, pretty good.

Mark is really sweet and cares about everyone. Lectures may get boring and will give quizzes if attendance is low. Do the book's problems to study for quizzes, and study quizzes for the exam. My TA was helpful. Go to office hours if you need help. Quizzes are not multiple choice but exams are. He is patient and teaches decently. Took him Fall 2020

I had Mark for both chem 001 and 002, and I loved both classes. He's nice and cares a lot about his students, just watch out for pop quizzes (especially if there's been low attendance). His final is all 3 midterms put together and he lets you have a cheat sheet, which makes it a breeze if you just study correctly.

Real talk his class isn't that bad, but him as a person is not understanding nor respectful. He puts no effort into making sure his students succeed. He is also very stubborn when it comes to issues you are having. No second chances are given in this class. You pass or you fail.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Mark is a nice professor, he cares about his students. The grading is a bit tough. Your grade mainly consists of labs, quizzes, and midterms. I would take his class again if I had to start over, but I didnt find his lectures or teaching style very helpful. (Everyone learns differently though) Other than that hes not a bad professor!

Tbh if you rely on lecture to help you learn new concepts than choose another prof. There is a quiz every week that is worth 25 points and consists of literally 3 questions that are so hard (no multiple choice on quizzes). There is no partial credit which is the worst part. you'll do well if you take good notes and study the topic more after class
He is a very kind professor. If you keep up with the reading and practice problems every week youll do just fine
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: very good professor, however, get ready for rigorous labs and lectures. in lecture, when you want something else, he is the man of the hour, but the lectures would only make more sense if you asked questions to him personally. Also, get ready for labs. manage your time wisely and use your resources because your grade depends on it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He is a great professor, however you will only understand what happens if you ask questions and really understand what he is teaching. He may be different in person, but I don't understand his lectures and have to go back to read slides since he goes through them fast. Easy to pass though! No homework, quiz every discussion, and a week to do labs.

Amazing professor. Everyone complains about him but its because he won't give you the answer. Pay attention to his lecture notes mainly he exams are kind of easy if you study. Final is literally the midterms verbatim! You will succeed if you put in effort. Had him for Chem 1 and Chem 2 he is so nice he looks intimidating but he's a teddy bear :)
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: At first you guys will dislike Mark. You will dislike how light his voice is, and how boring it will get in class. It is lecture heavy! Office hours help! Although he seems like a tough grader, he really looks out for us and his Final is exactly like all the midterms combined, so he gives you a really fair chance to pass the class. Strict but nice!
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Mark is a bit harsh but only because he cares about his students. He will give pop quizzes if the majority doesnt attend lecture. However, he explains things thoroughly and answers all the questions you have. If you do not give him respect he will be more mean. He is amazing and drops lowest quiz, worksheet, and lab.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Honestly, he complicates things more than he needs to. My advice would be since there are no other options other than his course, is to find a sold tutor or TA to go to. My TA taught me everything I need to know and Mark was basically the mascot with the PowerPoint. This is where the "in college you're going to have to teach yourselves" comes in

Mark although I was not a big fan of him at first he is an amazing professor. i. have had him for 2 semesters and i never really understood chem until I took his class. it does require you to put time and effort into it. if you do the homework problems although not required are useful because the quizzes are based on them and the midterms.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: used textbook for practice problems. do the practice problems in textbook and lecture slides and what he does on the doc cam
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: *thumbs up*
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: Just study and go over the lecture slides. You will pass!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Lectures are boring all you need to do is study and you will pass

by far the most unreasonable prof. Was working with a branch of the UN and notified all my profs I was. going to be at a conference in march a month prior. Smooth sailing until he moves the midterm to the week im gonna be gone, refuses to let me make it up despite saying i could make up my labs b4 moving the date, then refusing to let me withdraw.

As a person he is very nice and understanding but as a professor he is mediocre at best. The discussion classes help a lot but the quiz setup is horrible! He does not tell you what chapter/chapters the quizzes are on.

Do not be scared of this teacher. He is a passionate chemistry professor that will provide you everything on his lectures that will be on his quizzes and exams. Make sure you understand the concepts that are provided on his slides. Be sure to look out for his announcements that would be provided with the topics that would be in the midterm.

Vidensek was alright. Took his Chem1 freshman year, and it wasn't that bad. If you took Chemistry in high school, you should be familiar with some of the topics covered in the course. Could've ended up with an A if I putted in more time and effort. He won't say when you have pop quizzes in lecture though :(
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Vidensek taught me a great lesson. I have always enjoyed chemistry but due to his method of teaching I have ended up disliking it quite a bit. Study as much as possible and please prioritize the midterms. The lesson I learned was to pay attention to the resources available for this class as those that did were the only ones that passed.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Prof. Vidensek was pretty clear about earning the grade you deserved, and therefore offers no extra credit whatsoever. His lectures are VERY dry and I found it hard to concentrate at times. It takes a lot of practicing different problems to understand the material.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Mark Vidensek is a great guy. The issue with the course is that your grade consist of quizzes, midterms and the the final only! He gives no homework so there is no way to bring up your grade. I personally did not like the way this class was set up and this course doesn't give students the opportunity to learn and thrive in chemistry.

I haven't gone to a day of lecture, and I have an A. Midterms are 10 questions and 150 pts, study and understand, don't memorize, and the class is as easy as pie. If you took AP Chem in high school its p much the same. His slides regurgitate what's in the book & the TA's give out the book problems. There's a quiz after you finish a chapter.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mark is the reason that I now have a chemistry minor. He knows what he is talking about. Go to lecture!! He will give pop quizzes when attendance gets really low/right before break. I went to his office hours and it was very helpful!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He is so amazing! One of the nicest professors but definitely will need to attend lecture to understand what is going on in class. He also gives problems that are very similar to the exam to study. 10/10 would take this class or any class with him again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great lectures and makes sure everyone understands everything before moving on, take this professor if possible. best chem professor hands down.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: In the beginning his class was on par with the syllabus but after a while would get behind. Midterms were easy but consisted of 10 Qs. If you got even 3 wrong your grade would drop. Quizzes become a thing that slowly bring up your grade if you get 100% but if you were to fail a quiz your grade goes down. DO PRACTICE PROBLEMS! go to office hrs!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many

comment: Participation matters!. Attending to office hours helped me throughout the semester. He helped me through every problem that I needed step by step. The midterms were fair, and the final was easy. I suggest you do every practice problems in the textbook and show all work during quizzes because that is what is going to get you a 4.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I skipped every single lecture and got a B. The quizzes are graded very hard, you have to show every single step or else you will fail. I missed a part of a question, it dropped me down 8 points! and every single part of the question was perfection. the TA Michael is a very tough grader, I don't like him, never responds to emails.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is okay but it was a wasted time going to discussion

-Attend lecture or you get lost fast. -Syllabus said he would drop lowest one quiz, but on the day of final, he surprised us by dropping lowest 3. -Quizzes were all taken in the discussion except for 2 in lecture, which also happened to be the most difficult of the semester. -Great person outside of class, but very difficult to follow in lecture.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: Mark was a really boring professor and would serinate me to sleep I actually did good in the class but had to hella study. I think that as long as you have a good TA youll be good.

Overall Mark was an okay professor. I found his lectures to be extremely boring and difficult to learn in. The course has no homework. The quizzes, midterms, and final make up your grade. He also gives pop quizzes during lectures. BE CAREFUL BECAUSE HE GIVES A POP QUIZ DURING LECTURE THE WEEK OF THANKSGIVING BREAK.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: Quizes are a bit difficult. As long as you go over practice problems and lecture slides you will be fine. Mid terms are significanty easier then quizes.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Quizzes are graded heavily, I recommend looking back at lecture slides and working on practice problems!
Lectures are mostly clear and to the point.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Love Mark so much, I plan on taking him again for CHEM 002!

OH MY GOODNESsSSS! Vidensek is like an amazing chem teacher!!! He really dumbs down something you do not understand so you can understand during lectures as well as office hours. He is such a caring professor for our education and such. I can not thank him enough for being better than the other chem 002 teacher!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: understand the material. go over the practice problems. Ask questions

Mark focused on PowerPoints for each chapter. He went over the slides during lecture. He also uploads them online for later review. Your grade is based on three 150 point midterms and ten 25 point quizzes. Study hard and be aware of pop quizzes during lecture. Most quizzes are taken during discussion and midterms are taken during lecture.

In order to pass this class, you really need to do the practice problems. If you don't do the problems, good luck. He says that lecture is mandatory, but if you miss a lecture, his slides are really detailed, just make sure you do the practice problems. Make sure you actually take the time to go over your notes
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: TBH If you do the homework(which is not required to be turned in), go to lecture, and take time for study groups then you will pass his class. The more effort you put in the greater your chance of ending with a B or A. I usually did not go to lecture because it was not my style of learning, but I still passed the class with a B+.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: Overall Mark teaches well but dull, but this course is a tad difficult. Class is graded by just quizzes and exams. The problem is that there is so little amount of problems, an example of a quiz. He has 3 problems, 2 of them are worth 5, and the other is worth 15. His quizzes require you to read the chapter again, and again. Perfection is key.

Vidensek is a great professor. His voice might be monotone but when you put that aside and pay attention, he explains very well ! As long as you keep up with your readings and do the assigned homework, you'll do good with his quizzes and midterms. Also ask questions when you don't understand something and he'll try his best to explain it.

Professor Vidensek is incredibly kind and helpful and you can tell that he truly cares about his students. He is happy to assist anyone who needs help during office hours. He doesn't curve his midterms or his finals so you have to study and truly understand the material. There are weekly quizzes given in the discussion class based on the homework.
Very thoroughly explains material whenever a question is asked. You get out what you put into the class.

Vidensek was a very helpful professor. Sure his lectures were boring due to his monotone voice, but he is very nice and helpful during his office hours. I highly suggest attending office hours because he will show you how to solve a problem step by step.  He doesn't curve but the problems on midterms are very similar to the ones on the final.

There is no curve in this class. Getting an A on the Midterms is doable, he gives you optional problems to do as homework again if you want, but guarantee he will use these problems in weekly quizzes. The quizzes are made up from the homework questions, midterms from the quizzes, and the final exam from the midterms.

Mark is one of the coolest teachers on campus, that's if you get to know him in office hours. He is a boring teacher in a class for 50 min. He has very easy tests. There are 3 midterms and 1 final. Quizzes matter. There is a quiz every week. Take up a lot of your grade. Also it's easy to ace midterms. I have 94% and I'm a terrible student (2.4gpa)

The way he teaches is boring and confusing. Going to lecture isn't mandatory at all only when you have a midterm. I learned more from the book than i did from his lecture. Everything he teaches he also puts online so just review that and you will be fine.

Took Vidensek my freshman year first semest, so I had no idea what I was getting into. His midterms- 10 questions,so you have to know your Chem if you want to pass. Showing up to lectures is a must, since he often decided to quiz you in lectures instead of in discussion. Mark's lectures are confusing, which I suggest you read the text, and study.

I took Chem 01 and Chem 02 with Mark. It was tough, even though those are still pre-requisites. I found his lectures confusing and I was lost most of the time. If I would have asked for help more often, I would not have struggled as much. Don't be afraid to go to his office hours! He may seem intimidating, but he really does have a kind heart.
you get the grade you work for, he doesn't curve or round

His grading is a little tough but his assignments are doable if you're willing. In order to pass his class you must study, study, study! Do the homework problems, go to lecture, go to office hours,  and ask questions.

Mark is a tough professor. His exams are harder than practice problems and lecture examples he provides us.  My discussion instructor wasn't helpful either. He stated this in my  final exam "I know your common mistakes and I'm using them against you. I also put in pseudo-right answers too." He should be helping us overcome mistakes!

He is by far the hardest teacher i have ever had in my life. But he is also a very fair teacher and he tries his best to help out. He is very prompt at returning emails and genuinely cares and tries to be fair to students. His tests are worded very hard and extra studying is definitely needed. Practice problems also save your semester in his class.

I had Vidensek for Chem 01 and Chem 02. I am retaking Chem 02 this semester because I failed his class by one point. This is my main issue with Vidensek other than his crazy hard tests that are only 10 questions long. While he considers his grading system "fair" it is a no budge, no exception policy. There is no flexibility in this class.

As long as you do the practice problems, you should be fine. I found them helpful and I still passed the class. Always watch for sig figs because that is what he will use against you. If you have a good TA that will help the most. Use the slideshows along with the textbook for examples. He can be mean sometimes and does not curve ever so work hard.
He is not very lenient. If the average score on a midterm is a C he will not curve the score.

Pretty straight forward professor and let us know right from the beginning that the grade you receive in the class will be one you earned. I think that's what makes it all the more satisfying when you know you did good. He doesn't round grades, yet by doing the readings, practice problems, and attending lectures you should be able to pass easily.
Print lecture slides and do the practice problems if you want to pass.

He gives out pop quizzes so you attend lectures. He wants you to learn and the quizzes aren't hard at all. It's just he gives them out in the wrong time or before you can study. Lectures supplemented with practice problems will definitely help. The class isn't hard. It's just how he administers his class. He will definitely not curve.
Hard class, he does not explain well moves too quickly, grades unfairly.

Mark does not have a decent grading policy. For example, he does not think that procedure matters more than answers, thus, if you do the whole procedure correctly, but miss the answer, you get an F on your quiz. He makes it very difficult to get an A. Mark does not curve the class. Only about 1 or 3 people in his class get an A. Avoid Mark.

Mark is a great teacher. His power points are very helpful and I would have much rather have had Mark for Chem 02 than Vickery because Vickerys test are from the ACS while Marks are from his two midterms combined. Mark also a great site to look at.

Mark is a very good professor and is very respectful of students' learning environments. His quizzes and midterms aren't hard if you do the practice homework problems and study prior to the tests. It also helps if you have a good TA.

The work is simple at the beginning and gets harder as the semester progresses. He DOES NOT curve the grades. Its important to go to lecture to do well in the class. Having a helpful TA is also good. Previewing and reviewing the powerpoints and textbook will also help.

Thought this class would be super easy cause the first midterm was EXTREMELY easy but all of a sudden he started giving pop quizzes during lecture which killed many people's grades and the midterms got harder. You really have to be up to date w/ the material. & it's pretty stupid how the quizzes, midterms, & the FINAL are all weighted the same -_-

Very confusing about concepts and relies on his TA which are pseudo professors that makes mistakes on the concepts of the subject matter. Grading system is made up of quizzes, midterms and finals. If you receive a perfect grade in the finals,you will receive a low grade since his grade dsitribution is not reflective of student performance.

Mark is a cool guy. Cargo pants, polo shirt, and cowboy boots no matter what. Lectures are pretty boring. Does not mess around when it comes to equality so you might catch a couple breaks here and there. Nice guy. Do the homework, get help when needed, and you'll do fine.
Vidensek is a very helpful professor and actually enjoys what he is doing. He will treat you well as long as you are on his good side.
So he is a very tough teacher, he does have his moments were there will be quizes in class out of no where and if you taking chem 2 he does go through the material very fast so ALWAYS be prepared.

The only instructor teaching the course. Recycles questions from lecture on exams. Very friendly instructor. He does have quizes during lectures every once in a while, so always be prepared. Grades are based on a 1,000-point system, so nothing is curved.
Just get the easy lab TA's and you are set.  Got C's or less on all exams, failed final, and ended up with an A in the class because I got perfect scores on my labs

never went to office hr.Didnt like the class even though he was nice.he gets happy when talking about exams.around ten to twenty questions on finals/exams.it may be an advantage or not.when i took chem 10, i admit,I miss chem 2 n his exams bc it was only around ten questions compared to 45 questions for chem 10 n i dont think Mark curve the grades.

You get what you put in the class. He knows what he is talking about but talks a little to fast and makes some things sound so much complicated-er. So either have a good TA or read the darn book, and dont under estimate the little quizs cause they add up and ruin your grade.
His tests (when I took them) were 10 multiple choice chemistry questions. He has been known to have patterns on his tests (abcdabcd etc.)The only thing he has going for him is his rockin' bod.
Difficult. Will have to put in more effort than minimal. Powerpoints are very helpful.
Mark.... He's hard. The class is hard and he's not very helpful. I haven't met one person that has passed his class the first time. If you have another option for chem 2 I highly recommend it.

You can just print out his PowerPoints and go to office hours for clarification. Reading the textbook gives you a more in-depth understanding of the material covered. Paranoid about cheaters during midterms, and only gives 1 pop quiz. Labs will help you out tremendously. Recommend tutoring too.

How do I even begin to describe Mark Vidensek. He's a Chemist. He's hard (hard because he expects college level work, duh). I failed the first time and I'm taking it this summer. You CAN'T miss a single lab because it will help your grade a lot. Do yourself a favor also and don't miss lecture. You will regret it come test time.
hella hard
Good class straightforward.

Straghtforward,no gotcha-games, and it gave me a good foundation in chemistry when I took his course. Definitely  enjoyed it and the coursework comes from information in the book when I took it. Good class overall.

Good class, straightforward - (not easy but dense with information). The class is designed to give you a good foundation in CHEM so really try to slug it out during lecture (it helps on hw and classwork). Quizzes and exams cover what's in the book and material - so definitely study hard, but luckily there's no gotcha-games on his quizzes.(4.2/5)

His class is overall good. You'll definitely have a strong begining foundation after taking his class and its straightforward-that's good. (There's no "gotcha-game" on quizzes unlike other professors). Be sure to homerun it in lecture (there's dense information)and it helps in classwork. His office hours are also very helpful so do go. (4.2 /5)

Mark's class is altogether pretty darn good. I took his beginning CHEM class and it was informative as well as straightforward (his quizzes are bassed off of material covered so no "gotcha-game" unlike other prof). You'll definitely have a good foundation in his class but make sure to put effort and bear through dense lectures. (4.2 out of 5)
Mark is awesome. Very willing to help students if you come in and ask for it. Very fair--he believes if you study and work hard, it will pay off, which is true. Great guy

If you study from the textbook, you will pass the class. Office hours helps, but tutoring will help you even more if you don't understand the material. Make sure to go over his powerpoints, this is where most of the exam question material is! He may have a few pop quizzes (depends), so be sure to attend.

He is enthusiastic about what he teaches but expects a lot from his students and many people dont realize how much you have to study for the class until the see their midterm grades. If you go to office hours and look over your notes you should be fine; he is willing to help you if you go see him.

Frustrating to deal with.  Studied my hardest and went to many of his office hours but still didnt understand the material.  He grades exponentially on quizzes, in the BAD way.  I knew hardly anyone who passed even a single quiz of his.

He's a nice person despite his appearance. His class is hard but it's his way of showing that you can't slack off in college if you're serious about your future. He's also extremely fair, although it's not always in the student's favor.

Mark is "ok" book can be very confusing unless you go to lecture, quizes and midterms are fairly easy and multiple choice, most dont bother studying so dont be shocked to hear "avg for midterm was 68% ". Not unusal to have 3 question quizes. Easy class IF you study but expect to learn on your own, personally I would not recommend him if possible.
Quizzes, Midterm, and Final is hard but everything is multiple choice.

Very knowledgeable and you will appreciate him after the class, but not during. Obviously this is college and you have to study. One thing is that he doesn't care if you pass or fail and doesnt care if your clicker doesnt work, so you have to be prepared for everything.

This guys is extremely boring, makes the class way too hard. Monotone voice. Extremely anoyying grade system. Half class fails, and denied a review session wtf? Quizes before every lab that can be on anything, which encourages cheating since people take quizes later, so if you don't have connections, you're screwd! This encourages cheating x100

He seems to know what he is talking about, but i feel that since most people in the class are beginners, he takes it easy on us. Also have you notice when he flexes just to show off his muscles, apparently he is a farm worker and he like to show his guns.

Taken his class 4 times now. Twice for prechem now twice for chem 2. The man knows his stuff but his methods are not affective for me. He reminds me of a lawyer arguing a case in front of a jury when he lectures. Pases back and fourth just like one.
He was amazingly helpful! An A is achievable with hard work and dedication.

He's such a nice guy. It's just that his classes tend to be hard. But hey, if you really pay attention in lecture, do well on the homeworks, and do well on the quizzes, you'll be fine. Just don't slack off. EVAR!

Seriously, the level of intelligence must be low at this school. Chemistry is by far my least favorite subject next to biology. I went to class, sat on facebook, didn't take notes, did the labs when they were required, did the homeworks, and got a C. To me, that shows that the class really is not that bad. I put forth LITTLE effort and still passed
this class is hard and mark is super strict and has no heart!

The class was alright, I should have studied more. If you look over the slides he posted, it's like going to class. The explanation and main points are on his ppt. I recommend asking people in the earlier classes to see if there's a quiz. :)
Pretty good overall. Very nice guy and was fair. The material itself is hard but he helps pretty well. Dude is RIPPED for a teacher.
Mark is a great teacher if you take the time to read your textbook and pay attention in lecture.
Hard if you don't read, but Mark is very helpful :)
He's very hard. grades are not weighted so a midterm and final is worth the same as a quiz. overall, attend discussion and you should be fine as long as you live and breath the book

He was pretty helpful when I had him two years ago. Some kids cheated in his class and it made him sort of crazy. But there is no avoiding him at UCM if you are a science major. Get use to it. Overall he was(is??) a pretty effective teacher. (BTW it says Chem 12 but this just means I had him for both Chem 1 and 2.)

Mark is alright, but his grading procedures are terrible. The exams don't determine whether or not a student knows the material very well and the quizzes are a poor excuse to make students attend class. I find reading the book to be more beneficial than attending class, but if you don't attend class, you risk missing a quiz.
He is very friendly but the material covered is difficult.
An average college professor, knew what he was talking about. He tends to go a bit fast in lecture and doesnt use the mic. The class isnt to hard as long as you study and go to office hours.

Confident to the point of cockiness.  Claims that his class is easy yet doesn't understand why more then half the class fails. The tests are easy yet hard due to wording.  Gives quizzes on material just learned making them hard to pass. Doesn't care if your clicker suddenly stops working.  Says one thing then does another. I don't recommend him.

Over all jerk. His exams do not reflect the material covered in class. He also likes to tell his students extra credit points will be given, although he forgets to mention that they will not be calculated into overall grades. He also takes prose of his 40% fail rate. I'm glad I passed his class!

I had him this curren summer for Chem 1 and he wasn't too bad. His lectures are really dull and he's soft spoken. The class wasn't too bad, you have to do the homework and study and review in order to do well. I got a B in the class, however I'm extremly nervous for Chem 2 because he admits himself he gets even harder.

The subject matter itself is hard, so a lot of time should be spent studying it.  Vidensek himself isn't too bad, but it's hard to follow him during lecture if you don't pay absolute attention to him right away.  The first midterm is easy, the next two require at least ten hours or so of study to get an A. The labs are a toss-up, depends on your TA

Pleasant personality in office hours, but patronizing and lazy in explanations in lecture.  Highly recommend attending office hours and reviewing ppts before class in order to comprehend lecture.  However, midterms do demand total understanding and drive you to learn the material.  Otherwise, thankful that he will be leaving this year.

I think he is a nice guy and a great teacher. His midterms are the best midterms I ever had in UCM, because we can actually learn things from the midterms. For chem002, people shouldn't just want to get an A from this class. They should know the knowledge first. In order to get a good grade, you should be thoughtful and think twice about questions.

Respectable guy, not a great teacher. Used to work for some pharmaceutical company and often is verbose in his explanations of otherwise simple concepts. He caught people cheating last semester (the one I attended) and took it personally (taking it out on those who DID attend lecture). Probably my least favorite professor.

Apparently General Chemistry 2 was a lot easier back 3 years ago than it is now.  He's gotten a lot harder and I went into a trap when going into his class in 2009-2010.  His lectures get confusing fast and his midterms are ridiculously difficult and he expects you to know every thing just to pass the class.  It takes a lot of time and effort now.

fair grader & Good lectures.  Exams are difficult so be sure to study all main concepts and you will be fine.  Office hours are very helpful. Don't expect to have a grade handed to you just because it is a lower division course.  Be prepared to work hard and you will get the grade that is deserved.

Doesn't teach well. I had to use my knowledge of chem from before to get through the class. He gets very upset about cheating, and doesn't curve. He dropped 1 midterm for us, but still does not help since his tests are hard. Told us he would give us 50 points for attending class before Thanksgiving, but never gave us it.

My least favorite teacher/ professor yet. He pretends like he cares, but he doesn't. He has a temper problem. Mark is vengeful and it doesn't matter to him if his students fail or pass. He has "review" powerpoints, but when the midterm comes.. he words questions oddly to confuse his students and he adds topics he didn't mention in the "review."

This class is ridiculous and he pretty much expects everyone to fail.  His words of encouragement before an exam is "the test is extremely difficult, even the TA's missed questions, but they aren't studying it 24/7 like you guys"

If you want to get an A in this class then do the assigned homeworks and review the previous midterms and other exams (still mostly straight from the homeworks.) Lecture isn't much help since it's the same thing as reading the book. He's a nice guy over-all, he treats his students like babies...UGH I hate that!

Power points will only make the most sense if you read the chapter before class. He is willing to help but he always has alot of people in his office. Exams are just 10 multiple choice problems. Very bad when it means just missing 2 means you don't get an A. Try to get your hands on as many old exams as possible when studying.

He plays the whole Mr. Nice guy thing, but when it comes to the midterms you see that he's a total jackass.  All the stuff I knew was from high school and I didn't learn anything from him. Sucky professor and you people that think he's a good professor you're so wrong.

He is really an amazing teacher. His lectures are well organized and clear, the examples help a lot, and his arms arent bad either :)he puts all chem teachers to shame. i wish all my teachers were as willing to help as mark. AWESOME. i really recommend him
Has good powerpoint presentation but goes through it way too fast.
Go to class
This teacher stopped giving practice exams, so you cant use those anymore

Mark is really great at teaching!  He wants you to do well and is great at answering questions.  He definitely expects you to read the book before class, but if you do, it just flows.  By the end of each class, you find yourself working problems that would have taken hours to learn on your own.  I highly recommend his class.

Such a nice guy. Always willing to help. Go to office hour if you need help. Really cares about his students and he is good at explaining things. If you can do the practice exam, you will be ready for the test.
very boring lectures, just read the book and take the practice exams and u pass
Took this class in Spring 07. Very nice guy. Easy A. Easy tests. If you know how to do the practice exam, there should be no reason why you cannot get a 100% on the test.
No Comments

Very great teacher, while a bit monotone, he knows what he is teaching, and is very willing and able to explain things to students understanding. Plus while he may be a bit old, he does have some nice muscles

Goes the extra length to help students. Gives great, clear lectures, and encourages his students so that they want to learn Chemistry. Is a positive influence, and makes himself avaliable for students. Wants them to succeed. He looks intimidating, but he's pure sunshine.
Professor Abel is fair but the class can be tough. Attend lectures, complete assignments, and use resources like unstuckstudy to succeed. Grading is reasonable if you put in the work.

The professor lays out clear guidelines and rules to follow to get a good grade. You just have to put in the time to get the work done. He really tries to get to know all of his students and is very nice.

Abel is very good professor, he cares about his students and wants everyone to succeed, he grades extremely fairly and tries to give as much credit in exams as possible. With this course attending lectures may not be mandatory but he is a very good lecturer, and he is good at explaining concepts, the slides do help but they can be hard to follow.
Overall great professor. Teaches lectures well, offers a lot of resources, and interacts with his students. I believe the only downfall to my grade was that I didnt understand the material fully.
Good professor, the homework takes a really long time. Attending lecture and doing the homework guarantees you pass the class.
The class was mid, definitely needs a study guide
Be prepared to know the material and do problems fast on Exams!

Professor Abel Chuang thrives on student suffering, reveling in their pleas for leniency. He offers extra credit for compliance, coercing 5-star ratings, and laments low scores with a twisted sense of satisfaction. Beware of staged 5-star reviews. Thank you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Abel Chuang epitomizes academic dishonesty, exploiting his position for personal gain. He coerces students into inflating his ratings, feigns distress over less-than-perfect scores, and offers bribes for favorable reviews.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Amazing professor. Professor Abel makes thermodynamics feel so much more enjoyable and engaging. He truly cares about his students and even makes an effort to remember everyone's names. Would definitely recommend having this professor.
This professor goes above and beyond in his job. He does the upmost to help his students understand the concepts well. I'd suggest you take him if you can.

This professor gives you everything to excel in the class, but you have to work for it. The lectures are listening-based because he wants you to connect with the content more. He will occasionally post videos that go over the content in class and goes over homework problems. Going to lecture is advised to have an easier time. Very test heavy.
Great Teacher. Cares a lot about your learning.

The class is pretty rough, but going to lectures would likely help a lot, personally, I wasn't able to show up for most of them, which is a big mistake. Don't make the same mistake as other as well as myself, the lectures for this class are very helpful and make sure to review the homework, but not only the homework, but different variations of it.
Amazing professor, show up to lecture as he gives valuable information on the course. Super fair and wants you to succeed.

The exams and home-works are difficult, but due to my lack of understanding and studying, but in lecture the professor is very knowledgeable, understanding, and hilarious. You will learn in lecture, make sure you attend and don't make the same mistake I did, which was not attending.

The professor is very fair, and that is the best thing that can be said about him. If there are any bad grades it is almost always gonna be the student's fault, the professor provides plenty of resources to achieve whatever the desired grade is.

Professor Chuang is the most influential professor I have ever had. Very inspirational and an excellent teacher. He makes letures fun and he is such a down to earth guy. His class is very midterm and final heavy, so you do have to learn the concepts, but I would say the content is hard, not the professor.

Professor Chuang is the most influential professor I have ever had. Very inspirational and an excellent teacher. He makes letures fun and he is such a down to earth guy. His class is very midterm and final heavy, so you do have to learn the concepts, but I would say the content is hard, not the professor.

The only issue with this class and professor is how he weighs everything for your grade. You can do all the assignments, but if you don't excel in the exams then you will not do well in the course. The professor himself is amazing and cares about each student and learns everyone's names. Just be prepared for tests that make up a lot of your grade.

Amazing professor overall, the grading system is the only problem. Testing is 80% of the class, which is hard to recover from after not doing so well after one midterm. Overall his lectures are engaging and knows how to make concepts easier to understand.
Great guy.
Dr. Chuang is very attentive and clearly cares a great deal about his students. If you do your do-diligence, it won't be difficult to get a good grade

Professor Abel is one of the best engineering professor I ever had so far. The class overall is very difficult, filled with many concepts which can be hard to conceptualize. He is a very caring professor and really made an effort to make the class more enjoyable by always interacting with the students and really trying to connect with them.

This professor will try very hard to help you understand the material and pass the class if you also try very hard as well. Even though the attendance is optional, I would recommend going to lecture everyday because majority of the content that you need to learn is much better to learn in person rather than just looking at online slides.

Great professor who wants his students to succeed and provides a lot of help to learn the tough topic of thermodynamics. Lectures arent mandatory but are very helpful. Homework takes pretty long to do.

Best professor I've ever had! Tries learning everyone's name first thing in the semester and uses it when you ask or answer questions. Thermo is a difficult subject but Prof. Abel has the best teaching style ever to help understand it a lot easier. Be sure to do the homework, watch the review videos and understand the equation sheet. ASK QUESTIONS!

Overall enthusiastic in his lectures. Sometimes it moves fast, but keeping up with reading and homework is enough to prepare well for the exams. The HW takes me about 4 hours, so I advise starting early. The TAs leave good notes.

Cares significantly about his students and encourages the connection between teacher and student through his daily jogs. Attending office hours will help you in this course immensely and both the TA and Professor are extremely supportive

Definitely cares a lot for his students and will put in the time for you if you put in the time for him. If you need help, both the TA and Professor are very supportive and I highly recommend you go to office hours.

Professor Chuang is a good teacher that takes time and interest in reviewing the material that is supposed to be learned. He makes sure to review the material thoroughly so that you understand it rather than just memorize a few formulas. His occasional talks about his career helps give insight as to how it is working in the industry.

Professor Chuang makes an effort to connect with all his students. By the end of the semester he knows everyone's name. Lectures and homework are very important in order to pass the class. His lectures are very entertaining and interactive, he really makes sure everyone understands the concepts. Great professor who really cares about his students.

Professor Able was literally one of the best professor's I've taken at UC Merced. He genuinely wants you to succeed as a student and also in life. He'll give you everything you need to pass the midterms and finals by literally telling you what he is going to test you on. Hands down 10/10 professor!

Extremely nice and passionate professor. Abel wants the best for his students and wants you to succeed in his class. Make sure to attend his lectures as it's difficult to understand the content if you miss his explanations.
Professor Abel was great professor and often would joke with me and my table going missing. In all Abel very eager teacher and made thermodynamics a fun class to learn.

This professor really takes his time to help students understand this very hard topic. He uses lectures, videos, and hw to really help grasp your understanding , which would help on the midterms and final.

Professor Abel definitely was one of the best professors I've learned from. He lectures thoroughly and everything you're tested on is taught within lecture. There are no curve balls during the exams because as long as you pay attention he literally gives you a heads up on what concepts during lecture will show up during the exam.
Great lecturer and able to condense complicated topics into easily understandable material. Very clear on what is going to be on the exams and is very fair when it comes to grading the exams.

Overall, great Professor. The material seemed difficult but the professor simplified it and was easily graspable. The weekly videos help setup some of the homework problems and help reflect on past topics. The tests are heavily related to the homework so it is important to do it.
80% of the grade are tests. Nice guy but fairly weak professor when it comes to showing important parts of solving problems.

Prof. Chuang is one of the best lecturer's I've ever had. Makes easy-to-remember analogies of concepts, walks through homework problems, and posts review videos if you need additional help. 2 Midterms + Final. Tests are very similar to homework. Homework can be difficult. If you go to lecture and study homework, then you'll be fine.
Professor did his best to make sure students understood the material.  Overall, pretty good professor
Very Kind Professor, very difficult course but he makes it ver manageable and easy to understand
Office hours and lecture are super important.
Great Professor to take if you want to learn a lot and detailed
He really tries his best to make everyone that shows up to his lectures pass his class.

The professor cares about the students learning but the course itself is difficult and it requires several hours of study . The professor is great but you need to put the work and time to pass the class.

The kindest professor I have has at UC merced. If you are looking to take an upper div class and learn from a passionate and inspiring professor, he is your guy!!! You will not regret taking this class. Most entertained Ive been in alll my engineering classes ever!!

One of the best professors I've ever had. Passionate about the topic and very experienced in his field. lectures are engaging and funny, and also the best place to learn the material. Most of your grade comes from exams, but he does do excellent review before hand.

Professor Abel Chuang is a one of the best at UC Merced. He finds a way to make lecture interesting so you will pay attention(very funny guy). This course was very exam heavy, and a decent amount of homework which is basically your study material for the tests. He is motivated to helping his students pass his course if you put in the work.

Professor Abel wants all his students to succeed in the class. Overall, he is very detailed and tries his best in explaining the concepts in the easiest way possible. The homework is helpful for the exams and he is a fair grader. Also, he tries to make his class engaging, and his lectures are fun.

Professor Abel tries very hard to help his students succeed and he tries his best to get them to participate so that they understand the concepts. I think he is very motivating and he is an overall amazing professor.

The professor motivates students to do their best, and attending lectures is not mandatory. Thermodynamics is a difficult course in itself, but attending TA office hours is very helpful. Even though the professor does not curve in his class, he provides numerous extra credit opportunities throughout the semester.

Professor Abel Chuang provides a fair and exciting lecture where he goes into detail of the subject of Thermodynamics. He shows his enthusiasm in class and get to know the students that go to his lectures.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Thermo is no doubt a difficult subject, but Professor Chuang does a great job of guiding you through it. My recommendation for this class: just listen to him. Instead of taking notes, just stay attentive and participate during class, complete the homework (which is harder than the exams), and attend his office hours and you'll be set to succeed.

Abel does a very good job explaining concepts in class. Most of your understanding of the problems and seeing the steps and the process about doing them will be mainly achieved through the homework. I learned the most from doing the homework.
Prof is very passionate about teaching Thermodynamics and it is very evident. Homework was fair but time consuming. If you attend lecture you should be able to pass.
The professor is really passionate about the topic, making lectures very engaging and easy to follow. Spend time reviewing the homework and lecture slides to help prepare for the exams.
Professor is good at explaining concepts and wants you to succeed in his course. Content isn't too hard, just requires practice and understanding of concepts. No late work accepted.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Very good at making the concepts easy to understand. You need to understand your homework to do well on all the exams. Exams are based off of homework, but is still challenging. 2 Midterms, 1 final, weekly homework. Is also lenient on grading. I recommend Prof. Chuang to anyone.

I have come across many instructors in my educational career, but Professor Abel is one of the best instructors I have ever had. He puts his effort to make the lecture interesting, informative. He is very humble in answering students' questions. I really like his teaching methodology.

The professor's professional abilities in teaching are truly commendable. His approach to instruction is both engaging and highly effective in transferring knowledge. He possesses a remarkable talent for explaining complex concepts in a clear and understandable manner, which greatly facilitates learning.

The professor utilized visual aids in the lecture slides which were very useful and was happy to answer any questions. The professor would also be very detailed with the steps needed to understand the lectures and their corresponding assignments while also giving enough room to be academically challenging and promoting critical thinking.

I felt that I was prepared for the homework assignments and exams. Also, the lecture slides are well made. Participation takes place in the lecture. Such as answering questions or providing ideas on how to solve a problem.
The lecture slides are well prepared.
The slides are beautifully prepared and the course is finely ground to be absorbed easly by the students.
He asks for 100% attention during the class.
Really love how he engages with the class. Has friendly banter with students. Very encouraging about being able to pass and can genuinely tell he cares for students.

Overall he was a very enthusiastic and fun teacher. His lectures were more of a huge discussion session in which he drawn in people to participate in order to learn the material better. It was a very hard class which is graded very tough on tests but overall he did a very good job teaching. I would highly recommend him as a teacher.

One of the professors I can genuinely say cares about the learning of his students. Gives students all the necessary tools and material to prepare students for midterms, and finals. He is also really helpful and patient during office hours.

You will enjoy taking professor Abel he makes the topics really fun to enjoy in lecture and understandable. In order for you to do good in this class you must go to the lectures as the topics can sometimes become confusing also make sure to do the homework and understand it if you do you will be able to get a good grade as the test are base on Hw's

I found this professor to be really good at teaching. If you love learning, you'll love this class, if you hate it, this class will drive you insane. It is extremally test heavy and no curve at the end of the semester. There are extra credit opportunities, but very minimal. I recommend this to anyone who take their time to learn the material.
Was a very enthusiastic professor, difficult course, although would try his best to grade leniently and help on exams with review.
Professor Abel is a great instructor, lots of participation and interactive lectures. The course itself is difficult but the professor is fully aware of this and tries his best to help his students.
Tests are heavily weighted but grading is fair.
Tests are heavily weighted, but the grading is fair.

Overall the class is pretty tough. The concepts are hard to grasp but the professor is great at explaining tough concepts. When you leave the lecture you leave with a good understanding of the concepts. Studying homework is a great way to study for exams.

Really enjoyed class. Concepts aren't difficult but there is a great amount to cover further into the course.  Homework is purely based off the lectures and the exams normally have a study guide video that helps with understanding the concepts which I advise you practice thoroughly. Attendance isn't mandatory but I wouldn't suggest missing class.
Professor Chuang's class is difficult but if you prepare you will be fine.

Professor Abel Chuang is one of if not the best Professor at UC Merced. He is very helpful outside of class and genuinely wants you to learn. Thermodynamics was hard but there is no better person to teach it than the GOAT himself.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: This professor cares a lot about students success not just in class but in life. His goal is to make sure all the students are able to understand and grasp the information provided. He's very straight forward in his expectations for students. Understands that the course material is not easy to comprehend and is very patient with students.
The professor was very understanding and was excited to share his knowledge of the course with us every day. Rather simple to follow along. Must to your hw to get a good grade.

Professor Abel is one of the best engineering professor I ever had so far. The class overall is very difficult, filled with many concepts which can be hard to conceptualize. He is a very caring professor and really made an effort to make the class more enjoyable by always interacting with the students and really trying to connect with them.

Very entertaining during lectures, making them engaging and easy to pay attention to. The relaxed lecture environment makes it comfortable to ask questions and work at everyone's pace. The homework is very reasonable in length, and the optional problems and their solutions are great for studying before an exam.
Overall tough class, but the Abel explained everything well in lecture. He also made it a point to remember our names and some personal details about us. Overall he cared a lot.

Exams given are "hard" but fair. There was no surprises and everything was do able given you study. Lectures was not hard to sit through as he would make jokes or tell a short story relating to topic to regain the classes focus when low. Serious  when it down do it but had moments of laughter. If you don't put in the work it will be a hard class

Abel is a very unique professor. Not only does he go out of his way to make sure students understand the topics in class, but is also very understanding and easy to talk to outside of class. He makes an effort to learn all his students' names and I respect that. His class is made to learn effectively. It's not just a slideshow. There's soul to it.

Excellent professor. This is a difficult class and it can be hard to conceptualize concepts. The professor would go over things until he was reasonably certain most of the class understood what was going on. He made sure we were actually understanding the material and not just regurgitating stuff to get a good grade. Seemed like he really cared.

If you attend class everyday/do the homework, you will learn, like if you don't pass, you will still feel like you learned Thermo which maybe a hard pill to swallow. Thermo is really difficult and the exams are hard because in school we are not taught enough on how to look at solving a problem in different ways. But overall fantastic professor.

The course wasn't horrible, but if anyone isn't a great test taker. Avoid this class at all costs. But, other than that, the class is very interesting. The class does involve a lot of time and detection because it isn't a very easy subject to learn. The professor is interactive with his students, which is very helpful when it comes to learning.

The content within the course can be extremely tough and hard to handle at times but the professor does his best to remain energetic while explaining his lectures. Although he does rely heavily on verbal explanations that aren't as detailed as his notes.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor helps those willing to put in the work. Always accessible outside of class and makes a true effort to connect with the students. Very funny and caring. Tests are a majority of the grade and thus asking for help and studying is essential for his classes.

This professor is willing to put in the work to help the students pass so long as they meet him half way. The material for this class was extremely difficult to conceptualize but he always made sure to have availability for the student who were struggling. He can go a bit fast during the lectures so it's best to review the slides after class.
The professor's teaching style is very effective. Focuses on both theory and execution. Attending lectures is a must, lectures slides are posted but its not the same than going to class.

Overall, Professor Chuang is a great professor. He is there when you need him and is always available to talk and help you out. Please take advantage of his office hours and practice the homework thoroughly. Thermodynamics is a hard class that is not to be taken lightly, or you will learn that the hard way. Pay attention and ask lots of questions.

Lots of experience in the field. Material is hard but understandably so. Very charismatic and does his best to help his students understand the subject material. The homework is very helpful as a tool to learn and study for tests.

This professor is an amzing professor. He has a passion for engineering along with wanting his students to learn. He has an amazing background with a lot of experience. You will need to put in the effort to study but as long as you put in the time you'll do fine. He is always willing to help out so don't feel afraid to reach out to him.
Material is difficult but is tough well. You can learn a lot by going to his lectures and his midterms are based on the homework. He gives extra credit as well.

Abel is a great Professor, class is difficult due to the material but Abel is great at explaining it during lectures. He is also good at answering any questions you may have. Plus he makes the class enjoyable to attend.

Thermo is not easy, he will let you know that from the jump. You won't pass the class unless you really put the work in but he makes an effort to give you all the keys to succeed. He's super cool outside of class as well, a real good dude and will almost certainly know the name of every one of his students by the second month.

Professor Chuang is very passionate about what he teaches and is able to make complex ideas simple enough for all to understand. He doesn't try to trick you in anyway, and what he will teach you both in class and on the HW are what show up on the exam. Simply engaging in the lectures helps you do better in the class.

Abel is an engaging professor who really does care about his students success, he lays the expectations of the course on the first day of class. He explains the critical thermodynamics concepts simple enough that even a 5th grader could understand. With that being said, the thermodynamics class is tough and you need to spend a lot of time studying

Professor Chuang is incredibly understanding and accommodating. This is especially helpful when the content matter is so wide spread and complicated. He seems to genuinely care about your success in the class as well as in life!

This was the second time I have taken Thermodynamics, and there is a clear difference between the first professor I took the class with and Prf. Chuang. Chuang knows the difficulty at which the topic is, but he breaks it down to make sure that all the students understood the topic. He broke topics down and even helped make connections for us.

He was a great professor. I failed Thermal the first time I took it but not with Abel. The first time I took it I didn't understand anything the previous professor said after taking it the second time with Abel, everything made more sense. The exams are not bad as long as you study the Homework and homework solutions. One of my favorite professors.
Always come to lecture, make sure to review his lecture notes after class. Do homework, and come to office hours if you have any questions.

His teaching style is very fast pace. It was hard to take notes in class b/c how fast it went. However I think he was very caring and did try his best to make sure everyone understood the material. He recorded many lectures notes and videos on how to do the homework. Overall, I think he was a good teacher.

Prof. Chuang is a good professor that makes it easier for students to understand thermodynamics. His lectures are structured well and makes them entertaining by making jokes here and there. He is always willing to help and cares for his students. His homework helps you prepare for exams, so make sure you understand the concepts behind it.

Professor Chuang made lectures enjoyable with plenty of jokes. He also cares to learn students' names and will check up on students from time to time. He also reinforces important concepts and has very interactive lectures.

Professor Chuang is an amazing professor. His lectures were always welcoming and enjoyable with funny jokes here and there. He's also very caring and helps out students as much as he can to ensure they understand the material.

Professor Chuang is a great professor. He acknowledges that it is a hard course to take and is realistic with his expectations of the class. Lectures cover all the course material you need to know to succeed in the class and doing the hw is critical. Even though it's a hard class it has felt rewarding and the professors sense of humor helps.

This professor is great at teaching you the concepts. He tests you on exactly what the homework is except with slight variations that require you to understand the concepts behind the problems. Do not just copy answers from online or you will fall behind. Learn how to use the tables, and if you do not understand go to his office hours for help.
Great Professor! The class is well organized, and I was able to learn a lot. The lectures are engaging, and he makes the whole class feel welcome. Even though it's a tough class, It is taught well.

His class is straightforward. the midterms are based on the homework and he is pretty lenient in grading. He cares for his students in the sense that he takes time out of his day to make review videos of the homework.
Abel is a good professor who keeps you engaged in his lectures. His midterms are a bit difficult but if you study enough you should be okay.
Explains concepts during lecture and problems on exams are problems typically seen on homework questions
The professor has high energy when teaching which makes lectures better than others. He is also a pretty lenient grader when it comes to exams, which is great.
