Lectures include lots of information! The professor is not trying to overload you with work but making sure you UNDERSTAND the material is important. It helps a lot when taking exams. The professor does not make the class hard on everyone but is reminding us that Thermodynamics is hard itself and he continuously pushes us to persevere through it.

The professor has made a great effort to make sure each student has a strong understanding of the subject. He manages to gather the attention of the class without having to yell or be disruptive himself. He cracks jokes and always relates back information to new information to further our understanding. Overall, very effective teaching method.

From lecture to office hours and even out side of class. I always noticed that he was enthusiastic about the course material as well as cared about you as an individual, which meant a lot. He was very empathetic toward me as a person and my situation. Always coming up solutions to the issue. He is kind but firm.

He puts in a lot of effort for his students and provides good resources to help us review and practice. If we have extra time during lecture, sometimes he shares his stories about his career which are useful to hear since we'll soon be working professionally as engineers. His stories are motivating and enlightening.
This professors was a good fit for the engineering criteria. Not only are his lectures easy to understand but he takes feedback from the students and incorporates it into his lectures.

Most of the engineering Professors don't care in a sense that they want you to just learn the material and nothing else, but some professors actually care about the curriculum and how it can be applied outside of school. Although his test are manageable other students do exclaim that it is possible to get a perfect score on the exam.

Initially I was kind of worried since I heard this course was super difficult. It is hard, but he creates a lot of resources to help you understand, as long as you put in the time/effort. Attending his lectures is essential because he interacts with us and provides realistic situations to help us understand the concepts in a deeper level.

This thermodynamics professor gives a lot of tests, but they're good at teaching. They explain complex concepts well, which is important in a tough subject like thermodynamics. Although the tests can be stressful, they can help students learn.
The professor could be a little tough on the exams but other than that one of the better professors here at the college.

Learning thermodynamics was a challenging task, but the professor was committed to supporting students throughout the course and ensuring their success. I wish this class wasn't heavy on the exams so there was less stress about whether or not you did good on each test.

Although thermodynamics was hard to learn, the professor tries to help you through the course and does his best to make you pass. I wish he would walk us through more examples during the lecture but there is so much to cover for this course that I don't think we had time.
he was always energetic and made learning fun and interactive and would for sure take again

This course is said to be the most difficult engineering course, but Abel understands how to make us learn as much as possible. Abel's lectures are always clear, fun, and he always tries his best to help the students learn the material. He is open to answering any questions about the material, and he gives lots of practice to prepare for exams.

The subject that I had Professor Abel Chuang was one that was difficult in many areas to understand but thanks to the way he teaches, you are able to get a much more clear and easy way of understanding the content. There is still a good level of difficulty but it does help you in getting good practice and understanding of the topics.

Professor Chuang is great, he his lectures are extremely detailed and he makes them so that they are easy to understand. You have to do practice problems, and review lecture material after class. Be prepared to put in effort, and study hard!

Professor Po-Ya Abel Chuang is an excellent professor who truly cares about his students' success. He is very knowledgeable about thermodynamics and is able to explain complex concepts in a way that is easy to understand. He is always willing to answer questions and provide additional help outside of class. Take 130 with him if you can!

There are only a few professors I've had at UCM which are as respected and well-liked as Professor Chuang. While his class was difficult, his teaching methods and delivery is more engaging and motivating than any other professor I've had in engineering. I would recommend this professor over any other for thermodynamics.
Professor Chuang is great, he actually wants to see his students succeed. Material is lecture, and test heavy. Be prepared by doing practice problems, especially homework problems.

Abel is a great professor to learn Thermodynamics from. Lectures focus on theoretical concepts rather than practical application. It is up to the student to get practical application of thermodynamics problems but he provides everything you need, it's only a matter of putting in the effort to practice.
Professor Chuang is a great professor. He encourages participation during lecture and his grading is fair.
Professor Chuang encourages his students to participate during lecture and helps them succeed in the course.

Prof. Chuang is an outstanding professor, his lectures are extremely detailed, leaving little room for confusion.  I felt like I came out of the class far more knowledgeable about the subject than I did going in, and if that isn't a good metric for fantastic teaching I don't know what is.
You need to work hard and try to grasp what he teaches in the lectures. He is a great instructor and fully in control of the course content and the field.

The professor's lectures were very organized and his teaching style is very engaging. He encourages discussions which help with my understanding of the subject and the professor is very welcoming, he's always available to answer any questions. And if there was a topic I could not understand, he would not give up until I fully understood it.

Makes all lectures significant and engaging. Being committed to the work is a must to do well. But the course evaluation is fair. I have taken two courses with this professor and they were both worth it.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Expect to spend a large amount of time to be devoted to Dr. Chuang's courses. The lecture slides are very informative and have all the information required to pass the course.
Go for it, challenging but it is completely worth it. You gonna learn a lot.

I found Prof Abel as one of the finest professors in my whole student career. He is punctual, inspirational and caring. He has a good grasp on the subject and can easily relate the topic with practical applications. He encourages students to ask questions and never discourages if students answer incorrectly. I would rate him a great professor.
Learned a lot taking his class both academically and in life. Really passionate about teaching and super nice.
not only help student to learn technical content but also helps them in the way they should think in their life.

He gives very good lectures and he is available for questions. 
He is respectful and understands the different backgrounds of the students, I really enjoyed his classes!
As a recomendation for future students, through the course it is expected to do homeworks and dedicate study hours at home.

Professor Abel Chuang is capable of communicating complicated and niche concepts to students effectively. As a professor, he is diligent and honest in giving feedback and also respectful of each student.

Very dedicated teacher, Natural born leader and extremely talented. Always challenging students. a bit confrontational but always encouraging. Must be respectful to approach him. Exams are straight forward but sometimes the portions are not clearly covered in class before appearing in exam.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Chuang is a great professor who teaches the material very well. His online thermodynamics class was well-structured and organized. His tests were fair and he provides great feedback. He is a very nice professor and wants to make sure you succeed and understand the material.
Was a really good class and was easy to follow if you go to office hours and ask for help.

Professor makes sure there is student involvement in class to help students stay active during lecture. Lectures are very well organized and content are reviewed very often. Assignments are slightly challenging and take a good time. However, they help the understanding the course content quite a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: I really enjoy this professor overall, my only gripe is that his explanations of key details can be confusing to some students.
He is an experienced and very helpful teacher, However, the ME262 course is challenging and needs practice.

comment: Best professor I've ever had.
Prof. Chuang is a hardworking person and a egoistic person. He has some quirky behavior which hard to understand.

comment: REally hardworking Professor, but one of the best teachers I have had classes with ever. Very helpful and understanding as well.

This professor is really good I enjoyed his linear algebra course. His inclass lectures are sometimes hard to understand but as soon as you start the HW and see the examples on MYMATH lab you will get the hang of it. In my opinion he speaks with strong vocabulary so I get lost sometimes in lecture. He's also in the library if you need help.
It wast too bad having to do it online. The homework is 60 percent of the grade and the test were pretty easy. Made sure to be available

He really intends for his students to understand and grasp the material as much as possible, sometimes it got out of hand a bit to the point where the material was presented at a more difficult level than it truly was, other than that he does a good job at teaching but should consider condensing and simplifying some teaching habits

I have several big tips for future students taking this class. 1) Don't waste your time studying on Wileyplus, 2) Go to your discussion more than your lecture, 3) use Schaum's Outline for Calculus, 4) Study the worksheets for the exams, 5) DO NOT STUDY THE OLD EXAMS for new exams, 6) Make sure you know logs/natural logs well. Good luck. I'm out!!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Swenson is a great professor really enthusiastic and funny, if you ask for help he will provide it. This is one of those classes you can not skate through you actually have to put in the work . What you put in is what you get out.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: Definitely cannot go wrong with Swenson. Calc is pretty complicated but he obviously knows what he's talking about tries his hardest not to confuse his students. He active works so that his explanations and grading is as transparent as possible. He really cares about his students and his office hours are helpful. 10/10

Mr. Swenson is a great professor, if you fail his class it's because.. 1. You didn't do the homework, and relied on others. 2. If you were confused you didn't go to office hours.  Swenson is overall a great professor, and going to lectures and doing homeworks will gurantee you a B. He loves his students, and makes sure everything is treated fairly!

Honestly, I tried attending the lectures the first few weeks of school but I really could not get used to the teaching style of Professor Swenson. I don't know if it;s just me, but the way he taught was too fast, and he taught it way harder than it really is, therefore making the material confusing. The discussion sections help a lot, though.

comment: So the Midterms are worth 70% of the grade. If you miss lectures, it is whatever but you really need to know your stuff for the quizzes in discussion. I found going to his OH more helpful than lectures. At first I thought going to lectures were pointless but once we started to get into more difficult material it became a must.

comment: Odd Jokes, makes class fun. Ask questions. study and youll pass

Swenson is a great teacher who mixes in humor well to keep students engaged. Swenson, if you're reading this, please please use one of your screens as a monitor hooked up to a projector that way people on one side of the class can see what you write on the other side!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I previously took this class and the first time didn't pass.  Going to lecture is a big determinate for how well you're going to do. Mr. Swenson is very caring and his main goal is for his students to UNDERSTAND math. The quizzes can really make or break your grade, however, the exams are hard and where you want to devote your studying
I hate math with a passion, this class was difficult for me in that regard. I managed to pass the class due to Mr. Swenson, being able to appeal a score for an exam helped my grade  a lot.
Gotta be willing to put in work
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Swenson really cares for his students bc he's always willing to help and clear up any questions. He's really lenient with the HW bc if the network is down, he'll push off the due date. Also, his lectures were easy to follow in my opinion because a lot of the test questions are based on his examples in lecture.

Lectures are the hardest thing to follow as he writes all over and its random. If you've never taken calculus before then you're pretty much guaranteed to fail. Exams are so much part of your grade that nothing else really matters. If you fail one which most likely will happen, you are screwed. would def recommend taking this at the JC.
If you don't understand the material being taught, he explains it again until you know how to do it.
Very approachable
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He goes around and always does his best to get everyone's questions answered and will also give individual help when needed.

I really appreciate that he takes the time to help students individually in class with whatever problem. I also really like that he demonstrates how to do the problems on the worksheets instead of just letting us do it on our own without any explanation.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: This guy is pretty good.
He explains the topics very well, and will use multiple examples to answer questions if necessary. He makes calc a lot easier to understand.

Mr. Swenson's Math 11 class has been a joy to me, not only because I understand the material, but beyond such matter: His lectures are always funny and well- prepared, his ideas of how a student should study Math was more than interesting to me. (P.S. Don't take this class if you are not willing to do extra work.)
good teacher
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Swenson is a pretty chill professor and I like that about him. He is willing to help students whenever they ask for it and it shows that he cares.
I usually can never see the board he's body always covers it, but he's always wiling to help one on one if you have questions.
He goes out of his way to help you understand the concepts and various examples, instead of making you do the same type of problems over and over. He sometimes has funny comments about life.
He is a professor that seems like when he talks, he talks to himself. He is not the greatest teacher out there, but he's easy.
Great Teacher

comment: Cracks jokes related to subject that he will be teaching, he answers all questions in best way he can, and explains everything well in lecture.
He is sometimes unclear with The notes and is sometimes Unorganized,  he does have a lot of energy
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Some of the discussion teacher assistants are very confusing. They poses a heavy accent which makes it hard to understand the point.

Swenson is really a great teacher. He's very enthusiastic about Math, making the lectures easier to follow. Although, they can be pretty boring some times. He wants you to really understand the concepts behind the Math and not just learn how to do the problems. His exams are fair, quizzes are okay and as far as I know he does not curve.
He breaks down concepts in a way that easy to follow making hard topics easier to learn.

I'm actually retaking the class but the first time I took the course I didn't go to class and i had a C up until the final and then I ended up failing with a 67%. This time around I have been going to class and he has done a great job of winning me over and making me regret not taking this class serious the first time around. Great teacher honestly
Great instructor.
He talks down his exams way too much.
Too Easy.

I find it interesting that many say he is a hard professor, many students want his exams "Multiple choice", they basically want an A handed to them. Students are very lazy and always  try to get by so therefore they find Swenson as difficult. He is a great professor, who expects you to be  at the college level, this isn't high school!!

If you have taken calculus before you might have an easy time in the course. If not pay attention in class;although, he may not be very clear during lecture. If you need more help go to office hours . If you are like me you could learn the material while working on the homework. The tests are a bit difficult so don't forget to study.
Passed barely.. Had a B before the final and ended with a C. Overall, it was kind of hard considering I never took calculus before. I needed a 100/200 on the final and got 101/200.
first time taking calculus. he understands the hardships of a college student. he is really nice and a great professor to go to his office hours
Most stressful class ever and the method of teaching is very unclear. I used to like math and now I don't.

I think Daniel Swenson is so adorable. I love how he makes jokes in class and laughs at them himself. He can be confusing at times t just hang in there, actually attend his lectures, and study hard and you should be fine(:

So here is my thoughts. If you have taken calc you will be fine. If you don't have an pre-calc experience then lecture is going to get confusing. If you have a buddy with pre-experience sit next to them. My friend got an A on the midterm just cause she listen to my comments during lecture and did homework with me. Go to office hours and PALS people

Class seems to go at a slow pace, but as soon as he does an example, he goes so fast. He writes the process down so fast that while we are still writing he is explaining. It's hard to listen to other numbers while writing different numbers. The discussions help more than lecture but he puts a great deal of effort into teaching the class which is A+
He is a very good math teacher, the best I've had so far. Just know that the midterms are way harder than the given practice midterms.
I feel as though this class is much more confusing than my other math classes that I have taken. I learn more through the worksheets and peers but the professor is always there for office hours.
hes a good teacher. overall I like him

If you have taken Calc 1 before then you will understand him a lot more than if you have not. Those that are fresh to Calculus might feel as if the lecture is slow but he is thorough. Class always goes by fast.
Overall great class. Lectures are quick and worth attending. He answers everyone's questions and gives hints as to what is going to be on the exams.

Mr. Swenson is a very helpful teacher. He is willing to explain and explain until you understand the topic. I also really like how he does ALL the work on the board instead of just skipping a few steps and expecting us to know what he did. I know some professors who do that, its really hard to learn that way.
He is very good at explaining and if you need him to reexplain it he will. Gives lots of hints to what will be on the exams during lectures.
Easy class if you look for help and understand the homework as well as pass the quizzes.

I really respect and like Mr. Swenson. The class can be difficult, but he is fair, go to office hours with the TAs and himself for homework help, worksheet help or anything and he will help you. He is a nice guy and he is a good teacher. Wiley can also be challenging, don't be one of those students who do it last minute.

Go to the TA's office hours. They are more helpful and explain things better. This is a class that if you just practice a few problems a day or 30 minutes of problem solving, you should pass. Office Hours help SO much.
Tests are tough but that is the only hard part of the class
Short lectures so office hours and outside help would be very helpful

If you choose to take this class, good luck! It was by far one of the hardest classes I have taken. I have done well in my college classes and I didn't pass this class. The exams weren't multiple choice and they were extremely difficult. His grading on exams was also ridiculous. 16 points for a question all or nothing, things like that.

Professor Swenson was honestly the hardest math teacher I've ever had in my entire life. His lectures consisted of him calling random people in the classroom to do problems rather than do them himself first and writing really small on the white board. I've never gotten below a B in college, and I didn't pass! The class average on exams was a 50%!

Hardest class ever! He dives right into the material and expects you to know what he is talking about. His exams are really hard and worth a lot of points. There is no way you can pass the class if you don't do good on the exams. I got very good grades on the quizzes and homework and I still failed because of the midterms and final. Worst class!!

The teaching could be conveyed in a clearer way by slowing down and giving examples that we actually understand.  Instructor dives right into the material and gives advanced examples.  Students who are successful in the course come in having taken a calculus course before or have some background knowledge.  "TA training" should also be implemented.
Tests are difficult
Mr. Swenson is very clear in his presentation of topics. He just needs to cover the operations that will be encountered in homework assignments more.

he constantly makes jokes that aren't that funny but I guess that's part of his quirky charm. However he isn't the best at explaining, if you want to know why a formula works you have to go see him at office hours. He skims the top of what we are suppose to be learning, doesn't explain in depth and it is really hard to follow.

I took this class with previous knowledge from a high school calculus class, and was very disappointed. He spent a large amount of time at the beginning of the semester reviewing unnecessary pre-calculus concepts, and then seemed to rush through the actual calculus ideas. Without prior calculus knowledge I am sure I would have been absolutely lost.
A good professor and silly occasionally. Good class.

This is a lecture and discussion course. Lecture is not mandatory, however, it is difficult to learn math on your own. Discussion is mandatory because there are participation points and quizzes each meeting (20 points total). As for homework, it is online and takes a lot of time. Do not wait until the last minute. Office hours are a must.
Most of the time you have to figure out a lot of things by yourself. Attending discussion is a must. If you put in the work you'll be fine.
He is a fun and thoroughly teaches the class based on what is important .
The discussions are more helpful than the actual lecture. Homework work does pertain to actually to lecture material.

He makes learning the material as easy as he can and if you can't understand something he'll make sure to explain and go through the process. He's an excellent professor. He also cracks jokes which helps lighten the mood.

Maybe reconstructing the test to achieve the most points possible would be more successful. If students are receiving an average of 61 on the test, I think there is something wrong with that picture.  Maybe making the test multiple choice with the same format would be more suitable to attain more points
approachable and passionate about his field of study.
He's helpful if u go to his office hours. so go to his office hours

The Math Show is a spectacle to behold. Mr. Swenson has a great sense of humor which makes the material more approachable and less daunting. He is  very knowledgeable and the effort shows in his lectures. If you want to succeed, he is your best asset.

Great professor, always there whenever you need questions answered. His office hours were life savers. If you really want an A in the class, expect to go to his office offers constantly, especially for the Homework.

I took MATH 32 with Mr. Swenson and had him as a TA for MATH 122.  He is very funny, explains things clearly, and all around a great teacher.  Consider going to his office hours - he's very helpful and makes you feel welcome.
Good teacher and cracks a good few jokes. The TA was a good compliment though. So, with out the TA I would probably not have been in the great position of passing. TA Eric Roberts best TA

He's a very sweet guy. At office hours he will do his best to help you with your questions, even if you may not know how to phrase them well so do go. Lectures are confusing but especially so if you don't read the book or preview the material. A lot of the material gets cleared up once you practice it with homework and worksheets.

The only reason why I said the lectures are long was because of simple personal preference; it is simply my opinion. The tests are quite tough for me simply because I am not a probability nor statistics person.

Good teacher, lectures are good but I skipped a few and felt like I didn't miss too much.  Note that it's because I knew what I was doing and learned from the worksheet assignments, and that you may be different from me.  At least in lectures you can catch a few laughs or so

He is the most interactive teacher I have ever met; he does his best to improve his class with surveys. However, this is not an easy A; probability is not an easy topic for newcomers, and he sometimes makes us use R (a programming language) in certain assignments. Fortunately, his availability during office hours will help you survive through it.
A funny professor, makes joke and references. Having him for discussion as well as lecture really helps.

I wish that his lectures coincides with the homework and worksheet because when I try to do them I look at the lecture slides and it doesn't make sense. He could try focusing on the problem and not go into detail about each variable.

Swenson knows his material well, and works very hard to make sure you do, too! He is pretty funny, has a modern teaching style (so no useless busy work!) and lots of office hours. People sometimes complain he goes too fast, I haven't had an issue with that.
This class requires effort to keep up with the material but if you work hard your effort will be rewarded. Professor Swenson is very helpful and knowledgeable in the subject.
He really loves the subject. His enjoyment definitely is transferred to you. Great professor to take a class with.
Really helpful (especially in office hours). The reason why I did better than I thought in his class.

Daniel Swenson is an excellent professor. He fosters a free will class that focuses on worksheet problems. He roams around the class to help any student using a variety of methods, this includes using peers to help explain problems. quizzes are the reason attendance is mandatory. Over all an excellent instructor and has won my respect.

I had him in UC Merced, I thought that he was really funny and tried to engage the kids into the subject. He goes out of his way to make sure that the students learn the concepts. If the students don't understand the concepts he will teach them different ways to make sure they get it.  Overall i had a good time in his class.

Mr. Swenson is a great teacher - attendance is mandatory in his class but even if it wasn't I would still go. When asking him for help, he makes sure you come to understand the material on your own and guides you through it rather than just regurgitating the steps outlined in the textbook. He's fantastic and I hope to have him in a future class.

He is a great professor. I didn't personally like the structure of the class, but it was clear and concise. He writes on the board a lot, but uploads slides with similar content. Quizzes are easy, but you need to know your stuff for the test. Bonus points if you are a nerdgeek, you will enjoy his humor.
Teacher makes going to class worth it.
Its very simple, go to class, work on weekly worksheet in group, and take quiz that consist of a problem or two based on last weeks worksheet

The material itself can be cryptic, but the professor did his best to make it clear, or at least no longer intimidating. He has a few books listed in the syllabus, and it's best to get them for the class as the homework and worksheets are taken from them. Office hours are where an even more in-depth review can be done with him.
Makes lectures interesting, almost excited to be teaching.

The class is relatively easy especially if you took Calculus in high school. Also, he is very helpful in office hours. Be sure to go to lecture so you get all the notes and can understand the problems.

Great professor thats really passionate about teaching. There is no book so you have to attend lecture, which may seem hard to follow/all over but everything you need is in lecture. Do all the discussion and hw and youll be fine for tests. The final seemed hard but you soon realize its just hard looking with the same concepts you learned earlier.
Great teacher, he goes over almost all possible situations that you might get on a exam. Explains the math in real world applications.
Instruction got kind of vague due to him wanting to explain the concepts behind the math, overall good teacher though. Nice guy. Fair.
Overall explanations were clear. Class examples could have been clearer. Office hours really helped. Worksheet and homework helped to understand the material. Overall great professor.
Need more clear explanation during lecture

Some times unlcear saying 'this leads to this, which leads to this, which leads to this which is what we want' (hand motions included).  Other than that he is really good at explaining and does not waste your time.
Guys really good, knows his stuff, and does not waste your time.
He is a really good professor. He is very enthused on teaching the students in the material and if you need help, he is there to help you. Swenson is better than the other professors.
Very clear and easy to understand, always answered questions, and was overall very thorough in his examples
he was my math 22 sub but easier to understand then the actual teacher at times ill see if i can get him asa teacher for my nxt math class
Very good teacher. Definitely went into depth on reasoning for different subjects and theorems.

He went way to fast and wrote all over the broad making it very difficult to keep up with him. I did not understand him very well and always needed someone else to explain what the notes even say because he was so disorganized. I was not happy with his style of teaching.
i thought this professor was really nice really helpful but sometimes his explanations were confusing.

Daniel Swenson subbed my class while my primary teacher was on paternity leave, he was and amazing substitute, and I wish he would teach for the remainder of the course. If you ever get the opportunity to take one of his classes, I highly recommend it. He taught from right after our first midterm, all the way to our second midterm.
Overall a good professor, I enjoy the time he spent with us for the course.
Very good. Clear, used good examples, very funny! Sometimes went a bit quickly, but a quick read of the textbook before class made everything a lot easier.
Swenson is a great professor. Easy to understand and is very helpful.

Great professor. Best professor I had for a math class. I had him for math 032. He is very nice and if you go to his office hours he will make sure you know the material. He is very clear when explaining and he will use different examples until you understand that concept. His exams are very easy if you do the homework and worksheets.

I learned a lot in his math 05 class. He was clear in the lessons, and provided us with real-world connections that engaged me more into his lessons. The only thing I had trouble adjusting to was the speed. He went fast, and it was sometimes hard to follow along.
Great professor overall and always willing to help out. Although I would of liked it better if he held separate office hours for each of his classes instead of combining them.
Willing to help during office hours, overall extremely helpful. During class the lectures have examples and the material is not over complicated.
Really helpful if you attend office hours!

Great personality and is extremely knowledgeable in the material, but does not make learning easy. He teaches methods for solving problems which are harder to learn and doesn't teach you the little tricks which make math easier because they're "wrong". To have an easier time in class, study the lesson and do the homework before coming to class.

His lectures were always on topic but sometimes would get off topic which isn't all bad. He also tries to explain his teachings but sometimes it is hard to follow him. Overall he is not a bad teacher.

I found Swenson to be extremely invested in his students. His lectures were fun to attend. In his class, I learned a lot, while having a good time. On top of that, the class was not too difficult. You will do well in his class if you put in the effort.
Daniel Swenson is a great professor. Although i did not understand anything in lecture, the test was super easy. He is really helpful and a very nice teacher!
He was a legit cool guy. I really enjoyed him for a prof. It is a hard class, so if you don't understand it, make sure you ask. Much better than any other prof I have had before.

had him first semester n college 2011. didnt understand calculus and never liked it.i didnt understand his lectures.i had to learn through youtube videos.i liked that he did the hw online though. i still passed his class with a b- which was better than with haik in math 12. i dont know how i passed though. lol. but i think i prefer him over haik

Arguably the worst professor I have ever had. Horribly unclear, and will randomly call on students in lecture to answer questions, and makes you feel dumb if you don't understand it. He also will not round your grade, even if you're 0.01% away. Take him at your own risk- I should have figured this out when I had him for Math 11 last year.

His lectures are hard to understand if you have never taken a calculus class before. However,if you do all your homework and look at the notes from lecture, you'll be able to get a good grade. Do not rely on the practice exams when you're studying for the midterms and final.

I thought he was a pretty bad teacher. Not very good at explaining things.  He sometimes doesn't even teach but choses students to explain problems.  The class and homework seemed easy throughout the semester but the final was extremely difficult. I had an A at mid-semester and post-final I was given a D+. Don't agree with it but I guess I'll deal.

He was a nice teacher. Very fair. He knows his stuff. Works hard at his job. Sometimes it can be hard to understand him, but if you ask him, he will go over the problem again. If you visit him during office hours he is super helpful then too!

He is an awesome teacher. I love how he pushes up his glasses. Such a nerd! He knows his stuff! If you actually take the time to LISTEN, you can learn a lot. I would take him again. Calc was hard, but he made it bearable.
Great teacher, tells cheesey jokes during class. very helpful if you ask. and will redo something if asked

He comes prepared to class and knows exactly what he will teach in the lectures. He rarely ends a lecture early but he is not very helpful in his lectures. It is sometimes hard to understand his explanations and tends to over complicate his explanations when it is not necessary.
horrible professor. hard to follow during lectures. although he knows his stuff he is not very well at presenting it much less teaching it

Not great at keeping the class interested in the material. Writes on the whiteboard yet you can't see a darn thing. Uses a microphone but is still inaudible. Goes over problems too quickly. Though he knows what he is teaching he just does not know how explain the material to someone who is unfamiliar with calculus.

He's great for explaining problems one-on-one and during office hours, but his lectures only go over examples already in the book, which isn't helpful at all. He now uses a microphone, so he shouldn't be as quiet. He's really wants you to learn the material. The book is useless in explaining the material.
His lectures tend to lose a lot of the students' interest. Some of the material taught during lecture is useful for solving homework problems so take good notes.
One of the most dedicated teachers I've seen as well an entertainer during lectures.
He is definitely eccentric, but with the way he teaches, the course has been fun and challenging. If I were to have him as my professor, I would definitely be glad.

Really cares about your understanding of the material and will go out of his way to figure out ways you can understand it. Even had his wife wait a bit after office hours because our group was stuck on a problem! Great Professor!

Good Prof. Sometimes unclear but for the most part dedicated. The professor is unique. I would say get a good TA (hogan) because the prof. sometimes has too many ppl in his office hrs. Some of his midterms are unfair! like the first one this semester!! But other that that... excellent teacher
He is awesome!

I liked how he started out the class by writing out the theory of what he would go over that day. Some of his explanation might not be very clear but understandable when I reviewed the notes. Overall, he is a good teacher.

Well to begin, Swenson is definitely an interesting man. Although awkward, he did a fairly good job at teaching the class. At times he was very abstract though, which left a lot of work on the TA's. Remember to ALWAYS attend discussions- if you have a good TA, everything will be easily explained. Also, he needs to be a little more lenient.

I am not a math person but I passed this class due to a lot of time and hard work. Daniel seems to be new to teaching and is generally too quiet in lecture. He is very helpful in his office though. He gives out practice exams that are heaven sent. Once he gives out this practice exam, study it! Do not take Brent Edmunds for a TA, he is the devil!
it was legit
No Comment...

he is very shy. He sweats a lot he is somewhat helful during office hours but not very helpful in lecture. Prepare to teach yourself. I am not a math person myself but I am doing good in his class. He posts practice exams that look alost exactlty the same as the exam. You can pretty much just show up for the midterms and final and pass the class

He wants to be helpful, but he's EXTREMELY shy. He's obviously new to teaching and very uncomfortable being in front of the room. His focus in class is never on teaching or explaining but rather on getting through the lecture as quickly as possible so that he can breathe again. In other words, be ready to teach the material to yourself.
No Comment!
I didn't mind the class it was overall very organized since it was the same routine of the homework everyweek but it was just a lot with all midterms being cumulative.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Didn't show up to the midterms and describes the tests as a "treasure hunt" during office hours. The midterms are cumulative, and the topics very wildly from the textbook and lecture slides. There are 4 midterms and a final.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: The exams in this class are extremely difficult and do not reflect the lecture material well. Lectures are mandatory but often feel unhelpful, as the professor does not explain concepts clearly or connect them to the exams. Overall, the class feels disorganized, and the professor does not effectively support student learning. Would not recommend.

This class is known for its high difficulty. While the professor is clearly passionate, the workload is intense - expect to spend hours on homework and extensive reading. Utilize resources like Unstuck study and study groups to stay on top of the material.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASSA very bad professor has so many exams that are all CUMULATIVE and he assigns so much hw and readings is always late to lectures and never present for exams He spends 2 sec per side and moves on and packs so much into the lec He is not a good professorVERY unprofessional by far one of the most unorganized professors andclasses
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: He is an obstacle to your education, not an asset. You are going to be better off waiting for another professor to teach the same material next semester. Do not test your time, money, effort, and mental fortitude for his class. He may seem chill at first, but you will soon realize that you should've dropped out, and it may already be too late...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: I don't know why he is a professor. Lets just leave it at that...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: He has no structure in his class.  He made all of his midterms CUMULATIVE meaning every midterm only added more and more chapter to study for. Every lecture he only spent 3 seconds per slide and there was so much content that he would assign us. his exams were 70 MC questions in just 60 mins. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.

This class makes me want to jump in front of those CatTrack buses while my immune system to misfires and kills every cell in my body. His lectures are shallow and do little to prepare you for exams, and most if not all of your learning is from the reading homework. The first exam was disorganized as he wasn't even present to proctor his own exam.

comment: I had him for spark metacognition 2023-2024. very disorganized doesn't explain well and doesn't read emails. Had my High B dropped to a D due to a poorly explain paper that was somehow worth more than the final. Gave us free pass but when I tried to use it he never put it down. tests every class that greatly effectives grades.

Professor Dulai is disorganized, causing stress for students and TAs. Exams were difficult, but not based on lectures. Attendance policies were strict & insensitive, requiring extensive proof for even minor absences. This created an unproductive and anxiety-filled environment. Not recommended until improvements are made.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Honestly he is a good professor if you put time and effort into his class and then he does take attendance but as long as your there he can be leanient to one absence

Dr. Kamal is a respected professor. Nutrition was an easy class for filling a GE requirement. He gives a lot of homework in which there are a lot of readings each week, but they're relative easy using Quizlet. Quizzes & discussion are held only in class, so it's important to not skip. Exams are a good a mount of questions, but they're take home.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: He does a good job teaching the lectures, and explaining how the content applies to your life. Unfortunately, the material on the pre-lecture work, lectures, quizzes, homework, and exam isn't always the same. He wants you to understand, not just memorize, but the exams clearly want you to memorize. All exams are taken online from wherever you want.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: While he was not a bad teacher- clearly very passionate, be prepared to spend an hour on the homework alone x3 a week, and that is if you understand the material. You must read your text book to complete the HW that's due before the lecture- luckily he gives you as many tries as needed for your grade. Your grade is determined by your own drive.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Had him for Bio 2 and 110. Never understood the hate for him. Biology isn't supposed to be a easy subject to learn which is why people complain and blame the prof. 1st day of class he provides a clear schedule which tells you what is expected every day throughout the entire semester. There's no curve balls and you just have to be willing to read.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Hands down worst professor I've had. Makes you pay for a laggy website to participate in class when he can easily post the slides and textbook on catcourses for free. Class is disorganized. You're expected to study the textbook, compendium, pre-lecture videos, pre-lecture quizzes, iRAT quizzes, tRAT quizzes, homework quizzes, and lecture slides.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Very tough class, made students drop out of Natural Science School and switch majors.... But I would say in the beginning of the course they try and "scare" you in a way. Do ALL the assignments and do well in the group project, study, and maybe read you'll be fine. Good luck!

This class was insanely hard. Do not take it unless you want 2 quizzes per lecture (1 of which is taken at the start of class before they even taught the material) insanely hard textbook that was written by a genius, exams that are so hard the average is an F, fast paced lectures that aren't even helpful, and writing full lab reports each week.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: You will end up teaching yourself, finding your own videos, and seeking other professors to help with the class. He rarely prepares you for anything, throwing a bunch of resources at you seems like a good idea at first but instead the exam shows that half of it was unneeded nor brought up ever again. Some questions are also from other universities

Little guidance from professors when things are due like projects and homework. It is a reverse structured class where you learn the content before class or you won't understand the lecture. When students asked for more guidance for tests, the professors said no and that students will learn how to study better after failing their first test-my TA
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Dulai's class has been extremely stressful, unorganized and not effective at teaching. The expectations for exams are unclear and what is covered on the exams is not material discussed in lectures nor in homework exercises. I have had an extremely negative experience in Dr. Dulai's class and I will consider changing my major because of this.

The learning set up is so bizarre. You're required to know the material before coming to class, because the first thing you do is take a 6 - 10 question quiz. Despite going to mid-term review sessions, reviewing lecture slides and rereading textbook chapters, most of the material on the exams are asking things we've never covered or read about.
So many assignments it feels suffocating.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: This class sucked, they taught us very poorly and taught very little of what we had to actually know. Lots of stupid assignments like connecting microbiology topics to everyday life. Tophat quizzes and homework assignments were super specific and often felt unnecessarily difficult. I'm glad to be done with this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Bio110 is MUCH easier than Bio2 with Dulai. Grades fair & structure of this course allows students to get an A in class - get 100% assignments/quizzes then you can score poorly on exams. Study textbook, attend lectures, take notes. Class is do-able - I got a C in bio2 w/ dulai but did much better in bio110 b/c course structure is manageable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Between the two professors for BIO 002 I will say Dulai is better at lecturing than Alkouri. Dulai explains concepts better and sometimes provides a skit. This class does use TopHat to do iRAT and tRAT questions, so make sure to attend lectures and answer every question. There is a group video project so make sure you start early and get it done.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Dulai makes this course look structured initially, but it gets disorganized as the semester progresses. Complete all the discussion forums, homework, UVIs, and complete the video project early you will do fine.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: He made the students share their location so that it could be proven that they attended lectures. He is very strict on not sharing anytype of work with other students, yet he steals other universities work and passes it off as his own. How do we know? Because he gave assignments from University of Colorado while still having that school's logo.

comment: This class could have easily been 100x better if it wasn't so disorganized. Insane amount of work given during discussion and SO MANY QUIZZES, two for every lecture in fact. Although Dulai is a very engaging and funny lecturer and I can usually understand what is being taught. Reading the textbook beforehand helps A LOT with quizzes and midterms.

He makes funny jokes in class, however, he gives us so much work. We once had to work on TEN pages of discussion worksheets within an hour. They don't update the due dates until everybody has to ask them about it. You can't catch him after lectures, ever. He gives good lectures though.

comment: This man is so out of order, gives you like a packet or worksheets during discussion to finish and grades on how many pages all the classes did. The white lady that made the ALA format is somethingelse

comment: you can tell that he likes teaching bio but makes his class unbearable. they make pre-lecture quizzes based on reading and two quizzes in each lecture and are very unaccommodating. lecture attendance is mandatory. i'm a bio major and have never disliked a bio class until now. dulai be making me lose passion for my major fr. only take if no options.

He is a great explainer, but boy his lectures and homework won't help you for the exams. Some of the questions ask don't even make any sense. I'm barely in the beginning and am nervous for the end. I am only taking this because he's the only professor for this class.

comment: With professor dulai you can truly tell he loves teaching bio 002, after all, it is the only class he teaches at UC Merced (which he has monopolized year after year). comment: By far the most passionate professor/teacher I have ever had. Had a lot of fun during the class. Just make sure to attend and be extremely attentive during class and attend office hours.

Probably the worst class I've ever taken. There were so many little assignments due constantly, each with weird due dates. comment: One of the greatest professors Ive had so far. His lectures are amazing and hilarious, he keeps the class interested in the topics. I obviously put in the work, so it's not my ethic or effort, it's him. If you say you don't agree with him/the way he teaches, even after he ASKS for criticism, he gets hostile and defensive.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: He is the worst professor to walk this planet earth. avoid him at all costs. he assigns more homework than there are words in all of this worlds languages. hes a terrible professor. theres no time to rest or even do other class homework. he assigns 10-15 hours of homework everyday and theres literally no way to avoid it. worst professor EVER.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: This professor was horrible but I will not let that defy my passion for the subject. This term he made inappropriate jokes, contradicted the other two professors multiple times, and spoke over them, in which we can all conclude was very disrespectful. Email him? Yeah he might take a while, just depends on how he feels. Tests are difficult. GoodLuck
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: My main advice would be to not read Top Hat unless you don't understand the textbook. To pass you WILL need to read the assigned reading in the book. Although there is a team of professors he hogs the teaching and for 90% of the lectures you go to he will be talking. His teaching in lectures is good but that's about it. Homework and labs harder
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Worst teacher ever if you can take him over the summer. he expects you to know things he does not teach a lot of reading required. DO NOT take alongside chem your grades will suffer. if you do not read you will not pass. Quiz before and after the lecture. Midterms are based on things that were not taught. I pray for any Bio major who has to take it
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dulai was the worst professor iv'e had here at UC Merced. He modeled this class on active learning which was the biggest waste of time. He barley lectured about the material. Every class we would have to take a quiz on the material we had to read before class. And the tests are cumulative. Again WORST PROFESSOR!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dulai is without a doubt the worst teacher in the UC Merced BIO department. He tests you on material that he does NOT explain to you, he deflects both questions and criticisms and is often disrespectful. Be ready for intentionally misleading test questions and "40+ hours of reading per week". I have had him multiple times and am worse off for it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Do not take this class if you dont have to. He doesnt teach in class and expects you to know everything by reading. Horrible teacher. Hard exams. One average for a test in his class was 57% which says a lot about his teaching. Only get a 1 out of 5 cuz theres no option for 0/5.

You have to pay to do your homework online and attend every discussion section. Before the final I had a solid B and after taking the final, he changed the grades dropping me a whole two letter grade down. He said he made a mistake inputting something and with the final already in, my grade was one percent from passing. He DOES NOT CURVE.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Great professor, just too much emphasis on testing (quizzes everyday, long exams). Several E.C. Opport., USE THEM, I got over 70pts E.C. in total. Final was horrible, but got an A- in the class, I got a B- in Bio 1 btw. I would not consider myself a genius, I just put in the study time everyday. Watch the videos, and do the reading preparedness...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Took this class over the summer and loved it. The "deep reading" that he emphasized seems daunting, but when you actually start reading the text thoroughly, the quizzes are not that bad. Explanations are thorough & he will clarify if asked. Overall very knowledgeable but you must do the reading to pass! Deep reading is useful and I still use it now
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Had his this summer and wow what a breath of fresh air! He puts you into groups and at first I did not agree, but once we began taking with each other it was worth it. He is moving his classes to a new format which he talks about. After giving it a chance to work the class seemed to like it. I think I leaned loads!

There will be 2 quizzes in every class, he force you into groups at the beginning regardless of whether you want to be in a group, homework has little to do with the actual chapter (the questions tend to be taken from a Quizlet set for another textbook). He dose, however, do highly informative demonstrations and has stellar enthusiasm for biology.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Dulai has the ability to be an amazing teacher, but he chooses not to. When he chooses to lecture he captivates everyones attention. Absolutely great. But he chooses to do the discussion type lecture style which is over all not affective.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dulai is honestly just terrible. He seems so approachable during class but he's actually an arrogant narcissist. He doesn't really teach so he expects you to "deep read" the textbook. Meaning reading each section multiple times and reading all the pictures. If you don't do this you will NOT pass. Doesn't care about your personal situations.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: You MUST MUST MUST read to pass the class. Everything is based off of the reading. Get used to quizzes because you have will MULTIPLE a week. Homework, 2 in class quizzes, discussion quizzes, and fundmental quizzes on catcourses. Tests get harder and harder, not because of the material but because of the way he words the question- confusing.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Overall difficult class to get adjusted to, everything that you learn is based on your readings. Come to class prepared (deep read EVERYTHING). I find it a little unnecessary to quiz us every lecture, but I suppose it promotes good reading. Most of the time lecture time is allotted to quiz taking and activities, so there is minimal class "lecture".
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Dulai gives far too many quizzes and forces students to memorize every sentence and figure from the book. Counts on students overlooking tiny figures to make wildly specific quiz questions. Exams are poorly phrased and the averages were often 60-70%. Bio 110 comes after this course, has more complicated processes and vocab, and is still easier.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I disagree with the last reviewer. I followed his advise clearly and by the middle of the semester i was 'deep reading.' Once that happened it all fell into place and I have been able to use these skills in other classes to raise my grades. If you get a chance to take him please do so. It is a lot of work at the beginning but as I said it works!

Don't skip class - if you do, don't have your friend send you the attendance code... you will get caught. Ridiculous homeworks that had you scouring the textbook for questions that don't even matter; you had to pay attention to small details in the corner of the book to get the correct answer. Some questions weren't even in the book or lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Learned so much about how the cell works, from where we came from to what we are! He has a way of making it blend together, and his way of explaining was admired by my group! If you get a chance to take this class with him, I would REALLY recommend it.  Got the grade that I deserved because I did not read the textbook much - not a reader, but pass.

Dulai is a good lecturer. He makes sure that you understand the material. The semester started off a little messy format wise, but he got it together and the class was running smoothly towards the end. Be prepared to read. His exams are HARD! They are based on the material he teaches, but the questions are very difficult. No curve, but some EC.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His tests were not at all based off his lecture material, but he gave us a ridiculous amount of extra credit at the end. I don't think it's the correct way to compensate but I'm not complaining.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dulai's teaching style resembles a father who won't let you watch your tv show (Lecture) because of all the features he wants to show you on the remote (Tophat). His lectures are pointless and are no more than a regurgitation of the textbook.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Class was skewed so that many points were available near the end. Dulai does this so that students can adapt and learn before they get dinged near the end. Helped me a lot because it took me a bunch of time to jive with my team and learn how to deep read the book. I did very well in the end and a got decent grade. I THINK I am ready for Bio110!

Towards the end of the semester we were given two online discussion assignments. These proved to be very useful as there was so much good information exchanged between us. I learned so much from the class. More than just about cell mil bio. I learnt how to share work with others. Take him if you can.

Now the semester of s over and I managed a decent grade, I think I like the new format. The class was flipped so we had to do the reading and come to class where we worked in small groups to test our understanding.  Many students cheated on the HW assignments. We would just copy each other at the last minute. It don't think that was the purpose.
We pulled through at the last moment. The class overall is very hard and since it is the first time doing team learning, it was rather unorganized. Overall, if you work hard you can pass.

Well well well! It is almost the end of the semester and guess what the students are going better. Looks like he was right in that it would take the full semester to learn how to study in teams. Most of the class is now passing. I am getting it now! And we still have about 40% of our grades to earn. Well done, Sir.

Dulai is a very nice guy and enjoyable to be around which makes it painful to write this review. Basically, you cannot trust anything this man says. He will say one thing and do the other. He frequently changes the point values of quizzes and midterms, tells us things are on tests when they are not, tests us on things from another textbook he uses.

I am just a freshman in Bio 002. If I knew it was going to be this hard, I would have taken it at a community college over the summer. I have straight A's in all my classes except this class, where I am borderline C and D. This class is hard. Make sure to perform deep reading and go to every office hour and try to learn how to apply information.

60 to 70% of the students are currently failing Biology 002 with this new teaching style implemented. If he curves, there is a chance to pass but right now not sure if many of us will make it out of this class.

For biology 2, he teaches similarly like a graduate class. If you do not study and pre-read everything, you will not succeed or even pass the class. His teaching format has changed and implemented team learning. You need to focus closely throughout with deep reading, which takes 5 hours at a time. Be prepared to study for this class.
Overall pretty good teacher. Very enthusiastic and helpful when you have questions. Friends say he is also helpful in other bio classes.
Makes learning fun with lots of jokes and alternative learning stories!
Horrible. That's all I can say.
Quizzes can be difficult but if you read and try to really learn the material you will get an A.

Dr. Dulai is a great professor. Bio 01 is normally suppose to be taught in 2 semesters but he managed to teach it in 1. He is very inspirational in his lectures and teaches well. Read the book, I know people hate to read but just read it and you'll receive and A. Do the homework, go to office hours and you'll be fine!
As long as you read the textbook for the quizzes in the discussions and study the assignments for the exams, you will be okay. However, the exams are cumulative so you have to study past chapters.

I hated how in depth he went for a non-major requirement. I am a business major (senior) and had no interest in the subject, furthermore his weekly quizzes in discussion were tough to pass. This is definitely a course for freshmen. In the end he curves the grades, which is helpful. Don't expect an A if you're not devoted to biology

I love the lectures he gives. One word of warning: There's a LOT of online stuff to do, and he won't mention it in class much. No other class does this much online stuff, check that REGULARLY, it IS graded. It's really easy, but there's a lot of it.

Students did not do well on his second mid-term, which he made demanding on us. Instead of backing down he kept his standards very high because he wanted us to know the material. Students complained. Many students came around and began to really take the class seriously. Well, in the end I learnt so much more than just genetics. I learned to study.
Dulai is Awesome ! type of professor who is willing to help you if you actually ask for help !

Honestly Dr. Dulai makes his class easy. I gave up by mid semester and didn't pass the class. The tests were hard for me but because I didn't attend lecture I didn't get extra credit. I thought lectures weren't important but they are! no one forces you to go but it is very NECESSARY!!!! Do the work and you will pass for sure!

There was quite a lot of information learned in this class and it is very fast-paced. I stopped trying in the middle of the semester but I was still able to pass thanks to his huge curve. Just do all your bioportal and do fair on the quizzes and you'll be fine. I failed all the midterms but I still got a B- so don't worry too much!

He makes biolgy interesting as it should be. Dr. Dulai has the best in class illustrations, where he gets his students to participate little examples he performs to demostrate complicated pathways and makes it easy to lear. He also cares about all of his students and is willing to beyond measures to help on reach their goals.

Because the course is supposed to be 2 semesters it is very fast paced. Dulai tries his best but often runs out of time in lecture. He is easy going and forgiving. He heavily relies on BIO portal for many things including test questions so make sure to use it often. Easy class just study for quizzes and test as usual.
Really easy, honestly just keep up with all the homework and bioportal because it really boosts your grade. If someone really tries there is no reason not to get A.
EASY PROFESSOR AND EASY CLASS, I JUST REGRET NOT DOING WELL ON THE QUIZES, ANYONE COULD GET AN "A" ON THIS CLASS
lectures are pretty much useless and he never really answers students questions. He mainly relies on Bioportal and his TAs to teach yet he has really bad communication with his TAs
he runs the class well but discussion is another story. bad communication between him and his ta made things difficult. one of his teaching aides just sucked
The most entertaining class I have ever had! He is the very best at UC.Merced. Seek out dulai if you have any bio classes. Had some issues with his TAs one semester. Bad wrap for him.
Awesome Professor!
Dulai is one of the best Bio teachers i had, he is really enthusiastic in teaching Bio and it is really evident in his lectures.

I am not a science major and found his class easy.  What a student needs to do is keep up with the reading.  I did not find the lectures too helpful and seldom payed attention to them, unless it was a movie day.  Read the book thoroughly (not skimming) and you will succeed.

I am a fourth year bio chemistry double major and Dulai is by far the easiest professor i have ever had. The only reason people think he is hard is because they arent science majors and they have difficulty understanding him. As long as you somewhat stay up on the readings and attend class it is an easy class.
reading the text a must, not very helpful outside of class
As long as you read the textbook and show up, you will pass. He gives INSANE amounts of extra credit.

Dr. Dulai gives great examples, and keeps the lectures interesting.  He tells you exactly what he expects from you, which is a lot. You can't just memorize in this class, you have to understand the material, and this shakes up many students who like to memorize. Study to learn, and you will remember; study to remember, and you will forget.
he is a good proffessor for bio
He is great man! loved his cancer lecture.

Dulai wants you to learn! His teaching style demands students do not memorize and that rattles some of them. I submitted to his style and I am now thankful for it. I am now a better student. He sticks to his principles and does not care about evaluations. He gives these after the final exam. My best professor ever! You will learn a lot about life.

This class is so hard but Dulai makes it better. If you must take Bio classes then take them with this professor, this work is still outrageous but he is a fare grader and you will pass if you do all of you work and come to class.
He's a great lecturer. Poor at making some things clear, but he keeps you awake and very creative on his teaching. He's much better for this course than Rudy the course developer.
Good professor, tough class, read the book and hope for the best. Exams have 5 right answers but only one correct answer, so you need to know the material inside and out.

His class is very hard. I mean it. I am a nerd, and I study my butt off for every class. this was the only class that I had F till last minute. He curved at the end.  not a good Idea. I didnt learn anything in this class. because the tests were multiple choice, and if you think: well that should be easy, you are extremely wrong. Hardest M.C. tests.

As others have stated, Dulai really wants to make sure you truly learn the material. He has high academic standards for students. His exams are difficult, often jabbing at the small but key details. However,if you are willing to invest the time and effort to READ THE TEXTBOOK (to really obtain that in-depth knowledge) and STUDY you will do well!
Dr. Dulai is there to help you learn. He prides himself in learning. He really knows his stuff. Great Bio prof

This professor wasted my money. He is unprofessional, unclear, rude, and does not show concern for student's problems in the course. He relies on Bioportal grades to give out a final grade, but Bioportal doesn't work correctly half the time. Lectures are useless and exams are hard.

Lectures are fairly concise although he typically doesn't get all the way through and you have to read the ppts independently. Otherwise, I got an A by concentrating on ppt material and minimal textbook reading. He's willing to adapt his teaching style for the class. Lectures are entertaining but exams can be tricky, so study up.
Extremely difficult exams. Very funny guy. Useless in office hours. Make sure you study about 40 hours prior to each test and read every fine print.

This class is unbelievably chaotic. Dulai is "teaching" from an online book but the web site is so buggy it is useless. I have only been able to complete 2 out of ALL the online assignments so far because of all the bugs. Prof. Dulai shows NO concern and is RUDE. Class is on the verge of mutiny. This guy needs to GO. What a waste of money.
Humorous

Unless you are a science major avoid this professor. The class averages on the 4 exams preceding the final were failing. He comes off as wanting to hear himself speak. Can be difficult to keep up with his asides (they tend to be more helpful when studying than the info on the actual slides).

Office Hours were not worth going to - his advice was to study LESS!! If you are not "science-minded" do NOT take this class, he is not helpful. Off-color remarks in lecture veer towards the wildly offensive. Hard work does not pay off.

This teacher is great! He is passionate about the subject and he is very encouraging. He does help with tactics and techniques of how to approach the material. Plus his lectures are entertaining - I haven't fell asleep even once. 1 con - tests are Hard and sometimes a little tricky. lecture slides are super-helpful for studying.

Terrible professor. He is extremely perverse in class and DOES NOT care about students. He believes that he is always right, when in fact, he is not. He prefers that his students do not ask questions and just listen to him rant about his "rightness." He should be your very last resort!
He's ok but I recommend that he is your last resort

He teaches you how to learn, which is better than just memory. Only later you will appreciate how valuable this is to your learning. Really learnt a lot by the end of the class. Deep reading, associations, reflection, really appreciate biology.

This professor is the best I have ever had. His course forced me to work very hard and it surely paid off. This course involves deep reading, so just don't read and memorize; make connections and the material will become clearer as you go along.

This professor likes to help students pass,especially because of all the extra credit he gives.If he only provided some study guides or clearer guidelines on what he wants us to know,he wouldn't have to do that.He seems like a good guy.His class is difficult.You either study as much as possible or nothing at all to avoid confusion over subjects
Cares about us

He is a great teacher. People who do not put in the effort to study will not succeed his class. People at school that complain about this teacher are lazy. He is not the teacher to just hand you the answers.... just like any UNIVERSITY COLLEGE TEACHER. Study hard and you'll get the grade you deserve.

He co-teaches with David Ardell. A lot better than Ardell, more "jolly". But this class is still difficult. It sucks up all of your time to study for tests. Had to waste $50 for a "clicker" that we barely use too. Essentially just used to keep track of who shows up for points.

This professor really cares for the academic well being of his committed students.  He tends to ask questions that require thorough knowledge of the subject matter.  So do not expect to breeze past his course.  Don't expect it to be easy but know that if you are willing to put in the effort outside of class to do well, that he will help VERY much
Always willing to help students no matter how much time it takes.

Had her Fall 2022 for PSY 001, Literally an amazing professor who made me want to pursue psychology as a major. Her coursework was all online through Top Hat and went with the assigned readings. The tests were also based on the coursework and she's very open to office hours. You will not regret taking her, very easy to pass as long as you show up

I couldn't let the 1 rating be her last rating at UC.  She literally changed so many students' lives and perspectives while she was here.  Because she saw something in me, I am getting my PhD. in BioPsych!  UCM was bad not to keep her.  Her new students are soo lucky to have her.  Altman and her classes change lives PERIOD.

I took this course online for summer and I talked to her once- the first day of class. Test and quizzes are the only things for your grade and have nothing to do with the old recorded lectures.  Course is asinine . Would not recommend

The professor makes the class interesting; she likes to engage with the students and is prepared to answer questions. I did take her previously for PSY 182, and she was just as good in that class. This class and the previous class required a textbook, which wasn't a problem since it was mainly for extra context and support.

She has a great personality and can make the class fun. However, she does grade very hard which can make your grade look ugly at times. Overall, I would still recommend it, but be ready to work and study a lot.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I am SO SAD she is leaving UCM!!!  Dr. Altman is always upbeat and happy about class and made learning fun. She is definitely one of my favorite professors and I would have loved to take more of her classes.
I LOVED THIS CLASS! Professor Altman made lectures fun and exciting.  She was very easy to reach outside of class as well. 10/10 recommend taking a course by her.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Altman was probably my 2nd favorite teacher of all time. She gave A LOT of extra credit if you showed up to class and was flexible. Participation is highly encouraged because that's when she gives you extra credit. The lectures were super fun and enthusiastic and the material itself was super interesting. Somewhat hefty reading though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: I love everything about the course. Most of the material is interesting and even if it is not the instructor makes it interesting. The class is interactive and that adds another level of learning to the course. The instructor is awesome too. She is very clear in her explanations and adds other material that helps us better understand the topic.
I enjoyed learning the material about visual perception and how my eyes work. I liked how the instructor was very passionate towards the subject and always willing to  assist if needed.

By far the worst professor at UC Merced. Went MIA less than halfway through the summer semester and taught only through pre-recorded old lectures that were terrible. This is not a psychology class but rather an excuse for her to talk about her love of art. Seems to be a nice person but is less than helpful when you need help. Do not take.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. The class is heavily art and painting based, with almost zero focus on psychology. 90% of questions on exams were multiple part questions; for example, the "31 question" final had literally over a hundred questions and a 1 hour time limit. Her prerecorded lectures are horrible. Avoid at all costs.

Although she's nice, her summer course was bad. She was traveling during it so she left us prerecorded lectures where she'd to skip over the answers to exam questions and she'd go off on tangents very often. Her exams made up most of the grade but she didn't really teach the exam's content. It's still passable but I'd avoid her class if possible.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things
