comment: I loved this class and this professor. She is amazing. She made learning fun and she is so caring and understanding. Seriously, take her. Dont miss out. Shes amazing. She uses videos, doesnt give out hw. Literally goes over questions thats on mid terms in class. Show up and pay attention and youll have fun.

Professor Altman truly cares the topic and her students. She jokes around with us despite it being early in the morning, and cares about students' welfare. I'm  surprised that she remembers my name and I really appreciate her. When professors know their student's names individually, it means that they take the time to know people in the class.

I thoroughly enjoyed this course by Professor Altman. She is bubbly and enthusiastic about Psychology which influenced me to be interested in the course as well. Her slides are well organized and most information came from her, not the slides which I believe aided in the amount of attention I should have for the class.

Attend her lectures to understand the material and receive any hints or easter eggs she gives out. The textbook was an interactive online book that's similar to her lectures, but with more detail. Tests have situational questions, but there are quizlets you can find to help you study. She's vague at answering questions so ask the TA. Study hard :)
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: We had lectures twice a week and she isn't the type to read off of the slides and wasn't boring at all. We had 3 tests which included the final which wasn't cumulative. The only homework we had was due the day before each exam on tophat and was really easy questions. Does in class questions as participation points and tends to give answers.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Honestly one of the most engaging professors here. She makes the lectures fun and really breaks down the content, so it's easy to understand for everyone. Get ready to do some textbook reading and questions, but it's not too hard. She offers a lot of extra credit opportunities if you participate in her demonstrates, so be sure to volunteer!

The classes are fairly big in size but Professor Altman is able to keep everyone engaged through her commentary and videos. The only downside is that the textbook is online so you would have to pay full price. Grading is based on in-class practice questions and tests. There was a total of 3 tests which are fairly easy if you pay attention.
Very great professor! She is engaging, funny, informative, and professional.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Altman is a great professor. She was always open for questions and is happy to be in class. We knew what was expected and exams can be really hard but study and you will be fine. The teachers' approach to the class, made it fun and interesting.

Even though this course had topics that were difficult to understand and learn, I believe Professor Altman did a wonderful job teaching. She is eccentric, excited, energetic, and has obvious enthusiasm during class. The course was very unique, I have learnt a lot from her and has also kept me engaged and ready for more.

Professor Altman was a great person but not so great professor. Tests were extremely detailed and confusing and often times not spelt out in lectures or in the textbook. There also is a Kritik portion of the class where your peers grade you and often times there was conflicting opinions. Would not recommend to take this class if you dont have to.

So nice and understanding really fun to have as a professor. The whole class was really straightforward notes have all the information you need Ive taken her classes both in person and online and each great offers extra credit and makes sure students understand easy to talk to and ask questions

Dr. Altman is hands-down my favorite professor I had at UCM by far. I took PSY001 with her my second semester of my first year & she inspired me to minor in Psychology. Shes clearly passionate about what she does & she genuinely cares deeply about her students success and wellbeing. Shes super accessible outside of class. I highly recommend her!

She has been my favorite professor throughout college. I have taken Psy 01, Psy 181 and currently taking Psy 161 with her. Her lectures are really interesting and she grades fairly! She does have a textbook, but I have not gotten it any of my semesters and still passed with an A. Her lectures are information heavy but if you study, you can do well!

She's super nice and understanding if you approach her with questions. She doesn't use +/- when submitting her midterm/final grades. I took her class during Fall 2020 and she was great in teaching via Zoom, her class was asynchronous with weekly quizzes, spontaneous extra credit opportunities, and she uses Lockdown for her quizzes/exams.

I personally have taken 2 courses with Professor Altman and am looking forward to taking yet another course with her this spring semester. She is super clear in her explanations and extremely organized through catcourses. From my experience in PSY180 we met once a week and talked about that weeks lecture but this course was mainly asynchronous.
Best UC zoom class ever

Not sure about the comment below- but she has BENT OVER BACKWARDS FOR her students this semester. She gave extra credit almost every week, she dropped chapters and lectures and like 60% of the class got an A this semester. AMAZING prof. Don't listen to the haters - they didn't do the work.

Altman was great at the beginning of the semester, she would not make it mandatory to go to her class. But with Covid and the pandemic she really doesn't understand that students go through a lot. At the end of the semester, if you want to talk about your grade just don't, she claims to say that you are just persuadin the teacher. Good luck
She gave really good lectures. She was very welcoming for questions & wanted you to pass her class. Very funny too

Professor Altman is a bubbly and funny person which doesn't make the lectures feel long and boring. I wouldn't complain about going to the lectures; not only was the class very educational but it was also entertaining. I recommend studying a lot since there is a lot of material and information that is included in exams.

The quizzes and Top Hat was skeptical at first, but it's worth it. If you just go to class it will keep your grade up. That mean's there will always be a grade as long as you come to class. It also prepares you for exams and tests, so you'll always do good. Good variety in lectures too so it feels engaging, it has it's charms and its exciting
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I am not sure what was going on with the comments below. Altman is fair and explains her grading clearly. She's funny and interesting, gave out practice quizzes (that appear on the exam later) and explained what material was going to be on the test during lecture. don't listen to people who didn't come to class all semester- this class 15/10

This is one of the best courses I have ever been enrolled in during my time at UC Merced. I learned a lot about evolutionary psychology. in fact I have wanted to learn more about this field of research. Prof is awesome too.

At first I thought she was a kind and helpful teacher but was I wrong. She is very rude when answering student's question and has an uptight personality but claims she is so generous. She also grades easy little assignments as if they are research papers. Not the worst professor I had but not the best either.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: She tricked me. I took her Psy 001 class and thought it was fun. But DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT take her upper divs . She is super vague on assignments and what she wants and gives irrelevant assignments. She is extremely rude if you point out mistakes she has made and WILL NOT admit to making these mistakes. Lectures are interesting but shes unfair.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Altman is an amazing professor. Honestly, having this class at 7:30 am was pretty hard, but Dr. Altman's enthusiasm was incredibly motivating. Her passion for psychology was refreshing. She always made me laugh and connected the material to real life situations.

Everyone should take her class. She's hyper-enthusiastic about the material even at 7:30am. She offers extra credit frequently and she makes learning fun through demonstrations and Easter eggs that appear on the exam from memorable moments in the lecture. Super nice!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Altman is awesome. She is funny and makes it worth it to go to class. She will tell you everything that will be on the exam and explain things as many times as you need her to. If you pay attention and work- this class is an easy A. - Really only people who don't do well are students who don't care or don't go to class.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Altman is one of the worst professors. I tried asking her questions after the lecture and she would give me attitude. Study hard for her exams because they are complicated.

She is not approachable for office hours. All her exams are scenario-based questions if you want to pass this class I'll recommend going to PALS. This class is a lot of studying and memorization. I thought i loved psychology but after I took her intro class I did not like it.
The fact that you didnt need to read the book to pass the class

Dr. Altman is an amazing professor. Honestly, having this class at 7:30 am was pretty hard, but Dr. Altman's enthusiasm was incredibly motivating. Her passion for psychology was refreshing. She always made me laugh and connected the material to real life situations. Additionally, she gave us tips on how to study.

Class is awesome- even though its super early. During lecture she tells you exactly what is going to be on the exam. Quiz questions are exactly like the test and she discusses them with the class and tells you how to use the questions to study. The class before the exam she has a review and answers anything you ask about. Makes it easy 5 stars.

If you are an incoming freshman and like Psychology, I highly recommend not to take this class. This class will make you hate your life for a while, Lectures are actually funny but there's no way to study for the test. The entire time there's no goal and you gotta kiss ass to pass. Thank you for coming to my TED TALK.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Great class, she really likes the visual system! Sometimes it is easy to get lost- the eye is complicated. But she really cares that you learn it and will answer questions as many times as you need her to in order to make sure you get it.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I thought I liked psychology but then I took this class. Altman can have some entertaining lectures but she fails to be clear and specific on what will be on exams. The online book we had to buy was a waste of money if I'm being honest. You will need to study a whole lot, and try to attend all classes because she will give Easter egg questions!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you come to class, listen, and study you can pass this class. She makes everything so easy to understand and is very well versed in the subject. You have to come to class to understand the material, though. The book assignments help a lot but aren't required. Her tests are hard, but if you study well for them they aren't too bad. Extra credit!
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you come to class, listen, and study you can pass this class. She makes everything so easy to understand and is very well versed in the subject. You have to come to class to understand the material, though. The book assignments help a lot but aren't required. Her tests are hard, but if you study well for them they aren't too bad. Extra credit!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She does go over a lot of material during her lessons. You definitely need to study for her tests if you want to pass.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Altman demonstrates exceptional teaching as a professor who teaches early hours. She ensures you understand the material as it can get very dense at times. Her exams are fair and easy if you review your notes and attend lectures.

She reminds the class to ask her questions if confused about material. If you can't make her office hours, she is willing to schedule another time. The lectures are interesting, but build upon previous material, so study well and pay attention. HW is writing your own exam questions. I highly recommend forming a study group for this class.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This was a really cool class. Discussing the visual system and art from the renaissance and impressionism through Pixar and lord of the rings. 4 tests and some homework essay questions- usually related to what you just talked about in class. Go to class and ask questions when you don't understand and you'll be fine

Professor Altman is an amazing professor! She is incredibly knowledgable in her field. She will make the class laugh and wakeup for the day. The book and attendance is optional, but I recommend attending class because it's a real treat and helps on tests tremendously (Easter eggs). She is very approachable and will try and learn your name.

I absolutely loved having Professor Altman! She made getting up at 7:30am worth it! She's super nice and energetic! Her tests are easy especially if you go to her office hours to get help. Definitely go to the test review lectures!

Hands down one of the BEST lecturers at UCM. Full of passion and enthusiasm, which makes her early morning class worth it. Class consists of 3 midterm exams, 1 final exam, and in-lecture quizzes. Exams can be tough, but Dr. Altman is more than willing to clarify confusion. Extra credit offered. Don't buy the book! Her slides are enough to do well.

you will learn about the visual system, eye, and brain, and art--some things are complicated but she will explain things over and over until they are clear. Lectures were really interesting, tests were tough but they were fair, plenty of xtra credit, and I learned stuff that i actually wanted to talk about outside of class with other people
Very hard class. Material is very complex. Homework assignments are very confusing. Very tough grader.

Took her for a 7:30AM class and thought I'd hate it, but she makes class fun and interesting. Tests are based off of lecture, so it's best to be there because she tosses in a few Easter egg questions that you'll only know if you were in class. Didn't use the book at all and managed to get As on all 4 exams. Do the extra credit!!
makes a 7am worth it

I loved how much enthusiasm Altman. I have never had a professor who actually wanted to come in at 7:30am everyday to teach us something and have so much passion. Her passion made me come to class everyday because I felt like I was learning so much and actually enjoyed learning these things. I wish all my classes were this

This course was intriguing and the professor was always upbeat and active despite it being 7:30 AM, I was excited to go to class; the subject matter was captivating, and the book wasn't a chore to read. Very easy to follow, and the professor was always willing and able to give more than one explanation for the harder concepts.
Midterms are tough. Wouldn't take her again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: AAA-MAZING class. She's tough but fair, she's funny but clear, LOVELOVELOVE this class - get up on time, come to class, participate- and you WILL LEARN!!!

you kind of have to go to lectures for extra credit sometimes and for attendance. I only read the book and got a B. But I'm not a psych major so this class was not really valued to me. DO THE EXTRA CREDIT
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Altman has the most spontaneous personality and makes the 7:30 AM class a breeze! Its so interesting the way she teaches in lecture and she makes everything fun. Just be on her good side and she'll work with you. The exams are hard and do extra credit.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Tests are tough

comment: Awesome teacher! Altman makes her class interesting, especially a 7:30 AM class. 4 test in total (3 midterms and 1 cumulative final). The midterms are doable if you study and understand the concepts. The book isn't needed however if you still want to learn more about psychology, feel free to dive into the book. Overall, an awesome and cool teacher.

I love Professor Altman!! She gives the best lectures and makes it easy to come to class at 7:30 am. She is so engaging with her students and genuinely wants us to pass her class. If you study for class, you will easily pass her exams. She also gives a decent amount of extra credit. Would 10/10 recommend to any college student!
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Altman is such an incredible professor! Her enthusiasm and passion for psychology is so contagious! I love her lectures as she makes them very interesting and clearly and thoroughly explains the material. I had her for a 7:30 a.m. class which was super early for me, but she makes it worth it! Tests are not very difficult; do extra credit!
She's so energetic and nice
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: I really liked Altman because her energy and enthusiasm keeps you interested and listening. She sums everything important in her lecture slides and doesn't make you read up on extra info. Altman also gives a lot of clues as to what will be on midterms and extra credit chances. So long as you go to her lectures and take good notes, it'll be easy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: AMAZING LECTURES. I had class 7:30am and Altman made me love waking up early to come to class because her lectures are so exciting and enjoyable! The way she taught made me love to learn every morning in class. This prof is the reason I chose to minor in Psych! 10/10 recommend her for any class. She gives "easter eggs" aka extra credit which helps

It was because of her enthusiasm that I was very motivated to not be an "empty seat" and attend class at 7:30 in the morning. Her stories and the way she presented the material was also very engaging and I truly learned a lot. I became very interested in psychology because of my instructor which lead me to declare a minor in psychology.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Best Professor, that I've had  so far. Ask questions take notes. Esay A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I took psych 01 with her last semester and it was such a great class. Even though the class was at 7:30am, she grabs your attention one way or another. If you do everything thats in your power to better your grade, she will pump your grade up. TRUST!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: This was my first time taking her class and I heard she was hard, but she's not. She's passionate about the class and slides are clear and to the point. Just study the slides and you will pass. Go to class because she doesn't post the slides. There was 3 midterms, in class questions she calls minute questions that are relatively easy. Also gives EC

Professor Altman is a great teacher, shes tough but makes learning interesting. I have taken two of her classes and love her teaching style. Ive noticed that you do have to read the textbook and attend lectures so if you are looking for an easy A, dont take her.  If you actually want to learn then take one of her classes.

Awesome professor. I took her PSY 180 class over the summer and I can say that she is the best professor for psychology at UC MERCED. I also took her PSY 001 class as well and she makes the class very learnable for the average person. She offers videos and amazing class PowerPoint lectures. You do not need the book for any of her classes. Enjoy!

Professor Altman is really passionate about teaching us everything that she covers. Seeing her so into the lectures makes it much more interested and motivated to want to learn and understand exactly what she means. Which is very helpful because most of what we learn is pretty difficult.

She is very enthusiastic, has a lot of energy, and tries to keep lectures interesting. Uses tophat for quizzes and attendance. Only had 3 journal clubs (1-2 page writeups on articles) and 3 exams. Exams are kind of tough but fair. Go to lectures to jot down her powerpoint notes (she will not post slides).

I had a morning class with her and it wasn't one of my most pleasant experiences. Some days she would be happy and other days she would snap at you. Sometimes she'd fly through certain material and she wouldn't allow you to take a picture of the slide, even  if it had important information for the test. Her tests are hard but she has easter eggs.

She explains everything very clearly, is patient with the slides so that everyone can keep up and no one feels left behind. She makes sure everyone understands the concepts before moving on. She is approachable and students can feel comfortable asking her questions and participating in class. Incredible professor.

She was a good teacher. Very enthusiastic. 7:30 am classes were not so fun, but she was a fun teacher. I remember she made someone fall in class lol  At the end she uses your attendance to help your grade if you're borderline so I recommend going.

From the first day, I really admired Altman's enthusiasm and passion to teach. When she's up on the stage every Tuesday/Thursday at 7:30AM she is awake, unlike the most of us haha. She was really passionate about teaching and psychology. I found it very inspirational. I am undeclared right now, but am considering psychology as a major.
Great instructor, can change her mind a few times, but she she gives allot of extra credit. By the end of the semester she always tries to help students with bumping up their grades.

I had Altman's 2 hour lecture at 7:30 am. At the beginning of the year, I attended all the lectures and learned from her without having to study. However, I ended up sleeping in through most of the lectures. I studied from the psych book(5th ed Nairne) and still did well in the class. She's an AMAZING lecturer, but if you know how to cram, you can.

This lass consists of 3 midterms and a final. It also requires you to recieve 3 SONA Credits to make your grade. A good teacher but since I had it at 7:30am to 9:30am, it was hard to remember what we were doing in class later on the day. You have to review your notes much as possoble. The tests are tough but you should study 4 days before an exam.

7:30AM class but Altman makes lectures really interesting!! Complete the "incomplete" slides she posts (by going to class) & study those in order to do well on exams (DO IT!) Buy the coloring book & study pages assigned (even little details) b/c they're easy points (exact picture). Go to class for hints on exam. Pop quizzes & attendance are fair.
She is AWESOME, I highly recommend her class. Just know that the tests are pretty difficult for an entry level course
Lecturer Altman is still an amazingly brilliant and entertaining teacher!  Yes I was right!  :-D

Makes a 7:30 class bearable. She's a very animated teacher who explains the material clearly and in an interesting way. Her tests are very straightforward and she'll usually tell you what exactly is on the test. Just pay attention in class, go to her office hours if needed and review the dense Intro to Psych material and you'll be able to get an A.

Professor Altman is an amazing professor! She makes getting up early in the morning enjoyable. She's always happy and in a good mood, despite the fact that the class is so early. She's passionate about her teaching and you can tell she loves Psychology. I look forward to taking any upper-division Psychology courses she might teach in the future

I seriously love Dr Altman, but I must admit her test which are all based off her lectures are extremely hard. However, she's always available and willing to help, just don't expect her to give you the answer, you actually have to work for it, but she will explain the material a million times if you ask her to.

Morning classes are not as bad if they are with Altman. She keeps the material interesting and engaging. Uses TopHat for attendance and quizzes. Exams are almost entirely on lectures that she posts partial versions of the morning before class. If you want all the information, you NEED to go to class and fill in the blanks. She's "tough, but fair."

Love Dr. Altman.  She is energetic in her delivery of lectures and you can tell she knows this topic in depth. Altman is truly interested in her students learning and enjoying the material.  She is always willing to meet outside of class to discuss ideas.
Dr. Altman has to be one of the best professors I've had. She is so engaging and made my 7:30AM class something to look forward to.

I'm a psychology major, and I thought her lectures were very informative and it was great to see the perfect balance between learning and engagement she commanded with her class. Whenever she called for volunteers, the sea of hands roiled and battled for her awesome demonstrations.

I love Professor Altman! She is a great instructor and I really enjoy taking her classes. I learned a lot from this class just as I have in her previous one. She never disappoints me, and overall this course was awesome

Altman is hands down the best professor I've had at UCM. I actively look to see if I can enroll in whatever classes she's teaching. She makes learning fun and really interesting. Her exams are difficult usually but if you're good at studying and asking questions, it's not too bad.

If you have the philosophy that Cs get degrees then you probably want to avoid this professor.  BUT if you are ok actually doing the work AND coming to class, she is one of the BEST professors at UCM. Her lectures are fascinating, she's pretty funny, and although she's tough, she's fair.

I had a difficult time in PSY 1 with her. Nothing went through my head. I worked so hard for a C. She's either someone you love or hate, for me I hated the teaching style. I know many people who love her style of teaching so just depends on you. GO TO CLASS!!

The instructors enthusiasm was crucial for making this class fun at 8:30am. The course was also very interesting as it combined the aspects of psychology and biology well.  I have taken many cogs and psych courses, as well as neurobiology, but it really was this class that helped me understand the structures of the brain and their functions.

Dr. Altman is very passionate about what she teaches and always has interesting anecdotes to tell that is relevant to the topic of discussion. She answers all questions clearly and give clear and concise clarifications. She keeps the class interesting even though some topics aren't as interesting.

Great Professor. Although attendance isn't mandatory. she made worth while to get up and go lecture, even if it was early in the morning. No homework, and to do well on the tests all you have to do is read the chapters in the book or review her power points.
Although it was super early, Altman's class was easy and fun. i enjoyed her in class participation examples. and she gives the kids who come to class a better chance to do better on the exam.

I really enjoyed Altman. She's down to earth and funny, making the class interesting even though its so early in the morning. She's a fair teacher, so the amount of attention you pay in class as well as the amount of studying you do is what you get as a grade. I would definitely recommend her!

She is very helpful and clear. You learn so much from her class and she is very motivated and nice. She teaches this class in the morning so it's hard to wake people up but she does it with her enthusiasm. Her test are very fair and she only tests you on the things she has had a lecture on.
Even though her class was super early her enthusiasm wakes you up! her class is super interesting! technically No homework but 4 Tests, and good amounts of extra credit.
I like how enthusiastic the instructor is about this course, it makes it very interesting to go to lecture.
I liked the instructor's methods of teaching.  Her pwr pts were great for notes.  I enjoyed coming to class every day even though it was early.  The instructor made learning FUN!

Teacher was VERY knowledgeable.  The course was interesting.  I had a GREAT time learning the material.  Teacher enjoyed lecturing and that helped motivate me, even at 7:30 in the morning.  LOVE DR. ALTMAN!

I loved this class and I didn't expect to. She makes it fun and interesting. Some didn't get her humor but I found her very funny. Exams are difficult but as long as you study you should do fine. Also note that this is a topic of her interest so she knows what she's talking about, I'll definitely take her again!
She is so chipper in the morning.  She is informative. Nice. Comprehensibly covers info.  The reason I get up on Tuesdays & Thursdays

She has a tendency to make an interesting topic extremely boring. She tries to be funny but fails miserably, and when attending office hours she isn't all that helpful. I would recommend avoiding this teacher.

She is a fair funny badass and she will notice if you are paying attention. This will matter TONS if you are between grades. Go to every class and do your work and you'll be fine. The difficulty of her classes depends on the nature of the subject as does her enthusiasm. Your best experience will be in a course related to morality-her main interest.

Meaghan is fun! Her tests are fair, provided that you have studied. Her lectures are captivating, she has a sense of humor in class, and one of the assigned textbooks is a coloring book to help you learn brain regions.
shes really easy to understand and keeps the class interesting. her exams are all fairly easy.
Really good teacher makes learning fun and interesting. not boring at all makes me want to pay attention

This teacher was excellent. She was very clear and had my attention the whole time.  Her tests are not hard.  They are what you should expect from a test. Just study or pay attention in class and you should do fine.
A really good and fun professor in my opinion. Definitely attend class as she uses material in the lecture in her exams.
You must attend lectures to get a good grade, she gives lots of easter eggs to put on the exam, gives a great study guide lecture and releases practice questions for the exam. Very helpful and nice!

The material is very easy, you must attend class because she sometimes give attendance points which can be used to boost up your grade at the end semester. She is a very fun loving person, all I did was attend class, turn in my homework, and smile and she loved me!

She was a little annoying at 8pm since she's really bubbly but other than that, no complaints. She doesn't post the full slides online so I highly recommend attending lectures. They're beneficial to your learning. If you pay attention and study hard, you'll do fine! It's not that hard.
she was an awesome teacher and made psychology a lot of fun! I loved her!
Extreme Awesomeness
Lecturer Altman is an amazingly brilliant and entertaining teacher! Don't think I'll ever be able to shake my crush on her though!  :P
She was definitely a great professor! You should attend lectures every time you have them and pay attention! It will save you on the exams :)
She was a great professor as long as you went to lecture and paid attention and read the chapter you'll do GREAT in the class =) BEST STAT PROF!
She is a great teacher. I had her for Psych 10 statistics, and even though the material was difficult, I think she did a great job.

Math with Prof. Haik can be a real challenge, but using tools like Unstuck AI alongside the textbook helps a lot. Expect a tough grading scale, but engage with the material and you can pull through. Overall, a demanding yet rewarding class.

This isn't an easy class to pass but if you put the work in and try hard throughout the semester you'll do well in the class. The mastery topic quizzes can be challenging but you can attempt them as much as you want, he also emails a list of things you need to know for each topic a few days before the quiz.

Had Haik for fall 24 semester, was a bit of a tough professor, he rewrites the same notes that he has already uploaded and during lecture it makes it frustrating because he NEVER answers question during lectures, if you ever need to take this class and have him as the only professor available, its best to wait til the next semester.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Ur grade is just the mastery topics

Haik is genuinely a very talented and knowledgable professor; you can tell he has a strong understanding of the topics he taught us. His whole "mastery topic" niche just completely sucks as not only does the class go quickly but given only 2 weeks per mastery topic and you can also get up to 3-5 new topics in 2 weeks. Lots of homework, not worth it

Haik acts condescending in his lectures to students who are falling behind on math topics and goes extremely quickly when teaching, too fast for me. Study before lectures or you will be confused. I liked the use of mastery topics, every two weeks you get one question on a certain topic & can retake in later weeks. Otherwise, I don't recommend him.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Don't take any class with this professor; it's a guarantee of failure; he gives lots of homework that is worth almost nothing. Everything is either a one or a zero, with no in-between and no partial credit given whatsoever. There are no midterms; there are quizzes once every two weeks that count for 80% of grades, and solutions have to be specific.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I've taken his class three times: Math 21, 23, and 24. He's taught me more than any professor here. He's tough, but. his proctoring truly has reshaped my study habits. He knows his material deeply, and if you commit to his challenging lectures and homework, you'll love his class, If you don't attend lecture and don't do the work you will HATE him.

Haik is a friendly guy, his lectures go too fast to take notes, zero partial credit for anything, never curve (pain for him), old tests not given before next test, multiple tries is great but changing the problem style sucks. Overall, avoid if possible but I guess if you want to know stress, take this course.

He moves really quick through his lectures and it's hard to keep up with him. However, he is willing to work with you. GO TO OFFICE HOURS. He has an all or nothing grading system, but if you put in the work you will be fine. He is super intelligent and wants his students to work hard. Just don't be lazy and you will do good.
He expects you to have mastered every topic before his class, he seems to forget that he's been studying this for years and we've only been at it for like 3.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I liked the class a lot. Grade depends on mastery quizzes worth 80%, but you can retake failed questions every 2 weeks. Con, quizzes are pass/fail, no partial credit. Answers are only correct if done w/ same methods taught in class. He teases students, but is nice. He knows his math. Put in the work & you'll be fine. Do the homework, it helps.
Very difficult way of teaching for someone who doesnt know much. Makes it very difficult to understand!!!
Please, if you currently have him for any class or you're going to take him drop him. Save your sanity. Horrible grading scale. Homework so so much for little reward.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: This class was a huge mess. He didn't spread out the quizzes well and for most of the semester we were working on 4 topics. The final introd 40% of the course material with no chance to retake it. If you didn't do the problem perfectly, you get a zero. No partial credit at all, going against his "mistakes are good" mindset throughout the semester.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Not sure how many student's Haik is paying to give good reviews, but they are not accurate to his class. Horrible grading scale, horrible attitude and just all around a bad class experience. Passionate, but is overwhelming for lower division coursework. Knowledgeable in his field, but not a great professor. Avoid his classes if possible.

Really tough grader and crammed way too much material in the last week! Lectures were confusing and went through notes fast. Mastery topics were worth 80% of the class and were graded really tough. Homework was also graded tough and took up hours of time. Do not recommend.

whole class was graded based on 10 quizzes and each one is all or nothing(can retake every 2 weeks). graded pretty harshly as one error could give you a 0. the main issue i had was that 4 of the 10 quizzes all happened on finals day without any chance to retake (all the material was crammed in the last week). DO A LOT OF PRACTICE PROBLEMS IT HELPS
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His lectures will have you more confused walking out than before you walked in. Most of my learning of Calc3 came from videos and doing practice problems. He overly complicates everything. Despite lots of studying, his problems are still complex. On the final, we only had 1 attempt to solve 4 problems based on topics we weren't as familiar with.

The most unfair math professor at UC Merced. Grades you on very few things and is still a tough grader. 80% of your grade comes from bi-weekly quizzes and he does not give any partial credit. One mistake and it's an automatic zero. Same goes for homework, only worth 10% and will not be graded if it's incomplete. Do not recommend!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Haik really cares about whether or not his students are actually learning, but this semester has been rather rough for both him and us students, he has taken on too much work by himself instead of sharing them with the TAs, and I believe a great number of us students are dreading our grades right now, as the adjusted grading scale is unknown.

I really don't like this man. 80% of the grade comes from bi-weekly quizzes that, while retakeable, are INCREDIBLY harshly graded- with no input on what you did wrong. Finals introducing way too much new content (going against the promised grading system). Weekly homeworks are harshly graded too- one question marginally wrong, and instant 0. Ugh.

Haik is a great teacher, who is passionate about the subjects he teaches. That being said, his classes are hard, because they too are built for those who are passionate about math. Realistically, they are not for the average person; you will work hard. All in all, he cares about you, your understanding, improvement, all while being fun and kind.

He has a great system that should work. But he is just a terrible lecturer. by far the hardest class I've taken even linear algebra was easy compared to this. He is also a VERY harsh grader and the assignments are all or nothing. I do NOT recommend!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Haik is a great professor, very enthusiastic and knowledgeable. His tests are hard, but I've heard that he has recently started to opt out of having midterms and finals.

I had Haik for Calc 2.This was a difficult class, but I was able to enjoy learning the material by going to his office hours for help and utilizing the Math Center. He is down to earth and an amazing teacher who is understanding.  He tried out a new system that I think worked very well for our class, where retaking tests were a main part of it.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Very straightforward and wants students to participate. A little confusing but is very open about office hours. Test almost every other class.
he is good at explaining things but sometimes he overcomplicates it and totally confuses you

Haik is a professor who is passionate about all things related to math. However, he is extremely condescending and acts like you should know the material. He told our class that we should have been expected to learn the formulas to every shape in middle school (like cones, cylinders, etc.). Tough grader and the exams are 60% of your overall grade.

Only take Haik's class if you want to listen to theory all lecture. He is a physicist teaching math to engineers and  math majors but does not teach application of the math. Should stick to teaching upper division math classes only.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Great guy, passionate about math and pretty good at teaching but he is a VERY difficult professor who expects students to know ALL prior material thoroughly. If you struggle with math, you will struggle in his class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Haik is very knowledgable and passionate about math. He is a mathematician after all. But he is extremely condescending and acts like you should know the material. Extremely harsh grader.

Condescending. Takes forever to get to the point. Unorganized. Even the TAs don't like him lol. Exams are easier than the homework, but that doesn't mean the exams are easy. No curve. Did I learn a lot from his class? No. Only reason I passed was because I taught myself. Useless professor. Knowledgeable, but very useless.

This is the worst professor I've ever had during my time at UC Merced. His grading was extremely harsh. You basically get no credit or full credit. His syllabus says homework assignments are like 15-20 problems, which is an fat lie. Expect 30-40 problems. He tries really hard to be organized, but just turns out to be a failure. Takeaway: LIES A LOT

Despite the rating I gave Haik, I believe he is very knowledgeable and passionate about what he's teaching. However, his teaching style is not fit to leach lower division math. He asks people to write nothing from lecture down, just observe and then read the book later. He gives homework the week of exams, and does not curve anything.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: its only 15 days into the semester and I just want to be stranded on a deserted island. just switch your major if you have to take this class with him. save me.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Attend lectures! Haik's a great teacher and a decently lenient grader. His tests are curved, but I can't say if this will continue for future semesters. The tests are easy enough if you understand the subject, even just partially. I'd also recommend his office hours.
Haik is known for being the toughest grader and having low test scores with no altered grade schemes. Disregard other reviews, AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COST.
Haik is very  knowledgeable  and is  alwasy willing to exapnd  on   topics so  long  as you put  effort  in. As  long  as you  go to lectures and   do  the homework  you  will be  fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Haik is INFAMOUS at our campus for being the toughest grader and having the lowest average test scores across ALL courses he teaches. HWs are very lengthy, avg. of 40-50 questions. Rarely posts his notes, so if you don't go to class, you're screwed. Worksheets are posted on the day it is due. AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS if you want to keep your sanity.

Tests, he is the absolute worst. Will give you review questions that don't correlate to the midterm. The review session doesn't correlate to the midterm. When your midterms are worth 30 percent and is only four questions, give us stuff that doesn't set us up to fail. Also he is bipolar af bc he will say don't rely on the textbook but you must
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Took math23 and math32 with him in the same semester so his midterms were all on the same days. I do not recommend taking multiple classes with him in the same semester. Very tough but good professor, learned a lot.
If you show that you care, he will pass you. Very hard class recommend to those who want to learn.

go to the lectures. all of them. he runs a hard class but he understands the material like you wouldn't believe and can break it down to a point where honestly it was easy. i think I only asked one question all semester. haik is very enthusiastic and will explain things further after the class is over too.

This class is so easy, TAs skim through the homework. Quizzes are copies of homework questions. Midterm are the same as the practice midterms with the addition of a handwritten homework problem. Homeworks are  ironically much harder than exams questions. Extremely accessible outside of class. Overall great professor 
(No Final btw)

Honestly, this man will be a menace to your GPA if you are nothing willing to bend over backwards for his course. If you are learning from your dorm room reading off of class' slides, you are screw, but attendance is not mandatory. The TAs however will hold it against you - your attendance are recorded to the financial aid office. Be weary.

Haik is a great if you care about learning the subject. If you understand the ideas, you can figure out how to do any problems he poses. Homework is important. He's very forgiving for algebraic mistakes, but expects that you understand the main concepts of the material. He answers questions about the material kindly too.

He is a great professor, makes everything relatively easy to understand using concepts and visuals. His quizzes are definitely tough, but the questions are directly from lectures and homework, so if you complete them on time and understand the basics of what he is teaching you, you will do fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Haik cares for his students and is understanding, especially during COVID. Although the material in the class is difficult, he drops 3 quizzes and a midterm and doesn't have a final exam. Some of the questions on his quizzes and exams can be frustrating though. If you're close to the next grade, he'll bump you up.

Makes you work for your grade. He had pre recorded lectures that he would post for the week and creates quizzes every week that are based off of lectures but he doesnt create questions that are number problems but rather conceptual questions. Discussions are mandatory too and you have to participate in order to get credit
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Definitely one of the hardest professors I've had thus far; my class was cut short due to COVID and that made learning calc 2 harder than it already was. His final was awful in my opinion -- 30 multiple answer questions with 65 minutes -- I barely finished and he had to curve the final. Watch out for the pop quizzes!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Ok I know he has a bad rep and everything but to be honest, he is pretty good. His lectures are all on discord/youtube so you can look at them during a quiz. He rounds up and curves the class so it's rare to fail. I think majority of his class has an A- or better! He is understanding and there's not much homework. Most grades comes from test.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: I got a a 5/140 on the final and passed with a C. Tells you all you need to know about the class and how its set up.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Haik is the worst professor I've ever had. 50% of ur grade is based on quizzes and if u miss one question you fail the quiz. His quizzes are worded bad and very hard. The mean is always an F or below for the class . He does not want us to pass

Haiks a nice guy, but is unorganized and has unfair grading policies. Quizes are 50% of the grade and they are select all the true statements, and only 2 points for 2 questions. He also doesnt like to listen to students and does what he feels is best without listening to the students. I have heard he curves classes hard, hopefully ill get lucky

Haik has created the worst possible course outline for any student ever. In my course, 50% of the grade was quizzes. The quizzes were only two questions. This means if you made any mistake throughout the entire course on average, you would fail. This is a warning: avoid this professor. He may be a nice person, but his design of the course is bad.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Best teacher of my undergraduate career. Was a difficult class, if you don't stay active you will not understand the material. The class is hard for a reason and prepares you for upper div classes. He makes you feel respected and intelligent. Bottom line, he knows you can do it. He just doesn't appreciate laziness and shortcuts.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Attending lecture is extremely vital for his classes! He constantly reminds his students that the material talked about in lecture is exclusive & wont appear in other courses/materials. Lectures are fast-paced/tough & can be fun (he does go on tangents). Make sure to review your lectures notes after every lecture. He really isnt out to get you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Please do not hesitate to take haik because of what you hear. He is literally one of the most caring professors. He curbed the class so heavily and rescaled the class so no student would be harmed. His lectures make sense. He answers all questions you have. He just wants to make sure everybody learns the material and he's very supportive.

Frustrating professor. The entire semester you do not know what your grade is in the class so you do not know if you are performing well or not. How are you supposed to know if what you are doing is working if you get no form of feedback?
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: The biggest lie of your life will be that professor Haik "is too hard". I was sincerely worried about taking his class because of all of these comments and bcs I struggle with classes in general. However, he gives us quizzes from problems that come straight out of the homework. If you don't understand something, go to his OH he's a really cool guy.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This was the worst class I have ever taken. I was at a 95% no thanks to Haik, because I had to teach myself everything. He is an awful professor who goes on constant tangents and could care less about his students. Get a different professor if you can.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Haik is a funny guy. He tends to go off on a bit of a tangent during lectures but overall will keep you engaged. Your best bet when taking his class is to study very very hard for the quizzes throughout the semester. DO NOT rely on the final exam to fix your grade, its typically challenging. Use office hours to your advantage!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: You have to put in the work for this class not because of Haik but because of how dense the material is. Do well on the quizzes from the start to give you cushion. Attend lectures, office hours, and the final is 40% but he does some "curve" to get a lot of people to pass. It's not as bad as rumored. I was scared at first. Im glad I took it w/ Haik
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Tough grader

comment: This was one of the hardest classes I've taken so far. The worksheets are hard and they go beyond what you learn in class; however, if you attempt all problems you will be fine. His lectures were engaging and I looked forward to class. His grading system is wack, but he really cares for his students and wants them to pass. Take Haik if you can!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: If you can get Math 12 with a different professor, switch as soon as possible. Haik's lectures are confusing at best, and you'll most likely have to teach yourself the concepts. Your entire grade will be dependent on quizzes and a final, and the worksheets given have no answer key, so there's no way to tell if you're right. Transfer out if you can.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I regret leaving a negative review of Haik earlier. He cares about his students and wants them to learn. That being said, you will be stressed out from not knowing how well you are actually doing until final grades have been posted.
terrible professor, skip him at all costs.
Worst professor I've ever had. Haik assigns problems that are nearly impossible to solve and makes students feel dumb for not understanding the material. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: It's not easy but learning what you learn in Haik's classes will make your other classes his material applies to a breeze because you will understand what you're applying and how you're applying it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Best professor for Linear Algebra & Differential Equations. If you pay attention, attempt the problems assigned and actively ask questions, you will learn. Dont be discouraged by the negative comments on his teachings. Those probably came from students that simply wanted to memorize steps for problems rather than learn the proofs and concepts.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I heard both good and bad things about this professor. Took him for math 24 this semester and it was the most difficult class I've taken. I went to office hours and the math center multiple times and yet to no appeal. His curve is made to have most of the class fail. Advice, avoid him at all costs. I'm staying another semester now because of him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Incredibly enthusiastic and passionate instructor. But one of the toughest professor's I've had. Keep up your studies, do well on quizzes, and try your best at the very difficult final. I was not a fan of his methods, but he cared a lot for the class and wanted us to learn. Don't be swayed by the difficulty. Put in the work, and you'll do fine.

Good lectures, passionate about math. Study for the quizzes and you will do fine. He is available in the math center. Make sure you know your algebra, or else you will probably struggle in this class. The final is structured so if you do well on the quizzes, you will pass the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: His worksheet problems are really hard, and the quizzes are hard too.
The quizes determined my entire grade, didnt take the final due to a high grade. Make sure you study for the quizzes, every section is graded on a curve so your grade is likely not as it appears
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: People will tell you that his class is one of the toughest on campus. This is a flat out lie. Go to lecture, and make sure you're paying attention in discussion and you will have no problem getting an A.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I was scared to take his class at first. But truly, he is not bad at all. He cares about his students, and is willing to help! To do well attend ALL lectures, study for each quiz in discussion for two hours prior, ASK questions in lecture, and go to the math center. If you want a good grade you have to work for it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many--Amazing lectures

comment: Haik is hated by many students because of the way in which he structures his class. He does not give midterms, this is a method where all the stress is put on the final, at the very end. It gives you time to study for all the other courses you may have. Only take him if you are willing to LEARN the material, don't take him otherwise.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests are tough

comment: If you don't do well on the final you will fail.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: I will NEVER take him again. Took Math 12 because it was easier than Math 22 but I feel like this one was harder in my opinion. No midterm which may sound good but in the long run isn't because that makes final and quizzes worth a lot of your grade!

Haik is extremely tough, but only so you can thoroughly learn the material. I was so close to dropping bc I had an F. But after studying and going to tutoring for the final, I ended up with a B- in his class. Going to lecture isn't enough you have to take the time to go to tutoring or studying outside of class. Don't be discouraged! Ask for help!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Haik's love for math is insane. I just took his class and passed with a B-. This class was insanely hard the work you have to put in is insane. I didnt study for my chem or bio final because of this course. Everything you do in discussions is pointless because the only thing that matters is passing the final, if you think you can slack goodluck.

In my opinion, I found Haik to be inspiring. Most of the time he comes to class upbeat and excited to talk about math which makes it interesting to learn. However, make sure you pay attention and practice by doing lots of math problems. He makes sure every detail counts because a "careful student minds the details." If you have questions, ASK!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Haik's class has to be one of the most difficult lower division math classes I have ever take at this university, not because of the content, but because his teaching style and methods used. Doesn't explain his derivations very well and gets frustrated when you ask questions. Attendance not mandatory, but you're better off learning from the book.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Hardest work I have every put into a class. I hope I pass. I took the final and it was exceptionally hard unless you understand the creative aspects of the problems. I went to every office hour and not even sure that I passed. I am awaiting my score for the final hoping that I pass.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Took in Spring 2016 and it was a ROLLERCOASTER. Went to both lectures/ multiple office hours and spending hours outside of class to nail the material down.. this class was enlightening. Haik's excitement only made me want to learn more. It's a shame I'm a bio major otherwise I'd have taken math 23 24 etc. PUT THE TIME IN. Hardest I've ever worked
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: He goes through things very fast and had quizzes worth 65% without anything like homework to help balance grades or practice. The final was difficult and worth 35%. That is all he had for the semester were weekly quizzes then the final. There were no midterms or homework. He changes things every semester so you never know what to expect.

I took him for vector calculus, and honestly that class was a joke, To EASY!!. Haik has watered down the material, Exams are too Easy, he is an easy professor. He wants people who are honestly not college capable to pass and therefore makes lectures and exams too primitive. His exams are at a high school level.
good lectures, helpful in office hours, assignments are long and difficult

Haik is rude professor and extremely judgmental. Went maybe 5  times to his office hours and stopped going because he just made me feel dumb. I started going with Derek instead and was able to pass thanks to him.

Don't recommend him at all, expects you to solve all the problems as if you are a math professor. Have to go to office  b/c he won't explain everything in class.  Very judgmental & says "If you can't solve a problem like this and think ahead, don't bother going to Med school." Why judge, are we not smart enough? Studying hard, stillfail. Grading

Haik is such a good professor, honestly if you don't pass his class it's because you didn't try. He has 4 hours of office hours a week. He is very helpful, patient, and understanding. Best math professor at uc merced.

Haik is a really good professor. He may be intimidating, but he knows what he is talking about. He is very knowledgable in math. He really wants his students to KNOW the material- not just memorize stuff. It's tough, but he is always there to help.

First off, the class is insane. MATH 023 is easily the hardest class at UCM but the complete lack of tests made the class much more bearable. The homework assignments are, however, incredibly difficult. I spent every other week doing nothing but the homework sets (library 247 for a week).

Haik is an enthusiastic mathematician and a fantastic teacher. It is easy to get lost if you're not attentive (and even if you are), but he is more than happy to help out in office hours and is excellent at explaining. Homework can be tedious but doable and there are no exams. You cannot slack off in this class if you wish to pass.

It is clear that Haik loves his craft, but that can make things very confusing for a student who is not a math major (or isn't "good" at math). I found myself struggling throughout the semester. Would recommend studying vigorously for this course. No midterms or final, which is a plus, but the way he graded made it impossible to slack off.

People are not lying when they say he is a difficult professor. He makes your brain want to pop! Learning basic skills are not enough, you need to practice and go above and beyond. I failed miserably.

Haik is one of the greatest professors ever. People who complain only do so because they haven't put in the effort. Haik expects a lot from his students because he thinks highly of them. He wouldn't insult them by making things too easy. He is readily available outside of class and is extremely enthusiastic.
Great Professor! Very clear and would suggest taking his course.

Teaches as if students were at his level. As a first year student that came into this course with no experience in calc, his teaching methods were EXTREMELY confusing. Be prepared to be completely lost in his lectures. Tests are EXTREMELY difficult and most students fail them. Even with days of studying for his final I managed to fail miserably.

Haik is a very smart professor, and is a fairly skilled lecturer.  However when it comes down to the tests, that's where many students WILL FAIL. The tests are hard in that they go beyond what should be expected for a calc 1 student.

Hands down! best math professor I ever had in college. He is gives clear explanations of the required material and more. If you are really interested in math, he is the right professor for you. Expect to work hard in his class because he gives the longest hw assignments, but you will get an A if you do them the right way.

Haik works very fast paced but he explains everything thoroughly. He really wants you to succeed. He tests very fairly and very straight forward. There are no tricks. Though it may be discouraging that he lectures at such a fast pace, he is always available for questions and he is more than helpful in ensuring that you have a good grasp of material

You will never know what to expect on exams; material tested is above and beyond what is "taught". He rushes over subjects giving lots of unnecessarily difficult examples and little explanation of how to solve/prove them. Answers questions incompletely and rudely. Course is intended for students who have taken and done well in calculus and algebra.

He was an amazing professor.  There was never a day in class where he wasn't interested in teaching the subject and the students weren't interested in learning from him. I always came into his test knowing what to expect and there were never any surprises.  His HW was very helpful to my learning and the TA was awesome.

Haik is an awesome instructor, and he is super clear and gives great explanations.  He tells you exactly what he expects of you; as long as you pay attention, are relatively astute, and do the hard work necessary (i.e study and do the homework), there's no reason you shouldn't get an A in this class.
Amazing teacher. Expects a lot out of his students but is willing to help every step of the way. Very passionate about his work and his love of math is .....dare I say it? InFECtious.
He is an amazing instructor. However, he expects a lot out of his students, so expect to study a lot. If you ever take him, be sure to focus mainly on the theorems and how each of them work or fail.
Amazing teacher! I would go to office hours simply to do my homework. They were always scheduled to be two hours long, but he would stay for four or five. Very dedicated teacher; enthusiatic.
Good at some topics, confusing in others. Beware: moves through material at a fast rate

He's definitely an interesting professor. Obviously very passionate about what he teaches. However, he expects a lot out of his students. Be prepared for a lot of work. The TA is very helpful though and the professor takes time out of his day to help students with questions.
Wonderful. He made me actually like math. His enthusiasm was infectious and really helped me in this course. I couldn't have done it without him.
Best Math professor ever! Take his course.

People talk so greatly of Ross and I can see why. Took 2 of his classes and passed them both. However once I shared with the class a traumatic experience and singled me out for “smiling” when really that's how I cope with trauma. If he's a psych professor I feel he could've been more considerate. But other than that he's cool I guess..

Took human sexuality Fall 2023. Very easy class, but attendance is part of grade. Homework is assigned through tophat but easy to do. Tests have tricky wording and are a larger part of the class so make sure to study because they are not open note. He does let you skip one test and use your final to replace it. As long as you show up you will pass

He takes attendance online, code is open for 2 mins. IF YOU MISS THE ATTENDANCE CODE THERE IS NO POINT IN GOING TO CLASS. You only get 5 excused absences. Gives a study guide that doesn't help in any way. Gives an exam each month, the exams are basically worth your whole course grade, exams are based on lectures and the book, BUY the book to pass!!

Overall great professor, he allowed up to five unexcused absences. His course mainly consisted of exams (one exam per month) and allows to retake one exam if you missed it. He gives out extra credit on SONA and was passionate when it came to his lectures.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: If you can avoid it, avoid it. Material is interesting but he's not a good teacher. also has favoritism to men
Student to student, dont take this class unless your trying to show up for absolutely no reason. takes points away for every class you don't show up to and exams are 65% of your grade.

If you can avoid taking a course with this professor, avoid it.  you lose points every class you miss. If you are going to show up to every single class, buy the textbook, buy tophat for the semester, and work extra hard in a class for no reason with limited help or resources, then this is the class for you

Does not care about his students. He is very sarcastic and loves to drop your grade the second he has the opportunity. I told him that he never warned us about a specific grade drop, he said, "then read the syllabus!" this guy is COLD!

Avilla has zero regard for his students. He says he's open to change but when told what's not working he will just tell you why his way is better. There are four midterms, book and lecture-based, he provides a "study guide" but it's useless. The only good thing is that he is an engaging professor

Bro is pretty chill as a person, but can't say the same as a professor. He keeps his attendance code for 2 mins. IF YOU MISS THE ATTENDANCE CODE THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO POINT IN GOING TO CLASS. You only get 5 excused absences. He teaches off of his slides and gives a study guide that doesn't help. He keeps the class engaged tho (most of the time).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He gives examples of homework before assigning it, and plenty of time after class to stay and finish homework if you need help. It was an interesting class and I learned a lot. Just be sure to do the work, anyone can easily pass the class while learning a lot. I highly recommend taking him,

You'll have 4 exams, 5 group meetings, and five excused absences. Read the textbook or you'll fail the exam. No, he doesn't curve. He's chill, but also gets frustrated when no one reads the textbook. Lectures are usually ~60 min but sometimes they feel way longer than that

Reading the past reviews, it seems his classes were pretty good in person, but online, not really. He doesn't give extensions or much extra credit. If you have an online class with him, it'll be tougher. As a psychology professor, I thought he'd understand the situation of his students a little more. Most of my other professors do, so that helps.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He's not bad. He loves to dock points if you miss certain classes. He removes points without prior warning. He will sometimes give you exams at the START of class as oppose to the end. If you try to ask him about it, he brushes you off! A warning of all of this could be helpful in preventing reduction of points, but that's not what he wants.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Totally oblivious to the needs of his students.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I am surprised by all of the positive reviews of a professor that is so unhelpful. In the few conversations I've had with him, Ross has demonstrated a complete lack of empathy for his students. Glad to see I am not the only student who has been left in the dark by this teacher. I expect better from UC Merced.
Very inconsiderate and doesn't seem to realize we are in a pandemic. Required additional materials NOT included in syllabus and gave students four days to acquire them or drop. Absurd.

Professor Avilla is a good lecturer. The class is very organized. There are 5 exams, 1 group project, and random in-class participation assignments. The exams are a mixture of lectures and the textbook. He provides study guides for the textbook. He provides class time to work on the group project. The class is very straightforward. I learned a lot.
Ross Avila is Spectacular. Definitely makes learning easy.

Avilla is an amazing Professor his lectures are really fun and engaging. He is really enthusiastic which helps the class a lot, always making jokes and putting up funny videos. Attendance is mandatory, you get a code to put in Canvas, which helps your grade in the end. Overall I really enjoyed the class.

Professor Avilla knows what he is talking about and makes the class fun and exciting. Participation matters - we had an in-class. assignment almost every lecture. There is also a group project at the end. He also offers extra credit.

Awesome professor!!! So professional and approachable. He knows his material and is always open for new ideas or change. His classes are fare not complicated but full of knowledge. He is so so smart!! One of my best professors here at UCM.  Gives great feedback and is very inspirational. You must take him.

Really good teacher and interesting lectures. Definitely read the textbook closely. The tests are multiple choice, but the questions can be a little tricky. Don't miss lectures! Attending class will help you on the tests, and the lectures are really interesting anyway. He's also funny. I laughed a lot! I want to take another one of his classes!
Great professor, study hard and you'll pass the class! Great examples (Video Examples, Visual Examples) that make the lecture memorable. Would take him again, really enjoyed being his student.

Avilla was amazing! He made lectures engaging, hilarious, and bearable. He encouraged class discussion and the hands on examples he would show us would really help you understand the concepts he was teaching. He's really kind and caring, very friendly as well. The midterms are very concept based, and equal parts lecture and textbook readings.

The only reason I put attendance as mandatory  is so you won't miss his extra credit opportunities he'll mention in class. 4 exams is all you need to double focus in that class. He is available for office hours, and if you need to make up an exam, he is lenient! He convince me to minor in Psychology

Dr. Avilla is awesome! I definitely learned a ton from his class. He definitely keeps lectures interesting and I would recommend him to everyone. The tests were not that easy, you should definitely study for them because many of the questions are a little more complicated than you would think.
AMAZING PROFESSOR!!!!!!!!!!!

Loved the class, wish he'd be put more questions of the readings rather than the slides, kind of makes reading pointless but it is VERY IMPORTANT to read in order to understand the content, if you do that, you should have no problem passing.
Hilarious
He is an amazing professor, his lectures are always interesting. It is difficult to fall asleep during these lectures.  He is fun and engaging, I would take the class again if I could.
One of the best professors I've ever had. Going to his lectures doesn't feel like I'm going to class because they are so interesting and fun. Be sure to read the textbook for exams.
Fun class
I loved Dr. Avilla's class! He gives a ridiculous amount of extra credit. Midterms are hard, but he provides long study guides that really help you out.

GREAT PROFESSOR! TAKE! TAKE! TAKE! Class is fun, great guy, hilarious lectures, best professor I ever had. Go to class, do the reading (don't even have to take notes when reading), do all extra credit. Ace the class, simple as that! Some get by w/o reading btw.
Read the slides!! That's all you really need to past the class. Never really read the book. Pay attention in class and take good notes.
Very easy to understand lectures, he likes to crack a joke oftentimes.
Very energetic and helpful professor.
Avilla was an interesting professor and was rarely a bore in lectures. He gives study guides which are very helpful and should be done as you go along the course.

He gives really interesting lectures which cover most of what is on the tests. For this class there are just 4 non-cumulative tests and no final with plenty of opportunities for extra credit. You do have to study for the tests but he gives study guides which help a lot. Overall I really enjoyed this class.

Ross is one of my favorite professors ever! I always looked forward to his lectures, and he really made the two hours fly by. He was enthusiastic about the material and a really funny guy in general. The test were easily passable if you pay attention in lecture and read the book. I would recommend him to any student interested in psychology.
Ross is awesome.  Love his class.  He's funny, lectures are interesting and class is easy. recommend x 100!!
He is simply  amazing at what he does.
Dr. Avilla is hilarious and makes the lectures come to life. You have to read the textbook and study but it's nothing a little hard work can't help with.
He's just simply amazing !

Dr. Avilla is a beautiful man. He is super adorable and stylish. His lectures are very interesting and fun so you never fall asleep. Although his class is fun you do have to work for your grade. For the final I read the whole book and got 100%. His test are straightforward. Go to office hours if you need help and don't slack off.

Professor Avilla is an awesome professor! He really knows his stuff and knows how to explain it very clear. His lectures are filled with fun, it sometimes doesn't even seem like a lecture because all of the content is very interesting. After learning about psychology from him, I am not interested in the subject. Definitely take his class!

MY FAV PROFESSOR OF ALL TIME.  LOVE HIM. Looked forward to his lectures which says a lot considering they were 2+ hrs. long.  He was so entertaining and the class always so interesting.  I even enjoyed the book!  It was very easy to follow and engaging.  By far my favorite class ever.  Tests ask questions on lectures and book so READ and show up!

I took this class over summer and I really enjoyed it. Ross' lectures are super helpful and you will understand the material a million times better if you attend lecture. He takes attendance using TopHat and gives daily quizzes on the day before's lecture. We had 3 exams, 50 questions, 2 points each. Pretty clear cut. Study and you'll pass.

Very fun class overall! But if you're just looking for an easy A psych class, this isn't it. 50 multiple choice questions on exams, but the questions are very tricky & many are based off readings from the book, so READ! 4 midterms total and a group projectpresentation. Dr. Avilla is very enthusiastic and he made the class very entertaining & fun!
Great professor!  Very clear and entertaining lecturer and very helpful during office hours, not only with class related topics but with any topics in general also.  Highly recommended!

Nat Sci. Major took the class as an elective, Avilla is great he really seems to enjoy and love psy!! if you want to ask a question he is super willing to answer he loves student interaction. You'll need to read the text to pass the tests, the readings are long if you wait to the day before the test.  I would totally recommend Dr. Avilla .!!
So far I really love this class

By far one of the best Professor's I've had the UC, very engaging, funny, and really cares about what he teaches.
