There is a lot of information between the lectures, videos, and book but he also provides multiple resources, so you really have no excuse to not pass his class. Attendance is required bc sometimes he will quiz you on his lectures.

The class overall is very interesting. He knows how to keep the students attention. His lectures are clear and informative. I also like how he gives great examples about the concepts and topics. The book is very useful. He is very approachable. When I went to office hours, I received helpful responses to my questions.
He's Great!
This teacher doesn't really help you out much. You ask questions and he doesn't seem to answer your questions. Pretends that he cares, but really he doesn't

I was failing the class because I didn't study for the first two exams,however  I studied and aced the final two exams and went from an F to a C+. He offers extra credit and is very clear about all subjects he covers, his class is very interesting and never boring. I regret not studying I could have passed with an easy A.

This class is very useless. His lectures are really pointless and really obvious. The textbook he uses for this class is confusing because it's a customize textbook and he uses two different books and isn't clear on which book to use. Never willing to help or answer questions. Overall worse experience ever.

One of the best instructors I've had. Clearly, he puts a lot of effort into his lectures. He makes them entertaining and easy to follow. Not to mention he's a cute little thing. Put in some effort and you'll learn a lot.

Took his PSY 1 and PSY 145 class. Super easy in PSY 1 but if you're in any of his other classes be prepared for a challenge. That said, the guy knows how to make a subject fun! I had so much fun in his PSY 145 class even though I got a B. Definitely recommend.

If you want a professor who can keep a large crowd awake and interested in the material Professor Ross is the one for you. He is very charismatic and does his best to make the class fun. If you do well in the first 2 tests you can choose to skip the final. Make sure you look at his slides most of the test comes from there! Good luck.
Easy course, but I wish I put a little bit more work in. He's a great professor. Opened up to us and told us he was gay and discussed his research. Cool guy.
Very helpful and made the class fun. Also, if you do well enough on the first few tests you can skip the final.

He is a charismatic professor, but I am a critical and skeptical student, and I don't care about charisma. Lectures were good, but could have been better if he paused to ask if there were any questions in between slides, and was more aware of the room for possible hands. Overall he was good, but just not great.
Straightforward. Attendance gives a chance of extra credit. No laptops in class, but it is interesting enough to hold my attention for the hour.
One of the easiest classes on campus. I went to lecture 5 times during the semester and came out with a solid A. Just read the textbook and study the powerpoints. Easy 4 units.

I had him for both human sexuality and social psychology. His lectures are rarely dull. He doesn't grade on your general understanding, his exams are extremely specific. Make sure to read both slides & books & learn specific numerical data otherwise your scores will be average.

Ross is simply one of the best professors out there. He is super funny and I love the guy! He teaches a couple of other Psych classes, but they fill up pretty quick. He's hot too so that's a good enough reason to go to lecture. Also, his tests are based off the slides and material covered. But definitely read the book over time.

I've had Ross for Psy 131, Psy 15 and Psy 1. So, I have to tell you all that he doesn't grade very hard, but he is tricky when it comes to what he puts in his midterms. Please, at least skim the book (especially for psy 131, not really psy 15) Because he does include random questions that are VERY specific to the readings. Please go to class.
Attend lecture and look over the lecture slides. This class is not hard, but if you're lazy... your grade in this class will reflect it.
Smooth, straight forward instructor and class. He's funny and professional. You don't HAVE to go to class, but honestly why are you even in school to begin with if you're not here to do your best?

Very fun teacher and makes his class throughly enjoyable by providing interesting examples and being overall funny. You can not attend lecture and easily pass with a B simply by reading. I stop going to lecture after awhile but studied the ppt slides and book and got an A. I would love to have him as a teacher again, highly recommend him!
Straight forward, funny, awesome :)
Very interesting when it comes to his lectures.  Straighforward

I've had Avilla for PSY1, PSY10, and PSY15. His grading procedure is straightforward, 3/4 tests count towards your grade with an optional Final. His teaching methods are fairly dry but he covers the require material presented in his tests.

Awesome and interesting teacher. His tests  are kinda difficult, but passable if you just pay attention in class. Attending lecture is the key to actually getting an A though. He's very friendly, although my office hours visits to him weren't always very helpful.
Very interesting and fun!
All you really have to do is show up for lectures! His interaction with the class is the best part.

tests are based on where the text book & lectures cross. good amount of extra credit opportunities. Ross is a great instructor. really interactive during lectures. throws candy after the break. pretty chill class.
Super easy. Posts lecture notes after class. Almost pointless to attend lecture
He is a great teacher and he always makes really fun (:

Dr. Lee is not just a professor; he's the Beyoncé of economics. Every lecture is flawlessly choreographed and effortlessly delivered. His voice is a soothing yet authoritative symphony that could calm a volatile stock market.  The way he phrases concepts is so memorable that you'll find yourself explaining game theory to strangers at Starbucks.

If you are considering taking ECON 001 with Dr. Lee, let me assure you: this is not just a course—it is an odyssey of intellectual enlightenment led by an instructor so brilliant and inspiring. Dr. Lee doesn't just teach economics; he embodies it and transforms what could have been a dry topic into a symphonic masterpiece of supply and demand.

Professor Lee is one of the funniest teachers I have had. He makes lectures interesting and engaging with students, and while attendance is graded, you can miss a few classes and be fine. The class itself was not insanely difficult but even if you are new to investments Lee explains things in a way that anyone can understand. Top econ prof at UCM

Professor Lee has fun and entertaining class. He tells lots of jokes, you should definitely stay till the end of class because he does do extra credit. He does give breaks half way through class. He curves every midterm because he wants you to pass. Watch his review recording and you should pass the class!

Reasons why I do not favor Lee. Great guy if you know him personally but
- His office hours are too crowded
- doesn't help much during OH
- assigns too much work that is against the notes
Nice guy, very chill, very fun but shouldn't be teaching such advanced classes when he can't meet the demand for students that actually need help.

The class was lecture heavy with a lot of information in each class. As long as you do the homework and try on the test you will pass. He curves almost all exams because he wants everyone to pass. I honestly thought I had failed the class after I finished the final, but I ended up passing

If you have the option to, take Professor Lee. His classes are fun to attend and he curves almost every exam because he wants every student to pass his class. As long as you do the homework and get decent grades on the exams, you will pass this class.
Good professor, tough grader, funny, bratty, and gives a lot of work.
Just about as quality of a professor you can get.  Somewhat reachable and pretty funny, but highkey gotta work for that A cuz tests r rough.

Professor Lee is an awesome teacher. His lectures are really fun and he is a funny guy overall. He gives unexpected extra credit and he curves his tests. Love this man. I would definitely take him again if I could.
Prepare to work for that A! Class is VERY lecture heavy and attendance is mandatory, very strict on that. Participate and you'll pass. Also, do not take him over the summer, the workload is a lot.

Professor Lee was incredibly knowledgable and passionate. His lectures were fun and easy to follow (although they were nearly 2 hours long). He graded fairly and curved every midterm significantly. He took time to answer questions in class and held a review session for every exam. Relatively easy class as long as you go to lectures and take notes.

I hate this class. For this class you either pass your midterms with perfect score or you fail. Like literally every midterm you have to have a good score because if not it pulls it down. Any other work doesn't even count towards your grade.

Professor Lee was a good teacher the way he taught the class was by a big lecture hall but if you sit in front you could see the notes he was writing out for you. He did upload the notes that he did in class at the end of the day. As well as his grading is pretty easy as he curves the grades on midterms and the final. 1;50hr class don't nap!

Professor Lee is one of the best professors at UCM. There are a lot of notes but as long as you keep up, you should be fine. He curves every exam. The class average for most of the exams were about 50%, but he will curve it by like 10%.
Great professor, the homework matters, but midterms are what end up determining your grade. Extra credit opportunities.

He's a really good professor because he tries to engage with the class even though it's a big lecture. We're mainly graded on our 3 midterms, Final and problem sets. As long as you do all your work and study for the exams you'll do good. He provides reviews before every exam which is very helpful and has files/ video recordings of the lectures.
Homework - 1 or 2 times a week and usually not that hard if you go to classes. Midterms hard and need a lot of studying for them. Would recommend taking this professor.
Hes great and youll pass
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Lee is a solid Econ professor. If you're an econ major at UCM, you will eventually take one of his classes. He's fair on grading and seems like a genuine guy. 8/10

Never went to lecture, pulled all-nighters before exams, & got an A. He heavily curves every exam & curves grades on top of that. Ton of extra credit. You have to actively try to fail his class. He has stellar notes too. From what I've seen, it's clear he also cares about his students and is very understanding as well. Would recommend this class.

Professor Jason Lee is a troll. I left class early and he gave extra credit to everyone who stayed. I asked if he would do it again but the whole class was watching Prof Hitch's twitch stream. He said, "Why would I give extra credit for watching twitch". Besides that, Prof Jason Lee is a very qualified teacher, very humble, chill, smart and a troll

Professor Lee is one of the best professors you can have in the economics department at UC Merced. Everything is very clear from his notes to presentations, to study guides. Multiple informative announcements are made to help students. The material in his study guides/practice exams is guaranteed material for the exam. He is absolutely amazing.

Professor Lee is the best professor in the Econ department. He's a very good lecturer and can keep students engaged by making jokes related to the material. If you're having trouble he is more than willing to help you out during office hours so you can understand the material. I've honestly never seen a professor care about students like him

Professor Lee really cares about his students. There is a lot of note taking, but instead of just using power point he explained to us while writing everything down. Always checked to see if there were any questions.

Dr. Lee is a great professor that managed to connect with students while ensuring that all the information was understood. He is very helpful all you have to do is ask. This was my first semester at UC Merced and I hope I get to have him again!

Class is very lecture heavy. You have to retain so much information. Each midterm is based on like 8 chapters but with lots of information, as an A student I held a C. You have to study and remember everything. Notes are essential!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Professor Jason Lee is one of the greatest professors at UC Merced. He will help you when you do not understand if you ask for help. Office hours are iconic and explains things very well. He is also super smart, patient, and just amazing. Forever a UC Merced legend

This is my third time taking Professor Lee's classes. To be honest I think his teaching strategy very matches how I want to study. His lecture is very clear and always points out all the key formulas and theories for students to focus on. Both the examples and in-class exercises give a chance to better prepare for HW and exams. Highly recommended!

Straight up, Professor Lee is by far one of the best out of UC Merced staff. He makes classes enjoyable and fun during breakout rooms. Very easy to talk too if you need any help with homework or quizzes. A huge plus if you mention you don't like the SF Giants or 49ers !
Textbook? No. Readings? No. Tests? Easy. Homeworks? Easy. Office Hours? Helpful. Insurance? Geico.

Professor Lee is one of my all-time professors at UC Merced. He can make economic concepts difficult and explain it so simply. Should be inducted into the Econ HOF. Very comedic and knows how to make jokes. Having him as a professor has been one of the greatest blessings I have had. His classes are litty

The hws are easy and his review sessions are a must. Make sure to study and don't be a dummy and cheat he finds ways to catch you. Take his classes cause in the end he is a really good professor just hard to talk to cause all the boys are mushed in his office hours taking up all his attention. Go to class he gives extra credit a lot in person

Class is an easy A and also the professor is always available whenever you need help. It is advisable to always go to class as he gives extra credit when you show up and go to office hours especially if you are having difficulty in class or just need some help with homework. Also, NEVER CHEAT because you will get caught.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Jason Lee is a very good professor. He truly cares about his students which is why he holds so much office hours. However, you do have to work hard in his class and the only students who complain are the ones who arent willing to put in the work. I will most definitely take him again.
WAY TOO DIFFICULT. i am an average A student and have been failing his class all semester. Not once have i failed a college course. it just proves how difficult is this course

Dr. Lee is the best Professor that has ever lived. Dr. Lee teaching is like drinking fine wine. Ever heard of the quote "You can lead a horse to water, but can't make it drink"? Well Dr. Lee could make that horse drink. Dr. Lee without a doubt has made me fall in love with Economics and has inspired me to be better in life. THANK YOU DR. JASON LEE!
The course was interesting and I learned a lot. Professor Lee makes learning the subject fun. He was enthusiastic in lecture and used real world examples. My favorite professor by far!!!
Decent professor but assigns a ton of homework.

He's a good professor, he makes everything clear and concise just make sure to ask questions if you don't understand something. The exams are easy as long as you pay attention to the lecture. Plus if you stay the whole lecture there are times he gives extra credit.
His lecture is full of text and boring. I will be much engaged in class if he puts more images in his presentation.

He teaches the subject very well and makes it easy to understand. If you need help, he has office hours; you can also check your answers for the homework and online quizzes. His way of teaching was excellent for me who's a visual and reading/writing learner.

He's an awesome professor. He teaches very well and makes the material easy to understand. He uploads the lectures later too, so if you missed something or you missed class, you'll do alright because the notes are online. He also curves the tests. Homework isn't too difficult.

had him for spark ( econ thru sports ) and was an easy A. just do the homework and he curves the exams. funny professor! theres two group projects, as long as you talk and get all the info you get the full points. plays kahoot & the person with the most points at the end of the semester gets extra credit.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Jason Lee is a modern day Shakespeare, in the flesh. I was one of the students who sat in the front everyday, and its equivalent to a front row seat to Lebrons games or a Kanye West concert. Dr. Jason William Lee gives amazing performances on his lectures and writes concise notes. He has inspired me to greatness and his kindness.

Professor Lee is very good at teaching economics. He is able to dumb down information so everyone can understand it. The homework is exactly like the tests so if you are able to do the homework you will do good on the test. Professor Lee is very approachable. His office hours will help tremendously. Professor Lee is the best Professor I ever had.

Professor Lee is an amazing professor. His lecture are intense but he provides notes on CatCourses. He also takes attendance but he drops four attendance points. He also drops your four lowest problem sets out of 20. I recommend a study group for this class to do hw and study for exams. He does provide exam study guides and the final is cumulative.
Make sure to follow along with his lecture, he's pretty thorough. He interacts with his students as well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Lee, is a great professor that is very well respected, I took him for both ECON 1 and ECON 101 He is very nice and is willing to work one on one with students in office hours on hw and practice exams. He enjoys making fun and joking around with students that he is close with. He also makes sure to take time to review before exams.

Dr. Jason Lee is the man. He is really clear in lectures and is really open to interact with students. I am really shy, but he makes it really easy for you to ask questions. Made economics interesting. His persona is the best, he always roasts on some of the students that are close to him (in a nice way). Definitely recommend anyone to take him.

Professor Lee is by far my most favorite professor I've had. Although his lectures can be heavy because he gives many notes to take, his class is relatively easy. there are no quizzes and he curves every exam the final!! there is no possible way that u can fail his class!!

I bought the textbook but didnt use it. Just went to all the lectures because it was mandatory for attendance points. There is homework (problem set) after every 1-2 chapters or lecture. Curves midterm and final pretty fairly.

Professor Lee is a really great professor to have. I found his lectures kind of boring but he really does go in-depth with the material and is available during office hours. The homework is 20 problem sets and there are three midterms and one final. As long as you understand the material, the class is pretty chill. And he takes attendance .
One of the best professors at UC Merced. He keeps lectures very interesting. 10/10 would recommend. Do not purchase the textbook for this class. You will not need it.

Jason Lee is a very cool professor. He's very funny but also a smart ass. If you're a Psych major he will roast you nonstop. His midterms aren't very hard and he provides study guides. He provides help with the homework, you just need to show effort.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY--Would take again

comment: Go to his office hours (he'll help you out and it gives you a chance for him to get to know you). 8 total homework/problem sets. 1 investment group project where you play wallstreetsurvivor and write a paper on your experience. 2 midterms and 1 final. He gives you cheat sheets for the midterms and final; also provides study guides.

Jason Lee is a man's man. He is readily available and he has inspired me to achieve greatness. He is hands down the best economics professor in the economics department. His lectures are mezmorizing. His classes are enjoyable, brilliant, and real easy. You would have to be an idiot to fail this class.

His notes are helpful and his tests aren't so hard. I never bought and book and didn't need to anyway. Random extra credit pop quizzes here and there. I always recommend him to friends and he is why I switched majors.
The Best.

You can expect homework and hard tests with this class. His office hours are extremely helpful though. He has such a great passion for what he does, it is difficult not to become completely interested in the course. I chose a major because of this course.

Teacher's notes are extremely helpful, clear and concise. Textbook is not needed as lecture notes are posted online. He tells you what is expected of you in the beginning and syllabus schedule is followed throughout semester. Homework is extremely helpful. Go to his office hours. Tests are straightforward as long as you study. Do the practice exams

Jason Lee is the best professor any first year would take! I would not recommend buying the textbook, since his lectures are on the website. Unless you are a econ or business major, i would recommend the textbook. He is so funny, and curves the grade. He understands students life, and if you talk to him in office hours, he'll be lenient.
Lee was a very clear and concise about the material. Tends to be a bit fast paced but always helpful if you go to office hours.
He's an awesome professor. Organized and clear. There is an online quiz every week, but you can get help from him in office hours. HW biweekly, and a test around every month, cumulative final.
He is a really good lecturer, and gives info really loud and clear

He is an amazing teacher. I love his teaching style. He writes all of his notes along with his students. They are also posted all online, so if you cannot make a class, there are no worries. He provides practice tests and informative study guides. It is really hard to fail the class, but it is also challenging to earn an A. Anyone can do it though.

Both a riveting lecturer and relatable voice in office hours, I have seen this professor inspire students semester after semester. I consider him to be the best lecturer this campus has had the privilege and luck to acquire. I feel sorry for those that will never have the chance to take a course with this brilliant man. Also a total heart-throb.

A mentor , best selling author, winning smile, bodacious bod, but most importantly a best friend. This teacher can only be matched by his brilliant mind. With recent advancements in cloning technology Jason Lee is on the number one prospect list. MVP was created by the chancellor in 2005 to define him as Most Valuable Professor.

This man is an amazing teacher. His interest is that of the students. He always tries his best in order to help students succeed. His extreme charisma is not only backed by his amazingly good looks, but by his ability to demonstrate his interest in what he is teaching. If you need someone to talk to, just go to his office hours. He's there to help.
Great teacher. If you are an Econ/Mgmt student, my advise is to take Prof. Lee's courses ASAP, it will make all your other courses a breeeeeeze

Best Professor I've had at UC Merced. Very thorough and helpful. He is really helpful in Office Hours! Extremely knowledgeable and always ready to help the students. I wish more professors were like Jason Lee.
Easy. Just show up and write his notes.

Professor Lee is exemplary of everything a professor should be. He is exceptional at relating economic concepts to situations an average student may understand. Though his lectures are unfortunately long, he lightens the mood with witty and humorous comments often pertaining to his ego. Easy to talk to. One of the best professors I've had. He's hot
Very helpful. Uses comedy to maintain interest of the class.

Great Professor! Always ready with examples and lectures prepared. Constantly asks the class if material was well explained before moving on.Easy to talk to. Had a great personality so I wasn't intimidated to talk to him. Wished more professors were well prepared like he is. Awesome Professor!

An outgoing professor who effectively teaches the fundamentals of economics in this introductory course. His unmatched alpha-male presence echoes through the lecture hall as students are captivated by his teachings. Professor Lee's office hours are a feasible alternative way to study. The exams are fair, no complaints. 10/10 would take again

Professors should learn how to teach by the examples of Professor Jason Lee. Better then best of the greatest Professors. His notes are worth gold. Read the notes,attend lecture, then the course is just relaxing and eating triple chocolate cake. Sincerely, Professor Lee clarifies economics in-depth. Extra helpful in office hours.

Great professor, uses funny examples for his lectures, easy midterms as long as you study and pay attention. He is also always willing to stay as long as you need for office hours to work with you, one to one until you understand the material and homework.

He is an amazing professor. Very passionate about Calc so he knows what he is doing which most professors suck at. He gives a lot of extra credit and curves a lot at the end. The best part is he makes Calc so easy and fun to do. He has clear grading criteria and explains all that we need to do beforehand. Exams and participation is important!!

One of the best to do it. Genuinely loves math and shows it through his lectures. Lecture slides are easy to understand (and if you didn't understand, he had good LAs). Be ready to complete Knewton Altas and quizzes in discussion. Discussion attendance was mandatory, but lecture attendance wasn't always required. THE GOAT

I had to retake a course for Calc 2 and the difference he made was night and day. Unlike my previous professor, he explains things in great detail and makes sure everyone is able to understand. Topics that had me confused previously turned out to be easy when he broke it down. Lecture was very helpful most times.

Really nice guy all around. He's an easy professor, but the content is hard. He makes learning it fun. Only problem I had is that he moves VERY quickly through the slides, so just make sure you pay attention and you'll be smooth sailing. His exam questions are very similar to the review slides he posts ~1 week before the exam. DO NOT FALL BEHIND.

This man makes math fun. Calculus 2 is inevitably difficult, but his class doesn't feel as hard. There is a lot of homework, but the teacher (and TAs) is readily available to help. He does have an accent so if that's a problem for you, you might struggle but his class, yet his notes aren't bad at all, and office hours are very helpful.

The class was great, the midterms are about 40% of the grade so the 3 midterms given should be studied for. Office hours were great for understanding so I would recommend going to them. There is a lot of homework however if you attend the lectures the homework should be relatively easy.

He's the easiest Calc professor at UC Merced. Homework can be tedious. There are also weekly quizzes in discussion sections, but if you do poorly on those, extra credit is offered throughout the semester. The grading criteria and weights are very fair. He posts lecture slides and practice guides, which help prepare for the midterms/final.
great professor

Professor Yatskar was dedicated and enthusiastic, but his lectures tended to be difficult to follow and often did not make it clear what would be important. The homework was unreasonably hard; a lot of the problems could take up to 30 minutes with 10-20 similar ones to finish in two days. He gave partial credit on exams for writing down problems.
Very interactive and clear teaching style, lots of potential for extra credit, and homework is forgiving. Always gives study guides and says what material will be on exam.

One of the best professors! Picks simple questions on midterms which were similar to the study guide. If you attend lectures, you'll easily pick up the material. Super enthusiastic and you will enjoy learning from him.

Professor Yatskar is the best professor at the school, hes godly amazing lectures, honestly sometimes I wish people would applaud for this man after his lecture. Hes an amazing professor just make sure to do your hw, discussion TA Masato is the best very great at his job and explains in amazing detail couldnt ask for a better way to learn Calc 2.
Good use of lecture time and explains concepts very clearly. Even at 8am, lectures are interesting and exams are short and straightforward. Cool guy

Professor Yatskar was great and super knowledgeable of vector calculus. What made the class even better is the fact that there was significant extra credit. Exams were completely from homework assignments. Please take him if available!!!

I've had him for Math 21, and 23 and he was great in those classes. For math 32, I think it is different, there is double the homework, quizzes are on the worksheets and if you know Prof Yatskar his worksheets are tough. There are quizzes every week on WS and they expect you to remember every WS solution. Don't recommend him for Math 32.
Yatskar is super fun and chill. Amazing class and met some cool people.

Yatskar was a great professor and had amazing lectures where he would go step by step on how to do problems. He ensures that students know what concept to implement into problems. All exams and quizzes are based on homework, so as long as you know how to do the problems and understand the process you'll do fine.

Professor Yatskar has taught me Calculus I and III, his teaching style is great and as long as you can complete the homework you should be fine. Math 23 has been one of the most easiest class I have ever taken even though the material is suppose to be challenging. Professor Yatskar is a great professor and I hope to have another class with him!

Professor Yatskar's class is by no means easy, however he is an amazing professor and is very understanding. Exams make up a total of 60% of your overall grade, however I found that he gives a great amount of material to prepare you and offers a great amount of extra credit on top of that. Yatskar was a very good lecturer and taught very well.

Has lots of extra credit. Really respectful and has a sense of humor. His lectures are really easy to follow, and his exams are completely based on the homework and practice exams he puts out. Recommend this class.

I've had the luck of taking Yatskar for Calc 1 and Vector calc. Yatskar is definitely one of the best math professors for lower division. He is a really funny guy and the way he teaches is really good. During lectures, he is able to make hard concepts seem very easy. Tests are not too hard as well, his exams are based on the practice exam.

Hes the GOAT of math at this school ong. His homework prepares you for everything and makes a really hard topic seem easy and understandable. Overall just a great professor. I completely recommend taking this professor over any other if given the option. Just overall a awesome dude.

Absolutely the best math professor at UCM. His lectures are informative, funny, and not overbearing. Plus he gives extra credit and practice exams which actually mirror the real exams. I would recommend him for anyone who's required to take Math024.

Best Math Prof in Merced. Homework is easy to understand and if you don't, the website gives you a practice example and shows you how to do it. Gives practices exams and if you do the homework you shouldn't worry about the exam. He makes difficult concepts, easy to understand. Defleinty would recommend his class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Had him for spring last semester online. Has a bit of an accent which doesnt get too much in the way of learning. Can be fun at times. His lectures over some examples, but doesnt always explain his work or where he got X from. His exams are fair. He gives study guides that are very useful for the exams. Everything is based around the homework.

This professor was a good one even if I took the class online he was hilarious he made the lectures fun and was totally worth taking the course online very good at explaining and gave some good examples on the class very worth taking the course.

Prof. Yatskar is an amazing professor. He explains topics clearly and always stops the class to take questions. He has a slight accent, but this does not impact his teaching nor does it affect student's understanding. There are weekly quizzes, and somewhat medium sized homework assignments (9-12 questions. He gives study guides that help for exams.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: For Math21 in person, hes great For Math24 online, ehh. I don't think he is a bad teacher per se, but he rushes a lot on lectures(luckily they are recorded). I imagine him to be a better teacher in person. He gives extra credit and curves. Also, attend lecture, he will give in lecture quizzes at any time.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is good at explaining his steps during lecture and is willing to help outside of class if you have any questions.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He is a great professor. His class has some hard topics but you just have to study a little bit. He's a great teacher and very helpful. Also offers extra credit for his student and you better do it cause it will bring your grade up 5% minimum some people it brought up 10.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The best math professor at UC Merced.
i took his class this past summer, and although it was a fast paced environment and online, he still taught well

Yatskar is ok. Although, it's hard to understand him sometimes. His exams weren't hard, but there were a bunch of curve balls. I like him as a person though, he's really funny! He wasn't my favorite math professor, but I could see why people like him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Easy Class best professer I ever had. Makes learning easy. Slides make it easy to understand. Gives plenty of extra credit recommend 10/10.

Professor Yatskar is a truly great professor. I HIGHLY recommend going to all his lectures because he explains everything very clearly. He also offers extra credit every week for just being in a study group. He dropped the lowest midterm also. THERE IS NO FINAL! Just 4 exams throughout the semester. I also recommend going to office hours.

Great teacher, makes math lots of fun and easily digestible. Doesn't give much homework, and the homework he does give helps with the understanding a lot. He keeps the classroom alive and gives easy extra credit opportunities.

Probably the best and easiest Math professor ever. Super chill dude. He helps the class to understand Calculus and loves to walk around the class to see how the class do in class lecture problems. Gives out extra credit to students for out of class group discussion problems. Midterms and finals is USUALLY based on his study guides for the class.
He is a great professor and the class is fun .

Took 22 instead of math 12 because I heard he was a great professor , turns out he is and you actually learn things in his class. gives extra credit and is super enthusiastic. Never make you feel stupid , dumbs down the problems for you. Wish we could have him for math 12 or bio physics . whatever is on practice exams is on actual exam. Take him!
for me probably the best math teacher ever. He gets involved with his students and keeps the classroom alive. He will sometimes crack jokes and keeps the students interested in math.
Very cool teacher. Engaging class to be in. Learned alot from his examples and lectures.
He is chill and awesome.

Professor Yatskar is the GOAT. He is really funny professor, and I always laugh at least once each and every class. Is really clear on what we need to learn. Very accessible in office hours. We were also provided an opportunity to make a PowerPoint of applications of what we learned for extra credit. Quizzes come from hw. Sign up with YATSKAR!
The best professor so far in college. Would recommend this professor. He is hilarious.

Pretty funny guy, even though I think he doesn't try to be. Honestly it is an easy A. Especially if you took calc in high school. 3 midterms, around 5 problems each, and weekly quizzes but you are given a set of 6 problems each week and one of those will be the quiz. So it is really easy to get perfect scores on all the quizzes.

Yatskar is the best. He has a weird accent but you get used to it throughout the semester. The lectures aren't all that informative, just the example problems tbh. His midterms are five questions (up to 3 parts) and the TAs grade them. 10/10 would recommend

Professor Yatskar is clear on lectures. He's funny and incorporates jokes in his lectures. Best Math 21 prof. Three midterms and a final. Don't screw around on the midterms because it will be hard to bring your grade back up.

Yatskar is an amazing professor. During lectures he always makes sure to give students a quick review of what was covered the previous lecture so that nobody's lost. When he teaches he's very enthusiastic about the subject and he cares about students understanding how to do the problems. I would definitely have him again as a math professor.

While Prof. Yatskar becomes less helpful as the material becomes more intense, he's a fine professor overall. He chooses to do examples of the easy problems in class so you are sometimes left without the tools to do homework problems. He assigns far too much homework, encouraging students who don't have 100+ hours a week of time to copy chegg.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Best teacher I've had so far

Three midterms, one final, weekly quizzes. Yatskar was a fantastic math teacher, but his class was totally disorganized. By the time you get a graded midterm back, you are already taking another one. He curves at the end, but throughout the whole semester, you are in fear for your grade. He does offer weekly extra credit but does not help much.
Yatskar keeps you awake during a lecture and that is what matters most. Lectures are an integral part of the course and he explains all the necessary materials.

Yatskar is amazing at explaining concepts during lecture. The class and tests will be tough if you don't attend these lectures. You should try to attend lecture every chance you get, because if you pay attention in these lectures you will definitely do well in the class.
In my opinion the best Math professor. Funny but not on purpose. You might not necessarily like him at first but you'll miss his enthusiastic lectures and in class examples.
Awesome professor tbh
Yatskar is too awesome. Do the worksheets and go to office hours to optimize your potential. He makes it interesting and the test are not tough as long as you do the worksheets and the homework.
He's a very unique character, he makes learning calculus fun.
Great teacher, really knows math and how to teach it
Very enthusiastic about his material, thoroughly explains concepts, and keeps you interested.
Great professor! Super helpful yet did have a thick accent. Workload minimal, with extra credit for attendance to office hours. Nothing too unexpected out of this class. Curved at the end.
He provides a brief description of whats going to be on the test, but doesn't emphasize the material so because each midterm is weighed so much once you mess up there's no turning back.
online homework wasn't as helpful. the tests were simple, but i just dont think 50 minutes is enough time at 730am to take his midterms....
Pretty good professor. Makes things easy to understand and his midterms are not hard at all. Easy A, as long as you know how to use the formulas in this class.

Yatskar isn't the most exciting teacher, however he's still a damn good one. If you let him teach you, you will learn. Class isn't necessary if you're not looking to go; you can teach yourself straight from the book. Tests are ridiculously easy and the "quizzes" are questions straight from the homework. Do the homework, go to class, easy A.

As long as you know what the class is doing, you can try learning from the book. He basically teaches from it. He tries to crack a joke here and there so it made the class less boring. Overall, he's alright. Not a hard class, but you still need to do your work to really understand the topic.

He is a really great teacher. Doesnt go into very elaborate problems, but teaches the general idea very well. i love the pace of the class, it is very slow and gives plenty of time to understand the material. Also, the tests are great because they are not screw you over hard, just difficult enough to test that you know the material.
He is one of the best professors ever. Although his accent makes him somewhat difficult to understand, his excitement for teaching the class made all of us equally excited to learn it.

Cool guy, funny guy, saw him at Hometown Buffet once. He knows what material is hard for students and won't hesitate to go over it with the entire class and/or privately. And he plays doubles on his own.
Very clear explaining examples, occasionally funny, and all around a great math professor.

He's a funny guy. I like how in every lecture, we'd spend the first 15 mins to review what we learned before. He's willing to help and his midterms arent THAT hard. The quizzes are harder haha. (midterms usually 4-6 questions with emphasis on small things.. ugh)

Although some people don't like him, he is a good professor. At times his accent confuses people but he is willing to explain topics as much as you need him to and he is very helpful (all you have to do is ask).
He only uses examples from the book, so if you need new examples to understand, you are screwed. He seems friendly, but is not very helpful.
No Comments

Professor Khislavsky is so passionate and nice,and you can tell he is interested in what he teaches. There is an online textbook that you will likely need to skim through often, and there are lots of extra credit opportunities. The IT sets for homework were a bit challenging, but you will have groups for working together on those. Would take again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: Alex is a professor who's really passionate about his job and teaching the class psychology concepts. Class was given late in the afternoon everyone looked tired, but he kept the class going by his tremendous amount of energy. Must read the chapters to pass the exams. Quizzes are short. It's important to attend to class he gives extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: Do not take PSY181. He is rude during office hours and does not explain concepts well. His tests are VERY long for a very short class period. Assignments are straightforward but often feel like busy work. He is always changing little policies and fine details for assignments. Save yourself time, stress, anxiety, and your GPA by NOT taking him.

He cares about your mental health, he also gives a lot of random extra credit throughout lecture ( make sure to go although its not mandatory bc the extra credit helps a lot). He will also curve your test grades which is pretty sweet of him. The work is very easy, but it is time consuming. Every week you will have to record a video with your group

A lot of group work and extra homework assignments. Too many quizzes, all my friends took Altman and it was messed up how they had 4 weeks to do homework and never had quizzes. I wish I took Prof. Altman instead RIP.

I enjoyed this class very much! Lectures aren't mandatory but if you attended them it made assignments so much easier and lectures were very entertaining in the material we learned. Work load can be a lot if you leave it till the end. Great professor when it came to explaining anything that you were confused on and was very understanding.

He is an awesome professor. Very knowledgeable on the topic and will answer any and every question in & outside of class. One group paper at the end of the semester. Weekly homework but super easy, you could finish it in under 10 mins. Weekly brain labeling quizzes but easy if you study. 3 exams.. kinda hard.

If you want an easy A, Take Professor K as many times as possible. I don't see how anyone could have a bad thing to say about him. He has plenty of opportunities for extra credit and gives quizzes on lectures right after he taught you something while giving you a week's time to study. Just don't submit anything late and be prepared
Not caring at all, test have nothing to do with lectures or book.

He is very nice but his class is though. His summer course was very packed and the lectures over two hours long twice a week. His exams are on lockdown but with no cam and they cover most of the content in the book. A lot of answers are on quizlet though. He offers extra credit assignments during lecture so it's important to attend those.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The professor has a nice personality, but the class is challenging. I ended the course with an A fortunately, and I highly recommend you read the book in prep for exams. The lecture slides alone wont prepare you. Do EVERY SINGLE extra credit assignment. Thats definitely what helped my grade in the class. Wrote 2 papers and did 13 HW quizzes

Quizzes once a week. Did you know, it's actually cool to memorize parts of the brain? Alex taught me about that. Don't be upset about the quizzes and tests. He offers a ridiculous amount of extra credit. His course design is very well thought out, and it's optimally challenging. People complaining are dumb. Seriously. Gives you a ton of flexibility

Alex is the worst psych professor ever! Do not take any of his courses. His grading methods are unfair. This class is more based on passing than actually learning. He is awful. Do not get swayed away by his "nice fake" personality.
He is not understanding and is just awful. Do not take any of his courses. He tries to be funny, but he is not. Do not waste your time with this guy that speaks nonsense.

The homework can be pretty time-consuming, however, if you go to lecture, he provides most of the answers indirectly. There are 3 midterms and 1 final, each test consisting of 2 parts each 45ish questions long. If you just use your homework to study you will be fine. Very interactive and wonderful teacher.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Is a nice but bad teacher. Took his zoom class b4 and passed w/ ease by reading the textbook and ignored lectures, but I did both 4 this class and STRUGGLED to get an A. Tests are easy, but exams are TERRIBLE/INCONSISTENT! Memorize every sentence bc anything can be on the exam. He has to heavily curve exams to save his rep. PLZ DO ALL EXTRA CREDIT!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great professor. Some lectures can be interesting and some can be straight up boring. Will make you do group videos each week where you have to talk about anything for thirty minutes. The exams are pretty fair, he curves them a bit. The exams heavily rely on your memory. If you study for a day or two you will be fine. Offers hella extra credit. yay

Professor Khislavsky offers so many extra credit opportunities for this course through discussion questions that are so easy to do as well as attending lecture. There are both in class and take home quizzes that are very easy. Exams are heavily based on the textbook, although his slides do help but do not cover everything in detail.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: Professor Khivslavsky honestly, had a very good class. Best thing to do if you want to pass is answer every question on the problem sets to the best of your ability. Also participating gets you extra credit so I recommend you do it. Lastly, group deliberation videos are super easy to complete and do not require much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Good engaging professor. I enjoyed the class and did pretty well on the tests with getting As. Tbh though he doesnt go over everything and he takes a long time going over a single chapter so youre sorta better off just reading from the text book and taking notes from that. Homework isnt bad at all and doable. I passed the class with an A

Exams are lengthy and difficult. This class is memorization based. He is a really nice guy with good intentions, but not the best teacher. This class is also very fast paced for the first couple of months. I have never put so much time into a class to get a C. Best of luck to whoever takes it. Have your counselor on speed dial.

Such a great teacher, very caring to his students. Literally just attend class and read/annotate the book and youll be fine. Also he gives a lot of extra credit opportunities, take them, it helps a lot!! Very flexible, he posts his lecture slides, quizzes are very easy, he gives no midterms, just exams of the chapters.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Hilarious

comment: Worst psych professor I've ever took. He does not give you a study guide for his 80 question exams and just expects you to memorize all of the slides and textbook. It's more about passing than learning in this class. I wish I read his reviews before I chose him as a professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Great A+ lecturer, everything outside of lecture was eh. I. felt like I was in highschool. I had to memorize pictures, expects you to study far in advance, based on how hard the tests are. I just don't see the point, I will forget most of this information. Looking to take points off on hw also, class seems more about difficulty than learning.

I took adv course at the same time and now see why he avoid math formulas. He rambles & explains things SO wrong & you have to learn his way just to pass. He's fun&personable but unorganized, hard/unclear grading, forgets to send assignments on time & changes hw instructions. Do NOT take his psy10/15 if you need to understand how to do research.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I took his online PSY-140 class this semester and he was pretty understanding of student needs. He offered a lot of extra credit to boost your grade, and even extended the deadline to take the final exam as a lot of students misread the time it was due. He cracks a lot of jokes during lecture and talks like a college student too.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: lectures are mostly just him ranting about some random things about the chapter that aren't even related to the quiz. Not really informative. His textbook is old as he says himself but he still uses recent questions that aren't even in the book. Horrible grading scale, curves every exam cuz no one can get an A without it & never makes answers seen
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The lectures are really long and lengthy. He does not go over a lot of material that will be on the exams. The exams are super hard and frustrating. There are quizzes every week but they're really easy. Camera and mic are required to be on during exams. He's not really clear when lecturing but he's nice and willing to help you during office hours.

Took for fall 2020. It is a hard class that you have to keep up with. If you don't have a thorough understanding of the material then you will struggle on the tests. Every week we had to read over a chapter and then do a problem set that went with it. The questions require detailed explanations or you will get points cut off! Also had extra credit.

He is a good teacher but if you dont like taking quizzes every week this is not the professor you are looking for. I took him last semester and the exams requieres to show ur face and if you dont study you will not pass, this class is not easy.

If you'll be taking this class during COVID, cameras and mics are mandatory during the lecture when taking exams. If that's not something you're into, I suggest taking this class with another professor. Besides that, he's very passionate and very clear when teaching. There are weekly quizzes to test your understanding on the material.
Great class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Overall his class was very interesting. He is a good instructor overall and provides extra credit that can really help your grade. As long as you read the Top Hat book and study the lecture slides you will be fine in his class.
I recommend taking this course. He was a very nice, outgoing and fun teacher who tried to connect with the students. Just make sure you study, read, and go to class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Khislavsky offers so many opportunities for extra credit which really helps your grade! He takes a while to answer emails but he is always available for office hours to answer any questions if they are urgent. The tests are not difficult if you study the notes he provides, read the textbook, and do the assignments he assigns.
The way he teaches
His tests are so hard, I barely passed any of them with a C. He does give out a lot of extra credit.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Khislavsky is very caring and wants to make class as easy as possible for students. He will throw out questions if people do really badly. If you're taking his class during the pandemic, beware of Respondus Browser. It's an anti cheating browser. He doesn't like it but it's the only one available so just be careful with that. Great class!

Professor Khislavsky has a great personality. The class is mostly exams and quizzes. If you struggle with exams be prepared to work extra hard to do well. Read and understand all of the material and be a sponge in class to be prepared for the exams and quizzes. I recommend forming a study group in class. Do ALL of the extra credit!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Honestly Professor Khislavsky is literally one of the best psy teachers I have taken. Only thing IS his test are very material heavy, and long like 90 questions long. Make sure to get the book! Also I took him during summer so it was a faster pace. He did make the material easy to learn, it was just ALOT to learn in 6 weeks. DO THE EXTRA CREDIT!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Honestly I really love his class. I'm taking another one of his class again next semester. He has really easy quizzes that have to do with a coloring book. The instructor makes a difference in how well I did in the class. Thank Alex for all the smiles and stories in class.

The professor is super enthusiastic about the lectures and makes it really interesting with lots of examples. The class consists of brain structures and functions. The lecture is heavy, there is a lot of information you have to remember for the exams. Especially how to relate a brain injury to real life problems. Overall a really fun course.

He's a good prof, however his TA was awful. The TA graded like everything she can gave as lowest ever, for write assignments she gave the highest for 89, means no one even can earn an A for that. And for most people can get is around 70. Really unreasonable.

I took PSY 130 with Prof Khislavsky over the summer, and it was a tough class! He is really entertaining and tries his best to make the lectures interesting. Beware the midterms though - they are hard if you do not know how to apply the things you learn into situations.

Dr. K is very passionate during lectures, and makes the subject matter interesting. His lecture slides are a simplified version of the book. However, his exams are theoretical so you need to really understand the brain structure and what would happen if you were to injure it. Gives a lot of extra credit opportunities.

Relatively new course on campus, but super interesting! Get ready to memorize brain structures! Class consists of 2 midterm exams, 1 final exam, several in-class quizzes, and some take-home quizzes which are fun to do! Dr. K is a passionate lecturer and keeps you engaged. His exams are TOUGH - really gotta study, but offers plenty of extra credit!

Funny and encouraging professor! Although it wasn't super difficult, this was probably the most work I've ever done for a class before. 8 homework assignments, 2 papers, 10 labs, and 3 exams.  He offers many extra credit opportunities to help better your grade. Make sure to show up to every class or you'll feel extremely lost!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Gives extra credit and makes sure to go in a pace where everyone is following along and is not behind.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: For an upper-division psych class Alex was very good at explaining material that would other-wise be difficult. Be sure to memorize the coloring book and READ the slides. Very rewarding class, and often gives extra credit.
Quizzes are easy as long as you study the coloring pages. Exams are not as bad as long as you study slides. He makes the class fun with different visuals and explains and teaches the course well.

He tends to be sarcastic at times, but is very funny when it comes to his lectures. Going to office hours helps as well as doing sona for extra credit. The exams are a bit difficult if you do not study or read from the book.

Professor Khislavsky is such a great professor. I have taken him for both Psy 10 and Psy 15. Although his term papers are a bit difficult, and his exams, by going to office hours and asking question will help alot. He always made sure we all understood the concepts before moving on and would to to be as clear as possible.
Tough but rewarding. Group work is a very large part of this class, so hopefully you get in with people who actually care.

I really admired Alex's enthusiasm during his lectures. Even though statistics is very boring, he always tried to make the class fun and bearable. The class itself was a little tough though since it is statistics, but just go to office hours for the homework cause they just give you the answers. A ton of extra credit is given & 1 quiz every week!
Tough grader for writing assignments. Recommend taking psych 15 with Avilla.

Professor Khislavsky is one of the best professors you will come a across here at UC Merced. He makes the subject very interesting and makes sures that you understand the material in depth. Make sure to do all Homework Problems with a group of peers and as long as you read the book and study the powerpoints you will be set.

Alex is the best professor I have had so far. He is very approachable and competent. He lets the students know exactly what he wants. Statistics is absolutely doable even if it is not the most interesting class. He makes sure that everyone comprehends the material and explains everything in detail. I be taking another class with him for sure.
I like the way he teaches the class. The material is ok. Study from his slides for the exams; it helps out a lot.

The class offers insight to what other types of psychologists are doing but with more emphasis on certain tasks that clinical psychologists handle. The class is well-organized and you can certainly get a good grade by attending the lecture.

Prof Khislavsky is a great statistics teacher. Depending on who you have, statistics can be dry and tedious subject, but Alex makes this class fun and doable. He is great at explaining the material and is more than willing to help you if you still don't understand. I highly recommend taking this class with him.

This is a *Statistics* class and Alex makes the subject much easier and enjoyable than it has any right to be. He will spend as much time as is needed explaining stuff in class or in office hours. Lots of opportunities to  get extra points. The only downside is the potential difficulty of stats itself, but it is crucial to further psych courses.
very easy class if you go over the slides then you will do well in the class
He's an awesome professor! We have Monday quizzes but he covers all the questions during lecture! He's awesome and I strongly recommend him. Keeps the class interesting
Great professor! Laid back but very knowledgeable. He is willing to take the students opinions on work into account and sometimes adjust deadlines. He is also friendly and easy to talk to.

He was very excited about the topic & full of energy when teaching. Tests were hard, but quizzes were easy. Included talks about controversies in the area, which was cool. Helpful when answering questions. Really nice.
Really liked class. Lots of work, but really learned a lot.

The class was very interesting overall. There was a quiz almost every class so you can't be absent. Tests were challenging even for those who studied hard. I thought he lectured well and tried to keep it interesting for such a long class. Watch out at the end though because even if you're borderline grade wise he will not bump you up.

He's a good professor honestly. The assignments are fair but sometimes the contents in the lecture can get heavy and I feel like there has to be times where we need to breath. There was also not many resources given that he uses a very specific library on steamplug for C++. So yeah, make sure to make use of office hours and tutoring hubs.

Took this last semester. Has lab with lab participation tokens. Lab grades means a lot, forgot to turn in two and grade tanked. Really easy multiple choice final and the final project was not too hard. If you were actually coding your labs, then you knew enough to get a 100 on the final exam.

Kyrilov is a good professor but his class becomes extremely disorganized at times regarding lab assignments and I feel like we really didn't learn that many topics about data structures. Grade very dependent on final and midterm but the study guides help a lot. I think he could do a better job at explaining some concepts multiple times.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor who clearly cares about his students and knows how to teach. Despite all the issues steamplug has.

Doesn't provide feedback on lab assignments. Puts out a lecture for the whole class and expects everyone to know what to do towards the related lab assignment. Makes the exams mostly half of the class grade when it comes to grading exams.

I had Kyrilov for 3 straight semesters: CSE 022, CSE 024, and CSE 030. Over time, the classes have gotten more organized and comprehensible. Nonetheless, 22 and 30 rarely test your real knowledge as labs are very short and easy. As for in-person labs, I would've liked some sort of discussion of the material as they are almost 3 hours long.

While the actual computer science of the course is relatively comprehensible, the STEAMplug IDE required that all students are required to use is unstable, infuriating, fails even at its claimed purposes, and manages to reflect a level of instability that would be inconsistent with deployment anywhere except this class.

This semester, Kyrilov changed the style of the class, going from an automatically graded lab to project based labs. Labs were hard, and required multiple extensions, leading us not covering half of the expected topics. Exams however, were not very hard and mostly similar to the study guides. Kyrilov isn't a bad professor, but his structure is bad.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Kyrilov is pretty funny but nobody else laughs at his jokes so I hold back so I don't feel awkward but I feel really bad when he tells a joke and the room is just silent. Other than that, he teaches C++ really well. If you took AP CSA then this is just that class but easier and in C++. He's also very approachable and understanding.

The class overall was easy however the final was weirdly hard and dropped my grade from a 98 to a 85. One of the more annoying parts of this class would be the assignments due to them being very strict about formatting making it a pain in the ass a lot of the time. The teacher was nice though so as long as you attend and try you should be fine.

I have had Angelo for the past 3 semsters, and throught that time his lecutres got more engaging and insightful he genuenly cares for the class and you can tell if you ever speak with him personally. My only issue is the late grading times however Im not letting that overshadow the other good things in this class.

In my 3 semesters with Angelo I have come to like him as a teacher. His lectures are pretty solid but once he leaves the class don't expect him to respond to your email. This class is also one of the most disorganized classes I've ever taken, he never grades anything on time. Otherwise, he's great.

Easy assignment and midterm, but a surprisingly and unreasonably difficult final. no curve for the final (60% class average). Final didn't have enough questions since the test happened in the last lecture instead of finals week, so it wasn't the best representation of how a student performed in the course. 95% is an A, and anything less is an A-.

Although the class itself is difficult, he understands this and grades fairly. If he makes a mistake, he will own up to it. The first midterm average was very low, so he let the whole class retake if wanted to. Also, he will regrade exams if you think your score is inaccurate. The lectures are very important and I learn something new each lecture.
great professor

Very easy material as long as you pay attention. Easy midterm, easy assignments, non-mandatory lectures (but some lecture assignments, but you can do them remotely), and overall very good at teaching his topics. Quick pace and straight to the point. Would take again.
Very understanding professor!
He's a great proffesor, he describes every topic at a perfect pace and is very accessible outside of class.

I used to think Kyrilov was boring, but between now and my freshman year, something has changed, so I'm editing this review.
Being in his class is an absolute pleasure, his lectures are extremely productive and move at a good pace.
He's also excellent about communicating deadlines and policy changes, he never makes you monitor portals on your own.

He's honestly a pretty chill professor. Some projects given were a bit difficult, however, he takes his time to walk you through a pretty simple solution. Even though he might only release grades the day they are due, he does it for a valid reason.

Great class, the lectures are always recorded which is very helpful in case you miss class or just to go back to study for the midterms and finals. There are always resources for help outside of class and they are very willing to help if you ask for it.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Great lectures, along with good accessibility and and easy to understand instructions. This professor is great at conveying topics, instructions and concepts. He is flexible with extensions and understanding for outside circumstances. I would absolutely take this professor again, I had a great experience.
Do good on the midterm and final they are worth a lot and make sure to do all the labs because if you do bad in one category your grade will go down.

If this is your first time coding the pace of new material will be very quick and you will have to spend a lot of time on labs. Otherwise, f you can code, the class will be a breeze. Make sure to read all of the textbook. The professor is a decent lecturer and posts recordings of lectures online so attendance is not usually needed.

When he came to the lectures it was great. Tests are 80% of your grade. You have to go to lectures as there is a lot of information to know like the nuances of python and the system he uses (Steamplug) and the Linux terminal. Overall he is nice and tries to help us, and doesn't let people mess around in the lectures. He also accommodate for Ofchrs.
Great professor but 80% of the class is based on two tests so its important to do very well on both the midterm and final in order to get an A, overall class was fairly easy.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: 80% of the grade is midterm+final, midterms were basically the hw/practice midterm. Very easy course, the TAs are helpful and the prof is willing to help. His lectures are really boring but he makes jokes once in a while. He's also a very very nice person, always willing to help increase your grade.
He will not respond to your emails.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Professor Kyrilov is always available for help and his lectures are very important. Studying off of his practice exams is a great way to make sure you understand all the information in class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Kyrilov is so wholesome and funny. Although lectures are optional, if you are new to cs/python, keep up with new material because it tends to get hard for most people in the 2nd half of this course and then people naturally complain. Just try to keep up and you'll thrive, it's an easy class. He is a very generous grader.

Btw I had no coding experience before this class. It's not easy but it's doable. There is 1 midterm and a final so they're worth a large percentage of your grade so def study. Lots of hw assignments and labs so don't fall behind on them or you won't pass. He can be very monotone in lecture, but he's respectful and understanding overall as a prof.

Hes a cool prof, I enjoyed his lectures and his hwk and labs were okay. You need to have an understanding of code already to take the class despite being an intro class. He doesnt accept late work but he is very helpful. He does take a bit to email back sometimes. He makes jokes but sometimes idk if hes joking or not which throws me off a bit.

He is an okay-ish professor. His class has no agenda and no outline. It is an intro class but requires students to know a great deal about the subject. If you don't have any coding experience you are expected to be left out of the class unless you do an ungodly amount of studying outside of class. lectures:20% him bragging, 40% hw, 40% faq
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Kyrilov is a good professor, he is always available for help. He did take a while to input grades which did not allow students to see where they were at until the end of the semester. Other than that, he knows what he is teaching very well but it is ultimately up to how much effort you are willing to put into the course.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dude is an okayish professor. Not best not worst. Failed this class the first time. Had him for 3 semesters. If ur contacting him 50 chance he is replying to ur email. meet in person instead. Doesnt cover a lot of examples or scenarios. If ur not experienced ur gonna have to learn alot on ur own. Wish he gave HW to help practice code.

Kyrilov is a decent professor but his class can be a bit dry for people who already know how to code. This class isn't advanced programming it's Intro to C++. If you want an easy A, great! If you wanna further your growth in CS, eh? Overall, he's chill. Lessons are simple enough and he makes an effort to answer students' questions.

Kyrilov is a professor that will teach you computer science and have a good time simultaneously. The biggest thing to know is that if you are struggling you need to reach out to him or the TAs! Too many of my peers last year didn't use the resources he gave us and suffered for it then took it out on him. This man is a great teacher, v understanding

Had Angelo on and off for 3 years and he's been an integral part of my CS journey. One of the few professors that prepares students for success and actually understands the implications of his work. He cares deeply about his students and the work he does and it shows. The best research advisor I could have asked for

This class is by far the worst class I have ever taken and I'm only a first-year student. I mark this as inspirational as it inspires me to drop out as soon as I can. You are required to know a hefty amount of information outside of class, there is no way you will pass with this professor's lectures alone despite the class being for beginners.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Test heavy

comment: He gives out assignments on Wednesdays and they are due on Mondays at 11:59. His office hours are on Tuesdays. It seems this is intentional in order to reduce the professor's need to interact with students. This class is probably just a test of the submission software the professor created.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Bro good luck man, maybe in person class will be better
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He's a really great teacher! Pay attention in class and you're good! Also, you can ask him anything and he's gonna answer the question and make it simpler to understand. I wouldn't mind taking more of his classes.

Kyrilov was a great teacher to start to learn coding. The overall project that we worked on was pretty interesting in my opinion. He went over what we had to code for our project during class and was very knowledgeable on the subject.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: This is not a beginner's class. He goes straight into python, HTML, and javascript and if you don't pay attention in class, you'll get confused. The only assignments are labs which are on a weekly basis and worth a lot. You do the labs by yourself since TA's are never here. The labs are challenging and he doesn't explain during the lecture.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Kyrilov is great. Hes funny, sarcastic, and knows how to teach. Pay attention during lectures! If you dont, youll have a hard time during the labs. There is no homework, but there is a weekly lab and they arent too difficult.

I took Kyrilov when classes took place online. The professor he is a decent guy. He would crack a few jokes time to time, although if you try to joke with him his humor can be hard to read. From what I've seen he seems willing to help explain the codes, and help anybody that has a problem with their code. Overall Kryliov is a pretty cool dude.

Had this guy during Corona Virus epidemic. Gives us time and is understanding. Although, the lectures were boring, and I constantly I fell asleep so I did pretty bad on the midterm even though I thought I did good. I had a good TA too that went over a lot of things and made sure we were prepared, so my experience was good.

For someone who is barely learning CS, it can be more challenging. He only grades a few things so if you mess up the final/midterm, it'll hurt. Study guides are posted pretty late. As a visual learner, it was difficult keeping up when he just demonstrated code in the lecture. Doesn't give resources or slides to help students learn out of class

This is a great course to learn about actual programming and development. All of the labs are creating web applications, some simple and some require more work. It introduces you to front and back end programming and how it all connects together. If you want to learn programming instead of concepts and mathematical proofs, this is a great class.

I was frustrated by homework and labs because I need to know some python in order to do the work, so make sure you learn some before this class. Also, attend every lecture if possible because he always post his lecture notes very late, and he often post the note a few days before tests, so you won't have enough time to review.

Got him in CSE165 and CSE30 One of the best professors in UCM. He is a super chill and listens to class feedback. Lectures are sometimes entertaining (depends on the topic) However, he's not very good at answering emails and stuff (if you used his school email which he gives in his syllabus)

Professor Kyrilov's class is ridiculously easy. The bad: He was notorious for submitting grades very late and releasing the labs after my scheduled lab section. The same goes with him uploading his lecture slides. It was frustrating. The good: His lectures are clear and his exams are actually super easy.

Get his computer and education spark class. It's very fun because he teach us python and html. There is no homework. All work is done within class. Easy A. The most fun thing is to control toys using raspberry pi. If you are interested in computer programming and application, this is the best class. He is very patient to answer questions.

Easy labs, except the last two. He tried something new where the last two quizzes and labs are a replacement for your final grade. If you don't do well on those, you only have to do the section you failed on the final.
Had him in his first year of teaching, his labs were not that great but heard they improved, the standard do work  pass is pretty much his class
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Lecture could be a bit slow at times but he got the point across. Labs each week like any other CSE class, one midterm and the final. Its not a hard class. He gives out a previous midterm and final and theyre similar to the actual exam. Study the concepts and its easy to get an A. Offered to make up some points in the midterm as well.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: If I could take Kyrilov again I would, and I plan on it. I actually would look forward to lectures because they were engaging and funny. By far the best professor I've had at UCM. He listens to his students and teaches based of the class.
