Angelo is one of the few professors I have encountered who truly cares about the student success. He goes above and beyond to create the most efficient learning experience for the student. He's fair and clear with his expectations. Also, he's pretty funny. Definitely my favorite CS professor by far.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: ok
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures were helpful but not really; had to self-teach myself because I never took a physics course before. 2 midterms that are heavy on your grade but you can retake for more credit. 1 group project and a final (worth 10%). Calls you out during lecture but helpful if you ask her questions. Midterm averages were about 56~62 out of 100.

Speaks in a rude manner to students and will argue with anyone if she thinks they are wrong. I saw an incident where she berated a group of students who weren't working on the in-class worksheet because they were not part of the class, demanded for their names and threatened to report them all for punishment, just for attending a lecture.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Does not cover test materials very well, so you end up pretty lost. Good luck taking this class if you haven't taken AP Physics in high school, because it's the same exact content. No exaggerations.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Very condecending, class is full of videos. More about the history of medical physics. Loves to argue. Avoid prof
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Unhelpful and rude
The material was hard but she knew how to help us best after the first midterm let her know we were lost. She adapted her class to aid us best and we flourished.
No late work, pay attention to deadlines! Take notes. Lots of videos and they are important for exams. Attendance eventually became mandatory.

Disorganized class. Weekly quizzes in discussion, quiz is based off of the material on the discussion worksheet, you're basically taking a quiz on material that you learned that day. No real lectures, teach yourself. She is rude & intimidating making environment unwelcoming. But if you study worksheets, you have a chance!
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The class was basically just watching youtube videos then taking quizzes. She words her questions really unnecessarily weirdly. She refuses to actually help students learn if they didn't get it the first time. Her quizzes sometimes don't match the videos she plays, they match the slides that she barely goes over so she doesn't have to lecture.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The rudest professor ever. When I got a problem wrong and didn't know what to do next, she got extremely frustrated and started showing an attitude. She's super condescending and tries to make you feel like an idiot for not understanding instead of trying to help. Her lectures don't correlate w/ the weekly worksheets and quizzes in the discussion.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: NO. Just don't.
Just nah

She reads off of slides for lectures and requires attendance (takes quizzes during lectures) isn't understanding at all she only replies to select emails. Honestly the worst prof I've had don't take unless you have to

She is rude & condescending especially if you aren't grasping the material quick enough. In person she would walk around w/ a microphone and place it in students faces and force them to answer questions. Online she made lecture attendance mandatory but will cancel them for herself if she was going to be inconvenienced. Doesn't teach & bad attitude

The rudest and most disrespectful professor I've ever had. She mocked students who caught covid, grabbed and scolded a student for temporarily leaving lecture so she could deal with insurrance issues over the phone, rarely answers emails, and is generally condescending to students in lecture whenever we ask questions.
no

The lectures weren't very helpful. The professor knows the exams are difficult so she gives a chance to retake the exam but only for a couple of points. This class was manageable for me only because I had a great TA who explained how to do the problems. There's lots of homework.
She's a very old fashion professor. She'll expect you to know half of the material on your first day of class and if you have questions she'll very vaguely direct you to the book. Good luck!

Toni stone is the most cold-hearted professor I've encountered at UC Merced. She lacks sympathy, is scary, and thinks that her class is the only thing that matters in the world. I got a B+ in the course, but I would not take a class with her again.

Stone is honestly the epitome of average. Not as horrible as others would tell you, but not exceptional either. Be sure to put effort into your quizzes and the final research paper, and you'll pass. Be ready for a heavy workload. Also, pay attention to her lectures (they come back on the exams).
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Too many bad things to say. All I can is, be ready to be talked down as a student, to be treated with no literal respect, and be accused for this "misuse" of Chegg even if you don't even have an account.
She is such a bad lecturer and has such a cold personality. She gets mad because her students use Chegg but will give you two worksheets at 3 pm that she expects to be completed by 4 pm.

I took Prof. Stone back in Fall 2017 and out of the blue moon decided to look at her rating here. From what I recall, Dr. Stone was very accessible outside of class for office hours. I remember she was the only person to dress up for Halloween in the whole lecture room. This class is passable if you put in the effort. Put in the effort folks!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She sucks at teaching and gives some hard midterms. Be ready for that research paper at the end of the semester.

She's someone who encourages and inspires you to do your best and she believes in your success. She's an excellent physics teacher, she really cares about the students. Her class doesn't use a textbook, that isn't her fault. It's more the interfacing I was really fed up with. She is really a gem.
The legends are true. Stone doesn't know how to teach, is condescending, and should not be teaching here. Avoid taking physics with her, just wait another semester.

The above options are not good to describe this professor. She is rude, doesn't know how to teach, even she did n't drive equations. She is so monotone in the class, sometimes looks like the whole class including she is sleeping. She never helps outside the class. Super rude.

There's a lot of homework in this class. Even if you attend every lecture, you will have to look up homework problems online or go meet with her in to understand them. The quizzes are very easy if you've done the homework, but the problems in discussion are hard, and the tests are based on discussion problems. Be prepared to work hard!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Stone is a very-well respected, yet strict professor. Be expected to receive critical feedback on the major assignments. Her tests, aka quantitative assignments can be difficult to prepare for. The class does keep you busy with interesting topics, but do not fall behind. Would rec. for pre-med students. (:
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Didn't really learned from lecture, more from reading, homework, and discussion.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: You do not learn anything in her lectures and doesn't give any midterm or final review. Her lecture is very boring and consists of proofs and definitions. You have to rely heavily on Chegg and your TA's in order to pass this class. Good luck if you take this class.

When I think of college, I think of having the opportunity to learn from experienced professors and to better my future. Taking this class made me realize Stone cant do that. I had to learn every subject on my own through excess hours of YouTube and khan academy. Find another professor if you need the class for your major, otherwise be prepared.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Study discussion problems and lecture notes for midterms and finals. Learn as much as you can from your TA and get help from Khan Academy. If you get confused in the complicated way professor solve a problem, use your own way to solve it cause it might be faster.
Does not prepare students well for her tests
Curves second midterm.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Great professor
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Lectures usually involve problems that will be on the test, but will usually not be explained thoroughly. Best way to prepare for tests is to have a TA teach you the lecture problems. Most people who do well will do so because of a good TA, without one you'll need to be studying a lot more. Test averages are 55%, and are never curved.

I HOPE YOU KNOW PHYISCS ALREADY because her lecture are behind, and you'll be learning stuff before she gets to them in lecture, lecture also do not help when there is no explanation behind the concepts. DON'T expect a curve

Throughout the semester, I found myself more confused more times than I did understanding the material. Her lectures are heavily formula based and most times she does not delve deep into the formula to help you derive and truly understand the formula, but she'll expect you to know how to do so on midterms/finals. If you take her class, good luck.

Toni Stone has been one of the worst teachers I've ever encountered. This woman made me actually LOSE knowledge as the semester progressed. At first she doesn't seem too bad, but as the class goes on you realize that she teaches what doesn't matter leaving you to tach yourself EVERYTHING. Including how to do problems, which all of the tests are on.

You don't learn anything in her lectures and doesn't give any midterm or final review. Her lecture is very boring and consists of proofs and definitions. You have to rely heavily on Chegg and your TA's in order to pass this class. Good luck if you take this class.

Lacks consideration for students comprehension; consequently, fails to provide clear explanation. Eq in phys can be derived thru algebra &calc but she likes to use calc even when she knows some freshman students don't have calc reference yet. when the attendance site isnt working, she expects the students to fix the issue or their grade will suffer

You do not learn anything from your lecture and have to self-study. Your best resources are your TA's and Chegg. Also, her study guides are not useful to use for studying the midterm. Have self studying!!

This class was a nightmare, I was lost in this class form week one to the last day. During lectures, she'll start to solve the equation on the board, and she fails to explain how to apply them to an actual problem. Be prepared to teach yourself. Best resources are your T.A's and the internet.
Super chill teacher. Lectures were helpful with the practice problems. Curve was great since I ended up passing with a B. Super cool during office hours and she was the only one dressed for Haloween.

Toni is a bit confusing in lecture bc she goes over back to the same concept three different times. She is really easy in grading and gives you grade changes if you do better in a later midterm. Overall the better physics prof, though.

Most problems on exams were taken from lecture material and altered slightly. The course was not crazy difficult, but I was not able to pick up the material from the way Stone taught it. Utilize Khan Academy and campus tutoring sessions to learn the topics. Stone fails to explain the concepts in approachable ways and is slightly intimidating.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is caring and easy going . The reading intensity is not necessarily high if you go to core lectures. She gives good feedback on grades.

Stone is a very nice woman, it's obvious that she cares about her students, and wants them to learn, and understand Physics. However, she's not a good teacher, she'll give you formulas, and then expects you to know how to do a problem. The homework is also extremely hard, but pointless. None of the problems on the homework will show up on the test

Dr. Stone is a good professor. She's tough, but good nonetheless. She might appear unapproachable to some, but she cares for her students. Sometimes she goes too fast over the material, but you can always ask questions and she will gladly answer them. Her exams are HARD but fair. Attend lecture and office hours and you should be fine. No curve.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She cares about her students.

This class is definitely tougher than most. However, Stone does give students a lot of chances to bring up their grades. She posts important files on Canvas for students to utilize. Her lectures can get boring, and I missed a lot of clicker points because I was absent a lot. However, overall she's helpful and if you listen, you will learn.

This professor will make your semester living hell, make sure to take an easy course load when taking this class as a majority of kids in this class will have no clue as to what is going on. Go to lectures for clickers, no educational value.
Mama Stone can be really monotone and it is difficult to understand the concepts at first, but after a couple of weeks, you get used to her teaching styles.

At first I thought Toni was a mean physics monster; however after taking her, I see that she is actually a great teacher. Physics is not an easy class so you must work for the grade you want. She really gives you all the information you need for the exam, and is there to help. PAY ATTENTION in lecture, do the homework, participate and you'll b fine

Professor Harris? More like Professor Nowhere-to-Be-Found. He's so busy with super important things he's doing outside of class that he can't be bothered to actually show up. Instead, he leaves his so-called "TAs" in charge.  These "TAs" are not even grad students. They're just regular undergrads who barely know more than we do.

Professor Harris's demeanor can be quite rude. He rarely engages in meaningful discussions or shows patience with students who are trying to understand the material. When approached with questions, he can come across as dismissive or uninterested.

His teaching style is highly disorganized, with little structure to the course material. It often feels as though he is teaching whatever happens to catch his interest that week, which leaves students struggling to follow along and stay on track with the syllabus.
No hw, your only savior is to have abundant prior law savvy during lecture, or know what you're learning before taught.

This professor made me want to end it all. Worst professor I have ever had. Strict grading and if your format is wrong, he tells you not to even talk to him. He's never even there to proctor any exams. You have to talk to his TA's to set up office hours, instead of being able to email him. Don't take, unless you want to set yourself up for failure.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: be prepared to fail this class because this professor teaches in the most exotic way and favors students. He is terrible

The class itself wasnt bad but the professor was. Harris would tell students they have a better chance of passing if they kiss up to his rear end. Grades were mainly made up by quizzes and test, extra credit was very helpful in the end. Harris is not avalible for office hours unless he likes you. Doesnt allow make up for test unless youre dying.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Love-hate relationship with Prof Harris. I learned a lot in his class. Some days he's in a really good mood so take advantage as he will give extra credit points. When he's in a bad mood he tends to criticize students. Participation is key. Do ALL the extra credit so if you score low on an exam you'll be good.

He prepares his students for upcoming midterms & finals as long as you ask him question and interact during class you'll pass. Attendance is mandatory, you should always take notes during class, and actively participate. He's a very funny professor and very engaging with students but has clear rules when it comes to quizzes, they are open note
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Harris is a great professor here at UC Merced. Don't feel defeated if you get a low score on the first midterm there is always extra credit and ways to study for the upcoming tests. Staying after lecture is very beneficial to not only get to know him personally but to ask questions and understand material more. Overall, great professor!
Having Harris as your professor is like having a bipolar girlfriend. If you participate as much as you can and attend the lectures getting an A is easily attainable with the extra credit he gives

You would learn A LOT in his classes. This is the only class in where I have actually learned something. The bad thing about it and because I am rating it so low is because he is extremely disrespectful with students. You miss a little thing and he easily yells at you in front of the whole class. Only Econ 5 professor available so be ready.

This class is very easy if you go to every class, take notes, and stay after class(sometimes he would even tell you what's in the exam in the after-class time! Especially the class before exam day). Also, he is willing to give out lots of extra credit, for example, my final exam was a total of 20 points but he decided to give out 40 out of 20.

I've taken 3 classes with Prof. Harris, the longer you know him, the more manageable the classes are tbh. It takes a bit to realize that participation matters b/c that's what drives the class. Whatever is discussed will be on the test. Its a good amount of work but he was nice to give us days off to work on it.  Do the work and extra credit. worth

If you show up to every lecture and truly pay attention; quizzes and exams will be very easy, simple as that. I recommend sitting in the front as it forces you to pay attention. There will be a tremendous amount of extra credit so always be ready to put in that work. If you like to sit in the back and be on your phone, this is not the class for you
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: I passed the class. He is a nice professor but very much intimidating. Tbh if you have anxiety then the class is not for you unless you want to be on edge every class. He wasnt accommodating for a lot of students even when they were sick. In terms of grading it was either you get a 0 or full points theres no real in between. Just do the work.

Your grades are entirely  determined by exams and quizzes. You can craft the most perfect answer on an exam that would make even the most respected economists proud and you still get a zero because you forgot to define a term.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Horrible Professor, do not take. He brags about himself very chance he gets for half the class then proceeds to end class early while only teaching for maybe 10mins. Does not teach everything. Exams are based on word def citations and then answers. wish I can say more. PLEASE DONT WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THIS GUY!!!
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Do not take professor Harris if you don't want to be a kiss ass, he has favorites
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Harris is one of those professors you can only dream of finding. Not only is he hilarious, he genuinely cares about students and is willing to go above and beyond for us. He personally worked to help me secure an internship and has become a mentor to me. He is without a doubt one of the best professors I have ever had. 11/10

Grades are based entirely on midterms and the final exam. The professor is often talking about himself and sometimes the lectures are useless. The exams are mostly opinion based and you must cite every term or you might not receive credit. It is annoying when he brags about himself and other students throughout the lecture instead of teaching.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He talks nonsense about his life instead of actual information that can be used for his tests
I have anxiety because of him. The first two weeks he and his course readers were so nice..that's when they fool you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The worst professor ever. Don't waste your time.

He does not care about barbarism. He is more focused on those who want to understand and learn because they show it in class. I passed with an A not because I praised him or "fed his ego", but because he saw that I studied before attending class through the test. 100% Exam final grade. If you don't want to be challenged to be better don't take him.

Hardest grader but once you understand what he wants I promise youll succeed. You definitely cant pass without a book, you have to define and cite every important term possible. No homework only 5 tests with 10 multiple choice questions and two essays. Meet with him and he will help you!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Get ready to read

comment: He is nice on grading . You better work for your grade! I got an A+ because i worked my ass off. I recommend finding a partner to study with. Extra credit brought my grade up. Make sure you do the reading before class !! he expects you to be ready when you show up for class. Make a list of all the vocab from the reading. That is a must!

He's really nice! Best professor I've ever had. Would take a gain. This class isn't an easy A. You better read the textbook. Lecture heavy. You can tell that he will care about the course just as much as you care. If you don't try, it will show. Find a study buddy for this class so you can grind and pass with an A. Extra credit saved me.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I've never failed a class and it's because of this horrible Professor. This Professor brags about his accomplishments, the class average is an F and he doesn't help the students he doesn't like. He is the worst professor I've ever had. The only thing good is that he helped President Clinton in his office for economics but still cant learn from him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Brags about how he has the best extra credit system in the whole university which I do not agree with. Class is graded with a point system. Gets off-topic during lectures. Discussion-based class. No homework is given which is difficult for some students who need extra practice for problems on exams. Do every extra credit; it helps.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: I've taken 3 classes with Harris. His classes are all the same format. Class lectures are more like discussions and all tests are open response. Passing the class is simple; go to class, take notes, study, attend course reader office hours, and participate. This is not a class you can slide by. You will be challenged to think with intention.

Discussion course at best. Harris comes off as condescending and arrogant- he is. He didnt hesitate to call out talkers. All work done online. Pop quizzes if attendance is low. Makes you cite all sources. Exams done in free response not multiple choice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: graded with a point system, no percentages. two midterms are 25pts each and the final is 50pts. his exams are written response, so he is the judge of whose work is correct or not. if you answer correctly but it's not the answer he was wanted (he's very vague and doesn't always specify) then you won't get points at all. citations are a must as well
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Horrible. Do not recommend whatsoever. His lectures are discussions and you will be called on whether you raise your hand or not. He gives hardly any assignments. His instructions are NEVER clearly stated, NOT EVEN ON TESTS. He is self-centered and arrogant. If you're not teacher's pet, you won't have an A. He also doesn't respond to emails.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He's a great professor, will definitely challenge you to do well in the class. He will definitely help you out if you're willing to put in some work. Piece of advice: go to class, take your notes online, participate, and do all extra credit. If you do all extra credit, you will be waived from the final!

Professor Harris is a very respectable professor who expects his students to go above and beyond to get involved and puts you to the test by requiring critical thinking. Very professional and knowledgable, expects students to pay attention in class and do group projects.

Currently taking professor Harris, at first I hated his class. He makes bold politically charged statements and challenges you to say anything different. But then I realized, he isn't interested in pushing his agenda. He wants you to form your own position and be able to think for yourself which is the best kind of learning available. I respect him
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: His class is difficult, but he's a spectacular teacher. Type your notes, do the extra credit, read the textbook and outside reading sources, go to his office hours and the TA's office hours, and don't be afraid to ask questions and say your thoughts/opinions. His class helps you with real-life situations and to think critically.

He is an amazing professor. I recommend going to his office hours, as well as his TA's office hours (important). Read the book chapters, follow his twitter because he posts current events, and take detailed notes on your laptop (helpful for open note tests & it is easier to command F, than look through paper notes). Participate in class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: By far, my absolute favorite professor!! Strongly recommend to take any of his classes. He is the best the UC has to offer. Genuinely cares about his students. Work hard!!

Harris will change the way you view finance. Econ 5 is a course that helps you out with real life situations. He is funny and inspiration. My advice would be to get to know him during his office hours and put in an extra effort (know about current events) and he will appreciate that
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: I loved Professor Harris class. It was my favorite class despite being at 8:30am. He knows how to teach and how to make sure students understand what he is saying. He is extremely respectful and wants you to succeed. This isn't a class you can slide through but it is a class you will learn and grow.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I have taken a total of 5 courses with this professor and he is very caring and gives a lot of extra credit. you have to be willing to talk and give your opinion even it is wrong he will help you learn from your mistakes and pushes you to do your best. Don't give up to fast takes a lot of reading and a lot of critical thinking. offers many opportun

Professor Harris is very knowledgeable and tenacious in his ways of teaching. When I attended my first class session with him I found him arrogant and was going to drop but decided to stick it out and it worked out very well! I'd say a guaranteed A in his class would be to do all assignments (and actually know material) & A LOT of extra credit.

He is a pretty great professor. Previous students of his had been able to pay off their classes and all their debt for the school because of him. Discussion in the class is beyond helpful so go to class! Sit in the front! Sit with people who take GOOD NOTES and discuss the lecture! *Go to his investment lab if you have Econ 005. Open your mind.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Would take again

comment: Participations is optional but is highly recommended. Harris is always changing his mind and has favoritism for those who do well in his class. Lectures are interesting but they are more like discussions. You can opt out of the final if you get enough points. A lot of extra credit is given so take advantage!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Makes you have apple products rather than things one can afford. And when trying to talking to him about a problem with something he says we'll then I should have looked at the syllabus better before joining this class. Of not you might as well drop the class. he is not very nice like he says he is.
One of my favorite teachers I have ever had. He teaches by discussing, not by lecturing. GO TO CLASS, and he always gives extra credit, plus, you can opt out of the final if you get enough points!

Made learning about the course more than just a curriculum and course standard. Used relative current news and trends to express topics and concepts related to that of the course reading. Although it was a course on Women in Executive Leadership, Harris allowed the opportunity to learn all different views and aspects.

His lectures are full of applicable information using current events as examples to make it the easiest to retain. If you show him that you take his class seriously and put in work, you will most likely get an A. One of the best Professors I have ever had and would 10/10 take him again. I recommend his class to everyone.
Nice professor but all exams were the same format, which didnt allow the student to fully express their full potential in other areas in the course.

Harris is one of the greatest professors I have had in my 4 years of school at 3 different schools. He keeps you entertain and keeps you wanting to come back to class. You also learn so much out of his classes that you can take with you into your life. Everyone should take a class taught by him.

Public Policy, Spring 2011.  Professor Harris is one of the most interesting professors I have ever had. He required everyone to have a laptop, as assignments and exams in class are mostly done via CROPS, and if you earn an A+ as I did, you won't have to sit the final :)  This was not an easy class, but by far my favorite at UCM yet.
Great overall, and very effective
He is a great professor who provides valuable feedback. You will gain a lot from his class. He is fantastic!
If you are about to take his class drop it immediately PLEASE read the bad ratings because they are all true. I made the mistake of not looking him up one of the worse professors I have ever had.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Too many assignments WAY too many. He gives you assignments due in a couple of days then gives you assignments due that same day after literally just assigning you homework. You can't be late, or he will begin to lower your grade and give you absences. Inconsiderate and such a terrible professor. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This course was honestly kind of stressful. Very particular on the assignment requirements but room for accommodation. Get ready to mediate and talk about yourself because he was more of a meditation instructor than a writing instructor. Constant back-to-back 2-page essay assignments. In the end, he was putting more work out than he was teaching.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: This course felt more like an art class rather than a writing course. We had to do daily sketches and analyze a lot of artwork. The only interesting thing about this course is the labor contracted grading system. As long as you do the work, you'll get a B unless you want to do extra labor to get a higher grade.

If you do all the assigned work and show up to class, that's 85 percent in the class. If you do the three extra credit opportunities (ex talking in class, extra credit work, and being a team leader) you'll get an A in the class. He's easy.

My biggest gripes with the class are that it feels more like a visual arts class and that he often over explains assignments. He'll talk for 30 minutes about an assignment that sounds simple but then gets confusing as he goes into detail. It can get even more confusing when it comes to stuff like his final, which is a photo essay instead of a paper
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: this class has a very interesting grading system in place, instead of using the traditional grading system that grades based on quality alone this one grade off on quality and participation. This in turn makes it easy to achieve a B but difficult to get an A. This grading system is great, however, it's held back by unclear instructions.

Professor Ramirez's style of teaching is based on a labor-based grading system instead of traditional grading. This class motivates you to explore your creative side. You have to put in a lot of work in the class. He gives great feedback on essays and other writing assignments because this class really values the importance of improvement.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This class didn't even feel like a writing course, it was more of a film analysis class. He doesn't believe in grades so instead, he calls everything Labor and makes you sign a Labor Contract. Don't take this professor he was terrible and half of the time he only talks about himself rather than teach the class. I didn't learn anything either way.

The style of his teaching is something that should be more implemented in educational institutions nowadays. It opens up your mind to a new form of grading and what learning is really about, rather than the standard A/F grading. I would definitely retake this professor but for the sake of his effort as being a educator. Film is now different for me

This class, and teaching style is like nothing you're used to. Many times vague, on purpose, especially you're used to direct/clear instructions - done so for extreme creative freedom. He is, honestly a really good social artist, so I implore you to talk to him about some of his creative efforts to get rid of the student/teacher dynamic.

This professor praised himself so much, yet my peers were able write a far better piece of work. He was never clear on what he wanted from you, claiming it was a creative writing class so we should be able to write how we want, but after reviewing our work claimed it was not what he was looking for from us. I wrote more craft essays than creative.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Literally always compares himself to Bill Gates.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I knew something was off when I got a syllabus almost 3 weeks into the semester, leaving me little time to escape. We did next to NOTHING up until that point. Some perspective for all who see his name: the amount of writing we actually did, in an upper division writing class, was equal to about 10 pages. No expectations, no rubrics, no way to know.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: In the beginning of the year, I had a lot of issues with adjusting to the new school experience. However if it wasn't for his class, I wouldn't have ever taken my classes seriously. He really challenges his students while making sure no one gets left behind. Although his class wasn't easy, I don't regret taking it. It was a mind-blowing experience.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Love Profe Ramirez! He genuinely wants his students to succeed. He is by no means an easy prof, but he definitely made me a better writer and prepared me for upper div classes.
He needs some jesus...
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This professor will actually teach you information you need in order to take higher division classes. If you enjoy writing you should take this class, he is also very involved in the community so if you are intrested  in volunteering and helping the community this is also a great class.

He inspired me to be and English major. And belive it or not the communitu service he mad me do helped me when applied to a job! He is extremely helpful and it was a realy fun class. Also very helpful during office hours.

He inspired me to be and English major. And belive it or not the communitu service he mad me do helped me when applied to a job! He is extremely helpful and it was a realy fun class. Also very helpful during office hours. He is very smart and always willing to help.

Something is wrong with his head. He requires us to draw around one hundred pages full of bull in a sketch book and do community service taking care of little kids when its so hard for people to move in Merced so don't take his class its not even writing. Also he requires you to buy a LOT of materials which is really expensive.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This professor's teaching style is vague with no clear instructions. I felt very uncomfortable to even enter the class.

Biggest issue is clarity.  In class, he is asked many times to clarify something because nobody understood his instructions, as well as his handwriting. Requires off-campus meetings which are very inconvenient and overloads you with assignments. Many assignments are irrelevant. Facebook is required as all assignments are posted on the class group.
This professor gives a lot of homework that has nothing to do with writing. He will claim that is to teach you critical thinking skills, when in reality it is just a waste of time.

If you plan on having a life in college, run as fast as you can when his name pops up. He really has no understanding that students have other classes, so he requires so much out of his students. It's different when a class is challenging, but Professor Ramirez's class will suck the living life out of you. Drop out as soon as you can!

If you do not plan to place his class as your highest priority you will be lucky to pass his class with a mediocre grade. It seems as if Professor Ramirez believes every one of his students wants to major in writing. This class definitely makes you work for your grade and calls for tons of out-of-the-classroom requirements.

Don't. Take. His. Class.  He is very unclear on what he wants you to do, stockpiles projects on you, and you have to fight tooth and nail for every point you earn.  My favorite quote from him is "I don't expect any of you to get an A on this first essay."  Nobody is enjoying his class, even the English majors.  Avoid at all costs!

Taking this course with Prof? has definitely helped my writing skills. He's a great speaker and well-qualified professor to be teaching writing10, however the expectations are set really high. If you put in all of your effort into his class, then you're sure to do well.

I was told to go to office hours if I had any questions but when I went he was so vague and barely helped me, mind you we had a big assignment due the following week and I was trying to get some clarity on the assignment and he basically didn't help at all... However I won't say he's completely terrible because he does try to interest you in class

He was a great teacher, always showed interest when helping students. Can be reached very easily through Facebook and can even meet you off campus. Very great class,easy to obtain an A if you show interest and are motivated most people who complain it is hard as simply lazy.

Ramirez's class is challenging, but not because of him. Many people don't do their work, and just complain most of the time. He treats as adults, not babies, and that's why it's easy to slack off. He offers a lot of extra credit, and opportunities for redemption. And he brings a lot of sense of humor into his class. His class isn't difficult.
The work load is ridiculous and he doesn't answer questions. he likes to beat around the bush. do not get him!
he is vague, and the class is awkward.

This teacher was definitely difficult. However, I prefer his way of teaching because he does just feed you information like a robot.  He expects you to put in your best.  In my opinion, people who were in this class and found it too heavy in work just had low expectations of the workload, and that's a mistake for an upper division class.

"Profe" is out of touch. Not a thing about his instruction is useful. He has no rubric and gives abstractions instead of directions. He doesnt grade assignments untill the end which leaves his class stressed trying to manage his massive yet vauge workload. He is not native to merced and doesnt speak for this community, dont let him ruin your exp!

Profe, as he likes to be called, is probably one of the toughest instructors at UC Merced.  Not because the work is too hard, he just believes that we only have his class with the workload he gives.  Not to mention the community praxis that is required and counts towards your grade.  My suggestion DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. If you get him, switch out

DONT TAKEE HIMM!!!! HE makes you do to much work and doesnt understand that we have other course work on our hands as well. Honestly he is very oppressive and basically uses our grade as a reason to force us do community work. Worst part is he claims we do it because we the students want to get involved; however, the reality is he forces us!!!!!!!!

Honestly gives too much work outside of class. Does not understand that his students have other classes to deal with. He expects everyone to dedicate 100 percent of their time for only his class. MAKES us "volunteer" for a percentage of our grade. Everything in class does not click nor does it relate to anything. It's community service not writing.

Requires an unreasonable amount of work outside of class. Is extremely ambiguous about what he wants, and at the same time punishes asking questions. The course contained an obscene amount of content that was not actually related to learning how to "write" Do not take this class, your other grades will suffer!

Do NOT take this class. This is not a writing class. This is a class designed to humor a man about his ideas to change the world. Granted, they're noble, but it does not justify grading students based on how they do in a group project because this is supposed to be a WRITING class. Trust me, transfer out.

He is very opinionated, and doesn't listen to anyone's ideas but his own. I regressed as a writer during my time as his student (so did my interest in writing). He expected us to spend an unreasonable amount of time outside of class hours for his class. He hated me because I questioned his authority and rationality on several occasions, and this led to me being graded more harshly, talked to rudely, and disregarded as a contributor to the discussions.    Wouldn't recommend him to anyone.

Incredibly vague and self-centered. Considers his teaching style to be completely flawless though 99 percent of the time he is incredibly wrong. Assignments are vague and just about useless  to any aspect of the writing process. Only redeeming quality of the class is "learning through Praxis". Consider shooting yourself or dropping the class.
Vague instructions and expects you to ask questions, but if you ask the wrong question, he takes off 2% on your grade. Too much focus on film and group projects, not enough on actual writing.

Terrible class, he gave almost no help toward any of the work and all the work was unclear and difficult. Based on way too much group work and google groups was pointless. Only redeeming part of this class was the curve he gives at the end of the semester.

Awful professor. Completely unorganized, biased grading, nice only to students he likes, doesnt explain assignments, expects you to know what he wants and is generally unapproachable. I can believe hes still teaching!

He is a horrible teacher!!! If you get him as a teacher get out asap!! Does not explain anything in detail and will criticize work if you do not meet unexplained expectations. Google groups is very stupid to have online class discussions.
He's awesome, definitely helpful and his class is interesting with lots of great ideas and activities to get people thinking. I would definitely recommend him.

Too lax on everything- Usually have no idea to what we're supposed to do for the assignment, since he gives the vaguest guidelines. Most the class is based on the films we watched, group presentations, and google groups.   On the plus side- you get to choose all your topics. He accepts anything. You get to watch a lot of movies in class.

not a good professor. doesn't give essays back on time and makes assignments unclear. google groups difficult to navigate through. doesn't explain concepts through, he expects us to know everything already.

I feel that even as an English Major, this class was extremely dreadful. With the combination of back-to-back group projects, papers, and continuous amounts of demands, it makes it hard to do any other class. I feel that the professor was not very conscious of the pandemic and how much it could affect the students. She seems like an awesome person.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: AMAZING personality, caring, and genuinely cares about your work. Personally not a good writer AT ALL but she made it so easy! Gives feedback all the time, there is really no excuse why you can possibly get a bad grade in her course.

Awesome professor and very organized and detailed. Our group had a great time and worked really well together. Learned a lot from her. Thanks Dr. Danielson. Definitely taking next writing classes with her.

I don't even remember a professor who would spend so much time on drafts. She's so dedicated to helping everyone learn. Down to earth and really great personality and highly educated for sure. Learn from her as much as you can because she's there to teach you all the details.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Would take again

comment: Very good professor for Writing For Psychology class. Dr Danielson really builds you for future classes and degrees too. shes very cool. Everything she does has a good reason and she explains every step of the way. Hardcore paper! So glad it was a group paper because I don't think I'd be able to do it alone. Hard class but you sure learn so much.
She didn't have to but she cared so much and literally didn't let me drop. I was so behind, but she pulled me back. I'm so thankful for who she is. Thanks Dr. D. You rock. Awesome person.
She was very respectful and super
Extreme pleasure to have Dr. Danielson as my Core professor.

I think she's one of the best Core professors here on campus. Take her and you won't be sorry. I failed Core once in the past and I know so many students who aren't happy with their teachers. She's way more organized than others.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Truth: awesome professor. She's direct, tough, knowledgeable, and the nicest and coolest person you'll ever meet. She made class so much fun and everyone felt comfortable sharing their controversial ideas without any fear. Essays are difficult, but she talks to you one on one several times. Email her for sure. She responds in minutes!

I worked very hard in this class and probably contacted professor Danielson a million times! She was always very nice and never acted annoyed or tired. Thank you so much for always being there for me. Once I saw her at a grocery store, and she sat down with me at the deli and helped me with my project. Hard class but you must work for it.

Professor Doreen was so helpful in my thought process. She really makes you think on your essays. It was a tough class, but it is a class where you'll really learn. Very accessible through email. Asking questions and participation and always attending is imperative to success. Three essays, a group project and a Portfolio were the main assignments.

There are 3 essays and 3 group presentations per group but professor Danielson said she changes the class theme/text every semester, so this may not be the case for the rest of you. The final portfolio that's for all WRI10 classes is hard but she literally sits down and works with you. She baked us brownies and cookies too!

Writing 10 was difficult and we discussed so many social and political issues that are current, so everything made perfect sense. Essays are hard and professor Danielson is always there to help. Great professor. Participation and reading is key.
One of the best Core professors. I Recommend her without reservation.

Definitely don't take Core with Writing 10. Writing and reading consumed this entire semester. Really enjoyed how professor D sat down with every group in class and talked to every single person for quantitative assignments and all the essays. She's detailed and very helpful. Too much reading!
Great professor. I'm taking Core with her too this semester. You've got to keep up with the readings and connect the lectures to them. She's very helpful with essay drafts and one on one conferences.

I did not particularly enjoy this class but not because she wasn't a good professor. It was just demanding and since I am not really interested in writing much, it was hard to stay motivated to do all the work required. You are required to do 4-5 group presentations on the material in the book as well as around 3 essays and the portfolio.

WRI1 was such a cool class with professor Doreen. Everybody likes her for sure. Always laughing and making jokes. Don't get me wrong it's a very hard and demanding class because standards are high. She's so nice and helpful. Taking WR10 and CORE with her.
Recommend this professor--she's great. Worked with me fairly when I had personal problems in life. Very understanding.

There's just so much reading in Core it's unbelievable. Dr. D gives in class group projects and assignments to understand the readings and all the modules. All Core sections have the same readings. Good professor. Her one on one essay workshops really helped me with drafts. She Explains things well.

She will ask you about the reading, so make sure to do it. She began the semester by grouping up the students, so groupwork is a major part of the course and skipping classes affects your grade greatly.

Professor Danielson was an amazing instructor! She helped me a lot in improving my writing style and thought process. She is very insightful, benevolent, and caring. She provides opportunities for students to share their thoughts and opinions during presentations. I'm looking forward to take more classes with her in the future.
Good professor, knows her stuff, and very cool. Makes things relevant and interesting.

Professor Danielson really challenged what I had learned about Critical Thinking and writing before. The notes from this class will be the ones to keep because they teach me how thinking works in different fields. Very cool professor and always available through e-mail too.
So far my favorite teacher at UC Merced. Some say she grades hard, but if you really put in effort and ask questions, you will see that she is extremely fair. She is the best.

CORE was a roller coaster. Too many difficult modules, but professor Danielson did an awesome job. We went beyond everything int his class. I feel like I have traveled around a few continents. Thank you Doreen. You are great.
Can't take this argument course with anyone better than Doreen. My brain would explode during discussions and I loved it.
I took CORE 1 and WRI10 with professor Danielson. She opened my eyes to so many things I never even thought about. Very good instructor and very helpful for sure.
Very good! She is approachable and makes class fun to be in. Take it! She's a great professor and you will learn a lot.

Class theme was Neurosis! This because such an interesting class, I didn't even believe I was taking a hard argument class. Neurosis in Tennessee Williams's plays but I think she retired this theme and will do something totally different next semester. She says she does that all the time. Hard class but she's really awesome. Helpful.
Professor Danielson does interesting things with themes in this class. Very clear and direct and thought provoking. Recommend her for sure especially science students that struggle with writing.

Her standards for teaching Writing 10 and for us students are very high. But at the same time she has a plan to meet all those goals and standards. She's very smart and takes you along with her. I agree with others here, she's very organized and structured. You won't miss anything. Recommend her for sure.
Shes always willing to help out. Very fair and sarcastic in an extremely funny way. Very structured and disciplined. Recommend her for sure.

One of the BEST Core professors! This class is so demanding that many students end up taking it twice or three times. It's got tons of scientific readings, weekly Core Friday & lecture responses, quantitative assignments and 2 big essays plus you've got to attend weekly lectures at the school auditorium and weekly Core Fridays. DD's great!

My friends are all taking Core 1 with other  professors and they are hating it. Believe me this is a very hard class that covers so many modules about life, classification, math, social science and other stuff. When I compare the stuff my friends say to what we do in class I'm like "I have it great". I want to thank professor Danielson:)
Very good, kind, fair professor. She's so nice. She's tough on grammar and APA/MLA style.
Doreen is a good instructor. She connects and relates to students and makes class interesting. I hated the thought of Core, but I needed it for graduation. She made it a very cool experience.

Very detailed. Her grading is harsh, but she holds you to what she's taught during class, so you better be paying attention and taking notes. She's very understanding and has a cool sense of humor. Definitely recommend her:) Plus, she's gorgeous!

This is a great professor right here, everyone! She's awesome and she prepares students for more advanced classes in the Natural Science field. She is tough but if you follow her instructions (they are very very detailed) you will do just fine. She answers e-mails within 1/2 hour which is amazing. A lot of fun and serious learning.

One thing I can say about professor Danielson is that she's fair. Her grading, comments and feedback, and whatever she says about something we turned it is true. She doesn't sugarcoat things so this way you learn the truth and know what to work on. She's very clear in the classroom so I didn't see anyone having any issues.

D.D. reminded me that instructors like her are to be appreciated. She is innovative and passionate everytime we have class. She is able to relate to all of us and whatever we're dealing with. Also her grading is very fair, so if you really do bad on essays, she simply tells you straight up but she shows you every way to fix it. Awesome teacher!

Professor Danielson is always there to give feedback. Her comments on essays are direct and extremely helpful. She is always organized and has a fast pace in class and doesn't let anyone fall behind. This class is a lot of fun actually! I did not expect to look forward to WRITING 10. Definitely recommend this instructor.
Full of enthusiasm. You will succeed if you follow every guideline/formula she gives. Very interesting texts! You will master APA and MLA style:)
She is very energetic, but lacks organization.
She is so caring and helpful.....very awesome instructor....
She's a wonderful teacher and I highly recommend her! You might even get cupcakes.

DD is approachable and she worked with me whenever I had personal issues and couldn't meet deadlines. She is very understanding. This was an argument class so all essays must have an argumentative thesis. She made class interesting!
Very interesting, young, creative, different:) Definitely different--in a cool way!

Be Prepared to take notes ranging from 5-10 pages before lecture. Lectures are pointless and not helpful at all. Don't even waist your time in her office hours either. Taught concepts in the most confusing way possible. I learned more on her pre-lecture notes than I did in class. No prep for exams or tips other than work already provided.
exam right before thanksgiving break, the professor didn't even show but you still have to be there. hugely offensive, incredibly inconsiderate

Lectures are mid, everything can be done outside of class, lowkey teaching is not her calling. The group projects are not beneficial at all. Group work does nothing, group exams do nothing for you but there is ALWAYS a project to do and it gets on my nerves

Teaches concepts in the most confusing way possible even after attending her office hours. you are forced to rely on ta's office hours, or stem tutoring to fully understand a concept. exams are based on in class worksheets.

90% of the class is taught to you by khan academy and/or 15 year old youtube videos. There are occasional "quizzes" for attendance. There are group projects almost every week that are basically designed to bring your grade down. The exams are also two parts, individual and group exam. If you are assigned a bad group your grade drops if you fail.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Actually cares about their subject and cares about teaching people who are in lecture. All exam questions are primarily from worksheets and Knewton Alta. Expect frequent note taking with Khan Academy and Knewton Alta.

The lectures were helpful seeing as we were assigned videos before class to try and learn the topic ourselves and then lecture served as a way to make sure you understood and she and the LAs were available for questions. The exams were difficult, probably just for me though, but she tried to give you as many points as she could with partial credit.

Had us do pre-lecture notes and take a pre-lecture quiz as homework. Her lectures were primarily used to go over the topics from pre-lecture materials. Knows her stuff about Calculus, first half of the semester was a review from pre-calculus. Attendance was not mandatory.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Yue was amazing. Her lectures were very easy to understand and keep up with. There is a good amount of homework that you need to do to understand the coursework. Pay attention to the quizzes and worksheets; the same/similar stuff is going to be on the exams. Overall great professor!

Awesome professor who clearly wants you to succeed in the class. The tests are from homework and classwork assignments and not very difficult. Lots of extra credit offered throughout the semester and fair grading criteria.

Runs a very homework-heavy class, lectures most exist to reinforce the information learned in pre-lecture work. She does have a decently heavy accent, but she's still perfectly understandable through it, if the accent affects your opinion of her class that's on you, not her.
Very easy to reach for office hours and incredibly helpful once you do.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Great, dont even have words to describe her greatness

I enjoyed taking Math 141 with Professor Lei. I'm not a math major, and going into my first upper-div math course was a bit scary, but honestly this course is not hard at all. Especially if you took Math 24 the previous semester. It's essentially a continuation of that class. If you pay attention in lecture, do and understand the HW, you'll be fine

She is a really knowledgeable professor. However she does demand a lot from you. She is caring however and is really nice in class. She does curve, but she wants you to learn the material well and not just for the grade.
Lecture is very messy and unorganized

She does have an accent, but if thats your excuse to say lecture is boring then good luck failing all college course because most if not all have accents. She is very caring and willing to go out of her way to make sure you learn you just have to try. She is tough but thats how you learn, one of the best math professors I had. P.S do your homework
Changed how she taught the class in the past making it more difficult. Previous knowledge of linear algebra is extremely useful. 2 Midterms 1 Final (cumulative)

Know the material very well.  Not very good at explaining it.  have a very thick Chinese accent. makes the test pretty hard if you are learning the material for the first time. Unorganized sometimes doesn't follow textbook's way of working a problem out.

She a great lecturer, but it only the most basic idea of the topic at hand. This is understandable considering the lectures are only 50 minutes. If you listen in lecture, watch YouTube videos, go to your ta's office hours, and study with friends you should do well. Her lecture bonus is crazy good. I went from a C in mid-semester to an A- final.

Doesn't cover everything in class that is on the homework or the quizzes. The midterm is even worse, it has no relation to the quizzes or the homework and regardless of how many hours you study, you are bound to fail the midterm. Regardless of the fact that you go to office hours or even ask for help and understand the material, you will fail.
Very good professor. Slight accent but she knows what she is talking about. I really enjoyed Professor Lei Yue's class and she makes an effort to know your name.

Lei Yue is VERY intelligent. She could be the smartest math professor at the school. I did not enjoy this class at all however, I found it very hard for me to stay focused with her lessons. Lei Yue is good at explaining but not the best at keeping it interesting.I struggled with every midterm as the exam questions were much harder than the homework
She is very clear when introducing new topics and explains them in details. She also makes you think about math rather than just plug in and calculate numbers. Midterms are fair.

She explains things very well and she is clear. Her exams aren't super hard but they are challenging and tricky. She is straight to the point and is very nice with her students, well mostly. You should take math 21 with her she teaches you very well and you don't need the textbook very much but you have to buy it.
Amazing professor. She taught how to think about math as opposed to just doing math. Very clear &straight to the point. Her tests are VERY fair. Very nice person too! ^.^

Lei Yue is a very knowledgeable professor, if you are interested in learning the subject she is the right professor for the job.  If you are interested in getting an A with no work, well, you shouldn't be in college. If you have to take college intro calculus, be prepared to work.  That being said, she teaches the basics of calc well, if you care.

I've had AP Calculus my senior year in high school; my teacher made the subject interesting. This professor is the opposite. I'm not so sure if it's her accent or that she makes the course feel like a philosophy course always questioning meaning behind theorems. Bottom line: did not enjoy it as I did the first time around.

She made me understand real analysis. Explaining the subject came very easily to her, she was able to clearly explain concepts that seem incredibly hard to understand. Very organized and her test are fair. Very knowledgeable about the subject.

Great professor, really loved being in her class, I really felt as if I would never understand calculus prior to taking this class but im happy i had it with her. She makes it very understandable and the HW really helps for preparing for the midterms. Really great professor, I hope to get her again later, I would highly recommend her!
Best Professor I had for linear algebra!! She def knows her stuff and wants you to succeed. If you go to her office hours, she will help! Had her for Math 21 and 32 too and really loved it!!

She knows her stuff, and she is skilled at sharing it.  She's funny, too!  Her tests were challenging but doable.  You have to work to get your grade, but that's the way it should be.  People complaining about difficulty and test averages are the people that don't want to put any effort into passing.
I found math 32 to be ridiculously hard (they upped the pre-req. for this class to math 23). The professor isn't that bad - just the class is bad I think.
REALLY HELPFUL, AND SUPER INTELLIGENT

Whoever rated this prof. on 1/21/09 has a very biased view on this matter.  The reviewer probably failed the course and is taking it out on this website.  Lei Yue is probably the best and most clear math professor I have ever had. SHE WENT TO MIT!!!
Hard class but if you keep in contact with her throughout the semester, she is helpful. office hours and TAs are your friend.
easy teacher! got an A in this class. not only teaches well but also easy!
She holds a difficult class, but is both knowledgeable and helpful; you just have to be willing to ask.  She is a really nice person, just don't tick her off.
she was aight but really hard to understand... midterms are hella hard nothing like the hw problems but she is really organized... go to the TAs cuz they kno wats up

Ah if it isn't Lay Way. The professor who loves to fail yet hates to see half of her same students again the following semester. If you're a math wiz, then you'll have no problem. If not, then good luck. Oh, and prepare to bomb all the midterms cuz most problems she puts on them are problems not seen on hw's or quizzes.
You will only understand Lei, Yue if you already understand Calculus or if you're ready to work your butt off.  Do your homework and DO NOT SLEEP IN THIS CLASS.
Pretty much difficult. Learn your own information. Midterms are really difficult. I study for hours and really know information but still don't pass.
She was helpful. She breaks down the material into manageable portions and I liked how she goes step by step. It's really worth it to attend every lectures.
be ready to teach yourself calculus and having a teacher that doesn't know how to teach.
She was hard...but i still passed...just stick with it.
She never finishes on time. Really hard to understand her examples. Just learn from the TAs
She is really good at breaking problems down into baby steps.
I took Calculus last year, I teach Calculus to other students, and I still failed the midterms. I'm basically failing a remedial class.
Text book sucks doesn't even make any sense. Teacher is new so its really hard. I passed first text but 90 % of the class bombed it aver was like 52
Incredibly hard teacher. 50% failed her first exam.
No Comments
Worst. Simply put.

Engaging? Hardly.
Expect a cold, unapproachable demeanor from start to finish. Constructive conversations are replaced with sharp criticisms, and any attempt to clarify via email is met with unprofessional, clipped responses. Truly a challenging experience—but not in the good way.

Smiling seems to be against their personal policy, and their feedback is often unnecessarily harsh. Communication is abrupt and borderline rude, leaving students feeling more confused than helped. Avoid if you value professional respect.

Prepare to feel undervalued. Interactions with this professor are consistently unpleasant. Their tone is dismissive, their attitude sour, and they seem uninterested in fostering a positive or effective learning space. Business-related concepts appear foreign to them, adding to the frustration.

This professor thrives on negativity. Every meeting feels like a test of patience, with curt remarks and a refusal to engage in any productive dialogue. Their approach to emails is dismissive and often unhelpful, creating an unnecessarily hostile learning environment. Super harsh grader too. If you don't show up to meetings, you won't pass.

"You are wrong" seems to be this professor's favorite phrase, both in class and in emails. Every interaction feels like an uphill battle—never a smile, never a shred of positivity. Their lack of business acumen is apparent, and their responses to emails are curt to the point of rudeness. Prepare for an unpleasant experience from start to finish.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: I definitely struggled throughout this course but it challenged me in the best ways possible. With that being said, putting in the right time and effort resulted in valuable lessons. I would love to take this course again just to be around her wit and wisdom.

She is strict, but if you are willing to work, go into office hours and really put in your 110%, it will be worth it. She really pushes you, either very kindly and harshly. She will call you out in front of everyone. It's kind of inevitable. I would still take her class again because it will be a challenge. so worth it when she likes your work.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Reviews are accurate, marks down for plagiarism over things like facts you forget to cite and you have to rewrite essays over one incorrect sentence that is "plagiarism", outside of class she is a very nice person and helps if you go to office hours and talk to her but is also very condescending in class and makes class very confusing.

By far one of the worst professors I've gotten. Professor Bohrer will call you out and make you feel like your work isn't good enough. She marks your essay down for "plagiarism" if you don't quote something the way she wants it to be quoted. She's also not clear on giving instructions for assignments or homework. Would not take her class again.
If you're really good at writing and want a challenge, take her. But if you want an easy A grade, DO NOT TAKE  HER
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: WORST PROF. EVER. Participation matters and will call out on you for small things even unnecessary things. Gives students attitude and even if you ask her to go to tutoring hours she simply gives a NO even if a student is struggling. I had a friend who met an english major and explain how the teacher wants it and they were confused.

I love her! she's a very wise professor. She uses a teaching style very different than normal writing teachers. She doesn't give a clear structure to write off of, it's more free which makes it tough but it helps you grow as a writer.

This professor is a good teacher in my opinion, she does take into account if you attend class. She will see if you are putting in the effort, she is very observant. She is not very clear on rubrics and guidelines, if you have questions ask because she will not state them clearly. She is critical in essays but it made me a better writer.

If you have her. You might as well give up. No clear directions at all, it's as if she don't know what she saying. If she says sum just know next class she bout to switch up. Asked around class to see if it was just me but most people were confused like me. She is approachable but just know she gonna leave u more confused than before.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: The way that she explains how she wants assignments laid out is really confusing. I honestly just wanted to be online so I didn't have to stay committed to paying attention. I did not realize that she requires participation in almost every class (she has everyone in turn answer). She's also not very zoom savvy....
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: WORST PROF. EVER. Don't ever take her class even if its on zoom. Participation matters and will call out on you for small things even unnecessary things. Gives students attitude and even if you ask her to go to tutoring hours she simply gives a NO even if a student is struggling. There was so many times where I have to rewrite my essay a lot.

Very passive aggressive. Rarely gives positive feedback to students. The biggest problem I had with this class is that she doesn't give rubrics or guidelines to follow. She doesn't have a course schedule or a formal syllabus which is hard for students who do better when following formats.

Attendance started as mandatory but ended up not being mandatory. However, you do need to come because she WILL notice and account it into your participation. My struggle with Professor Bohrer was that it wasn't clear what she wanted for many assignments. But I did enjoy my time in the class and she cares about her students and her work immensely.

The professor doesnt give much feedback on papers but does explain the assignment a lot during class. Shell give you about 4 absences before she starts deducting from your grade. Shes understanding and is avaible outside of class during her choice of time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's a really good professor if you actually care about the class and she sees you putting in the effort. No book needed. She doesn't upload grades so do your best on every assignment! Do not miss a conference because she does call people out for the smallest things.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: First paper I did was 22 pages, story of my life, and she gave me a B, even after I had it grammar checked and revised by peers multiple times. She won't give essay prompts, expectations are unclear, she gives too little direction, DOESN'T UPLOAD GRADES, told me I was failing when it was too late and pretty much told me I was SOL. Worst prof ever.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Very great professor, she's caring even though she may not show it at first, but once you get to know her you realize she's a great professor. No textbook was used in this class all we did was three essays and an academic portfolio at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Her teaching style will have you confused for the very first couple of weeks but theyre interestingly connected to a whole bigger picture she is trying to drive into our heads. Her feedback is very good. There are times where a task is confusing but asking her to elaborate will provide you with more than enough information.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Honestly, her classes are boring and its a pain to attend every single time. Will call you out for the smallest things as well.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Susan is by far the best professor I have ever had. She really gets to know each student and holds them each to their own potential, rather than an objective standard. If you don't want to learn and just want to game a system to get a passing grade, don't take a class by Susan.

She taught me more about myself than I ever knew.  She really implements real life stuff into your writing. She helped me become a better person and writer. So when you do decide to take her class have an open mind, think about what you are writing, and ask for help. I know she seems scary but she really wants to see her students succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She taught pretty much the same material I learned in high school. On top of that, the only topics we really discussed were terrorism and cults (quite pessimistic if you ask me). We only had one session of peer feedback in the whole semester and I never knew how poorly I was doing in the class. She got pissed at me for skipping class only once.

This professor is awesome. Really strict and straight up but she will always be willing to help you. I went from not being confident in my writing to feeling pretty good about it. She taught me how to write using comparisons to reality. For example, writing is like basketball. You need good paragraphs and thesis to score. She is really cool

Susan Bohrer is one of the best teacher i have had, she challenges her students, and pushes them to a level of analysis that leaves you mind boggled. although she is tough, at the end of the day you will be grateful she believed in you! I do have to say that she has a very different way of teaching and grading than most professors but it is okay!

Susan will be one of your toughest teachers. It takes a while to get used to her teaching style (no prompts for essays; no grades are given unless you go to her office hours and ask). You will have to put in MAX effort to get a B or A. Don't slack off in your writing! You will become a better writer if you put in effort and TALK to her.

I have had this professor for three semesters in a row now and am going on a fourth. She expects you to put forth your best effort and can tell when you aren't doing so, but it is worth it in the end. I would go so far as to say that the development of my skills as a writer would have been hindered had I not been a student of Dr. Bohrer.

I had to drop the class. Her style of teaching is like a socratic seminar. Personally I can't learn this way - however, I thought she was brilliant. She doesn't smile and creates a sort of fearful mood in the class. I was also horrified when students would give honest answers and she would scoff and ultimately embarrass them for being wrong.

Avoid this professor at all costs, even if it means not having enough units to qualify financial aid. She never explains assignments, does not have a syllabus, does not use crops nor turnitin,com and does not give any due dates. There's also no grading scale, no prompts for essays, and she never collected any work. She makes me hate my life.

This class is definitely not an easy A,and just as any other class you have to readjust to the professors liking. She has different perspectives of life and she opens your mind to new ideas. As far as assignments, it would help to listen to her beliefs and agree with her in your writings... going to her office hours also helps!

Well, she's not a great professor. She never let me finish my arguments and she ALWAYS had a difference of opinion than I did so I don't think she liked me that much.
