Her class was very hard because it doesn't matter if you're in the hospital, if you miss a day she will drop your grade. So don't let life get in the way pretty much :/

She's not a great teacher. In the beginning of the class, she will act as if her class is an easy pass and things will be a breeze the rest of the semester, but after the dropping of class period ends, she turns into a tyrant. She thinks she is a great professor and is far from it. She grades harshly and is not very understandable. DON'T TAKE HER.

so... basically she never told me i failed two essays until like 2 days before my portfolio was due... so i thought i was passing the whole time until 2 days before my portfolio... thanks a lot jerk... do not take her... take her if u want to fail...
WORST PROFESSOR I HAD ON EARTH... i learned more on the day she was not here than all the combined days that she was here... does not help you anything... AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS...
She comes off really strict and uptight, but she is extremely caring and helpful if you put in any effort. She's always willing to meet with you and help you out. :)
I thought her teaching style was great. I really could see  she was interested in helping students learn and she allotted a good deal of her time conferencing students. Wonderful professor!
The most useless CORE professor ever.  Gives horribly unclear directions, grades papers based on her opinions, disorganized, stubborn and is overall incompetent at teaching.

Very sharp and observant lady.  She'll catch every last inconsistency, grammar error, or structural flaw with your paper! If you like a challenge and want to improve your writing skills, this class should be excellent for you.
strict but very efficient and helpful.
Excellent cares for each and everyone of her indvidual students. What professor really does that nowadays!!!!!

This teacher was completely useless in her teaching methods. Her opinion is the ONLY opinion while grading papers. She claims she is knowledgable in writing, but she made countless errors in correcting papers. Noob.
No Comments
No Comments

If you like controversy, it is unavoidable in her class.  She is very strong willed in her opinions.  She is good at complaining and making you feel foolish.  If you don't mind a teacher who hardly smiles, you won't mind her.

We have the power to cure! Great class and the guy is a true inspiration. He cared about us and is very passionate about teaching oncology. I was surprised how easy it was to improve my science writing skills just by following his guidelines.

The professor has a tendency of changing his grading policy at the last minute without notifying the students. His office hours are approximately 30 minutes in length, occur once a week, and take place right after lecture outside the lecture room. This professor cannot be relied upon for his lecture skills, transparency, or consistency in grading.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Very good teacher. He was very enthusiastic and inspiring. The material was very interesting. A big part of the reason why I now want to pursue Oncology!

Fabian is able to compile a myriad complex ground-breaking cancer research concepts/topics and explain them in a well organized manner. He is articulate and understands how to communicate to students in a way in which they can understand. Not a lot of academics have this ability.

Nice guy who cares about his students' success-will give As to those who put in effort/score decently. Calls the textbook your bible-1000% true do read it thoroughly. Provides lots of helpful practice questions & TA is awesome at clarifying info. Class boosted my confidence on how well I can study/learn difficult material. V. interesting material!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: He is very passionate about the subject, as it is very interesting. The class was fun, since both him and his TA are very blunt, and we found it really funny. There is a lot of reading in the class but if you read, you'll understand everything, and the writing assignments hella boost your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Class Lectures are really useful, provides a bunch of resources for exams, pretty funny guy who enjoys his job
He really encourages participation and is always available to clarify any questions outside of class. The class itself can be challenging and difficult. Despite that, it's interesting at least
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great professor, inspires students to learn. The class motto " WE HAVE". - professor "THE POWER TO CURE"-students really motivates me to learn. Professor gives great feed back and gives study guide to help prepare for midterms. Reading the book helps. This class is very interesting and the assignments in the class helped me learns much.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: This class can be challenging, however if you stay on top of your work you should be fine. The study guides provided are very helpful and useful for exam preparation. This class gave me an opportunity to practice professional development,
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class was taken as an upper division elective course. I would defiantly recommend this course if you are interested in learning more about cancer, he does focus on melanoma as that is the field of his interest. I came out of this class with more knowledge and respect for the field.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Encourages active classroom participation and gives good feedback on writing assignments.

I would definitely recommend this course. We learned some methods in how researchers make new discoveries about cancer. Dr. Filipp would often tie in what we were learning in class to current advances in the field. The discussions in lecture help me, just listening to others ask questions without judgement helps even if I dont like to speak.

Great class and inspiring lecturer! I really liked how recent research was integrated into the class. Very positive class climate. As the class progressed I started to participate more due to the increased discussions in class.

The professor is very caring of students and wants them to succeed. He promotes participation in class to get students to critically think of cancer biology. He is very knowledgable of this complex biology topic. Even though he breaks down the material very well, it important to read the book for in depth knowledge.

Dr. Filipp is an amazing professor! He is one of my favorite professors in my major and he basically simplifies complex information about cancer to help students understand biomedical learning goals. The course was a bit challenging, but if you read the textbook and review the study guide questions, you will definitely pass the class with an A.

Dr. Filipps grading was absolutely fair. He gives specific feedback and posts rubrics online. It is important to follow those guideline to get a good grade. The group projects around cancer are great. A cool way to collaborate with others in the class and to put biomedical research project on your resume.

Funny prof. The guy really knows his stuff. Can be scary at times - the class is very demanding and moves at fast pace. As long as you show up to class and come prepared to midterms and assignments it's a fair deal.
Great Class! Dr Filipp was very patient and knowledgeable about the topic.

Great professor. He is very knowledgeable and his lectures are very engaging. The different assignment components build upon each other and include group projects. The grading criteria are clearly outlined. He is always available outside class and truly cares about our career goals.

Fabian is a great professor but teaching is not for him. Class is very unorganized and there are due dates. There were no dates on the syllabus so if tests came up. He tells you a week in advance if anything is coming up or due. The tests are also timed so u don't get the full class time to do the test. Get ready to read in depth to pass the class.
Nice, understanding guy. Not the best lecturer. What's expected from you isn't always clear. Willing to help you if needed though. Attendance is mandatory.

Very intense course and a lot of information. If your a student who enjoys learning about science on for fun, this class is for you! The course is really centered upon the textbook, you must read to do well.
Not the best lecturer and his slides don't offer much context aside from figures that are already in your book. Lots of reading.
Expect to study hard for this class.

Cancer Genetics is an overall interesting subject however, if you're taking this course, you have to be prepared to do LOTS of reading and studying. The professor is helpful sometimes but you'll most likely find yourself learning the material on your own. Do not rely on lectures to learn the important concepts. The book has everything you need.

He knows what he is talking about though reading the book is necessary to understand what the figures mean as those are used primarily in his lecturing. Does attendance and little quizzes during lecture about preclude material that account for an okay portion of the grade. Questions on test are in order of chapters. Focuses on objective of lecture.
Doesn't really teach, forces you to research on your own. Great class though.

Definitely hard class with ridiculous expectations. Go over a chapter each lecture and even though you get points for participation in the quizzes, you only get 0.1/1 points if you answer wrong. Make sure to dedicate hours of reading for this class

Very tough class. You must be sure to read the book before coming to class, or else the quiz questions will be tough to do. When assigned papers, make sure to read them in detail, and follow the rubric closely.
It takes time to get used to his lecture style but his class is manageable. It's not that bad.
The course was hard, read the book. Exams not so bad. Attendance is everything!!!

Dr. Fabian is very knowledgeable in what he does and inspires me to work in the oncology field. His classes are fast paced and tough but you can do well if you prepare ahead of time. He is an awesome and caring lecturer.

class was very very tough, lots of material and lecture slides are just pictures. Need to read the book a lot to understand. Questions on tests had a lot of options with multiple answers possible. Made it very difficult if you didn't read.

Professor is very passionate about the material, but lecture explanations were unclear at times. Due dates and exam dates could have been assigned earlier and there's little time to complete assignments. Read beforehand and make sure you know specific details

The class demands a lot of studying and reviewing because the material is dense and very conceptual. A lot of information is covered in every lecture so attendance is important! He isn't very clear about what is expected in writing papers and discussion isn't really helpful at all.
The class would be much better if it was more organized.

Are you looking for another challenge besides biochemistry, organic chemistry, and human physiology? Well, this class is a great opportunity for you and to test your patience, perseverance, and persistence. You haven't lived until you've taken this class. You haven't felt more alive and accomplished until you survive and pass this class. GOODLUCK!

Tought class but one of the few i've taken where the instructor was genuinely engaged and interested in the topic. Professor Filipp himself is a cancer researcher, and has a lot to offer students who are willing to work hard.

You have to show up for class and discussion! Make sure you do or you will fail. The class is hard you fit 16 chapters in 8 weeks, the material is dry in lecture but just try to keep up. The professor is very understanding of students. Good Luck!
This class exists. Its not hard, but not a cakewalk. At least you'll learn a lot, but beware of short deadlines on large portions of your grade. I recommend it.

Class was poorly organized. The schedule constantly seemed to change. Expectations were not clearly explained so it was hard to excel in some assignments. He never really liked you asking questions either. Interesting topic just poorly executed.

I've never had a professor speak so unclear before. It's hard to follow him in lecture, and you never know whats expected of you. He goes through the whole book in two months, and he gives you due dates only days in advance. I would not take this professor again if given the chance over. You teach yourselves completely, so the book is necessary.

He was very unclear in his lectures and class overall. He speaks very fast, has a hard to understand accent, and said "um, uh, hm" over 100 times each lecture.  He wanted to go through the entire book in 2 months, to be done with the class a month early. He didn't give dates on the syllabus and gave short notice of assignments and exam dates.

Very dense course. A lot of the information is up to the student to unpack. Independent study is the way to go, but the course touched on a lot of the important concepts relevant to cancer biology. Helpful to take cells, tissues, organs, class or any immunology before hand.
10/10 would take a again
Good teachers and midterms and finals reflect what is taught in class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment:
Very helpful prof. outside of class, good at teaching but pay attention

Midterms are difficult, make sure to do all of the practice midterms and finals as practice

TAs generally misgrade, so check your midterms and ask for regrades (Went from an 80-100%)

Do all the hw without AI, great practice for midterms

Pay attention, and you'll get an A

Homework and quizzes do NOT match what we're learning in lectures, midterms and the final are way harder than the practice exams provided and is very tough when it comes to grading projects, take a different calc professor while you still can

Honestly, Professor Thompson isn't a bad professor. I took him in spring, and now with him in the fall, and most of my issues in the class were because of my own fault. But there are some things i'm not a fan of. The sometimes extremely harsh grading made this class more difficult than it should've been, The highest median on exams was 64%! Tough

I LOVE PROF KEITH THOMPSON! His lectures were honestly pretty solid and he was willing to answer any questions you had on specific topics! His study guides/practice exams were always so helpful and he's honestly just a really great math prof! I would def recommend him to anyone and everyone

Keith Thompson is a very respectable teacher. His lectures are worth your time, although you can skip if there's no lecture quiz and teach yourself the topic in class. However there is one big issue with him. His grading. You'll soon come to realize that his grading is rough. His midterms can be rough however the most frustrating thing is projects

His lectures has practice problems and they're mostly application based. They're a great tool for learning and are great for an introduction to a topic. However some of the homework problems are harder than the examples given in class. They're study guides for exams however sometimes they're questions on the exam that aren't included in the guide.
Professor is a very good compared to my others professor. He does a lot to help you out. He gives practice midterms which makes it easy to study.
Lectures are easy to follow and has clear explanation for concepts. Exams are fair although TA grading can be nitpicky with some questions.
His lectures are very easy to follow, and he answers all questions very effectively. The coursework is manageable and very helpful towards preparing for the exams.
Really easy to understand.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: The tests aren't so bad if you use the study guide. So many people narrow their expectations of whats going to be on the miidterms. Study the worksheets and you will be fine with every midterm. The final exam wasn't so bad.

While you'll get a decent grade if you show up to class, the exams are rough. There are 3 midterms which all tend to have things on them that weren't on the study guide so make sure you know the material. Other than that, just don't miss too many classes and definitely don't miss your lectures.

This class is similar to taking 3 different classes in 1. The lectures do not help at all because all he does is make students do "activities" and waits 15 min then explain how to do it then the hw is completely different and the discussions are different from the material. Take a different calc 1 prof.

Homework was pretty easy compared to other professors HOWEVER THE MIDTERMS ARE BRUTAL. Nothing like what he teaches in class or what's on his study guide. He uses the same midterms from previous classes but it always ends up way harder than the original study guide. Too many midterms, and I bet the final will be even worse.

Professor Thompson is amazing,Calculus is generally a tough subject so the class won't be easy, you have to put in the work to pass. His midterms weren't that bad in my opinion because he gave practice ones which were essentially the midterm, he is also very helpful during office hours so I recommend to go if you have any questions about anything.

Professor Thompson is a great teacher and lecturer. The midterms are fairly easy as they are very similar to the practice midterms however the final exam was extremely difficult.The homework was not too bad and there were a few opportunities for extra credit. The class was curved at the end of the semester, there are two projects and one is dropped

I appreciate that Professor Thompson always makes time for questions during his lectures. His grading is clear and he drops a lot of assignments at the end of the semester. He also gives multiple opportunities for extra credit. He is both very kind and patient, truly an exceptional professor.
Good lecturer with a decent amount of work. Homework wasn't super fun but with extra credit you can skip a few. The tests were alright, not too hard at all as long as you know how his tests work.
Lectures had very little teaching and were mostly activity filled.  Never went over activities cause he was always short on time.  Exams were very harsh.  LOTS OF HOMEWORK

Keith really does care about the learning of his students but his midterms and projects are outrageous. The average grade for his midterms would be just above failing; not to mention the numerous cheating allegations he made against students for completing the same project he assigned to everyone. Would not take again based off of this experience.

This is the 2nd semester I had Dr. Thompson, as I had him for Math 021 last fall. He was about as good as he was then, and ran the class similarly. However, one of the midterms was quite brutal as a lot of people did not do well on it including myself. However, he did give us a good curve (which he regularly does) to make up for most of the flaws.

Dr. Thompson is certainly one of the best math lecturers out there. While he has slightly harder grading standards on tests, his class was well thought out and he explains concepts quite well, plus there are also extra credit opportunities. I learned a lot in this class, and thanks to that, I am taking his Math 022 class next semester.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Keith is a solid professor. He is a good lecturer and gives a decent amount of extra credit to boost your grade. He is also very helpful and will make sure you understand what is being taught.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Keith is a great professor, I understood a majority of the things he taught for MATH23. He is a cool person. However, his tests are insane. Nothing like what he teaches.

Keith's a good professor. But his exams are absolutely brutal. Our averages throughout the semester were 50% or below. He does a good job of explaining things but the exams are worth a lot and are insanely hard. Gives lots of lecture quizzes and discussion quizzes as well (not as hard). Curves class slightly, also gave a bit of extra cred.

Keith is a master at teaching. His explanations are fantastic and he always understands the material very well. He is able to give examples of how the things you learn will be used in practice. I think my favorite thing about him is that he cares a lot and often tailors his teaching to be best understood he goes the extra mile.

Keith was great. Acts/talks a bit goofy, but you get used to it. He's is very nice about answering questions, and going back if you're lost. He did a grade adjustment at the end, adding abt. 3%. I definitely prefer him to Sandoval. I received a D in math 11, retook it at CC, and got an A- in math 12. Exams/quizzes near identical to practice/WS.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Great Professor. Explains very conceptually toward the beginning of the class but does more examples toward the middle to the end. 23 is definitely a hard class but if you put in the work, understand your HW instead of chegging it, do the worksheets, read the textbook for clarification, go to lecture, and work with your TA you'll do great.

Took him for Preparatory Calculus. The class was an easy A because I took Pre-Calculus junior year of high school. Overall, if you need to take Pre-Cal, you should take him. He is willing to answer your questions and attend his office hours if you need help with your assignments. P.S. the tests and exams are easy as long as you review ALEKS.

Keith was too conceptual in this class. Math 023 is known to be the hardest lower division math non mathematics majors have to take, and is difficult to visualize because it mostly deals with 3D graphing. Instead of doing multiple examples, he spent over half of the lecture explaining how to derive the formulas. Average grade was a 50% on tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: OMG, He is sooooo Kind and caring. If you ask him a question, he wants to genuinely help you. So kind, I wish he's was my professor for all my classes. If only I can duplicate him. Take him, you will legit not regret him. He gave the whole class an opportunity to fix 1 of our midterm scores by doing well on the final. He's both hilarious and kind!
Go to his office hours if you are struggling. He is very helpful and one of the best teachers at Merced. Super nice guy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Thompson was the best professor I have had so far. His lectures are amazing but what helped me the best was his homework and discussions. He did curve the final, class, and given quizzes at the end of the semester. Highly recommend to attend all lectures and discussions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Took him in Sp-18. Not too bad of a class and his lectures were very informative. Quizzes weren't too hard and the midterms were somewhat heavy but doable. Best professor to have as he is very knowledgeable and accessible after class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: This man is amazing and if you dont like math or struggle he encourages you with everything he has. He knows math like jesus walks on water. Probably the hardest working professor ever.
Keith is a god, and is super passionate about what he teaches.

Professor Thompson is an INCREDIBLE math professor! He explains the material extremely well and does not make you feel stupid for not knowing something. Readily available and accessible if you need his help and he is always willing to help! I truly enjoy his lectures!!!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Keith is one of the best math teachers I have ever had. He understands the material and knows how to teach it effectively. Teaching Calculus 2 isn't an easy task, and yet he excels at it. His voice is calming, and is patient with dumb questions. Take him if you can.
You can't go wrong with Keith

Overall great professor, he loves when students ask questions and is very helpful during office hours. Hw is all done on WebAssign. textbook is helpful when doing Homework all by yourself. If you miss a lecture try to find Professor Leonard on Youtube and you should be fine. Discussion is usually very behind. Only important for quizzes and hw.

Professor Thompson is probably the smartest person I have ever come across. He could explain math very well, even if you think "I can't learn in lecture", you will learn a lot from Keith. I highly recommend him as a math teacher
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Keith Thompson is one of the most concise and clear people that I have ever met. He makes sure that his class is both engaging and understandable to everyone, all the time. If one takes the time to attend his office hours, he makes it absolutely worth your while. He makes sure that all parts of his class are well-oiled and educational.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He is such a nice guy, and wants to help out with everything. His midterms were easy to me because I did all the homework and went to office hours, where he is super helpful
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I had a good time in his class, he explains problems very detailed. Would highly recommend anyone who needs extra help in class to take him.
He's a cool teacher, and he in the TA for math 011 , but he teachers ALOT better than the actual professor who was no help...

Keith is a really good math instructor. I cannot believe how many times he saved my grade when I went to office hours. When ever I ask a question he explains even with the most toughest questions with ease. He is definitely one of the best math lecturers here in UC Merced. He will make math more enjoyable (or less painful)  :-).
Quizzes every week. His office hours are full, really helpful
He's a good teacher, he grades fairly and he's always really nice and helpful, but you have to at least try and do you work , a good grade is attainable

I'm so glad I took Keith for Math 005 because I was able to meet such a kind and patient professor. However, even though he was not my TA for Math 11, I still visit him whenever I need help because his explanations are very understandable yet simple.

I took Keith for Math 005 last semester he was very patient with me and always willing to finish as much of the worksheet as possible he grades fair and he will help you if you go to office hours he has a good atittude

Keith is the most patient teacher I have ever had here He is ALWAYS willing to help if you ask Math is a tough subject for me but because he is such a good teacher I have an A He is so patient that he will explain things over and over until you understand  He gives partial credit, and he is a FAIR grader BEST Teacher at UCM

I had Professor Varnot for WRI 010, and it was one of the first classes I took at UCM. She's an amazing professor, one of my favorites I've had so far. The lectures were super interesting, and the discussions over the books we read and wrote about were great. I would highly recommend Professor Varnot to anyone taking a writing course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Varnot is an awesome professor. She is hilarious and cares about knowing her students outside of class. She is a very accessible professor and easy to work with if you ever have issues or cannot meet a due date. She is a tough grader but you will learn a lot 10/10

I took both WRI131A, WRI131C, and WRI105 with Professor Varnot. She is a great professor who knows what she is teaching the class. While some of her assignments can be hard to understand, she is excellent at answering questions and giving feedback about an assignment. She was also easy to get in touch with outside the classroom.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She is a funny and caring professor. Although for teaching she often went off to topics that did not have to do with the class and kind of left us with little time to give us instructions and instead had to work on things at home. This was in every single day we met so it became slightly annoying when we attendance is mandatory but we do nothing.

Professor Varnot is such an amazing Professor! It is easy to see she not only cares for the material she teaches, but her students as well. Although sometimes the workload may seem a lot and never-ending, it is definitely manageable and Prof. Varnot is more than willing to help. She gives extraordinary feedback on assignments for students to use.

Professor Varnot is one of my favorite professors at UC Merced. She is very passionate about writing and is very helpful in class and in her office hours. There are a lot of readings and papers but they are not too overwhelming. There is a lot of peer review in her class and she goes over topics very well.

Professor Varnot is a teacher that noticeably cares about her students and what she is teaching them. She is always willing to help you in any academic or non-academic way. The course reading is spread out and she always gives more than enough time to do assignments- many of which you will also work on in class. We need more teachers like her.
Professor Varnot is hands down one of the best professors I had this semester. Her teaching style is amazing and she truly cares about her students. I would definitely recommend!!

She is hands down the best high-energy teacher I've had. She genuinely cares about her students and it shows (even gave each of us personalized gifts at the end of the semester!). Don't expect an easy A out of her, but she is always very clear in her criticisms and genuinely wants you to improve from her class. I always looked forward to her class!

I took Varnot for Fall and Spring 2021. She's a great professor who is really understanding. We had four essays throughout the semester and she was a pretty tough grader. Attendance is mandatory but just show up and you'll get through it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: As long as you show up to class and do your work you will pass. She is very understanding, and works with you. She is caring and even sent us rocks and a gift LOL. I would definitely take her class if I were you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Took Varnot for fall 2020 so the class was online. She gives great feedback and is always available for questions. Had four essays throughout the semester and her grading was pretty hard. But just show up, keep up with the work, and get help on assignments if you need it, and you'll pass.

I loved Varnot as a writing professor. I was able to get to know her in another class, SPRK, so we had some history and I was used to her teaching style. It was a rough class and it was my first year, so I was still new to college, however, she was really nice and open and she cared about my growth, as a person. I recommend taking her class 100%
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Shes honestly the best writing/English professor Ive ever had. Very thorough feedback. The only thing is, sometimes she isnt very clear about what she wants and your left in the dark. She always willing to answer questions though. Great experience.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: She is a very thorough grader and very motivating. She wants her students to succeed and truly cares about them. Her lectures are very interactive and fun.

Professor Varnot is one of the best professors I've ever had. She makes time to help her students in and outside of the classroom, and is understanding of any circumstances going on in your life. Her funny jokes make class worth going to and you will learn a lot about being a better writer. Attend class and read and you should be good!

Professor Varnot is a must-take at Merced. She is an absolute gem in the central valley. She will motivate you to push your boundaries as a scholar, and she does so in a fun and engaging way. The feedback that she gives back on each paper is incredibly specific and helpful. She will not only make you a better writer, but also a better person.
She is a great writing professor! However, you must be willing to put in work on your assignments!

Best writing professor I ever took! She is very funny and interactive with the students. She really cares about her students and isn't afraid to roast them. Very silly and tells story of her life to get students energized. 10/10 would take her class again. Though the work is difficult, if you talk to her, she's willing to really help.

Second time around with Professor Varnot. For this class, four essays make your grade, each one increasing in percentage weight in the class. Three books, and overall a lot of work. However, would still take her again!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Varnot was an amazing writing 10 professor. I learned so much in her class, and she pushed me to love writing! I would defiantly take her again. If you do have her, be prepared for books to read along with quizzes, and also long essays.
Good person overall, strict grader.

I took Susan Varnot for my first year in college. She is by far one of the greatest teachers I've ever had. Hilarious, down to earth, willing to help students, and she makes sure to talk about her life also and not just teach. She is a strict grader, but you can tell she loves what she does and loves her students.
She is so silly and fun. I enjoyed this class. It's not easy but you will learn a lot. I mean its easy if you are a good writer. Yes, there is a lot of work.

had her my first year in college fall semester 2011.came to class with fear every time,not bc I was scared of her class, but bc I was scared of writing.I have to say, I absolutely love the professor! She made her class interesting.She's a strict grader though but gives thorough comments on essays, we wrote 4 essays total. passed with a B-

Interesting.  Essays get harder.  She's helpful.  I've never loved writing, but I do like her topics.  She makes you think.  She also definitely gives a lot of comments, they help a lot.  She also has you come to office hours to explain how you can do better. Bonus.  I don't love writing.  I like her class though.

Kooky fun teacher with tons of energy totally rubs of on the students. Really fun class really pushes you to work hard. She sets the bar high and does everything she can save do the writing for you to help you get there.

She gives a lot of comments, but I thought creative writing was easy.  She also expects you to read the syllabus and know the policies.  If you're late, your work gets a zero -- annoying!  She takes you seriously though, but I hate getting zeros for late work.  I'm used to professors being forgiving that way.  She is not.  She expects a lot.
Very fun teacher. but very hard grader.
Awesome!  I took this class because friends recommended it/her.  I'm still new to Varnot.  I hear, though, that she can't be beat.  So far, she is awesome and unusual.
Hard but worth it!  Really teaches!

When I first took a class with Varnot, it was Core -- and no one is excited about Core.  She did, though, make us excited, even at 7:30 am.  I also took 2 other classes with her.  'Nuf said.  You really can't go wrong.  She's incredible -- if demanding -- even for Core.

Everyone I know who has had a course with Varnot thinks she is both hard and awesome.  She takes classes and students seriously.  But don't expect freebies.  She helps students a lot.  Not an easy grade though.

ONE OF THE BEST PROFESSOR ON THE MERCED CAMPUS! She loves teaching and you can see the passion for literature in her lectures. A bit of a tough grader, but you will learn a TON!!! She loves Boston and her accent is funny!! She is probably one of the best professor you can have. I highly recommend her! She will make you appreciate writing.
Awesome!  The best professor ever!  Expect a lot of comments on your papers, and pay attention to them.  That Boston accent -- hella cool!  One of the best on this campus!
Loved the class & Prof. Varnot!  She's a tough grader, but her class discussions are amazing.  People in the class still get together and talk about it -- SO COOL!
I loved her teaching in 25 & also took 125 with her.  She's simply amazing, different, and you learn a ton!
THE BEST PROFESSOR! SOOO INTERESTING!
Average

I had Susan for WRI 25 & 125 - she's  awesome! She's my favorite professor from college and her classes helped me develop my writing to a level I never would have been able to on my own. She isn't stingy with grades, she gives grades you deserve. She's very understanding and willing to work with her students. I HIGHLY recommend her classes!

Awesome!  She makes class interesting, fun, and you learn a lot.  I would take this professor for every writing class if I could because she is amazing.  You will not come across many professors who are so dedicated.  Yes, she has high expectations, but you should too.  She'll teach you a lot.  The last person sounds like a lunatic. She's real.

One word to sum up this wonderful woman. Fresh. She loves what she teaches, which makes the students love what she teaches. BEST Instructor Ever. Wish she could always be my instructor. BTW extremely easy.
Awesome teacher. I highly recommend her. She makes learning interesting and fun. Only downside is that she's a tough grader, but she is very understanding and willing to help students
REALLY cool teacher. gets really into her subject...everyone likes her. has a boston accent. WILL take her again.

Diss Readings are 10%, exams are 90%. Attending lectures are highly recommended. Exams are on lecture and reading material. Lecture slides aren't posted. Really fun class & it goes by quick too. Generous w/ grade curves.

Professor Dodson is an amazing professor, his lectures are nice to attend to, he is a very understanding professor and he has office hours which everyone is welcome to attend if you are confused about the material. 10% of your grade is attending discussion once a week and 90% of your grade is 3 exams. Slides are not provided.
Professor Dodson is always available to help students if they don't understand the material. You will have to read every about 2-4 lectures per week if you want to do well on the tests.

His Soc 1 class was great his lectures are straight to the point and his slides are exactly what's going to be on the exams. 10% of your grade is participation and 90% is the 3 exams you have throughout the semester; exams are easy if you study a bit and go to lectures. Only downside is he doesn't share slides. But overall easy A/B.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His lectures were nice to attend, he's understanding, there are 3 quizzes that you would have to pass but he will make accommodations if it's needed.
Only 3 exams! Discussion sections helped review topics in class and readings. Exams were all MCQ for me, just applications of what was discussed in lecture. Readings weren't excessive.

The best class in this university. You get 3 tests for your entire grade. This makes lectures mandatory because the notes you take from lectures are going to be put on the test. Reading is also required because they make up 20% of the question on the test. Compared to other courses this class is relatively fun.

He's so so sweet and understanding, and uses amazing & very helpful lecture material. The only problem I had with this class is that I had a little bit of trouble finding the textbook for a cheaper price in the beginning of the semester. They sell it on campus, but it was wayyyy too expensive, so I had to rent it on Amazon.

Great class and an even better professor, He makes sure that everyone has a good understanding of the material. He delivers his points well and keeps the mood of the class high. the quality of the assignments never go down as well. do keep in mind that you have to take notes in lecture since he doesnt publish them outside oh class.

i really enjoyed this class, he is a very strict on not sharing lecture slides, they are very comprehensible, there is weekly discussion homework on assigned readings from the book, he brings his dogs sometimes to lecture, the class grade is 90% by 3 midterms, 10% from discussion attendance. he gives a 10 point curve to the midterms
Prof. is one of my favorite sociology professors! Attendance isn't taken but I recommend going since I was able to understand each assignment better. I would definitely take him again.

Kyle is by far the best professor I have had in my two years at this school. As many of these reviews have stated, his class is based on 3 exams and attending your lab. It sounds tedious but just show up to lecture, pay attention, and write notes, because you're guaranteed to see all of those things on the exams themselves.

was very understanding and easy to work with his test where open book and made so its very easy to pass took stats with him. already knew some of the stuff going in but gives you a lot of opportunities to learn the materials if needed ask questions very good at explaining them.
It is very hard to understand Dr. Dodson.

Kyle was such a great professor and he actually inspired me to change my major to sociology. He is so funny and full of energy, I love listening to him lecture. Youre graded on discussion participation as well as 3 tests throughout the semester. Just make sure you TAKE HIS NOTES because they are literally basically answers for the tests. Take him!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He's funny & chill, and his lectures are interesting. He allowed zoom attendance this semester which was helpful, but the lecture in person was always better. Discussions are comprehension for hw and sharing answers. Study, and you should pass. I'm not sure if the textbook is online, but... Amazon rental?

He is such a funny professor, plays music and is very chill. He says his lectures are not mandatory but most of the course, he teaches through his lectures so if you don't go you might not pass his 3 exams. Very little course work, but make sure you participate in discussions and read the chapters.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Great professor and material! Course consists of 3 tests and you will need a textbook, weekly readings,usually from 2-4, but theyre easy. Class is not mandatory however the class is interesting and most who pass with higher grades are those who go to class. Teacher is very understanding and constantly asks if we need further explanation.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Professor Dodson is so caring and respectful. There are only three exams in this class no midterm or final. The exams are literally your notes and questions from the readings. As long as you take notes and study them for the exams you are almost guaranteed an A in the class.
I loved this class! I looked forward to going every morning. Make sure you get your work done or you'll fall behind.

Professor Dodson is a fun, caring, and well prepared professor. His lectures are very interesting since he makes sure to engage with his students. His notes always match what is on exams so it is not difficult for students to pass with an A if they study the notes and reading questions. I would definitely recommend Professor Dodson and this course.

He is a really great professor. You have a total of 3 non-cumulative exams all multiple choice. Every week he assigns readings and you have questions to answer from those readings that you later talk about in discussion. The exams cover material he covers in class and from the weekly readings. If you pay attention you can easily get an A!

Attendance technically isnt mandatory but he doesnt post notes online so SHOW UP! Also one of the very few professors that give lectures and I dont fall asleep. I actually felt like I was learning in his class! Amazing teacher! Great Humor!

Dodson is such a good professor. If you attend class daily and take notes on his lectures, you will most likely pass but you also have to study outside of class. His lectures are very simple but material-heavy. You are graded by THREE midterm exams which are 30% each, and the other 10% is based on your attendance and participation in discussion.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Graded by 3 midterms (30% each)and 10% discussion . No final. Office hours are very helpful and he is willing to go over the material again if you do not understand. Study over time for the midterm. DO NOT CRAM! His lectures are good, with that being said, go to class to get good understanding of the content. What you work for is the grade you get
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: He was an amazing professor. I took sociology becuase I needed the credits, but man, he made me realize how awesome Sociology was and how interesting life is. He's a funny guy and i remember he would play music right before his classes started. Make sure you listen and read the book he wants you to read. Just have fun learning!

Prof. Dodson's lectures are very entertaining & enjoyable & material he taught really stuck to me because of his lecturing. He only gives his three midterms, no final. A lot of the questions on the exams were based off lecture material so attending lecture is VERY important. Assigned readings are interesting as well and were very helpful for exams.

Hes a great teacher! He makes his lectures fun and interesting. For the most part he connects his lectures to the real world, sometimes even personal experience, which makes it easier to remember. Would have him again if I had the chance!

Professor Dodson is a great professor! He tries his best to make sure that the class understands what he is teaching and he is really funny. The only thing is that the class is graded off of 3 midterms only and he doesn't post his notes online so you have to come to lecture.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Amazing professor! He makes class simple. Show up to lecture, take notes, do the readings and you will pass with a decent grade. I would actually recommend going to lecture because he makes them worth it.  He is always willing to explain the material further in lecture if you don't understand. Couldn't recommend him enough.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Great professor! At first, it was difficult but you will eventually learn how to study for the midterms. I really recommend him, but I would suggest you actually attend lectures because his midterms are based on what he says during lecture, lecture slides, and the readings.

Kyle is one of my favorite professors. Had to take SOC 1 for a ge and I'm so glad I took it with him. For discussions you only have to read some readings and answer questions which isn't that necessary bc it's only 10 questions of a 40 question midterm. Lectures were entertaining and made sure everyone understood it before moving on
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: My boy Kyle Dodson is the man! He made lecture fun. Spoke with him about teaching upper division sadly he's going on leave. But he is an amazing professor.

He is hilarious! The way he goes over the slides are really helpful since he not only explains the concepts, but he also provides various examples. He is willing to answer and go more in depth during office hours, and that helps a lot! Over all, he has to be my favorite professor this semester!

He is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is hilarious! He presents the material in a clear manner. The reading material is not hard. He doesn't assign a textbook for stats. I was nervous about taking statistics, but he made sure we understood the material before moving on. I would definitely take him again. I can't recommend him enough.

Before signing up for Soc 10 I was nervous since it's a statistics class, but once I noticed that Kyle Dodson was teaching it, my worries went out the window. Having taken his intro class, I knew his teaching style beforehand. Dodson is very dedicated to making lecture materials understandable and he goes out of his way to help students pass exams.

His class was simply enjoyable. He really took time to answer your questions and make sure everyone understood. His examples were pretty humorous enough to be memorable. I wouldn't necessarily say the class is easy however it is very fair. I would definitely take a class with him again.
I wish more teachers were like him.  He teaches well and tests are not a surprise when you get there.  If you put forth the effort, it is fairly simple to get an A in this class.

Dodson is a great lecturer. His humor and knowledge of the material keeps you engaged. He will answer any questions you have and well answer them so you understand. Everything you need to know, he tells you in the lectures. If you study, you can get an A in this course. Loved having him as a professor.
Dodson likes to be funny and use modern day references. i enjoyed his class. exams are easy

Prof. Dodson is a great professor! He's funny and keeps his lectures interesting. TAKE NOTES because he doesn't post powerpoints and know all answers to the discussion readings. STUDY the lecture notes and readings and go to discussion and you'll get an A. He's super cool.

Great teacher, he's got a good sense of humor making lectures more enjoyable. The material isn't rocket science, do the work and it pays off; the readings (for the most part) are fairly interesting and should be done a little bit at a time (they add up quickly so don't procrastinate them!). The tests are easy as long as you study. Great class.

Good professor. Sink or swim kind of class. Pay attention to lectures because they are important, he is a good lecturer (lectures very structured). STUDY for midterms & finals by knowing all terms. Dodson can be funny & connects terms to examples that are helpful to learning. Keep up w/ readings, they are interesting & shouldn't be done in 1 night

If you have the space in your college plan, I'd recommend switching professors or taking elsewhere. This is the type of professor you get verbal warnings about. I ended up dropping this class to retake it later with a different professor. Has a pretty unfavorable personality, but not too difficult bc of grade curves.

Prof Hlousek's cardinal sin is that he talks too fast. In every other way he was excellent: He answers student questions during lecture, he's very friendly, and he was even kind enough to give me a personal recommendation to be an LA next semester.
However, he does speak too fast. Taking notes at 90WPM was not enough for me. Just that one issue.

This professor is the worst I've had. Lectures are unclear, and they refuse to help or answer questions. Grading is ridiculously harsh, even when the whole class struggles. They show zero care for students or their success, creating a frustrating, unwelcoming environment. Avoid at all costs!

I get that everyone says this professor is bad... AND THEY ARE RIGHT. WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE HAD THE DISPLEASURE TO EXPERIENCE. UC Merced is already known for being a bad college and now it also has bad professors.

Look.. I'm sure whenever you see bad reviews, you might think "Oh this student is just bitter and the teacher can't be that bad". But I'm serious. Borna is the worst professor I've ever had. Recently, Midterm 2 grades were released. The average was around a 25% and the highest grade in the class was a 64%. Clearly he does not know how to teach.

Had him as a TA for discussion, 0/10 experience would not wish on my worst enemy. When anyone asks him a question, no matter how simple, he answers your question with a question. Grades extra hard for absolutely no reason. If you care about yourself, find another professor.

This professor is terrible, if you have him as a TA or Prof switch to a different one. Not understanding at all, emailed him within the expected guidelines and didn't hear back for 3 weeks, talked to him in person and he would repeatedly cut me off or disregard what I was saying. Terribly harsh grader he expects us to have Doctorates in Physics.

This man may be the single worst teacher on the face of the planet. Plenty of people already went over why, so I won't waste your time. Instead here is some advice drop the class take it over the summer at a community college and take a gen ed instead your sanity and GPA will thank you. It's not worth it having to deal with Borna nothing is.
Lectures often do not pertain to course material, just read the textbook if you have him.

This class is easy and prof in my opinion explains well. Easy to pass bc of huge curve, it helps w real problem solving.
Courses at this uni very easy in general
If you need an excuse to drop out of college this is it.
Complete failure at teaching. He cannot teach the simplest concept without overcomplicating the life out of it. Take Borna if you want motivation to drop out.

comment: Bro does not care about teaching, at all.
terrible teaching and is zero help before tests. even the textbooks suck but they're probably the bare minimum actual material you get. yt university prof

comment: Talks way too f fast and lectures are useless. Terrible teacher and you would be better off self studying off textbooks

Lectures are extremely boring, long, and usually useless, so you'd want to use the textbook. comment: His lectures feel very unorganized and disengaging. Physics is already a hard subject itself but he makes it even harder by not having clear lectures. It w

comment: Absolutely abominable grading scale with very unclear standards. Course schedule and structure is all over the place, professors and TA's are borderline incompetent. Professor does not give good lectures, monotone, zero clarity, condescending to students. Messes up all the time, gets basic facts wrong with a LOT of confidence. Needs to be humbled.

His lectures are near useless as he goes over the proofs of the concepts and not highlighting things we actually need. He releases slides but they're one line at a time which ends up being a pdf of 400+ pages of slight changes to each slide. He assigns really hard homework that takes forever to do.

I'm absolutely baffled by this specimen of a person. Lectures are EXTREMELY boring & useless, hws take 5 hours on a good day, discussion ws confuse you more, quizzes are on future topics not discussed yet, & TAs don't help/care. However, he curves a lot, so class isn't impossible; it's just really hard and makes you question your sanity every day.

ight here we go. not exaggerated
- lectures are a waste of time
- discussion worksheets are ridiculous. you can ask your ta for help but nah they just wont
- quizzes have material that are taught 2 weeks in the future.
- midterm 2 had concepts the weren't taught ANYWHERE in class/textbook. NOBODY got an A even after the curve
smartest kid went bald

Borna's lectures are really confusing. Homeworks will take 3-5 hours on a good day. Quizzes mostly only hurt your grade because discussions don't go over them. No review or study guides for midterm. Class needs a MASSIVE curve because otherwise 70% would be failing. Thankfully, he does curve a lot, so class isn't impossible, just really hard.

comment: Lectures are confusing with constant typos. His poor hand writing and presentation makes it impossible to understand his equations

Mentally painful lectures. Really bad handwriting. Lots of time and effort needed. Office hours/ STEM tutoring/ after-class conversation/questions highly recommended. Lots of hw, discussion worksheets/ quiz questions on exam. Don't forget pre-lectures.

People who don't want work shouldnt take college courses. Work is there, and effort needed if you want to pass. College dif HS

If the class and course easy, why pay so much for this education.

comment: Goo lecture, he's passionate about Physics and cares about students. he's a tough grader, and the course can be challenging. needs to put effort and study every week. HMs are not bad and they are helpful to the exams.

I had a good experience with him. My grades struggled in the beginning as Physics is not my major, but he encouraged me to ask questions and come to the office hours and he cares about everyone. Don't take this dude...like frfr
I hate this dude

Ive absolutely nothing good to say abt this dude. he makes us do assignments due in the middle of break, he has to curve tests or else everyone gets an f on it... plus his hw and quizzes are complete bull. kids are cheating rampantly just to pass, on hw, quiz, project, tests, all.

comment: The professor is not really open to questions and his responses feel condescending at times. I recommend you avoid if you have the chance.

comment: Do not take.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This guy is a very unreasonable and harsh grader as he will dock you points for the most trivial of omissions. often deducting points for minor errors or omissions. He is also very condescending as if you dare to ask him a question he make you feel stupid for even asking him and even the way he talks makes you feel this way even more.

The exams are the worst part. I passed every quiz, participation was an A, and my attendance was high. I took notes every class, went to tutoring, and I still could not pass any exams. I don't know how he continues on knowing that he's the problem. Good luck and be prepared to put in overtime if you suck at math because he doesn't care.
Professor is nice but the class all around sucks. 3 Midterms worth 30% each with no curving system and quizzes every other week during discussion. Overall, good person but not the best teacher

He is a nice guy but if you aren't familiar with certain calc concepts it will definitely impact your grade heavily. The midterms and final exam's are difficult and the homework is no help. He is a tough grader. During lectures he goes fast which makes it difficult to understand. Overall he is a nice guy but he is very fast paced and tough grader.

Hes a really fun and nice person but unless you already have a really good grasp on calculus you will die over and over and over again. His practice problems never match up to the midterms (difficulty level wise) and the homeworks are the biggest waste of time out there.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: if you don't put in the time then your screwed. it's really not that hard when you actually try and study consistently, and he is always happy to explain things

I began this class without any prior calc knowledge and in the beginning, it was extremely difficult however, if you dedicate time to the course you can be successful. The math center is extremely helpful! There were 3 midterms and a final exam, with weekly quizzes. Make sure you know how to complete every problem in the midterm reviews.

Sandoval was a pretty good professor. His grading might seem hard but he's super generous with partial points. I would ask him to look at it if you think you deserve more points. His midterms are based on his midterm review so ensure that you review it. He is good at answering questions. Study the basics of math online for a strong foundation.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Midterms are the largest graded category (30%). They are incredibly difficult and the only people who did super super well already have taken some form of calculus class in the past. However he is super funny and always happy to help even though I still struggled in his class. He has a slight grading curve but nothing that can save you.

The only students who are successful on Sandoval's are students who know calculus already. If you're learning these concepts for the first time, good luck! In lectures, he reads off slides and has the class do practice questions on their own (no one does them). Study guides are unnecessarily long and midterms are graded unnecessarily harshly L PROF

Sandoval's classes were pretty chill and easy to understand. He tries to be enthusiastic in his morning lectures, and has many slides to showcase what he is trying to teach. However, his midterms are all word problems and they are way harder than the homework he gives, or the practice problems done in class. 5 word problems, 1 mess up = grade over.

Very engaging, explains things at a relatively good pace (if you are well versed in precalculus). Overall his lectures were easy to understand, although I would heavily recommend if math is not your forte, to focus a little more on practice problems especially from discussion worksheets. The midterms are worth a hefty amount--good luck

Professor Sandoval moves too fast in his lectures. More than half the time they were very hard to understand considering I was an A+ math student. Beware of 3 midterms with review homework that consists of about 6 pages with all word problems. Midterms count for most of your grade than anything else and they are very hard.

Chris isn't a bad lecturer, but he moves very fast through his topics. As someone who struggles with math, it was difficult to keep up. He makes his office hours available but his teaching methods are catered to specific learners and many people are still unable to understand. Overall, good luck with this class.
MY RATING IS BASED ON CALCULUS 021. Professor Sandoval is an amazing lecturer, made the material easy to understand. Try on the material and you are guaranteed to pass, do not be lazy. Good luck!

Long story short, Calculus will be a challenge no matter what. Of course, Chris understood this. He provide numerous amount of practice material and many opportunities to improve on your math skills. I found that his lecture were structured in an organized manner (in order to what will be seen on exams). Participation is key for this course!

I was so close to passing his class but was not able to because he did not curve or did not give extra credit. Class is mandatory and requires you to sign in on a paper for attendance. He doesn't curve the midterm or final either.

Avoid this man!!!  Took his class, and even though I had calculus knowledge still failed. His midterms are horrible, with a final that has an average of 35%. I studied for hours for his exams and still failed his class. Take calculus at a community college, and not with him.

Unfortunately he is the only professor for math 11 but I would never take him again. Doesnt care to fail students and doesnt want to see you win. No extra credit, no curve, nothing. also he says 40% fail his class per semester, and exam averages are an F so that should say everything about the professor.

Nice guy, but hard class. Doesn't curve midterms, quizzes every week in discussion, curves final only for those close to an A and has a B. Takes attendance by intialing your name on a piece of paper. Homework every week through Knewton Alta which you have to pay for. Few pass his class. Don't recommend skipping class if you're struggling.

Attendance is mandatory and if you're struggling with your grade I don't recommend skipping class. Workload is heavy and quizzes are given every week except when we have midterms. Usually he will curve the grades by dropping some assignments but don't rely on that, just try your best.

Hes really nice and all but yeah he doesn't do a good job during lectures so homework is confusing and midterms are hard because you basically have to learn everything on your own://// but I do think he helps a lot more during office hours

Sandoval was honestly a really great lecturer, and I say this as someone who DESPISES math. He made it really engaging and although his final did make me cry, if you put in the effort and go to his office hours and study the exam guides he gives you, the class should not be hard to pass. For sure also gives major dad vibes.

He's a really great teacher! His tests are fairly easy, so long as you study. He gives these study guides before each test, which he pulls test questions from. His office hours are really helpful if you're struggling. He passes out attendance sheets every lecture, so attendance is "mandatory". You can always have a friend sign your name for you.

Homework & midterms are worth a lot of points. Using symbolab or mathway to give you the answers will not help you understand the material. he gives off parental vibes totally, but a some of his jokes aren't okay, even if he is funny as a person. He in engaging & he can clarify concepts but he never got me to understand them completely.

Really nice guy, lectures are very engaging. Fun personality; as some have said he has dad vibes. Lectures are helpful but not essential to pass, in my opinion, as he posts lecture slides. I recommend going as he usually adds his notes and tips to help with specific topics. And his teaching style makes you look forward to his lectures. Recommend.

Sandavol is a hilarious and helpful professor, but the class itself is incredibly difficult even after attending class, tutoring, and studying for hours. Exams only have a few problems so mistakes can make a huge impact, and a lot of trick questions. Thankfully homework makes a huge chunk of your grade, but they take a long time to do.

I hate math with my entire soul, but he made Calc 1 bearable with his humor, like I actually looked forward to his lectures. Homework is normal, not too much and not too little. His tests arent hard but if you feel it is, his review sheets and problem sets are so helpful. He gives all the materials you need and more

Chris made Calc 1 bearable. Course material obviously gets harder but he provides great resources to ensure your success. Knewton Alta is a little annoying. The worksheets and study guides were helpful for exams. Math isn't easy but if you do the work, you can pass. He is helpful in class and in office hours. Really patient, thorough, and kind!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: 10/10 one of the best profs I've had so far. He lets the students call him "Chris" and had major dad vibes. His Calc 1 lectures were very thorough and clear and he gave plenty of time to work the problems and ask questions.

Chris is an amazing instructor, he breaks down all the material. If youve never taken a calculus course it might seem very fast pace, but office hours and tutoring help a lot! Make sure to do the worksheets, study, and ask questions. He is very friendly and approachable!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Lots of homework

comment: Sandoval is a very fair professor. He is not lenient which really forces you to learn the material, but it's all for your own good. He's amazing during office hours, so really utilize that and TA'S office hours. Do all the homework and review the study guides to the bone to ensure a good grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Don't believe what you hear about him, he is a very great professor with interesting lectures, you do have to work for a good grade and this should be expected by a college course, he really does want his students to pass and is always there after class to help. if you fail, rethink your major...

Good teacher he really wants you to earn the grade and not simply slack off and get the passing grade. He curves the grade which came in clutch, hes really funny in class . Knows how to keep students awake

His lectures help a lot since he does the math on the board. He welcomes questions and comments, so ask away. He seems very knowledgeable about calculus. Definitely study the review sheet before the midterms, as in know how to solve each problem. The tests basically had the same questions, just a few changes here and there.

comment: very hard class, the midterm reviews are nothing like the midterms, please beware and don't overlook this comment, take yatskar please, im begging you all. not enough assignments to average out grade

comment: Very tough grader. I went to EVERY discussion & lecture, got good grades on the quizzes & homeworks, went to PALS 1-2 weeks, and I still HEAVILY struggled. comment: This is my first time failing a class, ever. I worked my butt off to pass this class and failed, the class average on each exam was around 55% and the average on the final exam was 52%. He "curves" the class by about 2-3%, which did nothing for me or anyone I knew. The best part is he teaches it in the summer. I'm retaking it at community college.
