comment: amazing professor, hard class but he is really good at making sure everyone understands.

Dr. Sandoval is an enthusiastic lecturer, so they're not boring, but he skips over steps when solving problems. He uploads midterm review worksheets a few days before exams and the problems on the tests are similar but they require more steps. There's weekly quizzes on the past week's worksheet as well. Wiley is a TERRIBLE program!

Great lectures. Wants you to ask questions and gives good feedback when you do. Homework is easy, but homework on WileyPLUS is a unnecessarily picky and annoying to work with. Study the practice tests and you will be fine.

Lecture is mandatory but they are not boring. He is really good at explaining every detail with a lot of examples. He wants students to ask questions. Exams are difficult but if you study the practice exams you could get a decent grade.

Lectures are good, and homework is easy but WPlus is needed for this course and is TERRIBLE. Chris's quizzes are easy (got 100% on almost all of them), homework is easy but submission is crap. Attendance is mandatory for your grade. Exam grading is extremely tedious and exams are way more difficult than the practice. Avg on midterm 2 was 17/50... .
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Sean Malloy is one of the most funniest professors out there. Attendence was never taken but I love going to his lectures because he genuinely cares about what he teaches.  Major papers and mid term and final isn't too bad. Totally recommend this class and him as a professor.

Although we have much reading to do in this course he gives us a week to read all materials each week, We don't have a midterm or final exam, but we do have midterm and final papers. He grades easy & will give you an A if you answer the prompt with reason. We did a total of 4 papers including midterm and final. I didn't attend lectures & got an A.

Only had 4 assignments and they were reasonably difficult. Lectures were not necessarily required, but they were fun to go to. You should do the readings as you need them for the few assignments given. Best class for someone who just needs to take a social science GE requirement.

Had him for fall of 2022 and hes such an awesome professor, only 4 assignments total throughout the semester assigned weeks ahead to give you time to do them, He always played music in before class started and his lectures were interesting, most information for the work are from the readings,there's no finals or quizzes and no need to buy books

Although I used to dislike the subject of history strongly, Professor Malloy quickly managed that with his way of teaching. He delivers very engaging lectures while effectively informing us about major past events. His sense of humor is impeccable and I really loved how he stood firm in his beliefs but wouldn't let them influence us.

Easy going, 3 papers, good lectures.

The grading is not done by him, its by the TA's so make sure you understand your TA's grading scale.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Malloy is noticeably passionate about what he is teaching and it makes the class that much better. The only assignments we had were an essay every month of the semester for a total of 4 assignments. However, it's usually just on the readings and he gives the assignment to you WEEKS in advance. Just do your readings and you'll do great.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--So many papers

comment: Hes a very caring professor, very lenient, very easy going. Overall, just a very chill person. Expect lots of essays though.
The class required a lot of writing as we were working on our capstone paper but Professor Malloy made the process a bit less painful. He gave helpful feedback on all of the paper updates.

One of the best Professors at UC Merced. Made my first semester here amazing. Always starts off the class on a good note by playing music no one's ever heard. Lectures were always interesting. Good humor. All essays are dealt on the reading. Gives study guides to all midterms and finals. No reason you should fail.

Honestly, my favorite professor here at UCM, his lectures are always so interesting and fun to attend for being US history. He's passionate about what he teaches and always full of energy. It isn't a complicated course, just make sure to do your assignments, if you have trouble he's very helpful in office hours.
I love him . Say you love mcgriddles he will love you too. :) Lectures are always so interesting .
AMAZING LECTURER! GREAT PROFESSOR.

Malloy was a great professor, his lecture style was clear and always easy to follow. He always seemed excited to teach and eager to engage his students. I went and spoke with him during his office hours and he was super nice in person! .. PS. I loved the inflection of his voice, but I know it did bother some of my classmates.
Malloy was a really good teacher, he knew what he was saying, and clearly and efficiently got his point across to the class. If you can, take his class!   :)

Prof. Malloy was extremely passionate about the content and his students' learning. I would def. recommend his class because he will find a way to make the subject matter very interesting and enjoyable to learn.

Prof. Malloy is the best teacher in the history department. As a result of taking his class, I was able to properly create research papers and use Chicago citation formatting. His lectures are engaging and he is able to connect to his students. He was always helpful when I needed further assistance in coursework and educational guidance.

Malloy is the best history professor at UC Merced. He's funny and passionate about history. He makes going to class fun, you won't ever want to skip class. He came to class dressed as a pirate to give a lecture on Blackbeard. His enthusiasm inspires his students. He is the reason I chose to major in history.

Malloy is the best history professor at UCM. He's funny, interesting, articulate, and EXTREMELY passionate about the subject matter! Going to class isn't "mandatory" but you better go if you wanna learn, FOR REAL. But he makes it so you actually look forward to his class. It's never a drag and the readings are almost always interesting.
Excellent, hilarious, engaging, understanding, and so awesome he makes dry material incredibly interesting and memorable. Nuff Said.

Malloy is awesome. We only met a few times, but I wish it was more often as he is chill and fun to listen to. He doesn't lose sight of the purpose of the course, and isn't afraid to change things. If students aren't benefiting from an assignment, he'll scrap it. Bonus: He gave us champagne the day we turned in our theses!

Honestly, Malloy, in my opinion, is the best history professor at UCM, at the moment. His lectures are entertaining and very informative (since he's a great teacher and knows what he's doing and how to teach…you will learn a lot). Overall, Malloy is very charismatic, funny, nice, and you can tell that he cares a lot about his students doing well.

Best professor I have ever had. He is SO passionate about what he teaches. and it rubs off on you. I felt it was a privilege to be in his class. No textbooks. just a few novels. a couple essays. and essay mid-term and finals. but he gives you a study guide with the questions that WILL be on the test.

Although I didn't always attend lectures, I'll admit that the lectures I did attend were quite amusing and interesting. Provides all vocabulary and essay questions that will be present on exams so studying is a cinch. Aced both my mid-term and Final. I got a B+ because I skipped discussions which made up 10% of our grade.

Absolutely one of the best professors I've ever had. Dislikes textbooks, so attending lecture is necessary. Other than that he's an interesting and extremely funny teacher. Lectures were never boring, and he'll always answer your questions after class. Never belittles students for stupid questions. I highly recommend taking his class!
Very fun and engaging, he makes the lectures fun and funny. You never want to miss a class because he makes history interesting. A great elective course to take with him!
AMAZING!!! Without a doubt UCM's finest. Though he isn't teaching this year, wait untill he is back and take his class.
I don't like history but he makes it very interesting. Such a great professor. If you can do the study guide, you will be ready for the test. I would recommend him.
Happy intellectual. Great insight & wonderful connections to other material. Very entertaining.
GREAT PROFESSOR, LOVED HIS CLASS EVEN IF HE IS A CAL BEAR FAN, GO TROJANS!!!

One of UCM's finest. His style is flamboyant and he's very enthusiastic during lectures. He really makes the class interesting, a plus when it comes to History. Very helpful and insightful. I recommend taking at least one of his classes for your elective credits if you're not a history major.
Best professor at UCM! Sense of humor. Great taste in music...played before every lecture.

The best professor I have had thus far in my college career.  He knows how to engage his students, and makes all lectures entertaining.  He is funny, but at the same time knows how to handle serious subject matter with decorum.  I recommend taking his class even if you are not a history major.  He will help open your eyes to the world.
I like the bangs.
An excellent professor.  He knows how to teach U.S. history and does it in an excellent fashion.  I enjoy his lectures because they are very interesting and helpful.
Enthusiastic professor - makes fascinating lectures through vivid stories that connect very well.  Very knowledgable and funny.
Excellent lecturer, really makes history interesting. Text is usually fairly interesting and not very lengthy.

I had Prof. Malloy when he was teaching at USF and it's easy to say that USF is missing out. He is boring in class and sometimes you wouldn't want to go, but what history class isn't boring? He tries to make it as much fun as possible and isn't very hard on the students. He also has a great mind in history which should make him a better teacher.
Great lectures and enthusiasm. Very engaging.
funny... makes classes interesting
No Comments
Great course. My first introduction to databases and I feel like I am ready for a job as a database programmer now. Loved that we could pick our own team and topic for projects.

Scales grading weights appropriately and tests are open-note, so it doesn't feel like one mistake can tank your grade.
Projects were well-designed and plenty of time and guidance was given for them.
Not the most glamorous professor or class but he gives you everything you need to succeed and is always fair.
Just do the homeworks and follow along and you'll do fine.

My experience with Santosh in previous courses like CSE 31 was very negative. However, Santosh in CSE 120 is pretty chill and puts more time and effort towards supporting the students. He is invested in helping your team make the best project possible for I2G. He only roasts teams that don't follow simple directions on assignments.

Open notes on exams and study guides are 90% similar to the actual tests. Never really paid attention to the lectures but the material was not that difficult to understand. Encourages participation and is always open to questions from students. Two projects with a partner, do not wait last minute to start these.
He is very rude when giving comments. Create unnecessary fear for students. Get ready to be roasted by him when doing the presentation. Definitely not the nicest prof on campus you can encounter
tells you exactly whats on the exams, pretty easy if you just go to the lectures. decent amount of work though
Choose your level of involvement, exam and assignments are all-or-nothing. If you're assigned a good project & team you get to be crowned king of the garbage can
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: The only assignments he has in the gradebook are labs and exams meaning your grade is at the mercy of the exams of which he gives no leniency towards. The lectures are made up of him summarizing the slides which always have 70-130 slides per presentation, and he always goes over time because of his convoluted explanations. Be prepared to google.
Last minute changes that weren't on the syllabus exam was changed last minute.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: this class is a lot of work. lectures important to go to and take good notes. class starts slow (at least if you have experience in C, otherwise glhf) but then picks up with an insanely difficult project that is assigned on top of regular labs and the midterm. there are only two projects, but I'd say they are as much work as 5 labs a piece.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Literally have to speedrun each midterm. The main beef I have with this man is his MOSS checker. Half the class got falsely accused of plagiarism and caused stress and panic to students during midterm week. If you have a commonly used efficient way of doing a code, I recommend doing the opposite to avoid unnecessary stress.
Too many people passed the first exam so he cut the time of the exam.
Very unforgiving grading. Grade is heavily dependent on tests and labs are not used for lab work. Lectures are not helpful.
If you can avoid him, then run :D

He almost always goes 30-60 minutes overtime. He just reads off a powerpoint for lectures, so I had to learn everything on my own through the textbook or other online resources. The lecture slides are a quick summary of the textbook. Labs were for discussion worksheets and not for the assignments. Very little time given for midterms.

At least with remote instruction this guy is an absolute nightmare. Most lectures go overtime and the material is overexplained and poorly explained. For labs he used a plaigarism checker that flagged people who didn't even cheat in the first place, which could have been prevented had he required us to demo our code.

Mostly reads off a power point to teach which can get very dull. Midterms are somewhat difficult as I feel as there is not enough time and you will also learn most of the material from outside of lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: He constantly goes over the given time limit for his class interfering with times of other classes. Lab assignments are given every week, but they can be quite challenging even with pseudocode. Exams are even worse since you are on a severe time crunch with long difficult questions. The amount of material covered is A LOT so be ready and good luck
80% of grade is midterms and finals and lectures are overtimed a lot he also likes to penalize and labs are almost all about work sheets rather than how to implement the code which is the other 20%

You know what is expected of you and how the class is curved. Taking the midterms are terrible because of the time crunch with the amount of questions given. He is definitely lecture heavy but on the bright side, he acknowledges your question.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: 80% of class is midterms and final and after 1st midterm he cut time in half and kept the same amount of questions

Had him for cse 20,21 and 31 was fine then during Covid hes gone over lecture time 90% of the time often by more than 15 min there are like 5, 2hr videos. He also cut midterm time in half after mid 1 with the same number of questions. What does that look like mid 1 I had 91% but mid 2 I got 52%. Worst thing is 80% of the grade is mids and final
Acknowledges midterm is time-constrained-- yet chooses to do nothing to help students. Lectures are very fast-paced. If you can take Angelo.

The class is well structured with a detailed syllabus. The professor encourages participation during lectures and is decent at explaining the material. The grading is pretty fair and curved based on the average class performance. However, keep in mind that the exams are difficult with very limited time to finish.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Where do I start let me just say that if you see him on the class name I'd run the other directions, you know what in fact just transfer. I had this foo for 4 semesters each time having him worse than the last. The tests super hard and gives you no time. 80% of your grade is comprised of tests, and his words not mine, "This midterm was a mess".
Very organized. Not sure what other people here dealt with but in almost all my semesters of having him, I knew exactly what was expected of me

He gives lots of assignments, which make sure that you know what you're doing. Additionally, tests are not the heaviest grade, homework is (midterms 10% each, homework 20%). I really enjoy his teaching style and workload amount, but the tests can be tricky.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: TA's all super helpful, the professor himself is fine. Really I just had one bad experience where I tried to get help from him and he went on a short rant about how sloppy my code was and how he hates beginners. It stung and was high key hurtful. He made several other remarks throughout helping me, such as "how don't you know this". Just ask TAs
Show up to the class, and you'll be fine. He posts lecture slides. There are quizzes and tests, but they aren't too bad. The bulk of your grade depends on the labs.

OS is a tough course, there's no way around it. There's 2 projects worth 45% of your grade, 1 midterm and final 35%. The rest is homework and lab attendance. Lectures are fine, but the material can be difficult to understand the first time, so you'll likely have to go over it on your own time. The professor's fine, but he was unorganized at times.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: super unorganized, he kept pushing back assignments to the point where we would get swamped by all our other classes. lectures don't help at all. it's all self taught + the labs teach you more than the professors since the TAs tend to explain things clearer.

For someone who addresses importance to professionalism and detail-oriented skills, he sure is the opposite. Unorganized, behind in lectures, hard to contact by email, stuck up in a way.. I could ace the class just by completing zybooks on my own. Lab was easier because of the TA and zybooks alone. Announcements and projects given out last minute/:
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class was a cake walk. This professor was teaching another professor's material and would often mess up the lectures.

Gave projects that were due at the most inconvenient times. Could've just looked at zybooks instead of went to lectures, but even so grading on Zybooks is a bad move imo. Computer lab is subpar, as these Linux computers did not have java; I had emailed my trouble, but he did not make the commitment to check on the condition of lab at all.

Get a good TA, and make sure you understand materials in textbook and his lecture slides. Know how to do all labs and projects. Don't worry too much if you do not do well on midterm and final because the challenge activity can boost up 5% total grade. He curve final if 80% of students do course evaluation at the end of a semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Curve finals. 5% extra credits for total. Projects and labs are helpful for understanding. Get a good TA and you will be fine.

His exams seems easy at first but grades hard. Class average was 54 on final but difficulty of test doesn't align. Most of the work is easy points but really learn the stuff on your own if you want to do well on exam. He is a good explainer but learning comes from self learn. Really nice guy during office hours and extra credit helps a lot.

All homework is based on reading activities and coding assignments. If you can do these, you should be able to get a B without much studying. Midterms and Finals are open-note, will be easy if you do the homework. There are solutions for all the labs/reading online, but be sure you actually know how to do it. 5% extra credit for extra coding tasks.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Lectures are pretty empty, but I always attend anyways and he's amazing at teaching. He really cares about CSE and he will always try to help any questions anybody has! Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Do not take this professor. Very heavy lectures with only notes. Very heavy on reading. If you miss a class it is very hard to catch up and learn what is happening.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: very lecture heavy and no electronics. doesn't like to be asked questions fast pace. I didn't get to know what my final grades were till I looked at my transcript. Doesn't use canvas at all. Highly recommend attending the discussions. Make sure to show up to next few classes after exams cuz that's the only way to know what your scored.

First class I've ever had to drop, for some people it may work but not me. No technology is allowed, so get rid of any phones or laptops at risk of penalty. Your grade hinges fully on 3 difficult exams, lectures are all handwritten with nothing posted online besides the required readings which are extensive.

Good professor. Discussions though saved me in understanding the concept. Take notes, attend those discussions, ask questions, and the class becomes a breeze once you figure out the patterns to solve the questions. As someone who's absolutely bad at math, taking this for GE felt relieving knowing I didn't need previous knowledge to understand.

I personally did not enjoy his class or his character. He belittles students if they try to ask clarifying questions or just review q's. grade consists of midterm, final, and two or three homework (5 points). does not allow electronics and only uses canvas for announcements, so be ready to take notes. would recommend another prof. if you need a GE
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took his introduction to philosophy class. As long as you attend the lectures (he summarizes the readings very well), and atleast review the day before midterms, you should do well in this class. His assignments and midterms are very straightforward. Also be ready to take handwritten notes ! (Does not like electronic)
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I enjoyed taking this class however, be aware that he does not allow electronics (or use canvas) and the entire lecture is copying notes from the whiteboard. You are graded only on the midterm and the final so it is crucial to attend every class and pay attention. As long as you do those things then the tests are pretty easy and it is an easy A.

I would say that this professor is someone who doesn't have the best teaching style. They usually read the notes and write them on the board. Something complicated while taking this class was the fact that he would introduce multiple new concepts all in one lecture which is difficult to process because some people take time to understand concepts.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Rolf is a horrible professor. If you plan on taking this class for GE requirements, CHOOSE A DIFFERENT CLASS. His lectures are extremely heavy and he works fast. He belittles students and makes them feel dumb when they ask questions. His class is only graded on the midterm and final so if you do horrible on them, you won't pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: rolf grades the whole semester based on three reading assignments, two midterms, and a final. for lectures he doesn't allows devices so you have to use pen and paper. he prewrites his material and projects it so you just copy them while he talks. overall he explains things well, its just difficult in terms of how few assignments are graded.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I don't think the work itself is hard. Lectures are heavy so if you miss one, you're going to miss out on a lot so make sure to read and do the assigned problems for that week. Book can be found online on scribd, using the free trial, a physical copy is just way too expensive. Your grade is basically a midterm and final so beware and study.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I thought this would be a difficult class, but no, it wasn't. Maybe it's cause it's the first few weeks but I'll update at the end of the semester. He's a pretty good teacher. I have to look over my notes after class, but other than that, the class is nice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I should have read the ratings on this professor because it honestly wouldve saved me from taking this cancerous course as others already mentioned. Lectures are super fast pace and boring. Students ask questions and he made them feel dumb then says I dont get what you mean. Doesn't post anything not even notes. doesnt allow electronics or talking.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Not a very engaging class in general
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Only had two assignments throughout the whole year. So all of your grade is counted from exams. All we have all year is basically lecture-notes. He was helpful if you had questions but the teaching style wasn't for me.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Took this profs class as an online course, would not recommend skipping class or not doing the optional homework, otherwise you'd do poorly on the exams. 2 exams are what make your grade, homework is key to practicing proofs which will help you pass the exams
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: The class can be a bit boring but it's a good introduction class to philosophy, especially for someone with little to no prior knowledge. This is not a debate class so don't expect to be debating philosophies, just talking about and explaining from philosopheres.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I took this class during the pandemic, and so far it has been a nightmare working with this teacher. He never posts any videos of lectures, so if you miss or have issues with the internet, you're screwed. I find his lectures boring, long, and overcomplicated. The textbook is so old I had issues even finding a copy. I regret taking this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Rolf is an extremely good lecturer & will cover everything you need to know for his exams; the study-guides he prepares are awesome. He will give you exactly one week to prepare for your exams which does kind of suck because he packs in a bunch of material towards the end. Go to office hours and talk to him after class and you will be fine.
Great professor but lectures are fast pace
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: You're graded on a midterm and a final that's 95% of your grade. The homework is the other 5%. I would recommend not taking this course if possible. See if you can take actual math or psych to fulfill your statistic GE. I wish more people reviewed PHIL5 before I took this cancerous course because it gets confusing & it doesn't help that it's boring
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I would give him a 5/5, best lectures, will always explain something to its fullest extent to help the student. He loves his class. Metaphysics consisted of two essays, that if you go to class and pay attention, are easy to score an A+ on.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is lecture heavy. Lectures are very boring and he does not allow any cellphone or laptop use in class. yes, even to take notes. Grade in class is determined by two midterms and one final. I bough the textbooks needed and only opened one book twice out of like six books, dont see the need for them. He provides study guides for all tests.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Three midterms make up this class. That's it. And Rolf is insanely boring. His lectures are mundane and he goes off on tangents a lot without covering the slack he missed, and expects you to get it all. Good luck if you have the misfortune of having him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The textbook is astonishingly boring. In the lecture, he breaks down the reading materials for you, transform them into easy-follow notes. The class is graded by only tests, and only 5% goes to hw. The tests were fair, and relatively easy if you learned anything from his lecture and lecture alone.
His lectures are very long and can get boring but his notes are very clear. There are no surprises on his tests as long as you take notes. If you put in the effort it's pretty easy.
Lecture is very dry and long .

Rolf's a phenomenal teacher, and taking this course has encouraged me to pick up a philosophy minor and take more classes with him. He is very happy to work with students outside of class, whether discussing class material or not. Really the only downside is that his office hours are usually packed right before a midterm.
Very organized, good notes, cool guy; he's nice and livens up the subject but he's monotone so the lectures can get a bit boring.
Just go to discussion and read the readings if you don't go to lecture. It's a interesting class but lectures may be a bit boring but the professor is cool and nice.

Great professor. Easy to understand and very clear. He has the best notes! I wish all professors were as organized as he is. And he does it all without TAs,including teaching discussions! Nice guy, too.
He is a great professor, and the discussion sections help clarify  the difficult sections of lecture.

The lectures tend to be boring and there is a lot of reading, but he covers it all in great detail in the class.  The only things in the grade book are the midterms and final, so make sure to pay attention to the study guide.  He makes the dry subject more interesting, he is monotone though.

Yes, the subject can be a little dry, but Rolf always tries to lighten it up by making jokes or using fun examples.  Attending class and actually paying attention means you should have a great understanding of the material without much studying. Office hours can be helpful when you don't understand some part. Plus he's adorable!

What I like about Rolf is his philosophy towards teaching. If you don't show up, it's your loss...unless you don't need extra instruction, which you'll prove to him in his two exams per semester. I just took PHIL 5 and didn't go to a single discussion section (the material was so DRY), but I'm really looking forward to PHIL 105 next year.

Rolf is a genius and an exceedingly good natured person.  The material is difficult, but what did you expect..its philosophy! He takes his time to help students when it's sought.  What you learn in this class can change your life! I recommend all of his classes!

Very easy and simple class. The lectures are a bit on the boring side but paying attention helps a lot with the test. He provides a study guide which if you do correctly, will help you ace the test. Good class.
He was really cool, lectures can be boring but you need to pay just enough attention that when you go over them to study for the exam you can remember what was what. Good teacher & very helpful.

Was a really good class. He was really clear, even though lect. material was dry. Exams are easy (just review past exams and study guide) and youll do fine. He curves his tests and only two tests a semster with no HW due. Rolf also really cares about his students and wants them to do well!
Tries to make the lectures engaging and ask for participation in return. Understanding when you are not able to meet deadlines if you bring it up to him.

he teaches and goes off topic a lot, attendance is through the polling app, labs are easy, it's easier teaching myself the material than what he goes over during class which is kind of confusing, occasional quizzes and exams, overall as long as you study on your own time and understand the material you should be fine, it's not too difficult
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: This was for Econ 05 not 01. Professor Hicks likes to go off topic a lot and the material covered during assignments and class lectures is sometimes not even on the quizzes/exams so you don't really know what to specifically study. Make sure to do the assigned readings on time as they are due before class starts.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The class overall was great, but you definitely have to be paying attention to the material that is covered in class in order to pass. If you're ever confused he is very helpful in office hours. He's a very caring and understanding professor but you have to put in effort into this class in order to pass.

Brutal.  Super unorganized, but ig can't blame him cause they x2 or x3 class size.  Often goes off-topic; in turn, we are forced to procrastinate on SUPER LONG assignments b/c we don't learn the material until 1 day before the hw is due.  Labs r fast so unless you take a vid u wont remember the insane material that the TAs also can't even finish.

This professor is the absolute worst! They are so careless and their teaching style is just awful. The concepts may be easy, but they make them incredibly difficult. And let's not forget about the ridiculous amount of curves on their tests because everyone just straight-up fails. Nobody has any clue what's going on in the class

Chill in the beginning but the worst teaching style on the planet.  He teaches one thing but tests on another, questions are literally designed to confuse you and you can't go back on tests.  Understanding graphs and charts and all quizzed on.  Designed to confuse you. TA's are your friends.  Go to class, attendance is major. TA Tiffany is amazing

W professor 
W class
W assignments 
W overall
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He went on many tangents and seemed to not have an agenda usually. If it wasn't for him requiring attendance, I would not have attended. You must study for exams. Don't buy the books, free pdfs on google. Exams were open note/internet, use that! His email responses are proudly slower than the pony express. If you enjoy econ, take it, if not, don't.

comment:
If you're a slow learner be aware that this class is not going to be for you. 
This class made me regret my major.
TA's are extremely helpful!!!!
Nice guy just too fast.
It will consume your time.

Heres the thing hes a good professor however his exams are just not exactly what on the homework. He curves the exams because theyre just too hard. In order to get a good great you HAVE to read the book heavily and study your notes. This class is not to be taken lightly or YOU WILL FAIL.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a legendary professor. He really wants you to learn and understand the concepts. You can tell he loves what he does. Very willing to help during office hours if you don't understand something. Also gives advice for life in general. Very inspirational. I would recommend taking him for both econ 10 and econ 100.

I adore Hicks. He is hilarious and genuinely cares about his students. That being said, he focuses on the big picture rather than the small details. His exams don't match the classwork or HW. I'm normally an A-student and find myself struggling more than I ever have. Love the man, but his teaching style doesn't suit my learning style.

This man makes school fun again. He gives a lot of real world and insightful examples for everything. While the notes look a little messy, they really aren't and are easy to understand if you FOLLOW ALONG. however, if you don't really pay attention, you WILL struggle. Also textbook and lectures are complimentary. not supplementary so do both.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Hicks is one of the best professors out there! Definitely pay attention during lectures and take good notes. Use time outside of class to practice and study and understand the application of the concepts. One of the most respectable and inspirational stories that you will ever hear

Professor Hicks is a great professor. If you're looking for an easy A, it's not for you. But if you're trying to actually learn the material, he's great. It's not difficult to get a good grade in the class. If you don't dedicate time to the class, that's your issue. Go to lecture, review his notes and go to office hours, if needed. He's funny too.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: He is a good professor. I like how he is fair. I struggle following his notes and he goes really quick. He will answer questions though so you can't be afraid. I would not take again unless I have to bc his exams to me are not like the hw and are harder. BUT I do recommend at least having him once during your time in merced. Online entertainment A+
Absolutely Phenomenal, talk about a professor whos already doing what he teaches. I took him for Entrepreneurial Innovation and he made remote learning enjoyable.

This class is tough. You have to work yourself to get a good grade and study hard this is coming from a top student. However, it honestly helps as you can learn a lot from him. He makes it fun and grabs your attention and if you're intimidated by him don't be because he is nice. OFFICE HOURS helps a ton so GO!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I took him for Spark, but that wasn't an option above. My favorite prof since I've been at Merced. He is very personable and uses real life examples to help you understand. He encourages students and makes so many jokes. There was one big group project and a couple papers to do. Pretty manageable. I'm taking another one of his classes in the fall.

Professor Hicks is a great professor. Having taken Econ 010, 100, and 126 I understood his teaching methods. Pay attention in class and be sure to practice the concepts otherwise it will be difficult to pass his exams. Always attend lectures and put in the work if you want to pass with a high grade
Professor Hicks is a great professor and he really cares about students learning the material. A few things he could work on is too respond to emails regarding students concerns.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Test heavy

comment: Professor Hicks is very unorganized this is seen in how he changes the syllabus every week. In addition, he is a very slow grader who takes forever to grade exams. For example, didn't get back exam til 4 days before the next exam. His notes are very hard to follow with zooming in and out every second. Lastly, he says homocide instead of homicide.
Hicks is a very engaging professor. His charisma made lectures easy to understand and seems to genuinely care for his students. He does curve so that helps.

Professor Hicks has a sense of entitlement as if we all owe him something for doing his job- in a mediocre manner a that. He frequently bashed the school for not catering to his wants which made him look bad. His notes are so disorganized and messy you might just give up, but dont give into that. Look for a different econ prof that can help you
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Hicks is a hilarious professor who uses anecdotes to help students relate to tough economic situations. His intention for his class is to make what you are learning useful in the real world which is what we are in college for kids.
Honestly would rather take the course at a jc if it was an option
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He is a good professor in my opinion. You need to study his notes often in order to pass his class. You need to take notes in class even though his notes are posted online. He shifts EVERYTHING! His project is a bit tough and a lot of homework. Final is cumulative. Take notes, study, and always have a calculator and clicker for pop quizzes!

Taking this class made me decide on my major. His lectures are interesting but he gives a lot of homework. His exams are long but he curves every single one including the final. Basically he curves everything so if you do the work you are guaranteed to pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Justin Hicks is an amazing professor. However, he is really sporadic and assumes we know stuff we don't know. Test and pop quiz questions are really difficult and wordy. Does not post notes online. Clicker and attendance is mandatory. Heavy group project and assignments. Adjusts grades fairly at the end though. STUDY, GO TO OFFICE HOURS!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Hicks might be my favorite professor i've ever taken. He really cares about his students and their success out of class. I would take him for every Econ class if possible. Go to class, do the homework, and you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Hicks is a very good professor and you will definitely leave his class with newfound knowledge. I actually took him for both Econ 10 & 100 (got an A for in both), and I don't regret taking either class. However, it is important to understand that although attendance is NOT mandatory, it helps tremendously. Also, be prepared for quizzes.

He's a really great professor. He knows how to keep the lectures entertaining. If you skip class, make sure you get the notes from someone else, you miss a lot of information when you skip. Always ask questions and ask him for help when you need it. Make study groups for tests and don't slack off!

He makes the class very entertaining and he is overall a great teacher. He does give pop quizzes. He is really clear in his explanations and he is always willing to reexplain problems if you don't understand. His tests are sometimes a bit tricky, make sure you practice a lot of problems. Don't skip too many lectures! You will fall behind.

I had a really difficult time in his microecon course because of his teaching style. I felt lost because he dabbed at so many different things at once that it wasn't until 3 lectures into a concept that I would realize what he was talking about. His tests and quizzes were tricky. Even if you study, prepare to think hard on each problem.

His intentions are good & he really wants you to learn the material. I had a difficult time in the course bc he is a very sporadic teacher. To get an A you must devote a lot of time to this class! Go to office hours to get a better explanation, he is helpful. Tests are tough, but the person in the class with the best grade sets the grading scale.
He is a very tough grader but one of the most helpful professors I've met. Really wants you to learn.

Suuuper easy class, I showed up to class sometimes but as long as you're in contact with your groupmates you really don't have to. Only thing that was kind of annoying was that he posted a ton of homework but it was all pretty easy.

Professor Derek Sollberger is amazing! He is very sweet and really cares about his students. We use a lot of Rstudio and do a lot of coding but he explains very well. Lectures include doing paper notes that are given in the beginning of class. I loved this class and would take again!

Derek is a pretty cool dude, he does seem sort of shy when you first try to connect with him. Most of your grading points will come from hw. In terms of the class the first half is pretty easy. Make sure to understand the hw because those questions will be on the exam. There will also be proofs in the class which can either be okay or pretty hard.

Class itself wasn't too bad. Derek focuses on theory which kinda sucks but tests are similar to homework so as long as you understand and know how to do the hw you should be fine for tests. Barely any curve (~2%). No discussion quizzes. Don't forget to do before lecture quizzes! Do well on the first test, it's the easiest and will carry your grade.

this class is confusing because lectures are mostly theory, but seldom does theory ever appear on tests. the problems given on tests are similar to the last problems of the hw's, and the test problems are no harder than those in a high school stats course, but the theory to understand is a mind boggler. derek teaches it well though.

Hes a good professor teaching wise but he doesnt prepare you well for test. No study guides, review sessions, barely had office hours. He just wants you to review the lecture slides & homework but mind you, you go through like 30 slides per lecture. Now study the past 9 lectures for your midterm. Youre screwed. The hw is easier than the tests.
Derek is amazing, funny,and overall is an effective teacher. sometimes his lectures get boring cause he implements too much coding segments, but he really is great

Love love love! I had heard a lot of good things about him for Math 015 but since I had already taken that I took him for Bio 184. This is an upper division class but he made it super easy! During class he basically does the coding and the students follow along. Few HW assignments, most of the coding for that can be found in the textbook. Easy A!!!

This class is about 50% exams, 25% homework. If you do all the homework on time, you get 100% in that. There is also a project that is about 25% of your grade, but if you turn everything in on time and complete all the work correctly, it is 100%. The exams arent hard, but if you do need to study. He has had only 1 kid fail in the last few years.

Had him for math 15 fall 17 and bio 18 fall 18. Derek is by FAR my most favorite professor! He makes the course material enjoyable and really cares for his students. The only things that were rather difficult were the quizzes and the semester long group project. Other than that ... easy A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: Awesome lecturer, made the class really fun, including the latest memes in slides. This was my first time working with code software and he made it super easy to understand. I got 100% on all assignments and a C on the final and ended the class with an A. He doesnt make you buy any textbooks or even a Scantron for the exam, do need a clicker app.

This is an easy class I don't think anyone can fail. Attend lectures because he will give clicker questions that will count towards your grade. He will drop one hw and one lab. Overall, I enjoyed his class very well.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is a bit difficult to understand with his accent, but the class overall is a breeze. The things you need to do to pass this class are to attend lecture to answer clicker questions and go to lab. I attended all lectures and labs and passed even though I failed the final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Participation matters

comment: Keeps everything short and straight to the point
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Clear grading criteria

comment: You can cheese through the semester but the final is always gonna be the toughest part and the deciding factor for your grade. Just review homework and labs.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Very intelligent; he understands what he is doing! Prof. Sollberger tries to ensure that you understand the material. He doesn't expect you to memorize all of the statistical formulas, but does expect you to understand the concept (as expected!). Great professor  easy class  easy pass!
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Derek is hilarious, I had him for Math 15 (Stats, yuck.) I suck at math so I can't attest to his teaching ability, but he did make lectures somewhat enjoyable. The only con I have is that the final seemed to be weighted pretty heavily, I had a steady A- all semester and when the final came I bombed it and ended the semester with a C+.

Derek was an awesome instructor for Math 15. Show up to lectures and take notes and you'll be fine. He also uploads them to cat courses incase you miss. All the homework is online and you have unlimited attempts to pass. Labs provide clear instructions, but you can always ask for clarification. Super easy A!

His class is hella easy. If you go to lecture and lab and ask for clarification then you're fine. He is funny in a cute way and he's super chill. All the homework is online, but the difficulty depends on the material of the lecture.

Derek is an awesome professor. His lectures sometimes takes a bit more of understanding. If you pay attention, and do your homework assignments you will be all set for the semester. His office hours are long so failing to understand something isn't a problem. His explanations are short but detailed. Lectures have memes. A lot of easy HW. No Txtbook
Loved this class. Easy A so long as you show up and do the homework and labs. Pay attention though, there is no textbook to fall back on.

His lectures are very confusing, he doesn't clarify things and expects you to know everything.  When asking him a question about lab or homework problems his responses are really short and it doesn't even answer your question.  But it's an easy A class, just do the homework and lab.
Pay attention and you will pass
He is very helpful, especially when students encounter problems with assignments.

I took AP Calc in high school and did not understand anything. Taking it from Derek was crystal clear explanations. Homework is online. Quizzes are in discussions, do the worksheets because some problems end up on midterms. A's on his test are possible just study! The final is bad but he makes up for it. Best math teacher I had so far

Derek is an excellent prof, but in lectures he teaches you 2+24, but come the exams its a whole different thing. Thus making you have to go over your notes, get a clear grasp on the concept and work through all the worksheets. Homework is easy, there's plenty of it online, and its very good practice for midterms. The final is monstrous.

I had him for Math 11 in the fall semester. Derek's lectures are clear and homework is clear-cut. If you go to class regularly, it isn't too hard to pass. Midterms and quizzes were fair but his final was extremely difficult and on a whole other level.

Derek Sollberger was a funny and one of my more favorite professors in UC Merced. He is witty and knows some decently current social mediums. His test were relatively easy. However the midterms get progressively harder and the final was almost a nightmare even for my fellow math wizards. Still awesome professor would take again. *clap *clap *clap

He's a great professor (lectures are clear) but his examples in class do not exactly match the level of difficulty on his exams. To pass you should expect to go to office hours every week if you do not understand a concept. Stay on top of it because it's really easy to fall behind since his tests are hard. expect a quiz & HW assignment per week.

GO TO CLASS. I love the way he teaches, he color codes every thing and follows his syllabus. Work hard and ask him for help if you have any questions. I passed by practicing his examples, learning the techniques, and going over dicussion work sheets. Exams are not too bad, just don't cram.

derek is a very nice prof.He is quite and not so amicable but will help if asked.I took his math-10 class at merced college.He is easy on test,didn't give any homework.If you need that class to fill a pre-req,I would suggest him

Love this professor!! Way better than my last one. Explains everything clearly and goes through enough examples just so everyone fully understands the material. I'm really starting to enjoy math more because of Sollberger :)

Kinda awkward guy at first but he is a very helpful instructor and he does have a sarcastic sense of humor. Always make sure to go to discussion because he does count your attendance towards participation. Midterms are fairly easy as long as you do all your aleks! (online part of the class)

I had a different TA when I took math 23. Even though Derek's discussion was at 8 am, I still went b/c I really needed to learn the material well and he is a good teacher! He drew and explained 3D concepts really nicely. I really appreciate how willing he is to help the students.
Very good TA who cares about his students and their ability to learn the material.

Unlike other teachers Derek actually shows you clear and methodological examples on how to solve problems. Not so much theory more just practice. He will drop a random joke once a while making you laugh only because it's so unexpected. Overall, if you know how to integrate and can learn the different techniques it's an easy A

Ms. Ayik is a great professor and I would take a class under her again. The only real thing I thought was weird was the awkward smiling at students. Her feedback, while harsh, is well constructed and she comes from a place of thought and care which isn't a given in most professors. She offered multiple times to redo assignments, which was amazing.
This professor is not a good one. When she smiles it's sort of unsettling since she smiles when it isn't necessary and makes it seem creepy.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: DO not take this course. The professor is more strict than Kim Jong un with North Korea.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: She is not a bad professor just very strict in what she wants. She is very critical in her feedback (she does not hold back) straight up told me to "try harder". Even though my writing improved drastically I wouldn't take her again. If you want a challenge go ahead...

Do not take this course if you are not able to handle criticism. Going into office hours will be something you will need to be doing regularly. As Ms. Ayik only enjoys papers she writes. I have went in multiple times and felt like crying every time because of how harsh, racist, and degrading she treated me.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She has so many restrictions on how to write papers that are hard to keep track of. She's also insane about attendance and tardies. Also started to get kinda rude later in the year.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Seeing the reviews that are recent baffles me. During the beginning of my course, she seemed understanding and very organized, props to her but down the line she declined in attitude. Having outburst of anger if we didn't understand the concepts. Even ending class an hour early due to her inability to concentrate due to "typing" during her lectures
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Her teaching made a lasting impact on me. Inside and outside the classroom, she was there when I felt like giving up easily. It really meant a lot. Some may she is strict. But she truly does care about you as a person and as a writer. As long as you turn in assignments on time, attend class, and do the readings, you should enjoy her class! :)

She can seem intimidating at first (strict deadlines and attendance) but as long as you attend class (if you have to miss, let her know), do the readings, turn in assignments on time, and participate in class, you should be fine. The few times I had to miss class, she was very accommodating and did her best to make sure I did not fall behind.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Hi, i read rate my professor but I still decided to go with her, she is not as tough as everyone puts it. As long as you have time to finish the assignments you should be fun. Enjoy
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She does not take other people's feelings into consideration and told me to reconsider college because I did not do well on a rough draft of a paper. She said, "You might want to really think about whether or not you are committed to college," and offered me other career options that SHE thought were suitable for me based on one rough draft.

HOLDS A SUPER HIGH STRICT STANDARD, but will give you the chance to boost your grade if you come to office hours religiously and make a clear point that you will put in the work to pass the class. Hardest class I've ever taken. Take her class, and your writing will improve long term -- at the cost of your mental health from so much material.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: Well Ms. Ayik is a good teacher but I strongly believe that her class would only benefit people that are majoring in writing. She's a great professor for writing but really strict on the structure of her writing, she'll make you redo your paper. However, I did learn how to properly write academically and improved on my writing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: She is the type of professor that goes straight to the point. She is a tough grader and you must pass all essays in order to pass her class but she will work with you to improve your writing skills and gives excellent feedback. This class isn't an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Toughest professor by far. A lot of assignments. There are three essays which I failed (MUST PASS ALL 3). Although she gave me the chance to get a passing score she was a bit rude and made me feel terrible about my work. She did give me good feedback which I do admit, did improved my writing. If you want a challenge, take a class with Ms. Ayik.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: As English being my second language, she helped me improve my writing skills. The concepts I learned in her class helped me excel the personal statement section of the school I applied to. She gives great feedback & wants her students to succeed in & out of class. If you explain your difficulties to her, she is very understanding, & works with you.

Had a very early class with her. Be ready for her to call you out in front of the whole class if you look even slightly tired. Classes are absolutely mandatory. She is not clear in her grading. Tried my hardest to get an A, but she seemed to fight me on my grade the whole semester. She knows her stuff, but she's a horrible instructor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I had to take her class online due to the pandemic. She isnt really a tough grader because she makes everything clear. Ms. Ayik gave us opportunities to gain back the points we missed if it was below a passing grade. Overall she was an amazing professor and my writing improved a lot. The essays werent difficult and were honestly interesting!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: WORST TEACHER EVER. DO NOT RECOMMEND. HARD GRADER, MAKES YOU REWRITE ESSAYS UNTIL YOU GET IT RIGHT her way. Seriously if you can avoid taking classes with her . PLEASE DO SO! If I could give her a 0 I would.

DO NOT take this professor unless you literally have NO other option. Her tone is demeaning, daunting, and unwelcoming. Hands down never felt so degraded by another professor in my 3 years as an undergrad. Half the class dropped after she said they wouldn't pass. She told me I had no chance at an A during a meeting HALF way through the semester.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: This class was absolutely awful. She is a rude woman and uses her office hours to talk down to you. I went in to her office hours with a positive attitude multiple times and every time I left I felt horrible about myself. Not to mention that after the course was complete she sent me a nasty email. I never received a grade high than a C- on essays.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I almost failed her class for not going to office hours to get help on my essays. I went a day before Essay 2 was due and she wanted to drop me. She gave me another chance and gave me a couple of extensions on various assignments and I pulled my grade up from a D+ to a B. She's great if you seek help and do your work. Go to class and participate!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Ms. Ayik is a very hard-to-please professor. She only expect the best of you and if you are not willing to do so. Drop the class. She is not up for games, and she will not consider playing with the class funny. Take her seriously and she will do the same for you. Many say she is mean, but in reality she is very caring if you get to know her.
Do yourself a favor, just don't take her class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Horrible teacher! I cant stress this enough. She talks down to you and holds her students to unrealistic standards. DO NOT TAKE HER!!! super rude and just an all around awful person.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Don't take this class, just do not take this class.

I usually enjoy my writing classes but not hers. This was the most difficult writing class I have ever taken and it really didn't need to be. Ayik is very weird and hard to please. Your ideas are not allowed in this class and all her writing topics are boring. I wish I would've read the reviews before taking her class:(

She's LOVES talking down to students and act like everyone is completely incompetent. She can also be really passive aggressive sometimes, which is super unprofessional. Also, don't expect to write about anything that interests you because she'll just shut it down and give you a topic instead. Do yourself a favor and don't take her class!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is picky, no one ever got on A on an essay in my class set. She is hard core on grading. NEVER taking her ever again, lesson learned. Tends to make individuals feel uncomfortable, will talk you down. Missed class maybe twice with valid excuses, she made a big deal about it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Super hard grader. She expects you to write professionally and always understand what she wants. During office hours, she does not provide that much help, but rather confuses you even more. She wants everything to be perfect. Disliked her class.

Ayik is a VERY tough grader. She is by far the most challenging writing professor I have ever encountered. When assigning essays, she does not explain the instructions well. Most of the time, I was left confused. However, she is very helpful in her office hours. She will help you and give you some ideas, but you must WORK FOR IT or you wont pass.

I took her and she was a really hard and tough grader yet I went to go get help and she taught me how to succeed. She helped me improve my writing and for that I'm grateful but she is a tough teacher be ready to work HARD but in the end it'll be worth it.

I actually liked Ms. Ayik She's pretty upbeat which I suppose could be somewhat annoying. She is very friendly and happy. She teaches you to be more professional as well. She is also understanding... I turned in 2 out of 4 essays late. As far as direct instruction and teaching, there was a few lessons... but we did a lot of readings.

Do yourself a favor, do not take her class. She is a horrible teacher. She talks down to students. She grades her writing 001 class harder than some teachers grade their writing 010 class. She doesn't teach much, but expects these over complicated crazy assignments perfect. She doesn't explain the grade you got on the crops description, bias grader

Expect a phone call to verify your illness when you skip class if you don't send her an email and a doctor's note. Expect to be put on the spot if your readings aren't done. Expect angry/nagging emails. Expect another mom if you register with her.
She was really nice. She wanted to help everyone. If you ask, she sometimes extend the due dates (or receive late works).

I really hate this teacher. She expects the students to be expertwriters when she isnt an expert herself. She says that our opinions mean nothing because we students dont have credibility, but who is she to say anything? Kara Ayik is just a horrible teacher in my opinion and she doesnt help the student succeed. DO NOT REGISTER WITH HER!

great professor! very organized class - lectures and labs go hand-in-hand, so if you keep up with the classwork you'll do great. assigns reading and questions (a handful) for each class - do these and you'll see how helpful his lectures are. nice guy who wants to help you - go to office hours, you'll be glad you did.
Great professor, very passionate about the subject and always willing to help you if you attend office hours. Do the homeworks at the end of the chapter for pratice.

It was a tough class, but Prof. Vickery knew exactly how to explain even the hardest topics in a way that we could understand. His lectures are interesting & go way beyond teaching you how to do problems - he really makes the concepts clear so that you can "think outside the box." I really feel like now I understand a lot about how molecules behave

Vickery is a great professor who can keep a class full of students entertained. Through his class, I learned quite a lot about chemistry and would definitely take his class again. He is a fun and enthusiastic professor that won't have you falling asleep. His tests are also very fair!
Just a typical great guy, really helps to diagnose a problem in the lecture and makes sure that every student understands him before moving on. Truly an honor to have him as a prof.
Inspiring professor. His class made me want to switch my major to chem. Either way, I definitely recommend him and hope I get him for the next chem class.

he was great - really knows his stuff. i learned so much and liked how class and lab were linked so closely. great lectures - i read the book but got A LOT more out of class. he was really enthusiastic abut chem and was always available for help even outside of office hours. good guy - wo his help i wouldn't have passed

Great professor. Really makes you interested in the material and the course. His curving saved my life. Labs are interesting with a lab report and a quiz every section unless noted. Gives handouts for the lectures which makes taking notes easy and accessible. Will give real life scenarios to make the information click. Glad I had him! :)

at first i was scared to take this class but he made it really interesting and helped me keep up. go to office hours - even though they are packed it will be worth the wait to get help. really great professor!
Great Professor!

Very passionate about the subject and is an organized prof. You have to keep up with the work if you want to get the most out of the class. I liked how instead of only showing us how to do problems, he also showed us the logic and reasoning behind all of the important ideas. He really made the material come to life

I've had better chem professors... He does not explain the main points of the course very well such as the calculations and always goes off topic into something irrelevant about an experiment. As far as tests goes, they were fair.

He explains everything clearly. He teaches the class very direct and sometimes hands on. Maybe its the subject or his voice but sometimes I doze off. His midterms are the homework problems. His final is the ACS and is not made by him. He curves on each category individually (final, hmwk, midterm) rather than the class as a whole.

Professor vickery is an awesome teacher. He goes beyond in explaining the topics of chemistry starting from a microscopic level to a more broader understand of chemistry. He inspired me with it. THIS is not an easy class thought, u need to go to lecture, read the book before class and go to office hours to get a good grade, wish I could write more
Dude is the coolest professor at this campus. Loves the subject, keeps you interested, explains his material very thoroughly.
tough class, good professor
Awesome professor! Really knows his stuff! Makes everything super interesting, and holds lots of OH. Super approachable!

Professor Vickery is very enthusiastic about chemistry and it shows. His lectures are captivating and he's very knowledgeable. He also regularly took the time to *thoroughly* answer our questions and i always felt like i could go to him for help. He connected the course material to new-developments in science which made it more interesting to learn
His ACS final is ridiculously hard. He makes the easiest topics seem difficult. Very confusing. Lectures about unnecessary experiments.
Lectures are interesting and fast-paced. He is helpful and eager to clarify any confusions but the amount of students that seek his help often leaves him with not enough time to attend to everyone.

Very enthusiastic, passionate professor who did A LOT to help us learn. He's a dynamic lecturer and the class was highly organized which made it easy to follow along. Exams are challenging, but if you study you'll do fine - no surprises. Quizzes are based on the homework, so make sure you do ALL the assigned problems. Labs were actually pretty cool

He showed interest in the subject, but was not a clear lecturer. I walked away from class confused at what topic we went over, very confusing. Not great at explaining things clearly. Really nice though.

VERY challenging class, but dr. vickery is the best prof i've had. go to his office hours - he will do all he can to help you. lectures are interesting and help you master the material. you'll get a deep sense of how atoms/molecules behave. my brother is taking chem at UC Davis and i was able to tutor him b/c of this class. definitely recommended
One of the best chem professors I have had. He really knows how to get students interested in chemistry. The homework can add up, but other than that, quizzes are exactly like the homework.

No way. Doc V is all business and his lectures really help you understand chem (not just the easy stuff, either). He posts handouts that help you focus on lecture and has lots of office hours to help with homework or lab. Although I'm not a chem major (bioengineering) I can definitely say he's a great chem prof

this class is a ton of work, but what esle do you expect when you take chem at a university. his lectures are helpful and to the point, but you've got to put your time in with the homework problems and labs. go to his office hours when you're stuck b/c he's super helpful and knows his stuff
He has alot to work on, he tries to hard to be cool than to actually teach his classes.
This professor knows his stuff and showed the interesting side of chem. Demos made lecture come to life. Highly recommended.
Very helpful instructor! Read the notes from lecture and do every assigned homework problems  and you will be fine :)

chem is hella hard but he wants you to succeed. holds lots of office hours. after we bombed the first test he volunteered to run friday review sessions which were super helpful. lectures keep you on your toes. pay attention in class, do the assigned problems and you'll be fine
This professor really cares about his students, and if you give him the chance-by attending lecture and his office hours-he will teach you what you need to know.

Really fun and great teacher, but tends to go to in depth during lecture for things you dont need to know. The book assigned is also in depth and the questions assigned are way harder then the midterms. Their are only 2 midterms, the questions are easy if you practice the hw, and the final is easy as well, its made by the ACS. Great teacher overall

Very fun professor, keeps things interesting. Attendance not mandatory, but the lectures are not posted nor give key information so attendance IS crucial. Be prepared for a good laugh with his quirky attitude.
Love this prof. The class is tough but his lectures are interesting and definitely help you get it. I thought I would hate the class but it's actually my favorite this term!

David Jennings is a brilliant man and an incredibly inspiring professor. I'm glad I get to take classes from someone I can assuredly aspire to be like. His teaching style, methodology, and material is always perfectly attuned, be it because of his strengths, or just that he is made for teaching. while philosophy is not for everyone, he makes it so.
Very strict and not very accommodating at all. He gives minimal feedback and isn't super clear with what he wants.

David Jennings is an inspiring professor to be taught by. He prioritizes the idea of philosophical thinking, rumination, and individuality embodied within the ideas reflected in the course. He is the epitome of a philosophy professor. Would highly recommend taking his class if you enjoy philosophy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Jennings gives the worst feedback one can imagine. And when you ask him oh well what did you mean by this he will respond with something snarky like "well what do you think" like, boy I do not know that's why I'm asking. His feedback consists of comments such as awk, not quite rephrase, reword, and sounds like class notes. He does not care for you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I had him for Phil 03 during COVID and he was great at remote teaching. He would ask us if we needed more time on slides and wanted to make sure everyone was clear on the subject. His quizzes were hard, they were multiple-answer multiple choice questions.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Jennings is really nice and he does a nice job at explaining things in lecture so you can really understand. However, the quizzes are still fairly difficult and you definitely need to know the information if you plan on passing. (taken during covid)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Jennings is one of the best professors UC Merced has right now. He will not move on unless every student understands what is he teaching. He literally changed the definition of lectures, with him lectures are fun and interesting and worth your time. If you pay attention and attend lectures youll not regret it and you'll pass.

This professor will change your life. He's the reason I added philosophy as a minor. He is one of the best professors there is. He's understanding and will not move on until every single student gets the concept. He's a gem. The classes he teaches are also very interesting and he presents the material in a way that will make you think differently.

Jennings is an awesome Professor. Hes nice, understanding, and really fair. His lectures are all in person only, no slides, so you have to go to lecture if you expect to pass his class. You can pass just by going to lecture because hes really good at explaining tough material in a way thats easy to understand. Overall id take him again
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Respected

comment: Professor Jennings is a great teacher, he really cares about his students and will set aside time to ask questions and provide clarification if necessary. He really wants everyone to do well, but you will need to attend class if you want to pass, and make sure you read your textbooks- thats where most of the test material comes from.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Take notes on everything. The tests are pretty long and require alot of writing in a short amount of time. You will need to study. You will read alot of essays and need to know alot about them off the top of your head. Flashcards help tons. If you want to pass, you need to go to lectures. Lectures are also quite long. Tough class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great professor, hard class. Gotta work for that grade!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: go to class, and keep up with the readings. his class was very clear that the readings made up the entirety of the few assignments given. Jennings is a very approachable person and always willing to go out of his way to help his students learn.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: very interesting and he is very nice you don't need to read to understand what is going on in his class because he explains everything but you probably should just because the quizzes ask you to remember where the quote is from and if you read it you can probably get it but it would be a lot easier if you just read 2 papers 2 quizzes 1final

He gives students time to ask questions in class, which is incredibly helpful. He is SUPER good at explaining concepts and what exactly he looks for in papers or tests. He grades upon quality of the work, instead of effort. He is accessible outside class, but he prefers office hours than emails.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: I took a lower division with him and then this class. His grading style was harder, of course. But it is very hard to understand what he requires to get a good grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Jennings was awesome. He was nice, respectable, and funny. He made lectures very interesting, which is good because attendance is crucial to pass the class. The readings are difficult, but if you pay close attention in lecture you will be okay.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He is very nice and understanding and will help you as much as you can. His class however is very difficult. Dont read, or take notes? YOU WILL NOT PASS. listen and take good notes to study later. he has quizzes which rely on your reading memorization where youre asked to tell who the reader of the passage is and what it means and connects to class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
