comment: He's one of my favorite professors I've had at UCM. Very passionate about what he does. Be prepared to read, he reads most of the material in class an goes in depth. He will randomly call on you which forces you to pay attention. And is quite the eye candy. I am already registered to take another one of his classes next semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: The concepts of the class are interesting but the Quizzes (Exams) and the Final are weighed a lot on memorization. Professor Jennings is available outside of class often, and it's a good tool to use otherwise attendance is CRUCIAL. Essays are quite easy and he recaps every class which is helpful but it's not an easy class if you aren't reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Overall professor Jennings is a great professor, I would recommend going to all of his lectures, do the readings and make flash cards. If you need feedback for a paper do not hesitate to go into his office hours, he goes above and beyond in helping his students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: His midterms are literally memorization. He asks you to remember a specific quote, where its from and who said it. Other than that, he's a decent lecturer.
Great person and cares for students individually, makes lectures fun and gives examples to make sense of the reading. Overall great class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Directions for tests and essays  are always extremely clear. Just listen and you'll pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Jennings is probably the best professors at UCM. He is very understanding and wishes the best for his students. His lectures are always entertaining and you'll never be bored. His views and explanations are very easy to understand. Just pay attention in class and jot down the questions he asks during lectures and you'll pass the course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Amazing professor, probably one of UCM's finest! He is very understanding and is always willing to help. I plan to minor in philosophy because he makes the material super interesting. Readings are simple, but in lecture, he'll take the time to make sure students understand them. His papers are simple, and he is prepared to help you if you ask.

Jennings class was amazing for me. The topics he chose to go over and read were relatable and interesting. He explains everything nicely. He lectures are almost everything you need to know. You should read the papers but skimming wont hurt. He takes attendance and it really helps to go to class. His papers are easy. He likes to review and it helps.

Jennings is a really incredible lecturer. He ensures his students get the most out of his classes by making sure everyone participates. He keeps philosophy interesting to those who may not ordinarly be interested in the topics.

David is a really good professor. Everything that you need to know for the exams, he will provide in his lectures. He gives you  a really helpful study guide for the exams and as long as you understand everything on that study guide, you're pretty much guaranteed an A. His lectures are sort of boring but it was an interesting class.

I love David! He always goes over the main ideas that need to be covered. He points out important passages that are essential to passing his quizzes! Show up to class because you are going to need those notes to go over the readings since they are sometimes hard to decipher. Lectures were always interesting & sometimes funny! Plus he's attractive!
Pretty easy. Just need to read and study for  the test.
Interesting, to the point lectures and you must take good notes but he makes the material interesting.

I loved this professor! While the material was dull to read and difficult to understand, his lectures helped you understand everything.  I took him over summer, and he took the time to learn everyone's name and make sure everyone understood a topic before moving on. He is very enthusiastic about the subject and gives understandable examples.

If he taught every philosophy class he'd be the teacher I'd take. He loves philosophy and he's beyond willing to share that. If you read and go to class you'll definitely pass. His lectures are fun and interesting. Hes willing to help clarify if you need it and his office hours are really helpful. Easily one of the best professors.

Took her Calc Based Physics 2 class that was online. The only feedback in this class was in her notes after she graded assignments and unfortunately she didn't do that until the class was over. My first week assignments weren't graded until finals week and the rest after I took the final. She provided as little feedback as possible and was no help.

I would say that the professor is nice and she wants you to learn but some of her teaching methods didn't really work with me and I found that I had to learn a lot of the concepts on my own or in discussion and lab. I think that the most helpful thing to pass would be understanding the labs and doing the discussion worksheets.

Attend lectures. Besides her taking attendance, Menke is a good lecturer and has in-class physics demonstrations of the subject, which helps a lot to gain intuition. Tests are pretty easy, generally multiple choice. Also take advantage of office hours.

I heard Menke isnt that bad so I didnt mind having her as my professor.Then it hit me why she should only be a physics teacher and not for my NSED class. Everything was going good until she didnt want to grade assignments. Took her 3 months to grade 5 assignments that were just 2 questions we had to answer. Good luck if you have her for this class.

Really great professor, taught well but was very helpful too. She would answer questions and made class about as enjoyable as a physics class can be. She's just one of those professors that seems like a real person, and you can tell she cares and isn't just here for a job, one of the my favorite professors I've had here.

Only thing I didnt love was tophat, the site she uses for participation questions. She closes submissions for questions very fast. For whatever reason my computer takes forever to load questions. Dont have this issue with iclicker on the other side of the school. But between my slow computer and my slow math, I missed a lot of participation points.

Prof. Menke was funny, caring, and a great professor. She was there every day on time and made an initiative to make sure the students were learning. I would take her class again and if there wasn't a schedule conflict with her PHYS 09 class then I would take that class as well.

Prof. Menke is such a sweet and caring person I really love that about her. She definitely cares about her students and is willing to help during office hours. Although I gave her a rating of 3 because her lecture could be a bit confusing, sometimes it feels like she is moving through the notes way too fast to comprehend what we just learned.
She is very caring and office hours is very helpful because she will work with you. I would defiantly take this professor again if I could.
Lab protocols (written by her) are very ambiguous and of no help

Menke is a solid lecturer and her personality makes the lectures much more enjoyable. Her office hours are really helpful and she cares to remember students names and faces, which is a plus. I had her for physics 8 and 9, the.2 are not too difficult but not a breeze so you definitely will need to do your homework and pay attention in class.

I enjoy professor Menke as a person, but as a professor less so. I usually do not have trouble understanding concepts and application, but this class I did. The material was not taught well in my opinion and I wish she provided more practice, maybe compiling problems that address the testing material. Not a bad professor, not my style of learning.

Easy tests. But she clearly lacks an understanding of class, lectures were from the textbook, had a hard time answering questions, could not explain things at all, her derivations came from the textbook and while the textbook explains why they are doing what they are, she never did. Leaving us with many holes in our understanding. Good for Phys 8,9
One of the best professors I've ever had, so far. Physics is often taught in a boring manner, but that is not the case here. It was enjoyable and a good learning experience.

There are a lot of things graded for her class, however, as long as you put effort you should be able to do well. She is very helpful if you go to her office hours and gives you chocolate. There are not a lot of examples done during lecture but she puts up her own work on her slides when you study. There are homework notebooks each week.

Dr. Menke is a great professor. Sometimes may not be too clear  but going to her office hours really helped. 3 midterms and before every midterm, exam prep problems are posted to work out and a notecard is allowed. Study the clicker questions because a lot of them are on the exams & final. Midterms are 12 MC w/ 1 short answer question.

Dr. Menke is one of, if not the best Physics teacher at UCM. I had her for Honors Physics 9 and then Physics 10 in back-to-back semesters, and while the workload can be stressful at times, my advice would be a trip to her Office hrs. She'll provide clear explanations and chocolate! Her tests are toughs because she wants you to earn your grade.

Professor Menkie was by far my favorite professor so far at UCM, although her lectures could be confusing sometimes, she was always there for the students during office hours. I was dreading taking physics 10 but she made it a great experience. Would recommend!

She's an awesome professor that actually teaches well at this school. She is understanding, and will meet you at a personal level. Of course, the classes she teachers are NOT easy, but by having her as a teacher, passing the class almost completely inevitable.
Very unclear. Average midterm scores were below 70%
GOOD LUCK! exam is basically based on masteringphysics
Physics09 was especially difficult, but she was able to clear many questions I had. Office Hours was definitely helpful

she reminds me way too much of myself, and if thats the case she'll be reading this at some point in the future lol. she is an amazing woman, i was just a bit too lazy (and high) to pass the class. see you next semester

She completely understands that physics is very difficult. Although she cannot change the difficulty of physics, she does cater to students so that they can get credit for what they do learn. She is a fantastic teacher who is fair and enthusiastic.

I hear you either love this professor or you 'dislike' her. I''m one of the few that falls in between. She was very intimidating to me but I have heard that she is a really nice person, lectures weren't that helpful at all but she tries. just read the book and google the crab out of everything and youll be fine.
Sexy energetic has a passion for physics, very helpful but difficult class
She's a very caring, down to earth teacher. She is very enthusiastic about her class.

Dr. Menke does a good job with the first half of this class considering how difficult the material is to grasp. The second half of the class was extremely fun and much less challenging. Some of the online homework was tedious, but she will work with you on it if you need help.

Dr. Menke is a very caring and down-to-earth professor. She is willing to work with you to help solve problems. I didn't use the book at all, just her lecture slides and the discussion problems. She makes physics fun and very doable.

ISBN: 9780321737007  She gives a lot of work, and she expects you to do all of it. Curves at the end of semester. Could really work on clarity in class, looking at the detailed examples make more sense. High expectations on level of understanding, but she has interesting demonstrations. Attendance not mandatory, but she gives quizzes sometimes.
She is a very smart woman on physics, but she is not smart on teaching.

if you need 0.01% more to get an A- instead of B+, you will get a B+. Her tests are difficult and she will not curve it. The online assignments are long, the website is just crazy and I have no idea why she set due dates on friday nights. You can get an A in the class without attending the lectures, they are not that helpful.

Extremely motivated about the material. Had no previous interest but between demos, examples, etc actually learned to like it. Homework is done online, which is interactive. It definitely helps. Overall a very fair class, but you will earn your grade.

I LOVED Professor Hambley. I had him for Math005 and couldn't have asked for a better teacher for a foundational math class. He explained things well and gave many examples. As long as you pay attention and do the worksheets the tests will be very easy. Go to office hours! I went at least twice a week and it's a big reason I was able to do so well.

The course has online modules due every few weeks, then in class content with follows sets of worksheets then quizzes/tests. He does a great job of making the in-class content clear and if you don't understand he will absolutely work with you. The online modules can stack up and be hefty, that is the only issue with the course.

I think, He needs to go home because, he does not help with the worksheet at hand and when ask certain questions in class, Professor Hambley tends to call you out and embarrss you in the middle of the class. I feel that hambley is not a good teacher and deserves his job to be taken, his office hours are a waste of time, he spends it smiling at you.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: It is important to try learning the lessons given through the website for homework. It is a lot of lessons that you need to complete within a given amount of days but if your able to keep up and learn from it then the quizzes, tests and exams will be a breeze. He helps you understand the material given and answers any question given.

Clear lectures to understand math concepts. Really nice professor and accessible when asking for help. Attending class is important to pass the class.ALEKS is the thing that everyone gets annoyed and hates for being time-consuming. Lots of studying for exams and quizzes. But generally the exams/quizzes are short and they're based on the worksheets.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Prof. Hambley is an outstanding instructor. As someone who heavily dislikes Math, Prof. Hambley made the material extremely easy to learn. He takes a few topics from ALEKS, puts them into a worksheet, from the worksheet he then takes a select few and creates the exams which allows for easy studying. He is also more than willing to help when asked!

Really nice professor who really cares about his students. I had no struggles with his lessons and the quizzes were super easy. Although I would say to stay on top of you ALEKS assignments as they honestly to make a difference at the end of the semester with your grade.
Great professor, very understanding and gives clear instructions of expectations. All tests are based on worksheets and not difficult

By definition, an instructor "is the title for an individual responsible for teaching students in a particular subject area." This professor was no help whatsoever. Assignments and quizzes were given with little to no aid on how to improve or learn.

Cares about his students a lot, he tries to remember things about individual students and the class overall to have conversation. You can tell he really likes his job and it makes the hard work worth it. (also a very talented actor!)

You never meet him because theres no lectures for this class. Everything is taught through ALEKS platform. Even though the assignments on ALEKS are time consuming, it's good practice. The assignments are well organized and the quizzes are exactly like the worksheets. He also posts videos on how to do certain problems if you're confused. Great class
Honestly such an easy class and a great professor. He memorized everyones name and he really made an effort. 10/10 would recommend. Everything was clear and the best professor I could have asked for.
He is a good professor. Aleks is the platform used to do our weekly homework which can be a workload since it is very time-consuming but other than that his class is very well organized.

Professor Hambley is a good math coordinator but honestly you never really meet him. All of his assignments and most exams were online through ALEKS, however all of his teachings are on Canvas. He's very good at explaining topics and is also very thorough, however I found in most situations I needed help, I'd ask the TA. Still, he's very good.

Professor Hambley really cares about his students and tries to learn everybody's names. Make sure you pay attention because he goes through topics fast sometimes. There is quizzes every week but if you do the worksheets, you should be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: The majority of the homework (and learning) is done on ALEKS. A lot of people hate it, but it's not that bad. Do ALEKS practice tests before midterms, the content is verbatim. For quizzes, look over worksheets and make sure you thoroughly understand his videos. The videos cover quiz expectations and are easy and simple to grasp concepts.

I had his class for math 005 and overall hes a good professor. He makes sure that everyone knows how to solve the problem and ask if we have any questions. Also to add is that he will talk a lot during the discussion and it might be a bit boring sometimes.

Great professor! Super accessible and you can tell he loves teaching. He made the topics very easy to understand. The class consisted of Aleks and quizzes. The quizzes were only 2 questions and were always reviewed beforehand in class and based on the worksheets so review them! He is super sweet and just wants to help you so take advantage of it!!

Usually, the work is on ALEKS which is a course online. If you want to study for midterms I advised to print out the ALEKS practice problems and work on it helps a lot. Need to come to class because there are quizzes on what you learned last class. In the end of class, there are exit tickets which are extra points that can help you raise your quiz.

Honestly he is a great guy and is very knowledgeable in the subject. My only advice is that if youre not the best at math, take any other T.A. because they will be much easier graders. He doesnt give you any points unless your answer is absolutely perfect, others give out points for work and such.

Professor Hambley is extremely knowledgable in his field. The course is incredibly organized and straightforward. There's a lot of homework, but there's no scheduled lectures. (In class: ?s, Quiz, Lecture, Worksheet) Don't be afraid to ask questions, he wants to help and learn names. Take advantage of the study guides for the exams. Study groups!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Ask questions, do notes

I really enjoyed taking this course. There are weekly quizzes, but if you do the worksheets and understand them then you will be fine. He goes over questions that you have before you take the quiz. He explains the material very well.  He will go around class and ask if you need help. He's very friendly!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Hambley is a really nice professor for the math 5 discussions. He will do his best to explain the topics just before the quiz, so it is easy to pass them if you pay attention. He also helps a lot during his clinic hours. Overall this professor is really friendly and kind, you won't regret taking him.

Hambley was an alright professor. He knows the subject, but he wasn't able to explain a lot of problems in depth during class because "we don't have enough time." If you've taken pre-calc before then you should be fine, but if not then be prepared to depend A LOT on ALEKS.
Hambley was helpful. One of my favorite math professors. Of course Math 05 was super easy, he went through each topic thoroughly. I enjoyed it and made me love math even more!

The class can be a bit difficult but he is very helpful although the class is boring, it was easy to pass my TA did not help at all so I went to his office hours and he was glad to help, very nice professor.
He's a nice guy but incredibly boring. Class is super easy and he's pretty available to students.
He is so slow and monotonic.  He is clear, just really, really boring..
Great professor. I think he's very handsome for his age and very clear at conveying information
Very helpful, provides his students with study guides  -- something not all Math 5 teachers do.  Lenient grader.  Just go to class, put in the work outside of class and you'll be good.
Prof Hambley is a real easy going fella. Just keeping up attendence is challenging.
He is a really nice teacher. He always tries to stay on schedule and posts sample quizzes and midterms to help you study. I would recommend him for math 05.

Class is very unorganized, professor didn't even stick to their own schedule. Grading is unfair, most assignments were graded during finals week and they will change your grade last minute before grade submissions. The professor is terrible at replying back to emails. You know it's bad when your own TAs don't want to help teach your class anymore.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Exams are tough, the Professor makes you watch 5-year-old videos of him for every lecture. You take an individual quiz every lecture for the first 10 minutes, then the same quiz with your group of ~10 people for the last 10 minutes. Flipped lecture class, told us to take surveys which he said we were getting extra credit for (his job) never got any

This class is very lecture and book heavy. You will not pass if you do not watch the videos and read the book. It's insane that he expects you to watch the videos which are 1-1.5 hrs long 2 times a week and on top of that do the reading. He doesn't really cover much during lecture they always make you talk to your classmates( DOES NOT HELP).
Took him for BIO-120, easy A. People say his class his hard but they are just weak. If you want an easy A, take him.

Would not recommend. The school had to extend the drop deadline for this course when I took it as so many left the course mid semester. He did not listen to students and blamed everyone but himself for low class averages. Very confusing wording on exams.

Took him for Bio110, got a good grade but i had to suffer for that grade. If you don't read the textbook, kiss an A goodbye. Attendance is mandatory so show up if you want credit. Exam questions are confusing and if you ask for clarification the professors wont help. He gives confusing quizzes as well, twice a week. If you want an A, study, a LOT.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Very understanding of student's situations in this pandemic. A lot of small homework assignments that can be finished in a few minutes after lecture. Exams are book based while biweekly quizzes are based on lecture prep slides. Lots of group work. Exams are all free response and quizzes are multiple choice. Nicest professor i've had at Merced.

He's a nice guy and a decent lecturer, but so many assignments that you'll feel like ur taking an extra course. His instructions on assignments are incredibly vague, and don't bother trying to reason with him. He won't listen to what you have to say or understand u have other courses that you are taking. Exams are mostly based on the book.

Its hard to fail this class if you actually TRY; be prepared to work hard. Lots of assignments. However, Ive learned a ton in this course. This professor and his TA clearly work hard as well so its a fair trade. There are quizzes every lecture, so attendance is mandatory. The class is also flipped.

Be ready to read and answer questions in class. He always said remember when you go to med school, but not all bio majors want to be a doctor so it really irritated me that he taught microbiology like if we were in med school.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The first exam was brutally hard, then the second exam i got a 30/100. During lecture he accidentally showed the class average which stood at 57% by midway in the semester. To say the class was hard is an understatement. However, Dr Ojeda pushed the class to dig deep and work really hard. Im happy to say i limped past this class. B-. its possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: For anyone who has a choice, do not take professor Marcos. He is a very nice person but he has no mercy when it comes to his class. The tests are extremely hard, almost no way to prepare for them and are 75% of your grade!!!!! Most people this semester withdrew, and nearly HALF of the remaining students passed the class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Bio 110 is a challenging class and required more time and effort than my other classes this semester. My advice for this class is to watch every lecture video before class, read the book and go to office hours. Doing the past exams for this class is very helpful for extra practice!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Professor Marcos is an enthusiastic lecturer, however, that enthusiasm is useless if the students don't learn. Flipped lectures is what this course is heavily dependent on, so YOU HAVE TO watch the videos, read, go to office hours, go to tutoring and be ready to get quizzed. Written exams will be something you need to get used to!
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: FLIPPED LECTURES ARE NO THE ANSWER. Dude had over 30 students withdrawal in one day. I wish I was one of them. This class will take more time and effort than all your others combined, and you still might not pass. Class doesn't have any HW, the quizzes are extremely difficult and pulled from fine print in lecture videos. TA helpfulness is hit/miss.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This was an insanely hard class. Half of the class failed bio 110. I was happy to make it out of there, but I will give this advice to my Friends and for those of you reading this. DO NOT, DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.

Dr. Garcia-Ojeda is a great and sassy professor! He is very knowledgeable. There are quizzes every lecture. You MUST watch his lecture videos bc it helps with his quizzes AND exams! Though it did feel like he favored certain students, he makes you think hard on this course. Know how to compare and contrast, go to OH, participate, and pray!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: I took Professor Garcia-Ojeda, who co-taught the class with Professor Ardell. Both are extremely passionate professors who do want to see the class succeed. However, you must work for your grade. While a good portion of the material was received through lecture, going through the back of the book questions was essential to do well on the midterms.
get ready to work your ass off

So I've had him for 3 classes and he's difficult if you don't make that class one of your priorities. I love how he makes you THINK about problems instead of just memorizing material. Still hard though.
His office hours were helpful but he was a really difficult professor when it came to the midterms and finals.

I don't know why people like this guy so much, but he's the worst teacher i ever had. He favors students, and does not particularly care about his students in general. overall, steer clear of him if you possibly can cause he's going to mess with your grade a lot, unless you happen to be on his "good" side. He's not worth ANYONE'S grade.

This was his first time teaching a lower division course with that being said, A LOT of the material on the exams were not covered in the text book. I attended lecture but it was pointless because it was difficult to understand his accent. Overall I had to teach myself the course and I only passed thanks to the TA's.

Professor is very passionate about our well being and wants to help us learn the materials and not just memorize. Lectures are sometimes difficult but if you ask him a question, he gladly answers them. The best professor I've had so far in my 3 years of being in college!

He's an extremely nice professor, very passionate about his subject in a good way. he cares about his students and  welcomes ALL questions. Very awesome environment in his class, too bad he's leaving :(

Definitely a hard class, should form study groups to study the materials.  Attending lecture is a must and reading the book ahead of time will be helpful.  He's a great professor overall and yes, he's pretty hot ;]
hardest professor i've ever taken. you need to go to class, read the book, and attend office hours. so much work but so worth it. I actually learned something.
What can i say...hes da shizznit.  great professor, learned tons...and hes teh hotness!!

Star Pants: $120.00 ..Winter Scarf: $50 ..HOT Professor with a Great Style: PRICELESS!!!  Don't take this professor if YOU don't know how to have fun yet learn at the same time. We enjoyed his class so much we stopped our bad habit and quit smoking. Thank you Professor Garcia-Ojeda...u definitely earned your hot and spicy chile pepper!
Great professor.
What can I say? I have such a great time in his class. I am learning so much. I wish he wouldn't show such gross pictures all of the time, but he's really a great teacher! (and he's hot!)

She was VERY unorganized throughout  the semester. Her instructions were not always clear and she's not tech savvy so she'll double posts assignments with different due dates often.

Attendance was also mandatory, 5 excused absences before your letter grade drops. 

she also grades 1 day before grades are due, also RUN if Kendra is the TA.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: She's awesome, super caring about student's success. She is a little disorganized so if you need a clear cut rubric then you're gonna hate how vague she can be. But just do the work and show that you care and you'll pass, she's super awesome if you are struggling and super helpful.
I don't know if Ms. Trook is actually a "professor" because she teaches classes like creative writing, but she is aloof and doesn't explain things well. She never talks about anything interesting.

one of the best professors I've ever had, Professor Dawn cares about her students and works with them to have a good grade in class, I loved her class, content, and structure. million times recommend taking her!
Take her class! She is welcoming and a great person couldn't have asked for a better teacher my first semester.

Dawn is an amazing lecturer, if you can sign up for her class you should. Her class layout is very different, we had few home works other than the 3 essay assignments throughout the semester. The class is also fairly easy as she grades by completion of the assignments, as long as you do every assignment with effort you should pass.
A for effort type class, Very understanding and touching

Honestly couldn't have asked for a better professor to help me with my first semester of college. Professor Trook is literally the best. She's really easy to talk to, accepts late work, gives great feedback on work and has a stress-free class environment. 10/10 wish I could have her as a professor again.

This class is pretty easy as long as you do your work. In order to get an A you can only miss 3 smaller assignments but besides that majority of our homework are easy. She is very lenient when it comes to turning homework in late. Overall she's a good teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Dawn Trook is an incredible professor and human being. She is exactly what you need right now, so take her class and be engaged and try your best to be involved, you won't regret it. It will take a little bit of time to get used to her class style, which is very student-first and made to engage the class, but you will love it once you do.

I had her a couple semesters ago. Professor Trook really cares about her students. The class isn't hard - as long as you put in the time to make sure your essays are well-written, you'll do great! Professor Trook is truly a wonderful professor and person!
She is helpful and does not overwhelm you with work.
She is very lovely, she is a very lenient grader and will get an A if you do all the work. Not a lot of Homework.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Sometimes, she is unclear about what she wants you to in class or in homework, but if you email her about it, she'll clarify it without a problem. She is very lenient on deadlines and gives great feedback on papers. But one problem some students have had with her is the specificity of her class theme so if you don't like it, you're out of luck.
Her writing assingment are not clear. She does not give enough feedback even when you ask for it, causing you to get bad grades on essays. Horrible teaching style, she is boring.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: No clarity on writing assignment. Constantly went to office hours to understand what she was referring to.
Dawn Trook is hands down the best writting teacher I have ever had. She is a very kind person who cares about her students and knows how to deliver feedback on an essay.

She's encourages creativity and collaboration inside the classroom so expect fun group projects. Wri 10 is a tough class but go to office hours as much as possible and ask for help or guidance. She is one of the most helpful and likes to see effort from students. Fair.
Just no forget taking this teacher. Bad teaching style ever.

She is more of those off the paper teachers. Don't get the class interactive and fails to get students to be inspired. Very monotone voice. Doesn't stress much on what it is she is looking for and really leaves you to discover your own work. You will get bored and you will be working by yourself on all the papers with no peer review from the teacher

Definitely take this teacher for writing 10. It's extremely easy to pass and she's super flexible with turning papers and projects, even though your points will be deducted. BUT STILL. She's an amazing teacher. We'd always get out of class 45mins - 50mins early (:
SHE'S AWESOME! ENOUGH SAID.
This Professor is super boring. You will be forced to write about the same topic all semester long. Worst  of all has no clarity doesn't explain what she wants or what she is looking for!

She really like her students and really makes time to help you out. The class overall is easy as long as you read. The essas are really simple and you have the opportunity to make up some of your own to make it easy
She is really nice, but all you really need to do is read. She really cares about the student's, but just make sure that you read.
As long as she likes you. You will get an 100% on your assignments unless if you are that bad.
Great teacher - very entertaining and educational.
Trook is AMAZING! She is super fun and super interesting! one of the best teachers I have ever had!
Very good teacher. You can tell that she really cares for all her students and wants them to do well. She's open to help whenever, for whatever. She is more than just a professor.
This professor is amazing. She is very helpful and understanding. You can be sure you will improve if you take her class. Coming to class is something good for a change. I recommend her class.
She's like one of the best professor at this school. Teaches Writing One and Ten. She's a cool teacher and understand us college students! Get her as a professor! She simple and easy :) !!
No Comments

I took Dr. Mello for 152 and 120 and he is an amazing professor. He is caring and takes the time to get to know all of his students. His exams are fairly simple if you study your notes. He uses a slide but does not share them so make sure to write detailed notes. I enjoyed all the class discussions. He is definitely one of the best at UCM.
mello is actually one of the chillest professors i've ever had; he's super understanding and does a lot to make sure you're okay and doing well. super easy class, great professor

I absolutely loved this class! Dr. Mello is an amazing instructor and makes learning such a fun thing to do. The class is sufficiently interactive and the topics are covered in such an effective way. He is a very understanding professor as well, and makes our work personal which I truly enjoyed. Also there's hardly any assignments.

Hes an amazing professor! hes really funny and loves to jokes with the class. Go to his office hours! he has tea! he really cares about his students and wants everyone to succeed. I've never had a professor that cared so much for us which was refreshing.

If you have taken PSY 152 then this class is very similar. Lecture heavy but the tests are also lecture based. Super engaging professor. I simply couldn't have asked for a better professor. I would take every class he teaches if I could!

Dr. Mello is the greatest Psychology Professor I have ever had. He keeps his class engaged for the full duration. He is an extremely caring professor who loves to get to know each of his students. His classes are lecture-heavy, but his tests are lecture-based. Going to class = A+ on the exam. Do his extra credit and some SONA and you'll get an A.

Mello was a great Prof. and his lectures are engaging. WARNING: he does not give lecture slides due to copyright issues so you have to write your notes. His exams are heavily based on lectures so take proper notes or take pictures of the slides during lectures. Five midterms that are each 21 q's and you get approx. 23min. Attend lecture!
Hes lowkey kinda weird but overall good professor. Would take again.
Highly recommend any of his classes, well put together with online quizzes and exams. Fun lectures and a good attitude ready to teach everyday!

One of the best professors at UC Merced! He is very passionate and knowledgeable about his field of study. I took his course in the summer and I learned a lot! He cares about your learning. He is accessible in office hours to help you improve on exams. Dr. Mello is amazing, kind, intelligent, energetic, and funny! The best of the best.

Professor Mello was amazing. I took this class to fulfill a badge, so it's not my major. He made this class extremely interesting. I always looked forward to his class. He assigns a 20-question quiz a week due on Sunday and a few projects that are two pages each (no other homework)! He's very understanding and lenient if you need an extension!

I've taken prof. Mello twice, he's great! You need to keep up with the notes and lectures/reading. His course was offered online due to the pandemic. Web cam and mic need to be turned off. You can engage in conversations through chat. He is always willing to answer questions and unmute you if you wish. Exams, no mid-term and no final.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Great teacher easy class!

Professor Mello is one of those professors that has a real passion for the material and genuinely wants his students to learn. Everything was clearly explained, there are no trick questions and feedback was pretty quick.

I loved this class so much not only did I learn a lot but I also had so many good laughs! If you take his class ask him to do his Irish accent haha. The work is super easy bc its just 5 2 page research papers that consist of summarizing what you learned. Read the textbook to be ready for the easy weekly quizzes. He wants students to enjoy learning

Easy class and you learn a ton of interesting and important info. Class is based on 2 things, a 2-page assignment that you have about a week and a half to do and 21 question quizzes that you have every weekend throughout the semester where 3 of your lowest scores are dropped at the end of the semester. Always gives a great amount of extra credit.

Wow where do I begin, he is what every professor should be like. He is so caring, teaches great, and wants to see his students thrive. He knows we have a lot going on so he understands and gives us tons of extra credit. His tests are super easy and my lowest grade on a test was a 80%. I am definitely taking one of his other classes. Easy A+!!!
One of the best professors I ever had and thanks to his amazing lectures and easy homework and tests, made the class easy, enjoyable, and still very educational.
Easiest professor I have had so far. If you need an easy four unit class take it with Dr. Mello.
Patient, kind, genuine, and caring, a wonderful professor who cares about his students and their well being.
Literally the best professor in UC Merced!!

Amazing teacher. His lectures were great very detailed. We cant have our camera on but thats ok better haha. Only got small tests on Saturday 20 questions 17 minutes to do it. Easy test. Small essays 1-2 pages max around every 2 weeks. No final. Final is optional its like extra credit. Lectures all recorded.

This was the best professor and class I took at UC Merced. Its such a great class that you get into it and its so interesting that its not even work because there's so much connection from class to real life. He does an amazing job at giving examples and teaching the class.

So im taking psychology 001 and its pretty easy. Every week you read one chapter (rarely read 2) and take a quiz on it due on Sunday. I didnt attended the lectures that explain the chapter but if you dont get the reading then you should. He gives multiple extra credit options and there is no final, its extra credit as well. Hes a nice guy!
He gives awesome lecture and is by far my favorite professor Ive had. The lectures were never boring! Psych 001 is solely based on lectures and the projects are very easy.
Amazing professor! Lectures are not boring at all!!!

If you plan on taking psychology, I highly recommend you to take Dr. Mello's class! He does an amazing job of making lectures very enjoyable and engaging. He always puts the needs of his students first which makes him very respected among all students. He gives weekly exams, but they are very easy!

Literally the best Professor I have ever had! So incredibly caring and as long as you listen to his lectures, you should be able to easily get an A on every test. There are 2 projects, but I haven't heard of anyone so far who has gotten anything other than an A on them! The Final is optional and is worth up to 10 extra credit points!

Do not take this class with ANY other professor BUT PROFESSOR MELLO! His lectures were sooo interesting that lecture will fly by before you know it. He's very inspirational! There's no homework or midterms but there are 2 small projects. He covers a chapter per week so there will be weekly quizzes. The best of all, the final exam is optional! :)
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: one of the best professors i've ever taken. super caring and a joy to learn from. he teaches everything in such a clear manner, and you can tell he genuinely cares about what he's doing. in terms of work load, he gives weekly test based on what you learned from the week & 2 projects.

Dr. Mello is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He is really caring about his students and is excited to receive an answer question with no judgement whatsoever. If you go to class and take notes you should get an A. He is a very reasonable grader, and an understanding professor overall.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Kelvin is an interesting teacher. You will either love him, or completely hate him. What I can tell you is that if you have passion for what you are learning in computer science, you will do JUST FINE. Show Kelvin you care by going to every lecture(yes he will notice you) and do all your assignments. Just demonstrate your work ethic!

Thankfully, this is my last class with Kelvin. He was a fantastic professor for CSE 20, but you can see in 21 that he doesn't care much anymore. Labs are long and daunting, but they are there for a purpose. Open note final and midterm, no curve. Typical Kelvin.

This professor should not be aloud to work at a university, he discourages students even though his class is an introductory course. He is a misogynist and is no help when you go to his office hours. If you go to office hours he will honestly not help you, unwilling to help struggling students and will encourage you to switch out of School of Eng.

This professor's lectures are not very useful, he often goes very far off topic. You would be better off using your own studying habits with his lecture slides as opposed to attending lecture. His midterms are easy to study for, but the concepts presented will be difficult. Attend all labs, study for the midterm properly, and you will succeed.

Kelvin is the best teacher that you will have for any CSE class. He is tough, but his lectures prepare you for everything that will be on the test. As long as you have a brain and can think you will do fine. I love Kelvin and so will you. Also Kelvin deserves a chili pepper, please help me give Kelvin what he deserves.
Kelvin is the best.
If you did poorly and are upset, you're a dumb dumb. Great teacher with a passion for the subject. I can't wait to take more classes with him.
Lecture slides are better than attending to his lectures.

His lower division class is really simple but he discourages people who aren't gifted in programming to switch majors. His lectures are pretty simple material but difficult to keep up when he's teaching. He has a sense of humor and really tries to prepare you for the week's lab. The midterm and final is beyond hard but expect easy grades on labs.
Lwin is kind of an jerk, but other than that he's a great professor. Just don't be a idiot and you'll be fine

He is an acquired taste,but extremely funny I thought so.He is at genius levels so when he explains things to non-genius' it makes not that much sense,such as me I didn't understand too much in lectures but my friend understood a lot of it. Definitely knows his crap. Felt a little under achieved to eb his student.But I think great teacher!

He's an awesome teacher in my opinion. His explanations are hard to understand. I understand why a lot of people don't like him but, he's challenging and builds a good foundation on fundamentals. What he expects is for you to learn the fundamentals and everything else will build off that. So pay attention in class and learn fundamentals.
His class is depressing, work is boring, and there's a severe lack of enthusiasm when he teaches.

He has one class a week and he doesn't specify the material we are supposed to read over before our lab. He is a funny guy and he is a bit rude. The labs are easy if you read over the material. When taking the exam be ready they are really hard. Harder than the practice tests he gives you.

This professor has got to be one of the meanest professors on campus. When students ask him a question, he is usually rude to them and mock them often. He does not explain things well either and expects the class to have known the material before coming in to class.

I did not like him at all! He got frustrated with those students that weren't already experts. He did not help me unless I knew what I was doing and needed help supplementing instruction. I recommend taking CSE 20 in the Spring when he is not teaching it. Very unhelpful in my opinion

Terrible teacher. Useless when it comes to helping or teaching you anything. Comes to class late almost everyday and spends at least 5 minutes talking about his pathetic life. Reads from lecture slides he copied from Berkeley and makes fun of UCM

He is the BEST CSE professor, contrary to what others have said about him, if you pay attention in class, you will succeed.  He will help you if you truly need help, however if you don't pay attention he won't feel obligated to help you.

He is not helpful at all. He is the type of professor that will only help you if you know what you're doing. I'm lost in that class and he looks at me like I'm stupid. My TA, Oktar, has been my main source for help. I will fail the class.

I've had CSE 020 and 021 with Lwin, and I have him right now for 031. He makes lecture hall type classes funny and interesting, and tries to engage the class in a smaller setting. When asking him for help, what he tells you will be of a lot of help if you understand the foundation well. Lower division classes with him are easy with moderate effort.
He is mad awesome

He is very funny and knows how to keep the class interesting. He does not use the book which is good. But one thing that is a flaw is when you ask him for help. He does not really help you unless you know your stuff.

He goes over a lot. He doesn't teach from the book, which is good. He is straight up, funny guy who is the best teacher for the class. Unfortunately, the TA's for this class are HORRIBLE. Thats what makes it hard.

He is hard if you don't know anything about computing. He doesn't really help when it comes to asking a lot of questions. On the flip side if you study hard and learn from other people its somewhat barable. He is really funny and makes the class go by really quickly, but still hard overall
HORRIBLE when you are trying to receive any kind of help from him.

He is the professor to get if you're taking a CSE class! Although he's not a great lecturer, (I always learned everything in labs anyways) he is the easiest you can get for exams since it's open notes (he has practice midterms that are similar to the actual ones that you can bring).
He is a good teacher. You can bring one cheet sheet on midterm. And then you can bring two cheet sheet on final.

Shows up less than 10 minutes late for class maybe once per month. Usually takes 5 minutes to get started with lecture after he shows up late, leaving about 35 out of 50 minutes to talk during each lecture. Requests no student interaction during lectures. Only reads slides and keeps looking at clock as if he has better places to be.
He's a great teacher, funny, helpful, and he posts all his slides online. Open book, open note exams
Not easy, put do the work and you will pass.  He is very funny.
K Lwin is HILARIOUS. He has the entire auditorium busting out during lecture!

She is a very nice teacher. Directions and class were confusing at times, but don't be afraid to talk to her after class and ask for clarification. This course is homework heavy as papers were due every class, however, they are very easy, but take time to complete. As long as you read directions and attend all classes, you'll get an easy A

I feel like this professor isn't best as far as instruction are going and half the time i feel like she's info dumping when explaining assignments and what to do. I think on top of that she's mean and rude for no reason and has a habbit of putting down other students or getting annoyed when students ask for help. Overall goodluck

This professor does not care about their students, they would call people out and belittle them in front of the whole class. Doesn't teach anything, everything is learn it yourself. She gets obviously annoyed whenever someone asks a question, she tells you you're doing something wrong but refuses to show you how to fix things I hated going to class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: This professor can be a little difficult as she is always late to class, calls people out, and may come off as rude when theres questions asked. However, Ive learned a lot in her course overall. No writing course is supposed to be easy. As long as you pay attention, show up to class, read directions carefully it shouldnt be a problem.

Genuinely the worst professor I have ever had. She was extremely rude to students during class and would cold call everyone. If you are thinking of taking her don't. This is just a class about what SHE wants and if it's not to her liking it's an automatic zero.

I do not really think that she knows what she is doing. Her explanation is not clear. When she assigned the students work she expect us to do the work that she needs to do. She also expects us to remember where some assignments are even though she will move the assignment like 5 times from different places.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: I was looking forward to this class because I was told by a friend that the professor was amazing. I will never believe her AGAIN. Compared to my harder classes, this one had most work despite being a SPRK class. They were disrespectful in class and unclear with instructions. Even people not in the class were shocked with their behavior and tone.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Her attitude is not it. She would tell us we could ask questions but if we did she would expect us to know the answer already. She would get mad if students corrected her. She wanted the students to do her job for her and come up with stuff to make her life easier. So glad this course was online not in-person

Super rude. Definitely grades on favoritism. Can't come up with ideas for class on her own and doesn't give good advice. Lashes out at people whenever she's having an off day. Theres no class structure.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took her Feminism SPARK class. It's not very hard but there is a lot of busy work. You are guaranteed an A if you stay on top of your work and follow instructions. She means well but her tone and attitude may make you think otherwise. The books read were interesting and assignments were usually based on them. Be ready to talk in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took it Fall 2020. Make sure to read and annotate (yes she will check) before class so you can participate well in the discussion, participate! There are 4 essays that grow in length as the class progresses, research assignment, and 5-10 journals. There is in-class work and collaborations so come to class on time, she checks attendance!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof. Toconis is a great instructor. This is not the class to take if you are not willing to put in work. There were three major essays and smaller discussion/participation points. Expect to do a good chunk of reading before class (if you want to participate well in discussion). As long as you try and get feedback from her, you will pass easily.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She does not like answering questions in class. She is not helpful. I tried to drop the class, but it was too late. Instead I just stopped attending. I had several times with her where she was blatantly rude to me which is not an accepted way of talking to your students. Do not take her class. Choose another professor if you can.

She is a great professor! May come off as rude but it's just her tone, she's actually really nice and helpful. Gives great feedback for papers and will help you in office hours. The class consisted mainly of participation so be ready to talk. Had two group presentations. She likes getting into controversial topics but she's cool about it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: she's an oddball of a teacher since a lot of people have mixed opinions. she does call people out in class and go on tangents. there is a considerable amount of work assigned, so if reading/writing isn't your jam you'll hate it. the work is very straightforward though, so if you do everything it's an easy A. she's pretty nice, just has off days
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Ms.T is a person you can joke around with in class but you can still get your work done in class. Sometimes she can be cranky but overall she's great. The work is easy if you pay attention to what she wants and she'll let you re do something in class before turning it in. We had about 10 journals and 3 essays and I did pretty good.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Amazing professor. Very understanding and interacts with her students. I was not very familiar with writing at a college level and she taught me in a very calm manner and made me believe in myself.

She is super kind, funny, patient and caring. She truly wants the best for her students. Theres a good amount of writing, but if you follow directions, it's easy. Such a great professor! There's also a good amount of reading, but its interesting and sorta fun to write about. Pretty easy class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: I struggled the whole time in this class. She was so unorganized and late a lot. More often than not, she wasn't in the mood to answer questions. Not exactly personable but not mean, either. So many papers and not enough class time to get the instruction needed on them because she went off on tangents. Interesting class at times and I got an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I think if I had this professor for anything other that core she would be great. It's not her it's the material she given. I had I hard time with the writing style she wanted -- just write like you in highschool and can't remember anything you learned since. If you have more than 5 paragraphs don't expect anything above a c no matter what you say
amazing professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: She is an amazing lecturer that truly makes you work for that grade. She can sometimes have a lot on her plate and can get behind in grading but I love her class! She helps you out and gives great feedback!
The best writing instructor
Ms Toconis is one of the most helpful writing professors at UCM. She loves what she does and if you show up to her office hours she helps you big time.
Very great professor. Very caring and does not take things too seriously.
She is the best! 12/10 would take another class with her!
Loved Ms. Toconis! Her Writing 10 class is very interesting. You will learn a lot about the feminism movement!

She is an AWESOME teacher!!! She is extremely approachable and will help you with any little question that you have. She does have a very sarcastic sense of humor so if you are easily offended, this isn't the class for you. She is super easy going and layed back. 4 major papers, and about 4 presentations (group and individual)
Great teacher! Get her if you can! :)
Awesome Professor!
Toconis is a great TA for Core. She makes the class durable with her wit and she is gives very clear instructions. Great instructor if you do the work and go to and participate in discussion.
Bultena is a pretty funny guy, and I was genuinely excited to go to class. I would say prepare to do a bit of reading, but it's not a bland and boring textbook. Overall, he gets five big booms.

This professor is very spirited and you can tell he cares, but be warned that he will tell the truth no matter what you think. Don't get offended if you slack off in class and get a grade reflecting that.

At heart, he's a good dude. But as a professor, I felt very belittled. He definitely has a distinct personality that to me felt incriminating when he talked to me. Never knew what it was like to have a panic attack in front of everyone, now I know. The ideas taught were interesting, but I'd avoid taking any class based purely on his attitude.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Bultena was a harsh grader and expected a lot out of students without entirely giving them clear and helpful feedback. This class felt more like an engineering class than a writing class; I was not helped at all on writing more professionally. I stagnated in this class instead of progressing due to the assignments and the course material.

Good professor, teaching, not the best. Gives good feedback on assignments, if you ask for help. I recommend him, you just have to make sure you do your work and attend class to not fail, there was no clear grading criteria.

He was so rude in class and made students feel dumb for the randomest things. A lot of people felt targeted in class when he would randomly shame them in front of the whole class. Some people like him, but I found him pretentious.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Overall he is a great professor, strict grader, funny as well. as long as you follow what he says you should be fine. Lots of reading!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I get where others are coming from but John helped me a lot on my research skills and gave me a lot of advice on graduate school. More than fair.

As another comment mentioned, he is a know it all professor. Really got on my nerves. Do not miss class because he will deduct point and I believe if you miss 3 times he starts dropping huge percentages.
Class was just boring.

Bultena is awesome! As some said before me, he has a unique personality & it might not rub you the right way - that wasnt the case for me. He conversed w/ the class a lot to see how we were absorbing the material and made it assignments enjoyable. Super funny and clearly cares a lot about what he does. Made my 1st sem of college unforgettable
Class was easy going and fun. I liked that he wanted to hear about our different topics and gave us freedom to report on what we wanted.

Office hours with him were great. Talkin and seeing the other students work during peer reviews, I know they were not asking Bultena anything. I went at least 4 times during the semester and it made all the difference in terms of my papers. Just talk to him in and out of class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Tough attitude, but very comprehensive. Youthful at heart, but has you read some crazy books that not everyone may be comfortable with. Cool guy though
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: just do assignments and don't talk. He's quite boring and has a peculiar personality.
At first he is intimidating, but as the semester progresses he becames a sweet heart. Cool Professor who is open minded
know it all type of professor. easy work
His teaching style is straightforward. His work is easy but his personality is pretty tough. I found his class easy but one thing I disliked was how his attitude was.
wasn't sure what to expect. he is kind of rough initially but warms up. Just turn in work and use office hours and a B isn't hard to get.

You'll learn but it is work. It is paced out not everything is done at once. Lot of it is just keeping to the tasks. He is easy to get in contact with in office hours or email. Felt liek this class was really worthwhile.

he is a quick  go to class and you will understand athome assignments. he teaches well. however, he is short with words. he makes minimal attempts to clear up peoples confusion. he ridicules students for answering questions in class wrong. he does the minimum to help. just enough to get by.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: not hard but just stick to the work and you'll make it
He has standards but as long as you do as you are told to do you should be fine.
Had engineering writing this semester and John made the class really interesting. Guy knows his stuff. Really quick grader too. always knew what my grade was in the class
bultena is alright. good interactions.
funny but not too serious. made it easy to get work done for other classes.
he is cool just follow directions
The key to my success in this class was utilizing office hours and Mr. Bultena has plenty to utilized. Make an appointment, show up, and you're good to go.
He will tell you he doesn't care if you don't care and it is true. If you want help, you have to ask, but the help will be great. The topic of comics is really different.
John is a cool professor. He doesn't sugar coat anything and treats students like human beings. he also has the best office ever!
Easy going and approachable.

Dr. Chopra does mean well and wants her students to be successful in this class. However, she was very unclear with her instructions, left my group and I often confused of what was being asked of us. If you have a concern, ask her in-person, writing emails was extremely counterproductive and would often get a 1-2 word response.

I want to acknowledge how fortunate I feel to have you as a professor. Your dedication to fostering an educational environment that encourages curiosity and creativity is genuinely commendable. Thank You, Dr. Chopra.
This is one of the more straightforward classes, and with proper dedication, success is achievable.
attend the class and be respectful to the class. It's easy A+
Thank you Dr. Chopra
I love this class.

Professor Pooja Chopra is amazing! Her lectures are clear, engaging, and well-organized, making challenging topics easy to understand. She's caring, approachable, and highly respected, always supporting her students and ensuring their success. Assignments are fair and insightful. Highly recommend taking her class—you'll learn a lot and enjoy it!

Professor Pooja Chopra is amazing! Their lectures are clear, engaging, and well-organized, making tough topics easier to grasp. They're approachable, always ready to help, and genuinely care about students' success. Assignments are fair and designed to enhance learning. Highly recommend taking their class—you'll learn a lot and enjoy it too!
Great Class!

Almost everyone who showed up to class ended the semester with at least an A. Show up to class, follow the directions of the assignment(even if you bullshit them) and you'll get an A. By far one of the easiest classes I have taken. If you show respect to Dr. Chopra, she will show respect to you. As simple as that.
Dr. Chopra helps me ,and my group with our project and guide us in all assignment.

Professor Chopra is a very accomplished instructor who uses her expertise to effectively guide the class. This is a research based class where we chose a grad challenge and nuanced it until the end of the semester. The work is very easy, only one assignment per week, sometimes none. She is very open to questions and gives great feedback!
So Yes if you take her Majority of the classes are gonna be easy but, if you do really get unlucky then like us you will suffer through the trenches.

Though the course was heavy, especially during the summer, Dr. Pooja put her best effort to help us understand the material and solve problems. While the classes were speeding with the material, she made sure we thoroughly understood the main concepts. If I went to the discussion, I will be confident of that day's concept, period!

Dr. Pooja was very good in our discussion and answered any questions to the best of her ability.  I really liked how she would do quizzes, and they were fair game if you completed the worksheets.  I would most definitely take this class again if given the opportunity.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Thank you, Dr. Chopra. I saw the best prof. in my life. She is a great inspiration and makes the subject very easy. I love her class.

I took the class in the summer and it was fast-paced with weekly assignments and challenging exams. The grading seemed fair, but the professor's deviation from the syllabus made it difficult. The research project towards the end was confusing because she didn't talk about it much. Overall, it was a stressful and not particularly enjoyable class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Chopra excelled in teaching "Spark: Inclusive Innovation," fostering a supportive learning environment. Her guidance not only helped me navigate assignments with confidence but also inspired a passion for research at UC Merced.  I gained invaluable insights into proper research methods and discovered a newfound academic drive.

I just wanted to reach out and express how much I enjoyed the course. Your enthusiasm and expertise made learning truly enjoyable and profoundly impactful.

Thank you so much for being an amazing professor and for your guidance throughout the semester. Your support made a difference in my educational experience.

I never want to miss Dr. Chopra's lectures. She consistently provides valuable insights into what is crucial for our understanding. Despite the abundance of online homework in this course, Dr. Chopra ensures ample time for completion. Her explanations are clear, and she is supportive during challenging times.

Prof. was caring and provided you with review sheets for exams but no solutions. Regarding office hours, it was quite inconsistent in location and scheduling. Exams are easy as long as you practice the review questions, attend lectures, & go to OFFICE HOURS. Midterms have extra credit and there is one easy group project so do it in advance.

This introductory class isn't as challenging as some might suggest! While it covers physics and is considered a tougher course, dedicating time to study the material can make a difference. Prof. is highly dependable and responds promptly to emails. Whenever I requested to meet after class or during office hours, she willingly accommodated.
Best physics professor ever, she will do anything to make sure you're successful in this course.

It's surprising to encounter student feedback that's completely off the mark. I admire the prof's receptiveness to questions and her readiness to adapt teaching methods based on student feedback. Her dedication to clarifying concepts is truly valuable. It helped me pinpoint exam study areas. I appreciated the interactive review sessions.

The teacher was very enthusiastic and quite nice to everyone. The class was designed to be smaller supposedly so if this was her first time with this huge group of people, I'd say she did an incredible job. She has stayed positive and has been quite lenient across the whole semester so props to her!

Dr. Chopra's unwavering dedication to understanding her students and refining her teaching methods, coupled with her commitment to student success. Her commitment to student success, along with valuable office hours, fostered a positive learning atmosphere. Responsive to feedback, like discontinuing clicker use, she's a caring professor.

Dr. Chopra is the best professor I've had. She is very kind and cares about her students. I would recommend going to her office hours and review sessions to resolve any misconceptions you have. She is super supportive and wants the best for all her students. Try your best and ask her if you need help, she is patient and wants you to do well.
She is really helpful and kind. Go to office hours and ask any questions you have, she is really the best physics teacher

AMAZING PROF! all you need to do is pay attention to how she does problems in class. She even has office hours every day for an entire week before the midterms. Very kind to everyone and wants everyone to learn. I am sad that this is my last physics class that i will have with her.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Mrs.Chopra is one of the most soft spoken, kind teachers I have met. The courses she teaches are group related, which brings incredible bonds throughout the semester

She is a very understanding and caring Professor. I had her for ENGR 096. She showed interest in the field and the work of students. She attempts to understand the perspective of her students most of the time. She can be a little bit too lenient and nice to students who are not doing work or participating. Overall, very nice. would recommend!

Professor Pooja Chopra is a truly empathetic and supportive instructor who prioritizes her students' well-being and academic success. She is willing to helping those who put in the effort and communicate their needs effectively. Her constructive feedback is invaluable, and she goes above and beyond to provide extra resources to assist students.

Pooja is the best TA ever! She really cared for her students and wants everyone to succeed. If it wasn't for Pooja I would have definitely failed but I ended the class with an A. She made the the concepts sound easier and made sure you understand everything. She would also host office hours a lot in order to better prepare you for the tests.

If you want any TA for Physics its Pooja. Intimidating at first, youll realize pretty quickly that shes the sweetest. Pooja gives you just about full points on everything as long as you try your best. She always made it clear that she wants whats best for the students. Go to her office hours and review sessions, itll narrow down your studies.

Pooja is one of those rare people who cares about your education and understanding of the class. She will take the patience to explain difficult topics and make herself available during office hours to further clarify if there is not enough time.

Pooja is a great TA who really cares about your success as a student. She can be hard on you, but really makes sure to give every student her time so that they can truly learn all of the material on the exam.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Honestly pooja was my favorite TA ever. She was so nice and respectful. She made physics easy and and gave good feedback. If it wasnt for her Id probably fail the class.

Without Pooja, I would have failed physics. She made the concepts so simple and always told us what we were expected to know. If you ever get the chance to have Pooja, do it. She helped me so much in physics and she is hilarious.

Pooja is such an amazing teacher. I went into physics thinking I was going to fail but she is very knowledgeable on the subject and knows how to teach physics well. Shes a very understanding TA and will always makes time to help her students. Shes the main reason for my A in the class.

Pooja was such a great help I don't think I would have done so well without her she always prepared us for the midterms and that's how I got As on both of them. She really does care and she can be strict but that is because she wants to make sure that we are as prepared as possible and that were actually learning.
She is one the best TA I have seen at University of California Merced

I was lucky to be in 5 of his psychology classes and graduated learning everything I know because of this man. He is extremely knowledgeable and although somewhat "boring" as people say he is very passionate and it shows when you talk to him 1 on 1. Slides are daunting but it's nothing someone can't handle. Thank you McDiarmid!
very interesting material, learn something completely new each class. sometimes dry and boring but overall very eye opening course

Interesting classes, his lectures are a bit unorganized but the material is understandable. You must study hard to get a good grade on the exams, but it's definitely manageable. He gives extra credit and the paper is very easy to do.
There was a lot of material he expected us to cover but the quizzes were only 40 questions.

I absolutely LOVE Jim! Ill be honest, you MUST work for your grade BUT what he teaches, he teaches with passion! he loves what he teaches and it makes you love learning! he's old yes BUT very wise with a lot of knowledge! if you are in COLLEGE to genuinely learn and work for a WELL EARNED grade, take every class Jim offers. Long power point slides.
Lectures are really unorganized. Also you must be extremely devoted to studying his lecture slides and other material.

I have no idea how Jim is getting such good ratings. He does thousands of slides and the material he lectures is all over the place. He seems to expect you to know everything before you come to class. Easy term paper to help make up points lost because the material he gives is unnecessarily hard. I'd avoid taking his classes at all costs.

Pretty easy classes if you read the book and powerpoints. The powerpoints are very long though, so start early. He does give an extra credit presentation, so as long as you pay attention in class and read you will pass.

Dr. McDiarmid is a very good professor. I took his Neuropsychology class which is very challenging and he really does everything possible for his students to succeed. It's not going to be easy, but he's always available at mercy hospital to help his students in any way possible.

Nice teacher who is very willing to help bend over backwards for students to better accommodate them. Class is fair and tests are entirely MC from lecture slides. Downside is that lecture slides are 100+ slides. He does give study guides so you now what will be on the test and what to weed out when studying. Great teacher overall.

Jim is by far my fav prof at UCM. He gives the students everything they need to succeed in his class. (I have taken 3 with him) He is very knowledgeable and is very understanding. I feel like her really loves to teach and wants his students to succeed. Take any class that is offered by Jim! You won't regret it.
Jim is my favorite professor. The content is very interesting and he is very helpful. The review slides are plentiful but if you review them you will be rewarded. Thanks Jim for loving what you do!
He is one of the best professors I've ever had. He is kind and very helpful, tests are easy, and like everyone else says there are many ways to get extra credit and earn a higher grade.

Best teacher ever, the class is easy to pass if you study the review slides. There's also extra credit and an easy A on the term paper if you just try. If you want an A and end up learning tons of knowledge, take his classes 'cause you have to know your materials to pass his tests, which are pretty difficult at times. :)He's also super nice!

I took PSY 181 with him and he was a great professor. I got into this class late into the semester but I still managed to recieve an A. As long as you review the 1000 powerpoint slides you will be good. He gives study guides so its even better!

He's a really great professor! You are expected to learn the material because his tests are challenging, and you have to apply your knowledge to get the answers right. He always shows up to office hours, and is willing to help you with your work! Really nice old prof, take him if you have the chance! You won't be sorry. :)
