Great teacher. He's extremely helpful in every regard, be it with grad school or just the classwork. The workload is simple but his test are pretty difficult. He provides study guides but you need to know how to apply the concepts to get a good grade on the test.
I have taken numerous classes with Jim and I absolutely love him! He is a GREAT professor! Super bummed I can't get any of his classes into my schedule next semester!
someone should put the truth on here. 1000 slides to review for a quiz, hundreds of slides during lectures. not even worth it to try to take notes.

Goes through slides very quickly. Puts slides up online for students to review. He's always willing to help and after I asked him he put up a list of which information to review on CROPS as well as slides. But is a really good professor. You really have to learn the material to pass the tests. Hard but amazing class and I would take it again.
My favorite teacher all year. He's the cutest old teacher ever. He lectures with his eyes closed though, so if you have a question, you have to call his name.

Seriously fantastic professor. He keeps things interesting when he can and skips through boring stuff even on his own slides. Really easy grader if you just do your work and do it on time. You do have to work for your A, by that I mean know the study guides. I will try to take all of his classes with my time here.

Don't try to take notes during the lecture-he goes through the slides way too fast. However he does somehow manage  to keep it interesting. The quizzes are simple and he gives review slides for them. The text isn't really necessary since his power points are the basis for all his quizzes/exams
5 quizes with lowest grade drop, one paper and a final exam. very very helpful, easy grader, always there for you. I would take him all year long
Jim is the best professor UCM can have. You can talk to him about anything and he knows his material extremely well. Very understanding.

I love Jim as a professor. He is incredibly knowledgeable, and reading the book helps a ton! He does deserve tenure, getting his class is getting lucky. So approachable, and very quick turnaround times for papers and tests. everything you could want in a professor. Not a mistake taking Jim.
Jim is the best professor at UCM. Very knowledgeable and organized, what every professor should be. He is very nice, and very approachable. I think he deserves Tenure.
My favorite psych prof. a guaranteed A if you read the lecture slides and do your paper. quizzes are easy MC ?s and he even gives extra credit...i've gotten three A's from him.

All his Psy class are very interesting. Very knowledgeable professor ! He know his materials very well and memorize everyone names quickly. Quizzes are fair (5 or 6 total + final), all multiple choice. Including a term paper due (50 pts.)-easy point. Attend lecture and even if you miss a lecture everything is on the slide, so study for the quizzes.

The class is really easy, you don't need to go to lecture as attendance isn't mandatory. If you do the readings don't bother going to lecture since he just goes over what is in them. Quizzes are open book so it isn't hard to fail. I'd recommend forming a study group as it'll help you grasp the material.

Took this class Spring 2023, Respectable professor who goes over topics properly, not a lot of work and wasn't attendance mandatory. Tests were open note and able to take anywhere. I recommend showing up to get a good foundation of the subject, but it's very easy to pass
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Spivey is an incredibly hilarious, passionate cognitive scientist. His lectures were engaging, and he often proved his theories using the audience. He provided every slide and past videos of lectures on Catcourses which is incredibly helpful if you miss a lecture or two. While the lectures aren't mandatory, the discussions are required! 100/100

Spivey is very passionate in his lectures. If this class goes for your major, he is a good teacher. You have to do well on all the midterms and final because that is the "only" real thing in the grade book other than attendance for discussion. Overall, he was a great professor 100000% recommend
He is very well spoken and extremely enthusiastic on the topic.

Took in Fall of 2022. To sum it up, his lectures were pretty interesting, but I fall asleep as his voice is EXTREMELY calming. Stopped going to lecture after a week. Exams are all online and open note. Quizlet is your friend in that class (USE IT) very easy pass.

Took Cogs 001 with Spivey in Spring 2023, and honestly it's been a favorite class of mine. You can tell Spivey is both well-educated and interested in the subject. It's not a very difficult class and attendance isn't required except for discussions, which depending on TA will affect your experience. Take advantage of your resources all you'll pass
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Test heavy

comment: This guy is the real deal, he has a lot of experience in the Cognitive Science department and is well-known in his field. In his lectures, he is very funny and good at demonstrating and explaining things. He is also very reasonable and will tell you as much as he can to answer your questions.

Despite the subject matter being fairly boring, at least in my opinion, Spivey made lectures an absolute joy. He's an authority on the topic and very clearly loves his work.
This may have been influenced by the TA strike at the UCs, but his class was extremely easy. Midterms and Finals were all online and open-note.

I would say that this professor is good with lectures since they are actually interesting and I like how the professor asks questions in the middle of lectures to make sure that people participate. Taking exams is pretty easy if you study well and it is even easier since they are online and usually multiple-choice.
Professor Spivey is so enthusiastic about cognitive science and it shows. The content of the course was a little challenging but Spivey did the best he could to explain each and every concept.

While I took this class to fulfill a General Education requirement, Dr. Spivey was able to make the course interesting and more enjoyable. The only thing to be aware of is that tests make up for a large portion of your grade so both midterms and the final are very important in that class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: I took Professor Spivey's Into to Cognitive Science Class in 2019 as a freshman. Spivey is friendly, approachable, but a bit of a rambler. He's enthusiastic about his subject, and posts slide before the lecture. However, most of the content is taught through his lectures, so attend class and create a study group in case anyone has to miss.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: He rambles a lot, if you aren't paying close attention to literally everything he's saying you will miss something.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: His lectures are sometimes hard to understand but they are extremely interesting. If you don't show up to lectures then you will not pass this course because the midterms are super lecture based. In this course you can get up to a 5% increase on your grade which is amazing as it can turn a B into an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Spivey's lectures were hard to engage in, let alone enjoy. He is confusing at times. The midterms are mainly based on lecture and a bit on the course readings.  He offers up to 5% extra credit which is a plus. I however, did not enjoy this course.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I think Spivey is so cool! he made keeps everyone engaged. You don't really need to read the book so go to lectures,take detailed,notes,record lecture, and review it weekly. Practice quizzes helped a lot. And reviewing just your notes is enough. the second midterm was very easy compared to the first. Discussion was useless for me but he was GREAT

He makes lectures fun and interesting! SONA extra credit bumped be up 6%, midterms are curved (sometimes), he gives practice exams that you can use to study for the midterms... point is, you have a very high chance of doing well! I would retake the class if I could just because he's THAT great!

Never even read the book but was able to pass his midterms. He definitely makes you work for your grade as he only takes midterms and tests about 80% of your final grade. His lectures are amazing! He will blow your mind. Don't get me started on his wardrobe though. His one of the coolest professors.

Very good professor and easy class just as long as you read/go to lecture. Sometimes goes a bit off topic but explains the material well. Entertaining lectures and he's very enthisiastic. You'll enjoy his class.
Best lecture professor I have had! Sometimes some topic can be a little slow but for the most part he does a great job at keeping you focused and interested. Only 2 midterms and a final.

loveddd spivey! only 2 midterms and the final. important to go to lectures since its mostly pictures so take good notes. if you dont understand something ask! exams are multiple choice & fill in the blank. there is times you will need the book  , but not really.

Spivey is the best professor I have had in a very long time.  I definitely recommend taking his class. I suggest to attend his lectures, they are amazing and he always keeps them interesting. Also the lecture slides are mainly pictures and he doesnt put them online. He is very helpful when you ask him for help and his explanations are clear.

He's an energetic and entertaining lecturer. Like it's obvious that he's really passionate about what he teaches. Do attend lectures since his slides are almost all images. No study guides, but his non-graded quizzes are similar to how his exams will be. He said that on the first exam, people usually get a 70% and then do better later on.
Keeps lectures really interesting. Funny and cracks jokes. Definitely have to attend lectures because he uses mostly pictures and almost no text in his slides. Read the text assigned as well.

He's a very entertaining lecturer. He knows how to keep the class interesting, but because it was such a broad class, sometimes the focus was a bit lost. I received an A in the class so I'm not complaining, but just make sure you read and understand concepts more than anything because that is what will get you the grade.
Mr. Spivey is brilliant, to say the least. Best teacher I've had.
Easy class, interesting, professor was funny and very encouraging about doing good on his final and midterms. I would recommend this class. He is also very helpful.

Makes the rather dull textbook rather interesting. You should definitely attend lecture because you'll never know what he went over from his slides alone. He's very laid back and makes lecture something to look forward to. Also, he's just a great teacher!

Spivey is an excellent teacher. He is not "insanely" hard, like the slacker below said, although some of the material is a bit abstract. He tends to stress network science and dynamic systems more than the fluffy humanities stuff. But if you pay attention and take good notes, his tests are easy (multiple choice and fill-in-the-blank).

It is evident that Spivey wants to get the subject across. He is very helpful when questioned. Very liberal. The subject is moderately hard, textbook use is low but it is still important to understand the topics addressed. Midterms and Final are important, his tests guide to the correct answer but still study! you might not do as well as you think.
great teacher. just do your work.
Great class, so interesting. Not easy, but if you study the slides and use readings as supplement, will do well.

Insanely hard class. The subject itself is ridiculously broad so it can overwhelm you at times. The test are also extremely difficult and there are no study guides for them. Spivey doesn't really teach the subject well enough for me to have understand it fully. If you HAVE to take this class, DO THE SONA extra credit, it'll save you big time

Overall great professor! Her class is very midterm/test heavy so it is best to get ahead while you can. If you put in the effort out of class and study, you will pass the class. Ochem is a difficult subject and her ability to make the class fun during lecture helps out a lot. I recommend going to class everyday or it will be a confusing semester.

Dr. Leslie was a really good ochem professor considering the rigors nature of ochem. If you put the effort into paying attention during her lectures and utilize her office hours you can for sure get a good grade. her practice exams were very useful and often reflected what was on the actual midterms.

Tbh I didn't have anything against her, great prof as long as you SHOW UP TO lect AND disc you will get a passing grade, she gives past midterms for you to review and the worksheets aren't so bad. It wasn't until the last two weeks when she said the final would be chem 8 and chem 100, I didn't do so great in chem8 and had an A before the final.
screw this organic chemistry teacher, you find better professors at community colleges than you would with her
don't take her
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: she has some biases in her class, but she doesn't care for the rest of the class, no matter if you're struggling or falling behind. In addition, she makes you feel as if you were stupid, asking questions and expecting you to know the answer to each and every single of them. Don't take her unless you want a hard time learning organic chemistry.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: As long as you don't go to her office hours, it's fine. She has a nice and approachable teaching style during lectures, but she gets short and quickly agitated when asked for help during office hours. If you know how to do the iClicker problems from class, you should do okay on exams as the questions are very similar.

Leslie has a maternal presence during lectures. Organic is complicated, but her gentle teaching style disproved these misconceptions. It's a crawl before you walk type of class. You can tell she does everything she can share her passion.Though I'm not a Chem major, I got the feeling that people have taken her class and changed their major to Chem.

Amazing chemistry professor! She assigns a ton of YouTube videos in the course study guide. Watch them all before coming to lecture! Pretty much the class consists of solving her old exam problems which are exactly like the actual exams.

B- multiple choice exams, get a decent grade if you study all iclicker and notes. Class is not difficult how it is setup. Dr Leslie's attitude unapproachable rude real Canadian Karen. professor sounds nice addressing the class. 1 on 1 expects you to be chem expert. Looks at you crazy if you ask questions u should know. slight suspicion she racist

She gets easily upset + makes snide remarks when students don't do things exactly to her liking, such as taking too long to solve a problem or asking questions that she thinks shouldn't need explaining. She will likely complain about helping you during office hours & tell you to figure it out by watching YouTube videos rather than asking her.

Exams are similar to in-class problems and I recommend using those to prepare. However, she is not very helpful for additional help outside of class during office hours and can be rude so I recommend using class time wisely.

Professor Leslie does a good job with the organization of her course. She makes organic chemistry so much easier by providing multiple practice questions similar to her exams. In order to do well in her course, I would suggest skimming over textbook sections and practicing iClicker questions. If you get stuck go to her office hours.

I strongly advise you to attend lectures; else, you will most likely not grasp the chapters and will fail. Took 3 midterms and 1 ACS test. I advise attending discussion; the TAs are quite helpful. Ask plenty of questions and don't be hesitant to talk to people around you; they could be going through the same thing you are. Get the help you need.

Professor Leslie is not very helpful. She will yell at you for asking a simple question and loses her temper very quickly and can be just plain rude to students. I would recommend taking this course with a different professor.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Uses the "flipped classroom" model and doesn't do much teaching during class. Lectures don't cover stepwise solutions to problems. Most class time is spent having students struggle through problems on their own, and she throws in some hints. If you want to know how to solve a problem, you have to watch her pre-recorded videos after class.

Best chem professor I've had at this school. Took Chem 8 with her in the spring and taking Chem 100 with her again this summer. Lecture heavy, there's clicker points. Make sure you can draw out the mechanisms for the reactions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: The grading is more than fair but the lectures are very heavy. She talks fast and goes over difficult material quickly, but going over practice problems in the book on your own time make up for it. Just decimate your social life and do practice problems and you'll pass just fine
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Took her for Chem 2 during Fall 2017. Provided great examples and she was great during office hours. The quizzes were multiple choice and were somewhat easy. The lectures were also live so it helped with retaining knowledge. Super chill teacher
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Fantastic professor. Can't give enough priase. Really knows her stuff. I feel obligated to mention that those individuals who claims shes rude were probably on the phones or laptops watching a movie - she doesn't like that nor would you. Pay attention, look alive , and listen to what she's saying and she wont get mad at you.

She is an incredible professor as long as you are willing to work hard. If you really focus in lecture and do the practice problems and homework you will get at least a C in the class with little effort aside from that. She can be very upfront but she never means anything personally. Suck it up and build a rapport with her and you will do very well
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is without a doubt one of the best chem professors here who is able to simplify difficult reactions. However, she talks way too fast during lecture to throw all this new info and expects us to prepare heavily on the midterm days after. She will be unnecessarily uptight towards the slightest and innocuous happenings during lectures and midterms.

If you go to class, study hard and don't distract the rest of the class you will pass. She will call you out for sleeping, being on your phone, or distracting the class but she is a great lecturer. I took this class before and am so happy I had her this time.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you go to class, pay attention to what she is lecturing about and do the practice problems with her, you will definitely learn something from her. You might need to do some extra reading and/or practice problems if you really want to understand the material completely and work for your grade! Her exams are difficult, but fair.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is an amazing professor. She gives easy to follow lectures and does a great job of making a difficult class somewhat easy. Going to class doesn't guarantee you pass, you need to work for your grade. I did every practice problem in the book and had no problem her classes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She puts on a facade that she actually cares about students. She stops teaching to reprimand students for whatever reason and was rude during her office hours. All I can say is she is not a very kind person and you need to study the most you can outside of class to do well.
I was repeating this class, and I learned so much more with her teaching style than the previous instructor. She did alot of examples in class, and always answered any questions we had.
Excellent, clear lectures. You have to work hard for your grade, but it is possible to do well and you will learn lots!!
She is good at lecturing since she does example problems, but can be very rude at times with little remarks during class and in office hours.

Probably the best Organic Chemistry professor this campus has ever had. She will prep you for the ACS, and is passionate about teaching. Other than that, it all comes down to you- practice and more practice will make you good at O. Chem.
Prof. Hundley was very clear in what he's looking for from each student. He really cares about different perspectives and is willing to help whenever it is needed.
How he explains assignments
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I wished I had him in an actually class and got to know how he was cause he seems like a caring professor. His assignments are very simple and easily manageable. All the feedback he gives is very useful. After this class I feel like a confident writer. Definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Hundley is an amazing professor! His class was something to look forward to (even though it was Mondays at 7:30 am). Every day was exciting and really made you think. His grading was fair: do the assignments you get the grade. If you're going to be taking his course, prioritize time management and you're good. Questionable preferences in baseball.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: The professor didntbgive any helpful criticism on any essay, even when we had conferences. My papers were graded super tough, when no help was given. The class didnt actually do much, just analyzed 2 boring books all semester. Advanced writing was the class that I took, wish I didnt even try in this class. I put so much effort in.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Professor Hundley engages students in class and tries to get students to participate. Participation is graded so participate! Mae sure you attend class as homework is turned in class at the beginning or the end and you get a 0 if not turned in when collected. Go to office hours and take feedback on essays seriously. Doesn't give extra credit often!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I loved Professor Hundley!! His WRI001 class was difficult, but not impossible to pass. If you stay on top of the reading logs, and try your best on your essays you can succeed. Also, (like all Writing classes) attendance is mandatory because if you miss 6 classes you have to either Withdraw or take an F. All in all, I definitely recommend Hundley!

Almost impossible to get an A. His grading is very objective and doing the work won't itself won't just get you full credit your work must be "outside the box". Miss one assignment because you're late and your grade will will never be the same. Also very sarcastic and talks too much politics. Participation matters too!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: John is probably one of the nicest professors at UC Merced. He wouldn't hurt a fly. Genuinely good person. He's super helpful, willing to work with you and negotiate grades if needed. Make sure you do the homework though or you won't pass. Even skipping one assignment will drop your grade, I learned that the hard way.

Great professor, gives feedback on all your papers. Will also help your grade by giving extra credit. He engages students in discussions and doesn't grade that hard. He's an awesome professor. Would highly recommend it.

Clear instructions, a lot of reading, but is doable.  Great feedback.  Focuses on "how to write" starting with sentences, structures, and organization.  Gives you the choice on what to write about, and who to work with when working in groups.
good professor

I took a creative writing/anthropology course with him. I really enjoyed the class structure which was relaxed. I thought he graded a little tough but I liked that he gave us the opportunity to fix mistakes and resubmit our assignments if we were unhappy with our score. Always avalible for office hours. Overall a good and effective teacher!
He was a great teacher. Grades very fairly and kept his class interesting. The novels in class are also interesting, which made my experience more a breeze. Take his class!

I feel as if he plays favorites. If he likes you, he will be more lenient with grading. I highly suggest actively participating in class discussions and to be prompt both with attendance and homework.

Professor Hundley is awesome! Not only that, he keeps the class pretty entertained. He's funny and his grading is not so bad. The novels and the short stories are interesting. There are quite a few essays and reading responses but that's what you expect out of an English class. I would really recommend taking his class.
unfair grading..
He is unfear grading.
Hundley's awesome. He is so relaxed, and he has a great sense of humor. On top of that, he is crystal clear during lectures, so chances are you won't be asking many questions.
He is a VERY unfair grader. Doesn't know what he's doing in class. Hippocratic professor.
Nice teacher, but a harsh grader.  He's not that interesting, but he tries his best.
Great professor! Very interesting to listen to and simple to understand. Compliments you when you make a good observation. I have him for Core 1 and he's my favorite professor so far.

Very nice and patient guy. Always willing to help. Attendence is very important and doesn't accept late work. Go to office hour if you need any help. It will be very useful. His hw and class work isn't hard, just time consuming sometimes. I took him for Wri 01 and 10. I really liked him a lot.

Very helpful to students coming in to office hours, but also a very critical grader(Make sure essays and work are spotless in order to ward off loss of nit-picky points!). Soft spoken but is understanding and makes class instruction clear.
Great teacher. Very patient and understanding. Doesn't accept late work but always willing to help. Class attendence is very important. Work load a bit heavy, but if you do your work, you'll be fine.
Okay teacher. Tries his best. Harsh grading. He is helpful that he is willing to look at your work ahead of due day and help you improve it. Take him at your own risk or benefit.
Very creative instructor...but homework much too extensive. Unfair grading.
No Comments
No Comments
He's a a good teacher. The homework is a little much but my writing skills have are a lot better then they were the first day of school.
He's pretty interesting. The workload is somewhat high, so you shouldn't procrastinate.

I got a D in this writing class due to my own habit of procrastination. You have to try to fail this course, and can easily be passed if you just stand up for yourself. Ask questions, turn in work on time, look at the grading criteria that she provides you and you should be set to pass. Loved her!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She was chill at first but gives so much homework its so unnecessary that she did tho. for instance we did an assignment from September and she give it to us again in November to redo the assignment. like it was so much BS in her class. she aint all that. don't take her class.

Do not take her if you want days off. She gives lots of work load and doesn't chill with it. She grades the work very heavy so make sure to do your assignments. She didn't round my grade up and I attended every lecture I was at an 82 and she couldn't put a 83 because she was petty.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Do Not Recommend! One of the worst teachers I have ever encountered in UC Merced. This teacher will not accept any reasoning to why students struggle to understand her. This teacher demands respect as a Dr., when everyone knows she does not deserve that title. SHE WILL CLAIM THAT STUDENTS DON'T LISTEN when she fails as an instructor. Stay away.
Very unjust & unfair.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Worst teacher at UCM, without question.  Super passive-aggressive. I overheard her gossiping about a student who didn't do very well in the class to her teacher's pet during office hours.  Believe it or not this is my first A- and was the reason I lost my 4.0 bc we had an argument and ofc I finished with .11 of a percent from the curve to get an A.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She's quite passive aggressive and punishes you quite a bit for little mistakes. God forbid you try to be creative on how you write your essays because if she gets confuse on one word then that like 20 of 50 points off your score. Also you need to be very specific of what you're talking about (Ex: games? what kind? Board games or video games?).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Harsh to some students and a tough grader. I wouldn't recommend taking her class, readings' done for the class were okay. Feedback to submitted assignments were okay but weren't helpful when revising my essays. There's a lot of working on your own which class got repetitive at times and didn't feel worth it staying for the entire lecture.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: this professor does too much when the course is literally just writing 1. do not recommend taking when there are  other professors who are much more tolerable. if you like your subjective courses being taught by someone almost authoritarian then this is the class for you!

Overall,easy class as long as you show up every day and turn in assignments ON-TIME.  The problem with this class is her "my way or the highway" attitude.  She can never be wrong and is EXTREMELY passive-aggressive, and will claim you weren't listening.  Get on her good side, especially men or else she will actively make the class harder for you.

her class is easy, you just need to participate and attend classes. make sure you do your homework assigned before class or she won't accept it after class. she is really passive aggressive towards students for nitpicky things like wearing your earphones in class or taking a phone call for .2 seconds unless you kiss up to her by participating alot
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: A very tough professor that can be a hit or miss depending on who you are as a student. She loves people who participate a lot and kiss up to her. She isn't very clear about what she wants out of an assignment and although she is accessible outside of class she isn't very easy to approach. Very passive aggressive and would not take again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I would say that the lectures were kind of boring because it was just listening to her talk and sometimes she'd repeat herself but the topics were interesting. For the assignments, I'd say that they were pretty straightforward and she was an easy grader. As long as you follow the prompt of the assignment you'd get a good grade.
I loved her!! Her class was pretty easy and she hardly gave us any homework! If you turn something in late she does not take any points away. She is super understanding!

She was so accessible to her students when we needed 1-1 help. She does leave work due weakly but its nothing difficult. Readings were interesting so it wasn't hard to pay attention. She can be a difficult grader at times and will know when you don't try on your papers. it would be difficult not to pass the class, makes it really easy to pass.

Tried to drop the class because it was to much to do with a full time job and an additonal 18 units. Said no, asked once more for her signature and said i was holding up a spot in her class all semester that her past students could have taken. Loves kiss ups and has favorites
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Horrible Professor Period. Avoid at all cost. Did everything asssignment still got a B.

Definitely a challenging prof! She grades essays very harshly and expects a lot from you. However, if you go to her office hours and ask her to read your essay and give you feedback that's exactly what she does. She will read your entire paper and make a ton of suggestions for you.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: There is short readings and then a reflection and then the essays and essay if you rewrite them about three times and get help from the writing center and you'll pass! Good luck!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: mean to some students
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She's the best professor for writing. Even though she may be a tough grader, she does it for best interest in her students. Her class is based on the liking of the students, meaning that you wont be bored at her class. Her assignments are mostly reading two page articles that are easy and a lot of essays. But pretty chill professor. Very understand

I had Bohrer for WRI 001 the semester prior, but Fenstermaker is by far much better. She seems very enthusiastic and involved. I like how we had legitimate debates/discussions for each essay or topic as well as frequent peer feedback. I learned a lot about rhetorical modes and how to revise. She makes writing class great again.
Had her once help me with a translation of a letter written by her in French. Easily the most interesting Professor I've ever met.  Would love to be in her class.
Kind of humorous, but tends to shut some students down. Portrays herself as someone who's easygoing but grades harshly. Doesn't particularly like hearing opposing views, not flexible.
She makes you write a lot of essays and grades them really hard.  You will always have homework even on your break.

I had her for wri10 this semester and I highly recommend. Her assignments are pretty straightforward. However, if you don't understand something you have to ask because she will not sit around and ask if you need anything. Pretty easy class. Her feedback isn't very useful though.

One of the best writing instructors I've had. She is down-to-earth, flexible, and helpful, as long as you approach her. Although she has a PhD in Literature, she doesn't stick it in your face and keeps class discussion interesting with whimsical comments and anecdotes! I'd love to have her again.

Hands down the best writing professor I have had during my time at UC Merced. She absolutely knows what she is doing and she is able to exert it on her students in an engaging yet academic way. Although her class is not a walk in the park, the outcome of her class is worth the challenege.
This professor was amazing. She made the class fun, and was always so helpful. Take a class with her! you won't regret it.

Dr. Fenstermaker is great. There is no reason for not improving writing skills in that class even if you are a good writer to begin with. Discussions are always very interesting as well. She is a great teacher and really nice to get to know so go by office hours or talk to her after class!

She is an amazing and hilarious professor! She is really easy to talk to and definitely helps you. My writing really improved because of her. she offers a lot of constructive criticism and exercises to help you with your essays. She is tough grader, but if you work hard, you can definitely get a good grade.
She taught at the U of R, she was a tough grader, Very nice tho, easy to talk to. You have to work to earn your grade, no freebees
Very good professor and had enjoyable lectures. Lots of extra credit given but you need to attend class for it. She's very funny and one of my favorite classes I've taken.

This professor is very nice :). Gives extra credit during lecture a lot. I had 50 extra credit for a 200 score exam. Some people had 80 extra credit. The exams are all based on the lectures, so if you take notes on the lectures and study them, you should be fine.

Dusty is a very good Professor recommend taking her class for chem 01. She gives extra credit which is good for the midterms and quizzes with low grades. She lets you use a periodic table during discussion when you have quiz. Attend her office hours given that she always goes over the material that will be covered on the midterms and quizzes.

Absolutely love this professor. She knows how to teach and is very engaging. To pass the class I would recommend working with Aleks and also doing your own research on things you don't understand. Methods of teaching from Dusty are effective. Would love if she taught chem 010 or any upper division chem.
she is great professor, she gives many chances of extra credit and is funny, and lets you use a periodic table for quizzes.

The best professor you will ever have!! She is very enthusiastic and helpful in her lectures. Not only does she have slides prepared, but she also gives example problems and helps you through them. She lets you know what is expected in her quizzes and gives you tips to do well! Very accessible and approachable, do not hesitate to take her class!

Dusty has a very energetic and unique personality! Her lectures were very engaging and I would get used to reading line structures because she hates drawing Lewis structures. Our grade was based on taking notes, weekly quizzes, and a poster project. She offered a lot of extra credit opportunities, which was distributed to your lowest quiz grades.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: hands down one of the best professors at UC Merced. Caring, kind, and resourceful; she makes learning fun and enjoyable. although she is strict, she is accessible to all her students, and will provide opportunities for extra credit as well! 100/10 rating. just pay attention to lectures, ask questions, and attend her office hours, and you'll do fine
She's a great professor and made chem easy to understand and gives a lot of extra credit. We have weekly quizzes as review and she was always available for office hours.

She's a great professor and is very funny! She also keeps things very real which I respect. Chemistry is really tough and she does not sugarcoat it. I think her being real and being funny is just an overall great experience as her student.

She's an outgoing person & makes her lectures interesting. The textbook & homework are online & the concepts are on the weekly quizzes & tests. Discussions include a group quiz & group presentation but it's easy to pass both. It's not hard to pass the class with a good grade, even if you don't like Chem. There's also opportunities for extra credit.

Dusty offers extra credit almost every week. She wants students to do well and the material reflects that. The later the weeks go on, the harder the quizzes. As long as you study, an A should be super easy to achieve.

FACTS ABOUT PRE-CHEM W/ DUSTY:
- Lecture NOT mandatory 
- Canvas is organized 
- quick to respond to emails 
- discussion is MANDATORY
- Drops homework, a quiz, and may drop a lab report 
- Ton of Extra credit opportunities
- A is possible if you put in the effort 
Dusty is a funny spontaneous professor, she genuinely wants her students to succeed

dusty was really chill - she always brought her dog, and she also offered extra credit either through practice problems via kahoot or just something she came up with toward the end of lecture. 10/10, really nice, patient, super funny, and she brings her dog and you can pet it too. btw this was chem 001(prep chem) so the class wasnt awfully hard

idk something about dusty makes me actually enjoy chem. She explains everything really well and has fun while doing so. sometimes she brings her dog to discussions as well. dusty was definitely one of the most influential teachers I've had and it's even motivated me to take on being an la for chem 1 next semester!

Chemistry isn't my favorite subject, but Dusty really made it fun. The lecture isn't mandatory, but I highly recommend going since she teaches really well, and she's really funny. I always look forward to attending her class. The ACS exam totally sucked, but she curved it a lot, which was really generous. I highly recommend her!

Dusty was a really amazing professor to have, I highly recommend taking chemistry with her. Her lectures and office hours are helpful, she goes over pre-lab questions and practice questions for the quizzes and midterms. Also gives major hippie vibes, which ties it all nicely together.

She's super entertaining in lectures. While attendance for lectures isn't mandatory, I'd really reccomend it. She gives extra tips and works out quiz problems/test problems and homework problems sometimes. She also gives out a lot of extra credit. Her tests are somewhat difficult but with the extra credit and practice she gives, you'll be fine.

One of the best professors in the whole joint. I literally came by to tell her that I was dropping the class (has nothing to do w my major) and she said that she already approved the class withdrawal. It was a pleasure to exchange the few words I had with her. In all honesty, I would take the class next semester just for her.

Dusty showed me that otherwise mechanical and meaningless science is quite magical. Molecular orbital theory freaked me out. . . but she anthropomorphized the concept and then it became magical. "I never met a female atom", she'd say. If you have her around you're lucky. She's super smart/really funny. Very easy on the eyes I might add.
Put in some effort, you should be good. She's hella cool and fun. She is very knowledgeable but you need to ask for help if you need it. Overall easy class.

Dusty is a really nice and understanding professor. Make sure to go to her lectures for extra credit. It's a real grade booster (boosted my grade by 4%). If you do the homework, you will most likely do well on the quizzes. She had no midterms or final (the final being the ACS which will not count in your grade).

Overall, Dusty is a good teacher. She tries to make the lectures interesting and the homework that she assigns correlates well with her quizzes. She cancelled class a lot which was a little annoying when we would have a quiz that week, but besides that her class was fine. Make sure to understand the homework because the concepts are tested.

Best STEM professor I've had so far at the university. She makes concepts as easy to understand as possible, and she clearly cares about her students. LOTS of extra credit opportunity which saved my butt. Gives plenty of resources to better understand material (and you will DEFINITELY need to use them). Overall, great teacher!

I didnt have Dusty, but I would attend her office hours and she is amazing! She covers the material we need to know for midterms, quizzes, and labs. Shes so funny and charismatic, if you attend her office hours or have her as a TA make sure to look for the flavors.  Shes the best at teaching, answers all questions as well!
Dusty is a great TA. She is super down to earth and really helps you understand material.

She is an alright lab teacher. Had her for Chem2A lab with Proffesor Tenn. She is a cool teacher and is pretty chill towards her students. But sometimes I get a feeling that she doesn't really pay attention to the quiet students, mainly towards those who are just talkative.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dusty is an amazing professor when she taught over the summer. She made it easier to grasp! She had helpful office hours and she is really passionate with ochem!

Dusty is a great lab Ta!! She is very helpful and is there for her students. She along with the help of Jason Hein of course, helped me to understand Organic Chemistry like no other. They were the major reason why I passed the class. She always clarifies the labs, tells you what you need to do to pass, and is just a fun Lab TA in general.
Excellent TA! Very enthusiastic about the subject and is great at teaching. Highly recommend attending office hours because it will help you pass the class!
Most helpful TA for Chemistry. Does not accept half-hearted effort on work though, so make sure to try your best in your work or you will not get a good grade.

One of the best professors I have ever had. Shes very passionate about her work. Can get off track sometimes but I find that cool. Helps stimulate. Lots of peer discussions so be ready to talk to people. Lots and lots of writing but very doable. Gives INCREDIBLE feedback. Final was just showing her your digital organization.
Very solid teacher, I feel my writing abilities increased immensely in her class and I really enjoyed the individual care she puts into each student!

She does a great job teaching, Mrs. Winek exceeds in lectures and has the classroom feel like home. Her feedback is very helpful, she is very passionate in her teaching and helping her students achieve success. I would recommend her class to anyone wanting to take a Writing 10 class especially in the Pre Health-Field.
there is no need to purchase a textbook becuz she always requires the free version. truly a respected teacher for her work in class and her dedication to students well being outside of class

Professor Winek is amazing during lectures, very engaging & hilarious at times. She really cares about her students and is super accessible outside of class. I went to her OH all the time & always got great feedback on my papers. I dont think I would have done as well in Core if she wasnt my prof! Definitely recommend her as a prof!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Required textbook had nothing to do with writing. Little lecturing on writing, heavy lecturing on politics. Professor Winek thought it was a California history class. Attending class made me feel like I was watching CNN.
Professor winek was one of my best professors! We had two presentations on zoom and the they were easy ! Great professor overall helped build confidence and a better writer
rating_tags: Participation matters--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She could be very inconsiderate and rude to some students, such as myself, or she could be super caring to others. Overall, though she did a good job at some stuff however she was really rude when it came to me asking questions about policies or homework assignments. I had enjoyed all my professors at Merced but by far she has been the worst.

Professor Winek is very inspiring and interested. She does not fail to bring passion into everything she gives to her students. Youll pass with a high grade if you come to class ready to discuss the assigned readings and stay engaged throughout the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Winek is seriously one of my favorite professors. And by favorite, I mean, she's funny, cool, hilarious and relatable. I never missed her class because she was always very enthusiastic and energetic and so full of life (even at 7:30 in the morning). Truly an AMAZING professor that really cares for all her students to succeed in life.

Professor Winek has been one of my favorite Professors at UCM so far. She is enthusiastic about the material and extremely organized, which I always appreciate. She cares deeply about not only her students' success in the classroom but also their well-being outside of class. I went to many office hours and she helped me blossom as a writer.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: WInek is an AWESOME professor! Not only is she a great instructor, but an awesome human. She is kind and really cares for students. Go to class, if she notices kids are missing she throws a pop quiz. Also don't wear pajamas to class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: Prof winek was a great professor. She cares for her students and makes sure that each person understands the guidelines of each assignment. She is very enthusiastic and an make you want to learn even at 7 IN THE MORNING! I recommend her!

She is a great and caring professor. Now that the semester is nearing its end, I reflect upon my skills as a writer and see the significant growth. There will be four essays throughout the semester and other assignments in between, nothing drastic or too time consuming. Going to her office hours is very helpful if you really want to improve.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is very close to Merced so good choice if you're a first year. At first, she may seem intimidating, but by the end of the semester you'll love her. As long as you go to class and do the assignments, it's an easy A. Go to office hours for feedback, she is very approachable. Stay on track and you'll love the class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class is actually pretty great, it is set up so that even if you don't do amazing on the essays you can still pass with a B or higher. Winek is really sweet as well. Do your readings or the pop quizzes can catch you off guard. I really like how put together and excited she is for this class, even at 7:30 in the morning
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Good Core professor, but is probably the hardest one. My friends always talked about their discussions having no quizzes and that core is an easy A. In our discussion we had a weekly response due every Sunday, when our lecture was on Thursday. Every assignment we did like Quants, Essays, and weekly responses were due a week before any other instruc
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Attending office hours is very important. Make sure u turn in all of the weekly journals and owl at Purdue assignment cause those are ESAY points. Dont expect 2 write an essay the night before and get an A. There'S 4 essays, get at least 40/50 on each one, do all the small assignments and u'll get  an A. You can't miss class, Read you'll be quizzed
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: She's a nice person, but she kinda tends to make her discussions into lectures. Beware of group projects and papers!!!

Angela is my favorite professor in UCM. She managed to make a boring class (CORE) into something fun and inspirational. All my friends complained about the class, but I never had an issue with it. Angela is a great professor because she genuinely cares for the students and the class. She's passionate, caring, and just a wonderful person to know!

I loved Angela Winek for my Core professor.  Seeing her in office hours I feel definitely saved my grade, especially when it came to the high stakes essays we have to write.  I highly recommend her. She gives five random quizzes worth four points which in the long run do help your grade so read!
She was very helpful in getting you to become a better writer. She is also very good looking so that made class that much more interesting!

For WRI 010, her class was based around discussions—read the assigned chapters beforehand, and you will be prepared. She's very enthusiastic to the point that it might have been over-energetic, especially for the morning class I had with her. Overall fun class and professor who has earned her stripes to be a professor. She has a valley girl accent.
Very good and enthusiastic teacher. Makes the class more engaging and gets students involved.

Angela is such an amazing professor. Her discussions are stimulating and she really makes you think. She's a tough, but fair grader. She applies the course lessons to everyday life. Definitely go to her office hours and get to know her, trust me, she's awesome. Warning: she has four point quizzes on readings every now and then.  I miss her class!!!
Very engaging and enthusiastic teacher. Recommend
She is super easy but you do learn a lot in her class and she really gets you to thinking about the world

Really involved in the course and super enthusiastic. Can be a  bit intimidating if you are a shy person since she is really into class discussions and likes to hear from everyone. She is a good instructor though. You will learn a lot.

Great professor, gets really involved with her class and discussions. Kinda tends to shut down the other point of view if it gets too controversial. Fun to argue with if you can back up  your points. Would definitely recommend if possible.

She is a great professor. However, she doesn't respond to emails and would say harsh comments about students. Be ready when you share your opinion and back it up as she wants to know how much of it you know. Reading in this class matters. All the readings build up onto each other. Annotations are 1-2 a week with a discussion post that follows. APA.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Lacks responses via email, you will be confused for most of the part.

I loved the subject (Latinx in Film), I learned a lot of information and it stuck with me. However, Mrs. Ruiz is unorganized and unclear. There were times when the entire class was confused and she would not explain further. She grades unfairly even if you did the work right and does not answer emails quickly. Needs to be clearer with assignments.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Iris repeatedly revised the requirements and standards for her course to the point where I was confused as to what was expected of me. Her weekly quizzes had little to do with the assigned material and she was inaccessible via email. Iris also stated the class would have no online meetings yet changed her mind halfway into the semester. 0/10
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: She is SO unorganized

comment: Dr. Ruiz had a clear framework for how to advise the course to ensure that work was completed and that students were on the right track. We were able to build skills that last a lifetime. Dr. Ruiz was there for her students throughout the course and committed time outside of class to ensure that the class succeeded.

I really enjoyed her Spark class. The semester was a hectic because of events beyond her control. She is very passionate about the subject and creates great conversation in class. The only thing is her assignments are not very clear but she is available outside of class for clarification.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Ruiz is an amazing person and professor! She really cares about the topics we address in class and is always up for personal discussion. If you are interested in social justice, I suggest you take her SPARK class (Intersectionality and New Media). The assignments are fun and set you up to pursue advocacy even after leaving her class.
Dr. Ruiz style of teaching done in a way that is comprehensible and pleasant to learn. I Highly recommend this class if you want to improve your writing. She's a fantastic Professor!
Dr. Ruiz is an amazing professor that effectively teaches intersectionality. There is lots of reading and writing throughout the course, but all manageable.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: THE HARDEST CLASS I EVER TAKEN! Professor is very petty.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great professor was accessible outside the classroom. The readings are not hard but it's important to stay on top of the assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Iris Ruiz is a great professor. she is very understanding, nice, and chill. honestly I liked her class a lot you do learn but in the same time its not a difficult class at all.

Many of my classmates and I would tend to be confused throughout the entire semester because of last minute changes or things that weren't clarified that well for certain assignments. The topics we went over were relevant and worthwhile. Although I most likely wouldn't take another class with her,  I found Dr. Ruiz to be an understanding person.

Dr. Ruiz is a very helpful professor and she is there for all of her students. She does her best to help the students to the best of her ability given that she is teaching a course like CORE. She provides a great experience in this class and your cooperation only makes it better.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Ruiz made the class both interesting and tolerable. She was always open for discussion and allowed everyone an opportunity to talk. She never shot anyone's ideas down and was always supportive.  Some assignments were ambiguous but this professor let you reinvent the assignment and if you had a solid argument she graded you on that.
She is very tough and unclear at first but once you get used to her style of teaching you will learn a lot. You are going to gain how much you put in to this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: the topics discussed are related to real-world situations, the class is structured to allow everybody's opinion to be counted and teaches you more about life

Amazing professor, passionate about the subject. She was kind of a tough grader, but it was only to help us. I loved Chicano Studies and would take it again if I could. She will definitely teach you a lot, but make sure you read so you can participate and stay engaged! She is there for you and makes class interesting and easy to relate to.

She was an ok Chicano Studies teacher.  My only real complaint is for a time the class devolved into a course about fighting for the Chicano Studies major which, while noble, was neither going to be tested nor help us in the class.  If you do take her class, read, but keep in mind that you wont get what she's testing until her study guide.

I took this professor and if I'm taking the time to write about her its because shes great. As a person and a teacher she is always straight forward and tells you exactly what you need to pass the class. There are weekly reading but breezing through them enough to contribute in class (participation matters) will allow you to do just great!

Ruiz is willing to give you feedback and is always open to discussion. There's an acceptable amount of work and you can't breeze through but you'll thank her for the skills you'll earn. The writing skills I've learned in this class have helped me tremendously in classes that require writing. I recommend her to everyone I know. Also, NO PORTFOLIIO!

As an incoming freshman I had the privilege of having Iris as a professor and now as my mentor.She is friendly and approachable inside and outside of the classroom. I quickly learned of her continuous eagerness to help her students with coursework.She is a great professor and I would definitely take her classes again if she taught upper divison!

Dr.Iris Ruiz is really a great professor, and one of the best that I have had while at the university (not exaggerating). Dr. Ruiz is very clear on what she expects from her students. The homework/reading assignments aren't difficult but they do take time. I really felt comfortable in class. I highly recommend you take a class with Dr. Iris Ruiz!

This Professor kept me on my toes. Her class was challenging but very helpful. I did not feel comfortable at all beginning this class and towards the end I really improved. Only downside is that instructions were not always quite clear and it was a big load at times. However, I am definitely prepared for any future writing classes.
Professor is an great professor, but needs to improve in being clear with all assignments. Also, to not add things last minute to an essay or go over board with the work load.

I had professor Ruiz for core and the first thing I noticed was she was a professor of color which our school dramatically lacks. Even though I am an African American student this was still awesome. I liked discussions in her class because she challenged us to think on more than just one dimension! She is relatable as well!! -ashley matthews
She is definitely a very fun and dynamic teacher!  Very easy to approach and relate to.  As long as do your work and participate (ask questions) you will succeed in her class!

She's a very nice teacher, very understanding to your situation and eager to help you, as long as you help yourself and try. Make sure to talk to her before an assignment is due, just to double check you're giving her what she's looking for.

She gives very detailed feedback, and going to her office hours is very helpful. Her lectures are always interesting, but participating in class is very important if you don't want to do quizzes. Overall she is a great professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Mrs. Abuan is a very understanding person. She understands the stress one can go through throughout college. She can be a tough grader, but she will always give you feedback and will allow you to redo the essays. There are workshops to get help and learn more on how you could improvement. I really recommend taking a writing course with her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Not sure if attendance is mandatory but always show up as much as possible anyways. Because I know what it's like not to. Go to office hours if you need help!!!!! Especially with the annotated bibliography. Talk to her first about office hours.

ASK FOR HELP.  A great professor that seems scary and strict but will help you if you ask. The annotated bibliography can be pretty vague of an assignment, so basically find something that's like a topic (Ex: underrespresented group in careers or Ex: obstacles in career for group of people). You can do ANYTHING but this guideline finds more sources
rating_tags: Participation matters--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: Personally, I would never have her as my professor again. She was rude and wasn't professional at some points of the semester. Her office hours were no help. rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Took sprk for f2020 and it was an okay class. She didn't really seem like she knew what she was doing and was making the schedule up as we went. Lots of reading!

Professor Abuan is great. Her sense of humor may not always be the best but she is a great person and professor. Make sure you are ready to read really long passages and expect a quiz- but may be in groups :) She assigns homework that is easy and is really accessible. Would recommend for SPRK, although it is not Black Mirror for the Spring course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: At first, I was a bit nervous to be in her class. I did not understand her humor to much and the work felt difficult but after attending office hours I understood her point of view a lot better and had a great time in the class. Her office hours was always busy with students but she always found time for everyone. Very constructive feedback. 10/10

Mrs. Abuan is an amazing Writing teacher, her class is hard, and you will have to work harder than you ever have before in a writing course, but she is always willing to help you as long as you put in the work and you will be amazed as to how much your writing will improve. She also somewhat has a sense of humor which always made class interesting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Abuan makes you work harder than you ever have before. You usually take her the first year and she doesn't hold back on grades. Most of my class failed mid semester and left the semester with D, or even F's. Do not take her if you don't want to work. She has dry humor and makes you print out multiple things a week for this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: At first, I was iffy about her because she came off as rude. However, her teaching style taught me a lot. Her class consists mainly of group work and presentations, but it is easy to get used to if you just participate. Her office hours were extremely helpful as well.

Abuan was definitely one of the best teachers I've had here at UCM. Many of the students thought she was too harsh of a teacher but honestly as long as you're doing the readings & going to class & you'll be fine. She'd always help me when I needed the help and she definitely allowed me to better myself as a writer, which is the ultimate goal .
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I took her my first year in college, and she has been the best english/writing teacher i have ever taken. Her instructions for her essays were so clear to be, as well as the readings. The readings are too long, but she has the class set up similar to a socratic, so be ready to share your thoughts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Need to go to class all the time. Go to office hours before you turn in final paper. There is about 4 readings per week but if people talk to her she will reduce it. No participation in discussion quizzes. There is about 4 papers. She can seem intimidating but shes just trying to be professional. She is actually funny and relatable.

I was surprised that most of these ratings were so low, Abuan was a great. She can grade hard, but once you get used to her grading style and requirements, which are reasonable, it is easy to pass this class. You can write about almost anything for essays, and she will help you find a way to relate it to the prompt. She is also very approachable.

Ms. Abuan might scare you away on the first day of class, but I kid you not sticking around was one of the best decisions I've made my first year. This class isn't an easy A, but if you speak up, ask for help, and do all that she asks you can definitely pass. She's super funny and she's very nice.

If you're looking for an easy class, don't take this professor. HOWEVER, why else would you be going to a research university? She's an amazing professor who has a dark but interesting sense of humor. Definitely someone who will help improve your writing. She made me really work my ass off for my grade, but she really does improve your writi
She's very indecisive and doesn't care about the students

Ms. Abuan may seem like a tough grader at first but once you get used to her grading system, it is possible to learn from one's own writing mistakes as it helped me improve my writing. Remember, this is college. if you do well or want to improve your writing, this is the section for you.

This teacher sucks. She gives no chance to the students to succeed. She does not tell you how she grades essays then will give you a d for citing something not to her standard. She will also fail you for stupid stuff like not bolding your thesis. Steer Clear she sucks.
Worst professor I have had and will ever have, avoid her.

Abuan is a tough grader. She deducts points for format. I struggled so much throughout her class. For my mid semester grade I received an F however I ended up with a B. I began by going to her office hours and eventually my grade went up tremendously. I recommend to go to her office hours from the beginning.

Please just go talk to her outside of class! Getting to know her students personally is a vital key to succeed in her class! As long as you follow her rubrics and talk to her during office hours, you will do well. She is an exceptional teacher and these poor ratings are ridiculous. Ms. Abuan will teach you a lot and her classes are fun!
Good Professor!
Extremely rude and awkward. The class is boring due to her dry sense of humor and unwillingness to teach. Avoid her at all costs.

She is amazing and really works with her students, especially during office hours. ALl you need to do is participate and show that you need help. She is always willing to help and she can make the class fun if you participate. Learned a lot more than any other writing professors here at UCM.

She is so vague about her critique on essays! I would get a D and she wouldn't even explain to me what I did wrong! She has a bad attitude towards her students also. She would complain that we didn't participate and once we did she would ignore our comments! Rude and terribly unprofessional!

The class won't be challenging if you learn on your own. During lectures, she tends to go on tangents and overexplains to the point it confuses everyone. However, she does care for her students and is accessible for office hours to help out.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Reshma is one of the best professors I have had. This class is indeed pretty difficult but Reshma is such a nice and sweet person that she will work with you is super helpful in office hours. Very clear explaining the material, example problems, and concepts.

I would not recommend Reshma. She doesn't grade things for weeks, or months, so when calculating your grade, it can be frustrating waiting to see what she grades. There will be a quiz almost every week, and lectures are mandatory. You get 3 free passes, and other than that you are doomed! Don't take for your own sanity
She said she would not give us a final or midterm. But will give 10 quizzes throughout the semester. Also homework is a lot. I would say just go straight to Calculus, I wish I would've done that.

Talks so loud and fast. Hard to understand what she is actually saying. Jumps around a lot and often confuses you. Lectures are not organized; doesn't provide any notes/slides or anything before class, expected to sit there and listen to her just say a bunch of stuff. Not ideal for a math class, only a few people actually know what's going on

Please don't take this professor. She is super unorganized and tends to ramble and yap (over explain) a lot during lecture, making the concepts more difficult and confusing than they already are. grades attendance in BOTH lecture and discussion

comment: ez class imo

If you actually do the homeworks(delta math) yourself the tests are much easier. WORST PROF. DO NOT TAKE. I could have passed this class because I was actually 2 percent away to get a C minus. I email her if she could do something about it and she said she couldn't even though clearly I had better quiz score also she took the only extra credit she gave us. Also usually when you get credit its 5/0 but for her she did 5/5.

I would say Professor Reshma was a good professor indeed. Her class is difficult but if you study the material she gives and practice outside resources, you should get a good grade in the class. Not good at lecturing,she'll do 2 problems then youll do the rest with a group she makes you pair up with.Youll teach yourself everything, watch youtube. Exams are rough, averages always failing. Class is very well organized though, had 3 grading schemes. Curved grades at the end of the semester since everyone was failing. She's very kind too.

Lectures weren't very helpful as she preferred for us to learn it ourselves instead of her going through the basics first, quizzes were asking us questions that we haven't seen yet due to earlier discussions and graded the same as the rest of the classes. Course was a mess on her behalf. Overall very bad :(
AftLectures are not mandatory but extremely helpful I def

Don't understand all of the negative reviews. Yes the lectures were heavy but if you find someone who actually wants to work through the problem with you then you'll be fine. She's also very good at explaining topics clearly, and the undergraduate Learning Assistants there helping students help as well. Really good professor.
Just read the reviews. AVOID this class if you get this prof, just take it in summer or the following semester.

Despite all the bad reviews, she isn't as bad as people are saying. Don't get me wrong she isn't the best but getting a good grade in this class is definitely achievable as long as you do the homework and thoroughly review the study guides. The class did seem a bit disorganized at times and tests make up a good chunk of the grade.

She's not a terrible professor, but she's not a very good one. The lectures are weird because we spend a lot of time working with the people besides us, even tho everyone is confused. You'll pass the class (barely) if you genuinely try. The study guides are helpful, but on the midterms, there's always one question thats unnecessarily hard

People leave bad reviews after finals obviously. Despite all of those, Reshma is an amazing professor and actually understands that students do better at different things. Her different schemes genuinely boosted my grades. Also, she really does care about her students and checked in to make sure I was okay after not showing up to lecture. Amazing.

Prof Menon is currently getting review-bombed because a large group of her students cheated for the entire semester, she caught them, and now they're angry that their actions have consequences.
Reshma is arguably the best professor I've ever had, she teaches a very hard course and makes it seem easy. Her class was an absolute pleasure to be in.

This professor was HORRIBLE. It didn't make sense how her class was structured, and often times I had to self teach myself because of how homework didn't correlate with her exams. On top of that, she changed her grading system last minute into the semester so I'm afraid I have to retake the class. Don't take her unless you want to fail, I MEAN IT!

I am generally positive when it comes to rate my, but unless she changes the structure of her class I would advise against taking it. given the current state of the class I will give it a 2/5. reshma clearly cares for the class. of you do end up taking this clas I reccomend going to officr hours to fully understand the topic.

These reviews aren't the best but the teacher is ok. Her lecture teaching type of style isn't the best and she could certainly improve. If you want extra help, she will do her best to help you, go to office hours and such. This first semester for her was rough, and she should change her teaching style. Class is fairly easy if you put in the work.

The teacher is hands down one of the worst teaching experiences I have ever had she does not teach in her lectures. She talks too much and is not related to the topic at hand. She expects you to understand the topic fast and goes way too fast. She makes you do group work but the whole lecture attendance doesn't know anything. DO NOT TAKE CLASS.

Horrible structure, would learn something new in a lecture and then be quizzed on it the same week. Would have to do group worksheets with others in the lecture, a waste of time if did not study topic beforehand. Graded harshly, the average for class midterms would be around 40%. Would not recommend this professor to others.
Hard teacher wouldn't recommend taking again.

AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS. her lectures consist of her going to fast on her ipad,  passing out worksheets and makes people work in groups. majority of people around you have no clue what to do either. Her study guides are nothing like the exams, and literally impossible to pass. The average for each exam was about a 43%. first midterm gave me PTSD.

Lectures are too fast-paced and feel like discussion sections with the worksheets she always hands out. Also vague on way too many things such as midterm topics and a D1 yapper; majority of the first half of lectures are her talking about stuff not related to lecture or even the subject. Did I mention she makes her midterms damn-near impossible.

She is not a good professor. It took her till half the semester to actually start giving lectures, which are not even that good sometimes. She makes us do groupwork for most of the lecture which barely teaches us anything. Do not take her she is seriously a really bad professor, and unless you want to fail a class, don't take her.
Lectures are useless she never is on topic, never is clear on midterm topics and is vague. HOF Yapper

DO NOT TAKE. Him and his TA are AWFUL and rude. Your grade is pretty much dependent on 3  group research presentations throughout the semester, which they grade very harshly. They claim they are clear on their expectations but they often contradict each other and are super condescending about it. The class average was about a C-/C andrefusedtocurve

Class is very focused on presentations and almost nothing else matters in the class other than participation in discussion. He and his TA grade very hard on the presentations and expect us to devote all our time to work on them, and then blame us when our presentations don't blow them away. I'm taking 4 other classes give me a break.

It's October and we already had a group project. My group presentation was decent and it probably deserved around a B but we got a 53 out of 100. The group next to us stood up and even had one kid walking around the class doing the most with their presentation, they got a 63/100. The TA is super rude and mean.
Questions on quizzes do not make sense lectures are confusing and the grading is so heavy it affects grade a lot.
Grades hard and confusing, and whatever is on the exams is hardly what we went over.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The course is a waste of time. There is no structure and it seems like he's making up the assignments throughout the course. This class would have been a lot better if he set a clear structure and have set clear instructions for the assignments.

This professor is incredibly bad at teaching. The slides on lectures are useless. Always off topic and does stupid things like newsflashes that have nothing to do with class. The entire class averaged a failing grade on the midterm due to him being boring and super unorganized during lectures. Does not know how to teach at all.

Assigns an unreasonable amount of work in very little time. Group projects are near impossible because of this. There is no structure or organization to this class at all. There is always confusion on what we acually do learn. Midterm and quizzes are not based on lectures. Does not respond to emails even though he admits to seeing them.
