DO NOT TAKE THE CLASS IF YOU ARE SHY! He makes the students do a lot of presentations than a normal class. Overall the class is very CONFUSING!

Class is not hard at all, you just gotta know what to study. I did terrible on my first midterm because I read the book, focus on lecture slides and do not miss lectures. This Class was simply a nightmare for me. Useless Class where you loose alot, and gains nothing. and that illiterate TA liza who knows nothing, but only a trouble for students. pointless side assignment. doesnt speak lound enough in lectures. tests are ridicoulously hard.
Would not recommend this professor at all. Lectures have little to no relevance to what students are tested on and he spends more time defending his teaching method than actually teaching.

Spent too much time with pointless side assignments rather actually teaching. Lecture can be hard to follow. Lecture is important b/c his slides are almost useless to look at. marine bio is interesting, but Dawson is a horrible professor that completely fails at making it so. You are not required to come to lecture but the only material he uses for exams comes out of lecture.
You are not required to go to class but you should otherwise you wont know what he is testing on.
did not learn anything useful

Ackerman is one of the best professors UC Merced has had.  She is incredibly helpful, her lectures are always really interesting, and she promotes an atmosphere of discussion and debate in her classes.  She works really hard and it shows.  One of the best professors I've ever had in my entire college career.
Class is fun and you'll learn alot

One of the BEST professors at UC Merced. Very thorough and un-bias with her judgement(I don't know why the other commenter said she was bias, he/she clearly wasn't paying attention in class when Ackerman noted her perspectives to be only an opinion). Dr. Ackerman was professional and knowledgeable. It was a real shame that she had to leave though.

BEST. PROFESSOR. EVER. if you don't pass her class then college is not for you. she isn't easy, but she's understanding. just back up your ideas/answers and you'll pass the class. if you get the chance to take a class with her...TAKE IT!
As long as you show up to class you're sure to get a good grade. She was great at explaining and getting the class to participate in hard hitting question. If you participate you'll do even better!
Like a boss she is awesome

Smart teacher. Knows analysis and sociology. But she interjects her ridiculous opinions into every bit of her lectures. And her opinions are boderline radical conspiracies and frankly it is just aggravting to listen to her talk.
Awesome
Good professor. Flexible and helpful. Discussion based.

Dr. Ackerman is one of the best professor's I've ever had.  I enjoyed her class tremendously and just wish I could take another class with her before I graduate.  She makes the class fun, enjoyable, and makes the material so much easier to understand.  She's one of the best and if you have the opportunity to take a class with her you should!

I have Dr. Ackerman right now and she is by far the easiest teacher I have. You do not have to read for her class to pass, everything she goes over in class is common sense. You can never fail her quizzes because she says  there is no wrong answer, just explain why you put that answer. She gives absolutely no homework, and is very interesting!
She is an amazing teacher. Very fun and funny. Loved her class. Awesome, fun, interesting. No negatives about this class. Even the discussion class with the TA was fun and interesting.
Awesome class. Taking more.

Dr.Ackerman knows what she is talking about and is very knowledgeable. Don't walk into class and don't turn in assignments late. Those are her pet peeves. Do the readings and participate in discussions; you'll be fine. Go to office hours, she is really helpful if you don't understand the material and will give you feedback on your papers and exams.
BEWARE OF THE QUIZZES!!!!! THEY WILL SCREW U OVER!!!!!        tests hella ez tho
Don't test her, or come in late. Do the reading and if you have problems talk to her. She will make sure you are taken care of if she can.

I am still in Prof.Acckerman's class, but I can definitly say that she is a good "teacher". Her class is very interesting and educational. She is really knows her stuff in criminology. She knows how to teach. Other Soc teachers this semester lack that quality. Prison tour was great. Life changing experience. Take  her class Soc  of incarceration.
enjoyed it.
Awesome teacher that you would like to have.. her class was very interested..

She is a really good professor who knows her stuff and loves to help students. The class isn't too bad so long as you make sure you know the readings. Her class was the only class I actually had to try at this semester and she was my best professor. Get to know her if you get a chance, I didn't and I wish I had. I still managed an A though.
Ackerman seems like a  tough professor, but she is not. Her class is fun and she is very helpful and cares a lot abut the students and their grades.

She gives the appearance of being tough and strict, but she is very understanding and extremely knowledgeable! Her lectures are thought-provoking and discussions are interesting & controversial. Readings/attendance are a MUST because quizzes are given periodically and homework questions come from readings.

Definitely one of the best professors I've had so far. She knows what she's talking about and is very passionate about sociology. Very understanding and is always willing to help a student. Take advantage of her office hours. I'd definitely take a class her if you have the opportunity. DO THE READING!!!...or else

Alissa Ackerman is an extremely fun and interesting Professor. If you have the chance, take any of her classes. She is the best and has a passion for criminal justice. Thanks for the great summer Professor Ackerman! You are the best!
She helps you prepare for exams very well.

Even though we are still going through the semester thus far Ackerman is the a great professor.  She teaches the information with great knowledge and is not afraid to say if she is unsure about something, she will check on it and get back to you.  She is extremely fair to the students in her class.

Professor Ackerman is one of the best professors that I have come across in college.  She is helpful, accomadating, and clear.  Just make sure you do all of the readings before each class or else...!!
She is passive-aggressive and unclear on what she wants from an assignment.

90% of every class was her rambling about politics and how evil Trump and Republicans are. Most assignments are about politics and she expects you to agree with her. She mentioned out of nowhere how she voted for Biden at least 3 times and how she is a democrat which means she is a great person just like every democrat.
Pretty laid back professor. Just have to attend and participate in the material at hand (usually casual writing about a video). Expect a lot of conversing in the room (mostly by her).

Class is just hearing Pam talk about random topics; she grades extremely subjectively and essentially forces you to write in her style. For example, you lose points for not writing (Name uses pathos/ethos...) in a rhetorical analysis, and she's still grammatically wrong. Constant stream of 60's topics, but always shows up late. Do not recommend.

Pam isn't a slides-type professor, she's more of a hands-on. Although I wish there was more organization about her overall work that is assigned, the class is still easy. The coursework was really light since it was a project that was done throughout the semester. She does ramble often, so if you aren't fond of it, I don't recommend her.

She isn't the type of professor to have slideshow lectures, most of her lessons are based on videos, which I don't mind. Gingold is more of an outside teaching type of professor instead of classroom based. She is passionate about teaching the 60s and I love learning about it from her point of view. She overall is very kind and is open to anything.

This professor doesn't lecture. She plays random videos she found were touching and make us take notes instead of learning how to improve your writing. The writing assignments weren't too difficult but she takes off points even for drafts. For the final you make a poster and present, as well as a literature review with a bibliography and research.
Very touching and amazing communicator with students.

DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!!!! This professor is not great. She is not tech savvy and very unorganized. Most assignments have zero description or explanations. She expects us to basically be too personal with our assignments. She is not at the level of a university professor. How much I pay in tuition, you'd think these professors would actually lecture.

Only take this class if all you want to hear is rants about Trump, black people being opressed in the 60's and them fighting for freedom. She tries so hard to let everyone know she is not racist. She said out of nowhere she voted for biden. Might as well have just said yeah I voted for biden im not racist or anything. Cause im a democrat.

I took her class 4 years ago and now I still remember her. In this Writing class she just talks about the "Sixties". She said this word for like 200 times every class and I wanna kill myself after hearing it in the whole semester. She's extreme, only talk about politics and gets mad easily. All I feel in her class is madness and negativity.

The professor was very unprepared for her lessons. The way she does grading is very confusing because you won't know your actual grade until it the last day of class. She takes a very long time to reply back to emails and lacks communication.

Don't take Pam's class. She has no clear lesson plan and rants about nothing the whole class time. Luckily I'm a fairly competent writer but I was expecting to actually learn something new in her class, sadly I learned absolutely nothing! Be careful with signing up for writing classes that do not have a professor assigned, you might get her.

I think that she is an extremely caring and understanding person! She is extremely accommodating if you have any health issues, and will work with you to get your work in. Overall, I feel that some assignments needed to have an actual description and/or specific requirements posted online, instead of word of mouth, besides that great overall!

I would drive to school without a seatbelt hoping I wouldnt make it to this lecture. PLEASE dont take this professor!! Save your time, she just rants and rants for hours and doesnt really teach you anything the entire semester and just talks for hours and sends so many emails. She is sporadic and a joke of a professor.

Her class is pretty boring but it's super easy to get an A. She is monotonous and can talk for a really long time. You just have to do the assignments and be there for attendance. She has really weird due dates so make sure you stay on top of that. Other than that, she's really nice and it's so easy to do well in her class.

Pam is a nice person but overall, I wasnt a fan of her teaching style. I was so bored almost every day of class and dreaded going. She goes on long tangents and shows so many videos its so easy to fall asleep in class. It is an easy A though, so that was nice. You do a lot of group projects, so if youre not into that I dont recommend.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: Deadlines super unclear. She only rants about trump, racism, and covid. She is really vague when explaining assignments and usually gets mad when we do it wrong. She made me rewrite an assignment using her feedback only for her to try to find more mistakes (and even made some up and just mark it a 0. class stopped showing up, threatened to drop us

This was one of the worst classes Ive ever been in, all she does is rant about Trump and other nonsense things. She is a nice person, but that means nothing when we are trying to learn. She often forgets statements she makes and will backtrack once you ask her Um that isnt how you do it/I never said that I honestly dont recommend this class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Professor Gingold was a really great professor. She could go on about things sometimes that don't have much to do with the class, but she's so nice. Taking her Social Movements of the 60's class was honestly worth it. You have to do a few group projects, and really use your brain but overall, the class isn't hard. Just listen, and pay attention!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Caring

comment: She is a very kind person! Her class is just extremely boring. She tends to rant about things that have nothing to do with the course. The deadlines are never clear and then she lectures the class about missing assignments. She just likes to hear herself speak. I recommend taking her course if you're in need of an A, but you will be bored to death.
Talks throughout ALL of her class time. Loves talking about how much she dislikes Trump. Her class put me to sleep. Deadlines not clear.
Not one of the greatest ones.
Good person at heart. Rants a lot but I personally didn't mind because I love to listen. I could tell she has a passion for helping others which says a lot to me.

She's crazy. Always talking about stuff that isn't relevant. I learned actually nothing in her writing in the disciplines course for psychology--but got an A+. I mean, take her if you can tolerate liberal extremist rants (hey I'm a democrat and she was extreme to me). Each class is a new ranting lecture hell. But at least I got an A

As a person, she is great. As an instructor, I did not like her. She was very unorganized and we didn't have deadlines but she would nag to us during class when something was "late". Also, we didn't ever have discussions because she talks about racism during the whole class. I truly feel like I didn't learn anything in the class.

Pam was helpful during her office hours and was willing to listen to her students. The class was usually just her talking about the topics and then you have to go and find the homework on line. Try to keep up with the due dates, she isn't specific about when things are due.  You can count that she'll grade fairly based on your effort & progress.

If any questions, this professor is willing to answer them after class or over the email provided. This professor can be accommodating to certain things. Just be prepared to read in order to prepare for class and understand material. Also, prepare well for exams! Tips and office hours offered.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: "Study guides" & slides are kind of useless when studying for tests.McGraw Hill homework is due before every lecture, you have to attend lecture at least once a week to submit the weekly lecture activity (they don't say what day the activity will be),& there are weekly post quizzes online. Not too hard to pass but you have to read (textbook online)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She's ok as a lecturer sometimes boring. But otherwise her grading with Mindy Findlater is very nice for the GPA. Do the homework and you'll get at least a B.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Mr. Beaster is an absolute delight! Her lectures enjoyable but also quite lengthy, you'll have to study rigorously . She brings a fun&engaging vibe to the class that makes learning a pleasure. Attending her office hours is recommended if you're struggling. With her and the rest of the professors, BIO is doable. Just study hard and attend lectures!!

She is a great professor where you could understand most of the things taught during her lecture. Slides were used really often, which makes what she is referring to easy to see. She is genuinely a pretty fun person to interact with, and her lectures aren't boring at all.
Beaster-Jones is super nice, but her lectures are a bit wordy, but otherwise pretty clear and decently easy to understand. Gets straight to the point and cares about students too.
Great professor and engaging lectures

I personally barely went to lectures because they werent very engaging or helpful. I mostly studied the pre-quiz questions, and it got me good scores on the exams. Laura Beaster-Jones is a kind and caring professor, but I wish that the lectures were more useful for preparing for exams. Look out for extra credit opportunities!

There's a lot of reading for this class, which makes it difficult, but attending lecture makes it easier to understand the content. If you have any questions, go to office hours and she'll clarify things for you. All three Bio 001 professors are really nice and supportive of our learning.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: The LBJ you got to know during Bio 001 will be so different when you take upper div bio classes. She structures her upper divs in a way that she knows we got other classes to worry about. Get to know her better and you'll see she isn't as bad as people make her out to be, she's so caring and down to earth.

Beware Bio Majors. This class may change your mind on majoring in Biology. The lectures are helpful, but the homework really isn't. (still recommend you do it bc its extra points) BUT heres the thing, the tests, ARE NOT like the lectures, most of the exam is 5x more complex. If you have other STEM classes it will become difficult to manage. beware
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Taking bio 01 with Laura honestly I struggled with the midterms. Forget the slides they were not useful just read on your own is my best advice. Also make study groups because that what helped me the most.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: LBJ definitely cares about her students success, but her tests are VERY difficult. You have to read, read, read your butt off to be successful. The lectures contained so much material that I found it difficult to take notes on everything!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: LBJ is a very tough professor, you will need to work for your grade in this class. The exams are hard. With that being said, her lectures are pretty straight forward. Attending lectures and doing the readings will guarantee you an A in the class. Make sure you do your best in every assignment, as every point really makes a difference. Doesn't curve
They changed things up for Bio 001 by adding journals. There is a lot of work outside of class with reading. She is a very nice professor, but things can drag and become uninteresting.

Great Professor. Very clear about what she wants from students, and she also uploads files for you to go over if you do not understand an assignment. I really liked how she had study guides for her midterms. Very helpful!

I liked her lectures and she seemed to be a reasonable, likable person. Midterms can be a little challenging usually averaging around 60 or 70 percent. The final was surprisingly easy in my opinion (I got an A in the class). For some reason the curve was just rounding up to the next percent. Other semesters claimed they got at least 5% curve?
This professor is horrible.  She makes test that don't coincide with any of the materials she lectured or readings.  Stay away from her... she's a dream crusher!

Professor Beaster-Jones is a good professor overall, and is very clear when lecturing about course material. Enjoys partner discussion. However, asking her for help outside of class is difficult, as she assumes that your confusion is a result of missing class or not paying attention. If you're looking for a straight answer, go to a TA instead.

The class is definitely hard and her lectures didn't help that much. Her midterm for some reason felt easy but I never got higher than a B+ on two of them. Despite that, she is really helpful and friendly during office hours and will help explain difficult concepts to you. Her final was surprisingly easy.

She stays on chapters for the longest times and teaches us things that are not relevant to what are are learning . The tests were super hard and she talks about the same subject all lecture and takes her time answering when students asked her questions. Overall, hated bio because of her,was a horrible teacher. Just really study before an exam.

We had so much material to learn! She crammed it and it was hard to study all of it just for ONE exam. It was 10 chapters to one exam. Exams were tough. Usually stuff that wasn't covered on study guides or lectures. She used BioConnect for homework. Um, yeah it was terrible. Did not require to read the actual text.
Terrible.

Dr. Beaster-Jones' midterms were extremely difficult, asking detailed questions. Given that, all the question either came out of her lectures or the book. She is extremely helpful and she also post "important questions" at the end of some lectures (those concepts ARE on the exams). The final was easy compared to her other exams. Studying is a must!
You have to pay $120 for "Learn Smart" for the E-book and Homework. The test are tough and the power-points were not helpful.

Shout out to LBJ for hooking up her students at the end of the semester. Throughout the whole semester she was sabotaging her students with the horrible midterm averages and she told some of her students that she would not CURVE the class, but at the end, she "graded shifted" by a good 5-7%

Listen up, if you are a School of Natural Science Major, (cough cough) Biology, then you should take BIO 001 with Dr. Beaster-Jones because she will definitely prepare you for upper division biology courses! Lectures are practically USELESS because they include subtitles and diagrams directly from the book, so READ THE BOOK!

There are plenty of people who would say Laura wasn't a great professor. I would disagree. She was nothing but helpful when I would go to office hours, her lectures were pretty awesome, and she made me love Biology (which isn't even my major). Really enjoyed this class, even though it was difficult. I would definitely want her as a professor again.
He is amazing
Great clasd
Good
Caring
Great class

This was my second time having this professor 0/10 wouldn't recommend. From his vague instructions to giving course work that realistically didn't help on any of the exams. This class had to be invistigated due to his poor teaching style and numerous student complaints. The class avg was a sub 40% basing off what the students could see for grading.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: I consider Dr. Serajian to be one of my favorite lecturers at UCM. Excellent explanations, handwritten lectures, and very considerate of students and their circumstances. He was always available to answer questions after class and very passionate about teaching each lecture
Prof Serajian was so sweet. This class was not easy but do show up, study for all your exams and you'll pass. You can tell he really puts effort into his lectures and illustrates things very well.
Working hard is a MUST if you want to get a decent grade in this class.

It amazes me that he gets negative reviews, he's a fabulous professor! He's extremely knowledgeable about the subject, and he interacts with his students quite a bit. His lectures include notes he writes himself. I highly recommend him!
Heavy class, lots of math

Good guy - good class. Course material is hard, but Professor and the TA make it very easy if you work hard. Don't take it with other heavy courses, it requires a lot of studying and genuinely understanding the concepts.

Professor Serejian was a good instructor. Me 120 is a hard course and both he and the TA helped students as much as possible. He showed a passion for the subject and I overall enjoyed his lectures. They were a bit heavy but it's a Me-120 course which is expected.

It is my second time taking this class. This is a challenging class but he explained the material very well with examples and illustrations. He has a lot of passion for mechanical engineering. Very nice guy. Talked to him during office hours and was very helpful!
Thanks to the instructor's availability via email, Zoom meetings, and on-campus meetings, my questions were answered promptly. However, I wish he had adjusted the grades more.

It was one of the best eng courses I've ever taken. Dr. Serajian wrote down all the formulas and figures by hand during every session. His notes & video recordings were posted on the course website. This made the class engaging for me as I didn't have to stare at old-school slides or worry about taking notes.
i give im a 1 because i cant give him a 0. awful professor absolutely horrible. i gave my blood sweat and tears for this class and still didnt pass. trust me dont take his class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: The way this class was instructed was clear as mud. Base grading relied almost entirely on testing which changed in methodology each time an exam was given. Extra credit assignments were mandatory to even have a chance to pass the class. The project's instructions were vague and did not lay out what was expected of students in a rubric.

He has no abilities what so ever. If you have him leave the course because it will be hell to endure the entire thing just to receive a grade that's subpar to your actual ability. He will blame the students rather than his own methods. The work load given will stress you out and always be given last minute with difficult instructions to interpret.

To start off, the class avg for final exam was a 19%. He was unorganized, very very inconsistent, and arrived late. The difficulty of the homework was a 6, his exams and the quizzes were a 8 or 9 (first quiz had class average of 11%). The quality of the lectures was a 2 at best.

Worst professor I've ever had.  Lectures were vague and incomplete.  The quizzes are heavily based on those terrible lectures, midterm and finals were based on 'the entire textbook'.  He doesn't provide any valuable assistance when you reach out to him and gets angry when the students are confused with his lessons.  Avoid at all costs.

Unprepared, confrontational, vague. His quizzes are fine and based largely around lecture material, theoretical and not at all analytical. The midterm and final, however, are analytical; no real world analytical examples are covered in lecture, but he still expects hundreds of equations and steps in dozens of textbook examples to be memorized.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Tells student different things to study. One is told to look at the homework while another is told to look at old lecture notes. Proceeds to tell the class that problem 10.4 is going to be covered on the exam only for it to not be on there. Blames the class for bombarding him with emails asking for help. Class average is barely an F. Will not curve

His teaching style has left me at a loss for component design. There are too many things to discuss here, but firstly, he is the most unprepared professor at UC Merced and his exams are not even a test of our knowledge. At times, he blames the students for underperforming, but with an overall average of 40%, hard to believe it's our fault.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: The most unprepared and unorganized professor I've ever had. Anytime we had a project, quiz, or test, there was very little information about it posted online. There was never a formal rubric for ANYTHING. There's no syllabus. There's no office hours. I couldn't even find out when the final project was due until the assignment was posted.

Would avoid this professor at all costs. He wasn't prepared or just didn't care about teaching this class. The instructions given were unclear at best, with little to no guidance. Also if you emailed him you were lucky to get a response back. The bar could been underground somehow he still went under it. I can't convey how much you should avoid him

Exams are worth 70% with the average usually being around 20-30%, the class was curved where 50% was passing, yet still a lot of people failed due to how difficult the exams were. The final was multiple choice and still the average was less than 40%. Great professor, you just need to put a lot of work outside of class if you want to pass.

I took her for CHEM-115 (Instrumental Analysis Lecture) and all she did the entire semester was read off her lecture slides. I didn't learn anything from her, just copied the info from the slides onto cheat sheets she allowed for pop quizzes and exams. The highest scores were barely 16/20, the average was usually 9/20. Avoid, or hope for a curve.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Worst Chemistry professor at UC Merced. Class work is very hard because she is a horrible professor (and really mean). Make sure to attend class and take lots of notes, get help from your TA because this professor is not helpful. She normally doesnt teach chem10, but when she does she sucks. Sorry not sorry but worst professor on campus at UCM...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Hardest class I have taken at UC Merced. Most of your grade is based on exams that are only 10 questions each. It is an all or nothing type of class. Discussions and labs are what saved my grade at the end.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: worst class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Overall a difficult class if you skip lecture and are not actively reviewing the material. Midterms are 10 q's all or nothing, but she posts practice problems that give you a good idea of what to study (although the exams are more difficult). Labs are what saved my grade at the end. ACS is the final, but she curves based on the national average.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: The hardest class I've taken at UCM so far. The exam questions are extremely difficult compared to the questions given during review sessions. The lectures are given by reading straight off the slides. Quiz is all-or-nothing (out of 10). The professor also made students to take the quiz first during discussion so smart kids can leave.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: This was the hardest class. I've taken at UC Merced. Each test was hard and I barely passed. The labs are what gave me a passing grade.
Very helpful prof to let u know u know nothing. The final is extremely hard than any other midterms. She curved a little at the end. U still should try her to challenge yourself!

She is a great teacher! She knows what she is taking about and has a good understanding of chem. Her test are hard, but the easy quizzes help make up for the lost test points. Homework is not graded, which was great for me, but some of her test questions are from the homework
Textbook is more clear(and given the reputation of chem texts...) her tests are extremely tricky and inconsistent. Without mastery of chemistry, doing well is improbable.

Hard midterms and final was nothing like the midterms at all...She does plays favorites and her grading is unfair for majority of the people. You literally and figuratively have to be her pet to get an A
Tests are inconsistent, she makes you feel stupid if you don't know something. Avoid her if you can.
No Comments
teacher is unhelpful. Plays favorites. Makes you feel stupid if you go into office hours. Have to attend lectures, because there are pop quizes. Do your hw, and you will do fine
Very intellegent and nice instructor

If you took AP Chemistry in High school, this class is an easy breeze.  Just show up to everything and it's an automatic A.  All her tests are multiple choice and most of her quizzes are obvious answers.  You don't even need to buy the book for this class, because I never even touched it once.
Lectures aren't the best, tests are difficult. If you've always dreamed of teaching yourself chemistry, this is your dream class and I hate you.

The lecture is pretty hard so is the exam.  Lecture alone won't help that much.  Reading will help alot. I believe it's very similar to chem AP.  So if chem AP is easy, so is this class.  Also her grading is descend and the exam is all multiple choices.
she's ok
Her lectures are boring; her exams are decent - you must study for them.
hard lecture that sucks ass but easy/sometimes interesting labs.

This class was pretty rough for me. The grading scale is curved. You're allowed one cheat sheet for every midterm. You still have to study though cuz her problems on the midterm are pretty tough. Labs are the ones that save your grade. Ok, good luck with her.
cannot. stand. this. class.  Too difficult.  easy labs.
Extremely difficult on midterms, quizzes almost every other session, but labs are easy.
No Comments
Grades harshly and his feedback does not help when revising
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Professor Hothem is one of the best that I ever had. Very understanding and extended due dates whenever we truly needed it. Attendance is mandatory. He has readings but if you don't read them you'll be ok. Really funny guy that gives good feedback on assignments. He is a very tough grader. There's a lot of papers though so be ready!

Grades harshly at first claiming ur writing got better throughout the semester but I didn't change my the style of my writing once and nvr bothered to make a final draft.  That being said, the class gets easier near the end. Nb is engaged during the lecture so he tries to get the audience involved and cracks the dumbest jokes mad funny tho Good guy
Great teacher! Does grade a bit harsh but overall is very helpful
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: I took Prof. Hothem in Spring 2019 for Environmental Writing. Tom is an awesome instructor and an even better person. Get to know him outside of writing. Tom gives great feedback so don't be discouraged by his comments. He made me aware of being consistent what tense to use. Overall, 5 stars for Tom!
Dr. Hothem strives to cultivate student participation and involvement in his course and all others. He's a gem.

Tom is a great guy!!  His class and assignments were graded fairly harshly, but he will help you and do whatever it takes to let his students succeed!  I found I pushed myself so much more because of his grading standards! Just a nice guy!  He also likes to talk about Angry Birds and lots of other funny things..!!

Hothem is super corny, but he really tries to keep his students engaged and understands them well. He's helpful even after you've taken his class--go to his office hours and he'll read over any paper or app, as long as he's got the time. Super nice guy!

Cannot say enough great things about this Professor! Extremely helpful, intelligent, and funny. Will constantly try and keep the class upbeat by cracking jokes, he also empathizes and relates with his students. Gives you every opportunity to receive an A
Great teacher, made class interesting and fun.
Very good teacher,

Professor Hothem made writing fun. I used to linger when it came to writing and I never got to the point, but he helped me tremendously and enabled me to make a huge comeback with my grade. He is awesome and I highly recommend him to anyone who takes a course with him, just be sure to put in the work and you will succeed.
Great professor, great guy. Really fun and interesting class.
A profound teacher. Knows what he is talking about and is good at his job. Quite the jokester as well. Get into his class if you can. I assure you will not regret it.
Good lecturer for CORE 1. He presents lectures in an interesting manner, and is interesting to listen to.
Hothem really pushes you to work hard and he is always available to help when you need him.

one of the best writing professors that the department has! very very enthusiastic and knowledgeable of his students. likes to get one on one with the students and extremely helpful when u feel ur worst. hard grader but you learn alot from his crazy enthusiastic silly discussions. approachable and easy going!

Tom is open to any kind of comment you can make, however stupid you may sound he can make you feel inteligent without anyone noticing.  He has advice to offer for any writer and is very personable.  I had him for wri01 and 10; Big thumbs up; good teacher and cool person.
His grading is pretty strict, but this just makes you try harder for the good grade.  I really felt like I was pushed to succeed!
tom rocks!

Amazing teacher, pushes you to new heights and just really challeges you without offending your opinions.  His teaching makes me want to come to class, even in the worst circumstances.  He tells the greatest stories and just inspires.
laid back dude. Nice enviornment for writing.
hes hella tight, one time he let us goto IN n out, hell yea

he's a great honorable respectful and interesting guy! very entertaining to listen to! although, he does make you work, his writings are very critical but its optimistic. anyone would be lucky to have him as a prof. laid back sorta guy!

Funny guy, he seems to naturally act like he's stoned all the time. It's quite fun. If you can get him, do. He makes you work a little, but is actually an enjoyable teacher to have. Especially for a discussion section
He's hilarious!

Best professor ever. Took him Spring 2023, Easy grader, open note quizzes/tests, can do a community service project for your final which doesn't take too much time. Not attendance mandatory but he has such interesting material and fun lectures so I'd rec just going if you like the subject. You'll definitely pass and if you care you'll get an A
my fav prof, he's so understanding and willing to work with students to succeed, he's clearly passionate abt what he teaches, offers extra credit just for attending class

great professor!! took him for 2 separate classes, and each time he showed a passion for the content. The workload is definitely doable, and exams were online. If you put in the work then you're guaranteed an A.

Amazing professor, very caring and puts students first. Tests are very infrequent and fair, and writing assignments can be supplemented by a "volunteer track" where you do 15 hours of community service in exchange for a lot of course work. Absolutely recommend his class
Highly recommend him. He is such a nice guy who is willing to work with his students if need. Easy writing assignments, quiz and exam is open-notes.

Fav professor! - so caring, understanding, & passionate. Easy online exams (I didnt study much) & 3 short 400-600 word essays. If u try even a little, u should earn an A. He offers extra credit for attening lecturs and for completing SONA hrs. Offered an optional final & optional essay to improve ur score. Intersting podcasts, lectures, & readings

Jason is such an awesome lecturer and he genuinely cares about his students! Abnormal Child Psychology must be one of the best classes I have taken in the Psychology department and he presented each topic with great knowledge and respect with sensitive subjects and discussions. Can't wait to take social psy with him this fall!

I really enjoy his lectures. He goes over the slides, but you still need to take your own notes in addition to his lecture slides. A few short video clips to watch, usually in class. Four writing assignments (reflection papers) and 3 formal essays that show him you are understanding the material. One mid-term and a final. Definitely recommend him.
Straight forward class. I highly recommend him! Show up and pass. Easy A if you show up to class. Easy grader. Creative quick writes, a few formal essays, a few quizzes, 2 midterm (optional final).

I'm taking his Abnormal Psych class during the summer....I still have the Final left. He is so nice and approachable, very understanding guy. He addresses all questions asked as you go along (chatbox or live). I would take him again..I highly recommend him. Material is super fascinating.

Professor Emory is one of my overall favorite psychology professors at UCM! He is super kind and very understanding. He goes over thorough slides during class and gives some quizzes, a few easy essays, and 2-3 exams throughout the semester. His exams and quizzes are super easy and come from his slides, podcasts, and videos. 1000/10 recommend :)
The best professor.

This professor posts his lectures for students to refer back to since he goes fast and is content heavy. He had us do 3 essays which were all 600 words max each. His quizzes and exams were fair and reviews before exams. Most of the questions are from lectures so make sure take brief notes and review.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Amazing lectures--So many papers

comment: The class was okay. It was not too much work the professor just took forever to grade stuff

Professor Emory is a very cool professor. He keeps students in mind and makes adjustments to the course accordingly. The class may seem very disorganized in the beginning, but it will all make sense closer to the end of the semester. The class consists of 3 exams and 4 essays. The exams and essays are straightforward. EC is given at some lectures.

Professor Emory is great, although he may seem a little disorganized. There are 2 midterms, 1 final which is partly cumulative, and about 3-4 short essays (400 words each). He's really relaxed and grades pretty easy. He's totally approachable, & understanding. Exams are all multiple choice, & are very straightforward, if you study, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: I've taken 2 of his classes, he is such an easy going professor. Exams aren't tough just study and you should pass.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. Emory is a little dry and has boring lectures, but he says more in lectures than are on the slides so they're very useful. The exams are not hard and the class is easy to pass but is graded solely on 5 short papers and 3 exams. Attendance is not mandatory but occasionally he gives extra credit for attendance.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Took his Social Psychology class during the summer and had a great time. He explained the material clearly and was very helpful. Also offered extra credit - always do it! One of my favorite professors at UCM.
Professor Emory is one of my most favorite professors. He is kind, caring, and knows what he is talking about. Gave out a lot of extra credit. If you miss some notes, he will give them to you.
His exams are super easy. Loved his class and is super chill. Strongly recommend!

I had him for PSY 143 last semester. He's the best! Very clear grading criteria. He shows really interesting videos during class too. I think it was just quizzes and a couple online discussions, attendance/participation make up your grade.

He is awesome, just show up to class he does give extra credit opportunities if you don't do so well on the exams. He goes over the material that will be on the exams, just study and you will be fine. He is a nice person too, very approachable.

Currently taking his Psy 142 class and its great. If you miss a slide or have a question, he is happy ro help you. Goto class and he sometimes gices extra credit points. Study the slides and all is good.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I have professor Emory for both psych 143 and 142. This is his first semester teaching at UC Merced. I really enjoyed his class. He is a really chill and shy professor, but if you approach him he's glad to help! Participate in class to earn points! He gives study guides for each exam and they are really helpful! study and you will be fine!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Would take again

comment: Greatest TA ever. I love Jason. I still leave him comments on facebook. He's a pretty shy guy, but if you go up to talk to him, he'll tell you whats up.
Best TA ever, try try try to get him.

Cory is real chill. Make sure you read the labs before hand because he doesn't really go over it before doing the lab. He is also really helpful so don't be afraid to reach out for help. Also don't be afraid to make fun of him. He's a solid choice as a TA for BIO Lab.
He is helpful, patient, and understanding. He answers emails quickly. Would highly recommend taking his class.
awesome teacher

Their class overall was really well presented. We were allowed to joke around and were not restricted in talking with our peers as long as our work was done. As long you prepare before class you're fine. If there was something that you did not understand within the directions, he would do the best he could to explain it. Great instructor!
My lab section was pretty early in the morning, but I never minded coming because my TA made the environment super fun and easy to be in. The workload wasn't heavy and I enjoyed taking the class.
He was a good TA and a good person overall. His class was very enjoyable, he tried to get everyone to talk so participation matters. Class was actually pretty fun though :)
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: He helps a lot and is really nice.

It was a good lab with an environment that made it both fun and easy to learn and truly take something away from this experience. Over all a true joy to be in and I really just loved this class all in all.
He's a great TA and is interesting to talk to. I enjoy making small conversations because it makes me feel heard and feel comfortable in the classroom.

Overall as a TA he was helpful and insightful when it came to answering any questions. He was fairly patient and allowed us to work through the material efficiently and thoroughly. I would recommend this TA for a more fast paced learning environment and those who like to prepare beforehand.
Overall he is a really good TA. He appreciates participation and will interact with you every class just to see how your life is going. Easy grader, highly recommend.
Since he is funny he makes this 8am class more bearable. Very chill professor
Professor has a fun personality. Goes over information if asked.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: A really chill person in general, he's more like a friend than anything :)
Very helpful. Overall good person. Top tier TA. Be cautious of family bonding time.

Overall a good professor and a fun class to take! Take his class for an easy A. Trust me you will pass (hopefully). Participation does matter. Interacts with everyone. Will require family bonding during the beginning of class, so be hopeful he forgets. Gives motivational speeches. Good luck and have fun! :)
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Cory is a really good TA and I would take another lab course with him again. He is not a difficult grader. In order to pass his class, you just have show up to class and put in some effort. He is really friendly and approachable. He also gives good advice when it comes to research and career opportunities.

Sir Cory-James, is a top-tier TA. Believe me, you won't regret taking his class! He's kind, funny, and very helpful. But beware of "family bonding time". He's not your typical boring TA, he's very interactive with the WHOLE class, and he won't disappoint.

While providing exceptional assistance and helpful feedback upon lab reports and experiments done, Cory-James connects with his class, and pushes his students to continue their Bio learnings if interested. Talking with him about future research opportunities has been very helpful. Also, be aware that 100% effort is needed within the class.

Over all this professor knew how to make the class enjoyable while keeping things serious. He was always there to answer your questions to the best of his ability and if he didn't know the answer he would work with you and help you find it. All in all a good choice!

Professor Pugne-Andenoro was a pretty good teacher! Honestly the key to passing the course is attending lab sections and making sure you pay attention to the details in the labs. As in any course, your grade is up to you. But Professor A was very helpful and responsive to questions.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: CJ is an amazing and chill TA. He's super approachable and if you have any questions/concerns, he's always on stand-by. Does expect participation. Semi-strict grader.
Super lax and very friendly all the while sticking to guidelines.
Dude is cool and ran a fun lab class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: In terms of the course, it is not too difficult. The difficult part is having enough time to finish the assignments she gives you. It is not very lecture-heavy, but you do have to attend. You write a lot outside of class. You will become a better writer, so take it if you have to write in the future.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Professor Wilson is extremely unorganized, which makes understanding her assignments difficult. Without a rubric or proper outlines its hard to gauge what she wants. If you talk to her, she will babble on about random things, and rarely helps. But she will be lenient with grading if you talk to her.

NGL I love Professor Jane she's sweet teaches you the basics of writing very well and cares about her students plus the assignments arent hard just don't do them last second but other than that one of the best professors I've had. Def would recommend it for any writing

Professor Wilson genuinely cares for her students and is also very understanding as long as you don't try to bs her. She assigns essays while in the middle of another one and talk about other assignments and we'll go into detail about something thats not relevant. Her lectures aren't really lectures, she kind of just talks.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: I took writing 101 with her. she was really nice but she talks the whole lecture and her class is pretty boring. We had assignments but they were pretty easy and she graded easy. There is a final essay that has to be around 25 pages as well as a presentation.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: I took Jane for Writing 101. Jane is such a sweet lady. She really cares for her students. She is not the best online and does not know how to use Canvas so everything was turned in on Turnitin. Her lectures can be really long and boring. There is a 25 page report due at the end.

Jane is a nice professor and person. I had this class Fall semester of 2019 while things were still in person. She gives good feedback if you are stuck. I recommend going to her office hours or send her emails with any questions- she likes interacting with her students. You work on 2 papers but they are really similar it is like doing 1 paper.

She loves students going to her office hours so take advantage of that to get on her good side. She's not very structured when it comes to class and isn't really clear about what she looks for in papers so I would def meet with her before you submit anything.
She is the cutest and so adorable! I love her as a professor, very understanding and great

Professor Jane Wilson was very helpful! She helped me to decide on subject that I would be passionate in and it really did motivate me to write the paper myself. She's very nice & a calm person. Would love to take another one of her writing classes!

Such a sweet professor, she really cares about her students. Her grading is very fair, and has a very nice schedule, so you will always know when things are due. Go to office hours, she is the sweetest person to get to know.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Wilson is amazing! She is a very nice person and loves to help students! She is very understanding, and just ask her to clarify things if you don't understand stuff. She posts up a lot of helpful guides to help you. She also gives you options to redo an assignment so take that chance! Recommended highly!
Ms. Wilson can be very boring sometimes but when you write the essays the prompts can be interesting. She does give good and clear feedback. Overall she is very chill and can be very lenient.

She is amazing! I have taken so many writing classes so far haven't  found one person who is a better professor than her. She is always there for you. She understands what students go through and extends the deadlines. She is very helpful when it comes to giving reviews.

Very easy class. Just show up, and participate. Now, if you really want to improve your writing she is also good at reading your papers from your writing class. Even though its a bit different since its another professor giving feedback, it still helps.

Wilson is amazing! She is caring, and wants everyone to be involved. She is very helpful when giving feedback, usually cuts you to the point on what you are doing wrong. Going to her class and participating is key if you wanna pass the class. If you try a little bit more than minimum you will do great in her class! Easily a favorite.

I think Jane was one of the best professors that I've had at UCM. She gives great feedback on every assignment and she is available to help in her office hours. She gave some extensions on assignments, which helped a lot, and she made me more confident about my writing. Showing up to her class wasn't difficult because she was funny.

Jane was my writing 10 and writing 11 prof. She helped me with every paper, and gave excellent constructive criticism. She really cares about all her students and has the most amazing English accent! Seriously if you can, take her class, literally any of her classes!
Excellent teacher - really motivated me to do better and helped me greatly in my writing skills.  I agree - get her if you can.  She really impacted my writing and me as a student!
Nicest teacher I have ever had, so helpful and caring!
She is an amazing writing professor. After coming out of her class, I felt more confident about my wrting! (she's also really leanient..which is probably how I got an A- in that class)
I took her twice, for WRI_01 and  10.  Get her if you can.
Great instructor and is very passionate about her work! Easy to get a good grade if you are willing to do all of your work.

The most chill professor at UCM, very lenient on grading, expects a lot out of students, the work assigned is not extreme. Very chill class as long as you do the work, helps the students out ALOT! makes it very easy to get an A as long as you take her advice on how to correct the drafts!
best writing professor I ever had!
This class includes lots of films and reading. It was said that I had ZERO activity status which took away some of my financial aid when I did in fact have a good grade in the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: professor young is my guy. his lectures did get boring to the latter part of the semester but you only do 3 really simple essays and he's genuinely a really cool dude. if you need to get that writing requirement out your first year, while not being backed up on work, he's the guy you wanna take

The class is really easy. For the first 2/3 of class we just watched movies. Then had 4 assignments in total. He's not a tough grader. However, if you are aiming to improve your writing, skip his class. I don't feel my writing improved. I just got the credit for taking the class. Nice guy though.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Class time is mainly just discussing the pdf he gave you, you work in small groups to come up with main ideas and key details. He is very laid back, easy grader (requires hard copies) and presentations are informal (we sat down). Very chill but don't expect to really learn anything about improving writing style or writing in general.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Young is an amazing, bright, and knowledgeable professor! This class is very enjoyable if you participate in the discussions and complete your reading on time. The reading is very interesting and very much do able! No need to buy textbooks because it's all usually PDFs. I took this class online and very happy with it. Very kind & understanding!

I found Frederick Young very biased in his stance. He brings politics 24/7 in class and makes several inaccurate statements without evidence. Stop with the political circle jerk and teach some actual writing. I didn't take this course to hear your opinion on politics or politicians. I took the class to further my writing and not to be polarized.

Professor Young is a good teacher just can be biased sometimes. There have been times when he's neglected a lot of my participation. He would call on other students and point out their opinions on a certain lecture, but then ignore my statement like it wasn't there. Good conversations just a bummer that he can be biased with some students.

Dr Young is the writing goat .This writing class isn't your average writing class where you have to write multiple filler papers. We watched films for the most part and psychoanalyzed them as a class. He made the atmosphere so comfortable and I personally felt like our opinions always matter; there was never a wrong answer here. He's truly a gem.

Professor Young is very caring and understandable, whether it's about an extension or personal matters. The lectures are very interesting and fun, he allows us to express our thoughts freely.

If you are debating taking him, I guarantee he is the best option.

This class is amazing. If you are debating on professors/classes, easily pick this professor. Best professor no joke. Im an average student and I got an A+ in this class. Very good professor... I miss this class lowkey.

Professor Young is great, he's the type of professor that comes along once in a lifetime. He's very understanding and easy to reach. His lectures are also always a lot of fun. I'm really glad I am able to take his course I hope to take more with him in the future.

I took this class during the summer so it was accelerated but he gave us reasonable time to complete assignments and was always flexible with meeting outside of class. We watched a lot of movies and the class was more like a seminar bc we discussed rather than writing. There was only two major essays and they were no more than 4 pages.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Young loves participation, 3 essays though no clear outline or rubric, get to choose out of 3 questions what to write on. 1 group project end of semester. kinda tough grader doesn't provide clear feedback. Great personality shouldn't fail just attend class and do the work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: He doesn't have anything ready and will squeeze everything to the last minute for you to do. There are no criteria for his essays, so you are pretty much writing blind and praying to meet his standards. He is easy but gives zero feedback on your essays or areas to improve. He says participation matters, but he gives everyone at least a B.

Professor Young was super helpful during office hours, and offered great insight during discussions. We got to talk about Freud and Jung, and study the visual image. I highly recommend him for writing in the discipline class.

Professor Young is honestly the best professor to take for Advance Writing. He's very understanding and does a great job teaching the class. He doesn't assign an insane amount of assignments and helps us write the best essays we can. He's been a very good professor and I would definitely take him again if given the chance.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Young is a pretty chill professor and is really understanding. Classes mostly consist of watching films, documentaries, and discussing readings. Homework is mostly reading. 3 essays are assigned throughout the whole semester including a final essay. The final also includes a group presentation.

I took this class my first semester at UC Merced and it was a great first class! The classes were very chill, we took readings home and discussed them in class. Also, watched documentaries and wrote papers on them. In total, we wrote 3 papers. We had one group project which was a presentation on any topic we had discussed in the course.

Honestly one of the best writing professors I've ever had. He was a super sweet and caring person, especially during the time of online learning he was understanding. One thing about this class is be prepared to discuss the reading assignments since you'll be doing that a lot. During office hours if you bring him you essay he would usually read it.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. Young is great for writing 001. Graded by 3 essays participation, and a group project. He is very lenient and understanding of his students circumstances. Gives you feedback in office hours. Please respect him by not using your phone in class (thats something that frustrates him)

Dr. Young is the best writing professor I've had at UCM. He is accessible out of class, he is caring, and he best aids the class by facilitating a strong discussion for the topics at hand. For Science Writing he developed a unique curriculum on Narrative Medicine, and it is one of the most thought provoking class I have taken. Take writing w/Young!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I took Dr. Young for Writing 101, and the class was pretty simple. He extends deadlines a lot, and is super understanding of student issues. He is very accessible outside of class and is willing to make office hours fit your schedule. Super nice guy, not the best writing teach ever, but was fine.

The class talked about topics that were actually interesting and relevant to today's issues. He is very open with his prompts to let you be creative with it, he's always willing to read over sections or the whole thing and will give good feedback on what to fix. There were no exams/quizzes. DO NOT BUY A BOOK. There are PDF's. Kinda disorganized.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr. Young is a really fun guy! His class is fairly easy and he doesn't assign a lot of homework or reading. The only things that count towards your grade are 4 essays and participation in class. He's very good at giving feedback and if you ever need to talk to him, his office hours are very flexible.

Dr. Young is a really nice person and very concerned about his students. He makes himself available to students outside of class. It is your typical writing class. You have a few papers. You get a grade based on what you put into writing your papers. Dr. Young incorporates films and a book to grasp the concept of narrative medicine. Great professor

Critical Reasoning & Writing. Socrates Apology,JP Sartre, MLK Jr, Mario Savio. Excellent choices to teach new concepts and stimulate debate. If you believe your position is right prove it in your essays! Emphasis on class discussion and essay writing. Dr. Young gives some of his own political beliefs, but equally respects others. ++Recommend++

When I was in his course, I felt like I was actually learning something.  If you want a professor that will teach you and have fun with you then Professor Gibbons is the right choice. I technically am still in his course, but I would want him as my professor all year if I could.
i love the way he teaches; my writing feels validated and never judged; he is very open and easy to communicate with
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: I took Paul back in Spring 2018 so my review has been delayed. Paul is a great writing professor and because our class only had 3 students, we all got to know one another on a personal level. Since this particular class was co-linked with Chem 10H, the readings were heavily Chem related. Overall Paul is a wonderful instructor and person. 5 stars!
Second time with Professor Gibbons, and I have never gone wrong with him as a teacher. The class is based off five essays, and two explanation projects.

I absolutely loved Professor Gibbons. He is truly a fantastic, thoughtful, and overall amazing writing professor. His class is straightforward, and his assignments are hefty and take a lot of effort to complete, and thought to pass. Would take him again without a second thought.
I loved Professor Gibbons in WRI 90! He was insanely helpful, and I loved learning both aspects of creative and professional writing.

Homework homework homework. Make sure you do it, there's a lot. Overall, he took a course with no shape and no previous students and gave us the freedom to let our creative sides flow. He's really insightful and teaches you some very important techniques to help you become a great writer. Awesome

Gibbons does not treat creative writing like a fluffy course, if you are looking to express yourself without learning or applying elements of craft forget it.  This class is not for you.  If you want to improve and can see beyond inspiration, he's awesome.
He knows what he wants out of you, you just need to give it. He knows what he is talking about. He is not an easy grader, but you learn A LOT in his class.

He's awesome.  Hard.  Realistic.  Honors what science students need.  If you aren't a science student, though, and want to take this class to fulfill a humanities class, you are in the wrong place.  This guy is incredibly helpful but makes you work for the course.  With good reason.

Not usual.  Tells students he wants them to be satisfied more than being happy.  Works hard.  We, as students, do too.  He gives a new perspective and doesn't try to make us like him.  We do though.  A lot.  He really teaches.
I've never been graded on my poetry before.  I do, though, see that poems are more than inspiration from this prof.  A whole new thought!  I've never really thought about language or form before!
This guy is great.  He makes everything you have to write practical & there's no fluff.  On the major assignments, the grades are harsh, so do all the steps in between -- or you're screwed.
Awesome!  Super great!
This prof. is scary smart & knows his stuff.  Gives lots of homework, but it doesn't feel like homework because it's fun as well as instructional.  I learned tons from this guy.  He'll awe you.

Gibbons knows his, well, rhetoric.  He's a super-smart, super-inspiring guy.  In 150, it took all term for anyone to get that poets, like Gibbons, are smart too.  What a revelation!  If you want your brain challenged, Gibbons will do it for certain!
Great guy!  Super smart!  Amazing writer and teacher!  Not a fool -- and gets the math and science too!
Great -- none better!

Gibbons is unusual but very sharp.  He will teach you skills you didn't know you might need to have.  His look is very casual, but his mind is scary smart, so don't try to play him.  He'll see through it.  He's a bear with homework, but he really cares about students and their success -- a difference from faculty at Merced who love tenure only.

The class means a lot of work, but the professor clearly works as hard as the students.  He's not for the person looking for an easy A without doing the work for it.  If you actually want to learn something and have a faculty member you can go to to ask for a rec. or help you out on grad. apps., he's the guy.  Don't let the ponytail fool you.

This class has been the most useful English or writing class I've ever had to take.  Gibbons knows his stuff and understands both the writing and science end of things.  He's tough but practical.  He's also an awesome guy who really knows his stuff and can call you out on the writing or science end of things.  He's sharp and cares.

If you plan to go into any of the sciences, this is your professor.  You will learn to write for your discipline very well.  People who think Gibbons is too hard don't get the relationship between being able to communicate scientific ideas and the science.  This prof. teaches you how to write.  He is the best if you are serious.
He's hard. gives waaaay too much hw and if Writing isn't your thing, I'd recommend taking someone else

Prof Gibbons is always cheerful and makes the class pretty easy-going, however the homework load is ridiculous! And he lowers your grade by a whole letter every 3 unexcused absences. It's very hard to stay on track and if writing is not your thing, I'd recommend taking another prof.

There is no textbook, but article downloading/reading is used heavily. His assignments DO seem to lead to somewhere useful, and I DO see how I could need it down the road, but be prepared TO DO A LOT A LOT A LOT OF WORK!!!!!  I am taking 3 other sciences, and yet I only seem to have time for researching and doing homework for THIS CLASS!!
She is a good professor. Good at explaining things and is always open to questions.

She is really passionate about what she's teaching and cares about participation from her students. You can retake your quizzes as many times as you want and she's more concerned about what you're learning and understanding than the amount of questions you're getting right on the quiz.

This professor is amazing at lecturing coming from someone who goes to every lecture since its easier for me to understand in person she also uploads her lectures on zoom. Shes caring and makes sure every student understands the material. Very loud and passionate which makes her lectures the best! Quizzes are so doable and for are the exams!

She is a great professor. We dont have homework just quizzes that you can take multiple times and she gives you plenty of time to finish. Very easy to pass, just pay attention in lecture and youll be good! She is also very understanding and you will enjoy lectures!
She is a wonderful professor as she projects her voice nicely to wake you up early in the morning. The class is easy than other stats class but you can still learn a lot in it.

Professor Trounstine is an amazing professor hands down. She truly cares about how you're doing and learning in the class. The information taught in class is basically what you will learn through the books, so it's fine if you just pay attention in class and consider the TA's feedback for your papers.

Trounstine is a great professor very energetic. However, she is a bit difficult to approach during office hours. I would recommend referencing the book as it can help you pass the exams. Try doing quizzes with friends that can help out.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Her slides are unorganized so just know that your notes will be all over the place. We barely used the book, you didn't really need it for quizzes or finals. She goes too fast to the point where you will get confused. She won't post lecture notes unless you bug her about it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: This class is fairly easy as long as you attend lecture. Shes super energetic for a 9am lecture and always made lecture interesting. Definitely would take this class again.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Trounstines lectures are great! She also gives a lot of opportunities for extra credit and is incredibly clear about whats going to be on each test.
Great professor!
I love Professor Trounsitne, she gives amazing lectures and is super helpful. Attendance is mandatory she took it on clickers. The book is really helpful going along with her lectures.

Professor Trounstine was an engaging professor who shows much interest and passion in what she teaches. I would recommend showing up to lectures, she usually gives answers to some questions on the quizzes and final if you show up. Her quizzes and final were very easy.

comment: Professor Troustine speaks loud and clearly, her power points are organized and on point. She is not moody or depressing but clearly passionate and always cheerful.

Teacher is fairly easy to understand. She has very little written on her slides so if you are one of those people who want to just sit there and not listen this class is not for you. The class is not easy if you don't read. Midterms are unpredictable as well. Pray they are in class not at home!

The class I had was Poli001. I found the class extremel simple it just there is alot of reading so be sure to stay on top of your reading. She tend to say alot that isn't on her slides so write that down, otherwise you screwed! She is great professor learned tons:)

Dr. Trounstine is an excellent professor and truly an expert in her field (Urban Politics).Overall, the class was very interesting and a bit challenging. It was a pleasure to be in Professor Trounstine's class.

An overall great professor that requires students to actually study to pass. If you read the textbook and go to the lectures, you will pass. Slides cover most of the textbook well, and the lowest midterm is dropped. Do not listen to bad reviews, simply study and you will not have an issue.

The bad reviews are from students who don't know how to study. Basic chemistry can be understood if you are engaged and taking notes. Be prepared to fail if u take her class. Her lectures were extremely boring and consisted of her reading off slides. No curve no extra credit very test heavy. Fail one midterm and your done. Take any other professor over Jenifer.

Absolutely horrible professor. Try to avoid if you can, her lectures are basically her reading off her slides. Dusty is the best option if she is available. if you want to fail take this teacher for this class

This is the only class i failed at Merced. Jennifer is not built out to teach this subject. If you can please choose Dusty or anyone else, because Jennifer makes the tests worth 55% of the class grade.

Very nice professor, accessible for office hours and accommodating to student's requests. Course materials aligned with the textbook and helped with the exams. comment: if you care about your mental health don't take this teacher for anything related to teaching

do not take no curve fails half class

A very difficult professor. If you can, take Dusty's class, it's much better. 55% of your grade is the final and the midterms. There is no extra credit, no curve. Very inflexible with her grades. She will dock you points for having spaces in answers on exam questions. She will not give the allotted three hours for the final. Will not curve any exams, not clear on her expectations, and her lecturing style is mostly reading off the slides. Very inconsistent with Office Hours. Take chemistry with anyone else.

Dont take her class shes a horrible grader. Doesnt curve any of the tests nor the final. horrible teacher, for your own good please do not take this class with her

she has favorites.

comment: This is actually the 2nd class I have taken with her. She is really nice, this class was taken over the summer and even though it was 3 1/2 hours twice a week watching a screen she was very considerate. She would give us a break and the material is fun and very interesting. I really like how she encourages everyone to participate. Very organized :)

She expects you to do readings so that you can participate, however, most of the book is common sense and you can easily participate without reading. There are 4 midterms plus the final which is optional. A lot of extra credit opportunities. I was able to get my grade up by 10% in just 3 weeks. She is really nice and will bring food from Colombia.

Took her for the summer and she is really nice and straightforward, but it was honestly a lot of homework, and she didn't give enough time on the exams even though the class was 3 hours long she only gave us 30 min to complete.

I honestly love this professor and her classes. I have taken 3 (SPAN 11, 107, 108) in total and would have taken more if possible. Yes, she is a bit strict, but you will 100% learn in her class! This professor is great! She encourages participation daily and offers opportunities for extra credit. comment: Prof Yolanda is a very caring instructor. She gave the class many extra credit opportunities. comment: A perfect class to learn grammar

I like the way she teach.
She was very good teacher

She has interesting lectures and includes many funny videos in her power points. If you show up to class and take notes you will get at least a B. She knows how to make the course interesting. Really cares about her students.

I enjoyed this class to much and gave me the final push to go into a Cognitive Science major. Every lecture was so interesting because of the dedication and time put into every single lecture slide. I would definitely recommend this class to anyone.

comment: Best professor at UC Merced.

Teenie is amazing. She loves to get to know her students on a personal level and is willing to help a student in anyway possible. Easy class if you study whats on the study guides and pay attention. She wants all her students to get good grades and she gives interesting lectures with videos to relate!  You won't regret any class with this professor
Teenie is an amazing professor and it was truly an honor to take her class at UC Merced. She genuinely loves teaching and cares for her students. UC Merced needs more professors like her!!
Teenie is great! Just attend lecture, get good scores on the pop quizzes, and pass the exams, you'll pass the class. Learning linguistics is really interesting, and lecture to me was never boring.
