I absolutely loved her class! She makes linguistics so much more interesting than it actually is. Her exams are very straight-forward. She doesn't try to trick you at all. If you go to lectures and pay attention, you're guaranteed an A. Plus there's extra credit opportunities!
Teenie is fantastic. I was actually a bit disappointed that her class wasn't harder (WEIRD). Her lectures are usually funny and she's so nice it's almost unbelievable.

Amazing professor and tries to make the material interesting and admits when it's real dry. She makes the first part of the class the hardest but after that, each exam is very very easy. Her simple lecture slides tell you everything you need to know and discussion is optional. Too bad she'll be at Berkeley for a few years.
Great Professor. Ditto what everyone else said.
She's just awesome!
Great professor. I'm actually not taking cogs again this semester because she's not teaching it.

Who can resist this gorgeous, professional, down-to-earth professor? Her lectures are clear, interesting and tests are to the main point. A professor of kindness, consideration and passion....definitely one that you should not miss in UCM
She is amazing! i love her! i will be taking another class with her! she explains the material with such enthusiams and she makes learning fun! i definitely recommend her class!
She's a great person & a great teacher.  You learn the subject matter & you enjoy doing it.

beautiful and smart professor! honest and has great teaching skills! her lectures are almost never boring and its always fun to see her in her experiments. very funny and approachable. liked by many students and is one of the professors that YOU HAVE TO TAKE AT UCM. cogs class is extremely fun cuz of her and her teaching style. tests are easy.
Very friendly and down to earth. She's a professor I feel I can talk to outside of class and office hours. Interesting subject matter.
She is really an interesting professor.  I loved her class, and what I learned in it!
I loved this class and her teaching.  She is such a sweetheart and makes the topic really interesting.
interesting class, fun to take as an elective

Amazing, professor. Shows up early at 9:30am and ready to start class and answer any questions that anyone has. Encourages questions to be asked and heavily encourages that students ask for help from him during take home assignments.

Craig is an awesome professor, his lectures are fast-paced with a lot of material is covered, this is why it's important to pay attention & due to the homework. A good amount of projects and exams that have to be done at home, which can be challenging. This is why it's important to ask for help from the professor & peers. Final is a group project.
Really cares about his students will help If you have any questions. Attend office hours if there are things you don't understand he'll help

I enjoyed having professor Vilhauer for econ 006a and 006b, it was a pretty easy course and even though lectures are fairly long, he gives us breaks and tells some pretty funny stories to keep us alive. 100 percent recommend him for those two classes.

He uses wiley plus which isnt the best, but you can manage for sure. If your stuck on a hw question you get the solution after the 3rd try. Quizzes you should get 100% (unlimited trys).

comment: Lecture heavy. Reads off slides and you should definitely take notes and study them. He has a homework and quiz on a chapter every week. Very easy to cheat though. Study for the midterms! Its really easy to catch up a day or two before the exams. Hes also funny.

He's a great professor, cares about the students and if you talk to him about your struggles, he'll help you out. Chegg will be your best friend in this course. Also you will have homework due weekly and the information is a lot but it's doable.
Professor was great. The material is just a lot and kind of tedious to do especially the homeworks on Wiley. Go to his office hours he will help you!

He's the best accounting professor, he provides students with study guides for all exams at the beginning of the semester, so I would highly encourage everyone who takes him to look at the study guides ahead of time. He sometimes gives extra credit, but not too much. Do all the work and group work and you will get an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Easy A if you go to class and do your work.

comment: I would recommend taking a course with Craig because he is structured and helpful. His lectures are long, but you get a break midway and he tries to keep students engaged with in-class problems and funny stories or accounting jokes. The only downside is that you'll have to dedicate a few hours a week to do online homework.

lectures are structured & there are a lot of resources available to you. Expect online hw to be due weekly. sometimes there is a take home portion to his exams. there's a big financial analysis project at the end but it's not too hard. Overall Craig is great. He shares stories from his accounting days which livens up the class when it gets dry.

Craig makes accounting fun & explains the material in a way that is digestible. We use an in-class worksheet that helps check our comprehension, which he stamps (so if you want points, go to class). I don't know how I would have survived accounting if it wasn't him teaching it. truly a great class, and a great guy. online HW due weekly.
Very good teacher.  Knows how to keep students engaged.  Very helpful.

He is a great lecturer and professor. He definitely knows what he is talking about. If you don't understand something he is willing to work one on one and show you where you are going wrong. He keeps the class entertained since lecture is nearly 2 hours long by telling us hilarious stories. His study guides and practice exams are helpful.
one of the best professors i have had. good lecturer and very reasonable. he is pretty easy if you just make an attempt at the hws which can sometimes be a little long
amazing
Awesome!
Craig is very interesting teacher who tries to make his lectures entertaining for the class and is one of the bet teacher's I have had in my past 4 years at this school.

Craig is by far one of the BEST professors I have ever encountered. Lectures are powerpoint based which can be boring (at times) but he always keeps the class interesting by telling stories. His study guides and practice exams are THE BEST. If you do those and understand 'em, you should do GREAT on the exams. Be sure to attend discussion!

Craig is an awesome professor. He makes useful study guides and practical practice exams. He is very nice and his funny stories make going to class worthwhile. Make sure you attend discussion, if u don't go to lecture because that's where he covers all the stuff you need to know for exams!!!
No Comments
Easy A if you study the material.
Craig is a funny and overall cool teacher just make sure you go to class for the second half of the course or you will be lost
Good course at proper pace.

I do not understand why the other students complained about his lectures. He explained important topics at least twice if not more. I see some studtents simply do not make sufficient efforts. The lectures are good and he curve a lot for grading.
you have to explain the answers you choose on exams in a limited amount of time and his thick accent can make it hard to focus and learn in his lectures.

comment: He is passionate about the topic and covers a lot of materials. He reviews what is covered last time at each lecture. He also explain important topics at least twice. The lab assignments are interesting and exam problems are reasonable and from the lecture slides.

Professor Yang is great at communicating information through lectures. The only issue is that his accent makes him a bit hard to understand but if you do the homework and study off of it you will be set for the exams.

It is a course with lots of materials to learn. The lectures are fine and closely related to the textbook materials. The exams are also not that difficult. As long as you attend the lectures and do the homework problems, you will do fine.

comment: Professor Yang is a very respectable person, however he is a very strict professor as the only way to pass his class is to "go to lectures" and "Pass the final" worth 30%. Ming also has a thick accent and tends to not go too in depth with topics. He is however very nice and will always go back and help you understand material if asked.

The lectures are fine. As long as you pay attention to lectures and do the homework problems, you will do fine in this class. I see some students do not work hard and yet complain about this course. On the contrary, I learn a lot from this course.

Prof. Yang explains that this is a basic course that requires significant attention to course materials right at the beginning of the semester. He also explains that it pays the road for us to study computer science in the next four years. I learn a lot of materials from this course and find it interesting.

comment: Overall, he is okay. The lectures are pretty to understand, and you do a lot of learning on your own. Go to the labs, this is where I learned most and got a lot of one-to-one help.

He barely gave any idea of what to expect for the midterm and final exams. It isn't easy to understand him most of the time and he says you can ask questions but then never actually answers them. All in all, a very bad class and a very bad professor.
He teaches a lot of materials from the textbook. Be ready to attend the lectures and read the textbook. The tests are fine and not difficult. All in all, I learn a lot from this class.
He often stops to ask whether we have questions regarding lectures or homework problems. The exam problems are mainly from lectures or homework assignments. The work load is fine.
I took computer vision from the professor. He knows the subject well and the lab assignments are interesting. He is enthusiastic about computer vision.

The lectures are mainly based on the textbooks. It helps if you read the textbook before going to classes. If not, it is still accessible but one needs to be attentive to the lectures. The lab assignments are fine and there are homework problems. The exam problems are not too difficult.

comment: I attend the lectures and find the materials useful. It requires significant attention to follow the materials but the content is not difficult to understand. There are weekly homework problems to solve which help the midterm exam.
He is eager to teach a lot of materials in discrete math. He pauses often to ask feedback from students. The test is fine (based on homework problems and lectures).
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: The lectures are organized and help me better understand the materials.

The lectures are very hard to understand and while questions do help somewhat I found that you already have to have a decent understanding of the material to get anything from the lectures. Using online video tutorials, textbooks then going to lectures doesn't help if you don't do this.
Read the textbook if you want to prepare for the midterm. Don't expect to learn much from relying on the lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Don't waste your time showing up to his lectures, you won't understand anything anyway without reading the actual textbook. You will learn more from simply reading the textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Professor Yang is unfit to be a lecturer. Unfortunately, his accent made it really difficult to understand him. Only a handful of students out of 100+ showed up to lectures after the first exam. The exams don't go too in-depth. I learned a lot about the material by watching YouTube videos and reading online notes from other universities.
He is a good teacher. Very easy. He will curve a lot. Just study all the lecture slides you will be fine.

Prof. Ardell is one of the best professors in BIO. He really cares about his students and it's hard to not do well in the class. His lectures are really interesting, but he can get a little bit off topic or behind on material. No exams and the grade is mainly based on labs (about once every other week) and participation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: I took Bio002 with Professor Ardell, who co-taught the class with Professor Garcia-Ojeda. Both are extremely tough professors, and this class was meant to weed out people who do not take the class seriously. The best advice I would give would be to read the book, go over the lecture notes, and find a study group. This class will make or break you.

I think he really cares about his students and truly does want to help you.  The way he says things sometimes is kind of blunt, but it is never meant to be mean.   He tries to make lectures as entertaining as he possibly can. One time, he even offered to buy scantrons for the students that showed up to the test with out any.
Intelligent but a little intimidating.  Always read and learn the models really well.

Lectures are super boring, hard not to fall asleep. Exams are almost impossible. Make sure you do REALLY well on homework, this will save your grade. Read, read, read, READ and repeat multiple times. Ardell seems really uninteresting in teaching. He told us his research is much more important and not to contact him unless absolutely necessary.

He has a real passion for the subject and you can see that through the lectures. He really  wants you to understand the material, but you will regret asking obviously stupid questions. Study lecture slides and take good notes and you at least have a solid B.

He definitely has a passion for the class, but his explanations are decent and sometimes confusing and his work load requires more algebraic and chem 008 knowledge.  Tests are pretty difficult, but decent as long as you study the right things (book), not to mention VERY PICKY GRADING.  The final is on a whole new level compared to his midterms.

He likes to explain concepts in a subtle and abstract way. To add to this, he will post a weeks worth of lecture slides 1-2 days prior to the discussion quizzes which is very painstaking on the students part. How does he expect a student to maximize the chances of passing his class if he cannot even do his part in posting lecture slides on time?
I fell in love with the guy!! He is extremely brilliant and loves what he teaches.  Literally my favorite teacher at UCM so far.  He is tough, but I learned so much from him!

I found that lectures really didn't help so I stopped going after the first midterm. Its very important to read the book and to pay attention to the figures inside. Go over all the power points he puts up which has lots of information thats not on his tests which btw are very specific so STUDY. Don't expect an easy A, you have to work hard for it.

His language runs to incomprehensible-one lecture,example was in the form of 'blob'. Tests are often confusing and poorly written, asking small minute details. Homework worth 2% per assignment&often reworded onto tests. The TAs are your friend-they grade everything so listen to them not Ardell. People rate bad prof. in comparison with Ardell.

If your looking for an easy A this isn't the class for you. Youll have to earn your grade. The homework helps and pulls exam questions off of how do we know. He's very enthusiastic and obviously loves this class. Grading is fair. If you do the readings, homework and attend O.H/ lecture you'll pass! Oh and cheaters beware.. He will catch you!

This guy is really a good professor. You can't be lazy though. Reading the textbook is highly recommended and seek help from the TA's. The exams were worded somewhat poorly, but he's really a great, enthusiastic guy who cares about his students.

This professor is tough. If you would like to excel go to his office hours and do the reading. Homework is time consuming, but it will help you prepare for the test. Take this course and you will be well prepared for other biology classes that you take. Again, do the reading and attend office hours.

this class id difficult, he is a nice guy but not a very good or understanding professor. He need to just do research because he is horrible at lecture, makes things harder than they seem Uses math in a biology class, and office hours don't help so go if you think they will and you will not be satisfied. Some people just should not be professors,

Not an easy teacher. Asks math oriented questions. A fair amount of his questions are unclear. Essentially, you MUST TRY very hard if you want to pass the class. If you are a bit of a slacker, I highly do not recommend him for bio 002. If you're willing to work, you should pass easily.

Bio 2 is not an easy subject to begin with. This Professor is very friendly and is very concerned with helping his students actually learn the material. If you work hard for him, he will work hard for you. Attend lectures, GO TO OFFICE HOURS (he will hint at whats on the exam!) and read and you'll do fine

Difficult teacher. His style of teaching is very math orientated. Points are very hard to achieve in this class (homework  & quizzes). Tests are extremely hard, requires great analytical skills. Avoid this teacher if possible.

He seems enthusiastic and helpful during lectures and it's true he monitors the chat room but his questions are off topic, oddly specific, and terribly worded. If you have a question, don't bother to ask him... his answers are useless. Avoid this professor.

Well, he seems very enthusiastic about teaching and can teach from the book very well. However he likes to use math a lot in his class, that would be okay but he doesn't really explain the math very well or at all in lecture. So besides the math, the rest of the class works out okay.

This is my second semester with Ardell, and he is an absolutely great professor. He is definitely hard, but biology itself never was easy to begin with. He stays after lectures to answer individual questions, holds office hours with students, and monitors the class chatroom to answer our questions outside of class.

Horrible teacher.. He really does seem like he's trying, but he's just bad. A lot of people fall asleep during his lectures. Co-teaches with Kamal Dulai, and everyone agrees Dulai is better. When it's Ardell's turn to teach, be ready.. he has harder tests too.
Avoid the teacher

He only does one clicker at the very beginning, not throughout the lecture, so you must be on time and by on time at least 10 mins. early. Monotone and everyone falls asleep in class or is playing on their laptop. He uses a lot of resources that are not from the book. He should just stick to the book.
hes not really clear...very monotone...you have to read on time to understand what hes talking about

I'm not sure why he has such a low score. I took him last semester and his teaching style was great. He was very clear about what would be on quizzes or exams and overall he has a great way of teaching pre-calc in a manner that will not have you sleeping in class.

I think that as long as you show up for discussion mini lectures you will do fine. Also, go to office hours; there may not be anywhere to sit at some point, but you get your work done and questions answered, so it's worth it. Ask questions always! The professor and their TA are usually open to answering any questions.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Definitely do not recommend taking this TA for discussion class. I found it unfair on how he gives 1 question quizzes and 2 questions on the midterm. so basically it's 20 points for 1 question so basically you are screwed. you would have to study every single question on the worksheets since that's where he gets his questions.but he is funny
Ridiculously energetic but in a good way. Always tries to explain things when needed and encourages questions to be asked. Would definitely take again
DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR
Harsh grader for the final. His TA I had was nice though.

Take the 5 star reviews with a grain of salt. these people don't realize that not everyone wants his terrible unfunny lectures and his disrespectful attitude towards those who ask for help. and almost all could agree that his second half project is totally misleading and the professor is unapologetic for it. TA is good, however

The course was fairly easy to understand and he gave many opportunities to ask questions during lecture. He's pretty funny and the lectures didn't get too difficult. Some of the assignments had elements which were a bit tedious but they were all fairly simple. Use your past assignments and read the instructions and rubric carefully.

The class has a stats level higher than AP Stats and the coding language R. I had an A most of the class, but you simply can't learn that level of stats in 10 lectures a semester. The professor also grades the second half project horrendously with a mean of 39%. No clear instructions on the project and my grade drops 10%. NEVER take this professor.

The course is very difficult (you learn statistics/coding simultaneously). The professor is strict on what he wants, but he offers plenty of support. I am grateful for the professor's commitment to providing students with valuable skills. While I wish my grade was better, I know it's because of the mistakes I made, and not anyone else's fault ;).
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Although I had an A, I did not appreciate the way he graded the second half project considering that his expectations were not clear and the rubric misguided many students. Most people had Fs for the project and went down whole letter grades. His lectures (mostly yelling) weren't helpful, but my TA helped a lot with the R assignments done in lab.
Office hours are the only way that I was able to survive the class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment:
not for a student that wants an easy class. 
participation 20%
cultural journal 30%
project 50%
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Grant is professor that knows what he wants. He tells you on the first day of class what he expects and how he wants it to be done. If you want to do well in his class, make the effort to do so.

You don't learn R or stats since the course is condensed into 7 weeks. If you don't remember something from lecture, he won't answer your questions in email. He yells a lot and though upbeat, it takes away from the academics. There's just a lot of red flags. Learn R and Stats before taking this course, you're on your own. Join the Discord for help.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: From harsh grading to vague instructions to harsh attitudes, this professor will be a living nightmare. TAs are kind and try to help as much as they can, but the professor himself will never be clear on what he wants. He will grade projects an F even if you were to follow the instructions written. Bare minimum resources outside of class either.

not a good class to take for those that don't know much about coding. assignment instructions are quite misleading and vague so you'll have to ask the professor or TA for clarification every time. it is also lecture-heavy and there are barely any resources to learn from outside of lectures. overall just don't recommend.
Just don't, the average for a project worth 20% of the grade was 20% last semester. Only 2 people out of 80 earned an A in his class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: I would say if you need a math general education class and never coded, I would not recommend this class. His lectures are fun to watch but many issues like the teacher's assistants for myself at least held this class back from being good. If you are to take this class I would tell you to ask for as much help as possible or you could fail.

Professor Grant is one of the most upbeat and willing to help professors that I have come across at UC Merced. Office hours is a must if you are not experienced in coding / R studio. Make sure to try and make it to every lecture since there are quizzes almost every lecture!

I never liked this subject but Grant changed my mind. His lectures were the highlight of every week, always making the class laugh with his joking attitude. Heads up, the material can be confusing if you do not watch his videos before lecture. His weekly HW and projects will make life hard in class but ATTEND OFFICE HOURS. It will help immensely.

Love love love his class! He has a lot of energy and doesn't make anything boring. He gets straight to the point and helps you understand what exactly is going to be on quizzes. Super caring and genuine. I went to his office hours a lot and he was very helpful. I 100/10 recommend taking any class he teaches because he is a gem.

took him last semester, he's a sweet heart. explains everything super clearly and genuinely cares about your success. makes himself available through office hours. he might seem intimidating to some, but his passion is so clear when he teaches.

He's super energetic & he has a cool and funny personality & he likes to cuss a lot (about funny jokes tho). Math15 is pretty much statistics and coding put together, but if you're not really experienced at coding (like me), this class might be kinda hard to understand. I had to go to office hours a lot, and a lot of people went too.

I actually had this man for 3 classes. 2 were math. I don't enjoy math at all but in Math 5, he really helped me understand it. It was my 2nd time taking the class (oops) so I knew the easier stuff but when it came to the harder stuff, he was a good explainer. In math 015, the homework was slightly hard but it was a easy class if you did the work.

I've always despised math, but Grant actually made this class enjoyable. Hes one of the few profs that actually cares about what he does and will go above and beyond to accommodate your learning style. He is extremely dedicated & energetic, which for people like me who fear math, is very motivating. Take Grant for absolutely any class that you can.
Tries his best to care about teaching than grades. Gives you enough time to turn stuff in. Just stay on top of your work and you will get an A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Despite what he says, he is not open to discussion for people with disabilities. His class is the opposite of learning disability friendly. Especially the final presentation. I managed though.

One great teacher. Highly recommend him. Utilize his office hours cause they really help if you want to improve your essays. I write a lot better cause of his help. He gives really good feedback on your essays if you ask for more in depth analysis on it. Don't use AIs even though chatgpt wasn't there when I took it (Fall 2022).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Made us buy an expensive textbook, all due dates were 9:59 pm, too much work, clearly has favorites and least favorites in class. Weird dude.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: You get the grade that you deserve. Don't slack off. Listen to instructions. I had to pull multiple all-nighters.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: This class was very stressful. He barely replied to emails, his feedback never matched his grading, and doesn't take late work. Most college professors curve towards the end of the semester but do not expect that from him. Thankfully he gives everyone the opportunity to get a 2% increase in their grade tho. If you want a good GPA, don't take him.

It's hard to fail this class. I enjoyed this class a lot because lectures were not boring at all and the work load is fair. Tbh I deserve the grade I got at the end. There's 3 essays in total and assignments are very straightforward. As long as you show up, participate a bit and turn in all assignments on time you should be fine in this class.

Honestly, I got the grade I deserved. I really enjoyed the class it was fun. If you do your work, participate, and ask questions. You will be fine, there is no way you will fail. Attendance is mandatory and textbooks. Other than that do the best you can. Assignments are due at 9:45.

Literally impossible to get an A even if you tried because "you can always write a better paper" which disregards the effort you already put in. Only cars about a perfect essay with everything laid out and if it isn't in the correct format be ready for 30 annotations on your essay.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: He expects you to know things, he gives you videos and you are expected to learn from it. I recommend not taking this class!

Very hard class. Made it to the end of my semester and glad I am done with his class. Harsh grader and I definitely would not recommend taking unless you are trying to mess up your gpa!! Does not do grade bumps so don't even ask him. You get the grade that you deserve
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Stan is a great teacher, he really inspired us to do well in his class. We learned a lot of very useful things such as: resumes, proposals, research and development. Dont be intimidated at the beginning. In the end, Stan ended up being the best professor, teaching the most useful class I have ever taken at UC Merced.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Gives a lot of feedback on papers, however its not as useful as you would think. Whenever anyone has a question he does not give clear answers but just gives you attitude and sends you to read the syllabus.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very hard class, not lenient at all. Made it to the end of my semester and glad Im done with his class. Harsh grader, and expects you to know everything. Definitely would not recommend taking unless you are trying to mess up your gpa.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hard class to get an A in. You definitely have to work for your grade. Pick another easy "A" teacher, as he is not one. Must attend class to pass as well. Not much leniency
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Great teacher. He will give you a lot of feedback on your papers and will help you as much as he can. He is somewhat funny but is also very strict. In this class, you get the grade you earn, there is only one extra credit assignment at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Do the work. Attend class. Follow instructions. He's cool, but he holds you to the deadlines and specifics of the assignment.

Porter was a great professor, however I often felt like he used my work as an example of what not to do. He really makes you work for your grade, and he's really anal about people following the format of things (portfolio, essay)which is kind of annoying. Other than that he's a cool professor, he'll offer his feed back and it really helps sometimes
Mr. Porter was great. We read different topics of interest, and were allowed to explore what we wanted. Feedback was essential, he was funny, and class breezed by.
Great teacher. Makes you work for your grade but you learn a lot.
Terrible experience. He made me feel stupid. Doesn't help much and I've done well in all other English classes. I had a 67 percent and dropped after midterms. Would not recommend.

If you take Porter for writing or core, expect to become a better writer. He is very precise with what he wants. Needs you to be a basic cookie cutter writer. Fair grader, if you ask for help, he helps all he can. If you don't, tough luck.

His class was somewhat fair, however, he is definitely a tough grader; he looks for what he expects out of his students. You get reading quizzes randomly, two presentations, and lots of reading! You will always be busy with this course! I do not recommend him unless you are one to challenge yourself!
This instructor is very good at teaching difficult subject matter. He is also very good and helping the class understand exactly what they did wrong and was always understanding when we struggled.
I liked professor Amin's enthusiasm during the lecture, and his willingness to answer questions, he was always supportive and never made us feel like we were asking dumb questions.
He is the best TA I ever had. He spends lots of time even outside the class time to helping us solve data science problems.
He provided individualized attention, helped students identify research assistant positions based on their passion, and provided exposure to labs in our program.

Amin is able to explain different scientific concepts in alternative ways, provide tangible and intuitive explanations of key terms, and keep the classes interactive and fun. He works hard to ensure the students receive the highest level of education and greatest learning opportunities.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Amin was the best teacher I ever had. He is so passionate and energetic. He keeps calling students "Wonderful people" at the beginning of the class. He is so patient and easy to understand.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I liked how he was super nice and how he would always go to you if you needed help in the lab. He was also available to reach you through email if you had any other questions. One thing I really enjoyed in Math Lab was the fact that I wasn't confused throughout the semester. Amin would help in many ways that led me to finish my assignments 30 min.

He assisted beyond the means of a instructor. Which includes staying alongside till the problem was fixed and further to assist if any roadblocks came to be; carried alot of patience. Overall, always brought a good demeanor to the class. Amin was by far one of the best! Such a sweetheart and always happy to help us.
Amin is a star. Super chill and always willing to help during and outside of the discussion. Very polite at all times.

Amin was a true homie that helped as much as he could on an online, optional discussion. He was always willing to answer questions and to check people's work. I always checked my work with him and he was always willing to clarify what is happening for the benefit of my education.
Amin is the best TA I have had. He is super friendly and helpful and would make sure we knew what exactly to do during each lab. He answered all our questions and made sure we did well.

What I like most about the course and Amin is that Amin is very helpful and made our questions simpler to understand. I'd really enjoy being in his class. Helped with the discussion sheets and HW when asked clearly. He did not leave until we understood what we were doing

He was the best TA that I have had so far in my three years at this university. He truly cared about our success in this course and went out of his way to make sure we were understanding the material.

I liked how the discussion was set up because the student teacher really understood the stress and anxiety we as students have when we don't always have the answer. The instructor gave us a lot of time for discussion and was very approachable if we had any questions.
Amin was extremely nice and always checked in with me every lab to see if I had any questions I needed help with. He was well versed in R Studio and knew how to troubleshoot problems quite easily.

Amin for this course is possibly the nicest person alive he made sure I understood everything during the labs. I needed a lot of help all throughout the class because it was difficult to follow along during the lectures therefore, if it was not for him I would not have done so well in the class
he is clear, funny, and organized
I like how well prepared the instructor was and how he made the course very understandable
He was very helpful when we performed labs and you were able to stay to get help on homework
He is always very helpful in the labs and with all the commands we have to learn. He explains a certain command when we don't understand what it is for and he always stays to help us all.
When ever I had a question about the assignments Amin was always able to help with the problem. I have never seen Amin treat anyone unfairly or hold any of his students above another.

Amin was a great TA for my Meth15 class. Although the material was quite easy, the class was curved and everyone did well. He really knows his stuff, is super helpful even if you ask for help outside of office hours, and even helps you outside of lab.
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: he is so smart and caring.
Dr. Padilla is fun and engaging. Read the books and look over the lectures and you should pass. Quiz once a week, Quizzes are worth 60% of your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: Your grade will be based on the three exams as they are 25% each. But, they are open-note and Padilla provides Kahoots that have exam answers on them and the questions are pretty straightforward. Great professor, definitely knows what she's doing and is easy to follow along.
I was blown away by the quality of her lectures and organization of her class. She was also incredibly lenient on attendance and even made it possible to take this in person class completely online.

She would pre record the lectures if you could not attend lecture. Her lectures were always clear and engaging. This was an amazing intro course for Cognitive science. She communicates well and reminds you of the exams. The exams are open book in this course and available for 24 hours.

Graded by quizzes, participation, & 1 paper. Uses 3 psychology books. Lectures are relatively basic. Most of the info is just common sense. This course is misleadingly cross-listed as COGS-170, ECON-153, POLI-153, & MGMT-153. It’s very much a cognitive science class, so if you’re not looking for that, then I wouldn’t recommend this course.

I agree the lectures are tough to engage w/ bc the material lacks depth. The 3 "pair & share" exercises per class are time killers. She's admittedly preoccupied w/ tenure to the point that she asked us not to give suggestions for improvement when doing course evaluations... making the many glowing reviews posted on/around the same day seem suspect.

I took this outside of my own discipline to gain skills in data visualization & this class has really helped. Dr. Padilla uses a variety of methods; traditional seminar style sessions, group work time that she assists w/, & program tutorials. She pays attention to skill level & interests of students, makes the course appropriate to you. Recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr Padilla was probably my favorite professor at UC Merced. She gave great lectures with content that actually mattered and was applicable. I was really surprised how much I look back and cite material from that class. I honestly wish I could take that class again! HIGHLY RECOMMEND

You will learn a lot! She uses a lot of great examples that is relevant today, keeps you engaged in the material. I usually hate reading books for classes, but I genuinely enjoyed the ones in her Judgment and Decision Making class. As long as you try to read the books and keep up with her lectures, you will succeed in the class.

Dr. Padilla is a very engaging professor! I have had her as a professor during my undergraduate and graduate career and never regretted taking her classes. She is a very open-minded and caring professor. In terms of classes, she is very straightforward with the expectations and gives clear explanations of concepts.

This was an amazing course for learning professional development skills. It thought us what we need to know to succeed as graduate students. Lectures were both fun and informative. We also had many chances to discuss and get feedback. The work in this class directly benefited us outside of class. I recommend this course for all graduate students.
This was a very informative and interesting class. Dr. Padilla made it very easy to understand the material. Her lectures were easy to follow and understand, and the material itself was fascinating.

The readings were very intuitive and even more so due to the very easy to follow lectures. The professors tone, pace, and brevity made the class less overwhelming given the amount of information covered. You will learn a lot if you take this course.

Fun CogSci class!! Dr. Padilla's lectures were both entertaining and engaging. Although this class was online, I felt connected to my peers through discussion posts, connected to the professor & TA through optional zoom meetings, & connected to the material through weekly quizzes, asynchronous lectures, and a final synthesis project of our choice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Padilla's class was very informative and life impacting. Her lectures are very interesting and her delivery style is very warm and friendly. The knowledge I have gained in this class has already helped me to make better decisions. The three textbooks that are used are interesting and affordable. She is an excellent professor. Great class!

Dr. Padilla's teaching style has been beneficial in and out of the class room, and has provided me with tools/skills that translate through the rest of my course load. Her lectures are incredibly informative, comprehensive, and easy to understand. She has been a key role in my development as a researcher/ graduate student. She is a model educator!

Dr. Padilla was very encouraging in this course, making sure to spend time with each group, keeping us on track with progressing through the course projects we designed. She was very respectful while gently pushing us to keep expanding and improving our research skillsets.

I enjoyed taking Econ 153. The material taught in the course is applicable to many disciplines such as cognitive science, psychology and business. Ms. Padilla made class engaging with in-class activities and you can tell that she really put in time designing the activities so they would be fun and still teach us something valuable.

Prof. Padilla goes out of her way to make sure you benefit as much as possible from the class, even after taking it (not only did I get experience from the class, but was also able to get a publication). She also has a vast amount of resources she can recommend for any problem that may arise in research and is attentive to each student's needs.

This was one of the best courses I've ever taken! Dr. Padilla gave EXCELLENT feedback on all the assignments. Everything I learned in this class has greatly helped me in improving my professional development. She cared so much about each of us in the class and you knew she wanted us all to succeed. I would highly recommend taking this course!!!

'Professional Development' was absolutely wonderful. The class was valuable not only for the practical skills or knowledge I learned, such as creating and managing my personal website, and how to write fellowship/grant applications, but because it was very apparent that Lace cared. The assignments were individually tailored and deeply relevant.

Her class time is divided by 3 ten minute lectures followed by an activity. For me, that is a much more reasonable way to absorb and retain the class material. The textbook is just 3 novelsdefinitely less expensive than an actual textbook. Read those and show up to lecture, youll pass the quizzes with ease. Easily best class Ive had at UCM.

I was not a fan of her lectures, they are hard to engage with, the material is redundant and overall very basic. I did not learn anything new. She will have you engage in 2 min discussions between lectures which is hard with the shallow content provided, the weekly quizzes will screw you over since they're 5 questions and worth 60% of your grade.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great class and great professor. I learned a lot.

professor yancey is extremely passionate about clinical psychology, he uses real life examples to further explain topics to us. the exams are online but taken on lockdown browser, he gives the opportunity for extra credit, and he allows for a makeup exam if you missed one of the 3.

Very understanding of your circumstances if you happen to miss a paper or exam. Lectures were very informative and entertaining. I enjoy his use of real world cases he dealt with as examples while keeping identities discreet. 11/10 would take again. If you need a psych class, I recommend this one. Exams are fair and questions are based off lectures
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: HANDS DOWN ONE OF THE BEST PROFESSORS AT UCM. I have taken him for two different classes and I am so glad I did. His grading isn't too hard but he makes sure you learn something from his class. His papers arent too bad and you can always ask for advice and help. If he was the only Psych professor at UCM, I would never complain. ps dont but textbook

Professor Yancey was my favorite professor at UCM! He is so caring of his students and does whatever needed to help a student succeed as long as the student communicates with him. Super kind and down to earth. Will definitely recommend his 100x to anyone!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Yancey very knowledgable and passionate about clinical psych. The class is a lot of lecturing but he has many interesting stories from his experience in the field. He's also a pretty lenient grader.

very boring and definitely a class that could be taken on-line. Not a forgiving instructor and does tend to go on rants. He looses his train of thought a lot and it's mainly the students in the front that participate. I noticed many students wouldn't attend lots of the lectures and still managed to pass the class.

Professor Yancey is one of the best Professors at UCM. I would highly recommend taking one of his classes. He cares for his students & does his best to make sure you understand the material. The book is not needed unless you need additional help. Attendance isn't mandatory, but attending class will help for the exam. The exams are straightforward.
A couple papers graded easily, Midterms throughout the semester cover everything in lecture.
Professor Yancey is pretty fair when it comes to assignments. The tests he gives out are not hard either. They are based on his lectures/lecture slides. That is all anyone would have to really study.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Yancey is a really good professor. He tried to make the material understandable and the exams are based on his lectures. I'd recommend him to anyone!
The best professor I ever taken! Totally recommended!

I had him for Abnormal Psych and Personality Psych and both classes were great! Very sweet professor and as long as you do exactly what you ask for his case studies, you will be fine. Fun class too! I wish I could have taken more classes with him during my time here! He also tells interesting stories about his experience in the psych field.
Dr. Yancey is the best Psychology professor I ever had. He really knows his stuff. He makes Clinical Psychology interesting by using great examples. He is top notch. Fanatastic instuctor.

This is a very lecture heavy course, but Professor Yancey tried making the material as interesting as possible. At times, the material was a bit boring. He genuinely cares about his students and wants everyone to succeed. Quizzes and final were easy, as long as you show up to class and pay attention. Overall, great professor and fairly easy course.

Professor Yancey is a very good professor. He's very passionate about what he teaches, which makes you get more into the material. Sometimes his lectures can be boring, but that was rarely the case since the material is very interesting (at least it was to me.) This class is an easy A, but you actually learn plenty of stuff. He's also very helpful.

LOVE professor Yancey! Although his lectures may be a little boring sometimes, he's a sweet, funny man that you'll adore after he cracks a few jokes in class. The class consisted of 5 quizzes, a case study, a term paper, and a final. Quizzes & final are really easy - just study the lecture slides; papers are graded fairly too. Would take him again!
Dr. Yancey is terrific. He knows how to teach a somewhat diffcult subject in just a couple of powepoints. He is very passionate about his field of study and has a lot of great stories to share.

I took Yancey for 3 classes in one semester...tests and measurements, personality, and alcohol and drugs...he is a good professor...he is very understanding as long as he knows that you are trying : ) I will be looking for classes that he teaches in the future!
Hard to pay attention. friendly and humorous. easy exams.Papers are decent and he's a lenient grader so I think. overall he's pretty cool.

lectures are hard to pay attention to but if you review the powerpoints really well and if you're willing to read the book too you'll get an A in the class. term paper and survey papers are graded super easily

I took Psych 123 and 151 with Professor Yancey.  I didn't really enjoy 151, but 123 was Alcohol and Drugs, so you couldn't go wrong with a subject like that.  I went to class about 98% of the time unless I absolutely couldn't.  Didn't read the books much, but you get more from his lectures than anything.  He extends deadlines like crazy!
cutest old man in the world. if you ask for an extension he will give you it. quiz questions ARE the exam question. some questions really are meant to trick you. but hes so adorable.
Made Ochem make sense

This is chem101L, not chem 100, so Perrotta is literally a horrible Lab TA. Had that class last semester and he was so unprepared. It wasn't until the last month that he showed us an actual example of what he really wanted our lab reports to look like. I showed up and did all of my lab reports and still failed. No wonder he got fired last semester

AWFUL. AVOID AT ALL COST. I am a Chem major. His Grading rubric is incredibly unclear. He would refuse to grade my lab reports because it was too much information. I find it hilarious that a UC professor would get upset when a student tried to put in even more effort than he expects from the class. He made me so unmotivated to even try anymore

I took Perrota after failing Chem 10 with D Lair. While lectures were boring, the class had a super clear rubric and it was very easy to pass. Please take notes, study clicker questions, and you should do really well in midterms/quizes. Labs suck but that's innevitable. ACS final is hard, but you can make up your grade beforehand.
He's teaching is disorganized and treats students like we are all chem mayors and should already know the marerial. My tutor has taught me more than this instructor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I had Dr. Perrotta for Chem 10 and was not a very big fan of his. I felt like he did not really care about teaching. However, when I got him as my lab TA for 08, I was a little apprehensive at first. BUT he is an excellent TA for lab! He is super nice, explains everything very clearly, and super helpful! If you need help, just ask!

He seemed as though he did not enjoy teaching, and taught as though everyone already knew the material. There were quizzes every week, he was very clear regarding grades. His lectures were quite hard to follow, had to rely primarily on textbook for learning the material. it was also difficult to talk to regarding difficulty understanding problems
Perrotta is an exceptional professor and he knows what he is doing in class. His lectures are well given and he always goes over examples when needed.

It is better to learn on your own, because he is that terrible at explaining things! The only helpful part of lecture is going over questions that might be seen on quizzes and exams. There is no extra credit at all, but the ACS is curved, which does not help much. As a chemistry major,  he is non inspiring to me, & seems not to care about teaching.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Not lecture heavy at all. Better to study on your own by using the book because the lectures are confusing and useless

You can skip his lecture and still pass the class, but you shouldn't, the problems he goes over help you understand the concepts just a little bit but most of the learning is done through your TA or on your own, the class is obviously curved for the ACS final so it helps to use some common sense and keep that in mind when looking at your grade

He doesn't understand how to teach. He's not enaging. Some material was from high school so I maintained an A for most of the semester but he didnt tell us the acs final wouldn't be curved until less than 3 days before  it. The acs is a national exam where the average is 50% correct and and u get ur raw 4 so  everyones grade drops a lot.

Perrotta could at times provide explanations to the subject that add more confusion than clarification. Additionally, his lectures can lack substance due to the lack of clarification and his tendency to go on tangents. Greater help could be received via outside sources other than Perrotta himself (but it's not advised to skip his lectures).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Perrota is an  absolutely awful professor, do NOT be fooled by his rating. He assumes much of the  information is already understood by students so he does not explain concepts well at all. Skips through slides and problems so fast you will not have time to write them down, while making nonsensical comments that have nothing to do with lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His lectures are pretty straight forward, but the type of problems  he writes out the solutions for, and the type of  problems  he puts out in his discussion worksheets, will be beneficial for his 2 midterms and ACS final. He gives a generous curve of the class overall. Just work hard and ask your TA for more in depth knowledge & you'll be fine.

Perrotta seems really passionate at Chemistry and helpful in teaching.  But the ways he teaches, he felt pretty lazy at teaching because when he went over the problems, she should go over problems w/ us the same time and he needs to curve the ACS final because what if he doesn't really help us for the ACS Final and the average score is descent.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Perrotta seems to expect you to know many things for this class prior to taking it. His lectures were boring & long; he didn't help me understand the material. His class is curved but the final isn't, which is unfortunate since the average is 50% for the final. I spent more of my time stressing and memorizing rather than learning in this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: he gives a decent curve but that just means people can get by from doing the bare minimum. Yet people still fail, and he has no mercy. If you come in for a grade change, when hes clearly wrong, he'll try to humiliate you. Our class did poor on the ACS compared to the national average, that shows we dont know anything but still pass his class.

Great professor, passionate about organic chemistry and really approachable!  This class will make you a master of spectroscopy! Just follow the lab template and take your time with the pre/post lab questions and you'll do fine!

He is very knowledgeable and passionate about this course. He understands the course material is tough for many students to grasp, so he tries to make it understandable the best he can (especially in office hours and appointments). Make sure to review all his lecture notes,  they help with exams. 95% available for 1 on 1 appointments. Gives E.C!

Perrotta is a great professor for a really hard subject. CHEM 100 is a class people usually fail and he makes it possible to pass the class. His averages are extremely generous. Practice problems he gives in class will probably show up on quizzes. He recycles quiz questions for exams. Only thing I did not like was that his final was the ACS exam.

Awesome OChem professor. Attend lectures and office hours to get a good grade. He is well-organized and enthusiastic about teaching organic chemistry to students. His grading is based on the average of the class (avg. of class is a C+B-). Office hours helps a lot since he'll give practice problems that are similar to quizzes and exams.

Prof. Perrotta is amazing! Attend every lecture and you're almost guaranteed a good grade in the course. Problems on exams and quizzes are verbatim from problems in his lectures and practice problems in the book. He's also incredibly accessible and helpful to students. He responds to emails quickly too! Highly recommended.

Lots of reading before class. It's pretty easy. Make sure you do the work because not doing one assignment can bring your grade down. Attendance is mandatory, can affect your grade if you miss a lot. She does talk a lot during her class, uses the full 2 hr. Overall easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Before going into her class, I dreaded writing and found it boring. However, she made writing fun and more open-minded. Going to her office hours was very helpful and informative. I loved having her as my writing professor and I have her to thank for getting me interested in writing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: I took Professor Deboard as a 1st year, I enjoyed her class, she does assign before-class readings that are due when class starts (they are not hard at all). She gives wonderful feedback on your assignments. I feel that my writing has bettered by being in her class. Her class is not difficult to pass. I WOULD TAKE HER AGAIN!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: VERY heavy coursework, boring lectures. Uses the full almost 2 hours of class time. You can find another writing teacher who grades easier & doesnt have as much class work

I chose this professor for the good reviews... and it set me up for failure. She is very HEAVY with coursework, unnecessary course work. Lectures are long & boring, attendance is mandatory. Look for someone especially since its only a prereq class.

Best teacher for a writing 001 course. You get assignments about every week that weren't too difficult. She gives you papers and presentations which make up the majority of your grade which come about every 3 weeks to a month. Was always nice and very helpful during office hours on parts that leave you stumped.

I really enjoyed taking this spark class. It dealt heavily with talking to the people around you which I didn't mind. There were a few group projects but nothing that was too hard to do. The topics were interesting and made the class one of my top favorites.
Professor Deboard is the best! She cares for her students and responds quick when you need help. Her class is very do-able and you learn important writing skills.

Took Professor Deboards Utopia spark class last fall and I absolutely loved it! She is very understanding for any situation that comes up and gives amazing feedback for essays and projects. There were 3 big projects for the semester and the other assignments were mostly discussions. I highly recommend taking a class with her!

Absolutely wonderful professor! Decent amount of assignments BUT very beneficial + she's very understanding if life situations come up. Great feedback on each assignment. Many opportunities for office hours. APA manual was required but some lectures include what you read. Main assignment is a lit. review but she helps you through the whole process.

Prof. DeBoard is amazing! Weekly homework assigned, but doesn't take too long to complete. The class had 4 major essay papers and the professor leaves good feedback on each paper. Extra credit opportunity was given at various points during the semester which helped improve the grade. The professor tries her best to get to know her students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: She is an amazing professor she inspired me to think about becoming a writing minor! She is very welcoming and very easy to talk to, she is very understanding if you need an extension on assignments. Would highly recommend but there is a lot of work honestly but its not too hard and she is very helpful and again is open to giving out extensions.
Unbearable writing course and professor caused me to hate writing altogether

Such an amazing professor, she inspired me to write and to be open about my identity! She gives amazing feedback and her work is really easy consisting of individual projects, group projects, and a final paper. She makes writing very straightforward and she even teaches you the basics. It's clear she loves her students and wants them to succeed

Great Professor, Really cares about you and wants you to pass. Attendance class is mandatory a slight part of your grade is based on it. Super nice and gives a good amount of extra credit that is based around the class. Picks great books and articles for you to read throughout the course of the semester. Use her office hours if you want an A!

Had her for fall 2019, she is amazing in all forms possible. Always gave good CLEAR feedback for essays on time (about a week after it was due.) Lectures do get a tad boring but theyre helpful when putting your essay together. She also posts them online so you can always go back. I would definitely 10/10 take this professor again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Amazing professor! She lets you know what you will be doing throughout the week the week before so you always know what to expect. Not to harsh, very understanding , and very caring. Lots of reading but not to hard. Id take her class if I needed to. Highly recommended!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Paula is one of the best writing professor I have ever had. She really cares about her students and also really friendly. I always look forward to going to her class because she has a bright personality and it always makes my day. So if you need a writing class take her and don't look back.

Paula is an amazing professor and gives amazing feedback that's helpful. Wrote creative fiction pieces and had lots of fun. It's a shame I'm graduating cause I'd take her class again.  Might be a bit of reading but the book is helpful. It's an easy A class. Definitely take her class!

She cares about her students. She provides valuable feedback on essays. If you use that feedback to guide your next paper, you will be in good shape. Her lectures are all valuable! Every class compliments what we learned in reading in an enticing way. She's kind and inspirational.

There is 4 essays & reading due just about every class session. Paula grades very fairly. She tries to make things interesting, although some lectures are more boring than others. Directions are fairly clear & she gives time extensions for use of the writing center. She is very caring and even offered her home/dinner to students for thanksgiving.
Awesome! High Recommend! All around a great person!

I really liked this class. You learn a lot of history and different music and instruments. Slides have a lot of info but its' from the readings and then she posts them after the quiz. Lots of time to review and a lot of discussion time to prepare for little essay questions. Cool documentaries that I wouldn't have seen otherwise. Recommend!

Very fun class. Attendance not mandatory, but all info for course can only be obtained through lectures. Slides aren't posted. Learned lots of history in this class, not just music history. Lenient grader, thought she was pretty funny and chill. Really passionate teacher. Good luck at Pitt, they'll love you there.

I really loved professor Garland and would definitely take her again. She's super warm and pretty funny. I don't get what people are saying shes rude, shes just straight forward. She doesn't even get upset when people clearly didn't do the reading, she just explains. Very clear assignments based on the reading and easy if you attend class regularly
Had a few problems in this class; tends to be kinda rude and condescending. Class was average, not very interesting at times. Made it hard to participate in class because of her condescending tone.

I really loved professor Garland's hip hop class. Sometimes the readings were kind of hard and long but she tells you the important parts and we discuss them. She teaches you American history, like what happened after MLK and economics and now BLM and also about the different sounds of hip hop and feminism, ideas I didnt hear in other classes.

Garland's Elements of Hip Hop class was an easy A, but you learn more about the history of Hip Hop rather than the message behind it. Although class was good, you are being taught by a white woman... so keep that in mind. Garland doesn't allow phones in class and is strict about that. She is funny but can be rude.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: Hated how boring this class was. Many unit quizzes but she does offer a bit of extra credit. Group presentation as a final but easy to pass. Her lectures are just her talking about the readings she makes as homework which is boring.

I really liked professor Garland and taking Hip Hop with her. The lectures were always interesting and fun and showed us aspects of American culture and history I never learned about before. Even tho im a big hip hop fan I still learned a lot in this class, and thought about race in a different way. You can skip the readings if you go to class.

Cultures of Hip Hop was an awesome class, very easy if you just go to to class, she puts everything on the tests in class. Group project presentation at the end and a lot of extra credit so I got over 100. I liked how we learned about the music but also the cities and race and gender and today issues. Pretty chill and she's very organized.

The course number wasn't listed but this is for Global Popular Music. I'm glad I took it for a higher level GE. The readings weren't too long but they were always interesting and I learned a lot about history and popular music in different places. I liked learning about the different artists and the movies we watched as part of it, fun class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Inspirational

comment: This was an awesome class to fulfill for a GE. You learn all about the social media and the music industry, stuff I never knew before. The quizzes are online at home, open-book and based on the readings, but she explains the readings in lecture so basically if you go to class its' pretty easy. There's always extra credit and shes nice.

The professor gives incredibly hard quizzes on material that doesn't really relate to the class. I took the class thinking its an easy GE and about social media and found the professor has no life and is obsessed with making ours miserable. You cant have your phone out in class or its an automatic F in the class and the professor is always rude.

This was a cool class for a GE. We got to learn different dances and about there history. I didn't think of culture like that before, the social aspects. There is reading but a lot is highlighted and then she talks about the important parts. There was a lot of extra credit in the community which was good to see different art and things in Merced.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Music of the Pacific World was a fun and chill class. There were good documentaries and guest lectures and performances and I learned a lot about asian then before. We also learned about local culture at the Laos festival in Merced. there's readings for every class but she covers the important parts in class. She's approachable and makes jokes.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Im glad I took this class It was challenging but she helps you out by highlighting the readings so you know what to look for and then goes over it in class so if you come to class to your good. It was fun practicing the different dance's and learn about different culture's, she helped me out when I had a family problem shes nice.

I never felt comfortable in Shannon's class. If you come to class without doing the assigned reading, you and your classmates will be berated. Asked to drop the class (had missed several major assignments and lectures) and was denied. DO NOT SHOW WEAKNESS SHANNON WILL JUST SALT THE WOUND.
take this class if you enjoy secretly crying during lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Readings were reasonable in length, and was a reasonably easy grader, at least as far as I could tell. She's obviously very smart, and just wanted us to pay attention and do the work. I thought she was a great instructor!

Assigned unit quizzes that you are able to do on your own as well as answering free response questions about specific reading. She wanted specific answers on responses and if not given was incorrect. Readings were decent in length. Group Project Presentation at the end (final).Was an easy A but learned nothing new.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I really enjoyed the course. The course is based on 5 quizzes and 5 written responses from the readings and a group project at the end. So it's really important to do the readings (2 per week x 20 pages) to do well in the class. If you do that, it's going to be an easy class. Opportunity for extra credit at the end of the course, but not a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: Overall did not take criticism well, when discussing what was going wrong in quizzes did not like feedback from students but preferred her method. Topics were heavy and readings were long but overall expected specific answers. If specific answers are not provided, not satisfied with a response.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Garland was fairly knowledgeable on the content shared in the Social Dance, Social Bodies class, despite it being her first year teaching the course. I will say while attendance wasn't "mandatory", as long as you attend the class you will pass the quizzes. She also provided extra credit and conversation to help better your understanding.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Failed the class and that's my bad but it still hurts my feelings that she didn't round my 50% up to an A. Really good and understanding professor though
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took BIO 60 online with her this semester. Best decision ever! Professor Conte is the one sweetest and genuine professors Ive had at UC Merced. Definitely take this class when you have the chance. Her lectures are entertaining! The workload isnt too bad. 10/10. Im definitely going to miss having her as my professor.
By far one of the most interesting and fun courses I have ever taken. Professor Contes passion for Nutrition makes the course even more exciting, and the work load is extremely manageable!

This class changed my health habits for the better! Lectures are great because she is passionate about the subject. The homework is easy to get through and very helpful. You get participation points just for going to lecture and doing some participation questions. With tests, I do recommend studying hard because the more technical bio can be tough

Professor Conte is definitely passionate about Nutrition, and is very sweet and caring. However, her lectures are very heavy and can be boring. There's quizzes taken almost every week during discussion and it seems as if they impact your grade more than the midterms. Other than her quizzes, the work isn't that bad.

Professor Conte is a very lovely and fun professor to take. Her course was very informative and life changing. You really learn a lot about nutrition and health. It's also very helpful when she shares her stories because she speaks out of passion for the subject because it has affected her life so much. Really a very nice course to take.
I loved this class. I had also taken bio 005 with her and I love the way she teaches. She really cares about her students and is very straight froward. I would take any class she taught

I would recommend Professor Conte for Nutrition. The class is very straightforward. Go to class and discussion and complete all of the assignments and passing the class should not be difficult. The homework assignments will help your grade and studying for the 4 exams. The quiz questions are from the book. Study the practice exams she provides.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great professor who is very passionate about bio.

I am a Bio major and out of all of the professors I have had she is by far my favorite. She is funny and relates topics to real life experiences. There is quite a bit of homework but it actually relates to what she lectures on. She gives out practice exams and that will 100% help you on the exams. super easy class, loved her enthusiasm!

Conte is so great. Shes nice, funny, & passionate about the subject. I loved her class, & she offers a lot of extra credit to get your grades up. Homework was online & assigned 1-2 times a week, but its easy points & keeps your grade up. Shes also big on giving extra credit for office hours, so go to those!!

Conte is hilarious, she throws a lot of shade and teaches at the same time! Class was actually useful to life too, the things she taught me will honestly come handy later in life. Book is required because the homework is in it. WORTH IT 100%. Loved the class, I would take another class with her. She cares about your grade too.

Class was easy. Professor is passionate on her subject and attempts to teach us as non-bio majors. However, when it comes to the administrative part the class lacks organization. Random quizzes during lecture, so you have to literally memorize the article that she will quiz us on. Unecessarily stressful for a GE class. TA's were good though.

Despite the class being fairly easy there are some things to consider. Course (and to some extent the professor) is very disorganized and grading system is not accurate. What you see online is not what you get for your final grade. Wish I would have known this before enrolling in the course. You should be fine, but these are some things consider.
Makes bio simple and relates topics to real world problems, making the info sitck. If you don't pay attention in class just read the book and you'll get an A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is not organized at all, her study guides do not help for the test, in lab there is no help unless you ask, her written exams are very tricky and confusing, she only reads the slides in class, and the lab manual is from a different teacher, so nothing matches when you are trying to gather your notes to study, so far no extra credit.

She is honestly a pretty good professor. When she gives lectures of healthy eating she speaks very passionately on the subject. It was a fun and enjoyable class. Homework was not so bad;  lots of reading though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Debra is amazing! She tells you exactly what she expects from you. Her practice exams are almost identical to her actual exams, at least for Bio Nutrition. Her lectures are really fun but you can still do well if you miss them and read the slides online. Overall great professor.

Debye is such a great professor. Since the class is for non-bio major, she only focuses on the big picture. Tests and Finals are straightforward. Make sure to stay on top of the inquisitive and info-graphics homework and Study regularly. The quizzes in discussion to be really badly worded and wrong sometimes but that depends on the TA you get.

Debra was an awesome nutrition professor. She has her own personal stories to tell which make the class more relatable and interesting, and her midterms and finals are straightforward. You scored if you have her for nutrition!

I found her lectures exciting and hilarious. She shares personal nutritional horror stories from her life, which are interesting to hear. There is A LOT OF HOMEWORK, but as long as you do all  the work and pay attention, you can easily walk away with an A. She also offers a lot of extra credit! Highly recommend taking her!

She's good at teaching and you learn a lot through this class, but you have to pay clear attention as she may sometime not be clear in some subjects. She is kind, very funny, but at times makes going to class boring. As long as you do the connect homework and reading and participate during discussion you'll be able to get a B-.

She was a great professor overall. She tends to be a tough grader but she means well. She does not give study guides but she clarifies what will be in exams. She is a friendly professor and she will answer everything that you wonder!

Elizabeth Cunningham is such a sweetheart! She's understanding, clear with her grading criteria, and gives excellent feedback. She truly loves interacting with students, making the class enjoyable and engaging. The work is straightforward, and it was an absolute pleasure being in her class. Highly recommend! :)
Very easy to understand and answers questions you may have effectively.

Professor Cunningham is one of my favorites because her class was easy the only hard things assigned were essays but mind you she gives you a week to work on them she is very understanding and will always extend dates if needed.
She relies on lectures, readings done before class, and videos. Class was easy but felt it not to be very lively. A few people have fallen asleep in her class but other than that it's a good class.
Professor Cunningham was one of the best professors I have had here, and she cares about her students so much. Take this class it was amazing.

In her syllabus it mention that she would not respond to email that isn't professionally done but throughout the course I have sent 3 emails, all in the same format and she only responded to one of them. It concerns me that a professor who is supposed to help you succeed can't respond to an email to help one of her students.
