I really enjoyed the course. There were a lot of readings, lectures are based on readings. She is so caring for her students, she is always ready to help. Only 2 essays and one group project at the end, plus the short assignments during the course. I really recommend her, you learn valuable information in the course.

Liz is a very kind and caring person, I liked her class, I would take her class again if I could. She is very flexible and gives you a lot of good feedback. We have 2 weekly readings and have 3 essays throughout the semester and a project, make sure to read and do your essays in a timely manner.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Liz is an amazing educator who genuinely cares about her students and their well-being. She's very personable and encourages everyone to participate in class. The one thing I will warn you about is the readings. There are usually 2 readings per week but she really just uses them to progress her lecture and have students participate.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Cunningham is an amazing professor! The class is reading heavy but I think the readings are actually really informative. The assignments arent difficult with weekly 1-2 page journals and 2 analytical essays throughout the semester. I would 100% recommend to anyone who enjoys engaging in class, if not you may struggle a bit. would def take again
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Liz is a great teacher and is super caring of her students! She is incredibly generous with her time and teaches the course material in a way that is understandable to all. I really enjoyed taking her class and it only met once a week which is great for those that need a more flexible course!

I definitely recommend taking her class she is so amazing. One of the best teachers I have had. She is so caring, she's here for everyone, she want's to know that your doing okay outside of school. Words can't explain what a great person and professor she is. Take her class!!!!

Really great professor who cares about her students! Very understanding and is open to helping students when theyre struggling. Dont be afraid to participate! Youll enjoy the class more when you engage in discussions.

Shes an Amazing person open to help you out if youre struggling. Gives a lot of readings ! Like 20 page readings or more per week. Lots of writing ! And they are analytical essays so there is no topic to guide your writing. Not to tough on grading though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Dr. Cunningham is an amazing professor! I would take any of her classes that shes the instructor for. She gives breaks in her classes and genuinely cares about her students. Attend office hours, attend class, ask questions/participate, invest effort into your work and youll pass the class.

Honestly, Professor Cunningham was the main reason I wanted to take WRI 010 (Writing 10) even though I was already pushing 18 units. She is literally amazing and the kindest teacher you will probably ever have. No final exam. Doesnt really check homework, just participate in discussion, and she usually gives breaks. One of the best teachers.

Professor Cunningham is honestly one of the best professors I've had in a long time. I alway looked forward to her class because she makes it so entertaining and thoughtful. Beware: If you are typically a shy person and don't speak in class, this class may not be for you. Participation matters! Read before class to help keep the discussion going

She is an amazing professor who really cares about her students. She is very kind and understanding but dont try to make excuses. Try your best on your essays and she will give you feedback on your drafts. Take her feedback seriously because it will help your papers and your grade!! Do you work and itll show. By far the best writing professor!
One of my personal favorite writing professors. Participation matters not too much but it can be a grade bumper, had I participated more I would have received an A.
One of the best writing professors out there. I learned a lot in the small amount of time spent in that class.

Professor Cunningham is an excellent professor! She understands the students and speaks to them with such high regard and respect. Prof. Cunningham always makes herself accessible and available. One of the best professor's I have had. Would love to take her again if given the opportunity. CORE 01

Elizabeth is a really nice professor that obviously loves literature. She very clear on what she wants for each assignment/essay and she gave us a smaller workload compared to other classes. I absolutely despise writing but she made the subject a bit better

Dr. Cunningham is an excellent professor. I wish I could choose more things to describe her. She is caring, inspirational, respected, and very accessible. She incorporates civics in her class which makes writing more interesting. She really cares about her students. She is a tough grader, but she does this to encourage you improve upon your skills.

This was my second time taking a COGS course so I knew it would be the most challenging class however, Professor Yoshimi was super helpful and funny! I ended up really liking it, It totally helps to do the readings/notes before lecture but lectures go over everything, pay attention! Super fun class, and interesting skill to learn.

I took Machine Learning Age with Prof Yoshimi. The class itself was okay but I'm not a CSE major so I struggled a bit to keep up. He loves giving feedback and is quite understanding and patient with students. His lectures can be very boring but he tries his best to make sure everyone is at the same level before adding new material.

Lectures are very clear and easy to understand. He makes sure you know what you need to do for assignments, even making a video walk through for some of them. As long as you come to class and do the weekly assignments you should get a good grade. He is very approachable and really cares about student success, so don't be afraid to ask questions!

Professor Yoshimi has an inspirational and caring character. He is interested in Husserlian philosophy, computational cognitive science, and the philosophy of education. He was able to provide me more information on both philosophy and cognitive science outside of the class environment. The class itself is fun and surprisingly easy.

He's a really good professor and is clear on what he wants. We mostly work on Simbrain software and iPython notebook. He makes is user friendly but iPython can be difficult and so can the online quizzes. There's also a lot of reading from the book. The videos he posts help a lot with the homework too.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: detatched from the class. didn't participate well in panel discussions. not worthy of the company of his his peers i.e Viney, Foreman, Ramicova, etc.
So helpful. Makes subject matter that isn't that interestign interesting. Excelent understanding down to earth professor. 2 thumbs up. U go Yoshi!!!!!!
Excellent.

This is a somewhat hard class, but the Prof. the best at this school.  If you can, take this class.  If you understand the lectures, you will understand the labs; once you understand both, you will get a great grade easily.  This stuff isnt that interesting, but the Prof. makes the class relevant and fun.  By the way, hes really cute!!!!!!!!!
No Comments
he's cool
AWEFUL. THE REASONS FOR THE CLASS ARE HARD TO UNDERSTAND. NOT HELPFUL WHEN IT COMES TO FACULTY PRESSURE.
All I have to say is STAY AWAY!!!!!!!

Elijah the TA is soo hot. OMG, our class is so lucky to have him as TA. He is like the smartest, most intellegent, graduate I know. But he is a little cocky. The Professor is excellent as well but not as hot.
He is a hottie and a great teacher. The TA is cool too. I really hope UCM offers another  philosophy class next year, I would definitly take it.
I really enjoyed this class everytime. He clears everything up if you have question. Always open and for students. One of the best Professors here at UCM. And hes a hottie, so thats a plus.
Hot TA, interesting discussions/topics, and really enthuiastic about what he teaches.  What more can you ask for?
Delicious.
Yoshimi is HOTTT!
Best Professor on campus. Very insightful, very charitable, calm and collected in his thought. I don't think he ever says anything he doesnt mean.
He is my favorite professor. Having a hot TA that looks like noah wylie doesn't hurt either. His lectures as actully interesting and he's really good at makeing the readings more understandable.
I think he's great.  He's really interested in what he teaches, and he's still young, so it's easy to connect with him.  I love his class.

Her grading system is vastly different compared to other professors. A lot of people hated it at the beginning and I did as well as later throughout the system I was able to understand how good it actually was. I went from having a D on the mid-semester grade to getting an A- for my final grade. You want to attend her lectures no matter what.

Professor Rutter explains the materials thoroughly, and while grading is based heavily on test grades, she allows for re-testing and numerous chances to re-raise your grade. Previous reviews state that tests are difficult and lectures are horrible, however I feel that many did not review/studying the material enough. She teaches decently for tests.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Really confusing grading criteria. Does provide some extra credit. Hw is Knewton Alta. Exam [standards] retakes are allowed. Lots of hw, prelectures & projects. 4 total midterms + final. Teaching style only works for some. Not necessarily bad, just different.

People who bomb the midterms will be fighting an uphill battle for most of the semester. Retakes are amazing if you only miss a few things here and there, but missing too many will make it difficult to retake every standard. Passing all standards is possible until the final exam is over, so don't give up.
Ask her ASAP about anything confusing.

If you do not like going to office hours then do not take this class. She is a wonderful professor who genuinely wants you to pass. She is amazing and attentive.She will sit down and do the homework problems with you and wants you to pass the class. Also, there are weekly retakes which are useful and allow you to pass the class. Impossible to fail!
The grading is very unfair.
Finished midterm #2 and feeling suicidal :(

When I was driving to lectures, I often wish I would get hit by a car so I wouldn't have to attend midterms.

You will have your grade entirely reliant on Standard Based Testing and a single question will often determine your grade. Retaking standards lets you make mistakes, but it'll never compete with the greatest mistake of all: this class.
Dofficult
Ridiculous
interesting
ridcious
I wasn't a fan of the texting style of the Standard type grading, class averages of 16-20% per standard
Didn't clarify topics enough, testing was very difficult
rating_tags: So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Testing was not pleasant, based on a pass/fail system veery hard to pass
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor however her grading is rigged. She has her course based on pass or fail on exams meaning NO PARTIAL CREDIT IS GIVEN. if I were to take this class with a different professor Id have at least a B. Her grading goes by novice, journeyman, and expert. Only when you get an expert that's when she gives you a pass on the exam.

1-3 HW assignments due per week. Pre-lectures seemed so unnecessary, I did it just for the credit and then took my own notes. Any late work is allowed 3x only. If it wasn't for the group projects, pre-lectures, assigning more than 1 HW per week, and the way lecture is done then I think it would've been better.
No text book, but did have to buy knewton alta

The class was exciting and was not the usual class you would take at UC Merced. Don't fall behind on the pre-lectures, or you will get stuck. This professor is much more understanding than the other professors teaching the same course. If you try, you will pass. (Choose your groups wisely on the Projects)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects

comment: Professor Rutter uses an inverted classroom teaching style where you take notes outside of class and focus on understanding information through group work during lectures. She does give partial credit for late work but there is not much homework given either way. She is also really understanding and available to talk during office hours.

Does a really good job of lecturing always stops and makes sure that people are following along, and gives helpful advice if you ever fall behind. Does a great job providing helpful and timely feedback for homework and any questions you may have on the material. Seamlessly adapted the class to online learning and did a great job with it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: she takes attendance and missing lecture will take a toll on your grade. she allows resubmissions of assignments (even late assignments) but she does assign a lot of assignments, including on pearson. exams are online which helps a lot, we went on field trips as a part of our labs. some of the field trips were really cool!

Very nice person and cares about students, but lectures are quite slow and boring. However this class does have some good field trips around campus and no assignments take much time at all. Tests are online at home and open note, so getting an A is not a concern in the class. Very good for all the credits it will count for

Every tag I selected, she is the opposite of. There is so much homework for this course, I'd say about 2 Pearson assignments and 1 random lab per week. I've been edging under table 6, the one in the back right corner, for pretty much every class and have never been caught. Show up for attendance, DO NOT MISS THE LABS, missing one lab will fail you.

The class itself is manageable and easy to get an A in. My advice is her quality as a Prof. should not determine if you take her class or not. If you want an easy A class to fulfill your engineering gen ed I would take this class. Just attend lectures for participation, complete and ATTEND labs, and complete Pearson homework.

This class is a lot of busy work. Complete the Pearson homework, papers, and projects, and attend labs. She will be lenient with you if you actively "pay attention" to her during the lectures. Midterms are easy and online. The lectures are very dry and not engaging. I recommend completing labs early because some do take a while.

Honestly, as long as you don't miss a lab, you'll get an A. I passed with a C pretty much only because I missed one of the labs but the homework and papers are easy and attendance is technically mandatory but only if you really feel like going. There's a small grade for showing up but you can definitely afford to miss a few lectures at least.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: The class isn't difficult to pass. But the professor's and I personality didn't mesh. How she explained the subjects  got on my nerves, and often left me wondering at the point of showing up to class. I only went for attendance. She talks in third person at least once per class,like "you should be happy Lynn gave you a chance to do this assignment"

Grade consisted of 2 papers, lab participation and activities, 3 exams, and eventually class participation and activities. Lectures were not always useful (unless you get participation points or are doing a class activity). She wants your feedback and is willing to adjust assignments and lectures for the class.

9 labs + 2 writing assignments total. seems like a lot of work but easy to do if you follow instructions. very kind & funny professor tbh. Pearson is needed to complete other assignments but easy to do. only 2 online midterms, should be easy since its open note! lecture may seem boring but attendance is mandatory! lecture slides are posted

Lectures were dry. The workload isn't bad as some people are saying. It's a lot but it definitely isn't overwhelming. Attendance for labs is absolutely necessary. Missing one lab could mean a future paper down the line could be very difficult to do and there was no making them up. The labs themselves, exams, papers aren't difficult
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Lectures are dry and super difficult to follow due to teaching style, and Ive had more work assigned from this gen ed class than both of my upper division courses combined. It feels like a high school class. Shes excessive when it comes to expectationseven required us to show our screens to PROVE we used grammarly on a paper or we lose points??
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Very nice professor but tends to go off topic which makes the lectures seem useless when the info is given can be found in the book.

Tbh I never read the textbook and still got an A. I just attended all her lectures and lab reviews for tests. The writing portions of the test are not that bad considering I never knew what was going on. The MC for her tests were online at home and it was through Pearson. Grades more harshly on written work but not too bad, lectures can be boring.

Be ready to read a lot! There are also writing assignments, quizzes, and labs. There are some opportunities for extra credit. There are 3 exams, and each has a free-response section separate from the exam. You can tell she is passionate about the subject but struggles to teach it and can go off-topic but she can be very understanding at times
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She assigns many writing assignments that are not necessarily hard but extremely tedious. Also, she assigns some work last minute which is very inconsiderate to her students. Midterms are mostly through the slides and she tells you what would be tested, which I appreciate. She tries to make lectures interesting but it can still be very boring.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: This course reminded me of high school, and I mean that in the worst possible way. She creates many pointless and long assignment that are simply busy work and have little to do with the lecture material. Most of the writing assignments are based on youtube videos, or simply topics you have to research on your own. Not at higher education standards

2  midterms, 1 non-cumulative final. Gives a lot of extra credit points from attendance and projects. Lectures tend to be dry and she goes through the material pretty fast, so outside reading is the only way to go to understand the materials. Not an easy A!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: There two midterms and a final. I did not pass any of the exams, but I still pass the course. In this course as long as you completed your lab's assignments, homework/in class activities, and your two written assignments, you are guaranteed to pass the course. Also, I highly recommend completing the extra credit lab journals, and any other extra as

rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Extremely helpful and actually cares about your grade in the class. Her lectures are clear and the labs and field trips make the class interesting as well. Would definitely recommend.

Lynn gives great lectures and will help you do anything to help pass her class! She actually cares about you and your grade! She schedules fun field trips and class activities making this class interesting! The structure and grading is great! Lynn saved my semester! Even if you aren't interested in environment engineering like me, take this course!

I took two classes with her. I didn't understand how she graded  because it seemed inconsistent to me when I compared grades. Her in-class tests are difficult. Ok going back to inconsistent grading... I failed the final and got a B+ in the class.. how?? You take her class let me know because I couldn't understand it. Good luck.
She always makes class interesting, even though you don't always have to attend classes because she posts slides, its good to good to go. Shes very lenient and always helpful.

14 quizzes that have unlimited tries so there is no way (well unless you don't do them at all) where you can't get perfect scores. 1 research paper but she does everything she can to help you. Final has 100 multiple choice questions.
Funny, stylish, awesome. Lectures are great but tests are hard. She'll do anything to help students do good.
She's always willing to go out of her way for her students, if they need help! She also always considered our preferences before making any decisions about the class.
Boring... But she does try to make the class interesting Her assistant was a jerk and not very helpful I would say take another class or teacher...

I honestly dont learn a single thing from her classes. The way she sets up her grading can be unfair because everything has the same weight, including weekly quizzes that people always seem to get 4/5 on. The way she grades her papers may be based on luck. Thank god she does take home exams. If she doesnt for you, good luck.

Took Personality Psychology with her. She lost assignments, graded unfairly, and forgot to enter grades. Interesting class, but very disorganized. She is very ..."dramatic." Nice lady, horrible professor.

Shes an amazing professor. yes you need to remind her to do things but she gets them done. We are lucky(UCM) to have such a great lecturer that will take time out to interact w/students as much as she does.She is AMAZING!
Odom-Gunn has kept me in school. I was gonna leave but she's so encouraging and stuff. She's funny in class. I loved her.

So her class isnt too hard, however, she has very high expectations for term papers and any other type of paper. she's a procrastinator when it comes to grades, which you need to be very careful if you take her class. if she messes up your grade, you better remind her, otherwise, she'll never fix it
She was a very helpful professor who is obviously committed to her job and helping every student understand the material and pass with the best grade possible.

She is never prepared, never organized, just not a teacher material. She takes time to talk to you and listen to your concerens, but friends can do that. She always leaves EVERYTHING until the last minute. She messed up the whole class' grade this semester, never apologized. Always makes up these excuses for her mistakes. (ex.no paper in printer??)

She is beyond amazing. She is an amazing lecturer. They are very fun and have strong relations to our lives. She makes them very understanding. She will work with students with grades. Her reader is a pain, but she will work with you to help better your grade. Definitely a professor you must take at UCM.

She doesn't hold your hand in this course, that's for sure.  If you ask her for help though, she's more than willing.  Good luck trying to catch her, she doesn't hold office hours on campus if your class is in the evening.  We used an online format for this course which is definitely not suitable to all students.

This class is ridiculous and honestly, odom-gunn is horrible when it comes to planning. She procrastinates and everything falls apart. I expect much better from a professor that has been around for a while to not fall behind.

Professor odom-gunn is very accomodating to her students. She does her part and more to help them suceeed, all you have to do and meet her half way and hold up your weight and you should be fine. She lectures well and is very compassionate about what shes teaching. she wont grade you on something she doesn't know and will adjust accordingly. Good

She is an awesome professor.  I can actually say that she is one of the few professors at UC Merced who actually takes teaching seriously.  She makes class lectures very easy to understand and she always uses examples that are intriguing.  Take her class!!!
I liked her! She's very passionate and has no problem keeping the class awake. Not the hardest class in the world but coming to class is a must if you don't want to fall behind.

If you're getting into this class, prepare yourself for lots of reading. Weekly online tests are assigned, and if you don't read, expect a bad grade. The lectures help with the understanding of the material, but reading is absolutely critical to succeed.

Considering the section had close to 300 students and was 7-9pm, I have to say she does a very good job at keeping you awake. Some of her examples were hard to follow, but that keeps lectures interesting.  She's also really understanding and will listen to any problems you may have (She is a psychologist after all).

Cool guy and caring teacher, he's willing to accept late work whatever the reason, as long as you email him beforehand. the lectures are important, and there are quizzes everyday for participation.if you show up, pay attention, and write well on whatever you need to (you can talk to him for further advice), you'll do well in the class.

One of the best spark classes you can take, the class is taught in a way that as long as you participate you will get through with an A. He teaches the class with students in mind and anyone that needs help can ask for it and know they will be catered to. Highly recommend for a spark class.

I really liked how passionate he is during class and he makes the topics really interesting, he even gave us a second chance for the midterm since our class was well-behaved. As long as you listen to him, he would be nice to you and even give you extra time to complete assignments. He also dropped the 10 lowest quizzes
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Prepare to read a lot and have your writing skills be tested!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: Gautreau is a really good professor and the class is very easy as long as you put in the work. He's very lenient when it comes to turning in assignments late and is willing to regrade essays. He is very helpful and easy to talk to.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Justin is a great professor! I had him for WRI101 as well as WRI001, and he is one of the most caring people at UC Merced. He really wants you to succeed. His class contains a lot of readings and you must put in the work but he gives good advice and drops quizzes. Attend his office hours and get to know him and he will guide you to better success!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Gautroe was OK except for grading, which was harsh and did not have a lot of reasoning to back it up.

For WRI 101 class do yourself a favor and take this class with a different professor unless you enjoy confusing material and unclear/unhelpful professors. Like other people said he grades stuff really bad too and doesnt give a whole lot of examples of what you did wrong. Lots of long reading and confusing tests too... lots.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Really really really tough grader but otherwise not terrible I guess. Didn't have almost any communication with him though, so I can't attest to his personality.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Awesome professor!

Classwork itself was not that difficult, but working with this professor was. Grading was so harsh that it almost seemed like he was just looking for ways to make students fail. The feedback he gave was, at times, extremely petty and ridiculous. He wasn't much better in person. I really enjoyed the class material but Gautreau soured my experience.

Professor G. was bad. This whole semester he gave tons of excuses for assignment and grade delays. When grades finally did come they were horrible! Class average was so low. At least he let us do revisions but those only raised my essay grades by less than 5 points every time. Describing him as a tough grader is an understatement. Avoid taking him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I was surprised how much I learned about writing in psychology! Tough grader but lets you rewrite for higher grade and he drops lowest quiz scores.

Professor Gautreau was unhelpful and condescending when I asked him anything. He graded assignments really slowly and extremely harshly. Lectures were understandable enough, but assignment prompts were totally confusing. Every week he assigned two to three 20+ page readings and quizzes on the readings were so complicated.

I really liked his class at first but I think he expects a bit too much from his students for it being a writing 001 class. He gives pretty good feedback but sometimes is a bit harsh of a grader. Be ready to do a lot of reading and have pop quizzes almost every week. He does make class fun and interesting though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Hes honestly not the best professor, but I dont hate him. His quizzes took place almost every day, which was anguishing because his open-ended questions were sometimes too specific. Even if I did the reading, I would be frantically searching the book. He means well as a professor, but I feel like he couldve been much better and accommodative.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: One of my favorite professors at UCM. Very supportive of students. Too bad coronavirus came this semester. :(

He is one of those professors that you don't hate but you don't like at the same time. He expects a little way too much from his students. He assigns essays and always says to ask him questions when you have any. The moment you need help and ask him things, he has this nasty attitude and ends up not helping you at all. His explanations are vague.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He was the best! It's easy to see that he is really passionate about film which makes it a joy to come to class. There are a lot of assigned readings that you have to do if you want to pass the short answer quizzes. He grades fairly and gives great feedback on journals but beware that he grades harder on bigger papers and the midterm!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Me. Gautreau is very passionate and caring and really made us feel like equals. Writing was made fun because of him.
Incredible teacher really made writing fun
a Free A and good professor.

One of my favorite professors at UC Merced. He gave the students full creative freedom in their writings and made it easy for students to write. I didn't receive too many homework assignments, in his class and had the entire year to produce two essays. He's a very understanding professor and is really kind.

One of my favorite professors at UCM. Very understanding professor, and does the most for his students. The lectures were early and long, and necessary for the class, but worth it. All course material is provided. You will pass the class with a good grade as long as you put in the work and complete all of your assignments. Should be a perfect class
Really funny and nice. Not too much effort required.

Dr. Snyder is a very fun and engaging professor that I look forward to talking to every class. There were three main assignments, plus weekly journals. He canceled class a lot, which I was actually a bit sad about. He really likes creativity and passion in assignments, I took a big risk on a project and got full points, so go crazy!
I would 100% recommend taking this course, the readings are very simple and interesting. Prof. Snyder is easy to talk to if you ever need help.

I'm currently taking him for Writing 1. I really enjoy him as my professor. He cancels class a lot, but he definitely knows what he's talking about and he's very knowledgeable. We get homework once a week and it's a fairly light amount. No tests or quizzes given so far. Would definitely recommend to anyone
Great Professor with a great attitude
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Get ready to read

comment: He's great, super chill and cancels class occasionally (he cancelled my class once because it was raining). A bit of a tough grader on essays but gives good feedback. Don't let the tattoos and skateboarding intimidate you! He cares about the students and will give you a break if you're open about it -- I had the flu and he gave me a huge break.

Snyder is one of the most caring and understanding professors that you will meet at Uc Merced. With his course work he is very clear of what is expected and genuinely wants his students to improve. He is very understanding to many circumstances and if you engage and do well in this class Snyder is good mentor and being. Just follow the syllabus

Matthew Snyder was a wonderful professor to have. He was understanding when I didn't have a draft done on time but also encouraged deeper thought on the material covered in class. I would gladly take another one of his classes.

Professor Snyder is by far the most energetic professor that I have had and his teaching is great as well. There is an expectation to be prepared for every class and have assignments done in a timely manner but there is no mandatory attendance or strict due dates.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Such a great prof! Very nice and down to earth. He cancels class a lot but is always there to help you with your papers, even if he's not in office he'll do Skype calls with you. You do use an online textbook that he provides the pdf for.

Amazing Professor! He really cares about writing & making you into a better writer. He is very chill, think of him as a adult teenager. He does grade hard on essays but its only to help you improve, also he gives you a week to fix your papers. He also cancels class a lot. He allows a two day extension to submit almost every assignment.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: He's the best writing professor I've taken so far!

Professor Snyder is a great professor if you put in the effort and enter with a positive attitude you will grow immensely as a writer. Go to all classes, participation is worth a lot of points, pay attention to feedback, do the readings and go to office hours and you will be all set!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is horrible I did well but he is just horrible

Will talk forever if you don't interrupt him. Sometimes helps if you have a presentation to do and didn't work on it that well. Can easily be side tracked if you know the particular topics to get him interested in. Will assist you though if in need and struggling with the class. He is hilarious and will make the class fun and worth it.

Very engaged in class and in the material of the class. Expects us to read the essays which are few in number and discuss during class. His class is a huge discussion based class and you need to be open to speaking for things to be more smoothly. Helps you improve your writing and is there to assist you if in need of help on a paper. Great guy!
His expectations on the assignments was too high; and he giving out too much stuff to do.

Dr. Snyder is really funny in the classroom. His expository writing class is pretty basic but he does challenge your thinking a bit with the text. The classroom is mostly discussion and most of the time he has us do quick timed writing once a day. He gives great feedback on essays and you get to revise them if you get a bad score. I recommend him.
Doesn't communicate when it comes to feedback. She grades harshly on essays, even if it's about your personal life she will grade based if she feels you expressed the essay the way she would want it.

She is very sarcastic and sometimes just blatantly shows disrespect towards her students.She frequently rolls her eyes and laughs at students that have certain questions.Over all her work was easy I did most of them the day before it was due.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: This is the class to take if you want an Easy A. She lets your write in your own way, to find your own voice. She may talk a lot when explaining assignments but she means well. She appreciates if you speak in class and participate, but if no one does so, she'll call on people (somewhat rare).

I do not recommend this professor. She lacks knowledge in basic technology which sometimes took up class time. Very vague in assignment requirements and leads to a miscommunication. I took her for my wri 10 class and honestly I learned more about writing in my wri 001 class! If you want an easy A this is it but you won't progress or learn anything

Silbaugh is very professional and kind. As long as you attend the class and don't skip, there is no harm. There are no quizzes or tests, but a lot of writing for her class. Make sure to follow what she asks or lectures you about because it is very important and she docks you points off if you don't do it correctly.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Besides the fact that you have to listen to her laugh every five minutes shes not that horrible. Class is super easy so, if you fail your an idiot.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough Grader

comment: This prof fails to specify what she expects on assignment/contradicts herself in class and docks points if your assignment lacks something she never mentioned. She often becomes frustrated with my class for things beyond our control, we follow her instructions, but that is never enough. Inconsistent office hours. Choose a different prof if you can.

Super unclear and unorganized, but when you ask she will clear it up well. You have to ask if you need to meet her outside of class, not accessible otherwise. Feedback on essays was mediocre, but grades easy. Will like you more if you participate in class, gets frustrated when nobody speaks.
This class was really easy! I really enjoyed her class discussions and she provides plenty of extra credit opportunities. We mostly did group work

Professor Silbaugh's class is a great place to have a discussion. She allows every student the opportunity to share their thoughts on the world every week. I really felt that I was able to communicate to my peers in this class much more so than any other class. Also, she is willing to help you and wants you to succeed. I recommend taking her.
Doesn't teach much but is super sweet and easy going.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She's good professor. She is a tad unorganized but very helpful when you ask questions. She is easy on the grading and doesn't give a lot of assignments. She doesn't give quizzes you just have a couple homework assignments and three essays for the semester.
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: unorganized

De Ette is one of my favorite professors. Shes not all that clear with what she wants but she offers a lot of chances to re-explain herself. Shes available to meet outside of class even if its not in regular office hours. Easy on grading and wants you to succeed.
De Ette is super nice! I liked that core discussion actually means a discussion course not just an extra writing course,

She is a very nice teacher and is inspirational. Very easy on grading. Sometimes she is not good on organization, so you have to ask questions about homework assignments. However, she has a great grading policy, does not believe in quizzes which is a bonus.

She is a very nice teacher. Very easy on grading. Sometimes she is not good on organization, so you have to ask questions about homework assignments. However, she has a great grading policy, does not believe in quizzes which is a bonus.

She is all over the place in terms of teaching, very unfocused and the class is kind of a joke in the sense that we really learn nothing about writing journalism we just sit around in groups and waste time "peer editing." I really can't say that she has taught me anything at all about how to write a journalism article. She has no expertise in news
Easy class if you show up and do all the work. Every paper should earn you an A if you stay on topic. Big on discussions and group work.
Ms. Silbaugh is a hilarious person, but she does a poor job when it comes to explaining assignments.

Silbaugh is big on small group discussions, which is a good thing in my opinion because I believe that people are more expressive in small groups. However, the directions that she gives for assignments aren't very specific and she gives little feedback. Her course stressed the components and design of arguments, which I really appreciated.
Accused people that did really good on the final of cheating! Avoid her or her husband at any cost.

Prof Liwang is a great professor, truly cares about your success, you have to work hard however and thats to be expected in Ochem, you do get the grade you deserve in this class, the harder you study the better you will do simple as that really. The class is only exams so you have to do good on them, 1 is dropped however and the final is the ACS.

Her office hours are what had helped me the most, she was very helpful in them because she would go over what was going to be lectured that week and even give hints to what types of problems were going to be on the exam. Her explanations were also clear and made ochem easy to understand. I would definitely take her again if I could.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Probably the best professor at UCM. Patti is kind, funny, and an incredible lecturer. Her office hours are probably the best resource for succeeding in this class as she goes over various practice problems that look similar to those questions that appear on the exam. Go to lecture, Go to office hours, and do practice problems from the textbook.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof. P. Liwang is amazing. She is clear in class and is probably the best lecturer you could get for O. Chem at UCM. The exams are difficult, but very fair and she does not put problems designed to trick you. If you go to her office hours she treats it as a small group lecture which is extremely helpful to succeeding in the class!

She is a horrible lecturer. She always goes on tangents during lecture and speaks too fast, so I can barely absorb any information. The only reason I attended lecture was to get credit on the clicker questions. The only way to learn in this class is by reading the textbook and watching YouTube videos. Be prepared for a lot of independent study.

Rushes through lecture slides and doesn't explain the material very well. I learned a lot more from the textbook than actual lectures. The only reason I attended lecture were for the clicker questions which she has instead of weekly quizzes (makes it difficult to learn anything). Be prepared for a lot of independent study in order to pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is great! She tests from her lectures and is very good at writing out examples so that everyone can get them down. She really tries hard to help students understand the subject. Take good lecture notes, study them, and you will pass. Do not expect a curve.

CHEM 08 initially gave me nightmares, the horror of failing the course- BUT doing the suggest problem right after the lecture not a week before a test really helped me succeed in this course. HER LECTURES NEVER GOT borning, but are long though. QUIZZES are ok- nothing surprising. DO the work and you will pass, but do it everyday :)  ---  YOU ROCK

Patti is an awesome lecturer. She will pause to take notes with the class and if you study her notes, then midterms should be straightforward. She was very fair with everything. Pay attention in lecture and practice problems (especially synthesis) to really understand ochem. WileyPlus helps for reviewing before exams.

Great teacher who wants you to succeed in class and tries hard to explain the difficult topics of organic chem. She does clicker quiz and extra credit questions. The book is a good book but sucks cause you have to buy a separate solutions manual. Tests can be specific but are fair. Great teacher overall highly recommend.

She is a really nice professor who wants to see you succeed. She gives extra credit. Chem 8 overall is a very hard class, but her tests are a little easier than other chem 8 teachers. She isn't the best Chem 8 teacher in terms of explaining stuff, but she is nice and very helpful. She does put a curve on her class too which helps.

Best professor I've had in my time here at UC Merced. She has a passion for the subject matter and relates her own research to what you're learning. Very motherly to the class, but she still requires you to work for your grade. I would love to have her again for Biochem next year. If able to, take her class. You won't regret it.

One of the best professors I've ever had. She clearly shows interest in this subject. Makes things really easy to understand. She has the tendency to talk about research a lot (especially in her biochemistry class), but it's pretty interesting. Do back of the book problems and understand how the reactions work and you should do fine in her class.

Amazing professor. Super helpful and really sweet. Her exams are not tricky. They are definitely not as easy as her clicker questions but I think those are made really easy because it's just free points. Just do the suggested problems and go to lecture and you'll be fine.

She is a knowledgeable teacher, but doesn't match the lecture to the exams. The tests are definitely not as easy as her lecture notes and clicker questions would lead you to believe. Her few suggested problems for the chapters are also not a guide to what you need to know. I'd stick to reading the book and going to TA office hours.

I love professor liwang! Very willing to help and genuinely is interested in seeing students succeed. I was scared for ochem but she makes it very clear. Do ALL suggested problems and the exam won't be too bad. Read the book, follow along the powerpoint slides and go to lecture because it's beyond helpful. Oh and easy daily clicker quizzes too. :]

Very clear and concise professor.  Make sure that you keep on track with material or else you'll struggle with later chapters, as concepts build upon each other.  Do all of the rec'd textbook problems and understand them and you'll ace the exams.

One of the best instructors i ever had. Organic chemistry is pretty hard at times, but she made it really easy-to-learn.I found her midterms and finals super-duper easy. If you pay attention in class and do the homework,you are sure to get an A in this class. :)

Very good professor, I like the fact that she writes out notes/examples for everyone to see during lectures. She seems very passionate about what she teaches, exams can be hard so you have to study hard and ask her if you have any problems. Overall good Professor
Liwang was one of the best professors i have ever had, chemistry is challenging but the way towards success is a guiding teacher and hardwork.
Awesome Professor. Great class. Learned a lot on energy system design and modeling.

As long as you come to class for attendance and do the homework you'll pass this class easily. I thought it'd be harder at first but if anything I feel like it was the easiest class on campus, no sweat easy A.

Lectures and exams focus heavily on calculations. You are EXPECTED to use your textbook to gain INFORMATIONAL portion for context so that you can understand the calculations. He's very particular about making sure every student understands calculations. All his attention and energy is on students!

I do not regret taking Professor Ghassemi for SPARK. He is so caring about each of his students, is approachable, and is passionate about what he teaches. For this class, we had three group projects. They weren't difficult but you do have to invest an effort to get a good grade.

This professor was very caring about each and every one of his students throughout the course. If you have any difficulties throughout the course, he is more than willing to help. He is super kind and caring and lets everyone know how happy he is to see them and makes sure that all of his students are doing well. I definitely recommend this class.

Renewable energy - grades consist of three major group projects. The professor is a gem of a guy, very nice, straightforward, good humor, very informative on the material & what is expected. Be sure to pay attention to lectures, communicate and take work seriously, not hard material; able to contact outside of class consistently for questions.
Awful, dont even want to spend time to describe

Professor Ghassemi was an amazing instructor! Although I rarely paid attention in class, he was really helpful during office hours. Make sure to do the assignments. Your whole engineering career was built for this EASY A class. Don't waste it. Capstone is the easiest class to get an A in your whole engineering career.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Awesome class. I learned a lot about the skills I need to improve for a succesful career.

Great class to take with this professor, He comes into class very energetic and ready to teach students. Overall I learned a great about renewable energy. There are several group projects and as long as they are done, you'll be guaranteed to get and A in the class.

The course is a great opportunity to be introduced to the expectations of college. There are 3 major projects: no tests, and no final. Do well on them they matter! Work is not unreasonable and he guides you through the process. You'll have to work for your grade but it is worth it. It is a great class. Word of advice: choose your groups wisely.

Really good professor and person. There are 3 group projects during the class. The first one was a presentation + a 6 page research paper. The second one was a presentation + a 10 page research paper. The last one was a 6 page research paper. He does give a lot of class time to work on projects. Easy to get a B+/A- but getting an A is a bit harder.
Awsome class. Learned a lot. Fantastic Prof.

Overall a hard class but worth it if you are willing for a challenge. He is a great professor and organizes what he wants from you very well. The class itself is very useful if you are everything about designing any sort of power system. As well as helping you learn how to research things on your own.

The class is difficult, but fun. You honestly must go into this class being interested in renewable energy and really wanting to understand this topic more. Dr. Ghassemi is a great professor and lectures can be fun. This class is NOT EASY. You will have to work hard for your grade and do multiple group projects, be prepared and do your best.
Was a wonderful class. Dynamic professor! Very knowledgeable.
learned a lot. Prof. Ghassemi is an awesome teacher.
Awesome prof. Really knows his stuff and made the course very interesting.

Amazing lecturer, and does a great job at making you care about renewable energy. Your entire grade is based on 3 group projects on various aspects of renewable energy, but if you put in the effort it should be fine. Don't expect a complete cake walk for a GE course, and be prepared to write a research paper, but they aren't graded too harshly.
Awesome class. :Love every lecture

I love the way she lectured. She was passionate and tried to make the class as hands-on as possible. However, her lectures were broader concepts and some test questions were not discussed at all in class because it is mentioned in the book. No need to deep read but skim through the chapters and go to class and you will do fine
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Song was really nice and all but she barely lectured. She had us watch videos and do additional readings or would bring in guest lecturers. We also had weekly vlog/blog assignments, which were really easy to do. There was a midterm and final, you really have to study for to pass. We also had to do a term paper, which was hard for many.

I loved Dr. Song! She was one of the best teachers I have ever had a UC Merced. I would 100% take another one of her classes. She was very understanding and fair. She also gave us extra credit and her tests were straight forward. Definitely get the book, and you can find it for cheap. I loved her and this class!

Very understanding professor. I took her online last semester, and I want to take more classes with her. She genuinely cares about her students and she cares about what she teaches. Not too sure why some people are rating so low... she even gave us two chances to take the midterm, and we had the whole day to choose when we wanted to take it.

one of the best professors I have ever had. Super understanding and respectful. Amazing lectures. Midterm was a bit difficult however there are assignments given throughout the semester to make up for missing grade. Only one paper to submit. Overall one of the best classes and professors I have ever had.

If you go to the class you won't have any trouble with the homework. She makes class fun and is respectful. Not homework heavy. The way she structures class you really do get to learn with less assignments.

Mandatory attendance (group discussions), group work, weekly presentations, weekly homework (blogs/podcast), exams, and a term paper. If you want a chill course, don't pick this. I hate this class. The only pros: the professor is funny.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I loved her class, she was an amazing professor and she truly cared about her students. Honestly i would recommend.

I am truly confused about how this professor got an average of 3.4 points on this platform. One of the other students mentioned back in 2016 that her exams are open notes and books. I want to clarify that that is no longer true. Professor Song is just a complete mess who disguise herself with a "good" lecture. Her exam questions are poorly written

I feel like everyone in my class was confused throughout the semester, and most people did poorly on the midterm and final. I felt like this was more of a public health class than a psychology class. She also tests on additional readings thats we vaguely discussed in lecture, so if youre not good at reading studies youll get those wrong too.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Make sure you attend class as it can help you if you are borderline of failing. She adds a lot of questions from what is discussed in class and the readings. She provides a lot of extra credit; however the TA is a hard grader when it comes to grading papers. The professor is not direct when answering questions and can confuse students at times.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Surprised this person is even a professor. She seemed to had confused everyone in my class; as she would give vague answers and trick Q&As to the students throughout the semester. Her tests were heavy on everything discussed, the assigned readings, book, videos, and lectures. Topic points seemed to be vaguely connected to psy subject.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: I loved this class a lot. Professor Song makes the lectures super enjoyable and she is hilarious! She is very knowledgeable about this topic. She gave us one term paper, a mid-term and a final (open note, open book). Overall I loved this class, however, she let the TA grade our paper, and her feedback would've been more appreciated.

She is very passionate in her lectures. Really wants you to get the main point of topics. 1 paper, 1 midterm, 1 final make up the bulk of your grade. Study the powerpoint slides and readings that she assigns and make sense of figures/plots/graphs.

Professor Song is great! Her tests tend to be on the difficult side, but if you attend class regularly you will be prepared. Her lectures are very interesting and she encourages discussion throughout. One of the best lecturers on campus.

Anna Song is brilliant and amazing and dripping with knowledge. She's the best lecturer I've ever had at UCM. Her explanations clear, her jokes are funny, she's engaging and smart. I feel like I'm actually learning and being challenged which is rare in a psych class. BEST professor EVER. Highly recommend taking her classes.

It's one of the few classes that I've taken at UCM that require you to use your critical thinking skills not just out of the book stuff. As long as you show you're really being thoughtful about what they're teaching in your papers, I believe you will do well. Watch out for the tests, they can get difficult. Study hard!

I enjoy being taught by her. If you are a Psych major you NEED TO take at least 1 course with this woman. She knows her stuff and enjoys tearing you a new one when you respond to her questions (in a good way). She is my role model. I was disheartened to hear when she was off the market for good. I <3 you Song!

Dr. Song was my professor for Health Psychology. She is very clear about expectations and the material. Her classes are interesting and her lectures are great. She is also helpful one-on-one, in action potential.
I've had her before in Health Psychology and she's really sweet and pretty. As long as you pay attention in class and read the book, you're pretty set to get an A. I love her so much!! :)

Fantastic Prof. My favorite at UC Merced. His lectures are very engaging and has a very bright charisma to him. His office hours were very welcoming and would give you all the resources you need to understand the material better. The readings are widespread and interesting, drawing from multiple different sources instead of just one textbook.

The worst Cognitive Science class I have ever taken. His lectures are a mess, no clarity whatsoever. He assigns a bunch of readings and none of them are even too relevant to the course. Too sarcastic and gives very vague answers when you ask him. The tests doesnt even make sense... would not recommend him at all.

Professor Pageler is a nice guy, but he teaches based off of his thought stream which is often not coherent, clear or concise. He has a lot of passion for what he teaches, but lacks clarity. When taking his test, I feel like I need to approach the questions from his individual perspective instead of the perspective of a typical cognitive scientist.

One of my favorite professors - he is very funny, light-hearted, and passionate about cognitive science. His passion definitely makes the class much more interesting, and I was excited to go to lecture each day. Despite the class material being pretty challenging, he did a great job in making the class flow seamlessly from topic to topic.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Pageler is an AWESOME guy, but hes so smart that its hard to keep up with what hes teaching. He made class entertaining, but the material was hard to understand and at times unclear. His tests are REALLY hard, but luckily hell curve if people do bad. Overall hes been one of my favorite professors at UCM, his classes just take a lot of work.

He expects his students to read the assigned readings (at least 2 times) and participate in class. He is accessible both in his office hours and via emails. The grades depends only on 4 take home tests: 12 questions per test. He does not give good feedback on grading (unless you asks him individually). Super inspiring character. He makes you think.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Ben's class is one that assumes responsibility in the reading. Lectures are not necessarily for learning, but rather clarifying what you've already learned in the readings. He also tosses in questions from the lectures on his quizzes. In other words, if you want to pass: 1: Attend Lectures 2: READ, READ, READ!  3: Ask questions in class
Very inspiring, though can be a hassle if you dont read.

The worst Cognitive Science class I have ever taken. Ben lacks clarity in his explanations, as well as his questions. Weekly assignments, which consists of groups answering his questions, which are hard to understand. His Power Points are terrible. They consists of his thoughts, which lack clarity and conciseness. Overall, do not recommend.
Heavy on Philosophy so be prepared to be confused in some lectures but you can clarify it with him in office hours. Great professor. READ READ READ READ for his class!!!

Ben is really sarcastic and likes to joke around. He notices when people do not show up to class and he starts to complain about it. Tests are hard. You don't necessarily HAVE to read, but it helps a lot. He emphasized on reading in order to pass the class, but he covers a lot of the same material that's in his slides.

Any one who actually cares about school will tell you to go to class and read, if you want a good grade. I will not say both, you always have to. The teachers job is to teach and if you go to class and read then you help your chances of passing. When you dont read and dont go to class then you might not pass with the grade you need. Tough luck.
You can tell he loves the subject but he has a weird way of teaching. He likes to joke around too much and his powerpoints don't have much information which makes it hard to study from.

Probably on of the best professors I've ever had. His lectures are super funny and engaging. Don't expect his classes to be easy though. You have to put in the work, but if you do he will go out of his way to help you understand the material. Don't get behind on the reading! You will drown!

Great class, but not an easy A. The class material is really interesting but if you let the readings pile up, there is basically no way to get a decent grade on the tests. Besides the readings, the class does not require a lot of assignments. It is more based on tests (3) and the final essay. Do readings and show up to lectures and you'll be fine.

I loved Ben's COGS 1 class! He was very funny, and also included some philosophical stuff in his lectures which seemed like a little much for an intro to cog sci class but I still enjoyed the material. Class was relatively easy but a lot of reading (which I honestly didn't do all of but I still did well). Just go to class, he's interesting anyways!

Ben is a great lecturer overall. He is very enthusiastic when he lectures and engages and interacts with the class as opposed to just lecturing for the whole time. Didn't do assigned readings at all & passed the class easily so the quizzes and final are not that hard, just go to lecture & pay attention. A little unorganized w/ the TA's though

Seriously....DO THE READING. He notices, and respects you if you do. He just wants people to be involved. His slides seemed a little confusing to me, but his tests weren't trying to trick you if you were reading. Also, I would recommend going to office hours -  I swear it turned my grade around.

He is a really great professor, yes he can go on tangents but as long as you are willing to do the readings in the depth that he wants, you should be fine. He really wants his students to get the material, so go to office hours if you have question. Other than that, great professor.

His tests are super hard, he goes on tangents. But the tangents are funny. I loved him even though I felt like that class was too challenging and too philosophical for my taste. I would take a class with him again because he is very helpful when you go to office hours and has interesting lectures. well... as long as it wasn't too philosophical...
if you can just take another professor, its alot of mini assignments on top of the essays
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: She is very encouraging, always makes herself available for questions and provides feedback. Tons of writing! The readings are interesting though, a lot of psychopath stories. She is very enthusiastic about the material and knowledgeable. No final exam, just projects to complete. Some documentaries to watch and TONS of extra credit is offered.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Such a great professor! Her work was extremely easy. She makes majority of the assignments due by Sunday, and you can rewrite the reader summaries and your essays if you got a low grade. She will not accept late work, but we have an entire week to complete her assignments, so it balances out.

One of my favorite professors! I had her for more than one class because of the structure in the class. Easy to reach through emails. She picks great novels for the courses & made writing papers interesting.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Cindy Chavez was so helpful with transitioning into college life. She is so sweet and down to earth. You need to be ready to write and read a good amount, but it is very manageable. As long as you show up, do your work, and put in effort you will get an A. The class is based on criminology but she makes it hands on and fun even at 7:30!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Dr. Cindy Chavez is an amazing professor. In my opinion the best at UCM ! This Writing 101 class made me feel like a detective because we studied serial killers and the anatomy of violence. It was a great experience and I learned lots. Class is not too hard just do the work and readings and you can get an A.
Shes tough, but she cares lol. Effort wise, shes well aware of who puts in effort and who doesnt. Sometimes she reminds me of a jail warden. But yeah.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Tough grader--Get ready to read

comment: She is amazing

She's an amazing professor who till this day is my favorite prof from UCM. I def recommend taking her class and I wish she taught more. I loved how hands on the work was and that I actually learned what she was interested and passionate about.

She is amazing! Very inspiring professor, by far one of the best professors at UCM. I highly recommend her! She pushes you to become a better writer and is there for her students. Very caring and she does a lot to help her students pass! Never a dull moment in class. Make sure not to miss because a lot of points are earned in class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Cindy is one of my favorite teachers at UCM. She is absolutely caring and driven for what she does. There is a lot of homework but its nothing too impossible. The class can be an easy A as long as you do all the work. She is really helpful when you need it and cares about peoples opinions and points of views.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: Incredible writing instructor. Very professional, and puts the class in context of her own journey in establishing herself in academia. She has high expectations, but if you work hard and display a trend of improvement, she grades according to that spectrum. While there is a lot of work, she makes it clear as to what is expected and how to do well.

By far the greatest professor I have ever had! She is such a caring professor. She truly wants her students to succeed! Yes, the load is a lot and tough, but the class is so engaging and she guide you EVERY step of the way. Wish every professor had her style, enthusiasm, and respect.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Professor Chavez is great! She does give a lot of homework. A lot. There are a ton of group projects, but she will guide you every step of the way. She is very approachable and seems to truly care about the students.

One of my two all-time favorite professors! Her lectures are incredibly interesting. The assignments include case studies, reading logs, and some group projects. She does her best on helping you pass if you put in the effort. I learned so much in this class. I just wished she taught other writing  classes, so I could take her again.

Hands down my favorite professor so far at UCM! She is very dedicated to her students and is always willing to help as long as she sees that you're trying. The class itself is a lot of work, but it's definitely doable and you just have to put in the time & effort. Assignments consisted of case studies, reading logs, and several big group projects.

My favorite professor at UCM, hands down. HATED writing before her course and absolutely fell in love with it after. I even considered a minor in it because she helped me improve my techniques rather than try to change it. You have to TRY and give effort, don't be lazy. Cindy is the BEST, cares about her students so much.
One of the best and most dedicated professors at UCM

Professor Chavez is the answer to every bodies fear of wri 101. Before I took this class I was so scared to take it, I heard it was hard and a lot of busy work. I was no excited at all. But I loved how she structured the class and how helpful she was. There is a lot of work but it does not feel like busy work, there was a purpose for everything.

She is very professional, willing to help, and knows what she is doing. There is a lot of work, case studies due every week in addition to weekly reading journals BUT if you do everything and put in effort you will do well. She makes the material interesting       and has a flexible syllabus if she feels the work is too much for the class.

Nice professor. He might appear disinterested or maybe too serious, but he's very kind and understanding. He encourages students to think for themselves. Lots of reading though, and lectures can feel a waste of time. But it's not to the point where you're drowning in them or that they're too complicated. He tries and he's respectable for that.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Good teacher overall but not the best to make the three hours of school go fast. Workload is average, as we have reflections every week until we start the final project. Attendance is mandatory and if you miss a lot, you will fail the class.
Excellent teacher. Provides a lot of feedback and the opportunity to redo assignments. I took two of his classes over the summer and I'm glad I did! Class is simple and straightforward!

I took this professor during the summer. There is a lot of reading so be prepared, however, readings are quite interesting. We had to complete two reflections on our readings weekly and at the end of course write a 6-8 page paper plus create a presentation. Professor provides good feedback and answers any questions quickly. Participation is KEY!

Professor Sinha has been one of my favorite professors. His assigned work actually is helpful in learned. Yeah theres readings but they all serve their purpose. He is also very organized and each class is essential. Considering the pandemic, Professor Sinha is understanding and is ready to adapt. Thank you for a wonderful course!
Professor Sinha teaches you with your career in mind. This class really helped me with professional development quite a bit. I consider it a very important class in retrospect.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Super cool and super lenient.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: There was a lot of reading in this course but it was all necessary for the in-class discussions and assignments. During this pandemic, he was very understanding of our situations and he didn't mind cameras off as long as you participated. He was very open to extensions and resubmissions if needed, all students had to do was talk to him about it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I took both NSED 100 and 120 with Professor Sinha - both classes were reading intensive; however, the readings are interesting. Reading is important, as class discussions are based on the readings & will make required weekly reflections a breeze. Professor Sinha is also flexible and cares about his students. I would take another class with him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He genuinely cares about his students, and he demonstrates that he wants to improve the educational system. This class is less on content, but more like self-reflection, participation, and effort. Very accessible and understanding. If you are trying to look for an upper division course, TAKE THIS CLASS.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He must have changed his teaching style as these other reviews were not accurate at all for my class's experience. I would not recommend his class unless you're required to take it for the NSED minor. He does not reply to emails often, so ask questions in person. The one good thing about the class is that he allows you to resubmit assignments.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Sinha is really focused on making sure his students are prepared for the teaching career. If you plan to be a teacher, the lessons he teaches in class can be used in your classroom. Participation and interacting with classmates is very important. Class consists of individual and group assignments.
Dr. Sinha is always willing to help his students out throughout the engaging activities he provides and makes sure that the groups in class are discussing and understanding the big picture ideas.

Professor Somnath is very understanding and kind to his students. He will work with you to make sure you do great in his class! Not only that, but if youre looking to go into the field of teaching he gives great career advice. He is also easily accessible through email, and will even give you feedback before turning in assignments!

Great professor! taken 2 classes with him! i'm taking another class with him next semester! Cares about student success. So willing to help. NO exams! Usually have weekly writings on readings (fairly easy) Sometimes a group project, group discussions in class, essay & presentation. Recommend taking his class Understanding & amazing professor
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: The professor is extremely helpful and this is a great class to take if you are thinking of becoming a teacher or want to learn more about the education system. Great class and great environment.
This professor is super passionate about his work and the education that his students receive! He is considerate and his lectures are super interacting!
Great professor! He is extremely dedicated to his work and helping students pursue a career in teaching!
the professor really cares! he does what he preaches, a great and effective professor.
just an awesome teacher! I would take any class any class he teaches!!

Lectures don't match up with the reading, there is a quiz EVERY SINGLE CLASS at the start of class on material that has not yet been taught and you have to be present in class to take the quizzes, they literally track you. Exams are very difficult and most people fail this class. I am an A student and struggled in his class.
I would take his class again. Obviously not everyones cup of tea, but hes brilliant. Like him for that.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I had Microbiology over the summer so the class is very fast-paced. The course requires a higher caliber of readiness to study and work, both in lab and lecture. The Professor is thorough and very willing to help when having difficulties. I would definitely take this class again, and I would take a class with this Professor in any subject.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Do not take his class. As if this course isn't hard enough, I don't understand any of the lectures & his tests are impossible to pass. Our whole entire class received a D or lower on his first exam and he doesn't do curves. Even if you are good at biology, don't take his class. You will struggle the entire semester.
Does not explain lectures very well. By far the worst teacher I ever had.
Worst teacher ever. I would suggest you don't take his class, unless you like your institutions free tuition money because you will fail his class. Worst teacher on planet earth

Pablo is an OK teacher. He didn't give back midterms as soon as they are graded.It was finals week and he had yet to pass back two of the three midterms we had taken. I had no idea how I was doing in the class and when I went to his office hours to get my test back he refused to give it back. He also plays favorites. DO YOUR BEST TO AVOID HIS CLASS
Are you talking about Pablo or Marcos Garcia Ojeda?

His class is difficult. The material is interesting, but he can be boring from time to time. Read the book and you'll pass easily. When you can find him, he's more than willing to help. The reason why people don't like him is because he'll fail people not working hard and he won't curve. He'll help if you put effort in the class.

This professor like favor people. if you are his favorite don't worry you will pass with the class even if you do horrible. He can't talk properly, his test are long, he is disrespectful, and he makes his classer harder than what it's suppose to be.

His lectures are boring and unclear. Sometimes his accent makes things even harder. His tests are stupid because they do not test your knowledge. It seems as if he wants his students to fail. He used fig newtons as examples and exams too much in detail and excessively long.

He has a way of teaching that his students won't get. It's one of the most time consuming class that you cannot slack and need to pay attention to every detail. Professor like him is worth it in the long run.
Pablo has a bad rep. Honestly, he's easy to talk to, but he just cannot teach. Exams are hard, requires thinking. Recycles questions from past exams.

Uses analogies that are hard to relate to the material. The material presented during lectures jumps around a lot, and he uses textbooks material in slides that students do not have access too. Tests gives problems that are often hard to understand and require more logic than knowledge.
His lectures are wordy and sometimes not to the point. Although BIS 001 is not a difficult subject, his teaching is pretty unclear and you must rely on studying on your own a lot.
accent, hard ass, asks questions that only biology students going for master's would know
