His tests are up to 20 pages long. Gives you plenty of opportunity to raise your grade. Read the book and do book questions. Go to office hours. He says he doesn't curve but he still helps.

I think this professor was just fine. His accent does not hinder lectures, he provides lectures, his office hours are generous, and his TA's seem fine. Labs aren't difficult if you have a background in science(you should if you took basic Bio in High school). Gives plenty of opportunity to raise grade. Very effective Biology teacher.

he's awful! his lectures dont make any sense! his TA is even worse! he has bad grammar and is super boring, tests are hard and most pepo are failing the class.  Labs and comp labs are a joke, they are never done correctly and do not make sense, he and the TAs do not help the students w anything! too bad there isnt another BIS 1 teacher we can take
No Comments

If you want an amazing teacher who cares for you and genuinely is interested in improving your work and help you succeed, take Prof. Tessa. She is very passionate about teaching and makes it fun for her students. Available always for her students in and out of class. I was terrified of the class but she made me want to take a writing class again.
Professor McIntire is an absolute joy, she makes lectures engaging. Attendance can impact your grade, so I would recommend attending lecture.
I love her

She is a really nice teacher that cares about students when they need help. She's willing to communicate with student outside of the class to help them solve some problems they are facing inside class.
The most visionary teacher I've ever met, easily passed her class, she teaches well and assignments are moderately difficult.

Tessa is the nicest professor and she always does her best to understand her students. She is extremely empathetic and not only this, but she does a great job of teaching and shows a great passion for writing. She gives it her all to improve her students' writing skills.
If you are able to pick her as your professor please do, she really is amazing and it's very obvious that she genuinely cares about her students which sadly can't be said about many others.

I can't express how much I love McIntire, I was so sad I couldn't have her for writing 010. The assignments can be long sometimes but she gives us plenty of time to work and deadlines can be flexible. I loved going to her lectures her energy and personality is unmatched. Her instructions are always extremely detailed and her feedback was great.
Amazing professor, she was very caring and goes really easy on you. Just put the work in and you will pass, highly recommend.
Dr. McIntire is an amazing professor who truly cares for her students. She is readily available to help individuals with their formal papers and give feedback. I definitely recommend taking her!

Professor McIntire is a fantastic professor! I highly recommend taking her class for any English majors and anyone who is interested in taking a writing class. Feedbacks are very helpful and effective. The professor is very understanding and articulate.

This professor likes to talk to her students and is very understanding. She assigns minimal work, and encourages us to skim through the content so that we have a basic understanding of copyediting. The major assignments which are relatively easy includes a group project and a portfolio.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Tessa is an awesome person. She isnt all about attendance but like someone else said she explains the assignments during lecture. If you are having problems with finishing homework you can talk to her and she will help you.
Shes an awesome person and a good professor. She gives lots of homework but its very easy. Her class is very easy to pass and her lectures are interesting.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: So a week will be 2 assignments of homework but they are easy and wont take longer than 40 minutes. She grades easily. I received full credit for everything I turned in. Lectures arent mandatory but she explains the homework so you should attend. Youll have 3 big writing assignments but she gives u 3 weeks and creative ways to do them.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Gives good feedback

comment: Tessa McIntire is a great teacher. I would definitely hands down take her class again.

Tessa was great ! She was really clear on her feedback and was very helpful if you really did not understand a concept. She made wri 001 super fun and interesting. While we did not use the books she wanted us to purchase the topic of a hip hop writing class made up for it.

Tessa was one of my favorite professors I've ever taken. She's sweet, thoughtful, and genuinely cares about every student. She remembers what it's like to be a student so she works with you and your schedule. She made Core bearable and actually fun, which I wasn't expecting. Highly recommending taking Core with her!
What a good teacher. Shes hot so it made me do better in her class.

If you are going to take core. take it with Tessa. Shes really helpful and clear on what she expects. If you put even the littlest bit of effort in you'll pass hands down.  just make sure your on top of assignments. there's a lot because its core, but tessa try's to make it as easy for you as possible. you just have to meet her half way
Very passionate. Thorough, knowledgeable. Yes
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I'm not a SSHA major, but Guzman made me a bit interested in Sociology, had to take this class as a prerequisite. He is very passionate about the topics he teaches, but at the same time he talks quite fast and goes through the slides too quickly to take down quality notes. Participation points are through clicker questions and discussion sections.

You will learn in his class. He's a very good professor but if you don't like to speak in class then he's not for you. Everyday he calls on students. His exams are easy and papers are easy as well. DON'T MISS HIS LECTURES! CLICKER QUESTIONS ARE WORTH ALOT.

Guzman makes you read a lot for sure. Be ready to answer clicker questions which are a big part of your grade, so dont skip. His lectures are very clear and its important to pay attention. He tends to mumble a lot but other than that you can tell he is passionate over sociology.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Guzman is a great professor. His lectures are well structured and clear. To make sure that students understand the material he applies the information to modern events. Not going to lie this class requires a lot of reading but because of his teaching methods, they become clear and interesting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Great professor and lecturer, clicker questions makes up for alot of your grade, and great class! I highly recommend taking this course!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great Professor will sgow you how the world works around us. He will inspire you to be more attrntive to your surroundings and you will realise things youve never noticed before.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Tony is an amazing lecturer. His lectures are very inspiring and he makes you think about the world around us. There are 5 books needed for the course. During the lectures he goes over readings and there are 4-6 clicker questions throughout based on the reading and lecture. Look for key points in the readings and take good notes to help you pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Guzman is amazing. He is such an a charismatic person, especially when it comes to lecture. This can be troublesome since he can get carried away at times but don't be afraid to ask him to slow down. His midterms/finals are easy as long as you pay attention in class. CLICKER QUESTIONS ARE A CRUCIAL PART OF THE GRADE.. sometimes included on test
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: No wkly hwjust tons of readings tested daily in class. Usually 4-5 ?s and usually 30-45 secs to answer with a clicker. ?s are worth 30% of grade. So if you miss 1 you get a 75-80% for the day; 2 and you've got an F for the days ?s :( In class activities are more like tests that one has to relate to a film (often in Spanish with subtitles).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Gomez is an amazing teacher, he is always there to help you understand the work when you are having trouble. The class can be intense but you can be assured that you will not be bored. Remember to read all the readings and keep close tabs on each author's main argument as that is what you will be tested on.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Be ready to read and do lots of work outside of class (ie projects). An amazing professor who loves his students and cares about what he teaches. He talks fast and calls out students but its Tony's charm.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is awesome!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Constantly pushing for answers in class and doesn't give more than half a second to think. These aren't graded, but man if you won't come out feeling overwhelmed. Probably will give you the answers to quizzes during quizzes (???) and generally just recovers textbook material. Not always the best at explaining things clearly.

Professor Guzman is very passionate with what he teaches. Although there is a lot of reading it helps to understand the class better. Be ready to be picked on, he is very interactive and will call on you the more he knows you. Talks a little fast but is always willing to clarify when needed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He's hot, he has worn a different pair of shoes everyday, for a semester with out a fail. He is some what difficult to fallow, but is passionate in what he does. Which  makes him hot! Beware of his gazing dreamy look, then he will scream at you, it's a love hate relationship really. 9/10

The readings required are really dense. He likes to call on students a lot. The more he gets to know you, the more he calls on you and expects you to answer in class. His lectures are really dense with information, so always pay attention. His tests are easy if you study and take the time to go through every slide and make sure u understand pattens
He makes sure that you understand the material.  There's weekly readings for clicker points. Good professor.
Obviously loves what he does and it shows in his approach of the subject. Lots of hard readings but most are interesting. He is always willing to slow down and re-explain harder material.

The professor interrupts the students when asking a question or responding to the question he asked. The readings are really dense and if you don't understand the readings then you're practically lost. On top of that his office hrs are after discussion, meaning you won't be able to answer the clicker questions, which is 30% of your grade.

This class was so unorganized and effortlessly thrown together that you could honestly kick your feet up on the desk and get a B. Every lecture is incoherent. Quizzes? Worth absolutely nothing. Homework? Nothing! 
Your grade = two essays, which, if they contain English, are given a B or higher. 
Want a free "A" with no material? Register.

He gave us a syllabus and many instructions for him to do the opposite. When you ask him a question about the assignment, he tells you one thing but then asks for something else. He only graded a few things and didn't grade until finals week, which meant assignments from the start of the semester. Like others said many students are frustrated.

I did not enjoy this writing class it actually discouraged me from wanting to take another writing class here. The class was so unorganized and the prof was grading everything last minute making students unsure about their grade until well after finals. While other profs made sure to grade throughout the semester. The students were frustrated.

Nuno is unlike your average college professor. Although he likes to go on tangents, he encourages his students to be unique about their writing styles which was really fun. Yes, his consistency in grading is frustrating but he's an extremely easy grader and doesn't care about grammar error. I've taken 2 of his classes and ended with super easy A's.

The course was disorganized. The syllabus was never posted; out of 70+ assignments, only one was graded by finals week, and many were posted, but the guides weren't posted alongside it. Promised opportunities were never followed up on, like revising the first paper. Communication was poor, leaving students frustrated and unsure about their grades.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: So I went off the rate and the actual class was unexpected/yes we did only two essays but the process of writing them is different and is the only thing he talks about/He did not do any actual writing in class and is sometimes repetitive about writing "notes" that are turned in at the end of class/Weird turn in times/
We only had two papers the whole semester but overall he's a pretty caring guy
pretty good, can be confusing sometimes
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Hilarious

comment: he a cool professor

I hate writing but Sena made this class bearable. After taking Writing 10 with him I can say that he is a easy going and laid back professor. If you need extra time for assignments he will give you a extra day. The assignments are not lengthy and we only wrote two essays in total. Overall, if you need to take writing 10 try to get this professor.

It is very rare to come across a professor that really cares about their students. If you want to outshine your competition when you start looking for jobs or applying for grad school, this is your guy. He is very smart and experienced, he'll teach you more than just writing. btw I hate writing in general but this class was very insightful.

His classes were incredibly boring, homework is confusing at best, and doesn't give the best tips. Not the worst professor in the world, and seems like an interesting person, but if there's another option, choose it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: not, organized, which at times can be good because you can have time to finish because he will give you time. talks all the time and gets distracted all the time.

He's very eccentric and goes off on a lot of tangents. But, I find that his way of lecturing really works for me and even helps me come up with more ideas on how to approach my next research paper. I recommend being an active participant in class because he will be more lenient with you. He's extremely smart and I really enjoy speaking with him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--Hilarious

comment: He means well, but he is the worst lecturer and most disorganized professor I've ever taken! Lectures, directions, and handouts are very difficult to understand, and asking him questions only leaves you even more confused. Usually the only warning given for assignments is in his announcements, which are usually long and wordy. Avoid his class!!

Hes not a terrible person, but he is terrible at sheduling and asinging assingments. He tells you that one thing is to be done within two days, and then the night before he sends out an email changing the criteria and it usually makes it worse. I dont think he pays attention to the length of his assignments in reference to the time frame he expects
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Nuno makes you think outside the box. In terms of coursework, be prepared to read a lot.  He gives one major project that is due at the end of the semester. The workload might seem a lot but you'll realize at the end that he prepared you beyond undergrad. He's always there during office hours & even helps with  grad apps. take him if you can
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: This professor is one of the greatest people you will ever meet. He's so intellectual and hilarious. It's a writing class so obviously there's reading and writing but it's not that hard. There's one research assigned that is given during the beginning of the semester and due at the end. It will seem hard at first but it is over before you know it.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Do not take him. Never on schedule. Never does what he says he's going to. Keeps you in class longer than the assigned time. Doesn't tell you what your grade is until final grade Is due. Feedback not helpful, tells you to do something and when you fix it, he doesn't like and then tells you to do the exact opposite. Bad grading. Stay away from him.
Nuno Sena is without a doubt one of the best professors that I've ever had. He really cares about his students and is paving the way for great new programs at UC Merced.
He's a professor, mentor and fantastic human being.

Nuno was great. He's very enthusiastic about what he teaches. The only annoying thing was that he always said "Write this down" even when it wasn't important. He does use up the full 2 hours of class almost always, so be prepared. His feedback was helpful and although there was a lot of writing, it was fair. Overall, I do recommend him.

Professor Hakala does a really good job at making Shakespeare not only easy to understand, but interesting. She is genuinely really passionate about the texts she teaches. I highly recommend taking a class with her if you have the opportunity!

Dr. Hakala is an amazing professor. She does assign a lot of readings, however for the most part they are enjoyable and easy to get through. Very organized and keeps to her syllabus. Participation is super important as is attendance but overall a really enjoyable professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I like Dr. Hakala and the class, despite what others say. READ THE BOOKS! She assigns a lot of reading but they're really good books and they're important for her surprise quizzes/free writes. She can have an attitude, but it's only if you don't paying attention or read. DON'T BE THAT PERSON! Participate as much as you can or she'll call on you to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Hakala teaches a ton of material, but every minute in is class worth it. She uses many types of content like drama, poetry and novels so if one kind isn't your jam, you just have to wait till next class. The level is how a UC education should be. She is an expert, and anytime I have talked to her she is so helpful!

Regular classes are easy as she either lectures on a topic or has a class discussion on the various plays you have to read. Reading and participation in discussions are important. Will assume you didn't read if you can't answer the questions she poses. Gets frustrated when no one says anything and can have attitude. Acting out a scene isn't bad.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Assigns too many readings. Be prepared to NOT sleep. And make sure you talk in clads if mot you will be called on atleast once per class if you dont answer coreectly it will ne assumed that you did not read. Also dont look at your book during class it will be assumed you did not read as well.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor give so much reading. Be prepared to answer questions if you don't it will be assumed that "you didnt read". You have to stay up super late to finish all readings. Make sure you understand all rules and instrucions the first time because if you ask again your question will not be answered.  Will not take a class like this again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Excellent professor in terms of knowledge and preparation for each lecture. Overly strict at times in terms of classroom style. Very dedicated, and does pay attention to students and gives feedback more than some tenured Faculty. Could work on being less rigid with students and others.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Hakala is a great professor! She works hard to make the lectures informative and fun.  The class material is difficult but it is explained thoroughly. Students know what is expected of them from the get go. Dr. Hakala is always available to help outside of class. I highly recommend you take all of her classes, especially Gothic lit!  I did!!

Dr. Hakala is a great professor! She works hard to make the lectures informative and fun.  The class material is difficult but it is explained thoroughly. Students know what is expected of them from the get go. Dr. Hakala is always available to help outside of class. I highly recommend you take all of her classes!!! I did!!

She assigns a lot of readings, but they're very captivating. She has a passion for teaching and makes her lectures fun. You have to work to get a good grade, imagine that.  Attendance is important, and necessary. I learned a lot and look forward to taking one of her classes.  She assigns extra credit, so keep an eye out for those.

7:30 am courses are tough but somehow Dr. Hakala made it work. She works hard to make her lectures interesting and it shows!  Be sure to show up on time and be ready. Take advantage of extra credit opportunities and office hours! They help a lot!

Dr. Hakala is an amazing lecturer. Each class is interesting and fun. She knows what she is talking about and is extremely passionate. Make sure that you take notes! Her tests can be challenging but they are extremely straight forward. Also, take advantage of the extra credit she offers

Dr. Hakala genuinely cares about her students. Read, participate, and attend office hours. Expect to grow a lot as a writer, her feedback is gold. Also, her seminar courses are a lot of fun! She is smart, clever and funny. She works hard to keep her classes interesting. She knows what she is talking about and is extremely passionate.
Dr hakela is amazing

Dr. Hakala is someone you can learn a lot from if you want to, because she teaches at a higher level than a lot of people.  She comes across as harsh sometimes, but actually really cares, and isn't afraid to joke around!

Dr. Hakala knows what she is talking about/teaching. She continuously asks students if they have questions. Office hours are extremely helpful. she is extremely clear and is more then happy to clarify. Pay attention in class, participate, and read! Her classes aren't the easiest but it has been in her classes that I have learned the most.

She expects you to know a lot of things that most students wouldn't understand or know going into Literature and Gender. I feel really stupid in her class, and I know that other students in this class feel this way too. Her expectations are crazy high. Going into office hours helped somewhat, but not entirely.
Hakala requires graduate level work and is not very clear about what she assigns. Her feedback is also not very helpful instead more so critical.

Taryn is such a captivating speaker. She is an expert at presenting key concepts and ideas--and offered me great advice for retaining information and locating: context, meaning and style. She is an effective teacher b/c she has an inviting spirit, very approachable and full of knowledge. Taryn provides a thoroughly  captivating and enjoyable class.

The class can be easy if you attend and follow the recommended schedule for each paper.  There were only four papers for the entire semester which is great because you get more time to write each paper but is kind of a detriment because all four papers were worth eighty percent of the grade.  Make sure to take into consideration the peer reviews.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Webb was great!  He was very kind and gave very thoughtful insight on assignments.  His lectures can get boring as he can ramble for a while, but nothing too bad.  He is a little bit of a tough grader. but not too much to worry about there either.
Very great professor! Took his writing class first semester of college. Work is very doable. Assigns reading but its only 3-5 pages. Reading is necessary to do the assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Course consists of 4 major essays each usually 50 points. Reading quizzes are usually given for readings. Must ask what grade is because the one given on canvas is not accurate. Readings are very rich in material but professor does not explain much of what he wants in an essay. however very kind.

I took him for writing 001 and 010. I loved his classes!! Straightforward and he if you are lost he will gladly explain it for you. He is fair and very sweet. He is an amazing writing professor so any feedback you get is so helpful. You discuss a lot and quizzes are on the surface questions about the readings. I suggest taking his course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is very nice. He gives readings but they are not to long and after each reading we have a small quiz next class. Quizzes are easy if you read. His directions for the essays are amazing ! Gives great format detail and what he is expecting makes it easy to write and get a good grade. It is easy to feel comfortable with him and ask questions.

Professor Webb would make sure that students understood the reading that was assigned and helped those who needed it. Essays had a lot of feedback when returned and the comments made helped you improve your next essay.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Respected--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Webb is a great professor. At first he is very straightforward and to the point but as the class progresses he develops a unique personality that matches the class. He is a hand written grader with a high priority in grammar. He gives interesting concept papers and is always willing to hear your ideas. If you can take him for WRI 101 do it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. Webb is a great professor. He is very clear in what his grading criteria is (four essays, like 9 quizzes, and some in class work) and is very approachable. He is very helpful during his office hours and is overall, a great guy. He sometimes talks on and on in class, but I was okay with listening rather than doing an assignement
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: If you like people that talk on and on, you got it. However, if you talk to him one on one, he's understandable.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr Webb is a great professor, he is a very tough grader though. Especially if you struggle with grammar! Get help from the PALS center and also go see him at his office hours and you will be fine. I learned a lot in this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: He gives quizzes and assignments on readings.  Nice professor but he's extremely tough at grading. He keeps having us re-do our essays which is very discouraging. I re-wrote one and he gave me a C- saying,"I know how hard you worked on it, but a C- is slightly generous." I wouldn't take him again. Not clear on what he wants.

It has been a pleasure to be one of Doctor Webbs students for writing 1 and writing 10. I was so pleased with him in writing 1 I waited a semester to sign up for his writing 10 class. He is a kind gentle soul and very easy to talk to and ask for help.  He is an extremely fair grader and his class will have the potential to be your fav class at UCM.

He is a very very nice person. I felt very comfortable in his class because he doesn't force you to talk or present (although we did group work and had to share in front of the class but talking is optional because I sometimes stood there with my group and said nothing). There are weekly quizzes.

Dr. Webb is a great professor. He basically walks you through the essays. He is specific on what he wants starting from the intro paragraph to the conclusion. You do have to read because he has quizzes but thats really it. The subjects he has for us to read are interesting anyways. If you like nature and how messed up our society is, take him.

Had him for both 10 and 116. He's a great teacher, can get boring but he lays everything out for you and the schedule of the class is always the same so you know what to expect. I recommend going to office hours to have him review your essays, the more u go the more feedback u get. He's willing to help and I saw my grade rise for every essay.

I had this professor for creative writing. For such an interesting subject, the class got dull pretty easily. However, he is a very kind guy, very easy going and understanding. You're not going to learn to become the next Shakespeare in this class, but it is a relaxed environment and an easy A. Make friends for the critiques so it'll be more fun.

Great professor, but keep in mind that he isn't very helpful and doesn't just give out answers. He expects you to think critically on your own rather than him helping you. He is also a tough grader when it comes to essays
Great teacher he knew how to explain the essays well. but he was a bit of a tough grader. However he did allow you to fix essays you did bad on
Very nice and helpful professor. Fair grader in terms of papers.

Was very unorganized and unclear with grading format (he essentially assigned 2 essays in the span of one week without warning). Not very clear and thorough with what he expects from you. Hopefully he improves but I got unlucky with it being his first semester.
A great guy. He gave very interesting and engaging lectures. Class was easy to take notes in and assignments had clear criteria. Great experience, would definitely take him again.
Professor Viney gives great lectures, although they can be overly technical at times. Viney is greatly helpful one-on-one during classtime, and office hours were consistent and accessible.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Great Professor. You can learn a lot from him. His homework problems will make you think hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Polymers is an awesome class would take it again for insight. Pretty sure it is Dr. Vineys specialty

Lecture wise Viney tries tp keep things interesting. Don't just shut him out of you don't understand in the beginning give it some effort. Viney is one of those professors that give you critical thinking problems. The homework isn't straightforward you are going to have to actually put effort into the class.

Viney is an ineffective professor, his assigned textbook is bad, his explanations are not clear, and his homework does not pertain to the exams. He is also very loud and likes to talk over others. I go to his office hours all the time, and I have learned very little from him. Sometimes I walk out of his office feeling more confused then before.

Professor Viney is a good professor. However, I always go to his office hours, he is not helpful at all. He overcomplicates things and rambles about other things that easily lead to confusion. He does not give clear answers. He is very rude. The book that he assigned is very poor at teaching the concepts. His lectures are not helpful.

the professor is interesting. However, he believes that 20% is average for exams, he explains things very vaguely, mumbles a lot, does not give much credit on assignments, often goes off topic, assigned a very bad textbook that is also vague, and is very rude. Lectures are not helpful, neither is the book. Try to take another professor.

Had him for ICP Physics. Not a good prof. esp for freshmen. His office hours are non-existent even at his posted times, and his help at times are not always helpful. Prof. not cool, and he often has an unfriendly/and agitated behavior. Advice - do not take him and for his hw, better off asking another prof. for help like Mitchell, Sharpe, or Ghosh.

Had Prof.Viney in 2006-2007 for physics. My overall rating for him: low. Why: here is the type of physics prof. you don't want to deal with esp. a freshman. Not friendly/open minded, & his office hours are non-existent even at his posted times. Overall: He wasn't helpful, failed my interest in physics; advice to students ask another prof. for help.
the rudest professor on campus by far but he does have interesting stories.

This professor is just too problematic (only to say the least). He's hard to understrand at times, tries to make class fun and humorous (which is good) but backfires when some sidetrack and lose focus on how to do well on hw and exams. Don't even think about office hours openly available, he's sometimes busy, talk about not helpful for students.
Nothing to comment.  Won't waste my time.
Interesting to say the least. Tries to make class humorous and fun.

Viney is awesome, plain and simple, His lectures are clear and to the point, he is willing to clarify any questions IN lecture, His lecture slides are clear and concise. Class is NOT boring, as he randomly brings in props to give practical examples of what he says, as well as jokes and talk about stuff outside of class.

I like how his eyebrows go up whenever he's really interested in something, and he is just so interested in so many different things.  He's a fascinating character, and he was quite a looker in his day...look on google...he looks like sam neill.  I likes him a lot.
He has a great British accent that livens up the lecture. I love the occasional reference to Harry Potter...it fits his britishness. He looks like a Joker(from Batman) with no make-up on.

He's a really entertaining professor; and the british accent always makes physics more interesting. He has a nice habit of incorporating interesting stories from his days in London etc, into his lectures which is definitely a plus.
No Comments

he is very chill and has interesting lectures. attendance is not mandatory but is useful as he sometimes says things that are important to know for exams. studying is crucial although most material is common sense. the grade is mainly exams but they aren't too bad as long as you get a basic idea of what has been said during lecture. 10/10 prof
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Excellent professor and interesting class if you like marketing. He gives good lectures, paying attention is recommended as some of the examples he gives,are in the exams. There are 3 exams and one group project, so getting good grades on exams is important. The group project is easy, as almost every group gets a good grade if you show your effort.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Seltzer is the goat. Ive took 4 classes with him and passed with A in all. You wont regret taking his class.
Heres the run down 1 quiz 10%, 2 midterm (30% each), labs 10%, and one group project (20%). Pretty straight forward class just study. And GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS! He wants to help you pass!

He is great. I have him for another class as well and I really enjoy the days I have him as a professor. He is amazing and teaches well. Just study and you will be okay. Not a lot of things are turned in so study and take midterms and the group project seriously to pass.

I took him for marketing online due to COVID. His lectures are clear and make a lot of sense, very informative. Don't really need the textbook. Honestly you could probably pass this class just from his slides alone, since he posts them before the lecture. He's a funny guy, his notes are clear. Good prof.

Seltzer is one of the best professors I have had. Doesn't give homework and there is not much going into the grade book so doing well on the midterms and the group projects are key as those are the only items that will determine the grade. Lectures are short but do understand the powerpoints and concepts

It's important to study for his tests and try to get tests fro others who have taken his class before because most of his tests are similarly structured and helps a lot when studying. He truly cares about his students as he will try his best to help you out with your grades. An easy class just listen to what he has to say as you can learn a lot.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: He was a good professor however at the end the grades on cat courses are not what you earn. i thought I had a A- but he gave me a C+. Confusing with grading.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Make sure to look at the study guide and know everything that is on there and you should be fine. The class is graded on exams and the group project so make sure not to slack! Other than that Professor Seltzer is great and you'll learn a lot about Marketing!

Professor Seltzer is a good person, but since we only meet once a week, lectures tend to get dry. However, to be successful, all you have to do is read the slides posted online, and he is clear on what he expects you to know for the exams. We occasionally have homework, but there are weeks where we have nothing. He blasts through the slides though.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Easy class if you do his study guide.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: No need to get the textbook; his lecture notes are enough for you to succeed in the course. 1 small intro test, some problem sheets, 2 midterms, 1 final. Really nice professor and you learn a lot about economic theory (e.g., topics like nash equilibrium, stackelberg model, bertrand, and more).

Professor Seltzer is my favorite professor at UC Merced. Tests and quizzes are based on lectures slides and he's very clear about what material is going to be on the exams. Very genuine and actually cares about his students.
Lectures are long and boring, but when tests come around he does let you know which slides are crucial to passing. He's a nice guy and understanding. I would definitely take him again
Made statistics fun and easy!!

He is very nice and such a sweet guy. However his lectures are long and it's very easy to dose off or get distracted. Nonetheless he prepares his students for his exams and will likely hint at the necessary points that are required to pass his tests. If you don't pick up on those hints you will likely be confused when it comes to take them.
Easy. But very unclear!

Professor Seltzer is a very excellent teacher. He is very helpful and he does everything he can to help students learn. If you follow his instructions, memorize the slides, and pay attention to the explanations in class you will do very well. Everything in his slides are from the chapters we read in the book. The tests are from the slides.

Professor uses iClicker for lecture attendance. This typically consists of answering easy questions regarding the topic of the lecture. He is quite a funny guy, and he explains topics thoroughly. Quiz and midterm questions are very similar to those covered in lecture and homework assignments.

Look, I almost failed this class but not because CCC is a bad professor, but because I am lazy. I didn't study (except for the final) or pay attention in lecture. I think that other people with bad reviews are lazy too. He's not too hard, just don't be a bad student. He has a thick accent, but I like his lectures cuz he cares about the subject.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: He does not care for his students or how well the class is doing. He is focused on just getting it over with and seems like he has no will to teach. His notes are LITERALLY scribbles. It is impossible to understand what anything he wrote says unless you attend the class. He has a high biggest ego and no intention of being a decent professor.

CCC is the best physics professor I've ever had.The thing about his class is that its not a hard class as long as you  make an effort to learn the material, and show up to the lectures.If that is done than a passing grade or higher is very much so possible.CCC is not trying to fail you and his class reflects that physics is not supposed to be easy.

Not a good professor at all. Really difficult to learn from because of his accent makes the lectures incomprehensible and audible lobotomies. Bad exams, grabs directly from homework, but either forgets to put values or is worded very badly, like the homework. ABOSOLUTELY DEPLORABLE PROFESSOR. Only thing I liked was spherical cow.

If you want motivation to drop out, take this prof. This guy makes me HATE physics and I loved it in high school. I've learned absolutely nothing from him and I only learned from youtube videos. You can't understand a thing in lecture due to his accent - his recorded lectures are useless because of it. like wtf bruh

I would recommend not taking this class if possible. Very hard to understand and seems to write in circles. Exams are very difficult without clear study guides or past exams. Probably worst professor I've had here.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor has a very thick accent that makes it hard to understand him. His exams are very difficult and very unrelated to what he teaches. He overcomplicates everything. Just watch Organic Chemistry Tutor.

comment: If you have the chance to not take CCC, take that chance PLS. His accent makes it hard to understand topics, and its hard to read his handwriting. can't read his handwriting. Boring lectures, thick accent hard to understand what he is trying to say.

comment: Insists on overcomplicating problems for absolutely no reason, and loves to go on nonsensical rants that are borderline incoherent while laughing maniacally about something that makes zero sense. lecture heavy hated it

Professor graded very few things

comment: He is a great professor, his lectures are nice but his explanations on solving problems are a little long. On top of that he makes jokes in every lecture. As long as you do your work and keep on track with the class you will be fine. His grading system is great as, final is worth less than the midterms. So keep on track and you'll be fine :)

Easy A, people who gave this professor a 1/5 are those who don't study. This class is by far easier than a high school AP Physics C - Mechanics class, the test/quiz questions never make you expand your brain, and it is all based on the bare concepts. If you've never taken physics before, then you should definitely study during your free time.

During the lectures, demonstrations with absolutely no connection to the content were used. Midterm class average 48. Only good thing is a C is 60% - 74. Professor would go on rants and claim things are "funny" when in reality he makes things more confusing. What's funny to him is confusing to us. I suggest you change up ur teaching Strats asap
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Lectures are mandatory bc he uses TopHat and it counts towards ur grade. No study guides. 90% of what he tells you to study wont even be on the exam. Class averages on midterms were in the 50s. He goes on unnecessary tangents and makes simple topics more complicated than they should be. Only good thing is 60-74% counts as a C in this course
Doesn't explain topics clearly, test covers information that is not discussed in the lectures, average test scores are in the 40s-50s.

Professor Chien believes that everyone should understand quantum physics as well as he does. He refuses to tell you what will be on the midterm. Will not give you a study guide. His advice on how to pass when his test covers 38% of the texbook: "Just know how to do all of it." My group and I spent over 114 hours on one exam. Average grade: F.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: People complain about Brokowski but his exams are really similar to the homework. He teaches difficult courses like Vibrations and components. For some reason people expect the class to be easy. If you go to lecture and make a good effort to understand the homework there is no reason anyone should fail.

This is an introductory course, Professor Brokowski does a good job of introducing the material in a way that's manageable; he also does a good job of relating it to future courses you will use MATLAB/Python in. Flexible, reasonable, and very clear on what he wants. The only hard part of this course were the quizzes, don't just blow those off

genuinely awful. first time being so lost in a class. this is NOT an introductory level course... if you see him listed as the professor, go next. The class was okay for the first week, then suddenly i'm being asked to organize data from text files and my entire lab class just sat there agape while our TA did the homework for us. Genuinely baffling
Makes you fall asleep during class, they don't help me understand the material. It's like they throw you into a pool and yelled SWIM! with their advice of helping you be, Use your legs.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He is a fair professor, clearly advising the work expected and closely referencing the homework to the exams. He covers the material in depth and more with real life examples for understanding. The pacing is perfect since he writes throughout lecture. Not doing the homework or show up = not perform good on the exams. One of my favorite classes.

He clearly states what is expected of students, and provides resources for students to succeed in this course. Exam problems are nearly identical to homework problems in terms of difficulty. Lecture quizzes were a good way of boosting your grades as well. Brokowski is very knowledgeable, and this class was one of my favorite classes.

A very difficult teacher. 75% of your grade was determined solely on three exams. No labs, homework and quizzes don't count for much. The exams in question were very difficult. While he doesn't show the class average, I spoke with some other students and most people had about 55-65% grade for the majority of the class. The curves are nice though.

Mike is something else. From the start it was tough. There were about 3-4 homework, then an exam. The quizzes are based on the prior lectures. He states that the exam is like homework problems. Would only have 3 questions on the exam. Just pray for that curve at the end it was a huge bump. I went from an F to a C. Seeing that F all semester is pain

The stuff he goes over in lectures, but it does not help at all with lab assignments. The online book assignments were easy, but it is not useful for labs which are worth a lot of percentage of your grade. The TA was very helpful, but I couldn't continue this class. I would suggest a different professor if you really need an engineering course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Honestly he is probably the worst professor there is. I have taken him for 3 different courses. He is always the same for all classes. Very monotone. He skips around a lot and doesn't get to the point. When you ask him for help he is hard to follow and you feel dumb for even wasting your time in his class. Good person. But terrible teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He is such a monotone teacher and takes forever to get to the point.

i had to code with python and matlab (might change per semester) very little ways to increase grade. but its mostly weighed by the assignments and quizzes, so ace both of those things and you can get a solid B in the class. go to TAs OH, they are very helpful especially if u dont understand anything in lecture. two big projects for each language
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Lots of homework

comment: His class is only graded by a few things. You'll only pass if you have past materials from other students which is how majority of the class passed. There's no extra credit or project or even additional assignments if you want your grade to go up. You'll have to work real hard just to get a C.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This class scarred me & made me rethink my mechanical engineer degree. I'm so glad I passed this class with a C.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: He is pretty good professor. He may seem monotone, but its a coding class so you can't really ask for much. Other than that, he is a really nice professor and knows his stuff.
Hes the best teacher in the universe. He a is great and a caring person. Super smart, he is so smart he makes smart people look not smart. The best the GOAT.
He is a very boring lecturer. There is a quiz every other week in lecture so that is really the only reason to show up, if there isn't a quiz just do yourself a favor and read the slides from home.

Good person, terrible teacher. He doesn't know Fortran very well, reads off the slides, and isn't very good at explaining the topic. The things on the lecture slides are simple, and then the homework is very hard and nearly impossible to do. Very boring during lecture, most only go for quizzes. Pick another professor if possible.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Teacher writes down notes for students to copy on the projector. Homework was due on Tuesday, Pop Quiz on Thursday making it extremely difficult to miss anything. Grades on correct answer for Homework and partial credit for Midterms. No final but 3 Midterms, not cumulative. It's possible to pass the class it requires some effort.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: This professor is too dependent on PowerPoint slides, this makes it pointless to go to lecture. However, he gives out pop quizzes which are the only reason to go to lecture. During lecture, he is really monotone and can make you fall asleep even if you are not tired. Materials recommended for lecture: laptop, earphones and coffee. Avoid if possible
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is an amazing professor. He communicates what he is trying to teach very clearly. Exams are 90% of the grade but don't let that scare you. If you go to the lectures and take accurate notes, you should have no problems studying for this course. I would recommend that anyone take this professor if available.

Amazing instructor, and awesome lectures. The class was 6 exams, two weeks between exams, two papers and extra credit. Honestly, the class should be an easy B/A depending on if you study well, read the textbook as instructed, and attend all lectures. Unfortunately I didn't do any of that and needed the extra credit to help me pass. Fun class though
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Test heavy

comment: hella cool, hella smart, hella interesting class but you have to go to class and pay attention and lock in for the exams, or you're cooked. 90% of your grade is 6 exams and two writing assignments and there's 5 extra credit points through sona. but he's hella cool tho and not that hard as long as you lock in

Greatest Prof at UCM. Really cares about his students, is very inspirational and there was never a boring lecture. Exams are easy if you pay attention to lectures, no final. Two 500 word essays at the end of the semester that are VERY easy. You won't regret taking him.

Professor Balasubramaniam is the best teacher I've had at UC Merced. His lectures amazing and he's really good at re-capping the material at the end of every lecture. Go to his office hours because he's very friendly! And often gives pointers on which material to study. But reading the book and attending lecture is necessary to pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Hes an amazing professor. Def would take again, although his test are extremely hard. If you do not pay attention YOU WILL NOT PASS
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Only 3 tests make up your whole grade, but Professor Balasubramaniam is hands down the best professor I have ever had here at UC Merced. His lectures were so awesome, and everything he mentions will be in an easy exam. Defiantly hope I have him again!
Easily the best prof at UC Merced.
Amazing professor! I loved going to lecture and learning complex material. He made learning fun! I highly recommend him and would definitely take another course with him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Ramesh is one of the best professors I have ever had. He makes complicating content easy to understand with clear explanations and examples. He makes the material very interesting and speaks very well. You have to attend class to have any chance to pass and studying is important due to only three tests accounting for the grade. Also is very funny.

There are only 3 tests per semester. Each one is not overly difficult (barring the 2nd), and you will have to work for your grade. The material is complicated stuff, but Professor Balasubramaniam will go over it with a lot of detail. Be sure to take down very good notes, because not all of the material is on the slides. Be sure to use the book too.

Ramesh Bala-la-la-la (big hero) or Bala-superman tries to make lectures enjoyable for students. Will joke here and there. If you read the textbook AND follow his powerpoint slides, you are guaranteed a good grade in his class. Only 3 exams make up your grade so study hard.
Loved the lectures, he makes you understand hard material with logical examples. Great professor, i would definitely take another class with him!!!!!!

He's a very good professor and makes complicated concepts understandable. One of the best professors I've ever had. Tough tests, but lectures are interesting. Would take another class with him. Very enthusiastic instructor.

His tests are tough, but his lectures are amazing! as long as you print out the slides and write all the important stuff he says, you will be good. His exams are cumulative so keep reviewing all the other stuff while you learn the new stuff and you should be good. He only has three exams, no final and no homework. He will make you a better student

He is very passionate about what he teaches. He is very concise and tells you exactly what he wants from the beginning. His exams are not very difficult but they do require lots of studying and memorization. I passed his class with an A because I actually memorized every slide. I would gladly take another class of his. Fantastic.
Very good prof. hard exams, but fair. his lectures are fun and he is a great enthusiastic speaker.

This class was very tough, but it actually felt like a college level class unlike other classes. There is A LOT of material that is covered in this course and it gets quite confusing especially if you are not keeping up w the readings and reviewing notes. 3 big exams & no final exam. Overall, take this class if you want to challenge yourself!

He is the most awesome professor I have ever had! The material is hard, but he explains it very well, so I recommend printing out all his slides and writing down notes as he goes through the slides, very helpful.
Fantastic!
He is just the most fascinating teacher I've ever had!

According to her,you have about 6 absences "before it affects your grade",but in-class assignments (which are every class & 2-5 points) are still marked with a 0 if you miss. So attendance is essentially mandatory or else your grade is affected even if it's by a little. A lot of group work & a lot of assignments,but they are easy and easily graded.

Professor Santillan overall was a great professor. He is very kind and understanding and makes lecture very interesting and engaging. She really enjoys what she her job and helps students achieve their best. Gives really good feedback and goes in-depth when reviewing the feedback to you one-on-one. Definitely recommend taking her classes.
She is the best writing professor ever!

You will be doing a lot of peer review, socializing is very big in this class for papers. Professor is very understanding and nice, never calls on you if you don't raise your hand. You buy books and write about the topic basically. All hw is reading chapters and writing papers. Love Jessica tho! Best writing prof ever

Phenomenal professor even if you don't really like writing (like me). Grading is pretty generous as long as you display effort, and you get a lot of time to work on essays. MAKE SURE TO READ THE BOOKS ON TIME. Being behind on reading is going to make the class unnecessarily difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She is a very sweet, caring, understanding professor. Attendance is mandatory to some extent, and it affects your grade but too much. She does give out quite a bit of reading and homework, but it is not difficult at all. Very flexible for her students, cares for them, and takes time out of her day to meet with kids who are struggling.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Absolutely loved her! She does give out assignments every week but as long as you keep up, you will do just fine!

Professor Santillan is the most amazing teacher throughout the whole university! I definitely have learned a lot from her during the 2021 fall semester. She is super sweet and caring and she is always accessible outside of class. She gives extra credit and there are plenty of assignments to get done but it's easy to do as long as you attend class.

Professor Santillan was one of my favorite classes I took this semester. (taken during covid) she is really passionate about writing and overall such a nice person! Not going to lie but she did give a lot of homework but she's very flexible. Overall, this class was amazing!

The class is structured very well. There are a lot of assignments but they werent hard and its just a matter of actually doing them. The book is needed because the assignments are connected. The essays are not hard and she gives great feedback so you dont have to worry too much. (taken during covid)

I had her twice because that is how much I genuinely LOVED her as my writing teacher! She is so awkward, funny, kind and you can tell she is really passionate about writing and the assignments she gave us. I'm not going to lie she does give quite a bit of work, but if you do it then you are fine! Overall, she is great! I'm going to miss her ):

I love this professor. She is so sweet and cares a lot about her students. You do a lot of in-class group work in the course but it's very easy to share the workload. She also gives amazing feedback on your writing. I improved my writing skills tremendously in her course. I wish I could take her again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I love this professor. She is so sweet and cares a lot about her students. I improved my writing skills tremendously in her course! I wish I could take her again!

comment: I found the readings very interesting and she gives back very specific feedback for your papers which helped me grow a lot as a writer. She truly cares about your writing and takes the time to read it. There are journals but they are pretty easy and you can get away with not reading everything
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Very flexible office hours. Her reading assignments are very interesting.

Jessica is really nice and she values individual growth in writing. She gives good feedback and she's an approachable person. It's not hard to get a good grade in her class, just show up and do the assignments and you should be golden!
Easiest professor that provides a lot of feedback. I felt like i didn't try in her class lol
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Do the work, and you'll pass
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: wow dude so hard he didnt do anything except complain and call his stupid students stupid. the students were not infact stupid but would enjoy to be treated like students and not robots to copy and receive commands from the french man who so eagerly dishes out commentary and useless rhetoric between flicking through slides which he reads off boring

40+ page final worth 60% of the final grade. Need to know every part of the human body that he covers in class, with correct spelling, and the proper description, and ALL functions of each part. No labels on exams, so you don't know what or how much you need to write down.
He still has a full head of hair.  Keeps the lectures clean and fun...my hat goes of to him.x-tests are helpful if you can get your hands on them..

Keep up with the lecture notes and make sure to give yourself plenty of time to study...you'll need it.  Basically Everything in lecture IS ON the TEST!  He knows his material, and will be sure that you will too...  Tough class, but you WILL leave knowing more than when you began.
not a bad prof. compared to weidle!!

Lecture: Passes out powerpoint handouts. Thick accent; hard getting used to. Boring lectures; I sleep every  time. Lab: Timely, but simple. Step-by-step procedures given. Lab reports due for every lab. Quizzes: three times weekly; done online (use notes, book, etc.). Exams: Difficult, unless you have a photographic memory. Given a study guide. Lots of information asked. 20 multiple choice, the rest... fill in, short answer essays. NOT FUN.
has no business being a professor. i hear next semester there's a new guy so yay

French ascent. You will get used it soon. His lectures are good, for the online quiz answers, sometimes you have to find it in the text book or internet. His tests are fair.  Prepare to write the answers in your own words and also explain it well in the test. Grading is easy, 85% is an A in the class. I would take him again.

sarcastic and funny professor, his lectures are interesting but hard to understand, tests are extremely difficult because of his wording and tricky double negatives. pay attention to his lectures because his tests are more based at what he says rather than the slides. good luck!
No Comments
Étrange........

His quizzes are much harder and the questions aren't very clear.  He is very specific, so you must answer his questions fully.  He's kind of hard to understand at first, but by the end of the semester you'll understand at least 50% of what he's saying

The first time I heard him speak, I though he had a speach impediment...turns out he just has a funky french accent.  It's not too bad, you get over it within a few lectures, but it still confuses people from time to time.  Overall, he's a very knowledgeable and enthusiastic professor, definitely worth the confusion.

Dr. Dayrat is cool but his lectures are somewhat boring. He tries to make it funny though. He is extremely knowledgeable about biology especially the life cycles. He's alright, heavy French accent but you'll get used to it.
He tries to make lectures fun w/ jokes.
No Comments
No Comments
Easy A

Prof. Perry may be one of the harder professors when it comes to grading but his courses are meant to encourage individual thought. He is very passionate about his subject matter and easily approachable if anything is unclear. He is not an easy A, but anyone legitimately interested in history should consider taking his classes.
Excellent professor, very engaging lectures and asks thought provoking questions about the readings.

Although Dr. Perry has high expectations for his students, he goes out of his way to offer extra help to those students who seek assistance. I found him to be very helpful in office hours and I appreciate him for offering different ways of viewing past events. I'm sure that his future students will appreciate his classes.

If one is simply looking for easy credit, keep looking. Dr. Perry has high expectations for his students with the emphasis of having the student think about a topic and, through critical analysis, discover the solution. Being able to think allows one to be independent. He was available for office hours and he did help me find clarity on papers.

Dr. Perry is looking to challenge his students to think like academics. If you are looking for an easy A and think history is stupid then take something else. If you are fascinated by history and want to really take your standards of reasoning to the next level, I highly recommend Dr. Perry. 1st essay grade may be a surprise but it is worth it.

Doesn't put up lectures online, nor does he provide a study guide, so you have to attend all the lectures to know the material for midtermsfinals. HIST 010 had two TAs so grading for papers is largely done by them. He often went over time on lectures, but didn't drone on. If you have questions, defer them to the TA.

If you wan't core to be stupid it will be stupid, but try to enjoy it. Nathan is a very tough grader on my first essay I got like a C and I was shocked ( I never got a C on a paper before). What you need to do though is go to office hours as much as possible, and that will not only help you, but it will show him that you care.

Nathan is an outstanding professor. I had him for Core 1 and that class is already one that you don't want to be in. He is a bit of a tough grader on essays, but they helped me grow as writer and he gives excellent feedback. I wish he'd give positive feedback as well. Anyway, I recommend him even though he's not too easy.
Great professor, very knowledgable on his subject, and gives good information. Makes you work for your grade, but worth it at the end because of what you accomplish. Total hottie with a body!

Professor Perry is a nice guy and easy to talk to, however he is extremely vague on what he wants you to study. Also, discussions are mandatory, especially because the midterm grade was just based on if you showed up or not. If your not into history, don't take this class. You will die of irrelevance and boredom.

Very monotone when he gives his lectures which makes it hard to keep engaged in his information. Always goes over the class time, very vague on what is going to be on the test and what he wants on the essay's. He's a great guy, but definitely needs to rethink how the lectures are presented.

Very passionate, CANT FIGURE OUT WHAT HE WANTS IN ESSAYS AND TESTS! no matter how much i ask TAs and the Profesor and go to office hours. HE JUST SO VAGUE OF WHAT HE LOOKS FOR. FOR ALOT OF WORK YOU GET A BARELY PASSING GRADE BECAUSE YOU DONT UNDERSTAND WHAT HE WANTS.

Professor Perry is charismatic and animated, but his expectations are extremely vague, making essay time etc., a difficult time for students to fully understand what is actually expected of them. He nitpicks every single thing without stating WHY he is nitpicking it, and never gives any form of encouragement. He also puts you on the spot.

I have had Professor Perry twice. The first time he taught at UCM, he kept reading from his notes, which was annoying and it made his class kind of boring. However, he has improved since then and continues to do so. He is a very nice professor, has a good sense of humor, is charismatic, and is very passionate about history(which is awesome).

thought he is very passionate about the topic he is unclear about what is expected and leaves much up to individual interpretation, which is fine, but come exam and paper grading time you are punished for not approaching the question in the manner he presented in class, which was unclear in the first place. very stressful+hardwork for average grade

Professor is scatterbrained in his lectures then cannot seem to finish lectures in time. Every class session runs 5-10 minutes over. You will work hard and hope for an average grade. Papers and exams are nearly impossible to get better than a B.
Soccer playiiing hottie!!!! do the readings they help!
The tests will mostly focus of what he says in class, so take really through note.  The lecture can be boring at times but the information is interesting.

I recommend going to lectures if you have time, but if not make sure to go over the slides. Sometimes lectures are long and tiring, but they will most likely help you understand the material better being put into simpler terms and examples. As long as you do good on quizzes you should be fine but watch out for tests; be prepared!

The professor was chill, just that the lectures get really boring because all he does is read the lecture slides here and then he would make jokes. He does let you out early.
The latest was 30 minutes before the class ended. All quizzes and exams are online; you do need to buy a scantron, but overall, chill tecaher, just lecture heavy.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: He's a chill teacher. but BORING lectures that feels like forever. He does allow flashcards on quizzes. class is in a theater so if u sit next to friend or someone smart you can pass the quizzes. *wink wink* Exams are online so again should be able to pass. Curves grades. Uses textbook but I didn't buy and didn't need it. overall 7/10

There are mainly just quizzes given with like 3 or less assignments, he allows 1 flashcard for the quizzes so write important things down from the slides that you aren't likely to remember. Exams online but final may be moved to online if course evaluations are 50% participation. Pretty chill course and lectures are just him reading off slides.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: All quiz questions are from the slides, and you should be able to read it once and do fine. I rarely ever attended the lectures and am finishing with a 110% in the class. The exams can be somewhat hard but they are online and you can google them, its just easy to get confused with wording and such. He's not very responsive outside of class at all.

cool guy but his lectures are boring, and sometimes theres random participation things that you can only do in class. regardless, the class was interesting but a little difficult(at least for me) bc there was so much being taught. he'll grade tests on a curve if the average is low and drop a couple quizzes since theres so many. 8.5/10

Boring lectures but class is fairly easy. 3 homework assignments for the whole semester, 1 quiz every week on 2-3 chapters, except on test weeks. Quizzes are closed note (although he started allowing 1 flashcard). Test are online, open note except the last one is in person, but if 70% of class does the course evaluation it will be moved to online.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: most boring professor and slides are full of text

Prof. Aguilera made this class easy-going by making all exams online and open-book, plus assigning two homework for the semester, which were unique and engaging. Attendance isn't mandatory since the slides are posted on canvas, but I find his lectures to be interesting since he doesn't simply read the slides but actually engages with the subject.

Class is not mandatory because slides are always posted. The textbook is also a good tool to use when going over the topics. The course had a nice schedule that remained the same throughout the semester.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: His test and quizzes are open note and open google! It's easy to do well in his class if you put in the work. His lectures are pretty boring too so you may not even want to attend them. Attendance is not mandatory, so you can get by if you go over the slides. He always answers questions, but sometimes his answers can be vague.

I had Professor Aguilera for PH103 and PH190. Hes a great professor that cares about his students. His class is pretty easy. Midterms are lecture-based. Project instructions are clear and easy to follow and he gives more than fair amounts of time to finish said project.

I had professor Aguilera for PH 001 and now for PH 190-04(Public Health Nutrition), he is a great professor who is passionate about the subject. He cares a lot about his students and is very understanding. Not a super strict grader, I wish he taught more upper division courses! I learned a lot in PH 190, I wish more nutrition courses were offered.

The Professor does a good job at making the class very easy for you. Most assignments were due at the end of the semester so he makes sure that you don't have to feel so stressed out. You'll do fine if you read the book and pay attention to lectures. Would most definitely take the class again.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took him during the pandemic, he made everything super flexible. All assignments were due at the end of the semester for a total of about 10 assignments. Most work was based on the textbook and lectures. The assignments weren't that hard. Lectures are boring though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: He is a sweet professor but REALLY boring. I would almost knock out every lecture.

Much of the exam content is based on the professor's lectures and the textbook readings, which is the usual case for many professors. Sadly, this guy's lectures are monotoned & "bare bone" at best with the text book being hard to read. Try not to fall asleep. I advise you seek another professor if you benefit from constant interaction during class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Aguilera is very passionate about his work which makes his lectures interesting. The class is not too difficult if you pay attention and follow along. The class is focused on preparing Public Health majors for a career in public health. The class is more project based. Class: TopHat, quizzes, individual projects, and group projects

He was very helpful inside and outside of class. He gives practice exams that are similar to the actual exams but pay attention because the top hat quizzes can really affect your grade. Overall would take one of his classes again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: He is passionate about what he's teaching but exams were worded weird. Most of the class got a c or lower on exams & there were only a handful of assignments that didn't help much in evening out your grade if you did not do well on exams. He's not tech savvy, assignments were on paper and there were no announcements for when things were due.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Poor Communication, Unfair Grading Practices, and lacks feedback. Our students often appreciate constructive feedback on their work. Professors who provide minimal or no feedback may leave students feeling uncertain about their performance.
Just know he wasn't great he was the complete opposite.

Walle is a great guy. His lectures are super heavy but he listens to student feedback and provides a ton of examples. Prepare for the midterms in advance cause some of the test qus can be pretty material specific. Overall the class was very interesting and you know what he expects. He also gives you the test SAQs in advance, so prepare for those.

This class was not bad overall with small pop quizzes here and there. The lectures were very interesting and exams were a combo of multiple choice and free response. He provides you with a list of free response questions that he chooses from so you ultimately know what the free response questions are.

Dr. Walle is laid back and really knows his stuff. His lectures can be hard to keep up with but he does upload all the lectures so youre able to go back and re read if you need to. His tests are not that hard. The short answers might scare you but he gives amble time to prepare for them. I never saw him in office hours but Im sure he is helpful.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Walle is a typical college professor. His lectures can be heavy some days, & light others. Half the lectures are dedicated to example videos. Exams are easy, as long as you study well. There are 3 exams (non-cumulative) & the final is optional, 1 research paper, &pop quizzes in class, so while attendance isn't mandatory, it's recommended.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He does give you extra credit but if you dont do it your screwed. His tests are hard and he doesnt give you a study guide, and this class is material heavy. I always get very good grades and I got a C in his class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Worst professor I have ever taken in all my school years.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Terrible class professor was not helpful in feedback with assignments at his office hours. Lectures were vastly paced to take notes, with pop mini quizzes that were based off participation. Would not recommend.
He's amazing.

Walle is really great! His lectures are interesting and he likes to include fun videos to bring the material to life. He does do pop quizzes however, but they're just to make sure that you're paying attention to lecture so you don't need to study for them. Highly reccommend!
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: By far the most interesting and well rounded classes offered at UC Merced.  Professor Walle made the class fun and worthwhile to attend, and really cared about the subject at hand. It's definitely a passable class, however the grade you earn truly does correlate to the amount of effort you put in. I highly recommend this Professor.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Easy class. Don't miss lecture.

Walle is great. He's so adorable and keeps you interested in the class. He has pop quizzes so stay awake in lecture. His paper responses are clear and he tells you what he expects. His exams are doable so read the book and lecture slides and you'll be fine. participate in Sona, and overall enjoy his class because it is fun!

My most favorite class that I've taken so far at UCM. Not only was the class easy, but Mr. Walle always made the subject interesting and I was always looking forward to actually coming to class. 1 mini exam, 2 exams, and an optional final exam along with several pop quizzes that are a breeze as long as you're paying attention. Overall, great class!

The tests are part multiple choice part free response.
