He gives you 7-10 possible free response questions before the test that you can answer (3-5 of them will be on the test- worded exactly the same).  I almost wish that the class was a little harder, I didn't really learn as much because of how easy it was... Still a good professor though!

I really enjoyed this class. He is very clear, his slides are organized and informative.  When I put this class was "easy" I mean that he made the info manageable and understandable. You still have to put the work in. I learned a lot though!

The class itself wasn't very difficult with there only being about 3 assignments and 3 tests. You can find all the book you need online. Have to pay for TopHat though:/ Lectures were pretty boring but if you're interested in anthro its pretty interesting. The tests themselves were easy. As long as you loosely knew what the terms meant, you'll pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She makes a lot of passive-aggressive comments toward students. You may have little assignments but they count for large points, if you miss one, you're nearly failing the class. She does not drop any assignments nor hand out extra credit, it is either you do well or do not.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Attendance is taken in discussions/lectures and she has participation questions in her slides. There are 3 big tests that affect your grade tremendously, she gives study guides with over 50 words on them yet only picks 9 to be on the test. She gives no hints as to what could be on the test so you have to study all of it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Class is easy but soooooooooooooooooooooo boring.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: As a class, ANTH 001 is an easy A so long as you attend the lectures and do the very few assignments. Keep your head down and pay attention to her lectures. She can be very passive-aggressive to students, especially when there's low participation. There are several times when she'll stop the lecture to target non-participating students so beware.
Shes fine ig but her class is expensive you have to pay for top hat plus like four different books for her readings. Her lectures are pretty boring as well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I never went to class as she never took attendance. Discussion is mandatory though. She's very passionate about the subject but bores everyone to death. She makes study guides for you with 100 words to study but picks 9 to be on the test. Whole grade is based off of 3 reading guides 1 kinship exercise, and midterms. No daily homework.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took this class last semester and it was alright.  The material was interesting but I personally wasn't a fan of how with the two books we read, the professor didn't lecture on it at all and only had us discuss the assigned chapters and reading guide questions in groups.  Her grading is fairly easy on the online midterms and final paper.

This is by far the most boring college class i have taken. Professor is very passionate about the subject, but the lectures make everyone go to sleep. If you enjoy anthro you should be fine and might actually enjoy the class. But if you dont i wouldnt reccomend this class. You have to read 3 books , all assignments are very very easy however.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Chose to use a brand new program for attendance, but the program would malfunction and mark you absent. Three absences and you get docked a third of your grade. It is not a recipe for success.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This class was easier than I thought for my first year. I had an A for the whole semester. Just do your work and show up to lecture and discussion because that matters. Prof DeLugan can't really take jokes and takes everything seriously but I never listened to her talking just copied notes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof DeLugan is a professor that truly cares about how her students are learning. She does get visibly frustrated when no one answers her questions, but you can't blame her. Part of her teaching philosophy is creating an interactive lecture, so if you want to make the class work for you, speak up. Don't be afraid to talk to her, she's really sweet!

Attend discussion because if you miss too much that can wreck your grade. Overall easy concepts to understand and lecture notes will be your guide because she tends to go over the slides really fast in class.

Take notes during lectures on everything and you'll be okay. Easier to type than hand write. GET TO KNOW YOUR TA and other TAs, they are the ones who grade your work and who can help you! Do all readings and midterms/final will be easy. Midterms/final consisted of term definitions and 2-3 essay questions. 3 books for readings, and an essay on each.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor DeLugan is very nice, yet reacts strongly if everything does not go perfectly her way. Attendance says it is not required in lectures, but she does occasionally take attendance so beware if you choose to skip. Half of the exams are identifying words but she chooses only 10 out of 100... so studying for a midterm is very time-consuming.
Very sweet, but lectures can be dull. 3 essays, a midterm, and a final.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Has an attitude and attendance is a must you cant find a loop hole believe me she failed me for an extra absence
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: She is a cool professor, willing to ask students for any help on her research. Her lectures are boring and you might fall asleep in some of them. Her exams are easy, half the midterms are vocab words, the other half are essay(s). She does not like the use of phones, and she focuses on socio-cultural anthropology.

I had him Fall 2022 and it was going well at first, he didn't give relatable content from his lecture slides to support the exams. When I attempted the infographic with my partner, we got a 190/200. When TAs went on strike, he suddenly started to regrade every assignment in the grade book. He also doesn't respond to emails and isn't sympathetic.

No midterms or finals, but it was the class I did the worst in & had the most trouble with. A lot of busy work & you have to pass most of the tests and quizzes to pass. My grade almost got screwed over because other people were caught cheating 3x & he gave everybody in the disc-section a 0 on the tests, including people who didn't cheat.

As the previous reviewer said, there is a ton of busy work in this class, which nakes me feel like I'm back in high school. We're also required to do a lot of the work in groups, which can also be annoying.   Finally, the class materials were riddled with grammar mistakes to the point of being distracting or affecting readability.

Assigns work due every day of the week. His assignments are easy busy work that reminds me of 5th grade. This man belongs in a middle school, not a university. Will both assign homework and have it due on weekends.
WORSE PROFESSOR I'VE EVER HAD AT UC MERCED. I SINCERELY HOPE THEY FIRE YOU BECAUSE YOU DON'T DESERVE TO TEACH AT A UNIVERSITY LEVEL. HE DOESN'T EVEN ANSWER EMAILS AND IS NOT AT ALL UNDERSTANDING.

I love his interest in teaching ESS2 class but his teaching technique is so confused. The lecture slides just relate a little bit to the exam and there are lots of short-answer questions in his exam. So be prepared for it when you decide to take ESS2 with him. For me, I never want to have him again in the future.

I really enjoyed taking this professor. I had him twice within a semester and I was able to manage. Not sure if its the same for all his classes but theres a lot of quizzes and exams. If you study you should be fine. You can tell he cares about the subject and he is willing to explain something you dont understand, if you ask for the help.
He was not a good teacher and he always changed due dates. Test are hard and he tasks weeks to grade homework.

He's a great professor, he does have a french accent so it maybe hard to understand him sometimes but you can always ask him to repeat what he said. He doesn't take roll in his lectures but I'd say it's worth going because you pay more attention to the material he's teaching.

Professor Masclin was a great professor! He is hard to understand because of his accent but he makes it clear that if you need something repeated you are more than welcome to ask. He's a very easy grader and when it comes to tests he tries to help everyone out as much as he can. Discussion was great as well, although attendance is mandatory.

Took this class thinking it would be easy but it was't. He screwed over the whole class because his scaling was off. He is disrespectful and even though various students emailed him, he did not honor the cat courses grades and screwed everyone over when he put in the final. His tests are stupid & hard and he goes very into detail. Do NOT recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class was ridiculously hard. Hes a good guy and he knows the material but the exams require tedious studying. Also, the labs are very difficult. I have an A but only bc of weekly mental breakdowns from excessive work
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: French accent. he loves orange. Easy going guy. Hard not to like him.

He is an amazing teacher. I didn't really have to try in the class at all. If you do good on the quizzes and labs you'll pass. Study his practice problems from lecture before quizzes because they are practically identical. He really cares about his students and tries to help them learn and have fun

Make sure to pass your quizzes, they can help you if you are in borderline of failing. Labs can be a bit confusing if you do not read or if you slack off. Make sure you pay attention to the instructions and ask a ton of questions. Office hours are mandatory if you do not understand, he can clarify anything you find difficult.

Sylvain is awesome! He is really there to help you and not try and trick you.  The material is boring so don't expect super exciting lectures, but he really does make most of them entertaining.  Office hours are a must and so is class attendance.  Not many teachers like him out there!

I had Sylvain as a lab TA for Chem2 and I am very glad I did! He is French, so at first I was worried about not understanding him well enough, but it was not a problem at all. He cracked lots of jokes during lab, was lighthearted, and very helpful in general. I looked forward to attending his labs.

First of all HE'S FRENCH! I am so glad to have had him for both general chem classes for a TA. He breaks down what is expected for the labs and offers many office hours which many students go to. He saved my grade for chem 10 because I didn't go to lectures. The atmosphere in labs makes the 3 hours really enjoyable. TAKE HIS CLASS!!!

I went into his office hours to ask questions about today's course/lectures. He did not answer my question. A wasted of my time. The exams he gave are hard and hards to understand. Exam materials are not cover in lecture, good luck to anyone who is taking his course.

I took a large lecture (200 students) so didnt get to know the man super well. Class was challenging. Exams make up something like 70% of the grade, and they were hard. Midterms not curved, final was. If you like math though, the lectures are worth it. Prof. Buvoli dives deep into some fascinating stuff you wouldnt get from most professors.

The class is not that difficult, totally exaggerated by people who search for answers instead of doing their homework. Quiz problems are exact copies of weekly HW problems, midterms can be challenging but scoring above average is enough for an A grade. Excess extra credit/curve is given and easily completable. Do the Homeworks and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: He might be a chill dude but there is no way he can be called a good teacher. His lectures are overcomplicated, extra credit is graded like assignments even though it is extra credit, exams are insanely hard & no curves until the end of the semester :) do a lot of out-of-class studying, like a lot. I'm serious.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: As a person, Buvoli's chill. As a teacher, he's awful. Lectures are confusing and don't cover the homework, which in turn doesn't cover the quizzes, which are given seemingly at random. Final was brutal and the class had an INSANE curve. Also, he counted extra credit as HW, which means if you don't do EXTRA CREDIT, your grade goes down. Do not take
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: There are pop quizzes in discussions. His midterms practically cover everything he teaches in lectures. His midterms aren't that bad but his final exam is extremely difficult. Grade curve this semester was huge (around 20-25%). Buvoli seems to be pretty nice and chill as a person, but I don't suggest having him unless necessary.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: As a person Prof. Buvoli is not bad he seems like a cool dude but his lectures are extremely confusing. His exam is pretty difficult which is mostly based on the lecture so make sure to attend his lecture. Quiz is nothing like exam. Although he does provide the class with lots of extra credit opportunities and he curves at the end of the semester.

Homework does not correlate with discussion worksheets or midterms. Midterms are mostly based on lectures which are just slides of his handwritten notes explaining mathematical proofs. He does not solve example problems in class. There are pop quizzes in discussion. Would not recommend taking his class unless it is your last resort.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I was apart of the 35/100 average on the midterm class. Lectures are very unorganized. He goes over his own notes (which dont help at all) be ready for the tests that come with this class because theyre very conceptual based and at random times, when you walk into discussion, there sometimes will be a quiz. OVERALL, DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: His midterms are all based on the lectures. The homework and the quizzes are useless for preparing for the midterms the class got an average of 35/100 on a midterm and blamed us for not studying correctly.

Gives good lectures but doesn't really cover much example problems. Sometimes lectures (especially towards the ends of the semester) feel rushed. The quizzes in discussion are nothing compared to the final exam. Final exam is extremely harder that all the quizzes that I took as a student. Overally good professor but his tests are insane.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Tomasso zooms ahead in explaining problems, but always has a great solution :)

I do not recommend his class. I never really learned in lectures, so I basically taught myself. And whatever I taught myself or learned through homework was useless. All exams were word problems, wherein the homework/study guides, not a single problem was as complex as the midterm/final.

By far the worst class I have taken. Lectures are based on confusing handwritten notes by him. The homework has no correlation to exams. Exams are worded in a way that leaves you unsure of what kind of answer he is looking for. I would not recommend his class to anyone.

Tommaso Buvoli is a great professor. His teaching method is effective and clear, his lectures are interesting, and though his class is challenging it is very rewarding. His grading is fair. If you are registered to take his course know that you can always go to his office hours, as many students found them useful, especially before midterms.
People are not lying when they say he is a difficult professor. He makes your brain want to pop! Learning basic skills are not enough, you need to practice and go above and beyond!

This class is really hard. First of all he doesn't even lecture. He literally explain the lecture notes he posted online. Never feel entertain to go to this class. Basically learn everything by myself. He's midterm is hard and he grades very specific. You literally have to memorize the answers and steps. He sucks compare to other teachers.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Even though he's new, I see potential in him. He started off quite confusing, but that's usual for a new professor. He has improved a lot over the semester and his current format of lecturing is ultra efficient. He is really clear and concise and homework problems helps grasp deep understanding. I took a lot out of the class. Just work hard!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor was very approachable outside of class and answered any questions students had during lecture. He was always open to clarify concepts, homework, quizzes, and exam questions.

For phys 09, it was a difficult course. There was 4 exams given to us in the summer, but the professor gave us opportunities to learn and get points back for the exams. If you were to go to office hours for your exams or homework, he would gladly help! It was a summer course, everything had to go fast, not his fault.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Inan is hands down an amazing professor. Because it was a summer class it was incredibly sped up which is what I signed up for, that's not his fault. He always makes him self available for questions and help. I was able to succeed because I worked hard and showed up to office hours to ensure I was understanding everything. He was a awesome prof

(Phys19) Professor Inan was overall a great Professor. Hes very understanding of student situations and helps as much as he can. He is always willing to help outside of class and goes above and beyond to make sure a student understands material. He is very patient with his students and is willing to help everyone that puts in the time and effort.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Physics 19: Dr. Inan was very kind throughout the course. There was a handful of homeworks + quizzes but he was lenient on due dates. Anytime you needed help or a question answered, he would be more than happy to help anytime of the day. He also gave extra credit. I recommend going to OH, keep up on assignments, and form a study group. :)

PHYS019: Dr. Inan is an absolute saint. His class was hard, but it was an accelerated physics class done in 8 short weeks of the summer. He was incredibly helpful and caring and truly cared that his students learned. Id always reach out for help, and because of that I managed to secure a pretty high grade in the class. Take physics with Dr. Inan!!

In Phys 19 for summer he left ALOT of coursework. EVERYONE was failing and he didnt care. In his OH he was rude and sassy, he was condescending so few people asked for help. He didnt listen to students concerns, dismissed it or made a patronizing remark targeting specific students. Class was set up for failure, too much hw + No time to study FAIL

For Phys 019: MANY students told him that he was leaving too MUCH coursework for summer and he dismissed our concerns. Everyone in the class was failing and he was rude when he helped us. Gave us an unlimited extensions on coursework which was useless since it was too much to begin with and it caused us to fall behind and had no time to study.

This guys is the best! I think he left UCM for another university. This guys needs tenure! His class is built in a way where all you have to do is have interest, the rest come easily! Physics can be dreadful , but Dr. Inan makes it enjoyable and understandable! I feel bad for anyone who doesn't get to experience him as a professor LOL

This guy is truly awesome! I dont think hes teaching at the UC anymore but they should have offered him Employment Security as a physics professor. Hes the best there is for physics at UCM! His course is designed for you to apply concepts instead of memorizing. He will go down as one of the best at UCM
Easiest most helpful class I ever had. His lectures are super and he explains everything step by step.

Nathan is a prime example of what a dedicated professor is! He stays long after his office hours are over just to help you understand the material. He is always willing to help and always is approachable! great professor at UCM.
Every easy professor, he's real chill. He sends out practice Exams and Quizes before the upcoming test so we know what to study for. Accepts late HW and a pretty decent professor.
He is the best proffesor from UCM.Fair grader.
The best proffesor ever had!

Gives serious, clear lectures that are understandable and just challenging enough. He is very nice and approachable and and although his office hours are busy he is always willing to help. A great professor.

Very engaging, approachable, and makes class understandable. He is easy going and is helpful, although his office hours can be busy. Spends a lot of time in class doing problems, but lectures are crystal clear and I couldn't ask for a better math professor.

Very engaging, approachable, and makes class understandable. He is easy going and is helpful, although his office hours can be busy. Spends a lot of time in class doing problems, but lectures are crystal clear and I couldn't ask for a better math professor.

I had Professor Kelly for both WRI 001 and 010 and he is an amazing professor who cares about students and will respond to any questions or concerns. I highly recommend attending office hours he will help you and give you straightforward feedback. The lectures are amazing. If you struggle with writing  I suggest you take Professor Kelly

Amazing professor that genuinely cares about the students. Very chill and always willing to help. lectures aren't boring but you do have a lot of peer discussions and a presentation so keep that in mind. again amazing class and amazing professor.
He is a very caring professor and genuinely wants to see his students succeed and he will definitely help in any way he can.

Professor was very caring for his 7:30 class, and gave us 15 minutes to wake up and catch up on the readings (if we had any, rarely). Lectures were him reading almost word-for-word what he wrote but they weren't boring enough to send you to sleep.
I would definitely take this class again. Such a great caring teacher and I recommend taking his class if you may struggle in writing because he will help you improve.
This is a class I would take again. He is such an amazing teacher and is very caring. Take his class you will not regret it. trust me

Such a amazing professor. I would recommend to take this Professor if you dont like writing 10+ page papers. We only had 3 essays overall and not over 5 pages each. Two of the essays were about you and your opinion and one was a research essay with 6 sources. Overall great teacher and helps you out a lot

Jacob is by far one of the most interesting professors at UC Merced. He makes class fun whilst simultaneously thought-provoking. It's very easy to develop a friendly dynamic with him. The writings aren't hard, but you do have to meet certain expectations. It's really hard to fail this class. Make sure you're involved and engaged-- it's worth it :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I took him for environmental writing. You can tell he's passionate in the conversations we have in class and likes to delve deeper. Try to be interested in the subjects and class won't be boring. Make sure to participate to keep things interesting. He gets along with his students and cares about input. Typical writing stuff, not too much work .
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: I had him for the scientific writing course last semester. He's a cool and outgoing professor, and he seemed to want his students to succeed. If you put in effort, you can definitely get an A or decent grade in the class. If I could have him again for another class, I would definitely do so. Still kinda hurt he didn't bring his dog to class tho
Great Professor

He was my favorite professor Ive had due to his genuine care for his student and teaching. He has a good class structure and makes it easy to follow along. I do not need anymore writing credits but if I ever needed to, or have time to take another course, I would enroll in clases hes teaching.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Attendance is a big portion of your grade- the required textbook isnt hard to read its on the basics of grammar and he works with the flow of the class. Homework is just writing thoughts in 500 words, and major assignments are no more than 8 pages. Very caring and gives great feedback- class was fun if you participate and the class isnt dead.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Attendance is important, he requires a textbook but we only use it for the first half of the semester, only three major assignments are required for this course, nothing over 8 page papers.
He's a pretty cool professor. Tries to be friends with the students and always has jokes. Four essays throughout the semester, two presentations, and journals about every other week.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Instructor is funny and chill. Often times can be rude or rather more direct and explicit. 4 Major assignments and alot of presentations(For those who struggle with public speaking)

Such an amazing professor! Very caring, funny and overall a good person. His class is very interesting and as long as you participate and turn everything in on time, you should pass with an A! There is some occasional reading but it's nothing too tedious, there are only 4 major assignments with journals here and there.
Great professor with lots of enlightened ideas. Really inspired us to work and think things through. Had her throughout my undergrad. A little bit of a weirdo and full of wild stories.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: So a week into Eng 54 looks like reading a book every week and having a response paper due that week about the book. The 2nd class of the week we have discussion in class and it is a very interactive class. Youll also have four 3-5 papers due but she ends class shorter than the semester also grades easily. I highly enjoyed this class!

I can understand why people don't like taking her class, I do feel like it's a waste of time going to class sometimes because, as someone mentioned, it turns out to be a "free-for-all" discussion period when students ramble about their opinions BUT you learn a lot from the lectures...definitely not so "opinion-based" as someone said...
her lecture style is very preachy, non- factual, opinion- based, emotional, and very dramatic. Quite a waste of my time.

dual lit and history class. posted crops readings rarely discussed, and if they were discussions were minimally intellectual; sometimes what began as an interesting topic quickly turned into a free-for-all, kid-like debate. definitely a waste of time and grading was based on how much you agreed with profs

Jan Goggans is brilliant. Everything she says is insightful, clever, and witty. Her personality makes classes thrive. the creative can create, the ones seeking knowledge can find it, she makes it hard not to have a good time.

Professor Goggans is seriously a professor I enjoy taking every semester. I'm sad she won't be here next semester. She was very engaging with this class. She had guest speakers who were, for the most part, great. She makes class fun and funny...which keeps us awake and interested.  1 of 2 best professors here. Second to Sean Malloy. :-D
Jan's class is simply amazing. She connects history with literature with such impressive detail, AND she's funny.
Wonderful human being who clearly shares her loves with you allowing for you to assimilate the material freely. You will not be sorry you took a course from her.
Very entertaining and enlightening. A joy of a class.
Awesome teacher, she's really into the subject and always willing to help.
Professor Goggans is really wonderful and a great teacher.

Professor Goggans is always looking out for your best interest and is more than willing to listen to your problems. While her lectures can get a bit off topic now and then, her class is not too hard, just make sure to keep up with the readings.
Pretty interesting class, love the lectures! she always keeps it pretty fun and interactive :)
Awesome prof, love the readings she chooses even if they are a tad long.  She's a great teacher.  (and a feminist!)
Great teacher -- really smart and funny! Enjoyed the class and I got a good grade!

Long reading assignments from the "Bible". Very strange and disorganized. Essay prompts don't make sense. Seems to try and teach history that she doesn't know (doesn't turn out well) so she desperately seeks advice from Prof. Malloy and has his students regurgitate his lectures. Too much wrong history, and not enough lit.

One of the easiest upper div math courses. Super easy to pass. No final, just 3 midterms with 4-5 questions directly pulled from the homework (which isn't due). While lecture isn't mandatory, the discussion is and it's a part of your final grade. Content is somewhat hard but Prof. Kim makes it super easy to understand. It's almost fun!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor, funny and easy to understand. No final, exams were 4-5 questions directly pulled from the homework and it isn't even due (you should do it to prepare for exams). Says from the start to succeed in the class you just need to show up the lecture, was just hard because it was early but great class.

This class is great if you want to learn about various research and internship opportunities. The class has weekly assignments however they take around 10-20 minutes and are relatively easy. Would take this class again due to how useful it was for resume building and outside opportunities.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Took him for opportunities in Data Science. Lots of informative guest talks and presentations focused on career development. There are weekly assignments that never take more than an hour. He grades generously but is strict on late work. He takes participation and attendance through iClicker, so go to all lectures and discussions to not lose pts.

He is passionate about the subject cracks a lot of jokes during lecture funny guy. He tells u at the beginning of the semester that if you want to do well you just have to show up thats it. Exams are literally problems from lecture and discussion. And he drops one midterm out of 4. Only reason i did bad was the class was too early for me

Extremely clear and passionate about the subject he teaches.  Available for office hours and extremely helpful. Homework is done online via WebAssign but it usually isn't too difficult. You will learn a lot from him
The best math professor I ever had!!!

What is it with UC Merced and Math profs? Kim is another one of the best and coolest professors ever. Material is never dry, always has a joke up his sleeve, plenty of running gags and jokes integrated into lectures.
Profound, simply profound.
OGIVE BABE! lol

He ROCKS!!!! I mean what would class be without the math sandwich, the non-stop party machine (which should just be named Professor Kim), and the poopoo brown marker. He expects a lot from his students and gives just as much in return. On top of being a cool guy, he's a real hottie too. ;)
He's pretty much the greatest teacher ever!  i love the poopy brown marker, sir james, and the real non-stop party machine!
this guy is awesome, uh, dont know where to start but his lectures are so interesting, he knows what he is talking about, and he is extremely intelligent, high IQ (you can just tell)
Easily the best professor at UC Merced.  He's interesting, intelligent, helpful, and, best of all, he's a really nice guy too.  I enjoyed going to math class when he was the professor.
Very clear, excellent proofs and very fun loving...

Dr. Kim is the man.  he posts everything online (lectures, notes, old tests), but it is worth it to go to class cause he is a funny guy. he is also good at explaining things. he keeps things up beat too with things like "math parties" and the "chronicles of Narnia." bottome line is that you want him as you're professor.
Professor Kim is the best.  I hated math before I met him, and now I want to major in it.
Funny and interesting professor, very knowledgable.
Awesome professor!

Informative and passionate lecturer! Lectures are important so take detailed and good notes; at least skim text book. Study for exams with notes, textbook, and study guide she provides so you can feel prepared and confident! Weekly assignments assigned during discussion section.

Professor Hull is definitely one of my most liked professors I have had. She is kind, enthusiastic, and relates actual lessons we learn in the class to her past careers. She lives and breathes this stuff. What you learn in the beginning of the class actually relates to what you do towards the end of the class, which made the class feel important.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Shes a very nice person. And if you are an anthropology major or minor then this class would be excellent for you. But if you are taking this class just to fulfill an upper division course, skip it. The tests are all short answers. Youve basically got to remember a months worth of reading and lectures. Good luck
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr Hull knows what shes talking about and is a fantastic professor. Make sure to actively take notes (not of only the PowerPoint outline) she talks a lot and goes through each term in the PP, so make sure you write down the details she gives. OFFICE HOURS. If Hull and the TAs see you trying they will give you the grade. DO THE STUDYGUIDE!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Hull is one of the most knowledgeable Anthro professors at the UC. Her voice is monotone but if you really want to go into the field she will do the most she can to help you. She is very nice and will assist you in any way she can. You will be surprised how well you remember what you learned in her class even years later.

Dr. Hull is easily one of the top professors at the UC. As a psych major, I found her class was beyond challenging - but I still remember all of the concepts and ideas that we discussed almost two years after taking the class. Even though her classes are hard, Dr. Hull is probably one of the most genuine and nice professors I've ever come across.

An amazing professor! Unlike any class please do not take her class lightly! You have to make sure that you come to class and keep up with the readings & articles. She will go lengths to help you, so do not call her a bad professor! She gives you all that you need to know for tests.Please make sure to come to class and DO NOT BLAME IT ON HER!

Hull is very tough. This class was my only under division class this semester and it was by far my most difficult! Tests are super hard. We had several essays worth very few points for a lot of work. Lecture was monotone especially after lunch. only silver lining-she curved at the end. She is very friendly and always availible for office hours.

Great professor. Her class was extremely challenging but well worth the effort in the end. Attending lectures and taking good notes is a must, use a laptop because you'll have to write pretty fast. Syllabus and instructions are detailed and clear. She also gives great feedback on tests and essays. One of the better professors I've had as a student.

A lot of writing and there is an assignment due in discussion every week. She knows what she is talking about but her lectures are dry. Lectures are mandatory and if you skip, the slides are posted but the information is missing. Tests are very detailed, and she uses examples from the book as well as personal examples for test questions

Professor Hull is a very good teacher. She is not unreasonably demanding, as some say, she just expects people to take the class seriously. This is a UC people! It's not high school anymore, step up to the plate! Hull is extremely helpful, and she really does want her students to succeed. But you have to put in the effort. Lots of reading, though.

Her lectures can be tedious, and exams difficult at best. But in all fairness, Prof. Hull is very knowledgeable, especially with California archaeology. She expects a lot from her students and doesn't tolerate any funny business in class. Take notes, study, and read everything! As an anthro major, I've enjoyed her classes and have learned a lot!

Do not take this professor if you are looking for a class that is stimulating and makes you ecstatic to attend class. This professor's monotone voice will put you to sleep every time. The content is dull, tedious and the way she presents information purely logical, not the slightest bit amusing, fun or creative. This professor? FAIL.

Very helpful professor. Instructions were clear and never conflicting. She was willing to help in any way possible and did much to make the semester a success. One on one conversations are wonderful and informative. A gift to the UCM Anthropology Dept.

This was the most unclear lecture series I have had to date.Lectures barely attach to the overwhelming readings, however you can pass the class by skimming the reading and attending every lecture. You can learn from her lectures BUT you must take "stream of consciousness" style notes...ignore the slides or use them sparingly. DO NOTE THE DETAILS!
Lectures may or may not mirror readings. Too much reading assigned. DO WORRY ABOUT THE DETAILS regardless of what she says.

Tends to bore with lectures. She literally stands before the class and has you listen. Is the stereotypical college professor. The topic itself is interesting, but her presentation of the information lacks imagination and creativity.
Best professor hands down!!

I had Schnier for ECON 120 during summer semester. Attendance isn't mandatory, but is recommended since most of the lecture material is written. The course was very fast paced due to being a short semester, but he was always thorough in explaining the material during lecture and he was very helpful during office hours. He seems very knowledgeable.

Kurt is literally a genius of mankind - also a passionate and caring professor, always ready to help his students with any help. His SPARK Should I Donate a Kidney highlighted many elements of research, but he made all of the assignments light in terms of workload and very engaging. Honestly, one of the best professors Ive ever had.

Prof. Schnier is an awesome professor! His class was only lecture-based and you'll do pretty well if you take the time to study the notes. The only thing I didn't like was that his handwriting is pretty bad, so good luck with that!

I had Professor Schnier for my spark class, "Should I Donate a Kidney". Although I was not initially interested in the topic, the lecture heavy notes sure made me learn a lot of information. Schnier is an easy going and funny professor. Lectures will give you all the information for the tests. Offered extra credit which was cool.

SPRK:I adore this professor he was so kind and caring for his students. One thing though that I did not enjoy about his spark class was that it requires a lot of work compared to other spark courses. If I knew I would not have passed with an easy A I would have no taken it. But I guess I'm petty because I did not get the grade I thought I deserved.

I adore this professor he was so kind and caring for his students. One thing though that I did not enjoy about his spark class was that it requires a lot of work compared to other spark courses. If I knew I would not have passed with an easy A I would have no taken it. But I guess I'm petty because I did not get the grade I thought I deserved.

Kurt was an awesome teacher, he puts worksheets up for every quiz and test and there is never any surprises on his exams. It is not cumulative, he breaks the class up into 4 sections. Really reasonable professor and works with you if you are struggling. Only downfall, HE DOES NOT USE CAT COURSES! You can ask about your grade in office hours.

Kurt is an amazing professor! He takes the time to make sure students understand the material. His lectures are fun and he is very easy to get along with. His exams are based off the notes and he also curves them. He is definitely a teacher worth taking.

Kurt is an amazing professor. He truly cares about his students and genuinely wants to help. His lectures are fun, you don't have to attend them but it's helpful if you do. As he explains the lecture in depth. Would take all my Econ classes with him if I could. Curves tests. I would recommended to attend office hours before exams and quizzes.

Very fun class to take. I really like the way Kurt grades clearly. Curved exams. Really accessible to get an A if you study. Attendance not mandatory, but helpful as he explains the lecture, which are posted online. Accessible at office hours. Very helpful in my opinion. I wish I can take all my Econ classes with Kurt!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He made econ001 easy to understand and really interesting!  I would definitely take him again!

I took marketing during summer, session of 2016. He is a great teacher, the layout of the class was easy to understand and clear! If you do the work and show up you can easily get an A. He curves a little more generously during summer, session. Overall, he is a very kind teacher and passionate, he is interesting and genuinely wants to help you !
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I really enjoyed Environmental Economics! Kurt is an amazing teacher & he makes his lectures interesting! His quizzes and exams are very straightforward, if you do the worksheets and go to class you will get an A! He is really there to help and I would take any class with him again! Honestly, I think he is the best teacher at UCM. He curves too!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Easy class, along as you show up and take notes you'll be fine. His hand writing is not the best and there will more times than not that you can not read his words. Go to office hours. Grades on a curve. NO HOMEWORK.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Overall great teacher, wants to help out students, fun and entertaining class.

Print out the worksheets and follow along in class, making sure you can answer each question. He often gets stuff wrong when he's explaining it, but overall he's a really nice guy and wants to help you learn stuff. Definitely had to go to office hours regularly (before each quiz and test).

Shes a great teacher whos always willing to work with you as long as you put in the effort. Her class isn't difficult but you will have to read if you want to do well on the pop quizzes. There is no down side to taking her class I'm sure her writing class is just as enjoyable as her spark class.

Great professor!
Just a heads up if take her sprk 001 class, be prepare to read multiple books and pop-quizzes.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Contreras is really caring and cares for her students well being. Understanding yet makes sures that your work gets done. Her class is very interesting. In total 5 different papers and mid term is on paper, final is a essay. Her class if easy as long as you show up and do the readings. I would take her again if I could.

Professor Alicia Contreras is the best especially I have had. I was in her Spark 001  class she is a very nice teacher and helpful especially when I was struggling in my other classes . I recommend going to her office hours she will help you with your essays, She is a great professor whoever has her for WRI 010 will be in good hands
Professor Contreras was very kind to her students despite that her class was at 8:00am. Her feedback is helpful. She does assign a lot of reading but as long as you do it you can pass the class.

I took this class last during fall 2019 semester, AMAZING professor. Understanding, helped me grow as a person, good feedback, and so kind. She takes into consideration your struggles and helps you improve as a writer and person. The readings were amazing, I loved them. She really cares about her students, not only through words but actions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is an AMAZING professor. I had her for the full year because I took Spark with her fall semester and she made it so interesting! With writing 10, she made it research papers our choice, as in we got to pick what we wanted to research. She gives amazing feedback and is very understanding. I would 100% take her class again.

I loved Contreras. She is someone you should definitely take for WRI1. I took her last year as a freshman and she was positive and easy to talk to for questions and conversations. She attended UCLA, so if you guys have questions about it, she is the perfect candidate. She knows how to empathize with you as a student, giving you ENOUGH homework.

I loved her. She's such a great professor she really stood out-out of all my professors. She really cares about her student. I was going through a lot and she would extend assignment due dates if I talked to her personally. Highly recommend for incoming 1st years.

Professor Contreras is one of the best instructors I ever had. She is the reason why I improved on my writing skills and it does not hurt to ask questions during office hours. She gives out feedback for each essay and as long as you understand the material you will be fine. I highly recommend her as a professor :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is the most amazing Writing 1 professor because she is so lenient. Sort of awkward but she is a great instructor that will teach you great skills. As long as you go to class, turn in everything on time, and participate easy A. She gives super helpful feedback and is super sweet and down to earth I wish I could have her again!!
Super caring and can be lenient as long as you talk to her and create a connection to her.
Super easy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Contreras is a great professor who helps students succeed. If you are unsure of what assignments ask for go to office hours; if you need any form of help go to her office hours. She is clear in what she is looking for and is a consistent grader. She is very flexible and understanding and offers extra credit!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Most annoying professor if you actually know how to write. Practices a very "cookie-cutter" style writing and expects you to do the same. Her feedback on papers is very cookie cutter and doesn't actually explain specifically what should be improved on. She's pretty lenient about due dates as long as you talk to her, so that's a plus.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great professor! Very helpful and lenient
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I am not a fan of writing but I really enjoyed Writing 01 with Ms. Contreras. She is super sweet and caring and really takes time out to help. It's really beneficial to go to her office hours for the essays because she will sit down with you and help you go through them and make them better. The class was really fun, she also brought snacks often

-attendance was not mandatory as long as work was submitted before class
- very sweet and helpful 
- replies to emails quickly
-light workload
- there's research and reading but very manageable

It was a very easy course to take. I would definitely recommend her. Grading is very straightforward, and you can resubmit assignments for a better grade. Attendance is not mandatory and lets you leave if work is finished.
Awesome professor and great person

Professor Danielle Minfuna-Lopstain is one of the best professors ever. She is super caring and always comes in with a smile and positive energy. She is my favorite and I'm excited to be taking her for Writing 010
Very kind! If you are someone who needs help and very disorganized, she's the perfect teacher.

Hands down my favorite professor of all time, she's the sweetest! Gives amazing feedback in order to let you resubmit for a better grade. She's even sweeter if you go to her office hours even if it's just to hang out.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Best professor in the writing department (opinion). She is a very caring person, enjoyed going to office hours to receive help. She is really understanding of your situation. 2 papers during the semester, so don't procrastinate. Discussions were fun, in the way she teaches. I highly recommend her, nothing bad I can say about her. One of the best.

Professor Danielle is one of the most caring staff members at UC Merced. She focuses on making genuine connections with all her students and has very engaging in-class activities. She is very laid-back and always willing to help with whatever she can. She gives plenty of time for all the things she assigns and grades fairly. 11/10 Professor.
Professor Danielle was an excellent teacher through my writing10 course, she is very nice and caring about any assigments.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Danielle is heaven-sent. She is so caring and understanding, and if you need an extension on anything she will gladly give it to you. Only had 3 essays and 3 homework assignments the entire semester. I would definitely take her again without a doubt.
I absolutely LOVED Danielle. She was so caring and understanding. She understands life happens and we are just trying to survive.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I loved this class! Professor is very understanding and helpful. Overall would take again
The teacher is so nice and caring. Gives good feedback and actually wants you to do your best.

Super kind, understanding professor. Class was asynch and based on one writing assignment a week + three essays over the course of the semester. As long as you do the work, you should be fine. Gives plenty of extra credit opportunities and allows you to re-submit assignments you didn't do well on as many times as you want. Super lax with deadlines.
Easiest class ever. I have 100% in the class because she allows us to rewrite every paper and just fix what she comments and you will get 100%.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Overall a great teacher. After she gives you feedback on your essays, you can resubmit them for an almost guaranteed A. Also, most of her assignments are based on if you did them or not. As long as you do the work and take her feed back you will get an amazing grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Shes extremely understanding. She also gives you a lot of opportunities to get a good grade in her class. As long as you do her work and show that you care youll earn an A.

Professor Mingua-Lopstain is a wonderful instructor! Her teaching style is quite innovative, utilizing fairy tales and board games to convey the material in a clear and concise way. She is very kind and patient, and is able to give great feedback on assignments to those who seek it before an assignment is due. Magnificent teacher!

She explained the chapters incredibly well but also made the lectures extremely entertaining and kept me engaged with the lecture throughout the almost 2 hour-long lecture periods even when really sleepy.

Altman makes learning worthwhile. Her lectures are engaging and she is very knowledgable. You have to go to class to get an A, but she drops your lowest quizzes and hosts review sessions. Overall she cares about her students and isn't one of those professors who just reads off the slides and assigns a ton of assignments.

The haters are dumb and didn't go to class. 
we had 4-5 weeks to do readings and homework.  Only reason anyone would have to stay up  is if they was slackin- .  Yes you got to show up -  you are also paying thousands of dollars for these classes! why wouldn't you show?  She's was smart, funny, and knew her stuff. 10/10

If you go to lectures you'll be fine I had her for psy 001 in spring and she would do attendance quizzes, she does make class engaging and if you participate in her class she gives you extra credit. The HW if done on time, in advance you'll be okay as the HW gives you 3 attempts at each question and most are multiple choice so pretty easy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor can be silly at times, but had nothing to do with the actual lectures itself. Never posted lecture slides making class mandatory. The lecture hall was so full that people had to sit on the floor to do their work. She would assign a certain amount of questions then add 100 more later on during the same time it was due. Would not recommend.

She's very sweet and uses very helpful lecture material. She also responds to emails VERY QUICKLY, so you're sure to get a response. Textbook was on TopHat, so no need top buy anything, but reading the textbook chapters was all of the homework, so there's quite a bit of reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: overall, altman was great in my experience. get ready to read the online textbook on ur own throughout the year. its a grade, its a lot but it really helps. GO TO LECTURE - might not pass if you dont. mini questions are graded each class for extra points. need to study for tests. a bit difficult but I personally loved it. she makes lecture fun.
This is the hardest teacher ever. Gave us 105 questions at the start of FRESHMAN YEAR!!! Outrageous asf, I'm struggling with the quiz/exam/homework. Got me staying up late asf to do all of it

She gives an insane amount of homework and before the mid terms, she gives an extra amount of homework. To top it off, she doesn't give us the lecture slides after class. After the class finishes, you have no source of notes, except the book. All in all, wouldn't recommend unless you want to cry before every mid term.

By far the worst professor at UC Merced. Went MIA less than halfway through the summer semester and taught only through pre-recorded old lectures that were terrible. This is not a psychology class but rather an excuse for her to talk about her love of art. Seems to be a nice person but is less than helpful when you need help. Do not take.

I loved this class and this professor. She is amazing. She made learning fun and she is so caring and understanding. Seriously, take her. Dont miss out. Shes amazing. She uses videos, doesnt give out hw. Literally goes over questions thats on mid terms in class. Show up and pay attention and youll have fun.

Professor Altman provides multiple examples throughout lectures as well as videos. Im a visual learner so it definitely helped me. The homework requires some time but she gives more than enough time to finish and its super helpful. I would recommend taking altman if youre a visual learner.

Love Professor Altman!! Interesting lectures and easy to understand assignments. Take good notes and keep up with the assignments and you'll get the A, super easy. When I took the class (Spring 2020, there was plenty of extra credit offered too.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Altman has been really great and understanding this semester with everything going on with COVID. She tried really hard to be accommodating, gave lots of extra credit, and she was super fair with grades and expectations.
She is very rude when asking about extra help. She lets her emotions get the best of her. I am never going to take her for another class ever again. Highly do not recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Altman is a great psy 001 professor. She makes lectures super interesting and provides great powerpoints for notes. 10/10 recommend because of how amazing and interesting her lectures are. Very understanding and offers extra credit.
She is super nice and funny too. She is the best and I would recommend of taking her.

Not good at teaching you the material TA's are better at teaching and help with the hw questions. Hw questions are similar to the test questions, just different numbers/scenarios. He does offer extra credit if you participate. Attendance not mandatory. 47% of  your grade are Exams and 53% of your grade is based on your homework.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Liu is a great teacher. He recognizes that not everyone has laptops, wifi, or time to attend mandatory zoom lecture meetings so he made class accessible by pre-recording lecture videos and uploading them for students to watch whenever they have time. He assigns four exams but he gives three tries. I highly recommend him, he's supportive!!

Professor Liu is an amazing professor! His lectures are easy to understand and follow but I recommend going to his class and not skipping bc the way he explains some of the concepts are really helpful. His grading is very straightforward! The homework isnt hard, and his exams arent too hard if you are following his lectures!He gives extra credit!

Prof. Liu is amazing! It was a complete privilege to take his class. His lectures are easy to understand and make statistics more enjoyable. He is kind and truly cares about your learning. There are three attempts allowed on assignments so it is easy to learn from your mistakes and he is also accessible for office hours. I highly recommend him.

I took his class during summer 2021, only 4 exams and you could download the exam as a pdf, so you had enough time to work on it. He would upload the lectures on time, he was also very organized. I would totally take his class again, he made it really easy.

I took Ren for psy010 during Spring 2021. There were five exams throughout the entire semester and we had to watch lectures every week. He allowed two takes on the exams and we were able to see the questions we got wrong. Its an easy class if you work for it. Would take again.

Lectures are really detailed and he provides lots of examples. Material on tests is exactly as depicted on slides with different numbers. Homework assignments are useful! You get three tries to increase the score. Active participation credit greatly assists grades too! Pay attention in class and you'll definitely pass.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Liu was truly enthusiastic and understanding guy with a great insight into his material and how best to relay it to his students. Just a great overall human being in general.

One of best Professors I've ever had. He delivers the content with enthusiasm and energy every time. He makes you want to listen and because of that you soak in the content easily and enjoy yourself while doing so. Content is hard, but he made everything crystal clear. A solid 10/10.

WITHOUT QUESTION, Ren is the BEST professor at UC Merced. Extremely knowledgeable, approachable, encouraging and nice. Grade is very well taken care of. "Master Bonus Point" and "Active Participation Point" and final score round-up all hugely increase scores. Bottom line is that he TRULY cares about you.
Most caring professor at UC Merced. Extremely clear with what he expects from the class & truly cares about each students grade. 10/10 recommend

Ren is the greatest professor I have ever had. I'm thankful for how helpful his slides were (when they were ambiguous, he would circle the same numbers 15 times to make the point more clear). I also appreciated his advent of the "Master Bonus Point" and the "Answer a Question in Class and Get a Percentage Point to Your Grade Point" Helped a lot!

This is a really cool class. You learn stuff that's actually useful in daily life. All the statistics are couched in real-life scenarios. 3 tests and 3 homework assignments- test questions can't be more similar to homework questions. Attend class and you definitely learn things.
Professor Liu is young, genuine and very personable. His slides are SO CLEAR and helpful.

You only get 3 assignments and the material is VERY clear. I heard some students took this in class with a different professor and it was one of the hardest classes ever. I would definitely recommend taking this class with Professor Liu. He really cares about your grade and is there for you.
He could quite possibly be the best teacher I have even had!!
He focuses on helping you learn actual stuff, not throwing you lots of homework or exams.

This professor made me think about my life decisions she made feel like I should drop out. She would do her lectures really fast to the point where your going to be left behind and to the point that stata is going to be your 13 reason why. she would give lots of homework and she would be really picky on how to answer the homework and test. Dont tke
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: She's a really great professor and while she does lecture fast, it's easy to catch up it you go to her office hours or ask questions. Weekly assignments. I'd 100% recommend going to office hours Whenever we have quizzes she lets us know prior to the next lecture so we can be ready. Midterms and final just like the study guide so complete those!!!!

This professor is very mean most of the time, she is constantly working too fast and yelling at people for not paying attention. If you have any other option do not take her. This Stata homework is unnecessary and constantly working against you! She will not answer your questions and will just pretty much ignore you.

What you get is what you deserve is her mindset. Random quizzes and offered 1 EC so far with no announcement on either; attendance is mandatory. Midterm average was below a 50 and she told us to just do better for next time. Homework is mainly all on STATA, which you basically teach yourself. And HW is based on correctness, w/ little to no feedback
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: This course is a mixed experience, suitable for those who excel in self-taught learning. You'll often need to teach yourself the material, with lectures essential for understanding the dense content. The first exam favored self-taught students, but the professor makes an effort to clarify subjects. Take the class but be aware it may be hard.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a nice Professor and understands her students if they come with problems what I recommend is going to office hours because that will definitely help if you need assistance everyone who is leaving bad reviews is most likely failing because there not paying attention!

I am currently fighting for a B in the class. She curves very strangely, that whatever the average score of the class is, will be a B at the end of the year. Its frustrating not knowing where my grade stands currently because the canvas score is technically meaningless and not a proper representation of my current grade.

I asked a simple question and she went off on an entire explanation of the lecture she just gave, even though my question was simple and had nothing to do with that. She shames you for having your phone out which isnt her business, and she's just salty that the average on her exam was 40/100
Disrespectful but demands respect and attention. Very petty about people not paying attention.

It is not of her concern if people are not paying attention, they or their parents paid for tuition, not the professor. Her priorities are imbalanced and her lectures have nothing to do with the quizzes and exams. Constantly taking off points for not paying attention and going on a power trip every session.

She teaches the basics and expects us to perform these concepts through STATA. However, she doesn't go over how to use STATA, leaving all students completely lost with the program. The tests have barely anything to do with STATA and her grading is unreasonable. She took off points because people weren't paying attention, which isn't her job to do.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She doesn't know what she is teaching and doesn't care if students learn or not. She only follows her own plans and she would walk up to students and ask questions. Even if they got the right answer she would ask for the steps to solve the problem. If the student didn't answer it then she would take off points from their homework.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Don't ever take her.

Professor Kose's predominantly lecture-based teaching style occasionally lacks engagement and interactivity. Incorporating interactive elements like group discussions or hands-on activities could enrich student participation and understanding. While assignments are promptly graded, there is no feedback on what was done right or wrong.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Omg she is horrible, if I could give her 0 stars I will, 0 extra credit, her way of grading is terrible, she should grade based on the average but she grades based on who got the highest grade, if you have the opportunity to take this class, waste it. Do not take a class with her, you will regret it.

ECON010 isn't really hard, but she is difficult to work with. On the first day of learning STATA, she went ahead rather than helping people who were having trouble finding the file directory. Additionally, she gave us the entire code for STATA instead of teaching us it, so when asked on the homework what code did "this", I was lost.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: I've had worse professors, however, she isn't great either. Although I can respect her for somewhat trying, sometimes it just feels like she does not care about her students. She does not explain things very well and I always end up just going to my group mates or my TA for help. Overall, not horrible, but not great. Take this class IF YOU MUST.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Took her for Popular Musics last year. I learned a lot about music from her. Participation matters, so be sure to talk during lecture. She entertained the class by encouraging us to stand up and sing/dance. I love music, so I found this class pretty easy to pass. If you take good notes and listen to the playlist, you will pass for sure.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is an amazing professor. She is truly passionate about her work and the music in general. She is really respectful of your preferences and truly engages with students so get ready to participate! Study for the midterms and make sure you know the music by listening to it and be ready to memorize facts about songs and info discussed in class!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The class was fun, easy, and she made learning fun. The lectures were pretty interesting for the most part. take notes, look them over, and you can easily earn a good grade.

Professor Gale is always energized and passionate to give lectures. She's a very great professor I wish I could've had her for all my classes. I regret not going to her office hours, I only went once during finals week. She's very helpful and caring and open to any questions or ideas.

This class was not what you would expect. You look at music starting from the late 1800's and work your way through the years. The class was engaging at first, but over time it got really boring. If you don't participate you lose 15% of your final grade and you're only allowed to miss 2 classes. The midterms are straightforward but a lot of info.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Gale is an amazing professor. Not only is she intelligent and caring, but she is engaging as well. To succeed in her class you should read as much of the readings as possible and participate in class. Attendance is mandatory, and I think you're only allowed to miss one class. Go to office hrs, it makes a significant difference in your grade.

She assigns readings which she sometimes asks on; majority of information you need to know for class, quizzes, and tests are the songs in the music playlist she creates on Spotify. You need to know each song in depth (artist name, song title, year it was released, genre, etc.). No textbook. She likes participation. You write a couple papers too.

I mostly took this course to fill up my schedule. Not an easy A, you have to put in effort. Lots of readings and memorizing dates. The tests are straightforward but if you dont know the material, you will not pass. Doesn't have study guides and can be confusing at times. Doesnt have a friendly vibe.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Gale is a fantastic professor! Period! She doesn't take lightly to people not doing the required readings or not participating. She's incredibly intelligent and has high expectations of her students. If you are lazy or unthoughtful she will definitely notice it and won't appreciate it. Don't be like that and you'll do well! Tough grader :)

Dr. Gale can be very rude to students. She can be very condescending and disrespectful to students. She is very unfair and does not grade equally across the board; her favorites have it easier. Her lectures can get dull, and she will yell at you if you're on your phone, having a side conversation, or anything. Attendance is mandatory. Do not take.
It's a very boring class

Professor Gale is very passionate about teaching her students. She is there whenever you need help and she prepares you well for all of the assignments. She tries hard to encourage discussion and class participation.

Emily Gale is a very upbeat and delightful professor. Her class will be very mundane for those who don't have a general interest in music history or music in genereal. Discussion/comments are required to further lectures and make them interesting. I enjoyed everything that I was taught in Gale's course. She's a sweet professor and is enthusiastic!

Emily was very professional about her teaching style. The class required A LOT of participation so be ready to raise your hand! As long as you keep the discussion going, it will be interesting else it can drag on. I love her quirkiness can be quite funny at times. If you're interested in music, take her else the class won't be interesting to you.

The class requires a lot of participation for good discussions. The reason why is may seem her lectures drag on is because students do not care to further the discussions (ask questions, make points, actually discuss music). If you are generally interested in music and care to learn more genres and history of music you will enjoy the course.

She's a new teacher and still trying to figure out what worksdoesn't work. The class as a whole was pretty interesting. She obviously knows a lot about music and is very passionate about it. She gives study guides for the midterm and final. STUDY THEM. Everything on the test is on the study guides. She took awhile grading assignments.

Only took this class for an art credit.  She is very confusing during lecture as she jumps all over the place.  She expects us to know things when a lot of us have never dealt with music before.  She is never on time with her work on crops.  And her review sheets are just stupid.

He was overall a very nice person, but I will say he is a little disorganized but very understanding with personal matters. He does give second chances to complete in-class work and sometimes homework. 3 total papers, which I recommend attending office hours to revise your work. Must know APA style writing, which he is very strict on.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: For this class Merrill is a pretty good dude I'd say most of the time his chill and relaxed but this class has taught me absolutely nothing and if you coming from WRI10 then you must know how to write APA because the class is easy but very unorganized he means really well but you just get nothing from the class overall.

Disorganized, repetitive, and an overall waste of time. Barely knows how to use Canvas and often leaves your grade overall inaccurate or downright unfinished. This is a class where your grade starts out at an A and then can only go downwards. He's a nice person, but a terrible professor. If you have the option, please just get someone else.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: He's great as person but disorganized as a professor, often going off on tangents. The constant updates to assignments made class hectic. However, he would make us write or collab with peers in-class which I found to be helpful for assignments. Overall, his class was easy and he is great at supporting you, but disorganized which is frustrating

Dr. Merrill is a very interesting professor. He often goes on tangents if you talk about an unrelated topic in class but I think that what makes him very easy to talk to. He was very supportive while I was going through a medical condition and simplified the course load for me. If you need help all you have to do is ask. Go to his office hours!
rating_tags: Hilarious--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: He means well. He really does. This is my second time taking any of his classes, and I've had enough. My main problem with his classes is how disorganized and unprepared he is. He also does not stop talking, and his assignments are repetitive, confusing, and lack substance. I have not learned anything from his classes, and I've wasted my time.

Merrill has a passion for writing. Assignments were easy. I was never overwhelmed by this class, but all the work was repetitive. He was constantly distracted during class and unprofessional. Instructions were never clear. Ask him a question; you'll see he's making up the answer as he goes, just like our assignments. Not a bad guy just disorganized

This professor was very disorganized and would keep moving deadlines for assignments. Most of his assignments were worth 0 points, regardless of their difficulty level. He was often late and went off in tangents. He did not grade numerous assignments at the end of the semester. This class was confusing, stressful, and frustrating to take.

RECOMMENDED!!!! Although I do not agree with his grading techniques, I can say that he truly has a passion for writing. He is not just here to get us out of the class, he really cares about how we write and how we develop healthy writing processes. I learned more about writing in his class than I have in my 13 years of education.

Deadlines were moved around so many times that it was impossible to know what was ever going on. Also, you won't be able to know when the actual deadline is. Mostly every assignment is worth 0 points besides like 4 assignments. At the end of the semester, he expects you to complete almost all the assignments that are worth 15-20 points.
rating_tags: So many papers--Graded by few things

comment:
Kind and laid back teacher. Fun lectures and easy to talk to. 

Particularly disorganized and has a poor ability to manage anything online.

Deadlines are nonsensical and moved around so many times that it was impossible to know what was ever going on. This caused half of the course load to be completed in the last 3 weeks.

A really kind teacher. He grades essays like any other teacher but is genuinely kind and always told me what I could improve on. I was always excited to go to class. Thank you for such a great semester!

If you need to take writing in the disciplines -psychology, I highly suggest you take Merrill. All we had to do was write an annotated bib, lit review, and do a presentation throughout the semester. I really liked that the assignments were broken up into weekly tasks and that he would give us extra time if needed to complete them.

My favorite teacher ever at UC Merced, I took him for my first semester and loved his way of teaching so I took WRI 010 with him for second semester. A lil tough with grading essays but if you're progressing and accomplishing what he's looking for in your writing you'll do great.

Class seemed quite difficult at first because he is a tough grader and definitely expects you to put in a lot of effort in your papers. You definitely need to participate in class. Very nice and approachable, outside of class as well. Gives weekend homework. You have to work for the A.

He knows his stuff and is very kind. Very helpful during office hours and is never intimidating. Yes, you must somewhat apply yourself for the "A" but if you really want it, he offers tons of extra credit opportunities. I also learned a lot about myself and writing in his class through his lesson plans and teaching styles.

Great experience. Engaging professor. His curriculum tailored to WRI 10 is my favorite when I compare it other professor's. He treated me with the same tone of voice he would treat his fellow professors around campus: respects everyone. Homework due each class period (takes an hour to finish). He's a funny guy. Plus,his office hours were rewarding.

Rewarding and insightful experience with Dr. Merrill. His enthusiasm for the curriculum in class and his one-on-one conversations and discussions in Office Hours make him an ideal professor for me. At office hours, he created constructive discussions and eventually valuable conversations with my essay as the centerpiece. Very creative guy.
