Honestly this professor is really chill. The problem is that he has a heavy accent and messes up a lot. He also talks a lot which can lead him to go off task and talk about stuff that makes no sense. He does help tho and his notes are easy to understand. But prepared to teach yourself at times.

Sandoval is so sweet but he is struggling to teach.  Everyone I know loves this professor but he needs to retire.  He has fallen down, been late to class, makes mistakes and his lectures are incredibly boring.  I don't mean this in hate, Sandoval is super caring however he needs to retire.  I see him struggling to walk and it breaks my heart.

I have absolutely no clue how on earth this guy landed a teaching job, let alone why he was assigned to teach a class as difficult as 105. It's mind-boggling how someone can be so clueless as to how to teach a subject in a way that is comprehensible for students. It's beyond frustrating that we are paying for an education
Great class structure and format. Thick accent but gets his points across and cares about student learning.

Professor Sandoval had no idea what he was doing in 105. He is a very caring guy though. If you go to talk to him during office hours you can get clarification on things, but don't ask anything too complicated. He has a big workload, which is the school's fault so I do not blame him, but if you are able to take ECON 105 with someone else do it.

Do the study guides and sample midterms and you will do great! Take the time to do the work and you will do well on the midterms. It's a lot of homework but it's usually what's on the tests. Love him as a professor and take the chance to understand him because he has so much to teach you. Don't be judgemental of his accent be humble and respect him

He is such an amazing professor. He definitely cares about your education. The accent makes you have to truly listen which is what has been helping me pass his classes. He makes his sample exams similar to the midterm. No final. He is fair and understanding. I would love to take more classes with him. I had him for econ101 and I got a B+.
Im not sure how he teaches in person but online hes not good a study and very tough on students.
THE BEST! 20/10 recommend

I have taken 3 classes with Sandoval - not on purpose. He is a nice professor but a lot of lecture time is spent on him talking about phone usage in the class or attendance. In all 3 classes attendance has been mandatory. There is a lot of HW and tests are easy if you study the study guide, which doesn't come with answer keys.

He is a very knowledgeable professor and knows what he is doing. He is also a good lecturer and super concise in office hours. However, we don't get much lecture done because he rants for about 10- 20 minutes about phone use every lecture. So you might want to learn some things on your own. Otherwise exams are similar to uploaded practice exams.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Hernandez is excellent! There are four midterms a lot of homework, labs, and agroup term papet. He posts his class notes online. Spanish accent, but easily understandable. Overall, a great learning experience.
Excellent Professor. Econometrics is a difficult class. You need to read his online notes, do the homeworks, and attend labs. His office hours and labs are very useful.

If you read his online lecture notes before going to lecture you will know what he is talking about. His office hours are where you "go to" when it comes to exams. His practice exams and VERY SIMILAR to the actual test, know the practice exam then you're good to go. Thick accent, tries to make the class interesting, funny!
rating_tags: Respected--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Spanish accent. Funny guy. Lectures are hard to follow. He wants you to learn all the material and even be prepared for next course. Active teacher.
He has an accent but he is a good teacher. Recommend going to office hours. He is very helpful and and office hours really help for the exams.

He has a  thick accent.  Above that his grammar isn't the best so he tends to confuse words around. Beside giving confusing explanations he tends to get ahead of things by writing down examples without explaining where the numbers are from so expect to teach yourself which won't be too hard. Just read the textbook. However, he is a bit funny.

I had taken professor DeHart multiples times, and he is very lenient with his work. Although class is not mandatory, his lectures are pretty good to attend. He is not very heavy with his work, he provides a couple roundtable discussion that are very helpful. Overall, very good professor.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback
Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Dr Dehart exams do not make any sense nor his lectures are helpful
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: You are graded based only on quizzes, the midterm, and the final exam. He does not have the greatest lecture slides, so attending lectures is encouraged. His study guides are also not the best, but his exams are still clear which makes it less difficult. If you've taken a statistics course before, this class should be fairly easy.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Balanced and considerate teacher, a TA horribly misgraded a test of mine and he fixed the error when I visited him in office hours.

I had Professor Dehart for Poli 010  A lot of what he says doesn't make any sense and dose not help when you do the quizzes . Also when it comes to formulas he dose not write them on the board he just expects you to figure it out though his slides and it is not helpful especially when you are studying for the final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Professor DeHart explains things really well during his lectures so if you have difficulty understanding his readings, going to lecture is a must. He's also a good lecturer and you learn a lot by attending and taking notes. Attendance isn't mandatory but you will miss out on a lot of substance if you don't attend.
I would take another of his classes. There's very little work and a lot of learning.

I took him for 190, he's amazing! His assigned quizzes (3 quizzes) are only 3 questions. He assigns essays (3 overall) but gives us enough time to do them. His coursework overall isn't difficult. His final as well went great! It's on canvas and he gives you the week to do it! It was an open note final and only 30 questions, plus extra credit.
Class was very informative. I had fun doing the writing assignments because you learn a lot while conducting research for your paper.

Professor DeHart's class was simple to understand and learn from. His grading criteria is clear and this allows for you to plan ahead. Not many assignments are given so it is important to do all the work that is given.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment:
Fall 2021: 
He assigns 3 essays as well as 3 5-question quizzes and a final on Catcourses. You can take all of the quizzes as well as the final at home, on your own time. The lecture is of no use if you took history at a U.S. K-12. Discussion is required due to participation points and updates about the course. Do not buy the textbooks.

Graded by 3 papers, a short writing prompt, a few online quizzes, a final exam, & participation (participating in some in-class discussions or posting to online discussions). Lectures are straightforward & concise. He's a good lecturer & a fair grader. It's a more laid-back class, and if you complete all of the work, it should be easy to do well.

Prof. DeHart is a great option for any poli class. His lectures are content heavy but not complicated and he makes them interesting. As long as you pay attention and do the assignments you will pass. His class really sparked my interest for poli sci so I totally recommend taking his class.

Really great guy, If you want to get into political science he's your guy. A great class if you want to get into political science as an absolute beginner. Lots of room for participation and not a lot of reading.
Does not give many assignments and lectures are straight forward!

Professor DeHart is one of the best professors I ever had, he makes lectures fun with videos and always has time after class to answer questions even outside the topic of lecture. He is totally understanding and will give you extra time on assignments. Best professors to take, highly recommend his classes for freshmans taking UD classes.
For not taking physics in highschool, I struggled, but he was always there to help and understand.

Great teacher. Takes up every second of lecture, never lets you out early. I took him over summer and he gave a quiz each week. Those aren't bad. But the exams can be killer. They get progressively more difficult as the semester goes on. He's really nice and explains things. Will reexplain if needed, he's an understanding, well-spoken, funny dude.

Mario Badal is by far one of the greatest professors I ever had the privilege of teaching my physics class. I also had him as a TA for Vector Calculus and Calculus and he is very clear when we explains new concepts and always keeps his lectures interesting. Outside of the class he is readily available in office hours and is very approachable.

If you do HWtake notes, test Q are similar.  He has office hours-always willing to help. Constantly asks if the material is understood during class and he doesn't mind going over it again. Gives you a week to do homework and easy quizzes about every two weeks. Loves 2 teach. Explains clearly. RECOMMENDED Took him at Merced College Calc1.

Man, this guy was so cool. I took his Calc 2 class at the college and he is such a great instructor. He is always willing to help out and he definitely does a superb job with being clear with the material. DO NOT hesitate to take a class with him and you will be happy you had him as your teacher.

One of the greatest professors I ever had at UCM! Office hours and lecture is a must and will help you in the long run. No notes are posted online. He kept lectures interesting and is a great guy overall. I highly suggest him.

One of the greatest professors I ever had at UCM! Office hours and lecture is a must and will help you in the long run. No notes are posted online. He kept lectures interesting and is a great guy overall. He WILL work with you if there is any family emergency.

One of the greatest professors I ever had at UCM! Office hours and lecture is a must and will help you in the long run. No notes are posted online. He kept lectures interesting and is a great guy overall. He understands his students and WILL work with you if there is any family emergency.

One of the greatest professors I ever had at UCM! Office hours and lecture is a must and will help you in the long run. No notes are posted online. He kept lectures interesting and is a great guy overall. He understands his students and WILL work with you if there is any family emergency. Wish I had the opportunity to take PHYS 19 with him.  :)

He is a GREAT professor. Goes through every thing slowly. If you miss 1 day, you can easily fall behind because his notes are not posted and often it is difficult to read other peer's notes when it comes to understanding the concepts of physics. Utilize his office hours because he goes over hw problems! Great teacher, A++ for him.
Pretty boring, almost no partial credit on exams.

Marion is an awesome professor. He's nice, clear, and makes the class as interesting as possible. His homework was all online using masteringphysics. His exams are also not hard, as it doesn't test you on calculations too much, instead more on things like summing forces/torque.

He is such an awesome Professor! He knows how to connect with the class and show clarity in what he teaches! He is a really nice guy and very optimistic and funny! Overall, He is someone I would recommend having for any class he teaches!

Marion Badal is one of the best professors i have ever had. Not only is he extremely clear and helpful with homework a the general understanding of physics. He is always happy, excited and willing to make his students love physics!!!
Very clear in his teaching. Highly recommend!

Awesome teacher! Helps a lot, and is very passionate about teaching. The class is difficult, but you get the hang of it very quickly. It's the teaching that matters the most and Mario does a very job well at it.

As someone who already struggles with math, I had a difficult time in his class. Don't get me wrong, he's a respectful guy, but the structure was very challenging. Most of the time, I felt like I had to teach myself the material, especially with ALEKS. Unless you're someone who's really good at math, I don't recommend.

In short, he doesn't teach you; the program used for learning doesn't teach you either; he isn't understanding of your situation if life gets in the way; he isn't there to help you pass, and you're fully on your own. 

If you're unlucky enough to have to take him (I'm sorry), then take advantage of tutoring and TA office hours.(there is no lecture)

Professor Moua always allowed us to collab with one another during the class times. Although he could improve on his lectures by going over more of the practice problems, he always encouraged us to go to office hours if we needed extra help. He is a very sweet professor and even said we could still reach out to him after the semester ended.

He had pretty flexible hours outside of class and we were always notified if there were changes, but overall he didn't really do much during our class time, the burden was all on you to learn and complete the material for the most part. ALEKS is a bit of a pain because it's a lot of work and sometimes pretty challenging with poor explanations.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Good professor but the Math 005 structure sucks. Not as great at explaining. Aleks was truly a pain all semester. Schedule remains the same to it becomes a nice routine in this class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Prof is very nice but the overall structure of Math 005 sucks. Aleks is a pain cuase it has too much work. You basically have to teach yourself everything. Make sure to do the worksheets because that's whats going to be on the exams. Prof Moua is very nice though so make sure to ask him for help when you need it.

I had such a great time in his class. I would say that he will teach the main portion of it and then the rest is on you. You will have to self-study using online resources or ask him for help. He explains the problems really well if you ask him.
You basically teach yourself in this class because his explanations almost never make sense.

Chai wasnt bad at all. I sorta zone out a lot because I feel like Im used to learning things on my own. Work isnt terrible. Takes me a good while to do it but you just gotta manage. Quizzes are worth 20 points for about 3-4 problems. Exams are 78 points. Chai is very willing to help. I never really needed it though.

Although he is a decent professor, I had a hard time understanding. Math has never been my strongest subject, and I basically had to teach myself. Lectures are once a week and most of it is spent in groups teaching each other or presenting. He does not assign a lot of homework but theres a lot due once a week. At least 5 hours of math homework.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He doesn't assign hw but there is a lot. He is the best TA out of all of them he will actively help you and offers extra credit for his class! He will make things so easy for you and his quizzes are super simple long as you get the concept. Highly recommend!! Him or Hambley cause he's the head but also he doesn't do extra credit.

Hes very nice, but his lectures are kind of shaky. Each week we are given a worksheet with a new topic, & he lectures us on it. His teaching isnt bad, but its just that sometimes it isnt clear. Also, he would just talk about one thing, & then send us into groups for almost an hour figure out the rest. Also, DO YOUR ALEKS ON TIME. IM SERIOUS.
The amount of homework we get is unnecessary it takes time from other classes. You are pretty much taking an online course and you are expected to learn on your own.

Chai is one of the TA's for MATH5. He was amazing with great feedbacks and is willing to help you if you need after class. There are weekly classes for all MATH5 discussions. Be prepared but ask questions before if you are confused. He encourages group participation. Overall, one of the best TA's here.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is very sweet and helpful! He really wants you to succeed. We had various extra credit opportunities and he explained any questions we had in detail
Very caring and wants everyone to pass his class.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: cool professor

Professor Colvin taught my SPRK 010 class "Computer Simulation of Reality." Great lecturer and always had an interesting story at hand. HW was straightforward, with harder extra credit challenges. I would highly recommend if he ever teaches it again.

By far it was one of the easiest BIO classes I've taken at UCM. I found it to be a mix of MATH015, a little PSY010, and a little BIO141, but it was pretty easy. The R coding assignments had the instructions clearly laid out and the answers for quizzes were usually very apparent after reading the slides once. Do the study guides, go to review OH!

Pretty late on this but he is a great educator. I don't regret taking honors chem rather than regular chem 10. Very friendly and knowledgeable. Lectures were all online and he even introduced R program as he is a computational chemist. Very clear study guides for the midterms and the quizzes were free response. Midterms are based on the study guide
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Awesome Professor. Very Caring Professor. Easily understandable. Answers questions very clearly. This Professor deserves A+.

Where do you start with Professor Colvin?  He's a brilliant professor, extremely clear on expectations, posts practice exams which are EXTREMELY helpful for pchem, is willing to work with you if you're having troubles both inside and outside of class.  Really, a true inspiration to budding chemists everywhere.  11/10 would take again.
Great resource, no wonder he is founding faculty of a University of California.
great teacher!  made subject interesting
great proff

extremely nice professor, knows his stuff and is always willing to help when u need the most. his tests and finals are easy compared to dayrat's. very straightforward guy. so take him! easy A if u've taken AP BIO. good luck! theres a curve too!
Pretty simple class.  Just do the online quizzes and you'll be fine.
Very good professor.
Excellent Professor, he says what he needs to say and efficiently so.
Wow, this guy is a genius and he's really nice.
His online quizzes are pretty easy!
He seems like a nice guy, few tests and quizes.

She is a bit harsh when it comes to grading essays. But if you come to her office hours for feedback; she will do her best to make sure your paper looks amazing. Her lectures are really engaging and she never fails to make us laugh. Her off topic discussions and playing the devil's advocate are really interesting. A great professor indeed.

She is a good professor, but you cannot miss any school for whatever reason. I had multiple doctor's notes to excuse me from her class due to various health concerns (one being COVID!), and I still lost points for attendance. It became so much of an issue I had to go to her class while I had doctor's notes, or I was going to fail!
You'll have to think with her, but she's very good at allowing you to.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Miller is great, she gives a lot of feedback on your papers so you know exactly what to look at. She is also very nice and always has offices hours available for additional help. Don't procrastinate and you should be good!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Miller is passionate about current events and I really learned a lot discussing different opinions in class with her. She likes to do a quote of the day which helps kick start my brain. She can be a bit repetitive when explaining things but she has a clear rubric on what she looks for.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great professor and amazing person in general. Expect to go to discussion and office hour to get to know her more. Likes to get off topic with the class a lot. Pretty good greater with the essays, but not an essay grader though. Don't expect an A, work for the A. Deadlines are always your responsibility, so don't fall behind on them.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Prof. Miller is a great writing teacher. She does not assign many papers but is tough when it comes to grading. She's very funny and conversational, and usually tends to play devil's advocate when discussing a subject (she does this to have you think about your papers argument on both sides) . Attendance is mandatory!
Susan Miller is a really great professor. She's very knowledgeable and extremely helpful. Go to her office hours and she will assist you. She is also funny and can be a little corny at times.

I loved her WRI 001 class!! She has an amazing personality and she really knows her stuff. Tough grader but it will definitely make you a better writer. Has quote of the day at the beginning of every class. Learned more about myself as a writer and how to improve. Recommend her class 10/10! Good luck!!
Great teacher 10/10. Had her for 2 semesters and learned so much. However, be wary of the sarcasm!

I put hot for her personality. very fun and easy to get off topic in her class. work is easy. essays are  little difficult but she is so helpful. great for first year students. highly recommend her class
Miller is knows her stuff. She fun and exciting. Her essays are no walk in park though. Take her advice seriously!

She's very helpful as long as you're willing to talk to her. Take her comments (on papers) to heart so you can really try to improve on your paper. I truly believe she made me a better writer. ^^' But I still have to work on my grammar/spelling for myself.
She's really helpful, fun discussions and fun assignments

She is nice and allows the class to get off-topic, but relates it back to what we are suppose to learn about. Susan is helpful and really cares about you as a person, not just a student. I felt that I learned more in my AP high school classes, but nonetheless, the class was helpful.

She is a very nice teacher and willing to help out students. She is also funny, and easy going teacher. She does not grade paper very hard like other writing teachers. Overall, I recommend to take her class because I learned a lot from her.

Very fun and funny...She teaches with what really connects to the students which was pop culture...seriously: music, tv, barbie (lol). She relates to students in a lot of way. Attendance is "not mandatory," but you need to go because of all the in class assignments. However, they are easy---and it's worth getting any point you can.

This statistics course was one of the hardest conceptual courses I have taken, mainly because I am not a math person. However, I grew in so many ways as a result. Sarah is a very talented teacher and has a very clear way of breaking apart material. She also is very accessible outside of class and answer any questions that she has.

This was my first stats class, and Prof. Depaoli made it really fun and engaging. Attendance isn't mandatory, but I highly recommend going since she's good at lecturing. There's a lot of extra credit given for attending/curving exams. I highly recommend doing practice problems since the exams can be hard, and it's easy to drop to a B.

Depaoli is a fantastic and caring professor. She gives lots of extra credit opportunities throughout the semester so make sure to take advantage of them. To do well I would suggest going to every lecture, looking over slides, and meeting her during office hours. Her exams are pretty good as long as you do the reacquired work and study the slides.

Depaoli is a wonderful professor. She is very nice and funny. Her lectures are very specific and easy to understand. The coursework is heavy with each week followed by homework and a quiz. As long as you attend lectures and do the work, you will be fine. Don't skip lectures, or else you will miss out random extra credit given by her!

She was one of the best professors Ive had and could actually teach rather than just lecture. Lots of work and quizzes but it helps to prepare you for the exams. Shes funny and is good at making lecture a little less boring than it would normally be.
Magnificent teacher! Explains thoroughly and is easy to follow along. Gives extra time for her students to understand concepts and cares so much about her students! I highly recommend love her!
Makes everything really easy to follow and understand. Genuinely cares about success of students. Would definitely take any class taught by her.
Very understanding
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: So far Prof. DePaoli has been an amazing professor! She explains everything extremely clearly and does not move on from the material until everybody completely understands. Interesting lectures and very personable.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: First time with Dr. DePaoli, and I loved her! Her class was organized very fairly, 20% for homework, 20% for each midterm exam (2) and 20% for the final, and lastly 20% for quizzes. She is spontaneous with her extra credit, so it is wise you go to class. She will curve exams as needed to make the average around a 76% per exam.
She is extremely specific in her lectures. She makes sure all students know and understand the material. She is very fair in grading and offers some extra credit sometimes!

Her lectures are dull but the she explains everything very well and the book she has us use is helpful too. She is very boring but extremely fair. You have to go to the class so you can understand, because just reading the book won't help in the tests or quizzes. OH! and The best time to do Homework is during class! =D
some topics were hard and some were easy. she  was a very helpful teacher though
she's really nice and helpful in office hours. Go to class to get extra credit points!

She provides good examples in class and gives extra credit sometimes on Thursday so go to class. The tests are hard but she curves. Office hours are really helpful because some of the material is hard.
TERRIBLE, her examples are ridiculously vague. Basically if you are not good with stats you will have a very hard time in this class because she cannot TEACH

It's easy to get As on assignments. However, an issue is the kind of topics the final should be about; these topics require lots of base knowledge about the subjects they relate to. This knowledge can't just be acquired via a month of internet research; u need to take courses on those subjects. Also the student led discussions were organized badly.

This class is a waste of time. Every class (1 hr & 50 min) 90% of the students sit in the back, open their computer, and drown out the continuous stream of nonsense coming from the professor. I learned nothing from this class and you won't either. Dodge this professor at all costs. Attendance is mandatory and all grades are given in the last week.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor John Haner is one of the most qualified people in UC Merced. I remembering dropping my old WRI 010 class because it was too early and signed up for his night class from 7:30- 9:30 PM. Despite being late I sent him a email asking if I could switch to his class. He was pretty chill and replied back with average emails and not much grammar.

John Haner is quite possibly one of the most qualified professors at UC Merced. Haner's dedication to students' education and writing development really does extend beyond the classroom and into real-world examples, even incorporating emerging technology into his classes. In 2024 very few lecturers care about their students' education like he does.

This professor is very laid back, the lectures, assignments, deadlines, and attendance policies were very flexible. He clearly wants students to succeed and often tries to give real world opportunities related to careers. It's a great class if you put thought into your writing and want to write about things you're interested in.
Good class, but lectures can be pretty boring. Only has a few assignments that lead to a big paper. He is extremely lenient and attends to student needs.

He loves talking about robotics and futuristic inventions. He's super chill and laid-back, and the work was pretty easy. He makes you get into small groups with other classmates everyday, so get used to it. He usually gives you an A or B on the essays, as long as you know how to do grammar and how to do basic essay writing, you should be fine!
His class has a very relaxed feeling and he teaches well without assigning much work. JSince there's so few, just as long as you don't forget a single assignment you should be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Haner is a great professor for writing 10. His class is centered around technology and you only have to write 3 essays the whole semester. He is VERY lenient, and often gives extensions all the time. Easy to get an A. His stuff is posted all on catcourses.

He offers lots of industry and business knowledge that books can't teach you. Very helpful for this. However, his feedback online lacks detail+doesn't read the whole draft that you submit+is disorganized+his prompt said "write a brief paragraph..." but he actually wants minimum of two pages. All promptsinaccurate and vague.
THIS GUY IS AMAZING, he made my first class in college a breeze and was very helpful throughout the course! A true pleasure to have taken his class.

John Haner was a great professor. He was very interested in the future of technology and based most of his assignments on that subject. If you email him for an extension he will always give it to you! He is very understanding and is always there for help. Show up to class, participate, and turn in all your assignments and you should get an A.
Loved Haner, one of my favorite teachers. Very laid back,and understanding guy

Professor Haner will give you great critical feedback on your essays and papers. He makes the class fun by having a class discussions. Overall if you do write the essays on time (use his feedback) and participate actively in his class you should get an "A". Also don't buy any books for this class. We never used them!

Very easy to get a good grade. Haner is lenient and flexible. Will allow more time to complete assignments. Course material is quite dry if you ask me. Class time is way longer than it should be. There's mostly discussion involved. Workload isn't too heavy.
He's a chill professor. Easy "A". Very lenient. Class material is rather dry though.

This guy is an engineer wannabe but is unwilling to put in the effort. He loves to talk about large ideas without actually knowing them in detail.  He should have majored in engineering if he has so much interests in it.  He waters down subjects meant for other disciplines in his class.  He is an insult to engineers.

Professor Torres, like the other reviews in the section said being too difficult and most of the things she goes over during lecture is not on the exams. I studied and read the textbooks and also the videos she makes us read during our own time doesn't even show up on the exam. The study guide seems half useful as most of the time it doesn't show.

Main problem with this class is that she reads too fast YOU CANT TAKE NOTES CUZ SHE SKIPS THE SLIDES and the notes are pointless half the test isn't even in the studies guide it's pointless and half the class were failing exams very tough and hard to understand around 100 questions for exams. Would not recommend choose another ge.

Professor Torres a unicorn amongst the professors at Merced. She is kind, funny, and super intelligent. Lectures were optional but I would still recommend going because exams are lecture-heavy. Exams were challenging, but she provided extra credit. She provides an online textbook at no cost to students, but dear God there is so much reading.

Very knowledgeable professor however this course (human osteology) required students to 'teach themselves'
Great to be in a smaller class and be able to get to know the professor and your peers. This course requires a lot of memorization!

Grade consisted of exams, study guides/infographic posters, and lab activities. Lectures were informative, useful for the exams, and entertaining. I recommend at least skimming through the text book. Study by taking thorough lecture notes (slides aren't wordy) and reviewing the readings and study guide she provides!
Dr. Torres is a fantastic professor and I highly recommend her. There are a lot of readings but they are easy to understand.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Honestly this class is not bad if you really care about the topic. I never showed up to lectures since the slides are in cat courses. The lab class is easy, that helped me with assignments and pass the class. Exams are really difficult there a lot of the things to remember and the study guide assignments were confusing, but it boosts up grades.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Overall, she is a good lecturer she does however talk pretty fast. There a lot of memorization throughout this class so prepare to study. There was a large curve on most of the tests that helped my grade not sure if that is because we were her first class back from the pandemic(in person). As long as you study from the book you should be fine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: 10/10 would take her for any forensic anthropology class -- I had her for my spark seminar on the forensic sciences. Sadly that class got cut short due to COVID but we had a great time in the months leading up to COVID.
Christina is a wonderful prof!! I have taken her classes many times and also leave class feeling inspired. She makes you want to understand what is going on.

She is one of the sweetest and most passionate about the subject of forensics. I had a fun time in her class and would definitely love to have her as a professor again for anthropology. She made me love the subject of forensics more! Spark with this professor is amazing and you wont regret it if you take this course! :DD

Dr. Torres-Rouff is a really good Professor, I just dont like Anthro. I took Anthro 5 & unless you really like the subject, dont take the class. Its really tough & involves a lot of memorization. Took this as an elective and it ended up being my lowest grade. However, if you like Anthro, i recommend taking classes with her-shes a great lecturer
Great at teaching and very passionate about anth!

I've had Christina for a couple class now, and honestly she is a really good teacher. In 152(a smaller lecture) she was engaging and fun, and really made an effort to learn her students names. There were pop quizzes based on readings, and A LOT OF READING(SO beware). But in all I would req. any of her classes!
rating_tags: Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: Not the best, not the worst. Not really compassionate. When the stabbing happened, she expected students to be in class the next day to take an exam.  Her lectures were tedious, she spoke way too fast. Her tests were ok if you'd study. She gave a study guide, but I do not recommend you rely on it. A lot of the material isn't even on the test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Mrs. Torres-Rouff was a very good lecturer, and she was easy to approach with questions. Her tests weren't hard if you study the material she tells you to. Great teacher, & clearly passionate about what she is teaching.

Daily (M-Th) Zoom meetings/lectures made him accessible to answer questions. Made lots of jokes which made lectures interesting. Very chill guy, just be aware he is very left-leaning politically; proven by lectures & links. Free textbook. Tons of reading, but quiz answers were literally the top answer option. Had several essay topics to pick from.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Carlson is fun looking. However, his lectures are about chapters he assigned in the textbook. His exams are questions exactly from the textbook and vocabs too. The cool thing is that if you don't know how to answer some questions, he allows you to write jokes in the exam to earn some points rather than leaving it blank.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Carlson's a cool dude, this class is all about reading. The lectures weren't really relevant but were fun and interesting for a history class. He has some interesting (albeit outdated) humor, but he also has kids so it adds a nice almost hipster-like perspective to the class. Take the Devil's Bargain if you've done the reading, it'll be worth it.
Carlson is an amazing professor. Very helpful, understanding, and easy going. Makes material easy to understand.
Carlson is def an awesome professor. He's interesting, he tells stories, and makes jokes to ease the material we are learning. He's def the man for Poli. Awesome professor!
Great professor. His lectures were long but he threw in a joke to keep it fun. Knows how to make politics fun and educational... and he's cute.

One of the best prof a student can have. This is my second class with him as an undergrad and he only makes class better. He is amazing. IPE is surprisingly not boring, there is not one day that I drag myself to class. He knows how to make class go by fast.
Witty, smart, great lecturer. Offers alternative perspectives on issues/events and keeps material relevant and interesting. Carlson is an awesome professor, take his classes!
One of the best teachers here in UCM. He is very enthusiastic about teaching the material and is very helpful to the students.

Amazing Amazing Amazing!!!!!!! Takes random attendance so it's always a good idea to go to class. One of the few classes you won't dread going to unless you're odd and you don't find him entertaining as a scholar. Great looking man compliments his ability to deliver lectures in an oh so great manner
very sarcastic but helpful. Class was enjoyable and he was always open for questions. He has one midterm and a final (somewhat hard) but not if you study.
Teaches well, invites questions and then insults you for 20 minutes.
Carlson was great. Knows his stuff, sarcastic as all get out, and doesn't take a whole lot of crap. He is an amazing professor. Take all of his classes. The POLI wouldn't be the same without him.
He's such a good professor, I love him! He's very straight forward & makes things nice and simple to understand. Also, he is always making "political" jokes which are super funny!
he is a very good professor, very straight forward, participate in class discussions, and attend office hours and you will do good.  Read the textbook of course.
He is awesome. Plain and simple. Please refer to his unofficial Facebook fan page for up to the minute updates on his school activities!

People in the comments are complaining because they were not prepared for her class. Lectures are heavy but informative. Tests are mostly based on lectures and reading. As long as you go to class for participation, READ THE CHAPTERS and take accurate notes you will pass. She has a google doc where you can write any questions that she checks often.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: She is not knowledgeable in the area of epidemiology; you will understand this if you ask her some technical questions. She doesn't know the answers and is not a good person to teach this. Sounds like the TAs know more than she does. If you don't have to take this class, please do not take it. Even self-study will add more to you, than her class

The lectures were very boring. She does not teach very well, she repeats herself a lot. Less than halfway through the term, nobody was paying attention to the lecture, only there for participation. The exams are super heavy and they are full of short answer questions. The class average was very low on exams. A lot of people did not do that great.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This class was not easy at all nor enjoyable. Professor Ha made this course more difficult than needed. Exams are tough and are the majority of your grade. She also gives contradictory directions. Will state something one time and change it the next leaving students confused.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: I definitely did not enjoy taking this course. For an intro class she made it unnecessarily difficult. Reading 5-6 chapters a week, papers nearly every week, lengthy exams, and exams set at 65% of the grade. Lectures were also 2 hours long and she just read off her slides making them not very engaging.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Shes a fair professor. Homework assignments are easy (once a week). Midterms (mc/short answer) are a little more difficult because a lot of questions are concept -based. Attendance is important, not only because of participation points, but also because midterms are lecture heavy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Easy to follow lectures that tend to be a bit boring. Answers questions in class and in OH. Exams were mostly multiple choice with some free response. Many extra credit opportunities throughout the semester. Overall very sweet and understanding of student's extreme circumstances in this pandemic.

Professor Ha is incredibly considerate of her students. During COVID, she allowed an extended window of time for the final exam, gave feedback on most missed questions, and she threw a curveball at us, but taught us how to handle the curveballs before the exam. She is also incredibly kind and a good lecturer. Also she gives extra credit a lot.

This class was an easy A as long as you show up for lecture. You needed a tophat subscription for attendance and participation. Dr. Ha was pretty accommodating through the COVID-19 crisis. Tests were very straight forward, only con was that the TA graded pretty hard for homework assignments but nothing major.

Dr. Ha's class is definitely not easy, but if you do the work, understand the concepts, and yes, memorize some things, you should be fine. You could definitely get by without buying the textbook (she covers everything testable in lecture), and her office hours are always helpful if you're confused on something. Overall solid professor.

So I took her spring 2020 and was excelling in her class before COVID happened. I was getting A's on her midterms and HW. When we switched to online classes she was extremely difficult and seemed to not care at all about our concerns. on the final, I had difficulty with connecting to the internet and emailed her and she said she could do anything.

Grading consisted of 4 exams, 5 assignments (one was dropped), and TopHat participation. She mostly read off slides and attendance was mandatory to receive participation credit. Some EC was offered. This class didn't need to be difficult, but Dr. Ha took opportunities to make life harder for her students when the course was moved online.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Horrible, I dont understand how she has such a great rating. Shes extremely boring. The professor had to continuously curve all her exams because the class was failing, which proves shes doing something wrong. This was my last semester at UCM, and from all my courses I hated going to this class.
You need to pay attention to everything. Her first test was easy but once we switched online courses she was extremely hard. I received way better scores in my in-person test rather than online.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Ha is very knowledgeable in Epidemiology. This class consists of reading quizzes, homework, in-class projects, 3 exams, & an optional paper that can help your grade. Attend class, do all the rqs & hw, create a cheat sheet for every exam, & do the practice problems & you should do well in this class. Don't be afraid to go to office hours.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Sandie is an amazing person and you can tell how passionate she is about the subject she teaches. However, her lectures are hard to follow and often very boring. The class is very statistic heavy and not well taught in a large lecture. Plus, she didnt coordinate well TAs with grading... She is available outside of class and allows a cheat sheet.

A great professor, makes time for her students. She gives good feedback and makes sure topic is understood before moving on. The homework is not difficult but readings are required to have a good understanding of the material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great professor, very approachable! Lectures can be boring, but everything she mentions in class in fair game on exams so pay attention! She allows a cheat sheet for all exams, which are extremely helpful! The homework is typically easy, it's online and you get 3 tries to submit your answers. She's very helpful during office hours!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Love this guy, he is so goated. I got a really good grade in this class and believe it is due to the homework he assigned. It really helped me memorize a lot of the material by working it through. Also, he had a lot of lectures dedicated to review before midterms and before the final, leading to my success in the class.

Professor Merg is a great professor, I took his chem class my first semester in college and couldn't be happier with the quality of the lecture and how straight-forward everything was. I would definitely be sure to read the textbook before lectures and study it for midterms.

His lectures are kinda boring. But if you pay attention and do the homework as well as keep up with the labs and the discussion worksheets its very doable. The way he grades tho is tough. It's only out of like 28 points and if you get one question worth 3 points wrong it bumps you down. Partial credit is non-existent.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: MERG IS THE GOAT! Have not met a more caring and solicitous professor yet. Lectures are kind of a yap session, but you have the autonomy to choose whether to go or not. He was honestly so concerned about his students' well-being, apologizing profusely for having lectures in the COB1 auditorium even though it was completely out of his control :(

Merg the GOAT! None of the lectures were mandatory and I only attended exams and finals. Only 2 homeworks a week and gives a very generous curve on the final (+20-30%). Very caring and understanding of students, great at explaining concepts/problems, and extremely knowledgeable about chemistry.

Professor Merg was the goat! His lectures are not mandatory, but the practice questions done during lecture really help you understand the material, as he will go through them step by step with the class. He was also extremely understanding and encouraging. Overall, a great dude who has goated fits, likes tennis, and is passionate about chemistry.

Professor Merg is the best! His lectures were clear and insightful, and he was always accessible outside of class, whether it was for office hours or appointments. He always reminded us to study and do the smartwork in order to prepare for the midterms and ACS final. His grading criteria is clear and he drops your lowest midterm and lab grades.

Professor Merg is such a good professor and you can tell that he is passionate about chemistry. I enjoyed his class and his lectures. No quizzes but 3 midterms and final. He is very accessible out of office hours and I like how he runs his lectures with practice questions during them. Would take again!
Super patient with his students and always willing to meet outside of office hours. Awesome prof
Andrea is actually the GOAT of chem. Super clear and cool and helped a lot during office hours. Hated the subject, stayed for the professor.

Professor Merg was very passionate and enthusiastic about chemistry. His lectures were clear and helped with understanding the topic. He was always willing to answer questions in class. He also offered extra credit multiple times, which helped as there were not many assignments. Every exam was also curved significantly.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: W professor, very accessible and easy to ask him questions. Also he curves a lot if you do bad on your exams. For us he also dropped one of the midterms and I went from an 80 to an 89% (which Merg counted as an A) through doing well on the final while doing poorly on the midterms

Professor Merg is one of the best professor! he is very caring, sweet, kind, and in general the best! He has lots of patients and by that, I mean A LOT! If you have the chance to take him plz do! u won't regret :)
Hes awesome and goes above and beyond to help us. Chemistry is not easy but he is extremely helpful during office hours which are very accessible. One of the best professors Ive had.

First off starting my freshman year was challenging with Covid. Chemistry is already a challenging class, professor Merg went out of his way to offer office hours before and after class also days before the final. He gave constant reminders on work, his lectures were clear and recorded. If I can take his class I would again.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I truly believe Professor Merg is one of the most caring and fair professors. Although this was an online class, I feel that I learned a lot. He always extended lectures and listened to the concerns of his students and went above and beyond to ensure that students were understanding the curriculum. He also reminded students to always try their best

If you have him as your General Chemistry 1 teacher, you are going to be so grateful. I had him in his first time ever teaching a college course and all I can say is that he is very caring and helps you no matter what. He went to the extent of curving the final exam, not once, not twice, but three times. He is Professor Andrea "The Goat" Merg.
He looked quite, but when you get to know him, he's very open person. Too bad, he left. I wish I could take his class again.
Does not use readings or material assigned for class in tests. Makes learning boring. His voice is so monotone. However I did enjoy labs and identifying specimens

Told us not to use technical jargon - yet he uses it constantly in his lectures.  Not sure where he gets his content from because its not from the textbook he assigns, and he doesn't have slides.  Also, very triggering content in regards to race which he doesn't seem to care about. Doesn't try to understand where students are coming from.

This class was my first college course so I didn't really put much effort into studying and attending class regularly. Labs are crucial which is the only reason I did not do well. Tests are fairly difficult because of awkward multiple choice wording.

He seems very interested in anthropology. Some people find him dry because of his monotone voice. He expects a lot from students, although I find it refreshing to be treated like an adult. He is stern, but very fair and actually a nice guy with good intentions. He's rare in that he actually reads what you write and gives thoughtful responses.

If you are looking for the easy teacher, he is not for you.  He is really tough grader and the class is really challenging!!! I am not majoring in Anthro but I needed his class to complete my credit/degree. He curved the grade, so that's why I passed his class.

He is seriously the most awful teacher ever. Don't take his class unless you really need to. Right now only 10% of the class is passing out of 200 people in the class. He does not explain things well and teaches his introductory classes like upper division classes. The does not teach at a level that people with no prior knowledge could ever undersa
Just come to the class, pay attention, taking notes, and come to his offc. hours--and then you'll be fine. I got As twice...

No judging!!! I learned a lot from his class, I know science is hard, and it is always hard. So, it's not suprising for me anymore. Mr. Stallmann is a hard grader, very tough, but fair. I really enjoyed his class.

At first, I though he was a mean person. After I talked to him in person, he's actually a good guy, family oriented and understanding. His class is super hard, because he wants us to think and not just memorizing. I recommend his class!!!

Don't take his class unless you really have too. He wants every one in the class to fail. Does not help much when u ask for help and gets mad if u ask him a question that he already answered. The notes he gives makes no sense and if u take notes in class u miss every thing he says during the lecture
Yes, it's a difficult class, but he is ready to give extra help, if needed!

Attendance is not mandatory, but it is definitely recommended. The material is very dense and there is a lot of reading - (no textbook!). Grades are not readily available, so going into the Final you're not likely to have any idea what your standing is in the class. If you are NOT a Bio or Anth major, DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS

If you are expecting an INTRO to Anthro, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Half the class failed the midterm including those who studied alot.  Everyone feels confused and if you ARE NOT AN ANTHRO major you will probably dislike this class very much.

By the time you read this, chances are his class will be drastically different. He is still learning how to teach at an introductory level and is making very good effort to help out the students. His tests will be hard unless you study VERY hard and the textbooks we had were useless. His voice puts some people to sleep very easily.Challenging class
No Comments

I took Dr. Stokes for organic chemistry online at Santa Clara University and he is an awful teacher. He is a smart guy but he does not know how to teach for the life of him. His lectures are very uninformative and he basically wants us to learn mainly by simply reading the textbook. Not a good teacher.

Stokes may not be the best teacher but oh man does he care about his students. He tried hard to get us all to pass. His team would grade the exams by the next morning! He's a fair grader and one of the best chem professors here.

This professor was amazing for ochem. The tests were challenging but if you work hard you'll get an A for sure. He is also very understanding and will offer extra credit to ensure you at least pass. He's a great guy, other professors should take note.

Prof. Stokes is a great guy and professor. You'll definitely need to read the textbook and ATTEND OFFICE HOURS. Since the lectures aren't very long and there's a ton of material, office hours are the best time to learn in depth. This class is hard, but Prof. Stokes wants you to do well. He's definitely one of the best chemistry professors at UCM.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is a very approachable & encouraging Professor with effective teaching techniques. He makes complex material EASIER to understand & provides extensive HELPFUL feedback on exams (almost immediately) & tips to help improve your learning throughout the class. With his help I was able to exceed in this class past my own expectations. STOKES ROCKS!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Attending lecture is very helpful as Dr. Stokes goes into depth of important reaction mechanisms, retrosynthesis, synthesis, and reactions. His notes he does are extremely helpful and would recommend studying those for midterms. He is willing to go over any question or problem during office hours. His midterms are fair and he is a fair grader.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Ben Stokes is a great professor he is available outside of lectures. The subject matter is difficult to understand and he makes it very clear you to know that. If you are going to take to class or need it as a requirement for your major, I suggest you begin early and not fall behind. Once you have fallen behind it may not be possible to catch up.

A teacher that is finally passionate about the actual learning of his students, FINALLY! He's such a true gem. He would respond to his emails within 12 hours, sometimes even in 30 minutes. He explains everything with just enough detail to grasp the concept. The exams were conceptual and points weren't docked if you didn't use his learning scheme 2!

Organic Chemistry is a difficult subject, Stokes makes it easier by providing in depth explanations of mechanisms, patterns in chemistry, and the underlying reasons for certain reactions. The midterms are not multiple choice for the most part, but good amount of partial credit. Grades on a curve. Thoroughly answers questions. Gives all book section

Prof. Stokes is a really genuine person who cares about your success and understanding. He ALWAYS takes time to go back over something if you ask him to. He never shows any form of disrespect, nor does he belittle you like other professors. Hes a great fit for O Chem and if I had to take the class over again I would pray that he was still teaching

Ben thoroughly goes over reaction mechanisms in class which is why it is beneficial to attend lecture as the book and the reaction mechanisms work off one another and a solid understanding of reactions and concepts will help in exams. The homework assigned were easy and other than taking time out to study the class is manageable and do-able.

Professor Stokes is an amazing teacher. Though his lectures focus more on working through the reactions, but he is usually available during office hours or by appointment to work through problems with you. He reasons through the problems that he assigns and works through them clearly and logically. He is a nice guy and really wants us to succeed.

Professor Ben is a very straightforward and clear professor. His tests are based off of his worksheet problems so all you have to do is sit down and practice. His lecture notes sum up the material extremely well and his grading is generous.

It was a good teacher. He explained everything that was going to be on the test.  I would recommend that students go to lecture, complete the bacon assignments, and really know there are the reactions.  Also takes attendance points during lecture.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Stokes was a great teacher. Very helpful inside and outside of the classroom. He wants you to succeed as long as he knows that you want to succeed and are willing to put in the hard work. Very approachable and willing to listen to your confusion in hopes of helping you learn the material. For sure recommend taking a class from him!

This class was really cool but it shows how competitive upper division classes work. If you beat the curve, you'll have a good grade. This really helped because it takes the pressure off of knowing every little thing. However, dont slack off because if you fall behind in your grade and in the lecture material, you will fail
This professor clearly knows what they're talking about and is incredibly helpful. I appreciate their efforts; they were funny, and the assignments were genuinely useful.
You don't even need to attend the lecture. Study for the exam, mostly vocab words.

Took this as a GE, and it was exactly what I wanted. All of the lecture notes are things you should study for the test, along with ALL of the vocab from the book. Easily got an A by only memorizing vocab and skimming notes a couple times. Final and midterm count for 30% of the grade each, with an essay counting for another 30. Last 10 is from disc
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The professor is great, all you need to do is pay attention, take notes of everything, and youll pass with an A or a high B+ only work needed is an midterm exam and end term exam plus a research paper. If youre not a polisci Major this class is still great. Id love to have the professor again.

He's really nice and tries not to be biased when giving lectures that would touch upon political ideology. Still have not figured out what party he is. You can just read and show up to discussion and easily pass the class.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Nicholson kept his lecture precise and discussed important topics in class. Didn't have to read the book as much only before midterms. Study bold face terms and read textbook on Theories as there is usually a question or two on the exam. Make sure to go to office hours and talk to your ta. Participate in discussion!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests? Not many--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Nicholson is very by the book. The class has no surprises and is quite standard. Take notes during lectures, have one midterm paper, and two tests. There is alot of material. I would reccommend doing study guides as you go over the material, as doing it even a month before the test can take a long time. Study and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Nicholson is very knowledgeable in his profession. He is engaging during his lectures, and adds a bit of comedy to a subject some would find dry (I do not because I am a poli sci major). By far my favorite professor this semester as a freshmen. Highly recommend! Easy class as long as you attend lecture to take notes and study vocab.

He definitely knows poli sci well. His lectures can be dry at time, but he has a good sense of humor. His midterms are easy as long as you like written exams. They include mc, short answer, and an essay. Midterms mainly based off of terms from book. You have to make a point to be noticed in class. Overall good professor and a pretty easy class.

He is such a great teacher, very clear and always there to help you! However, you have to pay attention do your reading and learn the vocab. to pass the class. The class alone is very essay. I LOVED IT!

If you took AP GOV, or have basic understanding of gov't, you don't really need to show up to the lecture to pass with adecent grade, but once you go you won't want to miss, hi's lectures are super interesting, and since his class is almost always less than half full he sometimes gives extra FINAL points during lectures. GREAT Professor!
best polisci professor

He is really easy as long as you go to the lectures. Discussions are really not necessary. As long as you know a few things about the topic the class overall is easy. The tests aren't too hard as long as you know the terms.
He keeps lectures interesting! I'm not into politics and I enjoyed class. Everything is made clear. Great professor.

Stephen Nicholson is a great professor, he adds humor into his lectures but at the same time makes sure that everyone knows whats going on by asking if there are any questions. Attendance is mandatory in discussions. Going to lecture is very important because he doesn't post the slides up and he emphasizes what may be on the test during lecture.

The class is overall easy as long as you attend the lectures. He DOES NOT put the lecture slides up on the internet. If you go to class then you don't even really need the book. Role is not taken in lecture but it is in discussion. The tests are generally easy too!

Amazing professor whose passion for the subject shines through in every lecture. She explains the material with exceptional clarity, making concepts easily graspable. Her approach to the course sets clear guidelines for success, she actually wants you to do good. Very knowledgeable and willing to provide assistance to ensure you thrive

As a recent graduate, this was the very first upper-division class I took. It was straightforward, and I was provided with all the information needed to succeed. Dr. Ge may appear serious, but he is very caring and always there to help students during their struggles. Would recommend taking the class and attending office hours with Dr. Ge.

I graduated a few years ago, but Dr. Ge's class was one of my favorite courses in college. This is a tough course, but it's clear she wants her students to succeed. Definitely attend office hours, Dr. Ge was always helpful in sitting down to frame things in new ways and draw out mechanisms. Overall, I absolutely recommend taking a course with her!

Bio 110: Dr. Ge is clear and fair about grading expectations. She understands the material well and is approachable for questions. Key words are very important to understand for success - not only for the sake of this class and grading - but because they can be applied to other science classes. I recommend going to her office hours frequently.

One of my favorite professors. Appearing serious, she sincerely cares about students. She suggested many useful studying habits that helped me a lot. She held the standard high, but gave lots of extra credit opportunities. I graduated already, and I learned the most from her class. Don't know why there are low ratings for her. She is amazing!
Hardest professors I ever had and does not explain topics well and is often cofusing
She is one of the most difficult professors I ever had and does not explain topics well
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: She is a very tough professor to have. She is sometimes not clear and will discourage student when not understanding a concept.
Professor Ge is not an easy professor. The exams are very hard. Ask for detailed information on exams. Worth most of your grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She goes over slides extremely fast and pay very close attention to detail she will put the most specific information on exams. Its not an easy A
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Ge is a very unprofessional professor and speaks to students without thinking. She is also a very tough grader. Good luck in this class

This professor is a tough grader and acts unprofessional towards students. The class overall is tough but with this professor make sure to take notes before lecture she goes overs slides really fast less than a minute per slide.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Bio 110 is the first upper div class I have ever taken and was challenging. You have to go to office hours, and I regret not going sooner. She can be a but intimidating but she is caring. Her grading scale is pretty normal, her midterms and finals are hard you really gotta study. Her lectures are super organized and nice which was helpful.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is enthusiastic and inspiring during lectures. It is a hard class. Lots of readings and quizzes. But I learned a lot from this class.

Ge is not necessarily a hard grader as everything in graded based off of keywords. Every question is nearly identical to what is on previous exams and the study guide. If you understand everything in the slides and can repeat the concept/teach it, the exams are a breeze.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: test heavy, harsh grader, they look for key words and if those are not on there they give a zero, the class is not curved. there are no study guides provided for midterms reads off the slides
She was awesome, sad to see her go but she went to further her education at another university.

She is an amazing teacher and a very sweet person. She is understanding, patient and caring. Kristina's lectures are interactive and easy to understand and follow. Her grading is in every way reasonable. Spring 2022 was unfortunately her last semester at UC Merced but in case she comes back don't miss out on taking one of her classes.

Kristina has her own way of running a class which allows her students to learn more effectively. Along with that, exams have a group portion which can help your grade. The only catch is that her midterms are not during normal class times. It is unfortunate that she is leaving, but I am glad to have been in her class for her last semester at UCM.
She is one of the best professors I've ever had.

I love Kristina. She actually cares about learning and is extremely sweet as well as knowledgeable. She is clear with her course- just do the work honestly and you should be good. I wish she could teach more of my classes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the best professors I've had. She genuinely cares about her students' learning. Put in some effort & you should be good. I used to hate physics, now I'm considering a minor in physics.

Great professor that cares about you. Her lectures are interesting and make learning physics fun. Her test and quizzes are related to lectures and very fair. Midterms and finals are easy if you study and put in the time. The overall experience was fun and helpful. I would recommend you take her for any physics class!

She's a good professor. Attend all classes and do homework help. Feel free to ask questions she is very happy to answer. Practice exams are explained during discussion. There is group exam in midterms which can improve grade if group exam score is higher than individual score. A good grade requires some effort.

She's a great professor that cares about her students. Her teaching methods are unique and makes the overall experience in teaching physics fun. Her lectures are interactive base and fun. Midterms and finals are easy if you study and put the time. The overall experience in physics is fun and interesting. I would recommend you take her for phyiscs 9

Hated physics with a passion. She is on of those professors that will go above and beyond to make sure you understand the material. One of the best professors on this campus. Tests are difficult but a doable because she actually teaches very well.
She has her own way of teaching that makes you actually interested and informed about the material being taught. The kind of person that you know has a pure heart unlike other professors.
Great teacher !
Looking back at Lecture Notes and written homework is what really helps when learning new concepts. Look at them as soon as they're available

One of the hardest professors I have had but also one the best. Best physics professor at Merced. She is very helpful during lectures and in office hours. If you don't dedicate time to study for this class don't expect to pass. A very hard class with her but it is doable because she actually teaches well.

I absolutely hate physics. Shes an alright professor. Gives a 3% curve at the end lf the semester (an 87% would be an A- if you didnt understand). So glad Im done with physics. But if you like it, or even worse, its your major, I think you would like her as your professor. Best of luck
Great teacher! One of the best Physics professors UC Merced has to offer.

He's an overall great professor. Something to note is that he's thorough & strict about his grading rubric & requirements when it comes to work, both useful & stressful. He goes on these rants & takes up time from class. Straightforward with instructions but loops around so it's easy to lose track of instructions, paying attention is crucial.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: He doesn't allow you to see your grades or any of the scores you got on essays. No feedback or anything, just a mid-term and final grade. No constructive criticism on any work, and he fails to remember his own syllabus, so beware of that.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: HE IS HORRIBLE. He said that he never received my final when I specifically submitted it twice to make sure he got it. Our final was a 12+ essay. I worked on it all semester just for him to not even grade it. He tells his students their grades at the end of the semester, there is no way to check your grades during the semester. Never take him
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The class itself isnt hard but prof habecker makes it unenjoyable. He is very passive and makes it clear that he has very little respect for his students. I would avoid his classes but if you cant then participation is key. If you talk in class and interact with him outside of class you will do better in the course.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: He focuses on how to teach writing. He is a good professor. He is a terrible person. He should be your last resort. Ew I regret picking him.

Does not even tell you grades until the end of the semester. Multiple occasions where he did not explain the instructions so students reached out but instead he sent aggressive announcements. Only knew my grade for my assignments at the end of the semester so did not know what to improve on or what to change. He also will pick on students

He demands respect but fails to give any. He reacts with emotion and that emotion is hateful, humiliating, belittling, distressing, and the list goes on. Lacks the common knowledge of teaching with one example being talking negatively about a student to the class. Overall horrible experience, thought about dropping but did not have the option.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: His style of teaching is way too demeaning when it comes to reviewing your work. He has no issue calling out students in or outside of class about not meeting his expectations. However, he failed to share what those were through lack of a syllabus. Not worth the rude and unnecessary comments towards sensitive subjects and you as a writer.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Doesnt teach formulaic, textbook garbage. He teaches how to think, question, explore, and perceive the world. Those are not passive activities, its engaging, its unconformable, and its preconception breaking, BUT it is vital wisdom. My writing quality doubled. Doesnt show grades b/c he doesnt care about them, participate and you will succeed.

On week 11, no syllabus, no grade yet! Emails passive-aggressive updates about things you would have known about if there was a syllabus. Has called students out in class and made them explain themselves to all of us. That is just the beginning of it all. Has 0 respect for any1. LV of difficulty is 4, due to not knowing where I stand in the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He grades personally, not based on your work. He has no empathy, even for a class with only 7 students. I can see how he is a great professor, if he likes you. He takes some random things very personally, even for common questions. He has a lot of knowledge to share, maybe in person he's better...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: This is by far the worst professor I have ever met. Disrespecting students, no syllabus was given at the beginning of the semester, barely reply to emails and unorganized. I never understood why I lost the marks I used to lose. I hated his class, I hated the day I have to attend his classes. If I would give anyone a serious advice I would say AVOID

Professor Habecker has his own style of teaching from the other Writing 001 teachers. For one, he does not really like going by the book. Instead, he tries to implement the student's interests into the curriculum. Most of the bigger projects are group-based so you won't be set to fail on your own. The readings are engaging but be ready to discuss.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: He seems like a good person but has a lot of work. Didn't really help me with my writing or I don't see it. He does not tell you your grade after you turn something in which is very frustrating because you want to know what to change or not for the next assignment
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hes a great professor, and has a lot of wisdom. He isns so much focused on rhetoric or arguments as much as he is focused on teaching you how to write. He does however require you to actually put in work, read the readings, and to use your head. As long as you engage in the class like this you will do well.
Great professor, he really enjoys his job and understands what is needed from him. He's so much help that I'm taking an independent study course with him. I'm excited for next semester.
Expects a lot from you, but you also learn a lot through the year. He is a tough grader but gives lots of feedback

Prof. Masclin isn't too great of a professor. The teaching is subpar, making the lectures useless. To make matters worse, he makes large assignments due on the exact same day as exams, forcing you to prioritize one or the other.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: I'm only taking ESS 001 to fulfill a requirement for GE. However, the way Professor Masclin teaches is very poor, to the point where the material he presents never ends up being related to the exams. Attendance is mandatory in everything, and he has very bad communication with his TAs. It feels similar to a middle school class, so try to avoid it.
