The professor was cool! Attendance was not mandatory for lecture but is mandatory for discussion. There are no midterms or finals! Quizzes are conducted online during discussion but there are take-home quizzes on canvas and ofc, there are homework and group projects (all of which are very easy!)

Friendly and has interest in lessons. Lessons plans are basically reused and sometimes he goes off schedules. Lessons given from modules and tests are either done at the end or beginning of discussions. Has multiple group projects that do not change unless you ask so choose good groups.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: He is passionate in his lectures and genuinely cares about the planet-super cool and nice dude.

No finals or large exams. Weekly tests in discussion section covering topics from lecture. Some group homework, individual easy presentation.
Lectures became boring after awhile.

Professor does have a French accent so sometimes you have to try to listen extra hard. No major exams, just quizzes after every module. My class had a TA but he was suppose to explain to us the formulas but instead gave us answers with little explanation. The professor however does stress that you can come to office hours for help

The class has no midterms or final exams, instead its replaced with weekly quizzes and test. VERY work heavy some assignments short of time, some takes hours. (Green minutes weekly, HWs)  3 Projects (infographic video and podcast) lecture not mandatory, discussion yes b/c attendance, unorganized when it comes to modules, grading is used by rubric.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Practically an online class, every week you have 2 homework assignments, 2 quizzes, and a group assignment to take and MUST read the eBook in order to understand the homework and tests. The quizzes sometimes have extremely specific questions based on the readings and are mostly what affects your grade. I ended with an 89% so I'm a little mad but ye
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: It was a pretty easy course. Most of the class is graded off projects and by TA's. The lectures are interactive. There are small quizzes and tests every week based on the lectures. There was no official final test. You just have to do the small activities to pass the class.
he's an esay teacher. I say take his class. He's easy going and understanding. Take his class.
The class itself was not interesting for me. The professor is really nice and is understanding. He is accessible outside the classroom. He does have a French accent that makes him hard to understand.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: He makes the effort to make lectures as interesting as possible. He gives about 3 assignments per week which include lecture preparations, green missions, & a small quiz to assess what was learned. I promise they're easy and simple assignments! There are no exams which is why the amount of work he gives is reasonable. Your work is your final grade

Professor Masclin is someone who respects his students and is accessible outside of class. If you have an any questions hell reply as soon as he can. His assignments are not hard you just have to keep up with the class. As long you keep up and do the work you will be fine.

The course material itself was not hard, but the presentation was dismal. Masclin is very disorganized and lacks proper communication w/ his students + TAs. No one had any idea what was going on in this class because every week he would change our syllabus. At one point no one knew when any of our exams would be. Good person, but not a good prof.
He makes you work for your grade but if you study and do the work and ask for help when you need it, you should be fine .

Very helpful professor, willing to help. He is very easy to meet up with outside of class. There was a few group projects but they are very easy to finish. This class is a easy course to complete for your science GE. Overall he's a great professor, but be warned he has a French accent so sometimes it difficult to understand him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Mostern has really interesting lectures and I really enjoyed the way she teaches history, which is more narrative. Lots and lots of maps and art. She is incredibly knowledgeable about the subject and meeting with her outside of class to talk about my essays helped SO SO SO much with the topic and structure and sources.

There is an old saying: "The buck stops here." I don't know what she is like in a regular lecture class, but in our class she maintained an environment where students predated upon each other and even non students were targeted. Her administration resulted in two semesters where our work was incomplete.  On a positive note, I learned life lessons.

As a history major, this class was absolute torture. She goes on tangents that are irrelevant to the topics we are supposed to be learning. She spends half the class talking about random things, and then rushes and keeps you after class trying to finish the lecture. Shes a passionate historian but a HORRIBLE lecturer. I learned nothing in her class
Ruth is fantastic, on a personal level as well as a professor. Not the easiest when grading but you end up learning more than you hoped. She loves the subjects she teaches beyond comparison!

Definitely great World History, so sry but I don't know why people are complaining about not understanding her. Her courses are informative & they really give you a global scope (hence the maps duh)of history of the past 14k years. Don't believe, ask her about Catal Huyuk, Renaissance technological advancement, & migration of peoples. Class rank A

World History is my major and all I can say is this class is torture. She is a really nice person but he worst lecturer. She will stay on the same slide for ages and the only thing that is on the slides are questions so you cant even really take comprehensive notes. The test was a joke as well because she doesn't make clear what will be on it.
Boring. Map fetish. Stays on same slide all of class

She becomes boring because she gets off topic too much. That makes it difficult to pay attention in class or to know what exactly she wants us to get out of lecture.Honestly I stopped going to class after a while. Good thing she gives outlines for the final.
Shes kinda boring and very obsessed with maps, but i think its an interesting class. she is pretty good at teaching ...
Kinda boring but it wasnt that bad. The books were HELLA expensive and you didnt even need them. Other than that, she was pretty okay.
Good but a lot of reading. Very understanding and helpfull at office hours. Work load for test studying isn't that bad

I think she's really interesting.  I kind of despise history, but for a history prof. she's pretty cool.  She doesn't just give dates of this and that; she points out the interesting things about different cultures.

Yeah, its boring, yeah, she is obsessed with maps, but when you pay attention it can be intresting.  She goes off on tangents from time to time about random things which is annoying and boring, but when she stays on topic she isn't half bad
boring class and i hate it. ughhh

she is so boring. i am rating her right now in her class while she is lecturing. and sh ehas a weird fetish with maps. she needs to make her lectures more interesting. right now, half the class is asleep.

Pretty easy class. Didn't buy the book and cause you get quizzed on slides. Show up for class and get easy points. Lots of extra credit opportunities. If you're looking for an easy A class choose Maples and you're good.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She just reads the slides to you for a few weeks, then you show up and get graded on whether you watch your fellow classmates presentations. Easy. Boring, but easy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Funny teacher. 4 quizzes (quite easy, multiple choice), 1 research poster presentation with a partner, and the final. Quizzes and final are off her lecture material; rarely need the textbook at all. Many extra credit opportunities.

I LOVE taking classes with Dr. Maples. She's passionate about what she teaches, and she wants you to be too. Her classes and quizzes are simple. Got to lecture, copy down the slides word for word, read over them before the quiz, get an A. Same goes for Final. Theres also 1 group project. DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK. EVERYTHING COMES FROM THE SLIDE.
Just do the work. She's funny and enthusiastic about her work.

If you want an easy A and a GPA booster then definitely take her classes, but if you want to actually learn then choose other professors.  Quizzes (4 of them) are very easy since they are based directly off lecture slides and then there's a presentation on any topic of your choice. She has interesting stories & good energy, but doesn't teach much.

I'm submitting a review halfway through the semester, because she's already stopped teaching  we skimmed the textbook and the rest of the class from here on out is student presentations. I feel like I've learned nothing, which is a huge let-down for a Human Sexuality class. Single-bullet slides, only vocab. and stats, and surface-level discussion.
Awesome Professor

If you are taking this class to learn psychology, take another class. She posts dumb lecture slides and most of the class is spent identifying discrimination and how to stop it. Quizzes are stupid and make no sense. For teaching a class on prejudice, she says a lot of problematic things. She is an interesting person, but not a goos teacher.

Inga is VERY interesting and has lots of stories to tell. She's very opinionated and old-fashioned.  Much of what she she says is debatable or wrong, which leads to heated discussions/rants. Class is not difficult, but lecture slides are unavailable online, so take notes. Quizzes often don't make sense, but mostly come straight from lecture slides.
very easy to get an A just go to class and listen. her assignments are easy and interesting

Amazing teacher, really interesting and it was fun to be in her class. Tests are based off lecture, definitely would want another class with her. Highly recommend taking her if possible, learned a lot about positive psych.

One of the easiest classes I ever had. Passed it without buying the book. Quizzes and test all come from lecture slides. Shes nice, funny, and makes class interesting. Shes simple, organized, and straight forward. You can't go wrong with one of her classes.

Easy class. All of the questions for the quizzes and the final are taken from the lecture slides (which are from the book), therefore, intensely reading the book wasn't required. You do give a speech and a final presentation, in which some people may get scared, but these activities were fun! I would definitely take another class with her.

Great professor! Out of all my psychology classes, I must say she is my favorite professor. She is really interesting and her quizzes are pretty simple they are based on the notes that she gives us in lecture

She is probably the most supportive teacher I have ever had. I have always enjoyed acting, but her classes made it fun and accessible. She gave a ton of time and feedback to help us improve and helped us carry our skills over from acting to real-life experiences, such as interviews. Would 100% recommend.
great teacher, just don't miss class.

She is quite literally one of the best professors around the campus and cares heavily for her students. Samuelson is super passionate in what she does and you can see it everyday. I was enrolled in two of her classes and both of them have been fun. If you are an introvert, GASP 41A might seem intimidating helps you get out of your comfort zone.
A super fun class! My goal was to learn more theory to apply to songwriting and I definitely have! Thanks Professor Samuelson!
Great professor that is actually passionate about her work.

She's awesome! I love her. Definitely recommend her GASP 041A. It gets you out of your comfort zone and helps you grow as a person. It requires you to do a group performance and individual one. She gives constructive feedback because she only wants the best for you!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hands down best professor I've ever had. Her class is challenging with tons of homework and tough quizzes but besides this, her class is so fun and she offers extra credit! She is kind and truly inspirational. She is also very knowledgeable on her subject and bakes the best cookies! 10/10 would recommend.

Professor Samuelson makes it POSSIBLE for you to pass her GASP 2 class! She offers as much extra credit as you need to pass her class. Homework is pretty heavy as long as you stay on top of it. Quizzes are given once a week and can be hard at times so make sure to study for those. Her lectures are amazing and fun! Everyone is jamming out to music

Professor Samuelson is one of the best professors I've had. She is always in good spirits and you can tell that she enjoys her job immensely . Her lectures have all the necessary information that show up on the tests. Although she sometimes give pop quizzes if you show up to classes, you should be able to pass. 10/10 would take her class again.
Samuelson is an amazing professor, her lectures are wonderful and you can tell she is an expert in what she grades and teaches. Will always give you good feedback and her office is always open.
A true gem here at UC Merced! She always comes to class in a great mood and gives it her all! There is A LOT of work, but she guides you through every step of the way! Highly recommend!

Honestly, this is one of the greatest professors I have ever had. The course may seem difficult but, it isn't hard to achieve that A. In addition, Samuelson goes out her way to make you achieve that goal by giving great feedback and thorough explanation of every lecture. Brightest soul out here at UC MERCED. You won't regret taking her.

Professor Samuelson is amazing, Honestly. This class is about American History through musicals and it is perfect. Sadly it is the last semester she is ever teaching this class. In class, her lectures are laid out nicely so everyone can understand and if someone doesn't understand she goes above and beyond to help them out! Greatly enjoy this prof.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Hard - really hard - especially if you don't have good ears. Also: reallllly fast class, it goes by like a lightning bolt. comment: Hands down the best teacher I had all semester! Her lectures were so engaging and participation was always fun. comment: Professor Shanley is indeed a knowledgeable person who genuinely cares for his students well-being and education. comment: Was kinda rude and not as understanding. He may have been more helpful if you were more of someone who likes to participate and engage heavy during discussion. He is always looking on ways to improve himself. He had a tough time with his personal life this year, but with his perseverance he made it work throughout the whole semester. rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Shanley is without a doubt one of the best professors that I have ever had, he genuinely cares for his students and treats them with respect.  His knowledge seems to be infinite and the lectures are amazing. I highly recommend taking his class. He is encouraging, understanding and overall just a good person. Highly encourage you to take his class.

I think he's a good person but he wasn't a good teacher. Lots of our class time was dedicated to trauma dumping instead of teaching. He was unclear about what he wanted from assignments and changed the grading weights almost every week. Success in this class was dependent on having a good high school English teacher.

I really liked him as a person, but while he was going through a tough time it felt like a lot to have him trauma dumping on us for over an hour at times. It also kinda sucked being told by him that we weren't getting his best self and while he had good reasons, hearing that didn't make me feel great about the class. Really nice guy though :)
Great professor! He is very easy to talk to and super understandable. Def recommend a class with him!
Honestly amazing professor. He actually cares and is always available after class. Learned a lot overall!

comment: This professor made it difficult to learn the material, and graded harshly. I would not take this professor again.
very rude and acts superior. Made it tough to learn because I didn't want to ask him questions.

Attendance is mandatory but you can miss like 3 classes and your grade won't change much. Super caring professor about your work and will help you throughout his office hours. The class has such a fun atmosphere around that it makes our experience enjoyable. No final exam just a final paper.

He's the man to put it simply always brings the energy. Think of how Neil DeGrasse Tyson speaks you'll be pretty attentive. Very nice dude the only thing that kinda sucks but you'll get used to pretty quick is these quick writes in the beginning of the class its like 5 minutes of continuous writing with no talking the hand hurts man.

This professor is very honest and tells you what he expects from you. It's not a hard class. He is very helpful and always has office hours. He expects a lot from you because he believes you can do it. If you're having a problem with something, just email him, he is a very understanding professor.

comment: Professor Shanely is a great professor. He is very helpful on the final research paper and he cares about his students. Professor Shanely give great feedback which was helpful for me in his class.

comment: There is a lot of writing in this course, but the professor does well overall.

comment: She didn't use the lecture time to actually lecture and she would use it to answer questions, as if it was her own personal office hours. She was also very unorganized and didn't even know where the Smartworks was located on Canvas.

Learned absolutely nothing from her. She went off on different tangents connecting her personal life to chemistry and then talking more about her life. It was very hard to follow what she was saying most of the time. She knows what she's talking about but I've heard she is very hard to reach outside class and ignored emails from students sometimes.

comment: If you need someone to actually lecture, Deborah's class is not the class to take.  She runs a flipped classroom where you need to watch the videos on lessons on your own time and come to class with questions.  I suck at this and if you do too find a different professor.  She cares but success is really dependent on how well you teach yourself.
Terrible, no lectures what so ever just YouTube videos. She's an absolute joke of a professor, youll find out real quick that the real professor of this class is Organic Chemistry Tutor.

comment: I would recommend taking this course elsewhere. Same professor has taught chem 010 for a few semesters and will teach it again next semester. The professor could do better on teaching students by showing how to work out problems and focus more time on the problems rather than defining terms. The program used in the class is awful it doesn't help.

I'm not sure why she comes to class. She has slides but doesn't use them to teach which in my opinion is ridiculous. She does know what she's talking about and I do respect her for it but she only ever answers questions in her class. Treating class time as office hours.

If you want genuine and good teaching, do not take any of her classes. She does not teach, she explains questions horribly with dumb metaphors that don't make sense. She has slides that she doesn't even use. She has favoritism, her office hours are useless. It's an hour talking about nonsense or horrible explanations. Gave a test a day before break
doesn't teach at all, her lecture is just like office hours, answering questions. Doesn't present, has no structure, reminders or due dates for homework and midterms.

Her grading at the end of the semester is unfair she does not explain the curve at the end and curves everyone differently. Be careful if you are 0.50% away from passing she will curve some select students but not all. I suggest to take this at a CC. She is a nice professor and has a good way of teaching but she is not fair.

Where do I begin. She grades attendance, yet I vividly remember last semester her explaining a concept about electrochemistry and how some specific thing is not necessary to know, yet she spend 30 minutes out of the 50 min lecture explaining that very concept. This idea repeats a lot and her actual lectures is just 5min yt vid not the 50 min class.
Overall she is a great professor. She goes over worksheets and answers every question if you go to class. Attendance is mandatory but overall she a good professor

She is super sweet and kind, but the class itself was not great. Lectures were based on worksheets that counted as attendance. They were helpful, but they were collected and not given back to study. The 3 midterms were ok, but ACS final was extremely difficult. The 3rd midterm was a few days before the final, so it was very rushed.

if you try then i feel like lair is there to try to help you succeed. this class was hard just because of the information but her lectures were really helpful so go to them if you want to pass!!!! exams are hard but if you go to lectures, review worksheets and study then you'll be fine. i love this lady she is very kind and caring

Awesome exam prep. Dedicates full lecture day to exam review, assigns useful study guides, opens old assignments for viewing to study. I always knew what to expect on tests and felt confident.
Lectures sometimes hard to follow but fun and interesting. Definitely go to discussion and office hours to get a full understanding of concepts.

Profesora Virginia took over profesora Yolanda 1/4 into the course, and although she was learning with us as it was her first time teaching the course, she did amazing. She covered everything that was on the exams very well, and was even willing to explain last minute topics right before the exam would open. She was very understanding & helpful.

must speak Spanish in class. Amazing lectures and explains things very well. Always some sort of extra credit. Mandatory attendance. very good study guides. Will grade most late assignments full credit. stay on top of the MCdougal thingy. Other than that pretty easy class. Very understanding and always ready to help.
If you care about your learning and academics, take virginia. SHE'S AMAZING

Great professor!! Complete the homework and put in extra effort into the papers and you should be fine. She may be a tough grader when it comes to grammar and punctuation, but she's very approachable and kind.

comment: Profesora Virginia is a really nice teacher and passionate in teaching. She really wants you to learn a lot. Otherwise just write decent essays, which she grades really hard. For essays, go to office hours.

comment: Great professor, very passionate about the class. Great interaction with the students. You will succeed if you do your part. You can do it!
Great Professor! Loves teaching, can be very repetitive but that is always good! She can be a little boring but paying attention is critical!

comment: Wonderfully odd and yet insightful professor! Her methods may seem weird, however she is incredibly passionate. Lot's of hw and difficult tests. But you can do it!!!
Eh she's a little wierd but overall she's a good professor. Her work is not that hard though she assigns HW almost every week. But, she's a hard grader when it comes to essays!
She's a great teacher, funny, helpful.
ok
Excellent  teaching methods.
No Comments
participate in class!!! thats way key. she's a really good teacher and really helps you learn and understand the material.
Always speaks in Spanish. MUST ATTEND CLASS EVERYDAY though. There is only one exam and final, but quiz weekly. Homework is easy.

Professor Moyes has interesting lectures and includes topics that can change how you think about the world around you. She is passionate about her work and you can tell she wants to help students succeed. She assigns an essay every week and you have to read various articles for the essays. As long as you put in the effort you'll pass the class.

Although professor Moyes is very enthusiastic during her lectures, her directions on assignments aren't clear enough and gives a ton of readings. She is also a tough grader when it comes to the papers she assigns. I would not recommend taking her classes to anyone who isn't an ANTH major/minor.

comment: Do NOT ever take this class. Worst class I have ever taken. Instead just spin a wheel and pick any random class other than this.

Awesome. Super energetic professor and great for archaeology classes. She WILL call you out for being on your phone or pick you for a question if she feels like you might not be paying attention. Make sure you do the readings - its obvious if you don't. Fair grader and fun classes.
Lots of reading for homework. Shes a good human being but not when it comes to grading for her class. She expects everything to be perfect. Dont recommend her class at all, unless you want to suffer.

Professor Moyes is a really fun teacher and would always be enthusiastic about teaching. comment: You will work on multiple papers and readings. She does grade your papers quite hard. But as long as you do your work and show that you care she wont give you such a hard time.

comment: The class was good, though in the beginning she talked about her issues with history majors. She dislikes that use of electronics.
The best professor I have ever had! Just show up to lecture and everything on the slides are on the test. She also gives extra credit and tries to make the course fun for everybody.

comment: Holley Moyes was a hilarious professor to take. She is extremely passionate about archaeology which definitely shows. She can be confusing at times and the tests can be difficult but I couldn't imagine taking this course with anyone but Holley since I have no interest in anthropology.

Great professor who is very enthusiastic about the subject. The class was not easy but it was fair when it comes to grading. Only reason why I gave an average helpfulness is she is a very busy professor and can be hard to reach outside of class and she will not be at office hours during her scheduled time unless she knows someone is waiting for her
This professor is awesome, she definitely knows her stuff and encourages students to be excited about learning.

Holley is one of the best professors I have ever had. She is so energetic and funny! Even if you are not interested in the topic it's easy to pay attention. As far as studying goes as long as you go to class and pay attention you will do just fine.She is very easy to talk to as well if you are having a problem. Pay attention to power points.
Holly is adorable! She makes class fun, she's super passionate, everything you could want in a professor!

UC Merced is lucky to have Prof. Moyes. Her class was engaging and she is full of positive energy and enthusiasm. Very approachable. She lectures from power points with some text use. Her academic research: the Maya and Maya cave archaeology, awesome :)
Overall, she is a good professor I am taking her WRI001, and I registered for WRI010 because she really does care about her students.

Her class is generally easy, and you'll likely pass it with an okay grade even if you do the bare minimum. There's A LOT of reading during the first half of the semester. comment: She does give out readings every week but they are usually very easy readings. And she starts off hard and throughout the semester it gets easier so you have the opportunity to focus on other classes too. She grades really well and she makes lectures really fun. The discussion

comment: She is probably the best Writing teacher here at UCM. She genuinely cares for her students and gives really great feedback. She will help you thrive and make your writing become much more effective. Definitely, you will have to work for your grade. She is not a tough grader though.

Honestly, one of the greatest professors I have ever had. She is so caring and loving about her students and about writing. I would recommend going to office hours if you need any additional help, and she will gladly help you!
Great professor,and very understanding. Going to office hours helps. Beware of group projects.
She is great and understands the work load of students so she gives lots of time for assignments
She's an amazing professor, really understandable. It is easy to pass her class if you are on top of your things!

Great professor! She is very understanding and knowledgeable. Her weekly homework consists of a "Reading Response" which is a 2-page essay and a  "Journal Entry". She gives very detailed feedback that actually leads to you becoming a better writer. She geniunely cares about her students.
She's so understanding. I wish all my professors were like her.
Take her! She's awesome, fun, and not a super harsh grader!

Ms. Alonso has to be one of my favorite teachers. She helps a lot when you ask and if you attend her office hours, she cares about you more than just how you're doing in her class. She is extremely organized and cares about her students immensely.

One word, Outstanding. Ms. Alonso knows her what she is doing and is super organized. She is very understandable and will help you to write amazing papers. Probably one the best writing proffessors here at UCM.

Fairly easy class w/ her. Just go to class every time since participation & attendance matter and do the work and you should be good. I definitely recommend this teacher! Fair amount of work, easy grader, and is very easygoing. She's a brand new teacher, but is very knowledgable and her feedback is very helpful! Does not assign a lot of readings, which was great. Overall, get this professor if you can!

comment: Yeah dude this was hard but taking it remotely took a large chunk of that stress off my shoulders. High praise to the professor and algo coursework since doing well in this class improves how well you do in technical interviews
Do your own work. Miguel is very strict, so make sure to study on your own and do as everything by yourself.
This class is not hard.
Algorithm Design with Miguel is one of the hardest classes to take. Make sure to do your own work and be ready to work harder than you have ever worked before. Study, Study, Study!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I took his machine learning course, and it was the hardest class I've taken at UC Merced. Professor Miguel knows what he is talking about and expects a ton from his students, make sure you have a strong math background in linear algebra and calculus.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I was the top scoring student in Machine Learning, I did above average, but above average is a high F. This class is a full time job on it's on. Don't take this class with other CSE courses. Take this class by itself if possible. You will not pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I could not understand a word he said, or what he wrote on the board. Be wary.

One of the hardest classes at UC Merced. If you choose to take this course, make sure to attend lectures, read the book, and practice a lot. The grading is tough, and small mistakes can be costly. Lectures are not engaging and can be overwhelming at times.
This man destroyed my computer science career. I had to change my major to public health. He is a hard grader, guaranteed to fail the course. Average is low, curve is heavy.
The worst professor at merced

Miguel's lectures aren't the most engaging, his homework/lab policy is strict so don't expect 'fair' grading. He uses an automatic grader so even if one line is off you get a 0, and one instance of cheating will lead to an automatic F. Exams are long and difficult but average is low so the curve is hefty.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Strict on grading, midterm was outrageously long with a small time gap. Automatic grading could be the worst or best for you.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: If I could go back in time, I would never take this professor. The entire semester I struggled because he didn't teach properly. Throughout the semester, he hardly gave 1 example with specific values. He kept deriving equations without giving examples. This class, with him, was entirely self-learning. I recommend ANY other professor.
LECTURES ARE SUPER POINTLESS DON'T TAKE HIM.
Don't. Just don't.
The professor can't teach, he keeps talking and the homework does not reflect what is being taught in lectures. If you like self learning take this professor.
Please do not take this professor if you care about your grade. All he does is talk the entire time, and most of the time, you will be confused.
The best professor in the Physics Department at UC Merced.

He gave amazing lectures and had an amazing voice but sometimes you felt as if he was going over too much material in a single lecture. A lot of derivations and stuff for formulas so that was nice but also got a little repetive. Gave a good amount of homework but it definitely prepared you for the tests. Also a nice curve at the end of class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Sure the guys a little quirky but what Physicist isn't. Too much brain is devoted to figuring out the universe and not so much on how others perceive you. His course was very thorough and clear, and he worked through the mathematics right there with you and didn't just jump to the answer like some professors. Great course but prepare to work!!!
lectures were a repeat of the book almost word for word; examples useful, but again they are in the book. discussion sections are just working out homework issues

Only once will you be able to stay awake - the 1st day. After that endless torture of boring, monotone, useless lectures that even smart people won't be able to understand. OMG!!! read the book and prepare to be confused. This is your last warning!!!!!!
i won't recomend him. i KNOW
Very interesting discussion hours. The lectures really go deep into understanding what is happening with the math for each section
I never stay for his lecture!
He really isn't that bad, just frustrating. And on occasion a little creepy. He's trying though, I'm sure he'll get there soon (Hopefully).
It's not that he's a bad teacher, he just needs to learn to touch on topics a little faster and ditch his monotonic voice.

Honestly the worst lecturer out of Dulai's two assistant professors. Her explanations are so complicated and she moves very quickly. It honestly sounds like she's rambling the entire lecture period. She also treats grown college students as children and wastes time trying to initiate discussion between the class. Take another professor if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was genuinely the worst class I have ever taken. Whatever is stressed in the lectures or homework, ignore it because it's not going to be on the midterms. They like to pull things out of nowhere and throw the questions on there. But don't worry, there are discussion posts that can drop your grade from a 95 to and 89 if one is missed :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Taking her micro class right now &I dread going to class. Is rude when I ask for help she seems annoyed compared to when she helps other students. unorganized, constantly changing due dates its annoying. she'll change the due date last minute &wont give you additional time complete it. no study guides.have to take laptop into class to take the exam
She's alright. The class is structured in a weird way.
Best professor! She was so kind and caring. LOVED her class

This class sucked. Lots of homework, none of it helpful, and lectures felt like a waste of time. Majority of what we needed to know we were supposed to learn on our own from the textbook, and lectures only taught what they thought was important, which usually meant super basic stuff or super specific and advanced stuff. Homework was also hard.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Altered due dates constantly, continuously added quiz after quiz,(seriously, one week I had 12 quizzes) she gave no study guide, uses lock-down browser, attendance is a must, watching and commenting on videos required, so concerned with the idea you are cheating she has you bring your laptop in to class for unit quizzes using lockdown browser!? RUN
She's a great professor! She is always super kind, offers a lot of help, and is always worried about her students and their well-beings. I will miss her labs.

LOVE HER! Best science prof I have ever had. Took her Microbio class at Merced and she simplifies the material cause she wants you to actually learn. Quizzes every week online that you can quizlet but save those quizlets to study for the in person exams because it is the same questions. Can get an A if you participate and do everything on time.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: The worst class I have ever taken. I used to love Molecular Biology but then I took this class and she definitely made the experience worst.
Very disrespectful, treats all the students like children and is not a good lecturer. Avoid if you can.

She's not nice at all and treats everyone like high schoolers. Active learning lecture is useless, participation and discussions are really important to her. She's hella rude and strict, only take her if u don't have an option.

Alkhouri has the worst lectures because her explanations are either understandable or don't make sense at all. She also teaches in a way that makes the whole class feel as if they are a large group of children. She is very strict and makes students feel stupid. To survive this class do all the required work and doing practice questions on quizlet.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Alkhouri is very respectful and caring, as well as a pretty good professor. Most of your grade is homework, which is very straightforward, and you'll also have a group project and small Bio based essays. Her grading was very fair and helped answer any questions I had. Pretty easy A and a fun class.

Professor Alkhouri is one of the most inefficient and cold-hearted lecturers Ive ever had. Ive learned more from 10 minutes of reading a day compared to 60 minutes of lecture. Participation is a big deal for her, but if you dont get an answer correct when she asks, she will basically humiliate you in to the rest of class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: He is very patient and helpful. He give you a hard time as a joke, but he really cares about what students think and how they feel.

By far the best spanish professor ever! Really amazing peron as well as professor. He has answers to all your questions and does not make you feel stupid at all. Great professor. Would recomend to anyone.  He is super funny and his class is very engaging.
Definitely the best Spanish professor on campus.

Professor Valesi was a great professor keeping class fun but also challenging and engaging students in critical learning. Never a dull moment in class. I would definitely take another class with him again!
I really enjoyed this class. Professor Valesi is an unconventional class, but this why i enjoyed it so much.

In my opinion he is one of the best professors on campus. He is very genuine, attentive, and always willing to help if you are in need. His class is not like the usual boring lectures, he makes coming to class enjoyable and seem less like a chore. It is very unfortunate that he does not teach other upper division classes.

Overall a really interesting class to take part in. His eaching methods get students really involved and the classroom vibe is one that keeps you wanting to attend class. It is rare nowadays to find a professor such as himself who genuinely cares about his students.

Likes participation, turns composition into critical thinking regarding current events.  Motivates his students to "think outside the box".  Great way of teaching, does not focus much on the technical way of writing, but on the content.  Improved my writing and critical thinking skills. Hilarious, and helpful, it was a pleasure being in his class.
MUY GUAPO EL PROFESOR VALESI. El profesor más guapo de toda la universidad. También el más inspirador. Excelente clase

Professor Valesi has this young ambiance he works well with students. As my first upper division class I didn't know what to expect. I wish he would have taught more upper division classes. It is hilarious when we talk about current events. He has an unconventional way of teaching, but thats what I think makes him unique from the other professors.

Most interesting lectures I have ever had. If you are a boring, by the book person who loves structure and doesn't like unique styles of learning, then this class may not be for you. Funniest teacher ever! I loved his teaching style personally.
He makes the class very interesting. Love the way he teaches. I would take more of his classes! Best professor by far!!!
good professor, wish he would teach more upper division classes.
He is probably one of the best professors, at UC Merced. He care's about you doing well, very helpful, and most of all very funny. I really enjoyed being part of his class.
I proud to proclaim that this was my favorite class this semester!

Professor Anne is a great and caring professor who clearly cares about what she does and spreads the passion to her students. comment: Had assignments get zeroes even though I turned them in on time. The lectures weren't helpful for me and the feedback on my writing was not useful either. Assignments were low in point value so one zero can potentially destroy you. Had more success by working with friends instead of the professor herself.

comment: Anne was a great professor! She is very in love with writing and her great attitude rubs off in her teaching.  The course itself was easy, with some challenges throughout the semester.  She definitely knows what she is doing.  Anne is approachable and available outside of class for help.  Would highly recommend her for Writing 10!
I haven't had this professor for years, and I still consider her one of the best teachers I ever had.
Not alot of work. About 4 papers the entire semester, and about a month to write each. This class is interesting and not hard. I highly recommend this professor. Lenient with grading.
Not helpful at all, class requires too much work and is nitpicky about stuff
Thorough when explaining assignments, and lenient with grading. Just meet the deadlines and you'll end up with a passing grade
She's a great teacher.  Lots of discussion that is interesting and relevant.

An awesome professor.  She is always there to help and guide you with your skills in writing.  Very nice, helpful.  For those taking a writing or literature class, this is your professor.  Highly recommended.
She is always available to her students and very approachable. She is very helpful and enjoys a good group discussion. I definitely recommend.
Excellent professor.
She is so cool. It sure is nice to have a nice professor.
Great prof.  Really nice.
Very helpful, good teacher, takes suggestions. highly recommended.
She's really nice and very easy and approachable.

Great professor and the best if you want to pass Calc 1 as the other professors are not it. Isn't an easy class, but that's because Calculus as a whole is challenging. his teaching style is very quick and straightforward. this class is very fast-paced so you are learning new material very quick but as long as you ask for help and are prepared for exams/quizzes, you should be fine. attending office hours or going to the math center is crucial if you need help to not fall behind.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He has a really soft voice so sometimes it was a bit difficult to stay awake, but he is a caring professor and tries to help students pass! rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Professor Zepeda had multiple home works per week including on days of the midterm. There is in class lecture quizzes for credit and he only allows for 2 minutes to answer them. Exams are all in the lecture slides or what he says they will come from so study that. I would make sure to actually study as the rest of the stuff is easier to get 100% on

Solid teacher in my opinion. A bunch of work, but he makes what you have to study clear. If you study the worksheets for discussion quizzes and study what he tells you to for the exam, you should do well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: How he does his course is completely different from the rest of the professors, and it isn't to your advantage. comment: hes a very cool guy, grades kind of hard(+ asks for participation), but is pretty readily available for help if you need it(at least he responded to my emails quickly + office hours were good). the class i had was a hybrid, so there was an online, and in person portion of testing, but all quizzes were in person. overall 9/10, math is kinda hard tho
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Mr. Zepeda always makes sure his students understand the course material. If there is any confusion, he is patient and promotes office hours. There is a bunch of homework, but other than that awesome teacher.
He gives really good lectures, try not to miss any because he can give out quizzes for attendance, which is part of the grade.
Amazing Professor!! One of the best Ive had! Just pay attention and ask questions.

Calculus is not entirely tough. If you have the time to study consistently, you will be good at it. If you don't have time, then don't take this class. Knewton Alta is used for HW (terrible site). He is very good at teaching one-on-one. Need to show absolutely all work on exams.

comment: An insane amount of assignments. Hw due every MWF which is incredibly hard to do with a job and other classes. The grading scale is very test-heavy.

Professor Zepeda is nice to a certain extent but I have had him as a professor for multiple classes and if I had the choice to choose a different professor, I would. comment: Don't judge me by my grade, but oh my god this professor is so bad in lectures. He is super boring and impatient. Gives an attitude whenever you ask a question. The only thing that got me through this class was the baddie sitting next to me. Avoid this teacher at all costs.

He is very understanding, you just have to communicate your concerns with him. He is very patient and cares about students understanding the material. Hes a little serious but he genuinely enjoys what he does. Theres quite a lot of homework, but its the same for every other math course.

She was a boring professor only rely on a slideshow with material that she doesn't even understand. Test was huge, 80 questions, most material wasn't on it.  She would do random attendance that weighed almost a whole grade. She doesn't read emails for excuses and had to remind her constantly. She messed up on attendance. She had calls during class.

I'm a current student of hers (Fall 2024), and I've noticed that few people attend lectures. When she sees that not everybody is there, she may make those days mandatory for attendance, so making friends in that class if you do plan not to attend would be helpful. Also, she teaches herself more than the class and often makes mistakes. Good luck. ^^
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Her teaching style was not the best as she barely explains the material but use the textbook on connect it should help. Majority of the work is online. As long as you complete the assignments and quizzes online you should be fine, but the exams are worth more points so make sure you do well, and study and I recommend going to office hours.

The course is okay if you take the time to go over chapters and use her study guides. Her teaching style is very difficult to keep up with as she basically teaches herself and is unclear; instead of interacting with the class. She says she is available through email and text but her response time is very long, so it is frustrating to get help.

Shauna Bennett did not care for her students. Her claims of "Being communicative on her email and phone" are false. I have contacted her on multiple occasions, scheduled meetings only to get no answers and flaked meetings. If you want more information join the economics discord server and ask for information on her, there will be links with proof.
Me personalty would definitely recommend Mrs.Bennett,she is so awesome.
she is awesome

HW, Quizzes, practice midterms: important for passing grade
there is a project and you to have present it so attendance is important bc she'll give out the packets for it a week before thanksgiving break
Attendence is mandatoryy!!!! no matter what others say if you want at least a B

Attendance crucial if you want at least a B, read the ch. for the quizzes, break out the hw problems through the week so it doesn't stress you out when its due. & If you don't understand the hws just turn it in & through the results section it will show you the stepbystep of the problem even for the practice midterm Q's & quiz.

She lets herself be available 24/7 for her students. On the first day, she gave us her number so that we'd contact her faster if we ever needed anything. Cares about students and is understanding. Easy class to get by, open book for homework and quizzes.
We had quiz and hw due at the end of the week but the hw's she went over practice problems similar. For quizzes, if you read they aren't so bad. Very caring and comprehensive Professor!!
Loved her but her teaching could be a little better.

Her classes are Easy A's. Attendance is mandatory but just sign you in or you sign yourself in and then leave. There is weekly HW (use Chegg) and Online quizzes every once in a while (use quilt) for. Study guide and tests are the same just different numbers. You get a cheat sheet note card so copy everything and Get an easy A. Easy Grader on tests.

She is the worst lecturer I have ever had. She's unprepared sometimes and she doesn't make any of the material engaging in any way. As boring as accounting is, she has somehow found a way to make it even less interesting. The class is homework heavy. Don't get me wrong, she is a very nice person but she just isn't a good professor by any means.

Mrs. Bennett isn't the best instructor out there. As a person, she's really nice, and also very helpful. But she's came to class unprepared numerous times, and her lectures are literally just her reading off the slides. If Vilhauer is an option as an alternative to taking Bennett, I would definitely take Vilhauer's class.

lecture heavy but not boring at all. You do have to pay for Top Hat as that's where you will be checking in for attendance and exams.Sometimes instructions were unclear. She's really passionate during lectures. I recommend learning the TA names. usually, that's what the bonus questions r based on.cheat sheets allowed. have to attend class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: I forgot to fill it out fall semester, but I enjoyed her class. She had a clear grading criteria and a lot of the activities, worksheets, and discussions were in class. There was minimal to no homework except for the final exam project. She is passionate about her work and understands health in SJV. Would take again and informative.

Amazing professor to have for PSY 001, lectures are informative and do not take the whole class period plus slides are posted. Attendance is taken and grading policy is clearly laid out in syllabus, very fair class and very easy to get an A with proper studying for tests and regular attendance.

Awesome lecturer, you can tell she's passionate. Go to lecture, take notes, review the concept list she sends out and you are golden for tests. There is a textbook, but you don't have to pay and there are required readings. Just complete the assignments she gives and you'll pass with a good grade.

Professor Howell an amazing professor. Almost never had any homework (most vids were about medicine in class) and if you completed it you got a 100%. Final project is super easy, educate people about a health topic you chose earlier on. She does not tolerate BS whatsoever though. Overall 10/10 professor, couldn't recommend enough!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: The grading policies of the professor were unclear.  Nobody knew when the assignments were due. Students failed at the end of the last final day. Also, the only extra credit offered was not helpful, as you had to write 3/4 pages on 10 articles to earn up to 5 points. She was not helping you pass the class. Not a good prof.

Professor Howell was a great professor for SPRK 10. The class was based on health issues in the valley and we were put into groups as we chose. Your grade is based on your knowledge of the health issue and overall presentation. Easy A+ in that class.

Her class is structured on learning through groups assignments projects but each group as 9 people in total. This wouldn't be an issue if the assignments weren't so simple and small that it'd be an equivalent of sharing an apple with 8 other people. This class feels like a waste of 2 hours of time and effort. Choose another SPRK class if you can.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She calls people out

You have two readings and a research paper every week. She grades so weirdly. Out of three check marks. One is bad, two is good basically an A, and 3 is grad level amazing. Basically if you do A work, shell grade it as an A minus, making your grade seem so bad. Like you can never get a 100% on anything. You absolutely have to participate!

Professor Howell is a great professor. Psych 001 is all lectures but she makes them interesting. We did have a textbook but she provided us with an online copy so we did not have to pay. She also offers a lot of extra credit so everyone has a chance of passing. One of my favorite classes.

Professor Howell is AMAZING! She is very passionate about her work and makes psychology very interesting. Also, she gives you lots of time for extra credit and assignments. She allows a cheat sheet and her exams arent hard as long as you attend lectures and study a bit on your own!
I absolutely adore this professor. She is very easy to talk to and gives really fun lectures. The class is a little difficult but its definitely worth taking.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Honestly one of the best professors I have ever met. She changed the way I looked at psychology!

THE BEST, she is very understanding to her students. She doesn't deduct points for late work. She prepares you for your next writing classes. She is the sweetest and tries to build a bond with her students.This professor is talented and has a lot of experience in her job. For one of my classes she made our class go on a campus walk,it was helpful.

This professor is awesome! She really cares about her students. Go to office hours if you need help and she will be more than happy to help you out. She isn't strict on grading, and it is pretty easy to get an A in the class as long as you show up.

Professor Fraser is a great professor overall, and arguably one of the best at UC Merced. She does not only care about you as a student but also as person out of school. She is both understanding, flexible, and reliable  gives lots of extra credit. I would recommend her to any student that has the opportunity to take her class!
Very inspiring professor, cares about students and is always helping out. She will explain if you are stuck on some assignment.
Nothing to say. One of the best professors for Writing at UC Merced. Always full of energy!!!!!!!

Professor Fraser is the best! She never lets her students forget that she loves helping them out. She's very caring and understands students' circumstances. She uses class time to engage with students and really just communicate ideas and topics. Overall she's great and the workload is easy because you work on stuff all throughout the semester.

This is the only professor who actually allowed us to write literally whatever came to mind. Her class was fun but yes we do have quite a bit of work but she's not a tough grader. I feel like as long as you submit all your work you'll pass. We didn't have any exams but we did have a group project. I would definitely take her class once again!

Professor Fraser is the best that it gets. She wasn't the professor the class was supposed to be lectured by but she was still very passionate about the course. She amazing but her class did have a bit a work. Nothing hard but you'll have to complete the work to pass. def would take again
Christa is one of the best writing professors in the MWP at UC Merced. She cares a lot about her students and is beyond passionate! I really hope to take her again in the future!

Professor Fraser is an amazing professor, she is very passionate about teaching her students skills for the future. Her lectures are very interactive and fun she assigns readings that will help you with future projects and assignments. Attendance is necessary to succeed in the course because she goes over many concepts in class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Amazing and wholesome person! I had her for SPARK 014 and let me just begin by saying that the class itself is a whole lot of work. There's this research project that's to be completed throughout the semester but it's so hard to do it if you don't feel the same way about it. The professor tries to make you feel the same way that it's depressing.

I took her class my first semester here at the UC. She is an amazing teacher and person overall. Loved her class and showed up to all except a few classes. Very understanding and cares for her students. Send her an email if you will be late or absent and she will be understand. Her essays are fairly essay. Easy A in the class.

She helped me start to write like myself, after having lost inspiration from my AP Lit and Lang classes. She is very caring and understanding and can definitely help you or work around whatever it is that you are going through.

Fraser is one of the sweetest, caring instructors who you'll ever meet on campus. She gives great feedback during conferences and is very understanding towards students when it comes to personal issues. Her due dates give you tons of time to work on your essays so make sure you take advantage of it instead of taking it for granted.

Great guy, hilarious, and very passionate. I had him for a "Spark" class (World Cinema). Very lax course. Show up, watch a movie, and talk about it. One 3-page paper is required for this class as the final, however, this class is very easy. Just show up, participate, and appreciate the passion he has for these movies and the history behind them!
He is the best professor I've ever had. he is funny, witty, and knowledgeable. Take him, he is the best that will happen to you at UC Merced
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: He is the only professor that I've had three times, each for a different SPAN course. He is quite funny and very passionate about the material.
