Great professor. makes lectures relatable and applies them to daily life. he'll also crack jokes that are actually funny and tries to interact with his students in order for them to be successful
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: He is a great professor
He is great, the class is great. He is very funny and hot. The topic of the class (Erotism) is hot. TAKE HIM, YOU WON'T REGRET IT. Read, read, read, that's all he cares about.
He is absolutely amazing

He is great, but he is not a historian: He is  in literature. His manin concern is about students reading the material. Exams are very easy. Just read, read and read (as he says) and will do just fine in his class. He gives you his notes, so togehter with the books he assigns you will have not problem completing assignments such as M-term n Final.

His research and topics are extremely interesting.  I had the opportunity to be in various of his courses and I loved the way he carries him self.  He is a very helpful and friendly. When I came to UC Merced I was undeclared and after taking Lit 51 I made my decision and declared under Literature Major! If you are taking his class, please remember
He is awesome
he is the best prof i ever had. he is fun, cheerful, caring. i hope he never leaves uc, merced. well, now everybody is leaving so...

Dr. Ricci can sometimes talk really fast but hes gotten better at talkin slower. Hes really cool. He makes the class laugh and he asks us how college is going constantly so he cares about his students.
he is hot and that is the only reason i gave him a good score. but he is a good teacher too, yes i must admit. i slave over him evrytime i am in his class. i only wish that he would notice me.
No Comments
Worst professor ever I met at UC merced! would stay away if i were you. Average were 40% on midterms and whatnot. Hardly can get into contact with him at all.
Talk about a professor that is a gate keeper for med school. He's teaches you nothing but how great HE is. Doesn't explain anything well. Expect to retake the class.

Horrible teacher and doesn't care if enyone understands the material. Tests are impossible unless you memorize the practice tests and 100+ questions PER CHAPTER. Avoid at all costs, and if you put in the work for an A, expect a B-. He goes off topic more often than not and belittles students every class. He is a GPA killer. READ outside to pass.

Seriously the worst teacher. He does not care about his students and disrespects them within class. He trails off topic and his tests will have a F average but he will barely curve the class. If you have to take this class then outside resources and teaching yourself is a must... to get a B. Good luck on anything better

Retaking his class this Spring & 1st time he's changing his teaching methods. 2 midterms + final instead of weekly quizzes + final. He goes by the book so easier to follow through, especially whwk problems he assigns bc you can check to see if you've done the problem correctly. Midterms are multiple choice w7freeresponse.

I took Matt Meyers last fall and didn't pass because I bombed the final (14 pages). Previous years, he based his class on quizzes (no midterms). Quiz questions are based off of homework problems he assigns (ranging from 2-5 pages). Answer keys are not provided for homework problems the night before the quiz or the morning of so can't check your ans

Makes irrelevant jokes that can even be offensive. Does problems way too fast and for such a difficult subject, it is essential that the students have enough time to understand the concept before wiping the board. No midterms, just quizzes every week that cover material that he has not even covered yet. TA claims to not even like him very much.
Talked more about things outside of class than actual material and very vague. Couldn't ever tell you where you were in the book.

Meyer is a smart man-and he wants you to know it. Class is geared for people who don't need to attend class: heavy on retrosynthesis, mechanisms and reagents. No HW,60% based on weekly quiz, 40% on final. All tests EXTREMELY difficult. Studying does not=success. Either get it or not. Final grade of 65%=B in class.

DR. Meyer, proofed to be a highly effect, yet relatable professor.  Unlike, some overly intelligent individuals that are unable to relate to thier students and properly teach.  Dr. Meyer formed a bridge betweent those who lacked organic chemistry knowledge and himself. I learned the essentials to be successful in his course and in others to follow.

Hard core teacher, but although his humor is a bit biting he knows his stuff, is well organized, and expects a lot from his students as any professor would. Overall, if you can stand the bad jokes he is approachable and willing to teach you if you ask for help. He is making better doctors out of us premed students. Thank you Professor Meyer.

He is very good, but sometimes it seems that he rushed through the chapters. So if you take his class jsut pay attention, do the hw, and read the book then you will have an A. cuz the test are multiple choice and he lets you drop 1 exam, 1 lab, 1 quiz. So you have to get an A

Very good professor. I like how he gives out handouts on everything he lectures on. (It really gives some forgiveness when you fall asleep....) He's the only chemistry teacher that isn't boring at all nor having a thick, unintelligable accent. Organic chemistry is hard, but it's easier to comprehend with him rather than just memorizing.
Prof. tends to rush through his lectures.  Was not there the entire week before the first midterm.  Seems like he has a big ego.
She allows several opportunities for extra credit.
One of the best professors here at UCM! Her class was easy, midterms were easy I never once studied just attended lectures and passed my midterms and final.(Psy 1)

She is a really sweet person, she makes herself available along with her many TA's. Tests were basic knowledge learned in class, no real surprises. Lectures were not necessarily boring but I am a psych major so i'm generally interested. I recommend buying a clipboard. There are no desks.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Easy to understand and learn.

She was honestly amazing! Shes super sweet easy material just study before midterms and she also gives a group project instead of one of the 3 midterms. Super chill class lectures arent mandatory as long as you read the slides she puts online youll be good.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I really enjoyed health psychology with her. Class is entertaining and she sometimes will give extra credit to those who are in class. She is very sweet and cares about her students!
Very sweet and such an interesting course
She spoke softly and reads lecture often just from slides. She always tries to put some form of visual like a movie or short clips during lecture which made certain topics a lot easier to remember.

I was afraid of taking this class after reading the reviews on here, but she was not as bad as described. Her assignments are worth a lot of points but if you follow the guidelines you should be fine. Exams are easy if you study the notes. Make sure to get a good group for the group project; it's worth a lot of points all together.

For Pysch 120 she had a clear syllabus. Only material covered in lecture was tested on. I printed out the slides and took notes next to them as she spoke. I studied only the slides and not in too much detail. Seemed to grade movie responses and class discussions easily, but her midterm was no cake walk. Study slides and try on the group project.

Worst professor thus far. Does not give feedback on your work and group projects so if you get a low grade, you just get the grade. Randomly takes attendance so you have to go daily. Her lectures don't help. The exams cover about less than half of what is in the textbook. Poorly put together rubric for group project. I regret taking this class.

Seriously the worst prof I have had thus far. Class was pointless but yet we had to attend because randomly she would take attendance and it was worth 10% of our grade. SHE SUCKS. Her monotone voice reading off her notes every morning was painful. But if you attend class everyday and pay attention you'll do fine...

This is by far the worst professor I've had at UC Merced. She doesn't care about your concerns, she doesn't grade fair, her exams are short and are only focused on some material not all. Never going to have a class with her again. To top it off she listened more to her TA then her students! FAIL

She reads from her notes rather than talking to the class. Her exams are really hard and do not cover all the material learned in class. She does not give study guides so you have to study "everything" Read the book if you want to pass. There is no curve at the end of the semester. Class is MANDATORY random pop quizzes and points for showing up.

Had him for Racial Inequality and he wasn't too bad. The workload is fine but the exams are on the more difficult side. He constantly asks for participation during lecture and his lectures were more or less helpful on the exams.
Do not take this class if you want an understanding professor. Does not have empathy for personal situations

Took soc100 with this professor during the summer of 2022. The documents he would upload were not updated and still had instructions that were repeated from other previous assignments. He would not give feedback so you could know how to improve before assigning the next assignment. Ignored requests for help... never before been treated so poorly.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Can be pretty difficult. If you do all the reading youll be ok, but he is very emotional sometimes on certain topics and doesnt give good tests. If youre a great writer youll survive.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Lectures were too specific. Mentioned things that were not on the midterm or final exams. Study guides were literally just random words and didn't given any context what we had to study. Really tough grader and expects a lot from students. You'd think a sociology professor would be a little more empathetic given our current situation but he's not.

If I could rate him 0/5, I would but I can't so I'll give him 1. Literally worst professor I've ever had. There were two exams that are worth a huge percentage of your grade so if you do bad on the first midterm you're basically screwed. There wasn't any homework but there were in class group assignments in order to receive attendance points.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: It's an easy A class if you put in 60% effort. Attendance is taken irregularly so you go to class every time. Is a nice professor and does want students to succeed. Be prepared, it's kind of a boring class with the readings also being boring. You most likely will pass though if you put in a little above half effort.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Worst professor ever lectures are not helpful when it comes to exams. He isn't clear or understanding. Readings are long expects you to read chapters out of 2 different books. Has weekly discussions of 500 words in which he grades hard on. Worst part is he gives no study guide for exams when students asked for one he just said he doesn't due those.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I took this class in hopes of learning more and overall having a good academic experience. Yeah thats a big NO now. The structure of his class and lectures are all over the place. Hes not understanding of the amount of workload he gives. In addition to that, he does not help with feedback nor cares for his students success. Do not recommend.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: So nice! took him for both research methods & Social Inequality & was extremely helpful in both classes with heavy lecture but ALL information was available on power points, posted on cat courses. Attendance matters, weekly quizzes/attendance but are beneficial because the exact questions are on the test. Office hour visits help your grade!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: If you are a shy person who does not like to speak in class than it is not for you. Participation is very important in his class. There is weekly readings and have to write 500 words single spaced every week. Do not slack on the readings because those make up your grade. If you receive a C or B on the exam just do the weekly readings how he wants.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I would HEAVILY recommend NOT taking Professor Erin. If you love yourself try finding an alternative. He will call you at random any time, any day. He has unreasonable restroom rules, hates it when people walk out of class and will call you out. Has assignments on random days. He has story times and it's pretty much the only time I like him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Meet the Turkish Michael Scott. He tries to make everyone participate and will call on you at random. Class is based on group assignments and midterms. This guy is super cheesy, tries to be humorous but students laugh more at his reactions than his jokes.

The lecture's good, the group project is a great way of getting a hands-on experience of surveys. However, the professor is unnecessarily anal when it comes to getting to class late. He won't even let students use the bathroom during class. Would advise others to avoid this class with him and if you have him, sit in the back.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: His class seemed very unorganized and he would make spontaneous changes to the syllabus like announcing that he would have a quiz in class and then later adding that quizzes are now 15% of the grade. He doesn't answer questions in a concise way and may confuse the students more than help. Lectures are alright but personally boring and repetitive.

Dr. Yarra is an okay professor. Chill dude outside of class, but his teaching is not good. Boring lectures, he reads the slides word4word, providing no further understanding or insight on the content. This is a self study class, exams are hard, & pop quizzes are common. Only upside was the class was heavily curved, which helped us a lot.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Other reviews from his previous employments are consistent with what is being said here. Students deserve instructors who promote deep understanding, not rigid assignments with low educational value. I'd advise avoiding him and hope the school reassesses its approach for better learning outcomes in the future. Horrible professor.

Not a joke when i say this is the worst professor i've ever taken in my life. You cant ask him questions as he just will respond with "you should know this" and basically shrug you off. He purposely makes the quizzes and exams different from the homework and lectures. He does not care about his students and is just in general a horrible teacher.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Avoid taking this class with this professor, take ENGR151 it's the same class. His homework, lectures, and learning videos will not reflect what would be on the quizzes and exams. He will laugh in your face for asking questions and expects you to know the information. He blames everyone but himself when the entire class is failing. BE AWARE!

Lectures can be very boring as the material is not very interesting and he goes very fast through the slides.Quizzes are difficult because theres not cheat sheet to for the many formulas there is.Exams are easier since its problems from slides and theres a cheat sheet.Labs are very fun but the instructions can be difficult to follow. Easy class.

Dr. Yarra is very knowledgeable however his passion for engineering does not continue to his teaching. He is very unenthusiastic and always seems to have more important places to be. Expect to learn more from your TA and be prepared to take attendance quizzes in lecture. Would not recommend taking him but he teaches a lot of GE engineering classes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: All-or-nothing grading on individual homework. If you make a mistake, it's an automatic zero. You are on a time-crunch on exams, work fast or you won't be able to finish. Biweekly quizzes in discussion. Talks very fast in lectures. If you had a choice between literally any other professor and Yarra, take the other professor.

During you're academic career you will have professors you would want to avoid, Dr.Yarra will be one them. His exams don't correlate with the lectures and the exams are very limited time. During his lectures, his monotone and unenthusiastic voice invites boredom. Don't expect to get any help through his emails.

Yarra is a very tough teacher to learn from if you aren't an engineer major. The lectures focus heavily on example problems but the work won't be shared. Slides are different for him and the students so slides leave out key information. The busy work in this class is crazy, you'll have weeks of 10 to 20 videos to watch and review.
Grades are fixed and no care for all students to succeed.

Very fast pace but if you feel lost which most students are but refuse to say anything about it, go to office hours. No curve but his syllabus is great compared to other professors. There is also a lot of hw and group hw but take the time to do it. You have more than a week to complete it. If you actually try, anyone can pass.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I don't feel appreciated when taking his class. He goes through his lectures at astonishing speeds, leaving you barely any time to write down anything he says or does. Any question you ask about the class will be answered with "see the syllabus." He makes mistakes in his work often so make sure you check it, otherwise, he will give you a 0.

When emailing him for help he either doesnt reply or gives you a very generic answer pretty much saying figure it out. Runs through too many examples too fast and you cant grasp any concept. Didnt curve the class. Emailed him about final grades, and he just ignored all my emails. Would definitely not recommend him for Engr 155!

Yarra is a new professor to UC Merced. Attendance is required for his class and he doesnt offer partial/extra credit. The quizzes were a bit tough and he is kinda strict on grading. He goes through lots of examples problems during lecture and prepare to work in groups too. Hell make you work or your grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is a very tough grader. Dont be surprised when he doesnt offer partial credit on tests. You either get points or you dont. Hes very strict on attendance. On the bright side, I believe he does care about his students. His lectures are clear and somewhat easy to understand. Hell go through lots of problems to make sure you understand.

My one positive thing I have to say about Dr. Singhal is that he is impartial: all students are equal before him. His lectures were very hard to follow, and he was at times openly condescending to students and their concerns.  His tests were graded harshly, as was homework.  He also occasionally makes false promises of curving grades as well.

Only has hw and exams. Lectures are him reading off the slides. His idea of an exam review was a speedrun of all the slides/content that might be on the exam. Doesn't really give definitive answers. Lab is optional, but going to ask questions helps a lot. Hw is all from the textbook. Does allow a cheat sheet front and back. Would not recommend

This professor is one of the most unprofessional lecturers I have ever had. He just reads off the slides! This guy, while nice in person and outside of classroom, is about as outdated as Windows XP. He has no idea what he is doing and is out of touch with his students. Also, TA's were not allowed to assist in understanding the material / homework.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Good freakin luck. HW's are worth 20% and the Midterms and Final's worth 40% each. Just know that every homework assignment counts - I was unfortunate enough to learn the hard way. I got 37/50 and 34/50 for both Midterms and 25/40 on the Final, thing is I was missing 3 homework assignments. Ended up with a 66%. God help me if I have him again.

Class was pretty disorganized, and the homeworks that are supposed to be "easy points" are graded very harshly. Tests make up 80 percent of the grade and he doesn't tell give us a guide to study with. The difficulty of the tests aren't too bad and you get a cheat sheet. He is also not the best lecturer which is why no one showed up to his classes.

Professor Singhal is, frankly, just old. He is not a good speaker, he will often misunderstand questions asked of him, and has a tendency to repeat himself without elaborating. That said, if you reach him outside of normal lecture time, or simply participate often in lectures, he will be very kind and helpful.
Tests are weighted at 60%, be careful.

Professor reads off the slides, does not listen to feedback, even when it's constructive.
Class is not very homework heavy but final is 60% of the grade so you want as much room as possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Mukesh Singhal is an uninspirational teacher with no respect for his students. After countless requests to go over information more slowly, give examples, and clarify next to every lecture, he chose to disregard with reply of, "I've been teaching for 38 years I know how to teach." Do not take, test heavy, 80% of the grade is midterms and final.
Horrible professor, lectures poorly and doesn't explain material properly. Homework it tough and done without help.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: His exams so far have been pretty easy and his slides are pretty informative. However, he's very unprofessional. Doesn't even listen to constructive feedback on how he can improve the way he teaches, in fact, goes as far as mocking those who do. Also didn't have the audacity to create review slides or problems before exams. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: He does not care about you or your opinion, even if its valid and well thought out. Even though he is a CSE professor, he does not know basic technology troubleshooting, i.e. has trouble using PowerPoint, has trouble with zoom, has trouble with canvas, etc. He also reads straight off the slides in lectures, even though he wants you to come to them.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: He's is a really nice professor I usually skip lectures for a lot of my classes but I usually attend lectures for this class because he makes it interesting and has a very calming demeanor. There is homework that is graded on accuracy however it's only one assignment a week. lectures and lab are optional attdence. mid terms are also fairly easy
He is confusing in his lectures and that causes difficulty in learning and the study guide or the lack of it is quite hard.

His notes and slides are top notch, however his explanations are quite atrocious. They single handedly reduced my knowledge each passing lecture. If you are in his class best learn about the specific topics elsewhere and dedicate tons of time to the homework.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Marcia is a very kind and caring professor; he really cares about his students. He gives you plenty of opportunities for extra credit (even on midterms!). Just make sure to do the homework and go to discussions and you will be good. I had a C- in the class after all the extra credit was put in and then ended up getting a B as my final grade!

No practice problems or reviews for exams. Rude and snarky to students who don't understand material. Harsh grader- will remove full credit if you miss any small detail of a problem. Not good at explaining material. Doesn't work with TA's well. Not credible despite being clearly knowledgeable in Linear Analysis. Avoid if you can.

He's a great professor, does a really good job during lecture at getting ideas across and answering questions thoroughly without judgement. He does give a lot of homework, probably too much, but it does help you remember. Some old reviews said he doesn't do review lectures before midterms, that's no longer true as we have for both midterms so far.

Numerical analysis was pretty awesome. At the end of every lecture he tells you what you should know from that lecture. Basically, those slides were a study guide. The homework is usually challenging. He stays after class if people have questions. Respectfully answers questions in class. Cared about helping students figure things out
Class would honestly be fun with a better professor. Doesn't give practice midterms. Doesn't host midterm review sessions in lecture. Rude in office hours.

It is often he overwhelms students with information in the lecture. He gives way too much homework with many book problems plus his own problems. Never has a review lecture before the midterm. Doesn't tell what chapters the midterm will be based on until someone asks. He is rude to those who ask for help by asking them why they don't know it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He wants you to know the whole book. Most of the time people dont even ask question because of how confuse we are. He doesnt even tell you what to study for exams, and his lecture slides are useless when it comes to studying. They dont contain enough information to be helpful in any kind of way.

Worst Professor Ever. Lectures are useless and are difficult to follow, lecture slides don't include everything. Doesn't clarify what to study for exams. Rude to those who ask for help, expects everyone to memorize all formulas, and there a lot. Overwhelms and stresses students through vagueness and disinterest in the class. Failed 70% of class.

I took Professor Marcia this last semester for my Numerical Analysis 1 class. He's a decent lecturer and he tries to get us involved with the lesson plan however being a difficult class most people get lost. In addition to that his exams are tough and he doesn't give back points easy, he also expected us to remember everything for the final.

Good lectures, Super tough exams. His final is a cumulative exam worth 35% and he doesnt tell you what to study, just expects you to know and remember EVERYTHING. Not very responsive when it comes to emails. If you dont know what you are saying he WILL call you out on it. Oh and he grades really tough and doesnt ever reason very well with points.

Amazing professor. One of the best professors I ever had. Always comes very prepared for lecture. If you are serious about math, rearrange your entire schedule to take a class with him. He is brilliant, helpful, and fair. Tests are difficult, so you better know exactly what you're talking about, or he will call you out on your bs. 5 stars.

He is good but strict professor. exams can be really challenging and if you go into office hours he do not hand you the answer you have to know something about it and he want to think and work it out the problem mostly yourself.
Test are ridiculous. Matlab homeworks are not helpful but a burden.
He is very helpful.  Pauses to make sure everyone is on board frequently.  Tests can be challenging but are doable.

Loved his class! I had him for 7:30 am and he was very adamant about attendance being mandatory. He does not take the full 2 hours and teaches what he needs to teach. He has a clear grading criteria, funny, and I like how all of the assignments lead up to an argumentative essay. My writing improved overall, and I created a strong essay.

His way of teaching keeps you engaged and is easy to understand. He goes in-depth when discussing assignments and if you have questions he tends to answer within 24 hours no matter what. His grading is fair and he provides input to help you understand what to work on. Lectures were never over an hour even though the class is supposed to be 2 hours.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Garman was a great Professor his assignments were not solely just essays. It was a mix of in-class activities, individual work, and two group projects. Some of his prompts are a little unclear but you can ask him any questions since he is accessible outside of class. He does a good job of incorporating various types of writing as well.
Garman was super nice and very helpful. You get very little work to do and minimal essays def recommend.

Great Professor! He ends class early if the classwork is completed. Sometimes the assignments are confusing, and the prompts are very vague, but he is a lenient grader. If you don't do the assignments, he will give the whole class more assignments.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: This was a very easy class, but I enjoyed going to the lectures even though they were very short. He really cares and the feedback is very useful. Assignments are simple and there was no exam just the final paper.

Great Professor, he cares about how you do in the class, he will help you to succeed. he won' do things for you but if you show you' putting in the work before the night before a assignment is due hell give you an A. He's really good at judging if you barely did anything on the assignment, don't try to blindside him but instead just be real w him.

Took this class Fall 2020, so it was completely online. When he did hold zoom, they would only be for 30 mins, never the two hours. About one assignment a week, all in preparation for one essay due at the end of the semester. No reading, no tests. You choose the topic of your essay and take the entire semester to formulate it. Also Fair grader

Writing 10 is fairly easy since most of your grade consists of assignments that support the final essay. Although, this professor doesn't give good feedback nor has clear grading criteria. If you are looking for a good professor I would recommend Micheal Elkins.

had him last semester, and he's hilarious. most classes are class discussions about the reading (expect a fair amount of reading weekly). he gives amazing feedback on your work, and grades very fairly. super great teacher to take!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: He's very resourceful with essays, he gives good feedback as long as you know what to ask help for. He makes learning enjoyable and seems to show genuine care for learning.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: He is straight up with what needs to be done. Makes the class really fun with his humor. He is dedicated to helping you improve as long as you put effort as well. Best professor I have so far.

honestly one of the best WRI professors. he is straight up and tells you what needs to be done. gives great feedback on your essays! read the novels he assigns because he does call on people to make sure you read it!

Garman doesn't mess around. You better come to class prepared. However, he does have a great way of making all of the material relevant by using real-world examples. He obviously does a lot of prep work outside of class to supplement the lectures that are already on the syllabus for everyone in CORE. Best professor at UC so far.

I took Professor Isbell for PSY 172 Forensic. Attendance was not mandatory but encouraged since exams are based off lectures. There's study guides for every exam, very helpful, very detailed, so I encourage going over the study guides for exam days. There's  few top hat assignments but nothing difficult, very manageable.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took Professor Isbell for PSY 180 and PSY 160. Attendance was not mandatory but encouraged since exams are based off lecture. There are study guides for every exam, and they were very helpful, so I encourage going over the study guides. There are a few top hat assignments but nothing difficult, very manageable. Amazing and attentive prof (:

Lovely professor and just a really cool guy. He makes lectures fun to attend which in turns make studying the material easier. He has retakes for his exams which I think is nice. He's the type of professor that brings back your spark for learning.

rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Pretty chill professor, and he explained the criteria of the class very clearly, the only way to fail the class was to not study lecture slides for exams, or turn in argumentative essay/questions but the workload was not overwhelming, would recommend and wish more professors used his structure.

literally one of my favorite professors taken at merced. he began doing tests in-person due to consistent academic dishonesty, but his tests are super chill and he provides a retake where he'll give an average of your two scores. awesome guy! lets you out early when we begin to seem tired and overall great lecturer, he knows what he's doing

The few times that I have the amazing opportunity to sit in through his lectures, I felt his passion for this course and how he communicates to students. Very brilliant and will DEFINITLEY take again. Everyone that attends his classes will say so also.

Best lecturer at this school. Truly passionate about his field of aggression psychology. Gives truly disillusioned views on what science really is for psychology. 

Few, simple assignments. Particularly light workload.

Loved his class. It was really easy to keep up with the lectures and there were very few assignments, which were also very easy. The exams are taken online and are based on the lectures, which are available throughout the semester. The professor is also very easygoing and nice. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Absolutely loved his class. Super understanding and his lectures are very engaging. You can miss up to 6 lectures without it affecting your grade. Super interesting discussions. Overall great professor, you will not regret taking his class.

I took his class online and he was great. It is an easy A class because he really breaks down everything in simple terms. He had 30 minute lectures on T/R and they were really easy to follow. His exams were the easiest exams I have ever taken in my life. If you listen to his lectures, there is no way you won't get an A!!!!
super passionate about his class(aggression and violence course), funny, easy to pass, is available when needed. He doesn't give a book for class but mostly makes you learn from lectures .
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Took Psy 190 Psychology of Aggression and Violence Fall 2020. AMAZING professor, his lectures are to the point and gives a quiz after every lecture; pay attention, they're review. There 4 exams and also 4 discussion days. Don't hesitate to ask q's, he will gladly explain it to you again. Dr. Isbell is also so kind, funny, and enjoys teaching!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Professor Isbell is a real gem. Always super engaging in his lectures. Homework assignments were straight-forward. Genuinely cares about his students. A solid 5/5!
Bob is an awesome person but, understandably, he doesn't make CORE a walk in the park. His discussion sections though definitely made the class much more fun than any other TA.

Bob was definitely one of my favorite instructors. He makes the confusing Core class SO entertaining and interesting. He is very approachable and very good at what he does. I wouldn't recommend any other instructor for Core.
He was ok, not the best, but FAR from the worst.
Bob is a great instructor. All you need to do is show up for class and get your work done in time.  He's always willing to help with anything.  Take advantage of the office hours as well.
He is an awesome professor. He makes class so interesting. Grammar Demon. (:

I found by him wanting to make the class humorous, it really ended up with him shoving his views down our throats in a rude way.  However, having said that I learned an incredible amount about language.

This professor is perhaps one of the best mentors I have had. Lambert has a great personality as well as a great understanding of the modern English language. His motto, the "grammar demon," is a phrase that he instills in his students' brains. Lambert is a superb lecturer, and I highly recommend him to students who struggle with English.

He's a very energetic and present professor, sometimes funny. Tries hard to engage the class very hard. But be warned, he is an imbecile, as long as you do the work EXACTLY as he says (do NOT fall under word count, etc) you will be just fine. Sometimes he says stupid/ignorant things but is tolerable for a good grade
awesome class.... thats all i gotta say...

He is absolutely awesome! I love him so much as a professor! I have to wake up super early for his class, but I don't mind because his class is a class that i cannot wait to attend! He is truly passionate about what he does, and you can see it when he teaches. There is never a class where I do not laugh! One of the best teachers I've had so far!

Mr. Lambert is the best!! I learned soo much from him.  He is easy to talk to and very helpful.  He teaches skills to improve writing, by correcting essays. Mr. Lambert knows the material to a tee, I wish there were more instructors like him.  He's Awesome!!!

he is great. totally reccommend him. take his time to read your essay. gives great feedback and advice in writing. funny and gives you great topics to write about. i reccommend everyone to take this instructor, esp. when you are billingual, and eng is your 2nd language. he's great at breaking that barrier. good instructor overall.

This instructor takes time with his students, knows his subject matter, and is clear in his delivery.  Moreover, he has a great command of the English language and is a role model for using and teaching it.  His sarcastic sense of humor kept me interested at all times.  Anyone who doesn't get it or does not appreciate it must be a moron or less.

The instructor makes people get confused when writing an essay because sometimes he has conferences that people attend to get help with their essays but, he tells the student what to write then when the students turns in a final draft he complains about how what you wrote is either wrong or confusing.
Honestly the worst prof on campus. He literally cant stay on topic to save his life and hes very hard to understand verbally. Avoid him at all costs !!!!

He is a great instructor and is very inspirational. After hearing some of his inventions you cant help but want to go as far as you can. He made connections to real life situations which over all made the class enjoyable. He is also very charismatic, hes the kind of professor that you cant just help but talk about with other students.
Excellent!
His the nicest guy I ever seen, really really good attitude probably some accent, but I like him alot~
Worst teacher i have ever had. Do not take this guy. He was trying to teach physics and engineering in a physical science class.
Excellent, Superlative knowledge. Explains real world applications. Need more like him!
This is vey difficult subject. However Leal-Quiros explains in detail that I undestood well the class. A lot of Homework and the Exams are not easy.
He's a great teacher, funny, helpful, and he posts all his slides online.
Very clever Professor.

I like his teaching skills, I learned a lot. He helps me to think like a real Engineer. Whoever rated this prof. on 10/11/09 has a very biased view on this matter. The reviewer probably failed the course and is taking it out on this website. Prof Leal_Quiros is probably the best and most clear Engineering  Professor I have ever had.
He was one of the best professors I have ever had.
The best Instructor I ever have.

He almost never reply to any emails, he will not try to accomodate students who cant attend his OH. He have heavy spanish accent and asthma, its hard to understand him (he's not so hot with mic) I put frequent textbook usage only because he scanned n use it as his lecture slides. almost never touched the board,no partial credit (online hw quiz)

Gutierrez lecture are slides with previously finished equations and he attempts to explain them in the lecture. He skips steps in these equations so once he gets to the answer you are completely confused. Do not take him for statics and dynamics if you want to keep your sanity. Or take him idc. Just know you will be teaching yourself. Good luck.

Chill and caring profesor, class was not hard at all. One weekly homework problem and 3 midterms and a final. The midterms were copy and paste questions from lecture slides. Although it can be quite hard to learn from him reading his lecture slides.
Great and fair professor. Passionate about the material he teaches.

Alejandro is very happy to teach and listens to students. If you pay attention and go to class, you will learn. He gives a lot of time to ask and answer questions about mathematical operations or concepts. Overall, a great professor that encourages students.

His slides are horrible, and he doesn't explain mathematical concepts well (or at all). He just tells you how to solve problems and guides you through them. Barely any assignments, but there's A LOT of partial credit and he makes it clear what he expects from you. Exams are copy/paste from hw, discussion, or lecture. GO TO LECTURE AND LISTEN!!

This professor's lectures are useless, and the slides used are even worse. From what other people have told me, the other ENGR057 professor is better in every aspect, so try to take the class with them.

comment: Horrible lecture slides
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor doesn't care about his students and doesn't respond to emails. He fails to teach what is needed for the projects. When asking for help he just tells you to google it.

50% of your grade is based on two projects. If you attend his office hours he is not helpful whatsoever. He told me multiple times to just google it. I in fact did google it professor and I was still confused that's why I was attending your office hours. If you don't mind teaching yourself then this class wasn't too bad.

comment: This class is tough he gives us 2 big projects and he did curve but that's because a lot of people were struggling in his class I was honestly disappointed in the teacher because he did favor some students above others I felt that he could have handled the situation in an appropriate matter. In general I wouldn't want to take his class again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: 90% of your grade is exams. 10% homework. class is super hard and he does not curve whatsoever. i barely passed. must study a lot to pass gg no re

Exemplary professor! Professor Alejandro is a great lecturer. He is clear in his examples and takes the time to answer questions. Participation is a part of your grade, so participate! There is also a comprehensive 3-piece group project that he releases at the beginning of the semester but is due at the end.

Very passionate about the field, and gives great lectures. His slides are always short and concise, and all the homework and exams are based on them, so you're never surprised. No quizzes. One of the best ENGR professors at UCM. Very kind and approachable if you're having trouble

Assigned readings were covered in lecture. Readings = lengthy, BUT provided me with a strong foundation of material covered.
He provides his slides and a study guide for each exam. When I took the course, he omitted pop quizzes for the semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Great teacher! Professor Kim is a young rising scholar who is well-organized and passionate about the topics he lectures on. If you pay attention to his lectures and review the study guide, you'll pass the class with flying colors. 11/10 would take again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Kim is such a nice professor. He cares about the students and teaches the material pretty well despite having a kind of thick accent I can still understand him. He asks for feedback on the midterm and once he found out the format was hard, he fixed it and the final exam was easier. The pop-up quizzes consist of 2 questions and easy!!

I took Poli 005! He was funny and very understandable! His class didnt seem long and all you had to do was pay attention to the slides he posted and go to discussion and youre good! He does do a lot of pop quizzes though that contained 1-2 questions but it was easy to get an 100%. The exams werent hard as long as you did the study guide.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment:
Well organized and knows his stuff. Brings invaluable, relevant personal experience to the class to make it unforgettable. 

His English isn't great but I never had a problem understanding him.

Lectures are clear and concise.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He can have a good personality but his grading style is not ok. His quizzes are worded in a very confusing way. And his lectures are hard to understand possibly due to the language barrier.

Dr. Kim seems like a nice person, but he's not the best professor. I agree his lectures are vague. It can be hard to make out what he's saying & identify the point that he's trying to convey. In lecture, he doesn't seem to know how to communicate (in a clear and succinct way) his understanding of the material. This may be due to a language barrier.

His class consisted mostly of quizzes each week and 2 really hard exams. Majority of his lecture notes were very vague and he worded all of the questions on his exams/quizzes very weird. He was a very tough grader especially on our last exam, which everyone didnt do good on. Overall, he was not a good instructor and not very understanding at all.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Great professor ! This is my second time taking him for a class and honestly his style remains the same in both classes. Its pretty basic. Everything is in his sides and hes pretty enthusiastic when it comes to teaching. You dont have to attend class but as long as you participate every now and then you will get a good participation grade.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class--Inspirational

comment: Absolutely horrible. Hes not understanding at all nor does he try to work with his students to get on the same page. He doesnt really teach or explain well but expects his class to be an in-person format and requires attendance or participation.

Prof. Kim is friendly and teaches well, and the lectures aren't too long. My only gripe with this class is the pop quizzes, there were only a few, but they were typically 1 question long and 10 points each, so you either get full credit or a 0. Also make sure you at least skim the readings, material from there will appear on the exams.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Kim is beyond kind and adaptable to the situation we were put in with COVID. I would take him again easy to follow just do the readings because thats what the pop quizzes are on
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Hard professor, but definitely worth it. I've learned a lot from his class. Participation is key!

Awesome professor, knows his students well and is willing to help out during lectures, office hours, and email. He explains things super well in lectures and continuously gives his students time to process difficult topics. If you are a math lover this class will be a breeze. If you struggle with math, I think you found the right professor.

Great professor that explains the material well. His exams were a bit difficult but he allows you to retake them which helps a lot. The final is optional as well which is very nice. Quiz questions were given to us a week prior to study and 1 question was drawn out of 3 per quiz. The key to passing is just practicing the material and completing hws.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Calculus 3 is inherently difficult, so expect to spend more attention to this class. The beginning of the course can feel overwhelming but will settle down throughout the semester. As for Nathan, he is approachable, chill, and an overall great lecturer.

Super helpful leading up to exams. Notes are literally just write what he writes so it's hard to screw up and even then it's uploaded online to look at. Recommend collaborating hard on discord especially for quizzes. Homeworks sucked but thats knewton alta, plus the thanksgiving break homework was really quick to do anyway. Attend office hours

Good professor overall; He needs to chill with the homework. My main and only complaint is the homework. There is no mercy. Thanksgiving break? homework. A midterm is coming? you have homework. Final coming? still have homework. Holiday? HW. Gets to a point where you can spend HOURS doing a few problems. Even the extra credits are just long HW.

Nathan's class is difficult, but that's because its calculus 3. His grading is very forgiving and if you put in the hours, you are basically guaranteed a pass. He has 10 quizzes throughout the semester, but are given opportunities to retake 3 of them. And we can redo our midterms throughout the semester on the final exam.

This man seems to be a problem. Honestly, it feels like he didn't even want to be there. The quizzes are crucial and can determine your grade if you don't do well on the exams. The homework assignments were manageable at first, but as the course progressed, the problems became too complex for the software, making them extremely tedious to complete.

Everyone warned me about multivariable calculus being the worst class ever, but Nathan definitely made it tolerable :D
Lectures are great, but be sure to pay close attention so you don't get lost. Tests will be a bit difficult, but people on here are making them out to be worse than they really are.

Multivariable calculus is a hard class and this professor made it a lot easier. As others mentioned, the grading is very fair and forgiving. You do have to pay attention and practice and study if you want to do well like in any math class. He will always answer questions and help explain things in lecture and office hours.

While the course definitely does need to take up a lot of your attention, given the subject its understandable. Willis makes the course easy to understand and is very good at explaining the material. While the test averages were in the 60 percents, the quiz averages were much higher and with the grade scale most people were fine in the end.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment:
The grading and scale were very fair: HW (15%), weekly discussion quizzes (25%), two midterms (15% each), and a final exam (30%). 

We're all required to earn a C- or better for credit, so the midterm and final exams are on avg a "failing" grade (although not actually an F). But, the homework load is manageable and is relevant to the hard exams.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Nathan is a super nice and caring professor. Obviously, don't expect the exam to be exactly like the homework. It's really important to understand the basic concepts too. He offers the quiz questions a week before you are given the quiz so take advantage of office hours and ask questions! I'd say his class is very fair and well structured.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment:
Goes over a bunch of various things that you may or may not - most likely wont use, in class. 
The exams are nothing like the given worksheets, homeworks, exam reviews, or quizzes. 
The median and average grade for every exam given was below a passing grade. 
Doesnt curve or care to hear a case for it,
I wouldn't take again.

All of the averages for the exams were F's or bellow. No curve. Most people drop the course. So much homework and the exams are nothing like the homework, the reviews, the worksheets, or the quizzes so goodluck.

I don't get the bad rating for him, he goes over a lot in lecture. But the homework basically goes over everything you need to know in the class it's knewton alta with around 1-2 modules which if you do it correctly usually ends up being 4-8 questions. You are given the quiz questions before the quiz as well. If you do the work you'll pass.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: His course is designed for the students to swim against the current. If you're not a good swimmer, you'll drown.  Activities are overwhelming as if you have no life. His class is designed to weed out weak students, rendering it a barrier to completing your CSE degree. He expects you to be an expert after many discussions with the TA and lecture.

Pravin was an amazing teacher. I took her writing class in the fall, and I learned a lot. If you wish to improve your writing, take the class. The workload isn't heavy, and she clearly explains each assignment. She cares for her students and will always accommodate them.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: You do have to rent one book for the class. Her assignments are reasonable, as she will give you plenty of time to do them. You can tell she really cares about her students which improves the quality of the seminar. There are 3-4 big assignments given for the semester and then smaller ones that are done during class time.
Professor was great with feedback on papers. Her class is challenging only because there's a lot to do but she makes sure everyone gets their assignments done.

I had this Professor for a Spark Seminar The dynamic aesthetic. She always asked how we were doing and asked every student personally if they needed any help or clarification. The book was $16 on Amazon, but it's a nice book to have. Lots of printing, multiple pages, prefers single-sided. V intimate small class, she gets to know us, & we, our peers
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: She tries her best to get to know her students which really makes one feel comfortable in her classroom. She is good at giving feedback and doesn't make you feel bad about it, she's really careful about that and actually makes you see different points of views.
Very understanding and helpful !
She's a solid professor, enjoyed the class despite not particularly caring about poetry or plays. Gives a lot of homework but as long as you stay up to date, you should be fine.

comment: When she grades paper she is very specific on feedback and the feedback is very helpful. Sheis very nice and also talks about her own experiences when teaching. rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is very caring and really loves when students participate ! She is a very tough grader. There are pop quizzes. Follow the syllabus! Go to office hours if you need help!

Dr. Pravin truly cares about her students and grades you in a way that shows you what really needs improvement. Shes not the type to teach because she has to, she does it because she wants to. Make sure to do the readings and follow the syllabus, everything can be done ahead of time. OFFICE HOURS, they help immensely.
Very accommodating.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: If you're looking to seriously improve your writing skills, I would definitely recomend taking her. However if you want an easy class, don't take her. She gives out a lot more work than other WRI 010 professors but her class is great. She really cares about helping her students improve is her office hours are extremely helpful.
If you dont like talking in class, do NOT take her class! Shes generally pretty easy and focuses on in class discussions, but watch out for pop quizzes.

Very unusual teacher to be honest. At first was very strict simple and stand off-ish. Very straight forwards and helps people of all levels learn. Look out because the pop quizzes on reading will KILL you.  He mood is almost bi-polar. Either hilarious and fun, or mad and wishing she wasn't in Merced. Either way, good teacher and a good grader.

Taking R1A with her was a nightmare! She is just horrible. Had to sacrifice everything else to succeed in this one. If you study 24/7, there's a slight chance of getting a C. An excellent professor, knowledgable, with a lot of personal care. Loves teaching, very demanding, and a very tough grader though!!

comment: I took R1A w/her at Berkeley & it was the worse experience I've ever had. I seriously contemplated reporting her because that's how terrible this class was & how bad of a teacher she was. comment: Absolutely horrendous. Is unclear with literally everything that she says and expects us to read her mind.

comment: I took her Tutor Training course last fall and loved it! Highly recommend Belinda because she made class fun. Always willing to help and gives good feedback. The books were very useful and I became a better writing assistant in her class. Easy A.

Amazing professor, I recommend here to anyone. The writing 10 course in general is hard. So every teacher is hard. Pay attention in her class and participation matters. The attendance is mandatory. or you wont pass. letter grade drops by one if you miss 3 days of class. Grading is basic, if you put time and effort into your essay, you will get an A

Professor Kremer was very rough to have as it was here first time teaching Core. She needed a lot of help from students to get her point across, but overall I found her to be a very knowledgeable writing professor. She helped during office hours and was there to help if needed. Overall, be careful of her with Core.
She seems to have her heart in the right place. My only problem is how confusing she can become, very confusing at times.
This professor has been one of the best professors ever. She is very helpful, and very educated. I would definitely have her again if I could.
She grades hard on essay !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Loved taking her for Writing 1. She was always there, made classes fun, & is super flexible when you needed help/clarification during her office hours & she adds more availability for students who want it either by keeping a close eye on her email or by having more office hours. She gives detailed feedback & I would take a class with her again!

Reads slides adds some context in lecture. Every lecture had an exercise (on what was being discussed), participation is important b/c it is a very close to exam questions (and topics). Good place to make mistakes, ask questions and get answers and explanations. Practice and exams will be okay. Labs: hard part figuring out what to do attend!

This prof is overhated imo sure he isnt the most prepared but he is extremely lenient and will make exceptions for anything you just gotta email him or ask him straight up. The labs are very easy you get a cheatsheet for midterm and final. He does ask a lot of questions for ur project tho.

This professor is awful. Literally tries to act like he cares for students but he does not. TA's & professors grade extremely hard for no reason when it ain't even that serious. To pass this class you need to perform above 80's on exams & labs. He does not activate grade scale on the last day of final which drops everyone's grades. Terrible.

Professor is caring and takes student feedback and used the feedback to improve the course by giving less labs, giving us a choice on the course projects and also improving lecture stuff. However, he is just like any other professor and reads off the slides. Lectures in this class are bad and labs are fairly easy, but graded hard.

Lectures were a nightmare to attend - he frequently gave contradictory information, was disrespectful to students who answered questions incorrectly, often had technology issues, and couldn't understand him due to lack of enunciation. Labs were fairly easy, however it wasn't clear what requirements were. Satisfactory exam prep materials.

This professor does not email back, he does not curve the grade, and he grades extremely hard. You lose points for the slightest mistakes like indentation in your code. Muffles and reads off slides, does not help, and is very tough on the class project. Would avoid this Professor if registered for this class

comment: Wears 3 masks and reads directly off slides, so he's muffled the entire time despite us advising to use the mic. This professor doesnt explain the material well at all. He has an accent (not bad, makes it a bit more difficult to follow) as well as never uses the mic in the room. Gave us a project that requires OpenGL and a library called SOIL we have used none of these so far and have been given very little help setting any of it up all he has said is "its easy" and when we ask the TAs about the project none of them even knew we had a project
just reads slides and cant tell what he says cus he keeps walking away from mic and wears 2 masks and a face shield.

Worst professor I have ever had. Literally sets you up for failure. DO NOT TAKE HIM.

comment: Go to office hours. He is an excellent professor that will put in as much effort as you will. People are afraid to talk to him, but they shouldn't be. comment: Kelley does not give good lectures because he rambles and goes all around the borad in a random pattern. He is not a fair grader, and he talks too much about past stories. I would not recommend him for a chemistry professor.

comment: Inconsistent on tests, lectures are nothing but formulas from the book so his lectures are not helpful whatsoever.

Boring class, but what do you expect from chemistry? He will occasionally make minor errors on the board so watch what he's doing. I hate the exam format, but you best option is to look at old exams, he will repeat some of the same problems he used in past exams. Take notes and get study groups.
Worst teacher I've ever had. Waste of money and time. Don't take him unless you have to and if you have to get ready to fail.

Horrible professor. Worst thus far. Messy on white board. Doesn't take questions well. Makes an error on each midterm. Once in class he had three R variables on the board, finally someone asked and each was something different. We all had assumed it was the ideal gas constant.
sucks big time

currently taking chem 10 and  HATING IT!! his lectures make no sense, he is second worse chemistry teacher i've ever had. he is wrong 51% of the time and thats a lot if ur a teacher...he screws up alot...confusing and annoying. be prepared to teach urself...love the TA tho. wish she was the professor...i do NOT RECOMMEND
Looks somewhat like Agent Smith from Matrix, but seems to be a nice guy.  Extremely knowledgable about subject and lectures go through a lot of information.
Pretty entertaining instructor, a bit strict.

I've concluded that he used to be a good teacher, but he's lost his ways in recent years. He's unclear with instructions, does not believe in full credit, and if you are unfortunate to be in an emergency with documentation, he will not give you leniency. I would avoid taking one of his classes ever again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: MMR is the Worst professor that I ever had. He's a harsh grader and won't give you any help, even during his office hours. His class is weighted in a weird way that doesn't make sense. He doesn't follow what the course is supposed to be and does his own thing. He failed 24/27 people in this class. I would avoid it at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Not a great professor, quite rude when attending office hours. Pushed the issues to the TA. TAs are harsh graders for no apparent reason. The material was not hard, but the class is unfairly graded. not what I expected from a Chicano class, take another GE.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: His lectures are great as they do deep analyses of the texts and give important material to mention in exams. He's a super nice guy!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Yes, he might be a harsh grader but his classes are some of the few upper division classes that feel like upper division. Plus, he keeps lectures very interesting. It feels more like a general book discussion than a lecture. Love him!
Interested in students progress and always very attentive.

Extremely biased in his grading. I didn't agree with a lot of what he taught and I made it clear that I thought differently though I worked hard. I ended up receiving an 89.6 (he changed my participation grade at the end of the year from an A+ to a B-) and he gave me a B.  Typical of a professor who's too caught up in himself. THINK OUTSIDE THE BOX
Make sure you read his published books, that might help you to understand more about what's being cover in class. He is very helpful and has a good sense of humor! Loved his class!
Very biased in his opinion and grading.
I LOVE THIS MAN!  That Spanish accent drives me nuts.
Tries to make class fun - it is most of the time. Very helpful if you have a problem with something.
Helpful. Makes class interesting
Great teacher.  Really funny.
Professor Bazua is by far the best! He cares, is engaging and cares about his students and the subject matter. I would take this course again for sure...and any course that professor teaches.

comment: I'm currently sitting in on lectures and different classes to prepare me for my upcoming semesters. This teacher seems really good and the students seem to like this class. But I will definitely give an update next semester and let you know if I do end up taking this class. I definitely enjoyed auditing the class.
I loved his class. His passion for the subject is very inspiring and he is crazy knowledgeable.

He's really sweet and there for you to learn. I get confused sometimes because his organization is hard for me to follow, and his lectures are a little too fast and boring. But he knows a lot about anthropology and wants to make sure you get a good grade.

He is a very good teacher, very kind and lovely. However, his lectures are a little bit boring and made me sleepy sometimes. But if you really into this subject, this teacher is very recommended for you since he is very smart and helpful. Moreover, he also gives extra credits for us. You have to listen to all of his lectures to get good grades.

he is a very smart person and a very good person,and by good i mean that he really cares for the less fortunate unlike hypocrite people,thus making him an inspirational professor. He is  also very understanding and fun!

Best Anthropology teacher! So Intelligent! So Kind! So Loving! Nonetheless, he loves so say "Nonetheless." Very understanding. However, keep reading the materials to succeed. This is a very true comment, it comes from my heart. ;Vince Wong Kesuma.

Best teacher for anthropology nonetheless the lectures are a bit boring, but if you are really keen on studying anthropology for your major, you should definitely take him because hes an expert in his field. He really cares for the students in his class. A very kind man.

He is spitting fire. Hotter than a boiling water fused with scorching fire. Talks too fast sometimes, however he really knows his stuff! very passionate about anthropology, especially things related with the Mayans.
He dose introduce a lot of interesting topics about anthropology, not too many homework are required, the curve is great.

Carlos is an amazing teacher who teaches with passion. The class itself wasn't a hard one to pass. He oft gives us extra credit for something smart said in class or an excellent assignment. With that said, class participation plays a huge role in Carlos' class. He also is there for you, and would explain top to bottom anything you didn't understand
He is a good person

Greatest guy in the world. Helped me out so much. And was so knowlegeble. This guy knows his****. Will help you read all those readings. He is crazy good. Make sure you have him. There is no other history ta better then he

GET READY TO STUDY!! Her test are handwritten no multiple choice, go to study hours!! overall a caring teacher and likes to create a connection with her students. All your grade comes from your quizzes also takes attendance daily and that affects your grade too.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor DePrano is one of the best professors I've had the pleasure to learn from at UCM. You can tell that she's really passionate and knowledgeable about the things she teaches and cares for her students. Showing up to her lectures will definitely help you succeed in the class.

Probably the best professor I've had, this is my second time taking one of her classes. Her teaching is great and I've actually learned things. As long as you pay attention and study for the quizzes (super easy exact same as study guides) you will for sure pass this class. Do not go late to class
She is very nice and understanding/lenient. Very wholesome and also very passionate about what she teaches. As long as you try and participate in class then you are good.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Deprano clearly displays her passion for art history and wants you to appreciate it as well. Her quizzes consist questions only from her study guides, so as long as you take good notes and answer her study guide questions, you'll pass the class. She also drops your two lowest quizzes and does not give a final!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: One of my favorite teachers here at UCM. She will teach you a lot about the subject but she will make you work for it. As long as you show improvement over the course she will be happy. Expects you to do research on the topics for the essays and she tells you how to do it. She will help outside of class if you need it. MUST GO TO CLASS TO PASS!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: This class is fairly easy if you show up and fill out the study guide. Use the study guides as... well study guides. The questions are exactly the same on the quizzes. Shes a great professor.

DePrano is fantastic. Gives great lectures, down to earth, and really knows what she's talking about. No homework, just 2 papers and 4 essays in class. So long as you attend lectures you'll be good. And make sure not to disrupt class as she has no problem calling students out, adds to her charm.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Maria is such a doll. Super funny, and knows her stuff. Class is super easy. All you do is take notes and she gives you a study guide for the quiz you take every week. No other homework, book isn't really needed. No final, just quizzes and the lowest grade (or two I forget) is dropped. Questions on quiz? Email her & she'll give you answers.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I got a B in this class and I had ALOT of outside distractions due to family/work. If I didn't miss class I would've had an A no problem. All you do is show up to class and fill in the blanks to the packets she gives you. THOSE NOTES ARE EXACTLY on the test. Plus she gives test questions before the test. THere's 3 and she picks 2. Show up take note

The tests every week really turn me off of this class.  Be sure to bring a computer because sometime she runs out of packets. When students ask for clarification during class she can be snappy, so kinda hostile environment.  The packets are the worst, its just fill in the blank, i'm too busy filling it in I don't appreciate the art slides.

The class goes by too fast. The study guide for the quizzes are dense. The quizzes are a small proportion of the study guide so many times I end up over studying topics that don't get put on the quiz and get dinged for something. I expect an art class to be taught like poetry,  with much space in between to appreciate the art, this is anything but.

I found this class unrelentingly difficult and perturbing. As she put it, this course structure is is typically taught over a year however she crammed it into a semester. It feels rushed. You get 4 page quizzes ever week, no joke.  This class is packet based, packets where you fill in the blanks while she lectures. I feel like a didn't learn. :(

Her tests are difficult and her lectures are very in-depth. But she is very thorough and clear in her explanations. You can tell she is very passionate about her work and willing to go beyond to help her students understand material. Her class is a challenge, but well worth taking!

Dr. Chouinard is my favorite professor.  I've taken two classes with her thus far and I love them both.  Her classes are very challenging but she's willing to do all she can to help. If you're looking for an easy A then you should look elsewhere, but if you want to challenge yourself like I do then you should take one of her classes.
she did not care about students unless it was directly related to her outside research.  Unhelpful and unwilling to work with students
Class was harder than expected, especially in reference to her tests.  Make sure to take good notes, she goes very fast and does not like to post lectures online.  A lot of test comes from notes.

She really takes teaching seiously. She is a good lecturer and is very easy to understand. Her exams, however, are very hard! You will not pass this class without studying!!! Ovearll,  very very good professor!

I was worried at first, but she is very available for questions and she really helped me understand a lot about the History of Psychology.  I got a good grade in her class because even though what she asked of us was a lot, I know I really stepped it up to meet the standard she set.  I enjoyed her class and I was very proud of myself.
This is a hard cl****, but I learned so much! Be prepared for hard work.

I don't understand why people complain about her cl****es. She taught me more than any other cl**** I took at UCM! If you want to learn, take her cl****. If you want an easy cl****, go somewhere else.

This class was soooo much work that it should have been a five or six unit course!  Reading three books and some 50 journal articles, then writing a 20 page term paper, and 30 hour final was not worth only four units. Very hard work!

the class wasnt that great, the discussions didnt help us learn the material....we didnt do anything except read for the first fifteen weeks, and by the sixteenth week, she handed out a 33 page essay final that we had to be finished by the next week...luckily it was only worth 15% of the grade.... those first time professors
This is a hard class, but interesting. She makes you work through hard topics and make connections.
pop quizzes, students lead discussion, lots of concepts to understand
Tough but good

Great professor, took her hybrid class, all materials are located online, all of the materials are based on lecture slides, outside sources such as scholarly articles. There are group projects, consists of answering couple questions VERY easy to do and submit. Exams are in person, open book/note, no lockdown browser of any kind.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: This professor is amazing, I took her hybrid course, all of the class materials are located on canvas. This is an easy A class as-long as you do the class discussions (located on canvas), the class does have group assignments, it's fairly easy and submit the assignment online.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: A kind professor knowledgeable in her field. One thing is her voice can be soothing which can make you sleepy (respectfully), especially if you're tired. However, she goes in-depth and provides great examples in class. There are in-class discussions every week however they're easy. Exams are open-note which is helpful as there are many terms.
Very sweet lady. she really cares about what shes teaching us. 10/10
Great professor made cognitions of affect and health a very interesting class. Tests were primarily based on outside articles and in class slides. There is no textbook which is a plus!

Dr. Cameron is a lovely lady, traditional teaching methods. She offers these great lectures and you should use them to study for her exams. I really enjoyed her course, high quality and exams were taken during class time on scantrons. You should definitely study for the exams because there's no notes allowed which is why I rated higher difficulty.

I learned a lot from her class. Very informative lectures, I do recommend her class. You follow along with her slides in class or online (hybrid class), you still need to take your own notes as you follow along. No textbook, reading material to download is necessary to keep up with the lectures. Extra credit in the form of discussion boards.

Very smart, experienced professor. I really enjoy being taught by someone who knows what they are doing!  She is personable and helpful outside of the classroom, assignments are relatively easy. No textbook, just assigned research articles.

Professor Cameron is very passionate. Her lectures are very informative and most of the test questions come right from the slides. She is there to help whenever you ask. The workload is on the light side.
She is so adorable! Her lectures are so interesting and easy to understand! As long as you go to class you will get a good grade!  No book required!
No book required. Tests based on lecture, so as long as you pay attention, very easy!

She is a very nice prof and loves talking about studies and research. She is very enthusiastic about the subject. She posts lectures prior to class but additional notes will help. Exams are really easy and no books is a major plus!
Really interesting class. Nice professor. Work and tests are a breeze.
