Cool guy. Do the reading, speak up in class, and he'll love you. Easy class, more of an overview than in-depth look. He's definitely willing to help you find research on campus, if you're into that. I would take him for a class again.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: People don't like Fradkin because he's "mean" and "hard" but not true. Likes to use sarcasm and Cynicism to make class funny and pokes jokes at things most people wouldnt. He's not mean, just dont use your phone in class cause he will call you out. Not hard, just be a college student, go to class, study, and do the HW. Knows what hes talking about.

His class was clear and organized. You have an assignment or two a week and you just read a case study or research article and answer a few questions. Tests are pretty much straight from the slides and multiple choice. Grading and class was reasonable. He can be condescending and a tad off-putting but he grew on me.

I have never had a class with such a disrespectful professor before. He enjoys to pick on students. I have seen how he humiliates and embarasses students left to right during lecture and says unnecessary comments. Definitely has "favorites" in his class. Made me feel very unmotivated  and uncomfortable to even show up to lecture.

Dr. Fradkin holds his students responsible for the material he teaches. Tests are not fully multiple choice, so if you do not study, it will be hard to do well. His lectures can be dry, but his over-the-top examples makes it easy to remember concepts he has talked about. I remember more information from his course compared to other professors.

This class was challenging but definitely worth it! He is approachable and helps you out of you seek it, if you are lazy and expect to sleep in class, wouldn't recommend. However, if you work hard, the results are worth it, his tests are not difficult if you put time into actually understanding the material.

Exams are super hard. I had him for psych 142 and psych 10 and that is consistent in both classes. For psych 142 he claims his exams are written so that you have to understand the material not just memorize but I found that there is A LOT of memorization of useless details in them. For psych 10 the book was more useful to learning than lectures.

I honestly liked Fradkin. The only downside is that he loves calling on students, but that just assures you to be prepared for every lecture. His humor can be kind of dry, but he tries. He really is an excellent professor. He makes sure his students understand it and has no problem repeating and going over questions. Should attend to pass.

One of the most rude and obnoxious professors here at UC Merced. How did he get a job here?! First off, he loves to call on people so expect to be called on. He likes to make fun of students to be funny. He's not really detailed on what you have to study for the exams, so basically you have to study everything.

Professor Fradkin is great. I may have learned more in his class than I have in any other. His tests are difficult, so show up to class and study. He is very approachable, so go to office hours. If you are looking for an easy A this isn't the guy the for you, but if you are looking to actually learn, take him.
The test are hard. You don't get the tests back to see what you got wrong. Have to learn a lot of specific information about the disorders.

Exams worth 75% and homework is worth 25%. Each assignment is worth 8pts and  so not worth the work put into it. Do not take his class. TAs aren't helpful. He is very condescending and doesn't know what he's doing. Take another prof. Will call you out if you snooze in class. The other comments are right, don't take his class.
Great teaching style. Tests are not just multiple choice, but he prepares you for it. I took away more from his class than any of my classes so far. I would for sure take another class with him.

I had Anna for WRI 090, the intersections course. Do not take this class with her. She is so boring. The class is pointless YET mandatory. The assignments are so basic but you will dread going to class all the time. She talks for the whole 2 hours about things you already know. Please do yourself a favor, don't get classes with Anna!

Professor Anna Moncovich is a great instructor, Sparks Class on immigration was very interesting and if youre interested into politics or not this class makes you feel comfortable and welcomed. The reading assignment are amazing and the topics are straightforward and easy. Show up, do the assignment, and participate, youll receive an A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Anna is a good teacher. She assigns a lot of homework and presentations. Homework is discussed in class and the presentation are usually about our essays topic. No textbooks are required for this class . For our essays, she allowed us to pick the topics of our interest. For this class you have to earn your grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Anna is extremely helpful and caring. She is super understanding and wants you to do well. However, she is a tough grader and gives a lot of homework.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Great professor! Extremely helpful and kind. She is wiling to help and provides great feedback. Lots of homework and reading but she is definitely worth it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Anna Moncovich is a really great professor. Although she does give a good amount of work and can be cumbersome, it does pay off at the end. She definitely pushes your superficial thinking and writing in essays.  She is very flexible when it comes to office hours. I highly recommend office hours because she might give bonus points.
Best writing teacher in the world!! Very caring and is always willing to help.

She's so amazing!!! I'm so glad I chose her because she's wonderful at teaching. I've learned so much. She gives a lot of homework so don't slack of. She gives really give feedback during her office hours, so I highly recommend going to her office hours!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: if you want to challenge yourself, take her class because she's tough.  no free rides in this class,  there's a lot of work.  she's also pretty straightforward and takes no bull.  she really knows her stuff because she's a published phd from uc, irvine

She gives SO MUCH homework.  you really learn a lot but you have to do a lot of work, too.  Don't ever skip class.  At the same time, she really helps you out if you show up to office hours.  I did improve my writing but it was hard.

Anna Moncovich is an AMAZING professor very helpful and always has a positive attitude. As long as you show respect and are willing to learn she is more than happy to help you achieve an A. Sincerely recommend her as a professor..

Ana was really nice and she has a funny sense of humor. She really likes to help you do your best in office hours so be sure to go. I didn't think she graded that easy, you had to do your work. I liked the class and learned a lot about researching.
She is an pretty fair and easy professor. Attendance is a must. Her assignments are pretty easy and she is very helpful. Very nice and inderstanding
You will need to put effort to the class if you want to get a good grade, but she is always available to help.
Very nice professor, provided a lot of help and very lenient with work and assignments. Attendance is part of the grade so show up to class, I definitely would take her again.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: By far has to be the worse professor I have ever had. Does not respects student's times and wellbeing. Releasing us at 9:20pm and expecting us to have read 40+ pages and have written an entire essay prior to 11:59AM the next day. Wouldn't take again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I took Professor Kennedy over the summer for WRI101. Although the workload sometimes felt a bit overwhelming, it was manageable if you stayed on top of things. She is very kind and wants the best for her students. She is easy to get ahold of if you have questions too. I really do not like writing, however, she made the course enjoyable.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Took her for writing 001 in my fall semester of 2021 and she's really easygoing. Get to know her, ask her questions, and ensure to participate. Kennedy is always open to all ideas and makes you think broader. She can be a bit unorganized, but, I think her character is great. She is always open outside of class and fairly understanding of conflicts.
She is a great professor! She is understanding and although she can give a lot of work sometimes, it is still very manageable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Had her for fall twentytwenty online. The class was asynchronous so I cant really say much about her. She did however assign quite a bit of homework. A little too much in my opinion. Her grading is easy and sometimes offers feedback. A textbook is required in which half of ur assignments are going to be based around. Offers extensions if u ask nice
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: We explored genres and writers I've never read before, and had the chance to interact and create our own pieces. Class encouraged peer workshops. Very refreshing class, especially if you need a creativity boost! Because of Professor Kennedy, I've started writing daily and am working on stories held off for years. Take her class! You won't regret it
My writing skills has honestly progressed thanks to professor Kennedy. Shes nice and cares fo her students.
She teaches very well. Makes sure we understand the information that is being given. Clears any questions you have about the in class. The work load is what has been expected from the beginning.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Go above and beyond for the A+. If you have to write 250 words, write 500. And participate in class.
Really easy, doesn't read your papers just add a lot of content
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Takes the time to explain anything that is unclear. She is really understanding and cares about her students. Tells you exactly what she wants you to do for homework. Make sure to stay on top of your homework because it is easy to forget a couple of assignments and they make your grade go down quickly. She is my favorite professor.

Professor Kennedy provides a great learning experience and rather interesting seminars. The work may be a bit heavy for some (lots of reading and essay writing), but Ms. Kennedy is more than glad to assist her students. Student participation makes the class easier and enjoyable--the class should improve your writing given her teaching style.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I had Dr. Zawadzki for PSY 146 and he was AWESOME. Super understanding and if you need to extend the assignment due date let him know and he will. Exams were fairly easy with some short answer questions. Discussions on canvas were used for extra credit and quizzes were also easy. He is by far one of the best prof. UCM has!!

Had him for psych 146 The class is interesting and easy to understand.
It's difficult for me to focus in classes honestly & in this class I don't struggle to.
Best professor l've had yet! & fav class so far! course material is honestly straight forward & common sense. He's
understanding, u should go to class be he assigns in class work sometimes

I really enjoyed psy 146. He is a caring guy who will give you extended time to do work if needed. He really wants his students to succeed. Exams are short 19 q's, multiple choice with a few short answers. He gives open note quizzes and in class assignments ever once in a while. Also does discussion boards for extra credit. Highly recommend him.

PSY of gender. Not a bad class. Easy grader. Asynchronous. Open-book quizzes (twelve in total) and exams (four in total): multi choice + short-response. Drops lowest two quizzes + assignments (twelve in total). Four easy papers. Discussion board for extra credit (up to ten points). Prof. is very understanding if you need an extension on something.

Professor Zawadzki is awesome. He is passionate about what he teaches and I enjoyed going to his class. Tests and assignments were fair. If you take the time to do the study guides for the exams you should be fine. There are random in class assignments ,so don't skip class often. There are weekly online quizzes but those were reasonable as well.

I really enjoyed this class. He's very interactive for such a lecture heavy class. The class consisted of random in class assignment, 3 exams, & 2 papers. The papers have simple & clear grading criteria so they aren't scary at all. I really appreciated the chapter reviews he provided, especially the practice questions-some might end up on the exam!

It was his first time teaching the class but you couldn't tell because his expectations were clear on what he expected from the class. He is very caring and a funny professor, the material wasn't that challenging because of the way he explained it, and there would be random in class assignments so it's always better to go to class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: His tests are straight forward, he has his some of his slides online, and does a good job at explaining the material in class. He also has study guides online for you to complete.

Professor Zawadzki is very entertaining. Had a video clip for every lecture and tried to keep students engaged. Many in-class assignments (ICA) and online, open book, short, multiple choice quizzes. He drops your 3 lowest ICAs and your 3 lowest quizzes. Drops your lowest exam score too. Don't really need a book.

Professor Z is an amazing professor. He is passionate about the material and it shows. The lectures are interesting and quizzes are simple. Make sure to study for the exams because they are a bit tougher than the quizzes. His study guides are usually very helpful.

Best professor I have had at UCM. Dr. Z really cares about his students. You can tell when a teacher is passionate about what they do and he is one of those. Quizzes and in class activities easy and helpful. Highly recommend any class with him.

This professor is really helpful and tries to make class fun. There are in-class activities that counts towards participation grades. The in-class activities aren't hard, he will give you points if you at least try. There are 5 exams and the last one is optional. There are also online quizzes right after every chapter but they are very easy.

Overall this class is really easy. He gives out random in-class assignments to make sure you come to class, and if it wasn't for that I would've hardly gone. 4 exams, final is optional, 2 assignments and weekly online quizzes. Teacher wise he's really cool. He loves psychology and makes lectures fun and he is more than willing to help students.
Just study a lot.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: You're okay if you do good on homework, quizzes, exams, and participate in extra credit. He refers to the textbook frequently. I don't think he's a great professor. He'd always use the phrase "you should already know this" when teaching material, which isn't helpful. Every person I talked to in this class had something negative to say about him.
SUCKED
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Not reasonable with students as this year, we had to deal with on-going strike of the TAs. If dependent on extra credit it was hard to obtain. He never responded back to my email regarding my grade and performance in course. Did not even consider curving grades as many of us students failed his class. Lai teaches material fast and has heavy accent.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Lai was a chill professor, and although there is no attendance taken, there are pop quizzes every week during lectures. He has an accent, but he really tries to keep lectures engaging and you can tell he's excited when you participate.
grades will be locked entire sem and he will ask you to calculate it on your own, he talks too fast which makes it hard to understand the lesson.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Thick accent, hard to understand at times. Lots of E.C., just answering/asking a question in lecture gets you 1.5pts. HW is worded oddly, easy to miss a problem. Tests are similar/near exact to hw and quizzes. Allows a note sheet for exam, I wrote done hw problems to reference back to. Boring/repetitive lectures. A few pop quizzes, class is curved.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Mr. Lai is straightforward and just an awesome professor. Offers extra credit - which bumps up your grade a lot. Sometimes he is hard to understand but he is really cool.

Really great professor, his english might be a bit hard to understand, but he knows exactly what he's doing. I'm currently taking his psychology 10 class, which is mainly focuses on statistics. He's extremely helpful, and very thorough on his explanations. He gives extra credit for participation. 10/10 would highly recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Lai is rally great. He puts a great deal of time into his lectures and puts effort into helping his students succeed in his class.
Professor Lai is a great professor! he really cares for his students. The class is not hard at all easy A or B. gives extra credit. go to office hours he's really helpful.

I would  say the class is good, the first midterm wasn't bad, and the second one was way easier. Keke is nice, sometimes boring but he tries his best. The class is curved and he gives a loot of extra credit.

Professor Lai, is so nice and he wants his students to be successful. There's only 2 midterms, plus the final. He gives you opportunities to redo homework, & there's EXTRA CREDIT! In lecture, sometimes he's a bit confusing but if you go to office hours and ask questions he helps! There is quizzes so you have to go to class. The class is curved too.
She is a good professor though the class very mid in my opinion.

Initially, she seems pleasant, but her demeanor changes drastically upon conversation. She has a clear political bias, often imposing liberal viewpoints. The workload is hefty, and she offers little help. Her unkind behavior makes me feel unwelcome in class. She presents herself as kind, but this facade quickly fades.

Her class was fairly easy do not want to miss her classes since a lot of 'homework' is based on what was discussed during class. want to keep up with the readings and the 'free writes' which are graded and often times based on homework readings. Pretty chill, really helpful, gives good feedback, easy person to talk to. recommend. took her WRI 001
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: She has a unique writing style that does not fit most students' writing abilities. Attend office hours any time you write a paper to get her to take on it. If she tells you to rewrite it, explain yourself and she might let you keep it. In class, she is passive-aggressive and has subtle political biases. I did not feel respected in her classroom.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This professor is pretty self-explanatory for all assignments. She has clear rubrics and guidelines for each assignments and she has fun, interesting lectures. There is reading and she will expect them to be annotated (these will be checked sometimes), but the articles and books are pretty fun to read.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Nice+Amazing teacher she makes sure you know what your supposed to do She told me my essay stood out, that she liked it only to give me a B-. Shes a very tough grader most of my classmates had Cs even though they did all of the work. Look for other professors & pick the one with the best ratings, TRUST ME I wish I did this before taking her class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: You must show up everyday to lecture. She was quite rude and appeared to be nice on the outside but in person she can be very sarcastic. Her assignments were easy and was harsh when grading papers. I would never take her again. She made me feel uncomfortable and feel like a horrible writer.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She is very nice, and funny. She expects you to do the assigned readings and annotate, and participate in class, which is all graded. She really does want you to pass. She does not do extra credit, but she does let you revise your essays after she's graded them.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Heather is a good professor. If you show up to class on time and do the work required then you'll past with a good grade. She gives you two free passes to not come to a class which is rare in writing classes. The weekly schedule that she provides in her syllabus is useful!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Did not follow syllabus, harsh grader, humor is very often rude, do your best to avoid disagreeing with her as she will take it out on your essays.

I personally found her to be very nice but when it comes to grading she is pretty rough. Never skip the readings or miss any days because you will NOT pass! She can be helpful if you keep going for office hours so use them! Her writing style is very weird compared with other professors so don't expect an easy A. Essays are everything!

She was extremely kind and respectful. Her grading on assignments like lecture responses, and in-class activities were a, give her what she's asking for and you'll receive an A on it. Heather was a tough grader when it came to essays. Office hours are extremely recommended. Her sense of humor was likable, in my opinion.
work is simply busy work. she is funny. and easy to get along with
Very helpful nice and funny. she grades fast and returns papers in a timely matter. Strict over MLA. very attentive to whats happening in the class.

She made me work my butt off but I definitely thank her for it.  After taking her class every other paper I wrote I've aced and they were so easy compared to her work. Thanks to her I don't really fear writing long papers

The first month or so of the class is just long boring discussions from chapters of the book. Then some group presentations on chapters of the book. Homework is just a one page summary of each chapter. A few long essays but shes helpful and very nice. Doesn't have an accent at all and if you give her what she wants you will do fine. And shes hot;)
She is overall a good English writing coach. However, unless you plan to go to her office hours all the time you might not get the feedback you need.
Expected a mini essay every class period. XP
She was very particular about what needed to be included in the assignments.
She's really helpful and always willing to help her students. Go to office hours for help and feedback on essays. Make sure to participate in class discussions as well.
Very helpful teacher who is always there for the student. Very fair no favoritism. Class went by fast. Very nice and cares about the student.
She is a very good teacher and helps every single student out when they ask for it. I ask for help a lot. Mmmmmmm yesssss Ms. Mirzazadeh.

She is extremely beautiful. When I saw her I almost died. I loved attending class everyday because she is an enjoyable teacher who really cares about her students. You can talk to her about anything and she will work with you. Overall her class was so much fun and she is my number one favorite teacher. PLus shes really hott!!
make sure not to get on her bad side. all you have to do is show up to class and turn the assignments in. overall a really good teacher.
make sure you use turnitin.com or she will fail you.

Pluses: She's extremely nice and very approachable. Easy grader; just 4 essays (4-5 pages each) for the semester. Minuses: Boring classes wasted with small-group discussions that aren't productive at all; teaching style felt more like high school.  Overall, you could do worse, but there are much more engaging instructors at UCM.

She was very sweet and didn't have a heavy work load for the class. Very understanding and good feedback. Focuses a lot on meaning of the writing rather than grammar. She was an easy teacher and super chill, despite it being early. Definitely recommend.

Professor Devrick, was extremely caring, she understands that life happens and allows you to make up assignments. Attendance is definitely recommended as theres 'do nows' with your table mates in the beginning of the classes. theres 3 essays and a presentation based on the third essay, she'll allow you to revise your essays for a better grade.

Prof. Heather Derrick was overall my favorite teacher, she was so nice and caring. She actually tried to have a connection with you. Her feedback was always good and would never talk down on you, just ways to improve.
Best writing professor ever. Prompts were amazing for the essays and gave really good feedback. Would take for WR10 but classes filled instantly.

Literally one of the best professors on this campus. She really wants you to succeed in class. Her feedback is amazing and she will help you with anything. I really enjoyed taking her class. She allows you to resubmit assignments for a better grade if youd like. Shes very understanding. ugh if youre gonna take WRI 10 take her shes the best

Professor Devrick truly cares about her students and it shows. She allows for makeup work and always gives good feedback. She was one of my favorite professors this semester by far. Not a lot of big assignment's throughout the semester.

I took Professor Devrick for wri10 as well as sprk01 (gaming class) and she is honestly so chill. Very nice and youll always be able to talk with her if you need help with anything. Definitely recommend if you dont want to stress out on at least 1 of your classes.

the sweetest teacher. i had her for the gaming sprk and we played games majority of the times (some writing, you could get by w/o doing the reading). she allows you to resubmit your assignments to get a higher grade. she genuinely cares, and just wants you to succeed without stressing about the class

She gives you 4-5 assignments throughout the semester but uses 3-4 weeks to talk about the assignment and help you with each part. She makes it very clear what she wants to see in the paper. Just put in the work, attend class, and keep in mind the due dates and this class is an easy A. She has conferences to talk about your paper outside of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Wonderful professor, know what she is doing and provides a lot of feedback to her peers.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment: Gives lots of time to work on assignments, one-on-one conferences before final drafts of essays are due. Grades final drafts roughly, but gives you the opportunity to go back and fix things for a higher grade. Do all of your readings, which aren't long, and make sure your rough draft is mostly finalized for your conference and you'll get an A!

Allows you to revise most assignments and has individual conference hours for each major assignment. Devrick is extremely clear with her expectations and the course is straightforward. A decent amount of outside research is required, but as long as you stay on top of things, it isn't too much to manage. Would definitely take again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is very kind and cares about your success in her class. For each paper/research assignment she has students meet with her individually, which really helps. Spend time on her assignments, and meet with her during those scheduled times to receive an A. It is a fun course, and you get to decide what you will be researching. Would take again :)

She is a dry teacher but knows the writing process really well. Her class was mostly research based essays which made writing essays fairly easy. You always have a chance to get a better grade if you want which improved my grade. I don't like writing essays but she made the process really nice. I would say she is the best teacher compared to others

She comes off as pretty crazy and kind of unapproachable but she's really nice even though she is very outspoken. She'll edit your papers in office hours which helps but it seemed like her grading was kind of based on who she liked and who she didn't.  Class is hard... I was the only one who got an A and she actually boosted it from an A-.

One of the hardest classes ive ever taken. If you take WRI 10 with her you must devote the majority of your time to it. She grades very harshly and doesnt make suggestions on how to fix something unless you go to office hours. I would not advise taking this class.

Susan get's so much criticism because she is a hard teacher. But honestly, she was one of the most helpful professors I have ever had. She really teaches you how to write and I feel like I immensely improved my writing because of her. People get bad grades because they don't put enough effort.

Oh my gosh... this is by far the worst English teacher I have ever come across, and that is saying a lot. She constantly makes me feel inadequate in my writing, only offering judgement, not criticism but judgement. What kind of teacher does that? UCM students should not take a class with her, and if you do, drop immediately. It's for your own good.
she is so stric on grading, and most of the comments she give is finding the problem, not helping at all. not a good teacher
She is so strict on grading papers, and the comments she gives on the essay does not help me at all!she questioning my writing, instead of helping to improve. Not a good teacher
do not take writing with her!
avoid at all costs

Overall a really nice teacher and quirky, if you needed help she was always there for office hours and did not make you feel stupid when asking a  question. The subject matter was centered on sci-fi, so if you don't like that subject matter this class my be very boring.
She is goofy but when it comes to papers she is really helpful!!!
A great professor. She made class interesting when she centered the whole class theme on gaming and sci-fi. She has a quirky personality and is very helpful when it comes to papers.
Worst english teacher I have ever encountered, nuff said

Lets just say, dont take this class. She doesn't follow her syllabus  at all. Actually she gave us the final paper, which is suppose to be our final assignment but since she was so behind on her syllabus she also decided to give us her another written assignment .... a 2.5 single space paper to write. I hate this class.
Do not expect any replies to email you send. Graded are all entered last minute so you do not know what you have during the semester. Class is overall fairly easy.

You basically need to know the material until the midterm. After that it's unnecessary to attend lecture. The assignments do not require the knowledge that you learn in class (it was very confusing). Anyone could do them really. She's disorganized, giving only  assignments on the syllabus and we're not able to submit a paper that's due tomorrow
Pros: She is a pretty easy grader. Cons: She's pretty unenthusiastic. All her lectures are dense and has way too much info on the slides. To be honest, you might end up sleeping in class.

I thought that Animal Cogs would be an interesting class; however, it wasn't. This teacher is very knowledgable on the topic so I will give her that, but her professionalism is not on par. It took her til after the midterm to grade our first homework assignment. We never got our grades on time and final grades were submitted late. Unprofessional.
beware, she's very slow at correcting assignments/exams and posting said grades. it can cost you if you dont stay on her about grades
Hated the class. But she was approachable.

She is a horrible teacher. She doesn't show up to labs when she's supposed to. She cancels class to play World Of Warcraft.  And she always seems to be "sick."  For CSE20, she didn't include my final exam in my final grade and it took 6 weeks into the next semester for her to change it because she doesn't reply to emails.
Don't Worry
A kind professor and very willing to help students. If you have specific need she is very understanding. Textbook is a bit hard for beginner.
Too easy and not responsible enough. Basically easy A.
She would often cancel class and never returned grades for any assignments besides the midterm. Would often not communicate with students.

2 Midterms, 1 paper, and a final. Overall, his class was good and passable so long you do your homework and try to get help when you need it. His lectures are not the best but he really explains well over email if you need him to. Not too hard of class but better make sure you study for the final because it is hard!!!

I really enjoyed Gramada this semester and am taking him again this semester for PHYS009. The people that do not like him are typically the ones to not go to lecture or not do the homework on their own. I was successful by going to every lecture sitting in the front, going to office hours (he is actually very nice), and studying.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Without a doubt one of the worst professors that I have ever had. Sure the material is challenging on its own, but the class as a whole reaches a new level of difficulty when Prof. Gramada does not effectively teach. I have no doubt Prof. Gramada has a clear understanding of the material, as he has achieved a PhD in physics, but he cannot teach.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: His class isn't necessarily hard, but his teaching methods leave much to be desired. Test questions come directly from homework, so study those and you should be set! The in-class quizzes are too short on time so you scramble to answer it. Labs are an easy grade. Although his class isn't hard, it is VERY CONFUSING! The good thing is the curve
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Introductory Physics isn't necessarily hard, but having a bad teacher will make it seem impossible. With barely any relevance from homework to tests and a lack of enthusiasm in lectures, this class will be difficult. His class is very easy to pass, but to get anything higher than a C is going to be very difficult.

I could barely understand his thick accent and even when I could nothing made any sense. All tests are completely different from anything from the textbook/anything he goes over. Attend lectures for attendance points, but I HIGHLY recommend reading/practicing from the book while you're there. I spent more time doing the homework than learning.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: PLEASE AVOID HIM IF POSSIBLE! I've had Gramada for PHYS 8 and 9, and he is by far the worst teacher I've ever had at this school. He is very passionate and knows what he is talking about, but his accent makes it hard to understand him and the class boring. His derivations are unclear as he doesn't finish the problems. Makes mistakes, loses slides.

This was the first semester Gramada had a physics 8 class. He was unprepared, lost slides, made tests at the last minute, and didn't communicate with the TAs. His lectures make simple topics confusing and bore you to death. Homework every week on MasteringPhysics and some simple labs. The average on the final was around 30% and he did not curve it.

Honestly one of the worst professors. He doesn't explain anything and expects you to automatically understand it. His explanations are confusing and if you don't get it he scolds you. His lectures are pointless because he doesn't work through the whole problems. He literally makes you feel stupid.

Gramada is an Amazing professor. Yes he is monotone but if you really pay attention to him, you'll understand what he is saying. He cares about his students and wants them to do well. Go to his office hours, get to know him. The man is really nice and has a good heart. He made me wish I did Biophysics instead of just Bio! I love physics now :D

Professor Gramada is a great professor and definitely knows what he is talking about. Does he have the best way to project his lecture to the students, no. His monotone voice and sometimes confusing explanation may make you question why go to lecture. Pop quizzes every other friday

Not the best professor. Hes very monotone and doesnt teach well. Hell teach by deriving the equations that are used to solve the problems and will then only do a couple of examples per lecture. There are in class quizzes that are easy, only your name and to remember formulas, each worth 5 points. Its to make sure students come to class.

Lectures were pretty hard to follow even having taken stats in high school. The homework/recommended textbook problems can be difficult but if you can grasp the core concepts you will do well on the tests

The lectures alone weren't enough to complete the homework, so reading the textbook was helpful. The midterms were similar to the homework questions and those covered during the lectures. Her grading system was quite forgiving, as she offered three different weighting options and selected the one that benefited you the most.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: this class was made hard for no reason, with the complexity in teaching and all that homework, i don't think i should've been stressing over this class compared to my other upper divs bc it got me tweaking real bad. would not recommend her :(

She teachers her class in a very old fashioned manner. Tests are challenging and for the most part unrelated to the homework, or quiz questions. You are expected to teach yourself complex concepts, as she expects you to understand the math the same way she does(instantaneously). However don't lose hope a mid semester comeback from failing is doable

Professor Bongers introduces topics assuming that you have read ahead before the lectures. Her explanations are confusing to those who do not have a statistical background (I didn't take stats), leading to lectures that are hard to follow. This class has really pushed me to actually understand the concepts, as exams are entirely conceptual.

I love statistics. MATH032 isn't supposed to be hard, but this professor ruined it. Homework and exams were not really related to what I've learned through her lectures. Her grading was also too harsh. Moreover, she applied statistics to give biased conclusions to show that she is the only best resource. Honestly, my TAs were even better than her..

I wouldn't recommend taking their classes and take a different professor. Their grading scale is heavily reliant on quizzes/exam scores. Which creates a sense of urgency where you have to pass every assignment or you'll fail. Their lectures aren't as useful as her teaching style is very confusing and most of the time needs to be self-taught.

Supposed to be an intro class but does not treat it as such. Exams are worth 55% so its a make it or break it, even if u excel at everything else in the class. Doesn't like it when students seek outside help if its not her, but when u do get help she's very condescending & rude. No study guide, class does poorly on exams..take this course at cc pls
don't take bongers unless hearing "welllll maybe think of it from a different perspective" and doesn't admit their wrongs is helpful to you.

Unable to teach her students. HW and lectures are very unrelated to each other, The quizzes aren't bad, straight from the book and the hw but the tests are handwritten questions that are hard to understand and unclear on what they are asking. No feedback is given on your work. The course is taught like a graduate class so its very self-taught. RUN!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Professor refuses to help 1 on 1 and doesn't provide any study guides or any specific info on what to expect in tests. I've had a hard time focusing and felt drained by not only the TAs behavior but professors teaching habits
This class led me to drop out due to the grading and lack of constructive feedback.

This professor was a poor lecturer who struggled to explain key concepts clearly. The homework was often unrelated to the lectures, making it hard to connect the material. On top of that, grading was extremely harsh with little feedback, so it was difficult to understand where we went wrong or how to improve. Would not recommend.

Great professor and great person! Lectures make the topics seem easy, and exams are a breeze as long as you put the work in.
The only problem is that the homework is often unrelated to the lectures, which means you'll sometimes have to self-teach some difficult concepts.

Fantastic professor! Lectures are really clear and having practice problems gives you time to figure things out. Homework is very helpful for learning the concepts, but it can take a while, so start early. You might struggle a little if you don't have much programming knowledge, as there are mandatory python assignments. Tests aren't bad.

The professor is genuinely a nice person that knows a lot. She is helpful, kind, and fair. The problem is, she teaches an introduction course to stats like a graduate course. You have to really self study, and understand the material yourself. You don't get many solved examples to refer to (one of many reasons why her exams were confusing)
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Refused to publish any lect. notes, everything is self-study. We only got the lecture Q&A's done in class but with no steps provided. There was no study guides for the exams, she said you had to make it yourself. The HW questions made no sense to the lecture work, textbook is very dense. Lacks communication with TAs-grading was a unfair.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: If you've never taken a probability class in high school, good luck. This professor grades on how well YOU can teach yourself from reading a super confusing textbook. Office hours are a waste of time as she just makes you sit there and figure it out on your own or just refers you to look at the textbook. Never gives valuable or helpful feedback.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: O'Day is a very difficult teacher to learn from. Her lectures make the class seem easy with concepts being the main talking point. But the class is based heavily on Hw and Tests that go over material not taught in class and when asking for help she is very condescending and will not do much to help you outside of a curve that she always does.
She is my 13th reason. Long exams, Long homework assignment, I wish I never had to take this class. very rude, and not very helpful.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Lecture heavy & talks too fast. Lectures do NOT prepare you well for exams, need to read the textbook (Good luck, useless textbook. difficult to find important info). She adds too much information that is not helpful for exams (Beware of getting confused!) Only graded on few things so its HARD to boost up your grade & Midterms are 65% of your grade
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Peggy constantly makes you feel dumb and inferior and answers all questions very condescending. She literally throws expo pens at people to force them to go up to the board and laughs in your face when you get an answer wrong. She doesn't give enough time for lab reports and has assignments due the night before the final. AVOID HER!
O'day is a solid professor.  Reading is required.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She doesn't teach us anything in this class. Had us sacrificing our Friday night to turn in a lab report 5 days after we performed it and made us turn it in on Saturday. Unless lectures that doesn't teach us anything that we need to know about the homework.

Lots of really good information even if you're not really into geology... I'm a psychology major and found it all very interesting.  The field trip was kind of boring and it sucked that it took all day on a Saturday but we still got to go to Yosemite so that's always awesome.  Great professor.

Peggy is really cool. She is very into her field of study and does a good job at engaging even the most uninterested students. Have to study regularly if you want to do well. She does pop quizzes if she notices a lot of people missing from lecture so its best to go to all of them.
She also try to help and explain but sometimes it didn't work out.
Has hard material to cover. So much that you have to read. But cool yosemite trip and fairy shrimp hunt. Had cool ta.... Robby Root!!!!!!
Very Fun Yosemite Trip!!  Meets only 3 times including the trip plus one BS essay!
No Comments

Understanding of situations and is willing to remove those barriers if you talk to her. She is fair with grading, if you work hard for your grade, and give all effort you will get an A, I liked how she gives rubrics for everything and goes based on that, look b4 submit. Quizzes can get a little bit challenging. Regraded some assignments last min.

Course material isn't difficult but my semester she changed the amount of extra credit given right before she inputted grades and gave my team half credit on a group project because of a technicality. I was passing right up until I wasn't, interpret that as you will. Overall a disappointing experience which left me very resentful

Okay at first I hated how seriously she took projects I did, but after midterms I realized if you just show that you care and expand slightly above what is expected on everything she will be very happy about it. Also ask her to look over anything important and she will happily grade by the rubric before you submit it with things you need to do.

she's a great person & her main goal is to make sure students understand the concepts of all bio which is what I really like. I was in her BIO 005, and BIO 003. However, her grades were very harsh; her nature breaks and quizzes were confusing. Alot of homework and quizzes in which she didn't explain very well
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She was an awesome person as a human being since and as a professor she really was caring for the students education and was always trying to make everyone in the course feel special in their own unique way, she is awesome sadly she no longer teaches in the school.

This professor does not teach Biology that easily if I am being honest. The class feels really rushed with all the content being thrown at you and for an introductory biology class you are expected to know alot. Plus, there is a ton of busy work you are assigned every week so you have that to look forward too.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: SO, she has quite the agenda there are readings, inquisitive, frequent quizzes, smart work, nature breaks, lecture participation activities that you have to turn in. And if you're not logged into zoom on time she won't let you. She will call you out. Overall she's unfair took a quiz 6 questions 8 minutes, might I add some were short answer. crazy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I had Gomez as a discusión teacher and she was beyond rude. My sister passed away the week of finals made me take the final but before she had penalized me, in order to give me credit she asked for proof that I wasnt lying. Like girl were all adults here and thats not something to take lightly. I didnt pass the class by 1% youd think they care

Most assignments had typos, were poorly formatted, or some unholy combination of the two, making it hard to even complete the assigned coursework. Her tests are also quite long, placing a heavy emphasis on short response questions, despite only giving us 50 minutes to do it. Stay away from this course if you can! Do not recommend this to anyone...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Half the things she talks about are not on the tests. The test are poorly worded by the way. I never understand what she says during lecture and she only spends five seconds top per slide. Sometimes she goes off in tangents and it's not clear if that's important information or not. She expects people to know more than she teaches.

Class is horrible. Its not hard if you study but I have to learn things on my own because I cant comprehend with her way of teaching. Her test are horrible. They are heavy graded on free response questions which sucks. COVID happened and instead of leaving assignments as is or minimizing, she added another assignment for each week.

Honestly, not the greatest professor. Puts a lot of stress on her students and does not really care about the students hardships, especially during the Covid-19 outbreak. Her lectures barely cover the material listed on the exams, and has an excessive amount of questions on exams that are meant to be completed in the span of 50 minutes.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Kind professor, easy class. Participation isn't graded but will make it a lot easier to learn (obviously). Some of the activities were kinda goofy but its an intro language course so that's to be expected.

Professor Zhao honestly was one of the best professor I have been honored to have. He makes class very fun and he also has good practices for mandarin. The only part of the class that is hard is the language barrier but besides that Professor Zhao is an amazing teacher and I am grateful for him teaching me.
He was a very good teacher and he helped a lot with homework if you went to office hours. He made lerning Chinese fun and he always looks happy.

Professor Zhao is a great lecturer. He is very caring and understanding about the students' grade. He is accessible outside of class and has a clear grading criteria. There is not much homework (things due), therefore you need to make sure you do well on the ones given. Definitely would take more classes with him if i had not taken them all already
This professor was super easy. He had quizzes but basically everything you learned was on the quiz and he was very clear about what he wanted.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Made learning the introductions to Chinese easy and somewhat fun! Although he gave quizzes, they were fairly easy if you paid some attention and he is very lenient with grading. I would love to take a Chinese class with this professor again.

He's pretty easy, just make sure you go to class. He takes attendance and gives pop quizzes randomly. Always feel free to ask him for help, he's super nice and patient and he's always willing to help you out!
He's AMAZING. Made learning Mandarin for the first time so easy.

Hes an awesome professor!!! He let my Friend take her midterm a day after because she couldn't make it to class because she was studying for another midterm. He is a really nice person, but he is his English is hard to understand.
awesome teacher, he's super helpful and nice
great professor.
A nice guy, but not that most clear. His handwriting is horrible so copying the Chinese character off the board is pretty useless. Knowledgeable and willing to help.

Professor Kaiser is my favorite English professor. He is very passionate about the topics he teaches. His lectures are always engaging and fun. He is very intelligent and is an inspiration. He is able to add humor to his discussions. He is always available to help with any question or issue you may have. Very respectable.

Professor Kaiser is amazing!! Really passionate about the topics he teaches. Super understanding with assignments. Reach out to him if you struggle he will definitely help out. Work was consistent of 6 analysis papers (super easy), one 10 minute presentation (super easy if anything you want to go over the limit) and the final paper/creative project
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Professor Kaiser's class was one of my favorite classes I took this semester. He's overall such a good lecturer. He made sure to keep the class engaged and fun. Lecture and discussions are graded however, it is worth the time investment! There are a handful of readings but it isn't so bad.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Graded by few things--Get ready to read

comment: If you take his class, you will enjoy it to an extent you didn't think was possible. The class is very interesting and Professor Kaiser can find meanings to anything and it really made you think. Seriously, the best English professor. As you go through the course, you just realize how phenomenal he is.

Fun, easy class! Lots of books that add up and are very expensive all together. 3 essays over the course of the semester, grading is easy. 2 papers (midterms) graded by TA, final paper graded by Kaiser. Attendance is 20% of your grade, but it's worth your time going to class! Kaiser is funny & keeps all of his lectures interesting, to say the least
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Second time taking him and is now in my top fave professors!

Professor Kaiser is God's gift to the English Major. The man can find humor, philosophy and meaning in any text, and transfers this information to his class in a funny, engaging and informative way. Bar none the best English professor there is.
The class is pretty interesting but there are a lot of books needed for the course. About 14 books for the semester. beware. other than that the class is really cool!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I love Professor Kasier! The class is super fun and he makes everyone laugh during lecture at least once. Easy class, just show up and try your best.
Matty Kaiser, as we refer to him, it a real pal. You're gonna love this class if you take it.
He's hilarious but his jokes can be offensive. So if you could take it go for it!

He's a great professor and he's hilarious. You have 5 close reading due throughout the semester, but can turn in whenever you want, a presentation, midterm essay, and final essay. Each component is worth 20% of your grade. The class is really interesting and there are so great books.

2 years ago she along with Keith Alley-taught Bio 10. The class was quite difficult since there were 2 professors teach it. When it came to tests her part was easier. She is very easy to understand and gave out tons of extra credit on the final.

Second class with this professor and I can say confidently that she is skilled. I have taken quite a few biology courses, but this class has been the most informative to processes of the cell. This class is difficult, but you will be pleased with the sheer amount you will have learned afterward. Great prep for med school. Highly recommended.
Good professor! Very organized and detail oriented. It would be greater to have more office hours though.
So...difficult....
fascinating
This class was super fun and when I give the chili pepper...I'm not kidding :-)

Be prepared to work an extreme amount. This class reuires that you study the lecture notes like no other. I would not recommend this course if you have not had previous courses in Biology, you will be very lost.

this class is my favorite. the teacher is really nice and very intelligent. the topic is extremely interesting. the tests can be hard but honestly i dont read the book and still get A's. just be prepared to work a little and you'll have a good time. i'd definitely recommend this course.
You just have to study for your tests, otherwise this class is not hard. the prof is nice and is totally willing to help with anything you need
Study for your midterms and finals! Those are worth the most points.  You're gonna have to study hard.
Extremely knowledged and helpful. Fun class to be in. Take it.
Easy A

If you don't have an interest in the topic, the lectures will be feel very long. Lectures weren't mandatory, but the discussions were. Guidelines for some of the assignments were unclear, but were graded leniently.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment: Does not provide lecture slides so you just have to listen, sometimes there are pop quizzes based on the lectures. Assignments have no clear grading as there is a curve. Talks somewhat soft and slow so made me feel sleepy during lectures. Sometimes goes off front of class to walk around class to check. Slow lectures so might feel sleepy.

Professor Sifuentez is extremely passionate about the subjects he teaches, and is very eager to establish an open dialogue with students. The assigned readings for each week can occasionally be excessively long but the writing required on them is almost comically easy, and the subject matter is always fascinating.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Sifuentez is an amazing professor, enthusiastic and passionate about the material. Probably would not recommend it because there was a lot of reading and the course required a precis for each reading every week. The TA graded pretty hard for an intro class. No required textbook.
He was a coo professor. He talks about real stuff that we probably would have not known because it is not taught in public schools.

Had him for history 139 and he is honestly the best professor I have had ever. He is inspirational and is easy to talk too makes me want to be a better student. You do have to read a lot and is a tough grader but the grade you work for is super rewarding.

This is a class you NEED TO TAKE! His course makes you care about the world in a way you didn't before. He respects his students, which never happens with a professor. He is funny. The work is a lot of print out reading but he doesn't make you purchase any textbook. If you go to class & do the assignments you will succeed. I learned so much!!!

professor sifuentez is an amazing professor. he's so passionate about the subject matter of the class and everything he teaches is super interesting. the class itself is fairly easy, it's mostly based on essays. if you have the chance to take one of his courses, take it.

He is one of the most realist professor at UC Merced. He is really dedicated and passionate about his work. The readings he gives out are really interesting. This class made me change the way I think and question the things around me. If I could, I would take his classes again.

He's a really good professor, I like his teaching style and He's super helpful. He's seems pretty intimidating at first, but he's probably one of the nicest professors I've met. I also like that we didn't have any tests, just quite a bit of reading and writing.

Tons of material to read and quizzes and test can have tricky questions such as focusing on minor details more on major ones.  Lecture can be interesting at times but if you do bad on the quizzes and essay you pretty much fail the class. Most of the class had low grades. Don't take this class unless your really good at history.
One of the greatest and most inspirational Professors I've ever had. He gave me the focus of my study for my Masters. Take him, you won't regret it

This course was composed of tests and quizzes only, M1 (60% avg), M2 (61% avg), Final (89% avg), because the average was so high not considering that they offered 35 extra credit points, accused anyone that got higher than a 90% cheating because he couldn't believe people actually passed the final keep in mind that the final wasn't commutative. NO!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Get ready to cry everyday.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I was struggling so badly because this class was graded by quizzes and midterms only. He said he doesn't curve but then a miracle happened, during the final he gave us 17 ec questions. He was so understanding due to the strike. Bless his soul, he's honestly a nice guy and wants you to do good. His lectures were fun to attend. He's simply the goat!

Exams weren't too hard, as long as you went to lecture and listened to what he was saying you do fine. The exams were based on material that he spoke about, not on the lecture slides. Exams were open note and we weren't given any practice problems or anything. The only reason I wasn't a fan was that he would go off on tangents while lecturing.

In class pop / clicker quizzes count for way too much of your total grade (about 40%). These questions range from very easy to very difficult- he'll also throw trick questions at you. This drags down your grade even if your exam performance is good- and he doesn't curve.  0/10 would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Absolutely riveting lecturer, you are literally learning biochem from a world class researcher here.  His exams are VERY difficult to study for and they cover huge amounts of material (1 semester  15 chapters).  Lecture and discussion quizzes help pad your grade, dont mess them up.  Take notes in your book, it's the only way to keep up.
I didn't like how he graded and made it very hard to pass Bio 1 (an intro course). He is fun in lectures, but I wouldn't take him again
just takes stuff from the stupid online questions with a broken website he is really bad, also grades hard, get dulai if you go here, much easier grading as well

Hes not easy, thats for sure, but hes amazing at teaching and definitely interested in this subject. You are going to HAVE TO WORK for your grade. He loves talking about Grad school but it keeps us interesting. Continue teaching Andy!

Dr. LiWang is a great professor who loves to use the figures in the textbook. Make sure you know the significance of the figures and why it's there. Overall, he's a nice guy especially in office hours (since I went to every one). His tests are multiple choice which can make you doubt yourself, but his exams are doable, but more conceptual.
WONDERFUL Professor! Very helpful, easy to talk to. His exam questions are sometimes difficult, but they are multiple choice and he goes over the questions in office hours. Quizzes are really easy

I took him for both Biochem's. Great professor. Very passionate about the subject he teaches. He teaches out of the book but gives you a biochemist's perspective. Also gives you history of Biochemistry to make class interesting. This is not your typical bio class. You learn critical thinking skills as opposed to just memorization.
If you are committed to learning, he is willing to help you. The way he instructs is fluent and easy to understand.

Ridiculously easy. He gives you a 100 practice questions prior to the exam. He then chooses 50 of them and they are exactly the same on the test. Hence, solve 100 problems, memorize all 100 answers. Your set. Simple as cake. You have to really blow it to get a B in the class.
Easy class, terrible teaching methods. Never graded a single question until the final. Wasted 4 whole class meetings on "practice exams," which were never returned. Not that nice of a guy either.

Extremely easy class. 25% of your grade is attendance. 25% online multiple choice questions that you can do over and over again until you get perfect. 25% portfolio. 25% final which is open book open note. You have to be a fool to get less than a B in this class.
Hard material. He makes you feel stupid in front of the class when you don't know the answer.
He acts all superior and talks down to the students. Stay away if u can!
He is very boring and he has alot of errors in his slides. Also it feels like hes talking jibrish! i do not understand what he's saying! i do not recommend him or his class.

He is definetely not hott unless you like an older man who is balding. DOn't get me wrong he is nice and all. But hot def not. Nevertheless, he knows what he is talking about and really helpful if you ask him.

Stats is just boring; you just have to deal without it, on a brighter note though, its better then Calc. ;)  The prof. is really helpful though, if you ask for help, he will always give it.  at the end, you get the grade you deserve, given how much work you have done...
Best Professor EVER!!!!!!
ABSOLUTELY, THE BEST PROFESSOR AT THIS SCHOOL!!!!!!!!!!!  He's really REALLY HOT too!!!
Great instructor, funny, helpful, and easy to talk to.
Pretty much all powerpoints and you gotta make your notes and allat. At least she isn't completely boring to listen to though. Liked her lectures a decent bit
Aditi is a great professor and gives a lot of extra credit.

The sweetest professor and you can tell that she loves what she does. I do have to say that the lectures feel like an eternity because of all of the info given. Just pay attention and take notes and you will pass.

Aditi is a great professor. She cares about her students and gives extensions when you need them. It's so easy to do well in her class because she gives so much extra credit. There's really no excuse for doing poorly in her class. She is very kind and very understanding. She is very helpful and will answer any questions that you have. Truly a gem.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: I took this class in fall 21, so the class was completely online. The class is mostly just the professor lecturing but everything she said was definitely in the tests. She was very understanding and a great professor overall if you communicated any issues you may have. If you do the extra credit in the quizzes you will definitely pass this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took Chandra for Spring 2021. We had a good amount of vocab tests on which getting extra credit was very easy. Also had 3 tests which are not too bad if you take notes during lectures. There was also one group project. Overall the class was interesting and easy to pass due to the amount of extra credit provided.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Only thing I did not like about the class was the readings. Other than that super easy and interesting class. Professor is super lenient and caring. She also gives extra credit on your quizzes. Loved the class and learned a lot. As a STEM major I think this is a good GE.

I took her class Fall 2020 so the entire semester was online. She lectures the entire 2 hours on zoom, but if u dont want to attend live, you have the option of watching it on your own time instead (asynchronous). You have weekly open note 5 term vocab tests with extra credit. Besides that only 1 group project, & 3 time consuming open note essays.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Aditi gives dense 50 pages to cover within a week. The discussion posts are consistent busywork. A four page paper due every week for all the readings/movies we had to watch OUTSIDE of class, was an overwhelming strain . The ideas in the material could be to the point, but the way this professor structured the work was unproductive. Burnt out.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Chandra is a quality professor, clear and amazing when it comes to directions for the tests and class projects. Super sweet and caring towards her students and their grades and well being.

Only take this class if you need it for your major or else don't. She is so monotone and boring and its only interesting if you like learning about buildings. Plus she talks for the straight two hours. I wouldn't take her again because she expects you to know background info and its not even relevant.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Very wonderful professor. Be prepared to read and attendance is crucial to a good grade, but she is passionate and insightful. Also, she's willing to look over any work and give you tips. Very nice.

Course work consists of a few formal essays and several textbook readings. The workload, however, is manageable and the feedback provided in the essay conferences is extremely helpful. The only area for improvement I would say is with communication. I had a bit of a hard time reaching out to Professor Kitchen and scheduling office hours.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Feedback was great and helped me improve my writing. The only bad side was doing so many papers.

If you're looking for a teacher that truly cares about the environment and her students this is her. Lots of homework but there's no reason to fail this course as she offers lots of feedback and chances to revise your papers before handing them in.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is a very great professor!
If you get the chance to take Professor Kitchen, go for it! She is a great professor and will seriously help your writing skills.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: She's amazing. She's good. GOOOOOOOO. EASY A!
Callie was an amazing professor! made writing more fun! :)
Callie is a really great writing professor. She is very easy going but can be a tough grader and is not a push over of a professor, expect for all a lot pf class time to get work done.

Greatest professor ever! She's kind and she knows what she's doing, despite her being a young professor. Her class is fairly simple, just complete all of your readings and essays and you'll get by just fine. Attendance isn't even mandatory. Super easy to get along with, and she has a great personality.
Best professor I've ever had at UC Merced!  Makes core fun (something I thought was impossible) to take and is extremely nice.  Definitely take her class if you can!

Callie was an amazing professor to take for writing! She's funny and relatable to students. Definitely not an easy class as there is lots of writing but Callie makes every writing assignment as fun as possible. She is very professional and gives great feedback! Definitely recommend taking her!
Best teacher of my freshman year! Callie Kitchen is an amazing teacher
She is amazing, always willing to help and answer your questions... the best econ professor at ucm (out of the 5)
She is amazing... definitely one of the best econ professors at ucm (out of the 5) Always willing to clarify and answer your questions
She is one of the best econ professor at UCMerced. She has the gift of teaching.

More of a right-brain person than a left. Doesn't know how to clearly explain concepts. Gets caught up in ideas and  math examples fail. Notes are messy and not labeled clearly but are posted on crops. Honestly learn more with Justin in the disc than with her. Willing to help. 2 pop quiz questions beginning of every lecture. HW every week.
There is a lot of work, if you put in the time, you should do well.
Great Professor!
Good

She's tough but with good reason. She needs to prepare you  in order for ECON 101 to make sense. She is definitely always willing to help and if you actually go to her office hours your question will be answered. You may be confused initially but she'll get thru to you eventually.

Her midterms are extremely difficult!  Even though attendance is not mandatory, you pretty much have to attend class regularly to understand anything.  She is very helpful though, although confusing at times.
winder teaches a hard class but is more than willing to help every student understand the material. go to every class and every pre-test study session or you will do poorly!
No Comments

I loved attending lecture, I learned so much from professor Wallander. I took this class because I wanted to learn more about behavior disorders in adolescents, children, and infants. If it was not for this course, I would not be in the field of behavioral health, this class sparked interest in the field.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Professor was straight forward in lectures w/ clear simple explanations. Took Abnormal Psy before his course, he's doable in taking. Did have a bit stale tone of voice but was't much of a probably just on student. Weekly hw with reading hw assignments. Easy homework tho. Tests were more or less easy in taking. Lots of notes but time given to take.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the easiest upper division psych courses I've ever taken. It's an easy A, as long as you do all the homework and study for the exam. Homework is extremely simple and he gives you a study guide for each exam. It's pretty straightforward. His lectures can get a bit boring at times, but overall I think he is a great professor.

Super easy advanced psych class especially if you took abnormal psych. I never went but the day before the test and the day of the test. 3 exams and weekly assignments (but they're short and simple). I'm really interested in abnormal behavior, but his lectures are so boring and long so I never went. He was a really nice guy and knows his material.

I didn't care fro his class. He is very boring and he doesn't do the material justice. Unless you have to take Abnormal Child Psych, avoid him as a professor. Also, his exams are weirdly worded, but I don't think English is his first language.

Subject is very interesting but he doesn't give it justice. Tests are ok as long as you study and homework each week is very simple. My grade was boarder line and he refused to bump it so every point counts!
Awesome topic it's just that he does not talk loud enough.

The material is very interesting, even though lecture isn't always, but he gives you everything you need to know in lecture. Fill in the slides, study them, ask questions (he is more than willing to answer), and you'll get a good grade. I got the second highest grade in the class, and I hardly read. Just show up, study his slides.

His tests aren't simple per se but he provides you with everything you need to ace them. Do the study guides and you're golden. His lecture slides are basically the book but very simplified and it's all you really need to know. Many people seemed to do poorly on his tests but I honestly don't see how.

The subject matter is so interesting and the way he lectures just butchers it.  He's a knowledgeable man, he just doesn't translate well into an interesting lecture.  His lectures are more or less straight out of the book, so do the readings and you'll be okay.  His exams are ambiguous, multiple choice which is weird for upper divs.

Dr. Wallander is not one who likes someone to question or disagree with what he states.  He does not like to explain anything in detail, depends highly on his TA.  Exam questions are highly ambiguous and doesn't like to hear this as well.  Maybe he will be better than his first semester here.
Her exams were pretty tough, she also assigns a lot of homework.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I did not enjoy this class very much. Professor Jarrel was okay but her lectures were totally uninteresting and even after studying extensively for the exams , they were confused because of the way they were worded. I would recommend this class 1/10, only take it if you absolutely have to.

Professor seems like a super sweet person, but she often goes on tangents when teaching, awkwardly laughs at her own jokes, and is very quiet. On top of it, the lectures are boring, so paying attention/picking up what were supposed to is a little harder. That doesnt pair well with fill in the blank tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The professor is nice and goofy which is fun. However, the lecture material is very boring and hard to get through. She gives study guides for the exams which are SUPER helpful. As long as you take notes the class is pretty straightforward. The labs are extremely boring and 90% of them you can do on your own but they are easy nonetheless.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor seems like an amazing person, outside of class. I enjoy the material, but the lectures are very boring, I fall asleep almost every class and feel horrible. The Exams aren't completely horrible as long as you study, and the labs are a lot of fun. Just wish lecture would be more engaging and that she posted the slides
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The professor is sweet, soft-spoken, and goofy. The class itself is quite dry, and uninteresting, but the grading criteria is clear. She distributes a study guide for each exam, and offers extra credit toward the end. Also, there are  group assignments (super easy)  due every other week or so .
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: The material in itself was very interesting but her lectures were non-engaging. She doesn't speak loud enough in lecture, many times people will ask her to speak up but she still doesn't speak loud enough. Your best bet is to sit in the front of the class and take amazing notes. She does not post slides up and your tests are based on lectures.
Doesn't work with you at all. Boring lectures. Poorly worded/confusing test questions. Makes you buy the textbook - didn't use it once.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Tricky class if you are not  good at Bio but better than regular Bio. She is very boring (sorry), and her slides do not help much. Must focus on her lectures and take side notes. Her exams are the type of exams where you know it or you don't. Expect homework every week.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Everything you are tested on is gone over in lecture. Take good notes and you will get an A with no issue. She offers extra credit. She loves the area she studies and is very helpful. Study guides have all the info needed for tests. No tricks.
