Prof. Jarrell is very friendly and respects her students, and will be happy to help you if you attend office hours. There are 3 exams and she provides a study guide. The exams are straightforward (no tricks); if you use the study guide and go over lecture notes, you will do fine on the exams.
Avoid this course, yes it's online but her expectations are insanely high. I lost motivation to continue with the assignments tbh
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Its a little bit hard to pass her class with an A or higher because of how much she makes assignments worth. She's a nice teacher, but just has high expectations, I guess. I wouldn't recommend taking her class if you don't have a lot of free time since there is a LOTT of writing and reading.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment:
Very time consuming, assigns like 2-3 readings a week, and makes you write a lot in response to very simple questions that can be answered in a couple sentences.

Everything is worth +100 points, the reading reflections are usually worth +300. Good Luck!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: If you can avoid taking this this class do so!! her explanations are so extra it makes the homework and any other assignment confusing. also all her assignements are 100 + points so even if you miss one hw your just done. JUST AVOID THIS CLASS!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: For an online class, the professor does too much. Her explanations of the homework assignments are clear however, it involves A LOT of writing. She also grades harshly mostly on grammar. 95% of this course is reading and writing. If you don't have to take this course DON'T. It's very time-consuming and some of the readings are long and boring.

Professor Whitt assigns a lot of reading and writing. No matter how much effort I seemed to put into these, I get back Cs and Ds on these assignments  I honestly felt less and less motivated to work on her assignments as the weeks went by because no matter how hard I tried, my efforts seemed pointless.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Professor was good and provided a lot of detail. But be prepared to do a lot of reading and writing. Weekly or bi-weekly reading and writing between 1k-2k words. Able to work on your own time and provided one free pass to turn in an assignment late.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: There's a BUNCH of reading and writing (1/2k-ish words) but gives plenty of time to complete it. Instructions are super detailed. There was a weekly breakdown of what needed to be done and by when. Sent out lots of reminders to do our readings/homework. I appreciated how meticulous she was with everything because it left little room for confusion.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Unrealistic expectations. We have to write b/w 1500-2000 word reflections on reading between 20-70pg long each week. They grade so unreasonably that the extra credit assignments become mandatory (additional 1000-1500 reflections with ~25pgs of reading). Material is very interesting, but assignments & busy work ruin the class. Avoid at all cost!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Gives A LOT of assignments. She must forget that we are practically teaching ourselves and have other classes to worry about. Not worth taking since it is to time consuming and only wants us to worry for her class. Most assignments have word limits sometimes 250 words other assignments are 1000.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: The course entirely online making it difficult to keep up in the sense that you basically learn the material on your own and you do that through A LOT OF READING. She has about 3-4 assignments per week and 2-3 long readings for the week. You have to keep up in order to keep a good grade in her class as she makes her assignments worth 150-200 points
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment:
His lectures are very interesting, and attendance is mandatory. Midterm and final are very straightforward and clear, as long as you attend class or read the lecture slides, you'll do great.
Would recommend taking this professor whenever you can
Professor Jang was great. Home work every week but other wise easy to due with clear instructions. Mid term and final are both in person. Great lectures. Definitely would take this course again.

Prof. Jang is an amazing professor. What you see in the lecture slides is what you will see on the exams. In addition, despite the class being easy, you leave the class learning something. To anyone looking for a political science class, if Prof. Jang is available, I would highly recommend him.

Attendance is graded! The assignments are reasonable, as long as you turn in your work on time and completely you will do well. His lectures are very clear and concise and he explains them well. For the midterm and final exams, he provides a very put-together study guide, which helps a lot.  There are extra credit opportunities available .

This professor is amazing! His lecture content is clear and concise and the study guides for exams are also clear and helpful. He is great at incorporating student feedback into his teaching style and is always able to answer questions in multiple ways for those with different learning styles. Highly recommend this Poli Sci professor!

Professor Jang is by far the best political science professor. His teaching is very clear and easy to understand. He also provides many opportunities to get extra credit and is always willing to help students succeed. I would highly recommend taking his class.

His lecture slides and how he teaches allow you to grasp the concept and understand what is going on. He made POLI 005 very enjoyable and politics as well. He is super understanding and you can tell he wants his students to succeed.

For this class, I have learned so much! Although it was early in the morning, Professor Jang always tried his best to make it engaging. During the whole semester, he was super fair and made the class enjoyable. The way he explained topics in class and did his exams was very good.

Very chill professor, speaks pretty clearly and outlines material well. Make sure to attend lectures as there is always participation assignments. Homework was very easy. Study for midterms as they're harder than they might seem.
Overall great professor and really nice!
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof Jang is a cool professor and he provides a lot of opportunities to ace this class. He gives a lot of guidance for his midterm exams and the final assignment is split over the entirety of the semester so you don't have a lot to do when you turn it in at the end of the year.

I have taken this proffessor for two courses, "How to be an Autocrat" and "Institutions of Democracy". Both have been amazing classes where I learned so much. His style of teaching is something all proffessors should do because it engages with students and makes you want to learn. Great professor! :)

Awesome Prof! The class outline is really clear so you are well aware of what you are getting into since day one. Very great feedback and the lectures are easy to understand. If you need any further clarification, he is very understanding and willing to help:)

The class is super easy, his authoritarian politics class is running the same way basically you have one big project and a final paper, and weekly response memos. However, attendance is required because that's how he grades participation. The class is kinda boring but easy A so is authoritarian politics course.

Took in Fall 2022. To sum it up, "I do not believe in homework, I do not believe in midterms/exams" - Prof Menke. This will be the easiest A+ you can get as all quizzes were online and had unlimited attempts. Only place that you'd have to try a bit would be discussion.

We didn't have any finals for his class and when there was tests or quizzes it was posted so you can do them outside of class. Feels to be an easy class and even appeared just to follow along with slides.

Professor Menke will always make time for his students. He encourages the use of office hours and will even schedule to meet with students outside of his regular office hours. He gives lots of extra credit and unlimited opportunities for quizzes. He is very chill and makes lectures entertaining. He knows his material and teaches it well.
I thought he was cool I did all the work in his class but I didnt do the office visit, neither did 90% of the class and it dropped my grade by 10%.

Professor Menke had great lectures and was very willing to answer questions. There were no tests in CHEM001, so the quiz and lecture grades were important. He graded the lectures based on how many people participated on an interactive slideshow, so if not enough people attended class, everyone's grade would suffer (He only did this once, though.).

He's not a bad professor. He does not give tests or midterms. You must go to the lectures for credit, but the credit is not based on your personal attendance, but the amount of students who are there in total. Be prepared to read a LOT since the stuff covered in lecture is different from the discussion packets.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Not sure why other comments say he is a lenient grader or gives good feedback when he does NOT. 9 lab reports, but some experiments overlap. Must be very precise in the Methods section. He deducts points if you do not know the instrument model, background scan, resolution, etc. Horrible grader with unclear feedback. Good luck, you will need it.
Hes so nice and respectful. He always answered peoples questions respectfully even if they were already answered two seconds ago. He grades fairly and knows the material well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Erik is the best professor I have ever had for chemistry. I suck at chem but this semester I actually understood the material, and even ended up getting an A in the class. In chem in the past, I never would've gotten a C or better. His grading is SUPER lenient and there are more than enough points in this class to get an A. Amazing prof!!!
Erik is a very good teacher, he teaches mostly on the board without powerpoint slides which is helpful because he goes slower at brain-processing speed. He is a fair grader and is very funny.
Highly recommend Menke if you actually want to learn, but as for grade wise it is not. His midterms are super hard, so study up!!!

Patrick likes to hear himself talk and no matter what you say, you will be wrong and he will be right. He has interesting viewpoints, but it is mainly regarding the US as a terrible place that screws over other countries. Don't take this class if your not interested in History.
Patrick is awesome!!!
Wilkinson is the man! everyone needs to take his class in their college careers. very easy and just an all-around cool dude. very laid back

Patrick is my absolute favorite teacher at the U of A so far. He's so funny! He's truly a great teacher. He treats you like a peer, and makes sure to keep his class interesting. I definitely recommend him!

I switched into this class after reading Ratemyprofessors and I was not disappointed. Class was always lots of fun and we watched some very interesting films. Fairly easy as long as you do the readings and go to class.
tough but fair, enthusiastic about his work, really helpful, lots of fun, really enjoyed working under him
awesome field school supervisor! lots of fun. lots of help

easy if you go to class and do the reading. quizzes almost everyday. interesting and funny lectures. really enjoyed this class. assigned paper but you do have all semester to work on it...dont wait until the last minute like i did.

Awesome teacher. Gives quizes almost every day, but drops around 4 and gives some bonus. Interesting discussions every day. No tests, 1 easy paper and very easy final. Easy A if you don't totally blow it off.
Quite possible the greatest teacher to hit UofA. Go to class, laugh your butt off, read a bit and get an A++++.

Really great teacher, lectures most of the time with a few movies. Lectures are always interesting and he always engages the class. We always had readings and then easy quizzes when class started. No tests, just one paper that we have all semester to do, and the final. He's fun and makes class enjoyable. Highly recommend!

I passed the class but it was such a horrid experience. The grading scale is ridiculous, the exams are hit or miss, Most of all UNORGANIZED and no structure !! I can say with without hesitance that I learned nothing from this class and almost everything about the life of Miriam Barlow, since all she does is ramble. Lack of professionalism period.

Grade distribution of this class is ridiculous. Class is very unorganized. Expect grades for assignments to be imputed last minute. Semester grades are due in a week and more than half of my assignments have not been graded yet. Exam questions are very open ended yet they are hit or miss. Overall, this class has been a waste of my time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Miriam is thee SWEETEST professor! People here are complaining about her rambling and yeah I admit she does it a lot but I would rather have a nice/down-to-earth professor than an inconsiderate jerk. The workload is light, and midterms are super fair. I am a C average student and I had an A all semester. There should be more professors like her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: This is an introduction to python class for biology majors. Miriam is lost and disorganized and does not seem to have a firm grasp of programming concepts; she relies heavily on her TA who cannot communicate well with bio majors. 2 weeks in to "intro programming" she is having us do complex hw problems using classes and functions. Too much too soon

This class did not have a textbook and all she assigned were scientific papers, which I thought was indeed very helpful in preparing for grad school. However, she's somewhat disorganized. I didn't like the way she structured the course, but she is enthusiastic about the subject, I'll give her that. I probably wouldn't take another class with her.

Not a very good teacher. She talks nonsense and very disorganized. If you are taking this class with her, I suggest reading the book and going to your TA's OFFICE HOURS. Anything but hers. Not very helpful.

This Prof. was all over the place hard to follow. Nice person but very weird. I didn't learn anything from her my TA did all the leg work. She is easy but weird. The review she does is useless before exam. Try too get a good TA and u will be fine

Attend Dr. Barlows class and she created an interest in a type of biology I had considered was over.  She is clear, kind, respectful and inspiring.  Her class is straight forward and more than fair she is committed to the success of all her students.  I would take another class from her in a heart beat

All these posts before me are exaggerated. Miriam is a great professor, with a great background. She is more than willing to help. You need to be willing to work though. You can't expect everything to be spoon fed. Genetics is the easiest class in the biology department. If you struggle with this, then I don't know.

She is the worst. I stopped attending when all she would do is tell irrelevant stories about herself. She got mad that the majority of the class was attending and said that she will give important information that will be on the test. When people started coming to class again, she just went back to telling stories. I have no idea how she is a prof.

One of the most ridiculous professors at the school. She rambles about irrelevant stories for half of the lecture and then lets students vote on what material will be on exams (in some cases to cancel them). Material is very easy but lack of teaching makes it very frustrating. Avoid her if you can because it will be a painful experience.

Considering that I have already taken AP Physics in high school and that her explanations of basic concepts even confuse me, she's not good at teaching at all. I have to explain almost everything to my peers just for them to grasp her nonsensical yapping sessions. Don't take this wrong, she's a wonderful person, and she cares about her students.

If you've taken AP physics in high school and did alright you'll probably do alright here. This is a class that takes a lot of studying and communication with others if you want an A. The professor is amazing and caring for each student but the subject can be hard to understand with little to no prior experience. There is a lot of extra credit too.

+: Plenty of extra credit and a generous curve (1sign)
-: Hard to follow due to accent and speed; difficult hw late in the semester, no demos in class
Tips: Attend all classes and pay attention (sit in the front 3 rows), be comfortable with algebra, read the textbook, practice lecture quizes, wkshts, and disc. quizes. spread hw not procrastinate= A
Difficult to understand at times. Explains things with heavy math and equations rather than logic and physical intuition. Condescending to students.

Professor Vafapour is amazing. Although she teaches quick, and has a slight accent, she is still understandable, and extremely willing to reexplain concepts and is always willing to help students. She offers numerous extra credit opportunities, and ensures we have the resources needed to pass exams. Homework is long but beneficial. Overall Great!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: The lectures are hard to understand. She kind of assumes that we already know the topic. She does rely a lot on the TA's and the TA's do not care that much as well. She is nice and friendly, but she just does not teach very well.

This professor doesn't know how to teach. Inconsistent with her grading so leniency is dependent on TA, thick accent leads to misunderstanding, rude to students, jumps everywhere with explanations, and is very unwilling to help on any homework questions during office hours. Take it at community or subscribe to The Chemistry Tutor if you want an A.
She had decent lectures, but relies too heavily on Macmillan when it came to homework/quiz/test.

She's a pretty decent lecturer. Her lectures are bit confusing but the annotated worksheets she posts are helpful. She also gives a lot of extra credit and allows you to use notes during the exams. If you put in effort and do the extra credit opportunities then you'll be good. Would definitely take again.

I showed up to two lectures and she taught some of the most basic physics concepts wrong so I just never showed up again. Sometimes the solutions she'd give for practice problems were wrong and I'd have to help my friends out with it. Overall if you do get her as a professor I'd recommend teaching yourself (organic chemistry tutor got me an A)

physics 008. midterms are lecture questions (which are done for EXTRA CREDIT!) & problems from the hw. w/ a cheat sheet, write down word problems from the hw up until the test (w/ proper problem solving steps) and ur good. quiz 1 a week in disc, but prblms are in annotated worksheet from week prior. if i had known this, I woulda passed w/ an A easy

Really bad at teaching. Lectures consist of her writing on the whiteboard the entire time, while going way too fast and erasing it right away, not giving you enough time to write anything down. She also gets mad if we don't know what a certain equation means, after the second time we've seen it. Don't take her class unless it's your last option.
Never again. Lectures went on and on and on. Exams were pretty easy, let us have cheat sheets. Only learned some things because the TAs were really helpful.

She takes attendance for lectures and does pop quizzes. The lectures consisted of her writing on a whiteboard for an hour and just interacting with the first row of students who were also the only ones who could see and hear her. Overall her assignments seemed disorganized and unclear. She is understanding and willing to help if you ask.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: do the hws its key in the class and the midterms are all based on the hws. The midterms are word for word from the hws and all you need to do is study those until the exam.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Awful, doesn't even get the questions correct on her own study guides and examples. Only reads off of slides and gives clicker questions that are graded completely wrong.

Awful. Where do I even start. Typos on every exam and example. In class question grading was messed up you could show up every day and get the questions right and still receive a 10/50. Wouldn't wish taking her class on my worst enemy. Goodbye and good riddance!

Her class is lectured focused, and fairly easy. I thought it would be harder since it's in an "honors" class, but it was easy to get an A. She teaches well and makes sure students are understanding but like man, some people were struggling to understand basic numbers conceptually, so if you can't do that you might be cooked.

The teaching style is very lecture heavy with many backtracks and confusing changes. If I was not already good at the subject, I'm sure I would have struggled a lot in this class. Great extra credit opportunity, though.

The content isn't too bad but the way she lectures makes it so much more complicated than it needs to be. Lectures every single class and will use up every minute of the period. We were all honors students who struggled greatly on the second exam. Weekly homework that is fairly easy. I recommend reading the textbook before hearing the lectures.

Don't take this class. She creates these slides and build off of them in class by writing on them, but goes way too fast to copy down. while you're trying to copy what you can, she has already moved on. I've taken all the pre-recs for this class, and nothing prepared me for this. She makes it seem like were already supposed to know everything.

She gives too much work for it being an online class during a pandemic. She piles so much work as if you don't have other classes. She teaches well but is not too considerate about other things that don't revolve around her class. The group project she assigned is very unclear and basically expects you to use outside time to talk about it,it's hard
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: She is one of the best Professors in the Economics department. Her teaching style really helps students learn and understand the difficult material in the hardest Economics course offered. She care about her student's well-being and is very engaging during OH. She provides a ton of opportunities for students to prepare for graduate school in Econ.

Professor Sheth is a really great lecturer. Although this course is known to be difficult as long as you put in the work and prepare ahead of time she is relatively very flexible with the class when it comes to deadlines. Really fair in evaluating feedback. The fact that the class is small makes it a lot better to communicate and learn.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Sheth's Advanced Econometrics class was no joke and many of us did not do well. Her style is very theoretical and lacks examples to implement what she teaches you. The information was so difficult to grasp that many of us did not do well on the tests with open book and even the internet available.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Class is straight lecture - she just continually talks. No participation from students and studying through the PowerPoints were useless because all the important parts are blanked out and you can only get the answers if you go to class. Tests are difficult because she doesn't provide any direction in how to study but she's an easy grader.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He talk a lot it's hard to keep concentration though, but all the work is pretty easy but it's annoying
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Online Savvy

comment: The readings are required to get a good grade and for the discussions, but as long as you answer the TopHat questions, you're all good. Only one writing assignment and two exams. While attending the lectures was not mandatory, it makes the exams and writing assignment super easy because he reviews the expectations during lecture beforehand.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: The exams are hard and not recommended.

The class wasn't as difficult however the exams were the only thing that mattered in the grade book which made it a little hard to get a good grade in the class so if you can't study good for the exams I wouldn't recommend choosing this class. There are only 3 exams throughout the semester.

Dr. Lor is one of those professor who genuinely cares for his students well being and education. His instructions are clear and organized. Very educated in his field. Although the grade is mainly on those exam, reading those chapters and following his study guide truly helps with being successful in this course.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Grading system is completely messed up. Only 4 things go in the grade book for the entire semester. 10% Discussion, 20% First Exam, 30% Second Exam, and 40% for the final. These exams while not particularly hard, draw upon concepts brought it up in both textbooks and lectures, which are honestly quite dry.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Professor Lor's teaching style is a perfect blend of enthusiasm, expertise, and approachability. He possesses a rare ability to make even the most complex concepts accessible, we did do group projects which at times could be stressful if you get a bad group.

Lots of reading and there are quizzes on them but it short so make sure to read. I really enjoyed lectures, even though he doesn't take attendance you should really go since they are very helpful. I would def take him again!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: There was a lot of reading in this class, and while attendance isn't taken lectures are mainly discussion based so it does no good to miss more than a week since he does expect you to use material taught in your papers. Other than that the course was amazing and professor Lor was too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor is really passionate about what he teaches. He makes learning fun and gives amazing examples. I really enjoyed his class and what we learned. His class isn't hard you just really have to study for the mid-term.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Lor is perhaps one of the best sociology professors I've ever had. He is passionate about the subject and cares to genuinely be a mentor to his students. He made class lectures interactive, interesting, and fun by being very relatable to our experiences and I liked that it was discussion post based. Helped re-ignite my love for soc!

few assignments but doesn't grade anything at all until the end of the semester so you're left wondering what your grade is or what can you do to improve. no grade also also means no feedback that'll help students for other assignments. nice teacher but strict grader so you got to do really good on the papers
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Not very encouraging. No enthusiasm which resulted in a boring class. Dreaded going to her class.

lot of writing assignments which included memos and midterm/final papers. she didn't grade anything until the end of the semester which leaves you wondering what your grade is and whether or not you're doing well in her class. lectures were interesting-sometimes watched films. do your best on all writing assignments. very kind & funny

Professor was very caring and acceptable of anything that happened outside of class as long as it was communicated class material was not very hard had her back 2 back in another class overall enjoyed having both her classes. she responds very well to participation and encourages it.
She was slow on grading, but it was only a few assignments that weren't too difficult. She is very nice and understanding I would take her class again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: There is not much to do in the class since there is basically only one assignment and it's a paper due at the end of the sem. Though, we do like little assignments that lead up to the paper due at the end. She is just overall a great professor. She makes sure that everyone understands what is being taught and encourages participation.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: There are little assignments but she is slow on grading so you never know what your grade will be by the end of it. She is also a tough grader so since there are a little assignments one bad score can drop your grade a lot.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Loved how textbooks were not needed at all. It's more interesting to do readings on different articles instead of one big textbook. Doing the readings will help with your papers, so it is recommended to do the readings. There are also no tests/exams, and mainly paper-focused.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: She was very understanding! Did not require any textbooks, which costs so much. Her lectures are very interesting as well as the topics in the course. She assigns many readings, but it makes up for the no daily homework and no tests. As long as you do your readings, you'll be able to do your papers just fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: HORRIBLE. Takes forever to grade, overly political, and has horrible grading criteria. Her assignments are never clear which lead to inconsistent grading. She acts nice but is very difficult to reason with. Do NOT take her unless you want your GPA to sink.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: The lectures were great, and she is very nice. Although there are little assignments, she is a tough grader, so you really need to get good scores on all assignments if you want to pass.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: UC Merced literally screwed over my GPA giving no warning whatsoever about the professor change and this professor only has two exams (WARNING: majority of things on the study guide DON'T show up) and five assignments. TA graded super picky and would make rude comments when you ask for help. Brown says he curves, well not enough for the difficulty
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He's a good professor and I found lectures to be really informative. But going to lectures is a must since his slides are usually over 100 and he ends up skipping a bunch of them during class. Exams are difficult and only has five assignments during the semester.

Forced to take this professor bc the og changed schools, I literally hate this class the professor says one thing and then the TA says another (listen to the TA bc they're the ones grading stuff). Got the lowest score I ever gotten yet on the 1st midterm bc of it. Brown is funny, but funny ain't gonna help me pass.

This class wasn't bad. There are only a handful of assignments in the entire semester which are pretty easy. His tests are heavy, and most people don't do great, but he knows that and curves them. The lectures sometimes could be boring but overall the class was actually enjoyable.

Do not take his class if you would like to pass. He only has 5 assignments throughout the semester which means his midterm and final really affects your grade. His exams are awful and the highest anyone in the class got was 80% and the average was 40%-50%. Then he only offered 2 points extra credit.

To be completely honest, this has to be one of the toughest professors Ive had. Its completely understandable to have heavy lectures but hed have over 200 slides. Hardly has assignments or extra credit. His exams are worth 50% of your grade. His cheat sheet guide with terms arent helpful at all. He admitted to having hard tests and has no mercy
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: The material given in this class was too much. He would provide us with a ton of lecture slides ranging from 59 to 200 slides each lecture. This class stressed me out and the cheat sheet and exam reviews did not help. Make sure you go to class and pay close attention. He does a lot changes on the grades as not a lot of students pass his exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Brown is very friendly & approachable, however his lectures can be heavy. He tends to go off on tangents during class, & honestly I feel like I haven't learned anything. The only reason why I passed is because he allows a cheat sheet during exams, which there is only 1midterm, 1 final & 1 book report, there are some in class assignments.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Brown is the worst teacher I have had at UC Merced by far.  His lectures are incredibly boring and show almost no understanding of public health.  He also makes a lot of "jokes" that are not funny.
Dry lectures with no enthusiasm, study guides given for the midterm & final but did not pertain to what was actually on the exams, and assignments graded poorly. One of the worst classes I've taken.

You must attend every single class! I cannot stress that enough with this professor. If you go to him during office hours, he will try and help you understand the material, but make sure you pay very special attention to everything he says in class. Keep up your interest level, and you'll be fine.

Very simple class if you do all the assignments. Its just that you should NOT be shy and attempt to connect with her. She usually forces you to read your papers (which she has assigned as HW) aloud to the class and others may state their comments at the end. She enjoys discussing-seeing CREATIVITY and DEEP THOUGHT.
She was an awesome prof!!! She likes creativity and deep thinking.... Go to her office hours to know what she expects from u and you'll get an easy A
I love her!! If you are a shy person & dont like speaking up, you should find another professor. I would say to give her a try && you will absolutely love this class!!
Wonderful Professor! Cares about her students. I loved going to her class :)

She's a great teacher. At the end of the class she asks what grade you think you deserve. I barely did my work but said I deserved an A, and that's what i got.  Just make small talk with her. She likes to connect with her students.

The class expects more than a WRI10 class should of its students. The teacher is great, but the expectations may be unrealistic. Community involvement is a must, as is on-campus involvement. Don't take this class with this prof. if you're pressed for time.

She was a really entertaining teacher. easy to say you will never get bored. Her essays are always on really random and broad topics she expects you to interpret yourself. The class wasn't difficult if you did your work on time. If you dont like reading aloud, don't take this class, because she makes you read your essays in front of the class.

Great professor. Although I never saw her rude or discriminatory towards students. If you like class discussion, she does discuss alot! (which is great because it is also very entertaining. Definitely take the course!

She loves to discuss which means ask a lot. You don?t need to read all textbook but read as much as you can because her assignments are NOT clear. She is rude to students and discriminates your color. If you love to read, write, and discuss, take her. You may have fun. Otherwise, take other course.
very very very hard teacher. she is not clear in her assigned work. I took this class for fun and now, I might not even pass.
Horrible teacher. Always rude to students. In a bad mood everyday. Grades hard. Too many assignments.

Just show up and do the few assignments she gives and you'll be fine. The class gets redundant as we read the same play aloud twice. The class discussions, which should be the meat of a class like this, are pretty weak so I don't feel like I'm even learning. Just an easy A.
EASY A! Just do all the Work! A very approachable Professor!

This course is slight different than her 102 and 103 course. There is more discussion involved. Each week you have to submit 2-4 questions. You also have to do a powerpoint presentation and one paper. Perfect attendance earns you extra credit.

Great teacher! Absolutely loved her lectures and is a wonderful person outside of the course. She is so helpful and extremely passionate about what she teaches which makes it easier to understand for students. I hope to take another class with her.

The truth is, you don't have anything on Prof. Ramicova. She's smart, snappy, and fashionable to boot. If you think you are too good to learn something about history or human behavior, then don't take her. But you are the one missing out.

Very smart and talented. She makes the lectures herself and they are rather interesting. No textbook! She dresses well and compliments students also. Very easy A if you just do the work, which you can access answers to on crops. You'll most likely have a super fun time doing the 2 midterms and maybe even the 3 essays. Research project was no sweat.
She is an amazing woman. Easy A. Just do the work. Class is out of 100pts. Don't miss more than 10 pts you'll get an A. It's not  super easy to not miss 10, but possible.
Easy A. Attend all classes and do the essay at the end, guaranteed an A.
Very clear instructions. Easy grading. Attend all class meetings and do the work, easy A.
I love Dunya!
Very nice, EASY A!

The majority of the students who do not pass his classes see him as a tough professor who is not willing to help, which is definitely not true! He is patient enough to go over themes and concepts and is willing to go over questions on exams especially if the majority of the class found it difficult. He's an awesome professor in general!

The biggest opportunity to improve for this professor is to consider what HE can do better. A great professor is intuitive about how to help students understand the material and then act tactfully. He is passionate about the material, but seems to forget that teaching is also an art.
really helpful if you just ask him. he is really clear as to what he wants you to do in the class.
He is a great professor and is beautiful. Should be a model for watches or something.
great class, i learned a lot and he was really helpful when i had questions.
perfect and beautiful human who teaches a glorious class. did i mention that he is beautiful. the only way you can fail is being distracted by his beauty ohmygosh
This is the sexiest teacher that has ever graced UCM's campus. His cold and unforgiving attitude really turns this dong on if u knows wut I mean. I wasn't even sad when I failed mang.
Just study and you will do fine

DO NOT expect this to be an easy class. He tests you on CONCEPTS and FACTS from both lectures and readings. Make sure you pay attention to his lectures and READ the assigned books! Expect to read about 600-800 pages of text for the semester. Lots of materials will be on Architecture because that's his passion.  Average on exams is around 75%. GL!
if you like art history do not take this class. no one did well on the midterm or final and he refuses to help

Feels the need to make a point to those he considers 'disinterested in art history'. The point: if you are taking this course for 'easy' gen ed credit be warned that his tests do not accurately reflect lecture and text as he 'dictates'. He calls this 'nuanced' test taking. He also encourages you to drop the course if you do poorly on his tests.

She is agreat professor overall. She does give a lot of workload a week. For example maybe three assignments and a quiz that is due every Thursday and then another more assignments due Sunday. It does get tough at times but as long as you email her and go in her office hours, you'll be fine. She gives great feedback on writing. Kind and respectful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Although Professor Memmott is quite strict, a tough grader, and gives a lot of work, she truly cares about her students. She's really kind, friendly, and is always willing and happy to help her students.

Requires the most of her students. This class was literally exhausting. If you are an engineering, do not take with Fiona. The class is not structured for natural sciences. This class revolves around bio, cogs or psych. But even then, she does not have any assignments that actually seem beneficial. It was more about rewriting other peoples work...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: She is an amazing professor. This was my first year taking a university level writing course, and she made the transition very smooth. Of course there was lots of work to do and she has high expectations, but she is doing this to prep you for future college writing. She takes the time to read your writing and tells you what you can improve.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This class is a waste of time. You will not learn anything. This class was easier than high school English class.

honestly, Fiona isn't that bad of a professor. do the work and you'll pass. the workload can be a little much at times but overall she explains everything so the instructions and guidelines are very clear. I would take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She is terrible, avoid at all costs!

I love Professor Memmott! Her lectures are very detailed and she walks you through what she expects in an assignment. She doesn't like to waste time, so you're always doing something in or outside of class, but the assignments aren't difficult. Super nice and gives good feedback on papers. She really likes when you participate too.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She indeed wants to prepare you to do well in your other college courses. Papers are 50% of the grade, and in order to achieve a good grade in papers, you better ask and follow precisely of her feedback. All of her homework assignments are time-consuming, and collaboration with your group members (even outside of the class) seems important.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Irish accent is great. Really cares about making class enjoyable.

Fiona Memmott is by far one of the most mind-numbing professors I have ever had the misfortune of work with. I worked with Fiona for quite some time and have come to learn the type of professor she is and it is one I hope to never have again. Yes, she has drive and motivation to do her job, which is fine, if she were working with elementary student

Dr. Gaab is always a fun and delightful person to talk to. As a research assistant for her, she always provides clear instructions and trusts us to do a great job. She is fun to work with and is easy going. I enjoy every minute we have a meeting and do assignments. She is very well organized and is passionate about the work she does - shes awesome!

Erin is not only a great professor but also a great person inside and out. She is very passionate about what she does and is always willing to help out her students. Very responsive to emails and always gives feedback. She is also very understanding and easy to talk to!

Erin has amazing leadership skills and her ability to coordinated a diverse array of people into accomplishing a goal . Her teaching style is easy going, open and aproachable. She is very proactive, optimistic and easy going, without letting go of being responsible and focused. It has been a pleasure working with her.

Dr. Gaab is an exceptional researcher with clear goals and explanations. I always know what's expected of me in this class and is always treated with respect. She's also very helpful in clarifying things and I've learnt a great deal from her.
One of the best professors here in UC Merced. She is easily approachable and always available if you need help. She is well organized and explains things clearly.

It shows that Erin is new to teaching. She reads from the lecture slides, and the lecture slides are straight from the book. She does not seem to know much, but she is probably just nervous. Make sure you (re)read what is assigned shortly before quizzes as they may contain minute details. As a person, Erin is very easy to talk to and very calming.

Good new professor. Really interesting class, but you have to do the readings or you wont do well on the tests or quizzes. She really loves kids and talks about the ones she researches all the time. Shes really open to talking about anything in office hours. She will help you if your not getting it but you have to ask for it.

One of the best new professors here. Used a lot of examples from her research, which is really interesting! Really open to talking about things in office hours. If you want to get on her good side, talk about kids. She loves kids (especially the really sick ones she did work with). Tests are fair, but you have to do the readings.
really interesting health psych (psych147) class. seemed a lot less passionate about stats (psych10) after the first week. high expectations. hard tests, but reasonable. really wants to help you.

She is the worst psy teacher i have had at ucm. her lectures were boring, she read straight off a piece of paper, and her lectures were 100% word for word the book. she was very confusing, unclear, and inconsistent with her class expectations. her tests weren't too hard though, you don't even have to go to class just read the book.

Really nice professor but needs to work on how she teaches, it can be very confusing. She makes up for it by being really helpful and will help you if you are lost. The hw can be tedious, but is crucial to acing the midterms if you do it. There are 2 hw+quiz questions every tues so be prepared. She uses tophatmonocole its $20 subscription so have $

I really like and respect professor Yeh, he really cares about his students, he is funny and nice, and is willing to help if you don't understand the material. The midterm essays are fair, and as long as you try you can get an A in this class! it was interesting too. He is a great teacher! He is really understanding and wants everyone to get an A!

Funny guy! he makes the topic interesting, even war & international conflict. He uses examples that are easy to understand, if you do the work you will get an A, he is fair and he is a nice guy & approachable. Would definitely take again! He is a good teacher
Very interesting class! Taking his class really helped me develop a strong interest in international relations.
Great professor. At first accent is a little thick but you get used to it.

Professor Yeh's lectures were very interesting and he was always energetic and well-prepared for the course. The multiple exams were tough though, but I managed to get an A minus from THREE extra points!!!

This is the toughest class I had among my political science courses, but Professor Yeh did a great job helped me to be better prepared for other upper division courses! Exams were hard, but reasonable.
Interesting lectures, but hard exams! I needed to study couple days for Prof. Yeh's exams, but it paid back!
exams were multiple choices, not easy and not my style, but was able to make it through with a B+. and he did explain those theories good
Lots of readings, but the exams are not too crazy. Always there when you need to ask him questions, and he is very approachable!

exams are reasonable. randomly take quizzes, so attendances are semi-required. once you got the ideas, then it is not too difficult to get a good grade in this class. FYI: good and easy extra credits!
He's ok, not too helpful and the topics are pretty boring. He also give unrelated clicker reviews that don't pertain to any reading or material in the class. The material is pretty easy.
I definitely recommend taking his class! He is a super chill professor. I actually learned a lot in his class AND I enjoyed attending class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: fun and chill professor. Super caring and kind and gives clear instruction on what he expects. 10/10 recommend. He wants participation but just don't look like you don't want to attend his class and he will give you those points. Understanding and can bond with him just like a friend!

Such an amazing Professor! Starts the semester grading a bit hard on the first paper but do not be discouraged because he grades much lighter from then on. Put effort into your paper because he can tell if you just typed it all the night before! Participate and go to office hours and you will love his class! He is also a super chill professor!

Kennedy's a really cool professor. He's funny and kinda weird. Really great at explaining what he expects from students and more than willing to work with you. If you're looking for an exceptional writing instructor, Kennedy's your man.

He's a great professor, grades really easy and understands that students have a lot of work outside of his class so he gives sufficient amount of time for each work and accepts late work if students have a good reason for being late. Understands reasonable absences and help you work out a solution for make up work. Feels like a high school class.

Kennedy was overall a good professor. He runs a tight ship, & at times I felt like his class was run like a high school class. However, he was probably one of the most organized professors I had, he had things graded within a week & always gave clear & helpful feedback on work. He can be frustrating at times, but you learn a lot in his classes.

Great guy! While the assignments were tedious and long, he gives enough time and makes sure to go over rough drafts in class. He genuinely cares about the success of the students and the material in the assignments since they are personal.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great professor! Gave great feedback on papers. He truly wants you to succeed in the class and in WRI010. Classes were very interactive and were an open platform for conversation. He touched on very sensitive topics, of which I may not have agreed on all, but he didn't shove them down my throat like other professors. Loved this class, and will miss
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Would take again

comment: Professor Kennedy is a clean dude. He cares about his students and gives an appropriate amount of homework. Participation counts so be ready to discuss in groups or even to the whole class.

Professor Kennedy was an organized professor. The writing 1 class was well structured and easy to follow. He also understands that his students have alot of other course works to do, he gives right amount of work. Participation do matter, he takes attendance everyday. He try to engage the class, always try to make it entertaining. Great prof
Take his class! He's very helpful, just go to his office hours if you need any help. His writing class was fairly easy just make sure you show up and participate.
Awful experience

Terrible professor. He will not help you at all if you are stuck on a problem, he just calls you out in class and makes you do the problem again with no assistance. Also if you format the pre-lab wrong or don't do something to his satisfaction, he won't let you do the lab. Would dropped him if I could! Stay away from him!

dont even think about it. he will make you suffer trust me. I hated him and his formatting. He is such a harsh grader that does not care about you. he will make you fail without any doubt. If yo even want a C, please take someone else. You literally have to work to even get minimum C. PLEASE DO NOT TAKE HIM. HE IS THE WORST of the WORST
If you see his name, drop the course immediately.

I didn't have Chris as a TA, but when I came to office hours he had a little following of A students that he took under his wing to help succeed. I would occasionally stop by his office hours and every week he worked through the post lab with students that made time to come by. Of all the TA's he offered the most office hours and was super helpful.

Professor Robledo was my TA. He was ready to help me during office hours and was knowledgeable about the material. If you're confused about lecture material, you can always ask him for help and he'll explain everything really well. He's eager to help students. He's ready to teach anything from the beginning to make sure you understand the material.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Chris is very uptight and does a lot when it comes to grading quizzes. He won't accept the quiz after a certain time even if you had a problem turning it in. Wants you to understand a problem first and doesn't really explain anything to help. Please choose someone else if he is your professor.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Chris is one of the most uptight people I've met at UCM. The dude takes his job extremely seriously. Most CHEM or BIO majors had some course with him at UCM and most have horror stories. 0s on lab reports for wrong formatting, making your group stay late to clean the speck of dust on a flask, getting a 0 on your quiz for not immediately stopping...
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: He is super picky during labs and will not let you leave until after he checks your work area to ensure that not a single drop of water is left on the flasks. Tough grader: takes off too many points on labs and assignments for unnecessary issues. Do not recommend.

He's definitely a tough grader. Will not help you during his office hours, he expects you to know the material before hand and sometimes gives unsure answers back to you. Nickpicky on a lot of his work during lab. does not care if you are failing. helpful most never. i rather drink bleach then take his class again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He really does not explain anything. I went to his office hours for labs and quiz questions and would just say try to figure it out on your own.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The course is divided up into two lectures a week and one discussion, there is attendance only taken in discussions. The grade for the main course is dependent mostly on 3 large exams, and discussion is almost all attendance with one project. That being said, this is one of the best classes I have taken with amazing lectures, just study for tests

I actually like this class. Just make sure to study with a friend to make it easy. Its literally just memorization.Also I passed this class because my TA was amazing who summarize the lecture during discussion and he is really a sweetheart. Paul lectures are interesting and funny there is boring lectures but it will make it up for the next lecture.

I genuinely found Professor Smaldino's COGS 001 class to be quite manageable. The grading criteria were straightforward: attending discussions and 3 exams. I ended the class with an A, and I attribute it to attending lectures, reading, and completing the SONA extra credit. If you follow these steps, passing the class should be easily attainable.

Professor is very unprofessional literally counts attendance as a grade and removes it the day before the final and drops ur grade down by 20%. Does not give any assignments from test. I personally do not just learn from readings and listening to a person talk for over an hour. I need assignments to keep me engaged. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS CLASS.

Very test-heavy but not too difficult. If you worked through the study guide posted before each test you would be fine. While there was a lot of reading, most were supplementary and he went over it during lectures. Grading was clearly explained in the syllabus. When he saw people were failing, he took the blame. Awesome teacher
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Test heavy

comment:
He's a kind professor, but he makes it very difficult to get an A.

He posts the lecture slides, which is very helpful. 

Studying for the test was challenging because of the exam style; you must understand every concept fully to answer the test questions.

I RECOMMEND MAKING FLASH CARDS. It helped me the most for the final.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The grading criteria was not clear in this class. He had attendance as something that affected your grade all semester only to remove it the week of finals. Overall your grade is very test-dependent. If you fail a midterm there's no hope for an A in this course. Lectures are boring but everything from the exams can be found in slides.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: you only have 3 assignments all year; all 3 are tests so if your bad at test, stay far away

He is a good lecture teacher but aside from that the only things that are graded are the midterms, the extra credit, attendance, and ONE assignment we get in our discussion. Sadly the extra credit is 5 points so it won't boost you that much. Everything is based on the slides he goes through and the discussion goes over what was discussed.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He assigns a lot of homework upfront, all on the syllabus. But he doesn't post the questions for them until 2 days before they are due. Homework isn't always straightforward and his feedback is vague. Gives good lectures, but sometimes they are pointless. The final was horrendous as he didn't even post the assignment requirements. For COGS 122 SP19

Paul smaldino is a great professor. He makes his lectures fun even if he had to do them online during Covid19. He gives little work if you do your readings and attend lectures theres no reason why you shouldnt have an A or B in this course !
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Ray is a young professor that can relate to students as she has a thing for anime and video games. She is truly amazing and is passionate about what she does. She tells stories from her life sometimes and uses them as examples in the lectures. Her assignments are easy to follow and she is a forgiving grader as long as you actually work.10/10!

Professor Ray was by far one of the best writing professors I have ever had. She is very understanding. Mental Health days are given along the semester and she cares much about how you are doing in her class. Throughout the semester you will work on a paper, and her feedback for each section is very helpful. She always comes to class with a smile.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Ray is the best professor I've had at UC Merced. She was a student here a few years ago then became a professor. She is very understanding and is easy to talk to. If you do the weekly homework and attend lectures this class is very easy to pass and essay feedback is very detailed. Highly recommend going to her office hours.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: The times I was in her class I enjoyed being there, even though it was just a class she made it feel comfortable and I felt I could really learn from her and not get bored.

Chloe Ray is an amazing professor. She always offers great advice for any improvements that should be made. She is very understanding of others when there are hard times. And overall, she is one of the best professors I've had in college. As long as you attend her lectures and commit to doing the homework. You will succeed in her class.

Awesome writing 10 professor, very interesting lectures and gives great feedback. The assignments have clear expectations and are graded fairly. Your grade is made up of four major assignments, in class writing participation and weekly journal entries. Overall very enjoyable class and would highly recommend.

Overall great WRI010 professor, she was very charismatic and you could tell she cares about the subject. She's also super young so she feels a lot more relatable in that sense and almost feels like she's just another high school teacher (in a good way). I will say that there was a lot of reading required, but apart from that, good class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Online Savvy

comment: Professor Chloe is really great. She understands the students and what they go through so that is great. Class wise, expect a lecture for every class, they can be a bit boring but they are helpful. All the lectures eventually lead to your final paper. Fairly easy class, if u need help talk to her! Shes a big pokemon fan too!

Instructor Ray is super straightforward when it comes to expectations. Shes very patient with students and is always available to ask questions for further understanding. Shes very understanding with life circumstances and will always be open to coming up with a solution if you cant submit something on time. Shes great and I would take again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She was a great professor . Loved her teaching and great to have as one of my first professors .
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She's chill, and that helps students feel more comfortable with her. Three essays, discussion posts, reading for in-class group discussions, and three minor assignments. Small lectures or "workshops" and small group work and share assignments in class. You might find a textbook online.
He is very lecture-heavy, he gives quiz questions, but when he gives the quiz its barely the same as what he said in class. You must read the book to have some knowledge for the quizzes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Ortiz is a well-respected professor and he is really passionate about physio. I had him for BIO 001 and it was bad because he didn't care. He knows the material inside and out, so take notes on what he says and his slides. I really understood the material and I didn't have to read. (Doesn't mean you should do the same). Overall, he's great!
Lectures: often went off on tangents; vague lecture slides Reading: must do reading before lecture or you will be lost in lecture  First and only class I have failed

He is such a jackass. He doesn't care for his students AT ALL. Basically, he eliminates exams when he wants to, and allocates points to his whim of fancy. He does not curve, and some exam questions are not even from the book! He doesn't care to inform us of what is to come or at least give us some tips. DON'T TAKE HIM.
Dr. Ortiz is a very intelligent professor. Pay attention to his lectures and read the book before and after class and you'll do excellent.

His teaching method for Nutrition is terrible. He splits you into groups and each lecture a different group teaches their chapter. This way he gets to do almost nothing while we "learn" from other students... This does not work. I learned almost nothing in this class. Oh and he makes jokes in Spanish, as if the non-latinos would understand. Sucks.

It's a very tough course probably because he doesn't curve, which should not be needed. Read the book before class, it's usually a chapter per 1-2 days that's covered. OH is something I would not advise going to. Throughout the semester, he made fun of one student who came to all his office hours. Overall, he's effective, but his exams are tough!

You either love him or you hate him. He likes to have his own students teach the lectures so they can learn it better; many people think he's lazy as a result but he is NOT. Sometimes puts on a mean front but he's super nice. Easy class for nutrition, but his physiology class is one of the hardest courses offered. Just pay attention and you will A+

Can be rude and condescending at times. His lectures go over little, but they are somewhat clear. His slides are vague. You really have to read the book to do well. Group lab reports...pick and choose your group members wisely!
Smart professor.  Not as mean as he makes himself out to be.  Very fun class.
Awesome class.  Always cracking jokes.  Cool assignment.  Has a great cooking class attached to it.

I took this class for a GE, ESS 050. fairly simple class, any quizzes are covered by the last lecture, no final exam.  I often find myself struggling to stay awake during her lectures since she speaks in such a soft voice. If you need help though, she was very nice and willing. A lot of people seemed to like her, she's passionate about her class.

I highly suggest taking this Professor. Her teaching style and class overall were great. The only thing I would say was difficult was the lab itself; attendance is required, and thus my grade did suffer slightly. There is a research paper that is announced at the beginning of the semester and is due at the end; don't worry, it's not that difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I really enjoyed Carolin's lectures especially compared to her co-lecturer. She really wanted to make sure you understood the material. She was the only professor that canceled in-person lectures before the school required it at beginning of COVID. That gives you an idea, made me feel like she actually cares about us. Tip: study the HW problems
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: The class was pretty easy everyone got an A, there was a lot of boring readings and one big project at the end.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Great teacher, had a lot of fun in her class and learned about about genetics. She only taught half of the semester but it was very easy if you go to her office hours and lectures.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Our Bio 140 class was taught by two professors - one for each half of the semester. I had Carolin for the last half and I thought her "section" was easier. Her class will be easy if you know how to do the discussion worksheet problems. Lecture isn't mandatory but I would attend because her explanations are clearer than the textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She is an amazing woman! If you do the homework problems she assigns you'll be fine. Her lectures might be a little dry, but her cuteness makes up for it ;). Definitely go to her office hours and discussions and she loves it when people ask her questions. :)
Hated going to her class. She is very monotoned. I learned more from going over slides by myself then her explaining. she goes in a very fast pace. Is absent alot.

Professor Frank is nice but she puts up useless lecture slides in my opinion. the tests are derive from the problems in the book...and you have to do ALL of them before the exam and know the ins and outs of each problem because on the exams she manipulates the question. Her class is basically 2 exams and a final..and that's it. NO extra points.

Very poorly structured class. She emphasizes alot of difficult and unimportant material and chooses exam questions at random from recommended but not graded hw assignments. Only 3 tests in the class and final exam is worth ~65% of your overall grade. She is also very monotone and obviously uninterested in the material. Makes slide mistakes alot.
Great Professor if you get to meet her personally. Her lecture is a little slow at times, but good stuff is learned.

Not very clear with the homework and sometimes there was homework that she wouldnt tell us about. When you would ask her questions, she would usually snap at you for no reason. Along with snapping at the students, she would usually give attitude. You have to turn in every homework and essay. If you didnt, you failed. Choose any class but this.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Really inflexible on the homework, and makes turning in assignments very difficult. Sometimes you'll just find out you missed an assignment you didn't know was assigned. Also, the amount of essays can be very difficult to deal with, especially if you're taking a full workload. Very tough grader as well. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: This teacher assigns lots of little homework assignments. Miss class? you will not get credit for that certain assignment. Up to 6 tasks of homework for every class meeting. Not very great at helping out with essays, from my experience she had trouble understanding what I was trying to convey, so she would often change my essay topics to her liking
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: not specific very confusing, take a different professor shes rude about not giving you a chance to help your grade. Never changes the dates to assignments on time which confuses you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She gives a LOT of work. It's not necessarily hard work, its just too much for any single person to be able to do when you have 3 other classes to worry about. She also gives partner essays, which are the worst, and you have to present them.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Assigns a ton of reading analysis homework from class book. Essay grading is tough. However, she cares about her students. Recommend going to office hours, will clear up any vagueness about assignment/essay, and provide excellent feedback on improvement. Gives summary quizzes based off of homework reading. Extra credit near the end, don't miss out.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Not the best professor, I would've preferred to take someone else. She is also unclear of what she wants.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Awesome teacher who gives great advice and will even help edit your resumes if you  ask. Teaches great writing skills as well as life skills, truly cares about her students.

She's the type of professor that you HAVE to go visit during office hours. She is very picky when it comes to writing style, so beware of that. However, once you get an idea of what she likes, you should be on the right track. (She loves the style that is demonstrated in the Common Culture book! Work along those lines.)

She is the Editor to the Merced Sun Star Newspaper and the toughest writing 001 teacher. Many of us did not receive an A in the class. If you don't have the same writiin style as the professor, you are screwed. Writing is the worst subject on campus because if a professor does not like your essay, they will bash it and a diff professor praises it.

She gives a boat load of assignments, but she's an amazing instructor! She's willing to help if you ask and she gives helpful feedback. If I had the chance to go back and get a different instructor, I wouldn't do it. I have grown to appreciate her! If you get her as an instructor, prepare for a large amount of assignments and a lot of learning!

Honestly, I didn't think he was a very good teacher at all. His notes didn't help with homework, his practice exams were actually different than the actual exams, and he's pretty boring when he explains things in class. I almost fell asleep countless times. He's a great guy, just not a great professor.

Love this teacher ! so far my favorite, I always hated math, but since I took his calc class he makes it so much easier ! Very helpful, gives lots of examples in class. Gives practice exams that are actually helpful for the midterms and final.  He  lingers on about his theorems and such, but it's amusing. Overall, effective professor.
a really intelligent proffessor. knows his stuff and explains it well. lecture goes by really fast. funny at times.

I never took Calculus before his class, and Greene can have a fast pace prior to the first midterm, but as long as you sincerely do the homework and take notes, it becomes easier as you go along.  He lingers too long on proving theorems, but is overall passionate about math.  Highly rec going to office hours for this class, very helpful!

He can actually communicate with Non-math majors and make you feel like you can understand the material.  He's funny (sometimes:) and a really great teacher who cares about his students. Calc is hard so whoever you take...don't expect an easy class!

Prof. Greene is a great teacher of calc III.  He has clever ways of teaching the material.  He does not trust students worth a dime which is mildly-offensive to me; to be fair though, he has been burned in the past by those kids who cheat.  I say kick those kids out of school so that we folks who have integrity are trusted and are treated as such.
Hard grader, but good teacher.
Relatively good, harder grading but better instructor and fun later in the year.
No Comments

Lectures are useless; he lingers on parts you'd already understand and skips the parts you don't understand.  He grades unfairly too.  On the 2-part questions, don't expect ANY partial credit (and I meant ZERO)  unless you have correct answers for both parts.

Very interesting class. His lectures are clear and his guest speakers are awesome (MC Hammer, Chancellor Leland, etc). Not exactly what I thought the class would be like but was still satisfied nonetheless. The books can be a bit of a bore but the articles he sends out are interesting and relevant. Read before class and take notes for an easy A.
he was pretty easy when i had him, but i have heard he has gotten harder recently

I had no prior interest in cognitive psychology. But e was just so passionate about what he taught. His exams are fairly easy if you attend class, and I believe the term paper was very easy to complete.I'd take another class just to look at him all period. He is so damn hot.
Don't have to go to class, since notes are online. If you study them well then tests are easy. He takes the best out of 4 exams.

Lectures are easy; he doesn't take attendance.  Instead of quizzes, he has easy participation activities relevant to the lecture, which makes it a lot more interactive.  Tests are a little harder than you'd think, though.  Study those lecture notes thoroughly!
He is ok...
Easy class
Hes the hottest teacher at the school!!!!
Interesting professor, always appears jovial and about to make a joke.  Passionate about the subject and teaches a fascinating class.
clear lectures, tried to make class interesting
She's a very understanding professor and really good at teaching. Her worksheets and videos provided in the instructors module are super helpful and make sure to complete your Aleks on time!
Professor Linda is very caring. She is also very understanding. I took math 005 this summer and even though it was a fast paced  course she tried her best to help us pass.
ALEKS takes up a lot of your time but doesn't really affect your grade much. There are biweekly quizzes on the worksheets and 3 exams.

Professor Navarro is such an amazing person. Not just as a math teacher but also in general, if you get to know her you'll see she's very understanding and caring. She helped me a lot while I was struggling in math and extended her office hours for me. I couldn't be more grateful for all the effort she put into my academic success. Take her class!

She's great at explaining math concepts and is always available to help during office hours. The only downside that I have about her class are the Alexs assignments. The Alexs assignments were time consuming and don't matter too much to the grade but are a great review for the exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: It's actually an ok class. Every assignment and quiz are due every two weeks for each section and exams are based on the 2 previous sections, but there will only be about 8 questions on them though and about 4 on quizzes. Pretty easy as long as you review before hand, she's also very nice and reasonable.

I was retaking this class and Professor Navarro is a godsend compared to my previous professor. She is very detailed and goes over everything that will be on the exams, and even reviews a couple questions the day of the exam. This class just requires a lot of time and dedication, exams have a very heavy grade, but otherwise not too bad.

Aleks is what makes this course harder. Linda is an awesome teacher and she will help you with whatever necessary. 3 exams total and 6 quizzes. Aleks is hard but manageable. Dedicate time to this class and you will get an A.

Linda herself is very sweet, but she does teach the lectures like if we are on her level. She will help you but your whole grade is mostly based on Aleks which made me get an F, your quizzes and midterm will also be based from Aleks

I was struggling with her class so much because the lectures were on Aleks but that was bc that's how precalc classes go, the discussions where she actually teaches is very good! I went to her OH often, she helps you so much and is there to listen, so as long as you prioritize and go to her OH, you will pass. Don't miss out!! She's very sweet!!

I could have never asked for a better writing course; the professor was very knowledgeable on the topic, but more importantly she was knowledgeable on how to teach the topic. Please, just do the work and apply what you learn, and you will be fine. Also she was funny.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Very cool professor and gives good feedback.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She made learning in her class really fun. She made us engage in interesting conversations which helped us with our assignments in class. She let her personality slip in, making the class more personal and fun, and engaging.
