I just felt respected in that class, and it was nice to have this easy feeling even if there was a lot of pressure.

Overall she's a really good professor and she gives really good feedbacks. Attending her class is mandatory because you attendance is counted towards grades. You have to ask her questions and visit her office hours to make sure your essays are good. There's only 3 essays that are necessary for the class and the rubric is straightforward.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Lol cancelled a lot of my afternoon class for personal reasons and always went off topic talking bout her stories. Her requirements for assignments were confusing and that is what got me points taken off.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Accessible outside class

comment: Very spontaneous, may cancel class, and constantly pushes back due dates.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I love, love Professor Dean and I appreciate her so much! She genuinely cares about us, provides lots of feedback on assignments, explains and lectures well (with humor), and is very understanding and validating towards your struggles as long as you communicate and let her know. She is lenient and focused on whether or not you have learned from her

Professor Dean was my favorite for my spring semester. She is such a sweet soul and she made her classes so fun and enjoyable. I always looked forward to her classes because of her humor. You will pass with a good grade if you do all the work and ask her for help. She's also really understanding so don't be afraid to reach out to her!

Great teacher. Had her for morning class so it was a bit difficult at times. Her teaching is above average and there is some useful stuff she goes overnexplains. Very lenient on deadlines and often gives extensions for assignments. She is very understanding with just about anything. She also tends to cancel class for safety reasons. Workload is ok.
Professor Dean is extremely understanding and easy going. I think her humor is what got me through the semester. Shes very helpful and provides good feedback. I loved her!

Rice is everywhere. there is homework before the class to read the textbook chapters and a quiz to double check understanding. But then during lecture, he just goes over the same thing as what you just read in the textbook and does no practice problems. also very aggressively sarcastic and when you have a question he gets in your personal space

Class was a lot of work, but going to office hours helped a lot and the bridge project was very fun and gives you your first taste of actual engineering. Be ready to grind and go to his lectures if you want to pass.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Rice has a unique sense of humor and cares about your future as an engineer. His class is tough to prepare you. Make sure to at least attempt all of the homework and study for tests by doing many practice problems. Highly recommend going to his office hours.
Tough with underclassmen

Professor Rice is great. He makes you truly earn your grade. You have homework every week and have office hours before they are due so that he can help you out with it. Exams are worth a lot so study hard. His exams are tough and original which reflects what you get in a potential job. Think of Rice as your first exposure to an engineering job.
He is sarcastic and unhelpful, not a good time

I was advised not to take this class because of the way this professor runs the class. And I will repeat this same message again having taken it. He does not care about you succeeding at all, even if it is because of outside reasons. The grade is strictly dependent on you and meeting deadlines and if not, it is often met with sarcasm not empathy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: I did all the homework. I struggled with some of the quizzes. I had a 68%, so I asked him if there is anyway to make sure I don't fail. He basically said no if I don't do well on the final exam and the final project. Over 70% of the class was failing, so I withdrew from the course before the last drop date.

Do not take this class if you wanna fail, the test is hard and homemade and there's plenty of homework that he grades harshly on. Avoid this professor throughout your engineering career at Merced. Overall though this Professor is good at teaching the subject but you will have a hard time with hw, quizzes, and exams. You've been warned!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Rice made me question if I wanted to be an engineer or not. But he's right got to stick to it for the money. Great lectures and very helpful.

Great professor with a clear goal for the class. The class itself is fast pace, but the professor gives great lectures that clearly spell out what is going to be on the homework. If you don't do the homework, you wont be ready for the tests. If you put in the work, you will get the grade you want. Excited to take this professor again next semester
DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HER. Never really know what she was talking about, this class was so pointless and a waste of time. Too much work and she doesn't grade fairly.

She is extremely unorganized & gives out so much unnecessary papers. She talks for hours & no one understands what she's saying. She's a tough grader. I worked extremely hard to get an A which I had up until school was over & I went back home she dropped me to a B! I emailed her to ask why and never got a response back. So rude and unprofessional.

Dr Conklin is very passionate about water chemistry but this class is way too difficult. There are weekly lab reports so don't wait until the night before and on top of that there are weekly homework sets. There are assignments coming at you left and right throughout the whole semester. You have to work to get the grade you want. Great class though
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Class is unorganized

Not an easy class. There are weekly homework assignments and lab reports. Do not procrastinate on either because sometimes they take a while. Dr. Conklin is very helpful in at office hours and guides you through homework. Homework problems  test problems. The book is good; it has example problems and decent explanations. Dr. Conklin is awesome!
Very helpful professor. Just a really hard class. Need to know your chemistry IN DEPTH before taking this course

She's very enthusiastic and willing to explain anything that is not clear. Brought up all the important points about the environment we are facing today, however, there is a 3 hour computer lab EVERY week and too much homework in my opinion.
very knowledgeable in her area
This teacher spends a lot of time complaining about the ineffieciency of school and the quiz questions are ridiculous, and sometimes have nothing to do with whatever was covered in the chapter.

Professor Carroll is one of the best professors at UC Merced. He is pretty transparent with his students and his lectures reflect that as well. He assigns study guides each week, quizzes every other week, one final, and a term paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: The course content was interesting as there is so much I didn't know about human sexuality. We had weekly readings from the textbook and from another book to which we had to complete weekly study guides. I would suggest you study with other students and ask them for lecture content if you are going to miss a lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Carroll is very fun to interact with. The class consists of study guide assignments, quizzes, a paper, & a final exam. The study guides are every week & are questions from the book. The quizzes are every week & are questions from the book & lectures. He does not post slides (unless online). Quizzes can be challenging. Do ALL the EC.

He's a decent professor that teaches you how to think critically about the field. There are weekly study guides based on the text and articles, several quizzes, and a final. Be warned, he expects you to remember specific numbers and dates on the quizzes and final, so pay attention to those while studying.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Positive psych class was amazing. Best class ever! Easy A. Highly recommend. Gives a lot of opportunity for extra credit. My class had no quizzes, only midterms, and hw. The hw consisting of reading the book and answering some questions, which he put the page number to where the answer was located. Learned a lot. Really fun!

Loved this class but there is weekly homework study guides along with a quiz each week. The final project is pretty lengthy, but since you get to choose your own topic it becomes interesting. The class in terms of work is heavy, but worth it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is probably one of the most boring professors I have ever had. He makes us students grade our work and we got docked if he doesn't like our grading. He also is a very hard grader and do not make the class fun it was more of a hassle to go.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Great class! Dr. Carroll offers a TON of extra credit, so there's really no way to fail. Weekly study guides, 7 total quizzes (lowest 2 are dropped!), one research project, and one final exam. Attendance not required and neither is participation, but I recommend it to get the most out of this class. The material is something we can ALL benefit from

Human Sexuality - Prof. Carroll is a cool guy who wears a different cat t-shirt every day. He seems knowledgeable about the subject. In the class there is a study guide due every week, very easy, he gives the pg. # to find the answers. A quiz every other week, common sense. 1 big project, group or individual. He also gives out tons of extra credit

This professor can be very dry and very lackluster. He seems very oblivious to students concerns regarding if they are going to pass the class and how well the students do on quizzes. His study guides don't always follow the quizzes and even if you know the information the answers are geared to his understanding. He does give extra credit.

I had him for Writing 10 in the Spring of 2024. He was super easy and fun to learn from. His teaching style is engaging, and he does his best to answer students' emails as soon as possible. He's super relatable, and I truly enjoyed his class. I would 100% take the courses he teaches. That said, he wants the students off their phones during lecture.

I enjoyed taking Prof Jordy's class. He was very chill and really cared about his students. The reading assignments were not hard at all, and I especially enjoyed the fact we had freedom on our essay topics. We didn't have class much this semester, but within the time of knowing him, I would recommend him to anybody looking for a writing class!

10/10 professor! Mr. Dakin keeps the class interesting while making sure we effectively learn. He assigns exciting readings and isn't too tough of a grader unless you present a lack of effort in your assignments. I would highly recommend this professor!

Dakin was such a chill and funny prof. Although we weren't in class much, he made assignments due online. The readings were short but exciting to read about. He cares a lot about student feedback and even though there's 3 essays due throughout the semester, the topic was our choice. The textbook can also be found online.

There was a bit of reading, but never too much and never boring reading. The in class quizzes were only hard enough to make sure we did the reading, and it wasn't difficult to get a 5/5 on them. The homework wasn't too difficult either and didn't take up that much time. You can tell he enjoys the topic, and lectures feel like conversations. Had fun

personality great, class tough, hard to follow 
2 books 
Weekly responses due every Wednesday containing summary of short story + narrative/connect to lecture.
Professor reads of the lecture slides and moves onto the next very fast
Final is a short story of choosing, first come first serve. Presentation of story, Prospectus, bibliography, essay
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Dakin is very easy-going and nice. The workload for the class is very light and not overwhelming at the slightest.

Jordan Dakin is by far one of the best teachers ive ever had. Hes understanding and caring about his students while still making sure you take responsibility for your work. He cares that you pass and will help you get there. Hes very funny as well, I love listening to him talk. You do read a lot but all of the selections are interesting. 10/10

The best professor ever. I took him from WRI 001 and let me just say it was the one class I always looked forward to going to. He genuinely made the class fun and got the whole class to be engaged. The essays are about anything you want and he gives amazing feedback and is very accessible outside of class. Literally 10/10.

I really enjoyed being in his horror literature class since the work was really straightforward and he was passionate. You read short stories every week and you submit a short critical review of the stories. At the end of the semester you write a final paper that you have a lot of time for. He even had mental health days ! Do the work and you pass
RUDE!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Ghosh is amazing. Ghosh goes through the material in depth as well as many practice problems to prepare for exams. Ghosh knows her material and teaches it well. Ghosh is also very carrying and fun. Definitely recommend, though seems like she mostly teaches upper division.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Super chill and she makes some jokes as well. Lectures are all online. Make sure to ask questions because there maybe some pop quizzes if there's no interaction from the class. The curve is superb, ended up passing with a B. She deferred to her Grad Ta's when it came to office hours though.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: Perhaps give more examples in class
She is a very good explainer and a really nice person, however she is a tough grader. The final exam was completely different from what we learned in class! Harsh during office hrs.

This class is a good class. Although Ghosh is a good explainer (she knows her stuff well) the final exam was completely different from what we learned in class & was heavily weighted (50% of our grade). She's okay, but be prepared to work. She's not really all that enthusiastic and a tad brutle in office hrs.

good teacher you homework can be hard to do but solutions are posted after. when studying for midterms focus on doing the hw problems and you will do fine make sure you understand the problems not just know how to solve them.
No Comments

I enjoyed her class very much. Her lectures are right to the point, and she explains it step by step. I learned a lot in the class. But the thing is, is that her tests are semi-hard. The difficulty of the homework and our tests were WAY different! But overall, she's a great physics teacher. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
Cute and fun

If any questions, this professor is willing to answer them after class or over the email provided. This professor can be accommodating to certain things. Just be prepared to read in order to prepare for class and understand material. Also, prepare well for exams! Tips and office hours offered.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: His lectures were boring. I think it was his voice that made it boring but I spent more time spending money on Amazon then listening to him. However his information and knowledge is great. Just his lecturing skills were subpar.

This is one of the worst professors I have ever taken. He has nothing but pictures straight from the textbook in lectures and cannot provide any additional help outside of class. I passed BIO011 but I did not pass his section's midterm. Absolutely terrible, made me hate central dogma even more than I already did.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: You can tell he loves biology, but he isn't a great professor. He just talks 80% of time without having slides to show what he is referring to. His lectures aren't that helpful and just overall boring. You could probably learn more from reading the textbook, which is my case here.
Cleary is a great person, but not that great of a professor. I definitely think he's super chill in one on one's, but when he's lecturing, it's pretty bad. Super easy to fall asleep to.
talks so slow is bad at explain and is very monotoned run

He may come off as unenthusiastic at times however he sure does know his stuff. I personally think he goes through material too fast during lecture but attend his o.h and he will try his hardest to help you. He's one of those prof that doesn't seem to care for students until they put in the effort, that he acknowledges for sure
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Students that claim he is a bad teacher are lazy. Midsemester, I had a D, but I attended office hours, studied his detailed lecture slides, and read the book more after that test. I ended up with an A for the class. His TAs are wonderful, also. Students that claim he is boring and uninterested in teacher obviously didn't bother going to off. hrs.

YOU WILL HAVE TO WORK FOR YOUR GRADE. I don't understand why people give bad reviews because they got bad grades. you have to EARN your grades. and when you work really hard for your grades, that's when youre learning the  most. Professor cleary is nice and helpful. My only advice is to READ THE BOOK and go to lecture although it's not required.

Doesn't help students! Recommend you to take another professor if possible. Avoid at all cause! He doesn't got into much detail but expects you to know with all detail! I loved BIO prior to this class, but I am reevaluating my life!

Seems as though he has no desire to be teaching the class. Extremely boring. Depending on your TA, quizes can be quite difficult. The book will be your best friend. The usual average for midterms was ~50-60%. Nothing is curved except for TA's quizzes at the end of the semester.

Dr. Soltis is very nice and she does take attendence, but if you won't be able to make it class. EMAIL HER AHEAD! She gives amazing advice. She does give homework and goes easy on grading. She also gives feedback on what you need to work on.

Does like you to be there every week for smaller assignments but is always willing to help as well as tries to offer her assignments and resources in advance so you can plan ahead. Really kind professor and always welcoming to help you learn something new.

One of the best professors Ive had. Her teaching is engaging and she provides constructive and positive feedback in our writing prompts. Her articles and assignments really sparks up your motivation to learn and enhance our skills for writing, reading, but also thinking creatively.

Soltis is an absolute gem. She's genuinely one of the best professors I've ever had. Took her SPRK class (Community Mapping) and she made it fun and easy. She truly does care about her students and gives people plenty of opportunities to do well. As long as you do the assignments, you should honestly be fine. No exams, no quizzes, no final. Amazing
Her community mapping class is really easy and helps build some useful skills for community assessment. She's also really nice!

Dr. Soltis is an awesome professor! She really cares about you doing well in her class, and she is accessible in case you need help on an assignment. She's very sweet and her class is easy as long as you do the work!

AMAZING PROFESSOR. She is one of the best professors I have ever had. There's too much to say about her but as long as you do what is expected from her class, I guarantee you that you will pass. 100% recommend her. You won't regret it. I PROMISE!!!

Dr. Soltis is one of the very few professors that has a genuine connection with her students. I say this because she has a similar background like I did. Her class was very engaging and effortless. She was very humorous which made going to her class not seem like it was hell. Definitely recommend her class and I would take her class again 100%.
she is very caring and awesome although she does gives a lot of hw for CRS 10 class

Prof. Soltis is possibly one of the most underrated professors on campus. She allows her students penty of in class study time as well as chances to work with each other. I'm currently in her Community mapping class, and I must say it's easy as long as you pick a topic you care about. It's a chance to let you be creative and think for yourself.
Great professor, lectures were interesting and enriching. Tests were pretty straight-forward and consisted of multiple choice questions. He also posts the powerpoint slides up on CROPS.

He's a good teacher. Good lectures. But you kind of need to use the book because he teaches you stuff aside from the book but tests you on his lectures and book readings. There are labs in the lecture class. They're not that bad of labs. It's an overall okay class. Not too amazing but not that bad.

Very easy class as long as you attend every lecture (he tests a lot on examples you'd only know if you attended and listened to lecture), complete all assignments, and study for midterms and final.  Meanwhile, he is extremely entertaining and thorough in his lectures, and always releases lecture earlier than in the schedule. Has influenced many of my classmates to major in Psychology.  Highly recommend  his class.

Greatest professor at UCM.  Maybe because I've only been there for only a year but he is the best lecturer thus far.  DO NOT miss his lectures.  Even though he posts them online, they are mostly picture slides, so you probably won't get the gist of his lectures just by looking at pictures.  Exams are fairly easy.  He is a chill professor.  Take him
Really easy professor. Just show up and listen to lecture. That makes the class very easy! The labs however are very difficult. Make sure to get help from TA's
If everyone had a professor like Yarrow, academia would be a much happier and even more exciting place!

AMAZING professor. He knows what he is talking about and is always willing to help out students. Tests are very fair and group projects are a minimum. Goes a bit too fast in lecture but he posts the slides after, which is really helpful. I enjoyed going to his office hours and he's one of the best professors I've had so far. Take him if you can!!!!

The best lecturer I've yet to come across. Powerpoints are simple and easy to understand, thus allowing you to really retain the information. He has a very chill attitude and really actually knows what he is talking about. I can't say the same for some other professors I've had in the past.
i dont know the textbook isbn. i enjoyed this class because i basically passed it using common sense and without attending any more than to do assignments and take tests.
He's really kind of nerdy, but in a cute, knows his stuff, and knows how to talk about it in a way students will understand. Plus he uses a curve. Basically awesome. Take his classes.

He is just a lecturer basically, you have to teach yourself. Midterms are hard because he uses the ACS a chemist would need to pass to get his degree. He calls it the real deal. One good thing his A grading ranges from 80%-100%, B 70%-80%, C 60%-50%, and so on.

Dr. Rogow should explain how to complete operations more. such as calculations and should give homework based on the next weeks quiz rather than just jump to a new chapter. I have been struggling to keep up because of the density of the homework. He should be a little more understanding when a student comes for help because it is a difficult course

Rogow's class is straightforward. I will say lectures are pointless to go to. Rogow and Tas are usually helpful with labs and quiz questions during office hours. Just do the homework and try to understand it fully and you will be fine. His quizzes and midterms are exact problems from the homework and lab. Oh and read the book too, it helps.

What can I say about Rogow? Well for one thing, he definitely has a soothing voice. (Make sure you don't take his class after lunch! Or else you will fall asleep). When I was taking the class, more than half the class did not attend his lecture. His final is from the ACS and his midterms are generally not too bad. Just make sure you study!

If you go to Lecture, he will just read slides so it is almost pointless. Nothing he says in lecture will be on the quizzes. Its passable but one must learn everything on their own literally. Hard midterms and he curves based on a National Average

His lectures are very hard to stay focused in. His examples aren't always helpful for doing homework problems. If you take the lab make sure to prepare for the quizzes. he uses the quiz questions on his tests.

I had professor Rogow both as a TA and as a Professor and I have to say he's a fair TA but a difficult Professor and has hard exams. While in his class his lectures seemed endless but none the less he was very helpful in office hours. Would recommend him to any students for chemistry.

He is very helpful. I had him as a TA for Chem 2 and a lecturer for Chem 10. In both cases he treats both classes similarly. If you go to office hours he is willing to explain things. DO THE HOMEWORK. Homework questions are the quiz questions.
Great professor, but very dry lectures. Has lots of typos in power point slides. Do the problems and you should be ok.

Dr. Rogow is a greater chemistry professor. His lecture slides are PURE GOLD. Don't read the textbook because it will make everything confusing. His midterms are tough but as long as you do all of the practice problems assiged and understand the lecture slides you should be set to go. I highly recommend Dr. Rogow to use clikers next semester!

Gave a ton of extra credit at the end of the term. Tough grader, but gives a lot of feedback so you can make it up. Quizzes on reading. If you visit his office hours, he's also lenient and will work with you to improve your grade. He is not an "easy" professor- if you don't have a background in history or strong writing skills, you will struggle.
Get ready to read! He gives reading quizes every week on 2-3 chapters. They were really hard at the beginning but they get easier. Give you many extra credit opportunities. Pretty boring lecture

He can be a little long winded in his lectures but speaking as a Bio major who takes his class at 8am he's interesting enough that the class is well worth taking.  Kind of looks like a kicked puppy when no one answers his discussion questions. Be kind to him and he'll be kind to you.

I learned a lot in his class. The reading at first is difficult, but it got easier. Participate, so the class will not be boring. He gives good feedback on essays the first essay I got a B- and was able to raise the next essay to an A. He's highly intellectual on history, but he's nice and chill. Really wants his students to grasp history.

Professor Hunnicutt  is a wonderful professor regardless of his long lectures. There are only 3 "tests," which in reality are take home essays based on the readings, and they are fairly easy. He isn't tough on grading, but I would recommend to develop a good argument. He is extremely nice , understanding, and overall a wonderful professor.
hated his class
Lots of reading, but engaging discussions. Class grading is usually just 2-3 papers and a presentation.
Great class! Great professor.
Really great professor, intriguing and interesting. I've taken 3 classes with him and they are all great :) Great professor.
Engaging lecturer, very helpful in office hours. He will tell you exactly what he expects from you.

I took Professor Crawford for both PH 102 and 103, and while there is quite a bit of work (especially group projects), I enjoyed both courses. Her lectures matched up well with the projects and quizzes, and she helped us step by step with the bigger assignments. Attendance was mandatory, but no textbook or exams. She was also very understanding!

She is a good professor, super nice and her assignments had a clear structure of what she wanted. Whole course is based on a group project for final so be aware. She is pretty lenient on who you pic for group project. She also grades pretty fairly, if you include what she asks for and the format is correct, you'll pretty much get full points.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor, highly recommend
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Ask the professor for help, she is a harsh grader. It's group project based but I suggest not to work alone because it's a lot. Do homework little by little each day. DO NOT PROCRASTINATE. I passed this class by asking for help. Attendance is very strict. Pop quizzes are easy. Do the practice final and time yourself for the actual final.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Class is extremely difficult for no reason, she will always find a way to give you a low score on any assignment that needs to be turned in. Try taking another professor for this course because getting an A in this class is difficult.

Scrupulous w/ attendance = Will not allow exceptions. Grading feedbk vague + scrupulous & vindictive grader. Unaccommodtng. Gives only 1 hr 4 ALL work = including exams. 5(|-upulous

Professor Crawford was honestly one of the best professors I've had at UCM. Her syllabus was very clear. There was a good mixture of lectures and videos and she always did her best to make the class interactive, making learning fun! I would definitely recommend Crawford to any PH majors. She is the best!

Professor Crawford is one of the best professors I have had. She is very caring and her way of explaining the material so organized and does not feel overwhelming. She gives great feedback on her projects and has a lot of time available for students. She has a very open format to her class and is more conversational.

Crawford is a caring professor and will give good feedback on your group project throughout the semester. She does do extra credit if you go to the writing center for every part of the project. Completing the parts of the project before the due date and having her look over them will improve your grade because of the feedback she gives.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Most of the class is spent on one big project, which is broken down into managable chunks.  Readings were assigned but we weren't quizzed on them.  Final consisted of a multiple choice exam, short answer exam consisting designing a basic health program, and a focus group.  Professor was nice but could be a little boring in lectures.
very nice prof and cares about his students.
Good guy

Lectures were not mandatory but were very informative. He cares a lot about the subject and for his students. Optional final and no midterms/ no in class quizzes. Lots of homework but has no set deadline. Great class
Sharping is fun, and very kind, i wish he taught physics 009.
He is a great professor and the class is fun and easy if you do what he says. He is also lenient.

comment: Sharping cares about his students and wants them to succeed, and is very willing to help during office hours. He cool

comment: Had him for physics 8. Great guy, always willing to help. Lectures not the clearest however.

just talks during the entire lecture. so boring and doesnt even allow time for questions or discussion - theres really not point in attending lecture. syllabus was extremely vague. so many readings to do every week. Waste of time

Does not give tests or midterms. Instead, grades on papers. She is honestly one of my favorite professors at Merced. She is incredibly knowledgeable. She does not do power points really and lectures from memory, so be prepared for notes. But if you show up, take notes and talk and ask questions you will pass with no real problems.

Dr. Rebhun is a Treasure and UC Merced should be grateful that she is there. She knows her stuff and can direct you to where you want to go if she doesnt. Her lectures may be kinda dry, but theyre always fascinating and display both her wealth of knowledge and the complexity of culture.

Professor Rebuhn is very experienced in her field. She is lecture focused and often goes into anecdotes about her own experiences and stories. These can be very very interesting and engaging but alot of the material can be dry. There is alot of long texts to read so use shortcuts when you can. Very few assignments but enough time is given.

comment: As a third year anthropology major who was procrastinating on their cultural credits I finally took ANTH 01 with this professor. It is finally after finals yet she doesn't even have our midterms graded.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tests? Not many--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She's a great professor, though her lectures were kind of boring. I was falling asleep to them, most of the time. Though there are moments where she would talk about her experience in the field, and it always makes that students last. She has take home midterms, and I suggest you read those readings she assigns. She taught folklore and it was great

I loved Dr. Rebhun. She is amazing and her Ethnomedicine class was just brilliant. She definitely knows her stuff and conveyed it. Very helpful in every possible way - in class, e-mail, and OH. She made me almost want to be an Anth major just so I could keep taking classes with her.
A very smart lady and a lot of reading. You will have to read articles to prepare every week and write 3 essays. As long as you can prove to her you read the materials you will get an A.

Professor Rebhun's medical anthro class was extremely easy. Attendance is not really necessary, the readings are interesting (if you're into that sort of thing), and all of the exams were take-home essays. Not what I would consider a difficult class. Easy A (if you keep up with the reading).

Prof. Rebuhn is like a walking encyclopedia. Her class was like a semester-long discussion section. There were no PP presentations and she either talked to us or listened to us talk, which was quite interesting. Reading was heavy, no exams. We had to write three five-page papers and one ten-page final paper. Might get bored if you don't like Anth.

The professor only uses quizzes and exams for grades. A week or so before the exams she gives a "study guide" on possible writing short answer questions on the exams which is super helpful if you memorize the answers beforehand. However, you should study the quizzes and lecture material to be ready for the exams.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER IF YOU CAN. Your grade is only based off of quizzes and homework. She doesn't offer any extra credit, does not drop anything, your grade is what it is. She does not require attendance, her grading is harsh, her lectures are long and pointless. Study the quizzes and you'll get the 60% average on her test
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
I found it hard to get a good grade.. Once you do badly on one test you have no way to bounce back automatically D/F 
The exams do not relate to lecture at all or are nothing like the quizzes done in class
WIsh she would drop the lowest scores cause if you fail one quiz/exam you fail the class as a whole.

comment: I really enjoyed taking this course. The professor is very clear on what is to be expected in both the class and exams. She is a very fair professor, definitely not someone to intentionally give trick or challenging questions/assignments that arent relevant to the course. Very understanding and doesnt require attendance. An A/B is easily possible

I really enjoyed her lectures. She was funny and made the class interesting. The grading was very straightforward and even though it was a challenging course I had everything I needed to succeed in the class. Overall her class is a little tough but if you dedicate time to studying and doing the assignments you can easily get an A.

One of the hardest psych classes I've taken so far and you definitely have to work hard for a good grade! The topic is very interesting, but there was just A LOT of information & material packed into one lecture so it can be somewhat overwhelming especially if you're busy. 3 exams, 1 term paper, biweekly online quizzes, & participation activities!

If you don't possess an innate interest in the subject expect lectures to be long and boring. She's a good professor but lectures can become a little dry by mid-semester and you might be less willing to come to class. Otherwise good if you want to go into developmental psych, clear duedates, online Quizzes & HW, exams are wordy

Professor Scott is one of the best instructors at UC Merced. She's extremely intelligible on the courses she teaches, she's very concise, and her expectations for the class are very clear. If you're confused about any of the material, don't be intimidated to go and ask her. She'll help you understand.

She knows what she's talking about and is clear when answering questions. Her exams aren't the easiest but all you need to do is study the notes, ppts and the possible essay questions. Lecture isn't mandatory but it is helpful to know what some of the studies and pictures from the ppts are about. Not an easy A, if you work for it you'll get it.
very hard, grades tough. Go to lecture, take notes, watch videos intently. Test are difficult and make sure you know what she expects from the reaction papers

Professor Cerpa was a hilarious professor, and covered computer networks very well (undergrad level).  However, there is a *lot* of information to learn, and the group project is huge.  The project was the single most useful project other than professional research, and I learned a *ton* doing it. However, it is perhaps not for everyone.

Feel like you're not really learning at school? Look no further. You will be force-fed large amounts of knowledge. The best class I have taken at UCM so far. This class isn't for everyone though. The workload of this class is more like 12 units than a 4 unit class. Caused me so much pain. If you understand that, I would highly recommend this class

You will constantly be held past the lecture end time, and judged for leaving. Some days will be fantastic as he reveals the magic of pseudo code, and other days will feel dismal as you are demeaned for "reasons". Stay ahead of the reading to get more enjoyment from the class. The material is conveyed well, but tough to receive.

He is the worst professor. He does not know how to teach. All he does is read his slides and adds stuff you didn't learn in class on the exams. He accused so many people of cheating when they didnt cheat. He even copied his lectures slides and notes from Stanford and claimed they were his and even "copyrighted" them when they weren't his slides.

One of the worst professors on campus and the rudest person I have encountered in life. He copied all his lecture slides and notes from other universities and yells out people's midterms scores during lecture.

The class was taught in extreme depth, but Cerpa always told you what to study for, there was never any curve balls. The course was exam heavy, so studying for every exam was crucial. He was fair, and if you visited in Office Hours, he would really explain additional information in detail. Great professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Cerpa is a great lecturer! He never shied away from answering student's questions. He doesn't return midterm exams, or curve the class, and is critical of plagiarism, so don't cheat! He also covers a bit more material than other professors. Do and understand the discussion problems, implement the algorithms in code, and ask questions!

This was a tough course. Your grade consists of labs (20%), 3 midterms (18% each) and a cumulative final (26%). The third midterm is less than two weeks before the final, so that is a huge drag. Final is cumulative so you have to study everything, and Professor Cerpa covers a lot of material over the semester. You'll have to study hard to do good.
You can learn a lot from his course but have to work very hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Best CSE class i've taken at UCM. He's a fantastic professor and you'll learn an insane amount. I'd take it again in a heartbeat, but prepare to work for 2-3 weeks at a time on projects, lose your social life and never get proper sleep.

I LOVED her class! She is the sweetest, most understanding professor. She cares about her students, creating a free environment to collaborate/share historical interpretations. If I could take a class by anyone, she will always be my first pick. She is always so excited to hear students' thoughts on the material. I could not imagine a better prof.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment:
Professor Quinn writes a very scary, intimidating syllabus. DO NOT BE SCARED. She is strict on the no-phones policy, but her class is basically a book club, and with small headcounts it's some of the most fun I've had in any class ever.
Two pages per week is a perfectly chill assignment pace, and the midterm-final assignments aren't too bad either.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Professor Quinn is one of the most caring professors at UC Merced. She assigns a lot of reading but the reading is necessary for comprehending the material. She is good about returning papers promptly with feedback so that you can improve on your analysis of the readings. Overall a great course and a great professor if you're willing to work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I took Sholeh Quinn this fall semester and if you're a history major, you're going to like Sholeh Quinn. If not, then maybe you might not. Quinn makes you work A LOT. You basically read 24/7 and it can be stressful if you have other classes that are time-consuming. Her lectures can be boring but also really informative and also she's really caring.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: This lady will make you work. Though she helps you along the way in the course. She is so great to talk to and she has OH that you can go, and she is great with helping you out. She is one of the most caring professors and she wants to know how you are, whenever you aren't feeling that well. She does not allow computers or electronics in her class.

She really likes to work you. 1 essay per week, 100 pages to read per week (sometimes more) She quizzes often. Half way in the semester she introduces this project where on top of already writing one essay per week, now you have to write another. This means by the end you are writing 2 papers per week + reading. Cool subject, terrible pace.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I took Professor Quinn years ago before I graduated. I used to dread her class, but I realized that I was spoiled by easy instructors and she challenged me through my thinking, my comprehension, and my writing.  Expect to work hard. You definitely earn the grade you receive. When it's an A, feel proud of your work. You earned it!

Simply put, she's brilliant. She is funny, approachable, and a total sweetheart. However, get ready to work hard. An "A" is hard to come by, but when you get it, it can be the best experience. She will teach you what you need to know, but you have to be willing to learn. If you want to be challenged, take her class.  Go to office hours!

I had Dr. Quinn for History of Iran, Gunpowder Empires, and for my History Capstone course as an undergrad. To put it quite plainly, she's brilliant. I've never been so challenged as I was in Dr. Quinn's courses (my only B+ in college). She really urges her students to work with the sources and torture them for more info. Take her if you're serious
Professor Quinn is amazing. She is brilliant in her field, personable, and funny. Yes, she grades hard, but it makes the grades that much more wonderful to receive. Highly recommend.
Grades hard but you learn so much and her classes are very interesting! You must take her.

She really treated this seminar as an actual seminar. You must do the readings or at least skim through them because of weekly response papers. Attendance is not mandatory but she can tell when you're not there. You must write many drafts to get a great grade. I'm praying my third paper is what she wants. She's a great professor! Work hard!

Awesome professor. Be ready to put the work in because shes does actually grade. Do the work youll pass and learn. Only advice I Can give is to be detailed when answering questions, but not bs detailing. She really does care and goes out of her to help. Shes turly amazing!!

Truly one of the worst professors at this school. I was incredibly frustrated throughout class because of her disorganization, the almost nonsensical slides, and debate bating . I love to learn, but I hated taking this class specifically because of this professor.

She was very disorganized. shell change the syllabus everyday and never give full points. plays favoritism and is very noticeable. Lecture is extremely heavy and doesn't have a fair grading scale. She changes everything last minute and never sticks to her words. I dont recommend her class at all.

She was all over the place the whole semester. I thought it was just me that was confused the majority of the time but it seems like this was something a lot of people in the class also thought. Wouldn't recommend to other students.

Best Professor I have had. There was a ton to learn and she was always willing to help out. Her lectures were passionate, interesting, and informative. There is much to say, but overall awesome teacher! Put in the work and effort, youll make it through!

She is such an amazing person and a great professor. Not only did she make her class interesting she would also help you with anything she could outside of class. There is no way that you can not learn somthing new. She is so great and I am so glad that I took her class. I am taking one of her other classes next semester!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Crogman has become one of my favorite professors because she helped me remember why I chose to Major in psychology. Currently a professor at Stanislaus State, I've taken three classes with her and each of those classes, she motivated her students to do better and made learning fun and interesting! I highly recommend her.
Maryam is an exceptional teacher, this was my favorite class. She does things differently, in a non-traditional way that really helps students to grasp the concepts.

Shes at Stanislaus now. Shes awesome. I definitely recommend her. If you put in the time and do the work no reason to get anything less then an A. Shes super easy to talk to and understanding. Only thing is shes everywhere when it comes to grading. I personally didnt have any issues but I recommend you keep all the work till the end.

Awesome professor. Always ready and excited for class. Knows how to keep students engaged and makes not only learning but understanding the material is fun and easy to do. Would definitely recommend taking courses with. Attendance is required sign in during every lecture. Participation is required, which actually helps the material stick more.

I took him for 146 and was really easy. Most of class was just lectures. He is very knowledgable in many topics. We did not do a single assignment until the last month. He is very respectful towards his students. Also has no problem extending deadlines on assignments for students if needed. If you think his class is inappropriate please grow up.
Uncomfortable topics and extremely inappropiate. Talked about things that should be noted as shameful. DO NOT take this class unless you want to learn about disgusting sexual conduct.

The workload's very light with no busywork; you're only graded on in-class particpation (very easy pop quizzes), exams, and open note quizzes that greatly help with exams. If you do all these things and pay attention in class, you'll likely get an A. Prof H is also very nice, caring, and approachable. There are hardly any chances for make-ups tho.

Bobby was an amazing professor to have and was able to keep the class engaging and entertaining. Bobby was also really considerate with other students, making sure everyone succeeded in his class. I really loved Bobby's class and I would definitely take him again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Professor Hutchison is a great professor. He cares about the success of all his students both in and out of the class. Exams are based on the homework "quizzes" so just remember the answers. Lots of extra credit is offered throughout the semester as he wants to ensure the success of his students. Overall I would take this professor for psych 001.

Professor is pretty good, not that hard. No quizzes but there is homework due the day before exam(s). Attendance is not graded but there are random pop quizzes during class so always show up. Class themselves are very informative will help with exams. Would gladly take the professor again.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Professor Hutchison cares deeply about his students. The exams for this class are identical to the quizzes you have for homework, which are assigned weekly, so use them as a study guide. The only thing you're graded on are on the exams and quizzes, as well as a little of in-class participation so go to the lectures. Overall, I enjoyed this class.

S-tier Lecturer. 
Get participation points by answering lecture ques during lecture. 
Exam Ques are the same as Online Multi-Choice Quizzes, so study Quiz ques/ answers for exams. U get 3 tries for Quiz ques. 
Skip the readings/do Quizzes/study for exams 
Follow my advice and you should do fine. Do yourself a favor and Attend his EXCELLENT lectures

I would highly recommend those who are taking PSY 001, to pick Professor Hutchison. The class is structured in way that instructions are clear and he is very passionate about his job. He genuinely cares for his students and their education. His lectures are interesting. His assignments are easy. Exams are based on those readings that have quizzes.

Hes definitely a yapper in lectures and goes on tangents to make his point. Its easy to fall asleep if you're not actively taking notes, but if you are, the content can be interesting if you make it relevant to your own life. Exams are all memorization. I suggest making Quizlets from the HW and just studying those before the exam.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: The only homework is the quizzes that we are required to take before the actual tests. There are about 4 tests in total based off of reading and the questions are the same as the ones on the quizzes. It's pretty easy but during lectures he doesn't really teach anything and tends to go off on a rant about something unrelated.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
this professor will make u come to class just to say the most boring things. feedback given on papers is terrible
choose another professor if ur gonna take this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: be prepared to write a 12 page paper, annotated bibliography with 8 sources, a synthesis, and a 800 word reflection. also a presentation. boring lectures, don't even bother going, lectures don't help with class. if taking wri100, look for a better professor

Her class was so informative, really caused you to reflect on yourself and life outside the classroom. I really enjoyed her class, but would not recommend if you hate writing. We wrote a 3 page essay once a week + a discussion. I would take again.
Terrible this class was so long and boring she repeats everything and she gives so many papers but doesn't even give good feedback on how you can improve.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: If you come to office hours, she really helps you a lot. She really cares about her students and is really nice. I learned a lot about the topic in Sparks and enjoyed the discussion. I think my writing has improved, too.
I would not recommend her to anyone at all. She doesn't make things clear and wants you to see the problem before you go to her for help. Pick another teacher if you get her.

She was very vague on many things and repeats a lot of things over and over. She made us get many books that we used to only answer two or three questions. She also has a lot of dumb filler work for class that doesnt pertain to any of our course work. She doesnt give helpful comments to help improve your writing either.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Although Professor Antoine is the only instructor who hasn't given me an A on an essay, I do really love the philosophy and science that is examined in this course. And unlike some students, I felt her feedback on assignments was spot on and helped me refine my writing skills. Overall, with a lot of effort anyone could succeed in her class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: I have never had a more unreasonable, picky professor than this one. Her comments and grading rubric are borderline ridiculous. I would not recommend this professor to ANYONE!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Worst Prof. to be honest. Her feedback makes no sense and there are way too many assignments, she spends most of the class repeating the same bs over and over again. Ridiculous. She never is clear about what she expects and everything is way too vague. She doesn't give clear feedback on assignments and is still unclear when you reach out for help.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Very nice teacher who is passionate about what he teaches, tests can be difficult and that is why most kids don't do well. But if you study and pay attention you will do fine.

I enjoyed Kello because Lecture was once a week and then for the remaining lecture we did activities based on what we learned in lecture. There was a lot of writing involved in the class, but no tests which was good. It is helpful to take notes though because his lecture slides are mostly just topics and the detail he explains during lecture

Lectures became really dry and boring a few weeks in. He also is hard to hear sometimes because he doesnt like to use the mic in class. writing assignments can seem lengthy for those that dont like to write, ranging from 10-15 paragraphs
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: No textbook, all readings were online. Lectures can get boring to some. Very detailed and encourages discussion in class. No midterms/final, just 3 papers and SONA. Follow the grading rubric and you should be fine on the papers.
Great Professor! Lecture may get a little boring at times but he provides a clear grading rubric for all of the assigned papers. Plus no exam :D

Everyone said the teacher was horrible and terrible, but I feel the teacher was great. He was really knowledgable on all topics and very easy to approach. You have to write three essays in the class and he provides a rubric before every essay letting you exactly what he wants. If you cover all of the things on the rubric you'll be fine.

This professor is TERRIBLE.  It's one of those classes where you have to teach yourself.  The class is unorganized & lectures are extremely boring.  Oh and don't plan on getting an A+ in this class....I had a 98% and he only gave me an A.  I emailed him about it and he said that he only gives out A+'s to students who get 100% or more in his class.

Peevish but knowledgeable professor mainly interested in research. There are three strictly-graded essays which make up your grade. You will find absolutely no leniency in Kello regardless of the validity of your excuse, so research well, follow the rubric, and use professional writing. Lectures are very interesting, but attendance does not matter.

Kello is a nice guy, but he is clearly way more focused on his research than on his teaching. He barely prepares his lectures and his assignments are thrown together last minute and are extremely vague, almost unintelligible. The class was obviously an afterthought for him, and he is not experienced enough to wing it.

Class was easy enough. Weekly writing assignments and three research papers. No tests. I'm not too sure about the grading system though. I got an A- with a 95%. Not sure what this is all about, but it's my only real complaint.

im sorry for being rude but, DONT TAKE A CLASS WITH THIS TEACHER!! she is one of the worst teachers i had in a long while. she was very unclear and not helpful! i feel like i learned nothing in class.
Couldn't understand what she was saying, couldn't read her hand writing on the board. Long story short, I only went to class to see what we were on, then spent every Friday at tutoring.

Dr. Crona is a wonderful, sweet person, but she has yet to learn how to teach mathematics to "average" students because of the level of explanation she gives. She is highly intelligent, but for Math 5 students; She does a poor job teaching them.
I love Dr. Crona! She knows her stuff! She really wants respect and wants for everyone to succeed in her class! I love Dr. Crona!

I LOVE PROFESSOR CRONA! i think people are haters, she is a VERY nice person and when she is unclear she will go over it without a doubt. Yes she does compare us to kids in Sweden but everything she says is true. She says she never had to tell her kids in sweden to turn in an assignmet for them to do it.americans need incentives its true!

Not bad. Just listen in class, at least try to understand where she is going at and go to discussion. Exams weren't hard. Graded fairly. Accent is not bad; I can understand her. Brags about her students in Sweden though. But she's willing to help and answer questions. Her exams were fair in my opinion.

(calc 1) hard to understand, went to fast for my little head.  claimed her swedish students were much better. hurt my feelings with that one. i passed the class with a B+ over the summer with a grad student as the instructor (Stepanian)
Can't understand anything she says. By far the worst "teacher" I have ever had in my academic career.
No Comments
hard to understand because of accent. lectures in a different way. very willing to help students.
She is smart, experienced, and fun, and sometimes aloof,  but go to office hours, and you get excellent explanations and help.  Do the work and she is there to help you.
Don't make the mistake of not asking questions when you have them.  Everybody else is trying to figure the same thing out too.
Don't make the mistake of not asking questions when you have them.  Trust me, most of the time everybody else is trying to figure it out too.

very unorganized course. When i took her for entrepreneurship she didn't even have a syllabus or a course textbook. I realized that this class was not beneficial to my undergrad degree. If you don't need to take this course, then you should not take it.

Although Davis is a silly, blunt lady, she is not the most organized professor. This is mainly because she lacks structure and clarity. She never explains or reminds students of assignments due, you kind of have to just make up your own rules and turn them in on the due date listed in the syllabus. Expect to just go with the flow.

Davis is an incredible mentor if you are interested in following through with a degree in Business, Entrepreneurship or Marketing. She provides real life examples and has so much experience it really makes up for her not using CROPS. Her office hours are great to go and talk about class or future plans. She really is an amazing professor.

I find her as an inspiring successful leader that is choosing to share the ways she made it to the top in so many categories of business and marketing in particular. She can be difficult to understand at times but it's not impossible, and you can talk to her after class or in office hours. She's also entertaining, and many people enjoy her classes

1. she never uploads anything on Crops. no grades no assignments. no syllabus. she emails everything (not grades though)2. i scheduled an appt. with her to see how i was doing in the class, she never showed up 3. how are you supposed to progress as a student if you never get feed back from the professor??? what is the point. SO UNORGANIZED.
Very unorganized. You ask for help and she directs you to the class to seek advice. Turn in bs stuff and you get full credit.

SO DISORGANIZED. Sweet but incredibly unhelpful. So. Disorganized. I never knew when anything was due or what she required from us. She doesn't use CROPS, she sends emails. EMAILS. She frequently changed due dates without informing anyone. I don't know how someone decided she was qualified to teach a class called "Organizational Behavior."
He's honestly such an amazing teacher! He always keeps the class engaged and is super hilarious. He really tries to make sure you understand what's being taught, which I really like.
Rohit is a great instructor. He got a great sense of humor and more importantly, provided good review sessions for exams to study for.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Clear grading criteria

comment: Makes bio simple. Easy A just go to class.
He makes sure that you fully understand the concepts and explains things in depth. Just show up to your meetings and be prepared to learn. Then you're good to go.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Amazing and funny instructor, you won't regret taking his class
I had Rohit for Biology 5 class and he was really great. He always gave feedback and the class was really easy. His review sessions are the best, so study and do not piss him off. He is pretty chill.

Rohit is an awesome TA. He is by far one of the best TAs! He helps you out when you have questions and is willing to guide you in the right direction. His memes are hilarious. Beware he loves Star Wars. Overall an amazing experience. I want him to be my TA for every class.
One of the best TA I have had.
Amazing TA! Very helpful and works with your schedule, best lab TA I've had so far. Definitely recommend.
Very good TA, was very helpful in explaining concepts that were hard in class or we simply could understand while trying ti complete the lab
He's the GOAT and he's funny asf you just gotta be on his good side and joke along.
Simply the goat.

Before rating James, know that this class will always be hard in the summer because of how much stuff there is to cover in 8 weeks. You need to go to office hours in this class to succeed (before going I had 64%, after I got 88). James's lectures were hard to follow at times, but outside of class he was kind and helpful and he gets undeserved hate.
Worse professor. Don't take his class, only depend upon TA.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: He solves example problems from his lecture handout, but doesn't post solutions often. There are some lecture pop quizzes and mandatory attendance. He does make some mistakes in lecture & omits some steps but his work is easy to follow. Exams are not difficult and are based off of hw, ws, & study guide but he is a harsh grader so show every step!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: His accent is heavy so you really pay attention to what he is saying. Goes straight into practice problems that he makes up on the fly, doesn't really explain the process enough and messes up. Hw is 15% of our grade(same as midterms)while quizzes are 5% of our grade which to me doesn't make sense. IDK if ima pass. Rely on TA and outside sources.

overall, his course is not the greatest. the way he lectures is mostly boring and skips major steps when explaining the material. when he does practice problems he does it wrong or doesnt explain properly. theres quizzes for attendance. hw isnt bad, not alot. in general, not great lecturer and course. depend on ur ta and yourself.

Heavy accent, unprepared lectures, unclear explanations. Lectures consist of doing practice problems which he does on the fly and would mess up on. Stingy on midterm points as well; a 3 part question, I got 2 parts correct and I get a 2/10 on it. Also must memorize/derive all trig rules, quadratic surfaces and their equations for midterms/final.

Avoid taking any class with him, the hw given, discussion assignments, and midterms contain things that you will not see in lecture or in any assignments. You must also completely learn how to derive equations for problems, if unable to just doing the work is worth 10% of the points for that problem. Has a heavy accent,  and bad at explaining.

has a very heavy accent so hard to understand. Would talk and not explain. Don't bother trying to reschedule a test. It can be a dire emergency and all he'll say is to take the 0. Did drop lowest test and allowed to retake 1 quiz but that's it. Need a better lecture plan or something. failed that class so hard

He will not work with you about changing your Exam dates AT ALL. He told me to just take the zero on my exam and fail the class when I asked if it would be possible to take it earlier. I had a dire family situation I needed to be out of town for, he did not care.

He's new and hasn't developed good lectures methods. I had him for an online class, his lectures were just 2 hours of unenthusiastically going through a textbook and doing the problems on them. He gives unscheduled pop quizzes in class that are on information we just went over that day in class. As someone who loves math, his class is very boring.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Fr this ma'am does not understand these data structures. I doubt she can solve any LC questions and pass the interview.

In general, this lecturer did not meet my expectations. Throughout the entire semester, it felt like she was only concerned with finishing the slides rather than ensuring we understood the material. The lectures were difficult to follow, and when I sent emails to ask questions, only a few of them received replies. It's better to learn from YouTube

Dr. Pan is a great professor, however, she sometimes forgets the English word for certain key terms, which may throw students off if they're not already familiar with a topic. Midterm and Final are MCQ, final has no coding questions and are all abstract data structure questions. She also has a few fun activities in class to demonstrate algorithms.
No cap, she doesn't understand what she is teaching. She neither a computer network person. Won't take classes she teaches.

comment: She does a good job of making u interested in the subject

Curriculum is horribly outdated and centered around 4 projects in NESC in which you receive little to no assistance from professor, when confronted about the difficulty and lack of assistance on project 1, the professor said we could fail that one because it wasnt weighted much of our grade. Tests are ridiculously difficult.

comment: Some perspective here, the curriculum for this class is awful. The languages learned in this classes is outdated and has little to no information on how to use NESC. Very extremely hard test and projects. I think the teacher is good and she was just handed another teachers curriculum which hurt the students. If Hamid is still a TA, hes the best one
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: In general this class is difficult with many topics to cover through the semester. I believe the professor could have done a better job delivering the material and showing students what topics are the most important. Expect to work by yourself and dont expect a curve. During exams you will see problems never seen during lecture or the textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Would not take again! Midterm and final were super hard and theres barely any guidance for the course projects.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: This was the worst class I ever took. After complaints about a coding project, she told us it was ok to fail it, because "it's only 5%" which to me means she's ok with not providing any help. The TA's are the only ones who will actually help. Everything snowballed into a terrible class that wasn't helped by the remote learning situation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I wish he taught more classes or more professors took tips from him. He is amazing, you just need to be present. I appreciate how he puts emphasis on understanding the work because these days there are many ways to simply DO the work. Easy n fun class.

Blanchette really makes this course something that you can digest. The material is hard, but he really does a good job of getting his point across. Not to mention, he basically gives you 30% of the grade for free for homework and quizzes. Just make sure you go to lecture. I didn't and I paid for it in sleep and tears to barely even get an A. <3

To be clear this is NOT an easy class. Francois is a hard teacher and you should be prepared to study. However, he teaches well, is a fair grader, and is always willing to help students. So far its been my favorite class at UC Merced! Review b4 Taking: Derivative Techniques, Integration Techniques (by parts, u sub, etc.) and, basic geometry

Calculus is 3 is a very hard topic to grasp, so the class itself is hard. He's genuinely not aware of the pace he's teaching sometimes but is willing to help in office hours. He sets a curve at the beginning of the year and doesn't change it even if everyone fails the midterms. Try your best and study hard.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Very hard class, but compensated by a brilliant professor (MIT PhD btw). He makes even the toughest elements of Calculus 3 understandable to the student. I feel prepared for furthering my mathematical training because of Francois. Note that the class will be difficult, but he is there to help you! Go to lecture! Go to office hours! You can do it!

Likely the best professor that I have ever had. Incredibly engaging and pretty funny during both lectures and office hours. Class material is very challenging and it is easy to fall behind as he goes through the course pretty fast. Highly suggest going to lectures if you want to pass.
The material in the class itself is difficult, but Professor Blanchette is their to help you out . He is hilarious in class and tries to make the material fun to understand.
He is a great lecturer, very funny and knows his stuff. However, make sure you go to office hours, sometimes he goes over things fast so depending how you are as a student it would help.

I did really well in this class. My discussion leader was an not very good. I mostly taught myself everything, but in class Francsois covers a lot very well. He is great in lecture. I would ask questions right away if you don't understand what he's saying in class.  I earned an A+. People say his class is hard; they don't study.
Blanchette is such a nice guy but his tests are hard but then again the class is very difficult. He is very useful in office hours but the class itself is very difficult to grasp.

The professor is clearly very passionate about the class and it shows. I would say, however, everything was graded to the last second of the semester and I had no idea what my grade was until the end. Midterm and final papers were 7+ pages each with mini-essays in between. Overall, the class was interesting just make sure you communicate with him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: Hatton is very kind and a great professor. However, there is a lack of clarity in lots of his assignments and expectations. This class was very heavy on reading and for the greater portion of the semester we had weekly short essays. He is very passionate and knowledgeable so if you take his class make sure to attend office hours and ask questions
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: This class requires a lot of reading. I do agree that this class takes a lot of effort but it is doable. The professor is caring and easily accessible outside of class. there are people who don't try and complain about the class being too much. the professor is just building up skills we will need for the future.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: took this class almost 5 years ago, lecture heavy class so get ready to take notes or doze off. I thought he was blind for the first two months of the semester due to him closing his eyes during his lecture. HE WILL CALL ON YOU, if he sees you on your phone. Make sure to read as he will ask about reading section assigned for the week.

Amazing, incredibly brilliant professor. Take notes on everything he says in class, as it will help with assignments and exams. Read and Keep in mind who wrote what, the time period, why they wrote it, and have an interrogating mindset. He is very welcoming and always open to helping his students in any way. Highly recommend office hours.

You go through a book a week, so it's a lot of reading. His vocabulary is intense, so you have to pay attention to keep up. Also, take notes because his slides aren't in the format of bullet points. His exams are pretty tough if you don't do the readings. He's super nice and a tough grader, but if you turn in quality work you can get a good grade.
Extremely intelligent man. Doesn't talk down to you and expects high levels of performance in his students. Reading intensive. Not an easy class but great learning environment.
doesn't understand theory as well as he would like you to think, pretentious and condescending. inconsistent grading (subjective) and does not respond to email

He is brilliant. Sometimes his lectures are hard to follow because his vocabulary is unfathomably extensive BUT he's a lenient grader, if you show up and try your best (office hours) there is absolutely no way to fail the class. Achieving an "A" is easier than you would think after taking one of his brutal exams. (Black lit exams easier).

This class was taught like i cant believe another could have--his voice presntation and knowledge of theory, was clear and exciting. His method of study and assignment for notes: are of such great use i never stopped implementing them. Completely approachable. Completely kind, and intelligent. Would give the most useful advice whenever asked.

I took her class during the summer and her lectures usually didn't start until 20 minutes past the hour as she took attendance every session (including the days we took tests). She has impromptu presentations and class rule changes which aren't on the syllabus. Her lectures and lecture notes can be extremely unorganized making the book a necessity.

I would not want to use the word easy, but she was not hard by any means. It was a summer class too.  She has an accent which can cause clarity issues thus leaving one to find themselves susceptible to boredom. Book not a must, but can help w/ above issues. Quiz questions pooled for test. Paper plagiarism check via turnitin.com. She was nice to me.

I took a summer course with Tandra and I thought she was a fine professor. She gives practice tests before each exam, and chooses half of the questions for the tests. She also has you do presentations from a section in a chapter. And does role. That is pretty much it. Just go to class and you'll be fine.

Her lecture is boring, so surf the internet with a laptop. She counts an attendance. Be there. Her midterms are extremely hard but the final is extremely easy. Also, you have a term-paper. If you get 50% for each mid-term, an A for the term-paper, and B for the final, you get a C+. A textbook is useless so don?t buy it.
Everybody hated her, but I never had a problem. She has an accent but it didn't bug me at all.

Quite possibly THE worst professor I have had in my undergraduate career.  Rude, very hard to understand, tests and quizzes were pointless, and she needs training to teach a class, seriously.  If she is still here next year, DO NOT TAKE ANY OF HER CLASSES!!!!

She could definitely use some practice teaching. She knows the general concepts pretty well, esp in her area of expertise; however, her classes are confusing, unorganized, and well, pretty irritating. She does have an accent that makes it difficult to understand her at times, but just ask her to write on the board and it'll be easier to comprehend.

I would not reccomend her. As a student, I appreciate accuracy. She does not uphold this characteristics. She is not clear in any of ther assignments or requirments. She is not that qualified in my opinion.
No Comments
He is a good teacher and this class is easy af. I went for orientation and that's the only class I've been to all semester. Currently sitting at a 94%. Uses onle homework that's super easy.

he is now at The University of Arizona. Really good teacher! he thought the honors class and made it really fun! I hate economics, but with him it seemed as pleasurable as it can be to someone who doesn't like the subject. Really smart, and VERY helpful! he cares for the students, and want us to do our best! do all the extra activities!
also had him for econ 001. i liked him better in the smaller, upper division class. he has unusual multiple choice tests, but fairly easy

Todd is a great professor. The class may be a little difficult if you have no prior knowledge in Econ, but there's enough extra credit to make up for that. The homework gives you three tries on each question. He's really fun to be around and his class is one of the more interesting I was taking this semester.
After retaking his class, I got a C and I think I learned more. He makes class fun and I Love the experiments.
Cool guy. Gives a lot of extra credit so don't miss it! Its help in the end. And the exams aren't too bad if you pay attention in class.
