Todd is knowledgeable in economics and is an interesting person to get to know. He's friendly, grades relatively easy and offers a ton of extra credit. But I offer a word of advice: Don't miss the real homework assignments!
Total HOTTIE. I love him and his diet coke. Even though the book teaches 75% of the class, attendance isn't mandatory. It is expensive though to buy the Aplia account.
he is awesome, hella easy, and lots of extra credit and homework credit. if you get him, youll pass. just do your hw!
The professor is great, Ive slacked off a bit and passed the class with a solid B, if you attend class, pay attention, and do the work you will receive an A. Greatest writing professor
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: One of the best English teachers I've ever had. Very fair and a great person to send drafts to.

Boring and unintelligent professor. Very unfortunate because the class could have been very interesting. Her job for part of the semester was to teach her class about certain topics in the STEM field, and would literally say things like "I don't understand this science stuff" and have a student explain it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Pretty chill. Appreciates a good blonde joke. Doesn't take late work but gives you sufficient time.
Shes pretty chill, just do your work on time
Very lenient. Enthusiastic about her teaching. Need to put in work for that A tho. Writing 10 class was not bad she's just a bit unorganized.
She is an excellent teacher! Provides clear instructions and gives great feedback on essays. I encourage you to go to her office hours, it really helps!

Great and interesting professor! Her class was always fun to attend. She is very enthusiastic about writing/English. If you do all the work and attend office hours, you will be able to get an A! Her grading is very fair and creativity is welcomed.
I had her for writing ten and one, don't expect an easy A. She wants hard work and unless you are a natural born writher don't expect anything higher than a B. Go to Office Hours!

Professor Vang is truly an incredible writing professor! You need to read many articles before class because there were many group discussions. I went to his office hours, and he was really helpful with the essays for the class. As long as you do the straightforward assignments and only three essays for the entire semester, you can succeed! 10/10
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: He really is so kind, 100/10 professor. He is so intelligent on culture, society and stuff of that nature. I will always recommend his class. BEST PROF!

I really enjoyed this class with professor Vang, he is very intelligent and knowledgeable on topics of cultural importance in education and other aspects, such as healthcare. There are weekly journals and 3 essays, plus an assigned reading and discussion every class. I highly recommend taking this class, and it's not hard to receive an A.
As a first year I believe his class was very nice to have. He's very nice and laid back. His class is manageable if you have to balance other classes as well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: The topic of his writing class this particular semester was pretty easy. I had a lot to mention off the top of my head. I did not attend his class very often, but he was very understanding. I never had a grade lower than a 95 on any of his essays. You need to present for in-class activities. Easy class.
Like his class, easy to understand

I had to retake writing class and did not want to be there. The professor personalized the material which made it easier to listen in class. He is awkward but is willing to help and clarify with any confusion.

Professor Vang is a great teacher! I would recommend him to people who are going to take WRI10. He gives feedback and is willing to help his students. The class is reading intensive, so it might be hard for some people but it is expected (it's a writing class after all). You should attend class as much as possible since the discussions help a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: This professor lets us out early, but he grades harshly and he's really awkward. There are several assignments assigned which includes: 4 essays (1 argumentative and 1 research paper) & 10 journals. His feedback's not that great so don't expect him to help a lot. He needs Jesus tbh
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Grade = 3 exams + 3 assignments. All notes were used on the exam. Very chill and kind professor. Very easy introductory course, but not a statistics class. You don't really learn a lot, nor do you learn applications.
He is a fantastic professor and gave us 3 homework assignments throughout the whole fall semester that were easy. No quizzes/midterms.

This class was easy and the readings weren't heavy. Your grade is based on lab work and exams. He drops your lowest exam score, therefore you only need to take 3/4 exams. Lectures aren't mandatory but he explains the material very good. He goes off track a lot but other than that, it's a good course.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: The only bad thing about this class was having to buy a book but it wasn't super expensive. The class overall was easy, we read 1 chapter a week and complete the lab from the chapter. Theres 4 exams but he drops one and the exams are easy because they are all from his lecture notes so pay attention to those mostly, the book is also helpful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Exams do makeup 75% of your grade, but theyre pretty easy and completely multichoice. Gave study guides for exam 2 and 3 that tell you everything you need to know. 25% of ur grade are labs which are filling in workbook pages that are graded on completion. He's really passionate when lecturing.
Easy intro class. Dr. Wooding is very kind and smart. Only downside is he has no office hours.

Professor Wooding is one of my favorite professors at UCM. Attend class and the class is straightforward. Attending class will help a lot with exams since exams are on the lectures. He gives examples and goes in depth in class that the slides do not. The class consists of 3 exams, 4 essays, 1 research paper, and SONA. EC is given at some lectures.

The class was not challenging, however the exams were a bit tricky. As long as you study, you will be fine. Make sure you work for it on the first exam as that can effect your final grade. There is only three exams so your grade can be easily damaged.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Wooding's class was easily one of my favorite classes at UCM. He can go on a tangent at times, but he is very engaging because he is extremely passionate about Public Health. Show up to the class meeting times, and you will do very well in the course--participation/in class activities are random and worth a lot of the grade.

I had for the summer, so it was short and easy, but he is confusing on the grading, but we got to work in partners the whole time for every assignment. My only advice is to always write more than what he expects even just a little can help even when he doesn't ask because he is going to want a least a paragraph for each assignment.

This isn't my first time with this professor but it was a better experience than before, he changed up his exams after hearing us out on how difficult they were, which they were because it was formatted like his upper div exams. Overall better than before but he always assigns the most expensive books and grades random attendance.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He seems passionate, but gets easily offended if you dont understand some things the way he explains them. Tests are awful. If you are a good writer and do the reading youll do fine, but hes a bit stressful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Professor Sakin tries his best to explain the material, but he does read off his slides for the most part. There are in class-assignments that are completed in groups so attendance is encouraged and 2 exams total. Make sure to do all the readings since exams are heavily based on them and STUDY since there are no opportunities for extra credit.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Been meaning to leave a review. Never thought a Prof. Like this actually existed. Stress of being a full time student and working part time, but this class made my spring semester at Sac state unbearable. Expectations of Prof. was unclear and to top it all off this guy was rude to his students. Hurt people hurt, is all I gotta say about this man.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: The class was harder than it shouldve been. The entire semester you have to work with a group and a big portion of your grade is based off of these group assignments. The professor makes rude comments to students fairly often as well. The class felt like it was all over the place and not thought out very well. I would not take this class again.
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Participation matters

comment: A lot of the time, it was unclear what he wanted out of the class. It's not a hard course, as long as you participate. He's a very nice guy too. Would take again.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Lots of reading. Unspecific with the grading, but overall, he was passionate about the subject. Do the readings, participate & study, and you'll be good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Beginning of this course attendance was not mandatory, after time he made attendance mandatory. Very unclear on the exact way our grades were being calculated and seemed upset when we asked for clarification. Class is loosely structured ( to his benefit), grading overall is not given a concise scale that is followed. Took months to put grades in.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: My senior seminar with Professor Joshi was a new experience. There was a lot of reading every week on dense PoliSci topics, but class discussions were always enjoyable. You were graded on two small reading responses, participation, and one bigger term paper. Though, sometimes Ishan will let students take stabs at answers a for too long
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: I loved this class as it was the only one I got an A. I enjoyed the subject, the professor and the class. Looking forward to another class with Dr. Joshi!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Absolutely amazing. Introduced me to the magical world of politics, and now I'm hooked on the science of it. Very approachable, very clear, and genuinely cares about his students. A very rare combination considering how smart he is-- his modesty is impressive! Too bad he is not teaching this term. Best semester EVER.

Professor Joshi's lectures are not very detailed and his assignments don't really make sense most of the time. He rambles in lecture and never really gets to the point. Students really struggle to connect to him and his class because he's really boring that its almost infuriating. If it weren't for the TA's extra credit I would have not done well.

Great prof! I don't like history or poli sci but needed to take for my major and he's very nice and makes the class interesting I'd take him again any day. He's TA Devon was really helpful as well. You must go to discussion if you want to get an A though!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Joshi is a new professor here at the university and has engaging courses. I took this intro class with him and found it very interesting; he goes into detail about the topic we study. I did not use the textbook, however, I did attend every lecture, discussion, and office hours to assure I felt confident in the material. Interesting class!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I am so grateful to Professor Joshi for giving such amazing lectures at I learned a lot from his class. The guy is so brilliant and yet so humble and helpful. We really enjoyed having him as our prof and add it turned out a mentor. I cannot wait to take another one if his classes.

Going to Professor Joshi's classes gave me the confidence to land a summer internship! He offered me assistance in any confusing topics that I was struggling with and made himself available via zoom for office hours. He is also just a really nice guy and his intelligence and vast knowledge on the subject never affected his ego.  Thank you so much!

Ive had him for 4 classes now. He gives study guides and sticks to the syllabus. Youll never get pop quizzes, but be sure you know the topics that are given. Hes very knowledgeable on international relations, comparative politics, and American politics. He tries to stay bipartisan. This causes you to think outside of your range no matter what.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: His classes are pretty easy. He gave weekly quizzes and everything was done via canvas. His exams were in class and you would have to sign in via post it's but if you did the quizzes, most questions were on the quizzes. You would go to class and he would lecture.

Dr Tracy is one of the best professors. You can tell he is very passionate about the subject and will miss all of his stories when he was a pharmacist. The class is so interesting. All of the assignments are easy because he gives you in questions to study. He truly does his best to make sure his students succeed. If you fail its totally on you.

Loved this class, great professor. You can tell he loved the subject and cares about students passing. It was so easy to pass with an A. Class includes 6 homework assignments (super easy), 5 quizzes (open notes), and 3 exams. The final exam could even be at home if enough students do course evaluations. I 100% recommend Tracy, will miss his class!

Such a great professor! I had his class multiple times and would take him again in a heartbeat. Really caring and you can tell he is passionate about what he teaches. Lectures can be confusing at times, but he is very approachable and advocates for students to ask questions & participate. Assignments & quizzes are few and exams are straightforward.

He is a caring and understanding professor. He will accomodate based on student needs, one of the most nicest professors out there. His lectures tend to be based off slides posted on canvas. But he goes fast over them so you will need to check them after class and review the notes.

Best professor ever! Quizzes are open note, exams are in person. Homework is pretty easy. If 70% of the class does the course evaluation last exam is online. Makes study guides for you. Class cancelled the day after an exam to help give you a mental break. Really cares about his students.

Dr. Tracy has to be one of the best psych professors at UCM. The amount of care he has for his students is amazing, making sure no one is struggling with the material he teaches. His exams & quizzes are not too hard, with quizzes being open note & exams consisting of questions straight from previous quizzes. Highly recommend taking this & PSY186

AMAZING professor! I learned so much in his class. He teaches a lot and it may seem overwhelming but the content is so interesting. It seems he may be going too fast, but just read over the notes and the material will make perfect sense. He's very enthusiastic about pharmacology. Highly recommend him!!

I took Professor Tracy's PSY185 class and its was one of the best experiences I've had with a professor so far. He is very respectful and helps students understand the lecture materials. Not a lot of homework but enough for you to review and understand the materials in the assignment. 10/10 would recommend taking his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Best professor I've had. He explains everything in detail so that you can understand concepts. If you don't get it the first time don't worry bc he reviews previous lectures at the beginning of every class. If you review slides, quizzes, hw, and class questions, you'll do great on exams. A lot of questions are straight out of them. So much respect.

Dr. Tracy is amazing! Extremely knowledgeable and passionate when teaching. His lectures are interesting and fun to follow. Although attendance isnt mandatory, I personally recommend going to class because some concepts tend to be more difficult to understand; however, he does an amazing job of explaining those concepts in class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She is a very amazing professor who is willing to dedicate time of her own to help you be successful in your Spanish. For her class, you could get the textbook and the access code or simply just the code, which I recommend best because you could access the book online, and plus the homework is submitted online, so the book is really not necessary.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Overall shes a good professor. I would have like four assignments weekly. You also have to buy a textbook and a code which was pretty expensive. Her grading is also very strict.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Great Professor! Gives good feedback on the work you turn in. Very accessible and works with you if you need extra help or explanation. I took this class online, attendance is required and she will call on students during lecture. Overall this class is pretty straight forward, there is a good amount of homework and studying to do however.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Professor Torda is intelligent and fair. Her lectures are focused and fun, she knows her material and brings joy to learning. Do all the work, follow all instructions and she will guide you to a good grade. Use her office hours, she is a wonderful listener! Highly recommend any course with this professor.
Professor is good at what she does, could use a little enthusiasm once and a while.  Is great with feedback! Can be an easy grader!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: It was mostly review for me, but it was also great. Prof. Torda is a great professor and a really nice person as well. Expects quite a bit of work from her students, but if you do everything you will have an easy A. She also laughed at my jokes and never kicked me from class. Wrote a letter of recommendation for me as well. Thanks for everything!

This class was upper division adv conversation and composition. I though compared to the Spanish classes I am currently taking) that this one was fairly simple. However, she does ask that you turn in flawless composition nearly every other week. She grades pretty easy and there's almost no need to study.
THE BEST PROFESSOR!!!

This is probably the easiest class I have taken at UCM. Do the work and you get 100%. She supposedly gives the hardest quizzes of all the Spanish professors, but really? Those quizzes were a breeze. She's a fantastic Spanish professor and has some fun jokes under her sleeve. She creates a close environment in the classroom.
Yeah... He's pretty hot.

All of those who says he grades tough are just people who simply cannot write or are not willing to take writing seriously. He teaches WRI10, not Introductory Writing. It's not his fault if you give him garbage to grade. Overall, a cool guy who is down to earth and hip. You can't go wrong if you pay attention and put forth a good effort.
Very hard with grading. Beware if you are not that good in writing. And must meet minimum length requirement to recieve decent grade.
Really bad teacher. Grades extra hard on everything. too many quizes!
Such a nice guy but terrible as a teacher

Jeremy is awesome! His class is really interesting and the in-class discussions are really thought provoking. All comments and questions are always welcomed. Jeremy treats all of his students with respect and is never condescending. He is very helpful and I definitely benefited from being his student.

Is an interesting, hippie-esque kinda guy. I don't know when the last time is that he trimmed his beard, but it was a while ago. Great teacher, but hard grader. He has a lot of potential to be one of the best WRI professors at Merced. Very chill, watches YouTube during class while students are working. He cares about who you are and what you think.

Very helpfull understanding professor. He is so cool. Picks reading taht I actually would like to read. Tells us his views and opinions straight up. Down to earth. Hard grader but that's good because it helps improve your writing. Thanks Jeremy your awesome
Jeremy is great! Since he is still young he can relate to his students.  The reading assignmnets are actually interesting and his class is never boring

I felt like the slides were unorganized and hard to study from, and they do not go in the same order as the textbook at all. It was hard to read along with lecture since the information in the book would be way behind or ahead of lecture. I also felt like some of the test questions were unclear and we only had like 4 other assignments.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: PSY 183 was very difficult and complex information about genetics. class consisted of a couple easy group assignments (like writing exam questions or movie reviews), take home midterm, and the final. His "study guide" for the final was very vague and unhelpful. However, i'm currently in his psy 133 and it's much better (so far).

The class was difficult. I usually get really low grades, like C average, I worked on the homework the day it was assigned and tried to complete it ASAP. I'm not going to lie, it was a very dense class and if your looking for something easy going, this ain't it. But if you are interested in the subject and are willing to work, then go for it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: The structure of this class was terrible. Professor gives you homework and doesn't explain anything. Came to every single lecture yet learned absolutely nothing.

Lectures were pretty boring. He expects you to know all the material, even though he never explained it properly. Lecture slides are pointless, they don't help with the homework or the tests. One of my least favorite courses I've taken at UC Merced.
Great professor, very knowledgeable about genetics. He might seem like a hard professor, but if you take the time to read and go to lectures, you won't have a problem passing his class.

As long as you do the homework, which is like 4 assignments the entire semester you should do well. The midterm is based off of the first two homeworks and everything else he wants you to know he tells you in the study guide. There are mixed feelings about this professor but in my opinion he is great.

Terrible Professor, doesn't know how to explain concepts, he can't even answer questions asked in class. Exams are difficult and lectures are boring. He expects you to know things he hasn't taught yet. TA is better than him. He's not helpful at all.

I enrolled in two of his upper division Psych 190 courses during the first semester that he taught at UC Merced. I received A's in both. There were mixed feelings about his grading but my experience was a positive one. Very helpful, clear, flexible, and understanding. Go to class and you'll pass!

He saved my grade in probability and statistics with his clear and good explanations. Lectures in Math 32 were often boring and hard to pay attention to with my professor. However, this TA explains the material very well and I learned more from this man than the professor in lecture. I also heard he is a great TA for Math 141!

A great TA who will literally go over everything on the test. There is one lab a week and it is 3 hours long. Hes funny, caring, and will make sure you are provided with everything you need to pass. He does his best to make sure you understand the concepts. Homework is through ALEKS and there is about 40 topics a week. Not too bad.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Such a great professor. He is so kind and caring. His lectures are very clear and to the point. The hw is not bad at all if you don't wait to the last minute to do it. He makes the course very easy to pass. He tells you what you need to know for the midterms so you don't even have to study the whole study guide. Would highly recommend taking him.

Made me love math. If you do the work and practice you will do fine. The midterms are very similar to the practice midterms. The method for grading quizzes can seem harsh, however it makes you learn the material. One of the most satisfying classes ever. He has a very good teaching style and is well organized. I can not recommend him enough.

He is great professor. Accessible outside of class and emails. Midterms and final have no surprises because he went over all possible questions in the tests. He will drop lowest two quiz grade. Do HW and possible quiz problems. It is an easy A if you are willing to do some work for it.

I thought he was a good professor. Each section hell simply do 3-4 example problems and explain them step by step, I thought it was an effective way of teaching. Weekly quizzes and homework, two midterms and the final is everything on the gradebook. One bonus question for extra credit on the first midterm and the final. Does not curve the class.

Prepares well for exams. Gives problems simliar to practice exams but harsh grader. He is so kind and caring, gives extra credit on exam as bonus problem. Screw over midterm but final exam helped bounce back. Very caring knowing that students struggle so he hold extra office hours. Expect what he go over to be on the final, his exams are no trick.
His grading scale is the worst thing I have ever come across and his pride is too high to help out struggling students when grades were bad due to his grading scale.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Hes very nice and caring since he was also a student not long ago. Very understanding and give extra credit. Just tough in grading since he grades by rubric so no work no points. Level of difficulty is actually low but carelessness can destroy you bc its easy to trip up on easy problems. Pass final and failed midterm will pass class.
His lectures are informative but if youre not a history buff, you wont like it. Multiple four page papers throughout the class, each one due once every 3 weeks. He is funny tho. Tough grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: There were fieldnotes and presentations due every week. Chill teacher just a lot of assignments.

Class was chill. Very few assignments though so make sure everything is done well. Quizzes are really easy as long as you pay attention to the TA. Lectures aren't necessarily mandatory but go to discussions (that's where you get answers for quizzes). Projects are chill and very open to interpretation. Prof is nice and an easy grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Super cool Prof! Really laidback classroom environment w interesting lectures. Not many assignments, so do them all. Chances to make up poor quality or missing work. Not a tough grader, unless its obvious that you didnt do reading, or your citations are not formatted right. Final project kinda unclear, so communicate progress to be sure youre good
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Tran's class is easy however, it's HELLA boring(taken during covid). The work itself was really easy; we had reading assignments and 2 projects. Take the class if you want an easy SPRK class but if you want to be entertained find something else because I was extremely bored.

Professor Tran is a really understanding professor. His assignments are super straight forward and very easy to get done. Yes they are 500 words but if you do the reading, the papers are easily completed. Hes a cool guy outside of class and if you need any help he will be more than happy to help. Also replies to emails extremely fast. 11/10

Lectures were jam-packed with lots of information and the professor does not post slides online. Sometimes he goes pretty quick but he never hesitates to go back if you ask politely. Overall I would recommend Professor Tran, he's an effective professor and friendly.

I took him his second year in and he is a very relaxed teacher and gets along well with students and can be very witty and funny given the opportunity, he was always a class I looked forward to and if you missed everything was online. He uses a reading book as a textbook but you can get by very very easily without it.

Took professor as when he was new that semester. Lots of reading in book assignments, ALOT! Easy-ish weekly assignment based on summarizing readings w/ 500 words. Lectures were easy understood learned Korea culture and history. Pretty funny nerdy professor that was nice. Had lots of office time to help. Group discussions in class that were great.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He was a helpful professor, but the assignments are definitely very tough. Be sure to maintain a good communication with others about the project as sometimes it's hard to tell if you are even getting the expected result. The final project is a killer because you have to choose your own project, so the objective is even more vague.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: As long as you pay attention in the lectures, you'll be fine. Homework is pretty easy and the final was take-home.

the prof is alright. i thought he did a good job with teaching the material during lecture and explained hard concepts well and he made lab attendance optional. exams were hard because he didn't give us practice exams or let us use a cheat sheet and he didn't make himself available for lab assignment assistance. he's not bad but not good either.

lectures very hard to follow, just read off the slides (i wish he did coding examples on zybook during class) The textbook is around 70 don't buy off UC store wait for him to post the syllabus. optional lab lecture. I just do the work and hope to pass. this course is not intro I found I had to teach myself Challenge activities r extra credit

The HW was not difficult if you looked back on the lecture slides. His lecture slides extensively covered all material on the HW and final take-home exam. You needed to actually pay attention and go to lectures if you wanted the class to be smooth, or self-learn outside. Chill guy, happy to answer questions. Not the best lecturer but he got better.

At first I was afraid to take this class because of the negative reviews. Prof. Farias is super caring and responds quickly to emails. His lectures are pretty straight forward....but, this class is not INTRO! It's best if you already have plenty of knowledge in programming using Python. It was not an easy class. Lots of HW! Took it in the summer.

Your time would be better spent learning from resources outside of class. The professor reads directly off the slides and never stops to confirm student understanding. Furthermore, the slides are so poorly worded that even the professor gets lost. The homework itself (as of 3 months in) is simple enough but you NEED Google.

Worst Teacher ever. Showed up to first lecture an hour late. Gives zero effort within his teachings, he reads write off of his slides and looks like he just woke up. He grades poorly, and grades assignments weeks behind. Would never take him again ever.

Very lecture-heavy but monotonous. Only reads off the slides and does a poor job of explaining concepts. Homework assignments are brutally difficult and necessitates the use of an outside programming software that students have no experience in due to this class being a prerequisite to taking an actual programming class

I'm not going to lie, this professor is a joke. Probably the worst professor I have ever had to work with in my entire life. I am a sophomore advancing into my upper division classes but had to retake this class elsewhere since she is so terrible at teaching, an absolute joke. Complicated lectures, lame picky grading even tho she grades w/scale:1-4

Every week, we are tested on topics. Everyone in my discussion would go in very confident and then leave stressed knowing they failed that assessment. Final has so many diff topics, hard to pass. Prof is too wordy and overcomplicates lecture. got so bad, teacher hid the "see average test score". this is for math 022, RMP doesn't have it listed tho.

I had her for math022. The textbook she gave us was online; however, it only gave us the answers to the questions and not the steps, so if you need steps to fully understand a certain topic, then good luck. You don't turn in any homework, meaning that the only things that are graded are your tests/exams. She also doesn't fully explain.

Test heavy class considering the ungraded homework. Quizzes are also given every lecture, but practice truly gets you through the class. You will be fine if you do the homework and attend the lectures. The professor was kind and mostly available if you needed help.

Overall, she isn't an easy teacher, but she is very open to explaining concepts if you ask. She makes note-taking templates so prepare online notes/physical notes with those sections. It's test heavy, no homework, but you can grasp most of the concepts during lecture if you have a good Calc 1 foundation. Do the homework to fully grasp the concepts
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She was very passive-aggressive toward students who would ask questions. Don't miss class, because there will always be a lecture quiz. Very disorganized. She made the two midterms a month from each other due to a "trip" she was taking. The 2nd midterm was a week from the final. Uses Gradescope so you don't know your grade until the end.
The absolute worst professor I have ever had! Most of the grade was exams and q
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: She's cool and friendly, but I wouldn't retake her class. She was a bit disorganized, especially at the start. First midterm wasn't great, too long for a 50-min class. To her credit, she fixed the midterm lengths after that. What stands out is how she'd stop mid-lecture, admitting she didn't know how she did a  problem redo almost the whole thing
lowkey passive aggressive tbh

Your grade is based on 35% final, 40% for 2 midterms, 10% for lecture quizzes, 10% for discussion quizzes, and 5% for discussion attendance you can easily get a good grade in the class. Her midterms/exams aren't so bad, if you do the optional homework, and show up to class every day you will be fine. The final exam replaces your lowest exam. CURVE!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: The worst experience in a math course at UC merced. The content is fun and useful but the professor made learning miserable. Everybody dreaded this course. She is not rude but get ready to speedrun notes and do insane problem sets and exams with unclear grading criteria. Get ready because she moves exams, office hours and hw deadlines all the time.

Labs are all useless things that no one will ever use. People started doing the labs beforehand so we can just demo and leave, so he stopped posting the labs so we can waste even more time having to find out what to do during lab. Even the TA's don't want to be there. Just wasting everyone's time over his huge ego

The class is ok, the lectures aren't that interesting but he posts powerpoints so you don't technically have to go. No one who took the class with me got an A, the average for the final was 56%, the highest score was a 80%, and he still didn't curve, so the highest grade given out was an A-. Also multiple people reported him being rude in emails

Yeah the professor curves by average but the class is easy to pass

If you wanna pass take this class. If you want an easy A+ don't take this class.

If you value your GPA, steer clear of this disaster. The grader is astonishingly subjective, causing widespread frustration as countless students watch their hard-earned GPAs plummet. A UX/UI class wreaking havoc on GPAs? It's beyond comprehension. The curve was only 1.5 points added to the final and only for selected students, pretty ridiculous.
overall a very subjective class with tough open-note exams. questions are often worded poorly and the slides are not detailed enough for full understanding of the content.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: While I think the class is fair and the assignments aren't to difficult, the exams take up to much of the grade. I got a 100% on every assignment and did pretty well on both exams, but my grade was still barely an A-
He's a chill guy. The class is pretty easy, tests are open-note, open-internet, all online, and class is curved so not stressful at all. Lab attendance is mandatory but are graded only on attendance.

grading seems to be dependent on the profs mood or perspective not even trying to see anything from a different view or perspective when the whole thing is grey in what they mean wish this wasnt required for my major
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Test questions are very subjective and does not reflect lectures much. if you take this class be ready to hate tests and assignments. You will explain something thinking you know what to put because it is in the slides then either get a low score or have difficulty replying to the question due to little or no context in the lectures only mentions

He does a nice job breaking down complex topics & legal jargon. Participation counts heavily toward the final grade. He expects you to answer questions about the material as he lectures. If you don't participate during lecture, you have to do 2 online discussion posts a week. Prepare for in-class participation by using Quimbee & doing case briefs.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Encourages debate but stays neutral. Will if needed disable the chat and does not tolerate poor language. I recommended that you read or at least skim the material but his lectures cover mostly what he expects you know for the exams. Exams are worded a little weird and questions are often from the text
participation is worth 20% and he gets to choose who participates so in the end he chooses who gets an A, even if you get an A on both midterms and dissenting opinion.

Professor Hansford is hands down my favorite professor at UCM. He has amazing lectures and encourages debate but stays neutral. I recommended that you read but his lectures cover everything he expects you know for the exams. Earning a B is easy if you apply yourself and if you try a little harder you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Hansford is by far my favorite professor at UCM! His teaching style is straight forward and his grading is fair. You will hear from a lot of students that he is one of the hardest Poli Sci professors at UCM BUT you get so much out of his class and honestly as long as you go to class, study, and participate you should get an A/B.
Professor Hansford's course material is clear and concise. As long as you attend class and do the required readings you will definitely receive a good grade.
As long as you show up and study there is no reason you should not get at least a B

Lectures are extremely helpful for learning material. You don't want to miss class. I learned more about the Constitution & how it was shaped by the Court than I ever thought possible. He has a great speaking style and personable manner.Grading is fair. You get what you study for...i.e. what you earn.

Attendance only necessary if you want an B or an A since his lectures explain PERFECTLY, the readings. A great mind for effect of political history. This class is very helpful to understand Supreme Court.

Personally, I'm not good at physics nor do I enjoy the class however if I had chose someone to teach me I am glad it was her. She was encouraging I bombed my first midterm and went to her office hours as well as her TA Patrick office hours and they both helped me turn my grade from an F - to an A. She really cares for her students. TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Going to office hours was easy for me and prof. Hirst was always helpful. She models problem solving well. Everyone knows those people who ask annoying questions, prof. Hirst knows how to shut them down. Its awesome. She even gave us cookies at the end of the semester. I feel like I learned a lot too.

By far harder than your normal Physics 8 class but I feel as if I really learned a lot in this class. Two midterms, 1 paper, and a final. She was clear in her explanations of things; however, if you did not get it you are going to need to go on your own to really understand everything.

Honors physics with professor Hirst was a hard class.  Linda was very helpful during office hours. Just make sure you attempt the hw problems first and THEN ask for help when absolutely stuck. She is a very accomplished, extremely intelligent professor who is passionate about physics. There is a research paper project. Attendance is a must.

Dr. Hirst is a very good professor, if she is available take her. She is very clear and knows her physics. She is friendly and grades fairly. She did assign a writing assignment but it wasn't anything difficult it was mostly to stimulate your mind.
Professor Hirst was awesome. Her accent is adorable, and she very clearly enjoys what she's teaching.

She is really nice and helpful with everyone and if you go to her office hours she will sit there and work the problems out with you. Her class is really long but very informative and I would definitely recommend her.

She is really into the class. Had fun in class demos. She was way more into it then we were. Fun to watch her too. Easy class. Fell asleep in every lecture, had it in the morning, still passed the class. Always half-assed the mastering physic.

She speaks with an accent. She is super nice. She is prompt with email questions on homework. Her exams were okay. She doesn't expect perfect grades. Her exam questions are nothing like the examples in class.

Pros: She knows the material, explains it well, is organized,  is funny; Assignments are time consuming and hard, but interesting! Cons: she can be arrogant, dish out too much personal info, be demeaning to students. Tip: take the class, do the readings, go to every class,  ask questions. The pros outweigh the cons... But you're warned!

Dr. G. demands that her students take a scholars approach to her class.  The book is just a reference, her lectures are filled with information.  It's not an easy A you get what you work for.  she is fair and knows her stuff.  you pay for your units go to class.  She answered all my questions but expects you to try to find the answers with research

Great teacher and helpful when you have questions, but can be impatient if you ask to many questions. The quizzes where alright and you dont have to go to lecture to get the material, but do go near the end for extra credit quizzes during lecture and also a suprise lecture that will help answer a good chunk of the final. Really good teacher though!
She is a great teacher and was always available to answer any questions I had. She is very accessible and knowledgeable, as well as an all around great person to know.
Godde is a great professor. Attendance is a must in order to pass her class because she doesn't go by the book at all. She clarifies very well and is easy to understand. Overall a good teacher

As a person I really like her...as a professor not so much. Her class is lecture and power point. Her assignments are very tedious and a lot of work. There is a lot to them and you must be very careful to follow instructions or you will get marked down. This class had a 15 min presentation at the end. Interesting topic!
She knows her stuff and will expect you to know everything she discusses in class. Follow her study guide! She doesn't go by the book so attending her classes are pretty necessary.

She isn't the most organized person in the world and can sometimes come off as a jerk (doesn't have clear power-points and doesn't follow the book). But follow her study guides and you will do well on her tests. She tends to go off topic at times. She simplifies things a lot.

Dr. Godde is awesome. She is really interesting and funny, and tries to make the class more interesting. She writes her notes on the board and occasionally has a powerpoint, so you need to go to lecture to get the material.

Easy class as long as you read the chapters she wants. There is no textbook except a short stories book that we read throughout the semester. She tries to make her class interesting. There are some group work projects. You do need to attend class because that's where you do most of your assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: AMAZING professor! Shes really sweet and cares about you as a writer. Attend classes. Theres only one major essay and the other main project is a really fun podcast assignment. You read one book and the quizzes/tests are open book. She gives clear feedback for your writing and really encourages you to do better.

Professor Liz is awesome! She really cares about the students and wants you to do well both in her class and in the real world. She gives the best feedback and is more than willing to read your paper during office hours before she officially grades it. As long as you put in the work, the class is a breeze.
Great professor.

Professor Liz was by far one of the most caring professors here at UC Merced. She is very clear when it comes to grading criteria and takes the time to look over your work. Her class is always very engaging, selecting readings based off of our current social/cultural climate. Such a well respected professor and very kind to all of her students.

I really liked this class. You have two longer essays, a presentation with a visual collage, and many group projects. In our class we also read All They Will Call You which is a pretty good book. All in all shes very approachable and makes class fun.

Professor Liz is awesome! I am not a fan of writing, but she does make the class and even writing more enjoyable. You do have to do a lot of group projects and presentations but its not that bad. We did 3 essays, a visual collage and the final portfolio. One of the essays was pretty short. Overall it was a great class!

Professor Liz was amazing! We did 2 essays, a presentation with a small essay, and a final portfolio. Very interactive class, don't plan to show up to class and not talk to anyone. Very welcoming environment. We read All They Will Call You by Tim Z. Hernandez, which is really the only required textbook for the class. Great book, very relevant.

Professor Scheid is awesome! The course readings were current and the conversations and group work in class were always interesting. There are 3 major essays and a final portfolio. Shes very understanding if you communicate with her. Great class!

This class makes me feel as if I am wasting my money attending this university. I have learned nothing and every class is full of guest speakers that have nothing to do with you. She assigns work that requires you to leave campus outside of class time. Huge waste of time she assigns only busy work. The big project is a pointless skit from pre k.

She is very passive aggressive and loves to waste your time with mandatory attendance. Class time is wasted with guest speakers that have nothing to do with the class. She assigns way too much busy work. I would advise anyone who loves to waste their time to take her class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Requires a book that she provides for FREE, she takes a while to grade some assignments, but she is not a tough grader, if you show up on time, participate during lectures, and submit assignments on time you will get an A. She's an amazing professor and always trying her best to help other students, sometimes too flexible, and gives extensions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She assigns a lot of homework, but her grading is simple and isn't harsh with grading. We were given a lot of annotation assignments but as long as you write one word per page then you're fine. We analyze a lot of different films and readings.She doesn't care too much about writing academically and has guest speakers throughout the year.

She is an amazing professor. Definetely the best professor I have had in my time at UC Merced. She is passionate about teaching and makes it easy to want to learn. I strongly recommend taking her classes.

A great professor, who genuinely cares about her students: she gives a heavy workload, but if you talk to her about your circumstances and why you can't complete them she will always work with you. I had a lot of trouble with the workload with other classes and I talked to her about it constantly and she was willing to work with me every time.
Professor Bristin was very nice and her course is very fun and educational. But, she assigns tons of homework and reading. Too much. Not very conscious of other classes students are taking.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Such an amazing and caring professor. She loves what she does and cares about her students. The class was a lot of reading, but after she got some feedback on the heavy reading, she toned down the reading assignments. Definitely listens to her students and considers each and every one of them.

She is the best teacher in the Spanish department. The textbook is mandatory, but she makes it very affordable for everyone. Her class consists of a lot of group discussions which helps a lot. The best part of her class though is that during class she discusses every single little detail so that you could gather all the required information.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Class was based on one paper, one final project, and twelve quizzes and labs. Labs are super simple, and Professor Dale basically gives you the answers, and the quizzes are open book, note, and lecture slides. The final project is simply one that you make yourself, so a ton of freedom is given.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Dale was awesome in Cogs 1!! He only had 3 tests that made up your grade, along with participation in discussion. Definitely glad I had him!
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Go to office hrs the professor really likes when students show up to office hours.

I'm glad I was able to take the introduction to cognitive science class with Rick. He is  an extremely approachable professor who truly cares for his students. The class wasn't completely easy for me, but as long as you study and attend lectures and discussions you will be fine. My TA Matthew Turner was great as well!

Rick is amazing! He truly cares about each one of his students. I appreciated how he took the time to get to know every single one of his students name in his class. For our activities, he gave great feedback. Overall, this great provided excellent experience for Cognitive Science majors. Would take any class with him if I had the chance.
Go to class or you wont know when they're be online quizzes, if you dont take them expect to get a low grade.

He is really excited to share about the material he teaches. He loves interacting with his students and encourages them to go to office hours. He's very humorous and tries to make lectures interesting and entertaining as possible. He sometimes bumbles along with what he says but it's excusable because one learns to appreciate his excitement.

Great class, learned a lot. It is cognitive science but not the usual type of class; more geared towards technology, super easy coding, an over all introduction to another side of cognitive sciences. He also keeps us with questions that one might and is always willing to helpclarify.

Rick is super down-to-earth and very knowledgeable in his field. He takes a genuine interest in his students' success, and his class was pretty laid back and interesting. No textbook was required, he just assigned articles relevant to whatever topic we were covering at the time.

Bit of a language barrier, and she also speaks quite quietly, so make sure not to sit in the back if you want to actually hear during lectures. Do the extra credit project. Tests were full internet access, open note, and were still incredibly hard. Be careful with your algebra so you don't waste time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Huifang was my TA for MATH011. She is not the best TA in the world and if you did not understand a topic that was too bad, since she did not have the ability to reword a single topic students struggled with. She also has one of the thickest accents I have ever heard in my life. Kind of generous at grading though I would say, but not great.

Huifang was my TA for MATH011. She is very hard to understand most of the time. It was hard to understand anything she would teach and say. I would ask her a question for clarification and she would just stare at me with a smile on her face as if I asked a stupid question. Attendance is mandatory and she will question why you leave early.

Great professor when it comes to responding to emails and feedback in office hours. Class has pop quizzes and can be difficult, but being open notes helps level the playing field. Overall, very intense class but very manageable.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The midterm and final exam made up 55% of the grade. She said all semester she wasn't gonna curve, until the grades for the final came in, then she gave a very generous curve. One guy's grade went up 10%. She also has an extra credit project that can boost you 10 points. Pop quizzes are there, so make sure you attend class. Not the worst teacher.

Huifang's accent makes it impossible to understand class lectures. I can barely recognize my own name when she calls it out to return tests. Furthermore, Huifang strongly believes in the "bootstraps" theory: If you're failing, you must not be trying hard enough. Huifang makes me regret my choice of major, classes, university and professor daily.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Probably the best thing was that the exams were easier than the homework. Very lecture oriented and practically just reads off the slides. Horrible communication and can barely handle any criticism. Responds to emails very late if even at all. Grading on exams or homework varies heavily depending on who graded it. Knowledgeable but cant teach well.
She doesn't care for students, she just says the material is easy but half the class was failing.

Decent lecturer at best partly because English is not her first language. You can tell she cares but also beware she doesn't speak very loud. The quizzes/exams are much easier than the hw so if you pay attention and do the assignments, you'll be golden. Sina is a great TA who's great at explaining things

This professor has such a strong accent you can barley understand sometimes. Also she does not want to help much outside of lecture. Moves very fast and leaves a lot of people behind. The practice midterm was almost nothing like the exams and they were VERY difficult.
Alright lecturer. Posts slides but going to lecture can help sometimes. She is happy to answer questions but the heavy accent can make it hard to understand, Overall good professor, but not great.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Rough class,lecture is boring and doesnt correlate to the exams. Labs are useless, no one ever went. Exams are tough, never know what to expect and the lectures do not prepare you for them. Hws and quizzes are way easier than the exams. Need to turn in an essay at the end but its a nice grade boost as long as you follow the rubric.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Midterm and final averages are generally very low, she does little to prepare you for them. Many labs and homework assignments are on topics not yet covered in lecture. Labs consist mostly of worksheets. Many students who did well in the class said they barely ever went to lecture and learned everything on their own.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Class was based on hw, labs, tests, and a paper. She curved ~3% which was helpful but the class is so content heavy that it's hard to do really well b/c there's just way too much info to know/remember. Not really a hard class to pass though. Paper saves your grade, it's an easy 100. Prof was relatively nice, didn't really interact with her much.

One of the harder professors on campus, but nice. Does not curve with midterms averaging less than 30%. The final review had nothing to do with the final exam basically bamboozled you when taking the final. If you are not in the major, DONT TAKE. Exams are HARD, she DOES NOT CURVE, and labs are pretty useful for information but not for the class.

She provides unfinished lecture notes that you have to complete by attending lecture (sometimes pages out of order or missing). Tests are similar to practice tests, which are based on the main homework problems + concepts. A 1500-word minimum final essay due at the end of the course. Final was much tougher than midterms and she does not curve much.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Overall a nice person. She will reply to emails. She has a very strong accent. The most dislikable thing about her class is the word limit for assignments. Discussion board replies had to be a minimum of 50 words? Discussion board had to be a miniumum of 150 words? Essay had to be 1500 words (no quotes)? So many word limits.

I've had her for engineering 45,151, and 155. All around good professor. Some people complain about her accent but it's whatever tbh. Just go to class and listen and you'll do well. She's not trying to trick anyone and she's actually funny. Wish I made this review sooner lol.

She made a mistake at the end of the semester with everyone's grades. The night before the exam she gave everyone a raise of about ~5% which people thought was a curve, she knew about this before we started the final exam and did not say it was a mistake until a few people had already finished bringing everyone's grades 5% down. Hard grader, avoid.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Professor gets mad when you use examples from the slides she provides. She has an indecent attitude, and is constantly trying to put her students down.

Super enthusiastic during lectures.  A lot of homework and lecture activities, which weren't too hard, but were a good chunk of the grade.  Midterms weren't too difficult because she lets everyone have one sheet of paper for notes to use.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Not sure why she has so many bad reviews. If you have a problem putting effort into a class, then maybe that's why you're complaining.Dr. Stark answered all of my questions and even took time after class to help me understand concepts. She is super sweet and friendly. Her quizzes and midterms are straightforward. I highly recommend her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Stark tries to be fair to students, and makes her percentages of assignments, tests, quizzes, etc. an almost even distribution. Lecture is heavy and you need to pay attention to do well on the weekly (or twice a week) quizzes. She also gives you a study guide for the midterm which is pretty helpful. Overall, do your work and you should be fine

This professor reads off the slides the whole lecture. She is not a tough grader and gives mostly full credit as long as you do it. We have quizzes every week sometimes twice a week and they could make or break your grade, since the midterms don't really affect your grade. Luckily the final is only 10% of your grade.

Very descriptive in what she is covering at the moment, this does however mean that lecture slides will be packed with information most of the time. She does post slides on canvas, so you can get any missed information back. Tends to be fast paced during lectures, but most should be able to keep up. Homework is very easy. Tests are multiple choice.
She is not pleasing to the ears.
Notes, Notes, Notes, do not take if you do not want to take notes every second of the lecture and have a quiz every time as well.

Tessa truly cares for her students and gives amazing feedback to strengthen papers. You are required to access a textbook and in pairs are asked to present on one of the chapters but it is super easy. She only assigns 3 major essays but other than that, it is an easy class to pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Would take again she was great
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Tessa is GREAT, one of the best professors I've had at UCM. If you have the opportunity to take any of her classes definitely go for it because she is genuinely cares for her students.

Professor McIntire is very down to Earth. However, she really talks a lot throughout the whole entire class time. Mainly her class consists of workshop time, and as long as you know what you're writing for the assignment, you will be fine. She grades really easily and is accessible outside of class time.

It was her first time teaching writing 116 and she was kind of all over the place and didnt give us enough time for feedback and to rewrite. But I feel like if she was more prepared for the class wed all do better but she is an amazing person and really cares for every student and their background with writing.
She is an awesome instructor. I love tessa.
Great instructor and is always just an email away.
Really nice teacher! Also very helpful and super chill! GET HER IF YOU CAN! :D
Pretty helpful and always makes sure we understand the prompt. The way she taught our Core section was through student presenting to students so that was fun.

professor briseno was amazing! yes, her class is challenging, but 100% worth it! it's taught me so much and has made me open up my eyes and honestly I wish I could have her for more of my classes! go to office hours, class, and participate and I guarantee you'll enjoy her class!!!!!

First, Dr. Brisenno is a great teacher. She's actually teaches. But you can;t slack off. Keep up with the readings and go to her office and you'll be ok. Also, she doesn't complain like the last person said; she uses what's going on in the world to discuss that day's lesson (she does identity and pop culture). Plus she's cute, too.
If you want a teacher who is not easy go ahead and take her. She will be worth your wild! She constantly seems to complain about a lot of things that bug her, but she doesn't try to drag you in.

Professor Briseno is a very serious teacher. She does grade hard but she expects the best from you. My advise is to attend class everyday and go to her office hours whenever possible. She did not stick to her syllabus and is a little unorganized. If you want to learn new things and want help in writing she is the one.

She is awesome! I know that is a lot of work for her class, but trust me is all worth it. She is super helpful and she is always willing to help you if you reach her. She is really understanding and her lectures are extremely interesting!

Professor Briseno is very liberal. She opens the eyes of her students, has very good teaching style. Ideas involve Chicana lit, feminism & challenging the status quo. Sometimes she can be unclear (when elaborating on a subject she is led to another, while never finishing explaining the first) & unorganized, as well as late in passing things back.

Rosemary is totally cool. She is extremely accepting of everyone and she helps anyone who needs it. But she doesn't give you any chances if you forget homework, forget to read or bring handouts to class. I like the readings and class discussions are interesting.Just come to class and keep up with the readings because  she gives alot of quizzes.

Rosemary has good intentions for teaching her class but her methods are very poor. She is generally very vague when assigning essays, and will only give good grades to writing styles that appeal to her intrest. For the record, she almost failed me because of my absences in the lecture.
She is a hard teacher, and I didn't like that we didn't have use of grammar book, but the reading assignments are good. She is also clear, her directions and expectations of us are written out.

Professor Bhat is one of those professors on campus that does not like admitting he can make mistakes and expects students to never make mistakes. The class is based on a one try system on homework ,labs, and obviously tests. We get no real feedback from the professor on course work and have no idea on how to improve. Teach yourself to pass!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I was in the same course as the two reviews below, and while the scope of this class was incredibly broad, I feel like I learned a ton from Prof. Bhat.  The exams were difficult not from a conceptual level, but a time management one.  Bhat is an incredibly bright individual, very engaging in lecture and passionate.  Take him if you want a challenge

Gives multiple choice Math Tests full of trickery, even stated by some math major friends. Weighs  tests worth way more than time spent on course work! Acts like hes nice in person but is really plotting against undergraduates success over what should be an introductory course!

Professor was often off topic during lectures. He doesn't know how to engage students in lecture. Maybe it was the lecture size (200 students) but regardless,  he had a hard time keeping students awake throughout the whole semester. His new approach to incorporate R kind of sucked because lectures covered too many topics. It was hard to keep up.
extremely helpful during office hours, attending lectures is highly recommended. make sure you understand the material and all will be fine.

He was amazing. The course was  challenging but very rewarding. Lecture class is not mandatory but discussions are. You learn a lot in the course. He is very smart and very passionate about teaching, always available for his students. Don't take his class if you are lazy! It requires lots of work.

Attendance is not mandatory, but he did start giving pop quizzes since many people were skipping lecture. He explains very well and does have an offbeat sense of humor, but he can be plain mean sometimes. Otherwise he actually fully responds to questions via email and is there to help outside of class. Still, a very hard class overall.
Very kind and helpful, very knowledgeable about the subject.
He's a young but extremely knowledgeable professor.  Made himself available to answer any questions that a student had about course material both inside and outside of class.

Professor Leung is a great CSE professor who makes tough material understandable. His office hours are super helpful, and the participation and homework grades offer a good cushion. The projects are challenging, but manageable with effort. Lectures can be tough to follow alone, so attending is highly encouraged. you gyatt this!!!

Professor Leung is a great CSE professor who makes tough material understandable. His office hours are really helpful, and the participation and homework grades offer a good cushion. The projects are challenging, but manageable with effort. Lectures can be tough to follow alone, so attending is highly encouraged. u gyatt this!!!

The purpose of this class is to work on a project with a group. The great thing about Professor Daniel is that he is super approachable for questions. I wish that he would have a system in place to hold all group members accountable. It is too easy for a group member to not contribute.

Great CSE professor. This being one of the hardest class on campus, he does a really good job at getting the material across to the students. You have to dedicate time to this class and you will pass. The projects are really really hard. DO NOT copy someone elses code, he will run it though similarity software. Get help, hes helpful in office hour

The exams are super easy and the projects take less than 3 hours max to finish. Just by studying the practice exam, you can easily get a solid A in the class. The lecture slides are self-explanatory and are posted online so all you need to do is attend a lab session once every 2 weeks to demo your labs. 0/5 for difficulty.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: The most focal things are Labs and Projects but the Participation grade he gives for Reading Assignment is an easy 12% and Homework isn't too often so it's a nice grade cushion (10%). But go to his lectures because his lecture slides are hard to learn off of on your own-- they're just full of pictures and phrases, there isn't much explanation.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Senpai 4 lyfe

I did not know any programing before coming to his class. His lectures are okay. Can be a bit unclear sometimes, but explains things thoroughly in office hours. The labs are manageable, and as long as you read and go to class, you'll pass.
Wow. Such teach. Chi Yan Leung is the best. Take his class, have no regrets. 10/10 wish he could teach every class I take.
Great teacher......
Good and funny lecturer. I learned so much for being in his classes.

Nye, as a person, is a wonderful and passionate guy. I had his SPRK 001 class and... the lectures get very tiring after a month. You're in there for a long time and it is filled with either him talking about said topic, group discussions and activities, and topic analysis. The class was very group-discussion heavy. To be honest, I got bored of it.
Very caring guy. Helped a lot with my writing skills and cares a lot about your success.

Nye cares so much about his students and gives amazing feedback. He truly just wants his students to pass and although it is a heavy loaded reading class, the readings are interesting and he provides the reading as well. He is always available to his students. 3 essays due throughout the semester. Couple of quizzes but easy if you do the reading.

He is a caring and thoughtful professor, and passionate about the subject he teaches for SPRK. Class discussions are often silent though, with him not being able to spark discussion, and with the students not being able to give as much input as they might like normally. I think he needs a bit of guidance on how to teach, but is enjoyable.

Professor Nye taught a very fun class and made the topic of Creative Writing very fun. I enjoyed being in his class and I found he did a good job bringing the class together. The class is made up of a Fictional Piece, a Non Fictional Piece, a group of poems, and a portfolio of all three. The class was not too difficult and I felt he graded fairly.

The class moves pretty fast. Most of the assignments are just busywork. Multiple due dates throughout the week. Lectures are very interesting, even though the class is long. Nice guy, very invested in your success.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: I loved being in prof. Nyes class! He is a great professor and really shows he cares about his students. Make sure to do the readings or at least skim over them. If you keep up with the work and stay in communication with him you will succeed in his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Nye is understanding and kind. I recommend keeping up with the readings, especially the first few weeks as we discuss them in class. The workload can be heavy, there are three essays throughout the class. He provides great feedback for assignments and he is accessible as he emails back quickly. If you keep up with work you will pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Matthew Nye is a well rounded professor, he chooses invigorating subjects to address in class and fosters an environment of fruitful class dialogue. Dense content at times, so keeping up with readings is essential, he is open to explaining and going over material with anyone who has put in the effort to read it. Will be taking his classes again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Statistics is hella hard. I only signed up for this class because I need it for graduation and already failed once with another professor. Professor Mireles made this class really enjoyable and made me want to attend lectures. We'd be laughing in lectures and move around the class for activities. Best math professor I've ever had.

Second time taking courses with Professor Mireles and can't say enough nice things about her, she's so helpful and understanding if you are having a hard time with the material, definitely attend her office hours, she and Jay (TA) will be more than happy to help! Lectures itself were relatively easy to manage, mainly reviewing readings.

Professor Mireles was amazing. She made statistics less intimidating and offered many opportunities to get extra practice through the lecture exit tickets she designed on catcourses. She is so passionate about teaching statistics and made me feel comfortable asking questions. I am looking forward to taking more classes with her before I graduate!

She really cares about her students and the subject she is teaching. There were many options for extra credit and the class was set up in a way that offered ways to earn points (there are individual quizzes and group quizzes). I was a bit bummed that this class was online but I liked the way she handled it.

Super super nice and understanding. Not only looked at us students but people as well. The material taught was ok but she set up the course in a way where we could understand and get good scores. There were collective quizzes and individual quizzes that were pretty easy if you paid attention in class.

I took this class for Spark, and it really stressed me out. Out of all the class options for the Spark Classes here at UC Merced, I thought this one would be really interesting, however, it wasn't. The class was easy in the beginning obviously, but the workload just became so heavy. Takes so much of your energy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Mireles is a very nice professor, however, her workload for her spark class was extremely heavy. It starts off light and seems easy to keep up with, but it increases by a lot at the end and is extremely stressful. Only take this class if you need the credit and the workload of your other classes is light. I regret taking this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Professor Mireles taught this class very well. Aside from the material she taught us, I loved the fact that she always took our well-being into consideration. She made several changes to assignments like extending deadlines & even removing some entirely. The class itself was easy & I recommend it to anyone!
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Mireles was very relatable and caring. She often granted extensions and made the class asynchronous so that all students would be able to attend. To make up for the lack of live lecture, she offered a "cafecito with the professor" where we'd have casual discussions. She was great and very understanding.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment:
He was very clear about what would be on the test, including regurgitating pseudocode. There were very few challenging questions requiring problem solving, and many questions very similar to example problems.
He is quite theoretically inclined, leading to quite mathematically rigorous lectures, which many people struggle with and don't appreciate.

The class was curved passing was 53%, fortunately. I am giving a low score because his explanations are very over-complicated and difficult to understand, especially with his accent and mask on. 24 hours before the final he sent an ultimatum to the class about plagiarism. not a great professor. you will need help and go the extra mile to PASS.

Pretty generous curves. Do the labs and you have a pretty good chance at passing. Exams are theory heavy, but he gives an accurate list of topics on the exams. Lectures aren't the easiest to understand. Mostly because of how dense the material is. I never went to lectures or discussions and just read the textbook. The textbook is a godsend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Im is unintelligible as a lecturer and his written commentary on his lecture slides is illegible. You will have to be self sufficient to take this class but even the most resourceful of students may fail this class since he actively strives to catch students "plagiarizing" which is very broad by his definition. Avoid him at all costs.

His lectures are not the best. While he may have a thick accent, his explanations are not clear enough, most of the times he goes to fast. The good news is that he has a very generous grading policy. His curves are not only generous, lab policy is as well. You need 1000 points on lab section(or get A+ on 10 labs) to get an A on that section.

Pros: Curves exams and grades Generous grading(10 labs need to add up to 1000 points to get an A in lab section) Cons: Goes too fast during lecture so you cannot really understand the concepts being taught. If you read the textbook and get As on the first ten labs you are set.
