Not really good at giving explanations. Sometimes he doesnt even know what are on his on presentations. Him wearing a mask didnt help either. My advice: Read the textbook and watch YouTube. You can also review the lecture slides as well. Youll be better of at trying to understand the material on your own

Warning, English is not his first language so understanding his lectures is a challenge. However he is very knowledgeable in the topic and knows what he is talking about. This is a very hard class that you can not pass by just going to lecture, you must also read the book. Reading the book and doing the worksheets is mandatory to get a good grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Explanations aren't clear, so lectures aren't that useful. Exams are long and difficult. Some labs feel impossible, most are doable. Discussions offer extra credit with participation.
I took this professor in first semester of freshman year and she is very chill and If you follow up with the assignments and complete its Alr and she also accepts late work!

attendance is mandatory. she is contract based grading so as long as you are in class on time and do the assignments you will get an automatic A. she is very understanding and as long as you talk to her she will accommodate for your success.

She is an amazing professor! Took her for writing in psych and she was so nice and helpful. The skills we learned in this class were so useful. the class was a bit fast paced but she's willing to accommodate you and your needs. Shes also always checking in on us and making sure we're getting our assignments done. overall 10/10 prof would take again

She was the best professor I've ever had. She is very sweet and she makes the assignments very clear to understand and follow. Her class was very engaging and enjoyable. I recommend this professor 100%
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: overall a good teacher. for a college writing class, this class was way too engaging for me. If you are someone like me who doesn't talk much, this class is mostly about that. Wri 001

Ms Bay is amazing she's super sweet and is always willing to help and give feedback. She very sweet and doesn't make you feel stupid for speaking your mind. She make sure the class has a healthy and welcoming class where everyone is respectful. Just don't be late !
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Baylynne is a really good professor. You can tell she really cares about her students. Her lectures are okay, she covers a lot of material in depth during instruction, so it's important to attend class. Although, if you ever have a question about something she's always willing to meet & discuss. She also makes sure to get back via email asap.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Get a B or higher by:  1.) Going to all class discussions. 2.) Knowing what's the gist of each assigned reading. 3.) Participating at least once every 2 discussions 4.) Writing essays on topics you personally know you are most passionate about or know you can write a good essay about.

Baylynne is not a bad instructor for Core. She has a set of high standards that she follows when grading. To get a high grade in this class you need to 1.) Go to office hours to find out what she wants to see on written assignments and 2.) Participate.

Bay was unfortunately one of my least favorite teachers. She picks on students and definitely played favorites which hurt my grade. When I would notice she didn't like me in class that day I would then see my next essays quizzes etc. effected by that and other classmates with the same mistakes not losing points. Shes terribly boring and also rude.

Fancies himself a great teacher and uses 'alternative' techniques that are just dumb. Like going over a quiz by making someone who didn't get the answer right come up to the board and do the problem in front of everyone with no help.   Also not willing to accept, talk or think about more than his one approach to a problem.

He described the concept of a professor being available at a given time and location for students to ask him questions as "idiot college." Also: Make sure to sit in the front. He writes small and speaks softly. Also: Don't take his course as a Bachelor's student. He does not like them. Also: hates quiet students, but won't respond to questions.

Super smart, if you wanted you could learn a lot but most people just take his class for the easy grading... People all over the wold know him so we should all take what he has to say as something that is very important... he did in all create a new field in physics.
Very hard to hear and when you hear what he does say, it isn't very much at all. All that is tested is stuff taught by his T.A's during lab time as opposed to learning it during the lecture.
He's too good for underclassmen, plus he needs a serious boost to the old voice volume
He is very hard to hear. He is a genius but he needs to talk louder and clearer
No Comments
He's pretty easy.

He's a pretty good professor.  Sometimes he'll tease you, and wants everyone to participate, but it's only because he wants you to learn.  His tests are somewhat tough, but if you do your hwks and if you go to some office hours, he'll give you a fair grade.  He's pretty reasonable.

If you'll be taking calculus 1 in UCM, I recommend Prof. Sprague. He makes time for you when you needed and he's the BEST math professor besides Prof. Kim. Tests are STRAIGHT out (well except the numbers) from the homework so you better do them and ask if you don't understand them. He's funny and entertaining old man, you'll definitely have fun.

He can be kind of a jerk at times. The reason is because he wants people to succeed but he gets frustrated if the class is doing bad. Exams aren't too bad just study a lot for them. At the very least he knows exactly what hes talking about and is very good at explaining but always runs out of time. The discussion class was very boring a pointless.

His tests are impossible. His lectures can make sense usually, be sure to ask questions if you don't get it, or you'll just fall farther behind. Keep your book handy, you Will be using it. He's a good prof, but the subject matter is a bit difficult... Good luck.

Great teacher, Unflexable as far as schedules go though... Thats about all I can say, very laidback and detailed in lecture, provides great examples for the material. Exams are not as bad as they first appeared,

I hated math before Calc1 @ UCM, but Prof sprague almost convinced me to roll math major.  His lectures varied very little; for the most part they were interesting and easy to understand.  My only advice for this class is to do the homework, beleive it or not homework can make or break you in the end.
he helps the needy who want to excel in math

Makes class interesting.  I hate math, but he is the best math teacher I have ever had.  He does all he can to help you learn the material, so you deserve whatever grade you get.  His class is very hard.
Fake emotion. Although I pass, I don't like the way to talk. If she wants somebody to fail, please just say it straightly; do not say some unclear words like "I don't really want/like you to pass."
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Assigns a lot of assignments and grades you on a few things. Unclear on a lot of assignments and harshly grades. However, it is clear that she puts a lot of effort into the class and really cares about her students. Mediocre at best.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: If you really want to do well, just meet up during office hours to get good feedback for essays before turning them, put in effort to get good grades. also too much small assignments crammed together during the first half of the quarter when reading the books. got annoying and waste of time
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She gives a lot of little assignments and at first they don't seem like that much but it adds up really fast. She also runs out of time a lot in class. I think one annoying thing about her is that while you're talking she will make a really loud "mmmm" of agreement with you. Last essay for my class is a speech. She's pretty tough on grading essays.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is a very nice and friendly professor here in UCSC. Workload is definitely overwhelming due to the MANY small assignments and their extremely tight due dates, especially when there's also other classes you have. She is also a tough grader on essays, so make sure you're really perfecting your writing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Beth is so sweet ad she's very approachable, but I will say that there are lots of assignments for this class that at times can seem overwhelming when you're also dealing with other classes. Her analyzation of books is also fantastic.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is a great teacher. This class is once a week, so you cannot miss it. At the end of every class she approaches students if they need help on an assignment. Participation in her class is crucial, because she has a lot of class discussions. As long as you keep with with due dates you will pass.

Extremely Boring, and she is a tough grader. This is the first time she has taught 101 in the regular school year and she is doing horrible. She always seems to be tired every class session. Would not recommend.

Super passionate about Sociology.  Lectures were really informative and interactive.  If you're going to miss a lecture, I'd suggest you ask someone to take notes as she doesn't upload the slides onto Canvas.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Honestly, she's very nice and cares about her students. Lectures are very interesting and engaging. The material of the class is really great. Idk there's something about the way she communicates to the class that's condescending. Like I don't feel comfortable in her class.

Prof. Canizales is an amazing professor. Her assignments and instructions were always easy and clear to read. going through this class was a breeze and an easy grade. Not to mention the lectures were also very interesting. I would take one of her classes again if given the chance!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Amazing professor, she does a great job at explaining things and is always available for office hours. Weekly assignments but very simple and easy to do. Readings are interesting and up to date. By far has to be my favorite professor on campus.

The BEST professor I have EVER had!! She truly has the students' hearts and minds in her thoughts and pushes for their excellence. She cares about what her students take away and their health, rather than throwing a whole bunch of work at them. Definitely recommend taking her class, you will LOVE it!
She is such a great professor and the best! Very easy A, just get your work done and make the effort on your end.

I took her for SOC 001 and omg she is the most AMAZING professor! You can tell she just cares about her students so much. Shes so sweet that her quizzes arent like your average study hard and you might pass, you just need to read what she gives you and you will definitely pass. Im not a soc major but I STRONGLY recommend taking her classes!

Dr. Canizales is seriously amazing! She is extremely passionate about Latinx Sociology and her excitement for the topic allowed us to engage in very interesting convos. She is not the type of professor that requires exams but actually cares that her students take away something from her class. Hands down best professor ever 10/10 do recommend <3

Nice professor, but horrible communicator. Does not reply to emails or teams messages. Homework assignments are hard. Has not graded a single assignment since the beginning of sem.
No exams except for a take home final.
This class was straightforward and easy little assignments. I would definitely recommend taking his course.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: By far the easiest class, but also frustrating. He is a busy man. Office hours are great, one on one helped me understand the content. It is hard to fail

Loved this professor. He introduced the topics well and was always available when you needed him. Tests were easy as long as you read the book and went to class. Often stumbled in lectures but if you read before hand, you would understand what he is conveying. Attendance not mandatory but helpful. Easy A if you do all the required work
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: As long as you pay attention in class, read the textbook when you don't understand the topic, and do all assignments you will pass the class. The material is not that hard to understand.

While the class itself has interesting subjects, he is very dull. Sit in the front, he doesn't speak loudly and doesn't use a microphone. His midterm was only 10 short answer questions, but each question had multiple parts to it. He curved it since only 2 people passed. Expect a combination of math & writing type of questions. Would not recommend.
He does not do a good job of going into detail and also speaks very low so sit in the front if you take one of his classes.

Does not like the use of technology in class and will kick you out if on your phone. Class is really hard. You will need to read the textbook before class and pay attention in class at all times. He tends to talk very low, so sit as close to the front as possible. Go to office hours they might not help , but it will atleast look like your trying.

ESS002 was mostly things you learn in grade school science classes. Lectures were straightforward and all slides were posted. The final assignment was talked-up but ultimately very casual. Midterm and final draw heavily from slides. Book for class was easily found as a free .pdf and rarely used anyway.

Great professor. Clearly passionate about her research and knows a lot about the field. Great classroom environment and classes are always full of discussion. Hard to get into office hours because so many people sign up. Class feels "easy" because she is very clear and provides relevant work - but you leave learning a lot from her.
She wants you to memorize 114 terms for a midterm and out of those 114 she's only going to pick 10. She extra.

She is awesome, very inspirational and caring. She does assign a lot of reading and class participation matters, make sure you read and you will be fine. I found her class so interesting she made me appreciate Anthropology, she is passionate and knows her stuff. I Highly recommend her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: all you have to do is show up to lectures/discussions, study and read, but then there are finals and projects that are worth like 70% of your grade so its easier said than done. some of my friends had her as an advisor for their MA and they didn't like her.

Nice lady.Her class consisted of power points, lectures about said power points, a huge project that most of your grade was based on and a final at the end. This project was tedious at best and unorganized. She was availible for office hours some of which were mandatory and returned emails quickly. TA lost papers  and assignments.

Great professor! Knows her material. Her lectures aren't the most interesting because she reads off the slides but if she goes off the slides then it can get pretty interesting. I recommend taking her Socio Culture class. Tests are easy if you study (duh).

lectures are quite boring since she reads her slides to you as it is projected on the over head. she does random sign ins for attendance. required to go to an office hour meeting which is ridiculous! she goes off topic a LOT! but her tests are easy. just memorize the vocab from lectures.
Overall the lectures were basically useless because she just put the power points up online.  The discussions are where the majority of learning to analyze different cultures happens.
Jason Hein is a great professor! He is approachable, helpful, and incredibly patient! He's always in his office and he replies to emails quickly, so contacting him for help is never an issue!
Jason Hein  Awesome professor! What else is there to say? (^_^)

BEST OCHEM PROF!  I hated inorganic chemistry 2 (CHEM 10), but I loved organic chemistry.  Take Chem 008 with Hein, he is very clear and concise with his explanations.  He's Canadian, so of course he is a super awesome dude.  Tips for success: 1) ATTEND EVERY LECTURE. 2) ATTEND LAB LECTURE (right after lecture) 3) STUDY LECTURE SLIDES AFTER LECTURE
He's a teacher that can explain OChem in a really precise and clear way. He's not boring and is enthusiastic about what he teaches. He's also canadian.
Very friendly and nice, very knowledgeable, his tests are hard but he is very helpful and fair. He s the best chem teacher in school.

Attending his lectures made doing the practice homework a lot easier. His clicker questions were based on the practice hw questions. He is super helpful during office hours. His obvious passion for organic chemistry made lectures more interesting. Best chem prof.
Best chemistry prof, his lectures taught me a lot but I learned most when doing the practice problems and during his office hours. Friendly, not scary to ask questions.

Jason is the best chem teacher on campus. If you have to take a chem class and he's teaching it, take it! He explains everything very well and doesn't just rush thru material like some profs. His test are difficult, but it is chem 08. He is very helpful and tries to help you the best he can. By far the best chem prof I've had at UCM.
Great Teacher

Often times makes himself unavailable for office hours. Doesn't pay much attention to what he assigns for homework. Makes you buy a faulty textbook and bases lectures off another book. Doesn't many resources for practice. Lets you have a note sheet for exam but they end up not being very useful. Doesn't explain anything very well. Goes off topic.
Great professor!

Very boring class and not the best at teaching. Thick accent and sloppy writing make it difficult to learn. Test are not related to lectures or book. The book helps but only so much. Solution-Based class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is not clear with the group projects, does not give feedback on work, doesnt know how to work Catcourses, you have one midterm and final (open book/notes & no laptops anymore), the class is very long, & you have hw every week and ch test after every chapter.  Hw isnt too bad. He skims over many things since you will learn them in future classes.

He is there when you need help and will attempt to help you. He has a thick German accent and is not loud. What he teaches is the exact same info from the book and power point; class attendance is not required.  His exams are open book, unlimited cheat sheets, basically you can bring and use anything you want. I did his exams with a laptop.
Has a tough german accent, but overall a very funny guy. I'd like to stress that attendance is a MUST. Chill professor overall
No Comments

I took Professor Ye for CHEM-155 (Instrumental Analysis Lab) and he was understanding when I ran into life problems that prevented me from submitting lab reports on time. It's a senior level course and he does expect that you should be able to handle the difficulty of the material, but he does care. Just make sure you write according to the rubric.

Hes a good professor in terms of knowing the material but he doesn't know how to relay information in terms of combining concepts to problems. I'm a fan of the class but not of how it was taught, that definitely needs to change and it is definitely NOT a 3 unit class.

He is a really good professor. He definitely know what he says and can explain it for more comprehension if you are willing to ask him. The midterms are a bit hard but they really test if you have a clear understanding of the topic. You may notice an accent in the first week or so but after that its quite clear and doesnt interfere with the lecture
worst prof ever. doesn't speak english, and don't know the answer to his own questions. hardest tests ever and have nothing to do with the review.
terrible teacher.  All he ever says is umn and never knows the answers to his own problems.

i can honestly say he was the worst teacher i have ever had. i think more than 50% of his class failed last semester. the midterms are hard and the practice tests dont help at all. he seems to be talking to himself more than the students.i didnt meet one person in our class that liked him. the point is... he sucked!
No Comments

Prof. Ye is a good teacher, but very tough. His exams are designed in a way to test your comprehensive ability...They make you think outside the box and put several pieces together to come to an answer. Quizzes are extra credit and TA's grade labs easy. Just don't screw up on your exams and you'll get an A.

Honestly, the best professor I've ever had. She honestly cares about our success so much. She'll even sometimes bring us treats! She's usually running a little late but it's not a big deal tbh. I could not recommend her classes enough! She teaches Indigenous Sociology and Urban Inequality which are both amazing and highly interesting classes!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: I LOVE THIS PROFESSOR. SHE IS SO GOOD AND REALLY WANTS EVERYONE TO SUCCEED. I'm a first year taking her class and her class is so easy to pass. She is really helpful and understanding and you can tell she has a passion for what she teaches.

Shes an amazing professor! she even brought us cumbl cookie once! she really cares about her students and wants all of us to succeed. She would love it if you participated too! the class is engaging so it's easy to participate and bring in your own experiences. She's so smart I love hearing her speak. Highly recommend her class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Very nice one of the best professors Ive has! Very caring and very understanding. her classes are intersting weekly easy quizes & some essasy & weekly reading

Professor is amazing. She actually cares about what she teaches us. Her classes are writing classes so be ready for that. Personally, her extra credit saved me. Shes so funny and real, the realest professor ive ever had. She went to Dartmouth and Harvard so shes incredibly smart. 10/10 she was amazing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Blythe was amazing, this was such an interesting course although the material was sometimes tough to get through, they were always super interesting. Professor Blythe is hilarious, helpful, laid back and in general such a lovely person 100% recommend this course!

This class is amazing! I am learning so much about Native and Indigenous people from Dr. George. Every student should be required to take this class because it gives you a solid understanding of the world view from a Native and Indigenous perspective. Dr. George is a very fair instructor and is genuinely concerned about her students' success.

Took Indigenous SOC 185 with professor George! Loved having them as a professor!  We were her first class and the content itself is engaging so longer readings weren't too bad! She was excellent with feedback and super understanding. The only part that sucked was the TA we had wasn't that great.

Marcus clearly cares for his students and teaches in such an understandable way as well as waits for everyone to understand before continuing. He doesn't asked questions on exams that are overly hard and the questions are quite easy and only ask for the fundamental understanding. He was the best professor I've had so far.

Professor Lee always tries his best to help students. He often takes students' feedback to improve his teaching and exam structure. There are also a bunch of easy-to-earn extra credits. I am so happy to have him as one of my first professors at UC Merced. Although attendance is not mandantory, there is no reason to not attend lectures of THE GOAT!!

Marcus was the best professor I've had at Merced. Clear and concise lecturing, you can tell this guy is really intelligent when he knows how break down hard subjects into digestible chunks. We were told exactly what we needed to know for exams, no surprises, "pop quizzes" were warned ahead of time. He cares a lot for your success as an engineer.

Overall awful professor. His homework assignments are very long and difficult. His midterms and finals are also difficult with not enough time given to finish all problems. On top of that the discussion worksheets had far too many questions on them so most of the time we wouldn't even finish completing them in class.  Also a very boring lecturer.

This professor is the best and I've taken them all! He taught my class as a brand new professor. He's attentive, clear and concise with his material. He annotates all of his lecture slides while also live recording for students who wanted to watch from home. He allows remakes on all exams. He answers emails promptly. Protect him at all costs!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Used to be amazing, now terrible. Too much work, deadlines coincide with other huge deadlines that he very well knows about. Project was not straightforward at all and was super difficult to finish. Still had a final exam too which was right after project deadline so didn't give us time to study. Lectures were too long and boring. Homework alright.

Great professor, very clearly articulates what he wants you to learn and why its important to your major. His course is only as hard as you make it. Just study his study guides, understand his work, and do his homework; I promise you you'll learn the material and do well. Overall great, and highly recommend him
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: One of the GOATS at UC Merced!!! He offers lots of extra credit and grades on technical communication in work. His teaching is inspiring and really cares about students. Provides valuable feedback and is very accessible outside of class. Demonstrates lot of passion in teaching and engineering. Flexible with student's needs and lectures are useful!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Amongst the best professors in UCM! He cares for his students and has good lectures! Go to lectures and do the homework and I guarantee you you'll do well!

Hands down, the best professor at UC Merced. His lectures are very clear, and he ensures everyone understands the concepts. I felt the tests were straightforward. No discussion quizzes; however, he does have occasional quizzes during lectures.
Nice Professor, easy to understand, and offered a lot of extra credit in midterms and finals.

I took this class in Fall 2022, and it was also Dr. Lee's first time teaching when I took this course. He was great especially for his first time as he explained concepts well and made sure we understood the concepts by doing examples and being accessible through office hours. The only drawback was the homework as it was all written and graded.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I enjoyed this professor's teaching style and would take another one of her classes again.

i took her eng 022 class, and i got to know that she's really kind, and i'd honestly recommend taking her class! this specific class is pretty attendance heavy with quizzes for credit based on the readings(mostly short stories) almost every lecture, and there are 3 essays in total. she's also an amazing person to talk to in and out of class :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: I took this class for ENG 022 and I really enjoyed it. She provides the readings and we are quizzed on each for attendance but they're easy if you do the reading. Also watched movies in class and gives extra credit if we stay to watch the whole thing. She's very passionate when she teaches and cares about her students. Really recommend taking her.

I took this class as an elective; I was not disappointed. This professor is not only super sincere, but super witty! If you want to succeed just put in the work. The class is super fun and easy if you allow yourself to follow her CLEAR instructions.

All I can say is that this class, without a doubt, was incredible. It was better than any past English class I've taken, mainly due to how it blended the workload that writing entails with meaningful discussion. It overcame the barrier where not many people seemed to talk, despite taking place in a time when nobody's physically next to each other.

The course was very interesting and I enjoyed it more than I thought I would a traditional English course. The instructor is great, sparks good discussion, and is usually excited about what we do in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Was extremely confusing with instructions, given this was her first semester teaching, there were no clear rubrics for the beginning of the semester AND miscommunication with the hired grader and the professor herself. Would not reccommend her class for online learning but would consider in-person instruction in the future
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I would not recommend taking Eng 067 with Professor Burney. She tends to confuse her students on what she wants on an assignment and she grades harshly. She also tends to get annoyed quickly if you dont understand her.

Whoever said this class was easy lied.She was hard to understand and class was so early in the morning.Hardly interacted with the class.TAs though were very helpful did the best they could and were understanding. Not enough hw and xtra credit to help boost our grades.Grade is entirely exam based. Even with cheatsheet half of lecture wasnt on exam.

She was super caring and gave extra credit opportunities. I was able to have a cheat sheet for all three exams. The lab/discussion was also not mandatory, but I do recommend going because it provides help for the homework assignments (which are very easy and straightforward). Lecture is also not mandatory and slides are provided.

Professor Liu was amazing! She was extremely caring and understanding. Gave many opportunities for extra credit through in class participation, attending discussions and lectures. The textbook was optional along with attending the lectures however, I 100% recommend attending them as they were helpful in interpreting the provided slides.

Lectures not mandatory. Recommend attending discussions because they explained the homework (which was assigned mostly once a week) and sometimes gave extra credit for attendance. Homework was easy, but the exams were quite heavy, with an average of 60% and worth about 60% of your grade. She allows one paper as a "cheat cheat". Will need scantrons!

She is an amazing professor. She is very kind and understanding about students needs. One thing tho, she does have an accent which can make somethings hard to understand. Her lectures tend to be based of slides posted beforehand, but I believe its still good to attend in class to set in stone the things.

She is my favorite professor!! The material and exams may not be easy. However, if you stay engaged and attend lecture, you will pass. Extra credit is offered as well. Going to her office hours is recommended. Take her class!!

Professor Liu is a caring instructor who wants everyone to succeed. This class is not easy, but it is possible to get an A as long as you study and review for the midterms. Be sure to participate because she gives out extra credit that will save you in the end. Overall she is an amazing professor who always makes time for students needing more help
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Liu has a very clear grading scale. The lectures are very easy to follow and there are plenty of opportunities to ask questions. Extra credit is offered for class participation every lecture. This class has a research proposal component, but there are assignments that slowly build to become the research proposal.

I passed this class with an A+ and didn't even attend lectures. After the first exam, it was clear everything was based on the slides. If u attend lectures memorizing is easier, but if not do what I did and write EVERY definition from the slides on your cheat-cheat for exams. It can take hours to write them all down, but worth it! 10/10 great class

Professor Liu is one of the best professors Ive encountered! Her lectures are very easy to understand and lots of examples are provided. Participation is encouraged since she offers extra credit points but not mandatory. There are 9 assignments total that are very easy to do and 3 exams. If you study her slides its very easy to pass without doubt.

She gave 9 assignments for the whole semester, but they arent worth much. The exams are worth almost 70% of your final grade, so you need to pass exams to pass class. Exams are heavy so you need to know most of the material, but she curves and is understanding is students needs.

Avoid taking Math 32 with this professor. You'll probably have to speedrun the R studio assignments because of lack of time. She also reads off the slides and is very monotone. Only good thing about this class was there was no exams, but she gave alot of difficult quizzes and homeworks to compensate for that.

She is extremely disrespectful & will target you in front of the class. Very passive aggressive and can be threatening. You are LIMITED to what questions you can ask; unable to ask for help about hw. Absolutely NO accommodations. Weekly assignments include: HW, Worksheet, Quiz, & 4-6 videos. NO clear explanations, VERY disorganized. EXTREMELY rude

Lihong doesn't accommodate with the student's needs and when brought up to her, she doesn't make any changes. When reached for help, at times she is unwilling to help and is very precise about her due dates. In lecture, she is very monotone, reads off her slides, and when asked to clarify a concept she reads off the slide again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: The minute I walked into this professors class I knew it was going to go downhill from there. She is not accomodating to any student needs and brushes them off. There is weekly worksheets which are due 10min after discussion, homework which is due at 6pm,and quizzess opened at 8am and due at 6pm the same day. When reached for help is very unhelpful

Lihong reads off her slides and doesn't justify her steps. Her grading is precise and her due dates don't accommodate the student's needs and schedules. Worksheets are extensive and are due within a 60-minute period. She assigns weekly quizzes, and only gives a 10-hour time frame to complete them. Lastly, she can be passive-aggressive at times.

This class is honestly the worst class I have ever taken at UCM. The professor lacks the skills to teach a UC class, the grading is unfair. I advise to stay away from this instructor as they assign very hard work that has to completed within short time. The R Studio work given is also absurd to complete for only 2 hours.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: this Professor just reads off her lecture notes, if you ask for help shell send you a link for YouTube videos, quizzes are based off YouTube videos and homework(whose answers are posted after the quiz.) basically if you dont do the homework correctly youll fail the quiz and wont know the answer till after youve taken the quiz. Very Horrible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Be Ready to Teach yourself and put in a lot of hours because this professor reads off her slides and gives no background information on the topics that she teaches. She gives a lot of assignments

Dr. Manilay is extremely kind and really honors your learning and questions. Content can be confusing so read beforehand and utilize office hours. Her lectures are interesting and really solidify the book. There is lots of reading but it's worth it! Use the homework to guide your reading in the class, it'll help loads.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: She cares about the students and often asks how she can help us better. The slides are helpful and guide the textbook reading. Her lectures are clear and concise, and the homework isn't too bad. If you really want to succeed in this class you definitely have to read the book though. Especially compared to Ardell, she was a guardian angel.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: makes lectures interesting!

Dr. Manilay shows that she genuinely cares about students' success and well-being, however, her lectures can be difficult to follow because of how much material is presented at once. The tests are all very difficult, be prepared to read a ton.

I really enjoyed taking her class. She's really clear and thorough in class and if you pay attention and take notes, it helps a lot for the tests. She does vocab questions on the midterm and she'll only have those slides in class, so attendance is recommended. I also recommend reading the book and going to office hours, it helps a lot.

She is a  great teacher!  She is most understanding and willing to answer ANY questions students might have about science. GO TO OFFICE HOURS; she is helpful there!! Goes steady with the book. When studying for a test, read the text, understand the pictures, and DO THE PRACTICE TEST! I love her! Work hard and you will too.

She is a great teacher both in class and in office hours.  She knows everything about Cell Bio and can and will answer any germane question, even if its outside the box. I have nothing but good things to say about her! Take her class whenever you get the chance. She also researches in the lab and undergrads can work there too. Just ask.
Nicest teacher in the world! I took Great Women in Science History and learned alot from such a small class. She makes it a pleasure to show up on Friday mornings.

I've had his for 3 courses and he changes his policies every time. No more attendance sheet, electronics now allowed. His notes are long tedious and not succinct so you better be damn interested in the class. Homework problems aren't so easy but the tests are the questions copy pasted. In a sense that makes it easier but it's easy to fall behind.

Several people seem to claim that he is a bad teacher because he is not timely on returning your homework or that he gets off subject. These two things are true, but it doesn't make him a bad professor. Thiem is the most passionate teacher about what he teaches that I have encountered. He is also always interested on improving his teaching.

Thiem is awesome, very energetic and passionate about what he teaches. Its just a shame that some of the students just don't give a damn about what he's saying. My suggestion is take a class you're interested in and make sure he's teaching it. You'll get the most out of your experience.

You people are all ridiculous, everyone whines about thiem. Grow up this is college he isnt going to hold your hand, who the hell complains when his tests are the exact questions and answers from your homework, he is handing you the A but you still **** about it!

Thiem has changed his policies since F08.You can now use electronics.But still a horrible professor.Never get the homeworks on time or reviews for midterms.Makes up every excuse as to why.Lectures are useless and don't help with homeworks.He likes to talk about when he was younger and his spiritual experiences. Awful awful man.Avoid at all cost

He's a really nice professor and will help with homework for other classes if you ask. He cares about his students but he feels that the students don't take his class seriously. I use my laptop all the time for class. I find it easier since he sometimes speeds through the slides. Attend office hours.

This guy is a terrible teacher. He is unclear, goes off on tangents unrelated to the material, and is a total jerk. He has you turn in homework on days when there is no class. You have to come in to school just to turn it in to his mailbox. Its totally ridiculous. He doesn't allow any electronic devices, including laptops for taking notes.
Great teacher, Great class. Do the work, you'll get the grade. Don't think you can slack and rely on the study guide, big mistake!
i hated history classes until brad. He is awesome and super chill
He's a really chill guy and a good teacher. Only thing I don't like about his class are that his test are take home essays. If that's your thing then this class is for you

Brad is a great teacher. He grades kindly, lectures intelligently, and has a good sense of humor. Only word of caution: he won't make fun of students who ask dumb questions, but show up for class 30  minutes late, or irritate him to much, and he will make you feel dumb. Either way he's usually super chill, and  he skateboards into class.
He made History fun
AWESOME!! Best teacher I've ever had in history, clear in work assignments, easy to talk to, makes boring history interesting!!

Good professor, definitely wants to connect with his students.  He makes things pretty interesting and his discussions can get really fun.  He encourages you to argue, debate and question your fellow students as well as him.  Speak up and you'll definitely be rewarded.

I think there is one word that can describe Brad, which is Chill. I had him both as a TA and a lecturer. He is an amazing person and knows how to teach U.S. history. Brad is very nice and is always willing to help. Definitely one of UCM's greatest.

Brad is the chillest professor ever! He skateboards into class and plays alternative music; lectures include a duel reenactment with Nerf guns, and special emphasis on mobs/rebellions.  Only tests are one midterm and final which consist of IDs and essay(s) that he outlines beforehand. Never required a single date memorized. Highly recommended!

This guy's class is pretty rigid, but he is brilliant. It is test heavy but just go to office hours and ask questions if you are concerned. Its all lecture based material and he posts the slides. I got a B+ in his class with out trying hard and then he helped me get more undergrad research experience!
Lecture heavy, but if you ask for help he's ready to do what he can! One of the best professors, would recommend taking any class with him.
Dr. Noelle is one of the best professors on campus. Do go to class or the material does not make much sense!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: I am a straight A student and I have a F in his class right now. Tried emailing him and he never responded. Everyone I know is failing too, this class is horrible.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. There is no textbook or other reading material for this course, it all supposedly comes from his lectures. Exams are very subjective and impossible to do well on. More than half of the class is failing right now, with only a few weeks and one test left. Average score was 65% on the first test. Beware.

Dr. Noel knows his practice well, however, his COGS 123/CSE 173 (Computational Cognitive Neuroscience) course is extremely difficult. The concepts are difficult to wrap your head around, and the homework assignments can be difficult to complete. Best of luck if you have to take this course with him.

CSE175 is one of the easier upper div CSE courses. There are some programming assignments, but they're pretty easy (not if all your programming experience is from CSE21 though). The class is centered more towards AI concepts and what he teaches us from the textbook. There's weekly quizzes in lieu of a midterm and a comprehensive final.
This class is challenging, but Dr. Noelle is the most helpful professor I have ever had!

His teaching style focuses on getting to the answer in a very particular way, without showing which numbers are being plugged in or how the calculations are done, youre just expected to trust his results. Other professors teaching this take the time to show all their work and carefully walk you through the process of solving the problem.

He's really good at introducing new topics & explaining their broad applications, making lectures engaging. Once the discussion moves beyond conceptual overviews & into the nitty-gritty of the theory's application, it starts getting tricky. Its honestly just a difficult topic and you can get lost in the numbers if youre not too careful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor has a good heart and tries to make sure everyone is somewhat on the same page. Class is just a tough class. Huge project and the midterm/final exams were really tough. Huge curve at the end though. Do the homework, do practice problems, and you'll probably be fine.

Lecture slides often didn't have enough information other than equations and I felt that his explanations weren't thorough enough so you didn't understand the concepts that well. His grading was pretty generous as long as you seemed to know what you were doing and he definitely wanted people to pass. Reading the book helped out.
If you want to learn, take his class. It aint a cake walk but, hes good at what he does. Read the book, actually try to do the homework problems, study and you will be fine.
great professor if u want to learn and beware of his midterms and finals, study hard
Very clear explanations
No Comments

Super amazing, nice, thoughtful professor. Only 3 homework assignments (done in groups), no exams or quizzes or projects. Labs were mainly for homework help. Lectures were quick. Professor obviously cares about his students and his material and was very jovial. Love him.

Course was online even after COVID. Professor made sure everything was well organized and gave everyone many chances to excel in the class. The material isn't too hard and prof does a good job of teaching it. He's very understanding and accommodating.

This class was very well organized. The calendar, access to google docs helped me a lot in organizing my goal and effort. Quizzes were given fair weights and splitting them into 10, 15, 20% was a brilliant idea. The way how professor gave me opportunities to discuss boosted up my spirits all through. Glad I took this class.

The best thing about this class was that I developed physical intuition as well as learned to validate my intuition with mathematical analysis. I could very well express my thoughts and engage in discussions. I even enjoyed the well co-ordinated (between the professor and the TA) labs a lot for this course.
The awesome part of the course was team learning. It helped me understand the broader aspect of the field. The projects actually helped me in my research. Professor highly recommended.

I liked how this course challenged me to not only learn to solve problems based on given data but also to look at problems in a quantitative manner. This way there was more learning as opposed to just plugging in numbers.
I really liked the focus was on the concept rather than the formula based problem solving.
This professor sucks big time. He really have no clue what to teach. I don't think he deserves to be here.

I took a year of proseminar with Deb (PSY 200AB) and she is an amazing person and researcher. Very sweet and kind. Also she gives really good feedback on papers and presentations and is very supportive of our success. For feedback, it is important to be open to changing your way of approaching the material.

I took her for Health Psychology, interesting class. Exams werent too bad but the wording on the second exam threw me off and I didnt do well. Three exams, 2 papers, and a discussion board for extra credit. Very kind and sweet professor. You can follow her on the slides, but you need to take notes and read the textbook. I do recommend her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Vile woman. You would think someone in her field would be more pleasant. Run far away from this bitter and angry woman.

She is straight forward with her students and tries to make it easy for her students to get a good grade. She has a very fair grading criteria. If you do the reading guides and go to office hours, you'll definitely pass.

Professor Wiebe is a great professor. I really enjoyed how she incorporated real world examples. This class consists of 4 exams, 3 projects, & 10 in-class assignments. The in-class assignments are proof of attendance & they are randomly assigned during the semester. Attend class, complete all of the reading guides, & review & you should be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: interesting class. Tests, 2 (easyish) papers, and in class activities make up your grade. I started off using the book for the reading guides she provides but its not required, just helpful. the final is optional too which is cool. shes's very smart and can answer any questions

Professor Weibe is really nice. Theres 3 exams and the final is optional, and there's 3 assignments but you only meed to choose 2. Attendance is kind of mandatory since you receive credit for participation.

Dr. Wiebe is such a sweet, kind lady! And you can tell that she has a passion for what she teaches. But her lectures can be very dry and boring. The class itself is very easy; 2 projects, 4 exams (including the final) & she only takes your 3 highest scores. Go to class as much as you can cause she gives out random participation points.

Her lectures were very boring, her voice is so monotone, and she doesnt post slides until a couple days before exams, so it makes it hard to study beforehand, or even take notes. Attendance is mandatory as she takes it through kahoot for participation, and uses kahoot for quizzes. However, exams are open-notes and open book in class.

Took PH190 w her and it was lowkey interesting, but also wack. Idk what happened to her throughout the semester, but grading been late and boring lectures have already been discussed. Random attendance is whack, cuz it makes certain days more important (collected through kahoot or index cards). Cool subject tho, ez tests cuz open book.

The class was easy but sitting through the lectures was agonizing because she is so bland. Attendance matters and you do get a grade for that. She is strict in how she wants her assignments to be turned in. She requires a specific font rather than TNW, because its easier to read.. If you don't follow the specific instructions, she will doc points.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Her lectures are boring and attendance is mandatory so there is no getting out of them. She knows her stuff but lectures in a way that doesn't grab your attention. The class isn't really difficult though but it was definitely the least favorite part of my day.

Her lectures are straight up boring... You're forced to attend every lecture for "participation points" and sit for a little over an hour and listen to a monotone voice. You can tell she knows her stuff, but she isn't very good at lecturing it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: As long as you do your work and pay attention in class you can get an A or B. She shows a lot of videos in class for demonstration.

Dr. Gonzalez is a great professor who has a real passion for her work. For the most part you are responsible for taking your own notes. There are weekly chapter quizzes and the midterms/ final are open book/open notes. Attendance and participation are counted by using a clicker. She offers many extra credit opportunities. No reason to fail.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Everyday was a struggle to pay attention in class. Sooo boring...
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Bob is an extremely rude person. He does not know how to talk to a students & expects all the students to give him respect. He does not know how to explain any of the complex coding for excel and R. I did not learn anything in this class. He wants you to write answers to questions exactly the way he does or he'll mark you off.

GOO TO CLASS and follow all directions he gives. He's a strict teacher but it forces you to really crack down the skills and stay on task. Strict grading on exams and 2 quizzes per discussion but this only forces you to LEARN the material and work HARD!

Bob is actually a very good professor, even though he can be rough and a bit rude sometimes he actually knows how to teach and you WILL learn. He does mark off for every little mistake on tests, so be aware of that. You will learn to be a perfectionist in this class. Overall, the class was easy and sparked my interest in the world of statistics.
rudest professor I have ever had and takes off points for things that aren't even related to the test such as saying step 1 step 2 step 3 instead of simply say 1,2,3

Knows what he's talking about, but blabbers a lot about random stuff not useful for the course.  Grades heavily on minor mistakes so you better be correct overall. Worse thing yet is he treats you like you're still in high school. No phones, computers etc and if he sees it he's take it away. Oh and no chewing gum. Glad it was really easy, bad prof.

Bob is a great instructor.  His explanations are clear, and he makes sure to repeat important concepts over and over again so that you get it.  Fair grading, and he tells you exactly what he expects from you.  If you do what he says, you'll be sure to get an A.

Thankfully, the tests are straightforward & book is ill-written, but useable. The downside is that he wants the work done his way. He marks off heavily on labels and insignificant details. Worse yet, he is not clear at all. He's especially not good at explaining the more..complicated concepts (anything above mean and median and variance),good luck

Lab are really easy, the TAs pretty much walk you through them. We dont really learn much, so the quizes are a bit tough. The HW, like the labs are easy and are a for sure 100%. Lectures arent mandatory as theres nothing really learned.
Loved Dr. Warlaumont. Her lectures were very clear and she makes it known what she expects from her students. I definitely look forward to other classes she teaches in the future.
Really enjoyed taking this course with Anne. She always provided help when needed. If she couldn't help you with something, she would figure it out with you. Great professor overall.

Professor Warlaumont is not a good professor. She doesn't make clear what she expects from her students. She uses too many filler words in her lectures and her exams are all over the place. I dislike her power points as well because they are too structured.If you can avoid her. I won't be taking any more classes with her. Awful.
She is really sweet and helpful. I learned alot in this class. DO the study guides, they helped a lot.

This is her first semester teaching. So obviously there are kinks however she makes a huge effort to improve. The exams are not very hard. She has also made the test easier because she knows people are having a hard time. She is extremely helpful when talking to her in office hours or through email. Her next classes will be better.
She's a good professor. Extremely knowledgable. Go to office hours and she will make things crystal clear.

She's a new professor and although it's a little obvious, it is understandable and she acknowledges it. I appreciate her efforts! She is knowledgeable about her subject area however I find that because it is her first time teaching she doesn't know how to communicate it effectively. Overall, she will do her best to help and responds to our feedback

Really boring, not knowledgeable of subject. She is inexperienced and it is painfully obvious. She should have started with a class that is not so dense for her first time teaching. Tests are hard, but curves and gives a little extra credit.
Thicccc accent
An amazing teacher. I have massive respect for him. Easy grader.

Shortly he doesnt know how to be a teacher. He grades EVERYTHING wrong: homework, quizzes & even the midterm. He never curves, in fact curves down. He never taught. The quizzes had nothing to do with the textbook or the lecture slides so it's always a surprise. He doesnt have a clear schedule and cares so little that he never showed up for tests.

Reads off of Lecture Slides, and does little teaching of his own. Only came to one exam the whole course, and doesn't do much for the class besides teach, as the TA's grade. Never responded to my emails. Rounded down, did not pass the class. No syllabus was provided, only lecture slides that explained some parts of the class. Avoid him if possible.

Does not like to teach. Reads off copied slides from another professor. When you ask him questions his explanations make you even more confused. Doesn't do any of the grading himself, TA do everything(Teaching). Does not round grades when you have a 79.89/79.99% to 80% or 89.89/89.99% to a 90%. In fact, 80% is a C+ and 90% is a B+ according to him.

This class was awful. The professor never created a syllabus, moved the midterm up 1 week and even then never inputted midterm grades. The lectures are him just reading off the slides and the TAs don't show up to labs. The professor doesnt even bother to show up for the midterm or the final. Overall the class is very unorganized, avoid at all costs
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His lectures are boring and literally repeats all the information in the book and lectures aren't mandatory so you can just read the material on your own. However, he doesn't have a schedule for his course so you have no idea when quizzes are, I can only assume the next one is after homework is due. *sarcastically* It's so fun.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He has really strong accent and his lectures are boring. If you are going to take CSE 15, make sure you study the textbook by yourself. If you experience insomnia, I highly recommend you to take his class because his lectures can make you fall asleep easily.

This professor is very rude. He responds to emails in a very rude manner. He is not flexible at all, if you request him for something, he will most likely say no. I don't recommend this professor for any course. The course also was very unorganized.

His course is extremely unorganized, and he does not know how to talk to students, he is really rude and inconisderate. He cannot teach at all his lectures are an incoherent mess of endless ramblings.

Not a bad prof, but not amazing either. Class itself is pretty simple and straightforward, material isn't too hard. Go to class for participation quizzes. Group project was a grade saver. Prof wasn't too terrible to deal with but he's somewhat boring and monotonous. As long as you can do the homework, you should be fine.
One of the worst professors I've had. He replies to emails in a rude manner and isn't very understanding. His course was very unorganized, I would not take again.

Since we have online classes, he's extremely unfair. Probably one of the worst professors I ever had. He has a lot of technical issues in class and his midterms have a lot of bugs. For example, he asked to put an equation in but he made canvas unable to enter equations. How are we supposed to answer?

Super nice guy. Spends a good amount of time sharing anecdotes or stuff about his family during lecture but its not an issues as the material is rather easy. Provides a lot of feedback if you take the time to talk to him and is generous with partial credits in exam.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Josue is an excellent professor. He cares about the class and wants us to pass. If you do poorly in the class, it is your own fault. He is very helpful and is always willing to give you hints for your assignments. He is frequently available in office hours and via email as well. Great professor, great class, and he makes boring subjects enjoyable
This guy is unfair and stupid.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Her lectures were easy to understand. The exams were easy as long as you attended the lectures, but lecture attendance is not mandatory. Homework was easy and you had 2 attempts. Overall a good professor.

Attendance wasn't mandatory. The only reason why people showed up to class was because there was a possibly that she would give extra credit. She gives a lot of extra credit and gives good feedback during office hours. She has article analysis assignments and wants us to apply core concepts in it and has weekly quizzes. Ta grades slow so email Ana
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: Very easy class as long as you do the homework. Simoes sometimes offers extra credit especially if you're in class so it is encouraged to go but not mandatory. You'll be asked to purchase the textbook but you might not need it unless if you want to. I bought it for extra credit but ended up hardly using it. Exams do get curved 5 points too.

I really do not understand the negative reviews; Professor Simoes's PSY 010 class was extremely easy for me. I attended all of her lectures and asked ample questions when needed. Her lectures were absolutely clear and thoughtful. My final grade in her class was 103%. Literally just attend lectures and do extra credit and you'll pass.
The class, itself, isn't difficult, it's the professor who makes it hard. The exams doesn't match what she puts out for the study guide and the grading's mostly impacted by the exams.

Lectures are off slides and the class is self-learning. The grades are based mostly on quizzes, but more heavily on exams. Fail the exams and you fail the class. The bad part is that her exams are so different from her study guides, to the point that even if you study 200+ terms for an exam, you will not score high. Beware of these facts.
If you failed your exam and quiz, then you failed this class

Professor Simoes is amazing. Without a doubt, one of the best at UCM. Read before lecture, review after lecture, attend office hours, and pay attention during lecture, and you're guaranteed to pass with that prep. Attendance is graded for the Labs (where HW is reviewed). She is caring and knows how to teach well. In lecture examples help a ton!

Cisneros class was interesting and engaging, she's respectful and overall a good teacher. Lots of writing, all with different approaches my only complaint is the textbook is expensive, used enough to harm your grade if you don't have it simple there's readings that you are tested on pretty sure you may find this online.

as someone who was sort of a no sabo kid my Spanish has improved thanks to this class. professor is so kind, funny, and respectful. her lectures were so interesting. weekly homework assignments but easy to do if you put effort into it. mandatory to present in front of the class for 10+ mins
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: She's really nice and organized. Participation matters but she doesn't demand a lot. Her lectures are entertaining and so are her assignments. It's mostly a little reading before class and then discussion during it. Her bigger assignments are just a short essay and a 7 min video. (I took her SPAN180 summer class btw but it's not listed on here)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I took Professor Cisneros this spring ! I loved this course very much! Not only is she an awesome professor, Professor Cisneros really takes time to prepare students with readings, discussions, I.e. the class is manageable to pass if you complete all of your work and study notes!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: One of my favorite profs! I loved SPAN001 with her! The class was a lot of fun and I learned a ton. I would definitely take another class with her! She is very helpful and makes herself very available for extra help outside of class during office hours. I entered the class late and she helped me catch up to the speed of the rest of the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: This Class is really doable to pass. Always there at office hours and willing to help. Professor is really nice and makes you feel welcome. Just don't slack off, ask questions if you need to. I learned a lot, I finally learned how to use several accents. I would definitely take this class again. It is upper division, but its doable to get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: It's a very organized class and even though the work load is not extreme I believe I learned a lot in the semester. I think this is the perfect class that proves that you do not need an extremely heavy work load to reassure yourself that you are learning. The discussions are very enjoyable and insightful. Finally learned how to used accents.

Really Good Professor, Lectures are enjoyable, Can never get bored, the majority of the topics are interesting making it easy to participate. Really hard to fail unless you do absolutely nothing. Would really recommend this professor if anyone is trying to learn Spanish.
Great Professor, Great guy.

quizzes hard to understand ... if I would have studied more i probably would have done better in quizzes but nevertheless they are a bit unclear. midterms if you study the hw problems posted in his web pages you will do fantastic in his midterms. read the book I dont have to show up to lectures because I study the book and hw problems.

Had kiley for both physics 8 & 9, he's an excellent teacher he knows all his material thoroughly and explains it all clearly. he's super nice, plus classes are relatively easy- homework is large % and he does problems in class if you ask, note sheet on midterms and finals, plus generous curve at the end :) if you have the option, take kiley definitely!

Although a lot of people like Kiley, I didn't like him. I actually preferred Menke better. He is by far a better lecturer (he doesn't even use notes!) and a great speaker, but I didn't like his style. His tests were difficult.
Very helpful during office hours! Doesn't respond back to emails, but if you go talk to him hes very understanding. Great professor! HIGHLY recommend!

Awesome teacher! He may talk a bit fast during lecture but everything is very organized and clear. Grading and tests are very fair. He provides detail answers to any questions asked and wont mind explaining step by step. I hated physics before I took this course with him. Highly recommended.

This guy is an awesome teacher.  I have had several physics teachers, and this guy is one of the best.  He knows the material, and presents it in an interesting way.  His grading policy is very fair.....Basically if you give it an honest effort, even if you hate physics, you can get a passing grade.  Take this prof. if you have the chance!!!!!!!!!!

CORE probably wouldn't have been as beneficial if she wasn't my discussion teacher. Discussions were engaging and meaningful. Makes you think critically by giving amazing and thoughtful feedback on discussions and papers. Modifies some homework so it can be more manageable. Also gives freedom to choose a topic of your own, as long as it's approved.

Her class is very research based which help you expand to your own writing style and helps you to critically analyze a paper.  Overall, I enjoyed her class very much and she makes us understand the concepts to the full extent.
This professor gives a lot of homework and the readings are essential to the class. She grades extremely hard, but gives a massive amount of feedback on every paper you turn in.
Great professor

Katherine is incredibly nice and helpful. She assigns a lot of work and readings, so don't expect to get an easy A, but that's college. She definitely gives a lot of feedback though on your assignments and is very open with discussing her comments with you. She is really there to help and seems to be one of the most sincere teachers here.

Well if you expect to get an Easy A, don't come to this class. However if you decide to enter this class, you'll end up learning more than you initially came in with. Honestly she is a nice professor that expects a lot from her students but gives great feedback on how and what to improve on. This class is a lot of work- Comparable to 2 classes. GL

She is nice, but assigns so much homework. Every time there is class there has to be so much work done, as well as annotations and case notes everyday on daily readings and research journals. She also does not give breaks in between her long class.

His lectures can move pretty slowly at times, but he is ABSURDLY helpful and gives amazing feedback. If you show him that you're putting effort in and you're willing to pay attention to what he tells you, you're pretty much guaranteed a good grade. He's also just wonderful to talk to, really great guy that makes this writing-heavy class fun.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Hoda's office hours is in a building where you need access to enter the room. Talk about accessibility... You would need to wait outside until someone from her lab group walks out and notices you. Being paid to do office hours instead you focus on your own research study is scammy. Please do a better job at providing for the people that pays you.

Avoid this spark class. The group projects are intensive. He is a nice guy, but he would drone on in his lectures and go on tangents. The quizzes he gave were tough and written extraneously. The class was unorganized; he assigned 2 research projects last minute in the final week of the semester and wanted us to work on it after it ended.

Professor Bernard is a very understanding and knowledgeable individual and gives good feedback on your work. Attendance is not mandatory in most classes, except for times when participation is necessary such as presentations or debates. He is also lenient on late work, accessible outside of class, and quickly responds to emails.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Bernard is very knowledgable and willing to help students understand difficult topics. He does take a while to grade assignments, but gives a lot of feedback when he does, and is understanding on late assignments. The largest assignments were group projects that were very involved, but having a bad group member would not hurt your grade.
Professor Bernard is a great teacher, he provides tons of feedback on papers and is not too tough of a grader, the lectures were also interesting

His lectures aren't the most riveting ever, but he is extremely knowledgeable and willing to share all of it with you. He gives literal pages of feedback on essays, often three or more, and is extremely understanding with mistakes and late work. I consider Professor Bernard to be both a great professor and a great person.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Essentially every piece of information was communicated through lectures. If you don't attend the lecture, you are bound to miss out on some important info on due dates/assignments/etc. Very respectful and understanding, just act like an adult. Only critique was a lack of feedback throughout the semester. Lectures were great, you'll love his class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: 10/10 teacher fr, super cool dude and is always available if you need help.

Great professor who cares about each of his students. He is very understanding and approachable during office hours.   Grading is very fair and unlike other classes. iT takes a while to get feedback from him. If you procrastinate it seems like a lot of work, but it's not.
rating_tags: Group projects--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Cool guy, very nice and fair. The goat fr fr

Truly and S+ professor. Not just a great writing prof. but a really stand out guy. His class isn't necessarily a breeze, you gotta push yourself to get a high grade, but you'll come out of it a better writer then you'd ever think your be. Would absolutely recommend.

One of the best teachers I've ever had. Such a genuinely kind person, and super helpful in Office Hours. As long as you try your best and communicate with him, you should have no problem in his class. His class is also super calm and the workload isn't super heavy. Professor Lovas is such a gem, and his class is worth taking.

The class is relatively easy but if you want an A you have to work on your essays. There are 3 essays that are due throughout the semester then put into a portfolio at the end of the semester. The three essays are Discourse Community, Rhetorical Analysis, and Report with a group presentation. Plus a few other assignments but they aren't too hard.

Professor Simoes', lectures were long but very informative, attendance was optional however, she will occasionally give in class extra credit for attendance. Theres 14 mini exams but, she drops 4 of the lowest grade. Theres were also a few comprehension papers you'll write about your chosen topic/concept where she is very picky about the format!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Very easy class and don't even have to go to the lectures. Those mini exams are very easy and open textbook so super easy.

Based on my experiences in PSY-001, Professor Simoes was a easy grader as the "mini-exams" are things we do on our own time, which she allows us to use open notes or work with other people as well. Overall the class is super easy, mandatory isn't necessary as she posts the slides online.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: The class was okay, at some point of time (probably after Exam 2), I started to struggle in her class. If you aren't a test-taker person nor into a class only of lecture, I wouldn't recommend her since that is basically what her class is. Simple quote, "Fail one exam, fail the class," and like usual, one good exam isn't going to help your grade up.

I really do not understand the negative reviews; Professor Simoes's PSY 010 class was extremely easy for me. I attended all of her lectures and asked ample questions when needed. Her lectures were absolutely clear and thoughtful. My final grade in her class was 103%. Literally just attend lectures and do extra credit and you'll pass.

Professor Simoes wasn't helpful even when I went to her during office hours to ask if there could be a way I could get my grades up. All she told me was to study harder, but how is studying harder going to help when I have been studying her study guides and the textbook? It's not just me, but several of my peers feel the same way.

Definitely do not recommend, Professor Simoes. Most of her grading comes from exams and quizzes, with the fact that her exams are very contrast from learning. It is also self-learning since she doesn't teach you anything but lectures off on slides you can find in the textbook. Her study guides are also not helpful and futile for her exams.

Great professor, just be sure to do your part and study for the material before the lecture and review after! HW is open note, and cheat sheets are allowed during exams. Her explanations are great, and she does in lecture examples for the math concepts for statistics. Honestly, don't be intimidated by statistics or readings, she helps you tons.
She is very monotone

Took this for BIO 140 - Genetics. This class was not structured at all. Even if you read the book and go to lecture + discussion it is still a very difficult class. The HW is useless/waste of time as it does NOT prepare you for exams. I hope the class itself gets changed or someone else helps with it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Taking this class with prof hernday is unnecessarily difficult. Exams are set up the way he prefers and without taking any student feedback into consideration. They are also 70% of your grade. This is a difficult course to even get a C in.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Mediocre professor. He is a nice guy, but his tests are insanely difficult and ask for many details that are not within either the text or slides but is expected to be know. The exams he write are graded heavily and have little to no partial credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: It is a difficult class, get ready to read! Exams are written which cover a lot of material for an exam. Grades are based on exams, hw, and participation.
