comment: Super great professor! Really cares about the topics he discusses. Warning: Pay attention to the topics he goes on long rants about, those will be on the exams. Also, do the worksheets; they're not graded, but they will be on the exams!! As long as you study the worksheets and attend lecture, you'll do fine in the class.
Great professor, Helpful
Great professor and is always willing to help. He tells you what will be on the test and all assignments, though not graded, are what will be on the exams. Attend lecture and you'll pass.
She's very understanding and kind, truly cares about us students. There's some work but thats normal in any class. Shes super nice and funny. A wholesome lady. Awesome professor
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: I took her for my thesis class, she helped out a lot along the way. Though what annoyed me was that when she talked in class, she would look up at the ceiling and she would have her moments when she looks like she's thinking of what to say next. She also uses her hands to speak, but sometimes she has them in a midway pause. Cool, but not much.
Really an unfathomable amount of reading. Really good teacher but the workload is insane.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great class and very informative. The class is upfront and there are no trick questions / gotcha on exams. The lectures are dense info though when I took her European History class so I could see why some students would fall sleepy due to energy drain (but chew gum, it helps alot). Office hours were additionally helpful for hw advice. Overall good
A little hard to sit through some classes but overall a good teacher
She is a great teacher but her classes are boring.
No Comments

Took his sociology of juvenile delinquency and all we talked about was racism. It seemed like the whole term he was trying to make all of the white students feel horrible about themselves and our ancestors. The tests were nothing like what we focused on in class. Im used to getting As and might not even pass this class. Hes very one sided.

My problem with Professor Chirino is his one sided ideology. He seems to tell the truth, yet, he also seems to tell in his truth or rather his own words. Just because what you say 'might be true' does not mean that it is. Chirino should not use Politics in Sociology at the same time his ideas are dangerous or rather more radical. Keep that in mind.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Chirino was fanatastic. I took his Community Mobilization and Politics course. You wish the class was longer. Lectures are important, but easy to catch up on. He is very good at providing help if needed but does not do the work for you. Follow the syllabus and formats he gives out exactly and your grade will be good. Highly reccommend.

Professor Chirino is a great intellectual that advocates for his students no matter the consequences. He teaches many great lectures and is a great person. Although he grades hard, I would fail this class purposefully just to take it again for the things that I've learned!
Extremely tough grader. Lectures are very interesting and inspiring but, again, extremely tough grader!!! Almost impossible to get a decent grade. Do not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This is honestly one of the best professors that I had,he truly cares about his students, and he encourages people to repeat himself if his going to fast. The reading is dense and long but he does explain  SOME of the reading in class and breaks what the writer was saying,but still do the reading. Your will take a midterm and final will be a essay.
An amazing professor who is beyond passionate about what he believes and teaches. He will challenge you but teach you more about real life than any professor has before.

Doctor Raymond is one of the greatest biology professors at UCM. Great guy and keeps the class very interesting. I was enrolled in his microbiology course in 2009 and absolutely enjoyed every lecture. Great Professor - study his lectures and pay attention to what he says in class and you'll do fine.
Jason is great. He keeps the class fresh and really engages you in his lectures with his charisma. Hot too!
i dont even like bio but he did a great job teaching it because i loved going to class to learn something new about nutrition. he taught interesting topics and is easy on the eyes!
GREAT professor- interesting, funny, keeps students engaged. Loved his class.
I dont know if this was an off semester but BIO 60 was a joke! Didnt even read the text and got over 100% on the exams. Get a good group, stay on top of presentations, and the rest will be an easy A
No Comments

Mumford is by far my favorite professor here. He has the class greatly structured and gives excellent feedback for writing assignments. Everything is properly organized so there's almost no confusion, but he will address everything either way. He cares about his students and offers one on one time throughout the semester. 10/10 recommend!
Great professor and his vibes were just overall amazing. Would take this class again. Love the professor.
The class was overall amazing. The way the class is structured really helps towards writing the final essay. The feedback on papers also helped greatly in perfecting my writing.

a really great teacher. he provides very clear instruction and grades fairly with generous feedback. while there are only a couple of papers throughout the semester, they all require a good bit of critical thought and are overall very fun to write.
Great professor but tough grader
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Mumford is one of the better writing professors at UC Merced. He is a fair grader and cares about your writing development. He is a funny and an overall laidback guy. People shy away from the course, but I ENCOURAGE ANYONE who is interested in the writing that is involved with doing research to take him. He isn't out to get you. Peace.

Mumford is really chill and genuinely want to develop his students. His grading is fair and he treats all student with equal lenience. He accepts most late works, if it's in reasonable time but he said he doesn't have time to always grade late work . Gives big grade cushion for participation & group work and provides class reading materials.

She's trying....I think. Only uses blank notes filled in during class to teach lectures, which makes lecture notes utterly incomprehensible when trying to decipher them later. Somehow both patronizing and obtuse. Her explanations often use terrible examples, making simple concepts super confusing; this also applies to HW questions and PROJECTS!!!
I done failed her class! (S)he definitely (H)as a w(A)y with he(R) studen(T)s! Please take another professor!
exams are extremely hard and are not related to hw and quizzes. you could fail the exams even if you understand the materials well

One of the WORSE professor I have taken here at UC Merced. Her exams have nothing to do with the concepts we have learned. There is no study guide for exams nor practice exams. I do not recommend to take her. She makes learning miserable. She sometimes does not even go to class! Ad she will not cover what the sub covers. Her exams are Theoretical.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Bad teacher unclear, gone many Fridays and missed teaching. Wants to make your experience miserable because hers was (told class). Unavailable during office hours. Tests have no connection to class. Killed myself for a C. Does not seem to care at all about us taking class.

The WORST professor I have ever had. Not enough students go to her office hours, she assigns more homework. Students had a hard time on the first test, she stated she would not truncate, or grade on a curve as she did not have this in College. She was not there Fridays, doesn't respond to emails. Makes tests as hard as possible, doesn't teach.

I so far have a good grade in the class, but that's because it was mostly self-study. The lectures were not enough to get you to pass the exams, the quiz questions, homework, and exams had nothing in common. You have to really dig online to find problems that will help you prepare for exams. I was tutoring a ton of people in the class.
Highest of quality and has memes
His teaching, communication skills, and exam structure were all horrendous. The final was a joke.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He's not a very good lecturer, he just uploads poorly explained videos that go over basic problems instead of concepts. He doesn't like responding to emails for some reason. He isn't very understanding either, I had internet issues during a quiz and couldn't submit it on time. He said it was my responsibility to have "stable internet." Just wow.

He had accused almost everyone in the class of cheating, pretty much ruining everyone's grades and records. Don't take a class with him because he will screw you one way or another. I had sent him a detailed explanation of my answers with my notes but he didnt believe me or anyone else, and neither did the conduct office. I went from a 96 to a 75.

He really does not know how to teach. With his lectures he goes over material so fast and finishes the notes in 15 minutes and the rest of the 45 minutes youre stuck doing a worksheet. Dont use chegg because somehow he has access to it. I didnt use chegg for the final and he still said I did I showed him the books I used and he gave me a 0. ��

The lectures were tough, but that was expected in physics. He made sure that we were practicing problems in class, so that we could get questions answered on the spot. The best part was that he cares about academic integrity. He was actively monitoring Chegg to make sure that cheaters would be caught! He made sure my grade mattered!

Terrible. Don't take. Teacher never lectures effectively, learned through other resources such as Khan Academy. Gave us worksheets rather than teaching material. Don't take this teacher if you want to understand and learn the concepts.

Took the Latin American history through film! Attendance is graded (for discussions only), the movies and readings given are great! (Snacks are available during movies) Not much writing but a decent amount of typing. I recommend this class if you love movies and have a slight joy of writing! (If you need help the professor is helpful)

Professor Smith made me feel heard in the class and she was an amazing teacher. The class was very interesting and intriguing not just for me but for my classmates as well. The class is focused on a lot of readings and the lectures cover a lot of material but the tests and papers are very forward and don't ask much as long as you do the readings.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Professor Smith taught my HIST 051 class, History of Things. She was always prepared for lectures and the assigned reading was always interesting. I took the class for a GE and wasn't expecting much, but I learned a lot and would highly recommend. Be prepared to read a lot, and the writing assignments are fairy light in comparison.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: I loved taking CRES/HIST with Professor Smith. Readings are heavy but a lot of the readings are explained throughout lectures. Both the grading and feedback are very clear. We start off the semester easy and end it easy. Just do the readings and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Accessible outside class

comment: Do the readings and the majority of the work is done. Going to lecture isn't a must but is advised. My class was online instead of in person because of covid and that changed how our exams were taken making them pretty easy. If you're taking this right after fall semester 2021 then I say it's an easy A. Fall 2022 might not be the same but still.

This course consists of 4 major assignments, essay #1 and 2, midterm that is half multiple choice and a timed essay and a final project. So much reading and lectures are hard to follow however TAs are in charge of grading all assignments so depending on who you get some are lenient and very helpful. Professor is kind but material is difficult.

Her spark class was pretty easy, considering it was online. She is very caring and understanding. She cares about students' health and wellbeing more than forcing them to do work. Grades on participation. Watched movies while learning about the background in history. Learned a lot.
Great professor, would absolutely take him again if I had the chance to. Checks in with students when needed and offers great feedback to writing assignment and rough drafts.

Professor Elkins is timid and soft-spoken but is a great professor. He grades fairly, is helpful, and is understanding. We would read and have little assignments due almost every class but he gives you the answers. We had a couple of essays(gives you a lot of time before it's due) and there were two short presentations.

Mr. Elkins is a respectful+considerate professor. May appear quite timid, but is proactive in students learning. Gives great feedback that helps us improve. The daily readings he assigns are simple&easy to grasp, making learning enjoyable. Exam was ez, task was to write about WRI 101 experience. Great teacher! I would definitely take him again :)
Really good!!
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Elkins is a good professor but is a bit too quiet during discussions. The work he gives is fair and if you are having trouble with something, talking to him about it goes a long way!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Michael Elkins is a really great instructor as he is not of a demanding as other instructors. Core 1 is really a hassle, yet he tries to make it work the best for the students as much as he can. Make sure to do the work, take advantage of the extracredit, ask questions when needed and you will be fine. Core 1 as a class sucks, but he is a good prof
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Pretty good and helpful

A very wise CSE professor I truly admire. Even though his lectures can be hard to navigate at times especially with his handwriting, he does his best to make sure you pass the class and also understand the content. Just make sure you do the HWs and textbook problems; they are very similar to the exam problems.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Class is difficult, but he will answer each and every question. Even if you have the textbook it is better attending the lectures 'cause his explanations are better -- and you get the jokes, too. If you do the homeworks, you will do fine on the exams. Would definitely take it again. As others have noted, his handwriting is atrocious...

Straightforward explanations, plenty of time for review, well organized, answers questions and gives examples. Extremely precise in his teaching, felt like I was being taught by Aristotle or something. He acknowledges his bad handwriting and refuses to fix it which is so respectable, but he still rewrites clearly if you ask.
Took stefano for cse 180, as a graduating undergrad he was by far one of the best professors at uc merced, I enjoyed his lectures and I feel like I learned a lot about robotics !
Lectures are very concise and to the point. Exams are fair. Also only thing is he writes his n's very weird(they look like m's). TAs grade homework and labs.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: The lectures are filled to the brim with content. If you blink, you'll be behind 2 units. But, if you ask the professor for help, he'll stop everything to make sure you're up to speed. If you aren't afraid to ask questions, he'll hold your hand through the class if you need it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: To be honest, it was a really hard class but it really pushed me to learn the subject. The concept was hard and so was the work, but in the end I learned something so it was alright.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: There is homework every 2 weeks but the homework takes about a week to do. Lectures consist of notes and he goes through them quickly. However, hes very understanding and will go back and if you slightly miss a deadline he'll work with you. Overall, he gets more hate than he deserves. His final wasnt that bad, and I would take his class again.

He is not a good professor. He doesnt answer questions clearly, and goes through lectures too quickly. He has TAs grade hw so you never know why you get things wrong or not. I would avoid this class unless you absolutely need it to graduate. Probably the worst professor Ive had during my time at UCM.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Expects you to learn things right when it's taught. Goes through the lecture too fast. Homework is difficult.

The labs were pretty straight forward but the only thing holding us back was crappy hardware that wouldnt work 2/3 of the time. Lectures are long & Chen assumes that you know a lot more going into the class than what you actually do. Would only recommend taking this as a 4th year in the Spring or see if it could be offered as a grad level course.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: i dont even know what to say, words cant express how horrible this professor is

This class was very confusing and unengaging for most of the time. The lecture slides were difficult to follow because the professors would rush through them. At times he was very rude and would get mad for stopping him to ask a question. He would sometimes go off-track and talk about his son and how he got into UC Berkeley.
Lectures are really fast and his tone when he answers questions is very discouraging. When asked a question, he will answer it in a very harsh manner almost like he yells at you.

Its unfortunate that this class skipped over a lot of pre reqs which puts everyone at a big disadvantage and makes this class very hard. With that being said, Chen does not help with the issue said above, instead makes it worse with fast, hard to read, and unclear lectures. Take this class if you are willing to learn 99% of the material alone.
He lectures really fast, without checking for questions. When questions are asked, he isn't patient and says things like " I won't go over this again" discouraging future questions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: NOOO!!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: There was a lot of reading in this class and a decent amount of assignments. But as long as you keep up on everything it is an easy class. Attendance was mandatory for lectures and discussions but there was plenty of extra credit to make up for missing a class. Dr. Brokaw is very passionate about literature which makes her lectures very enjoyable.

Brokaw was an amazing professor! She was very understanding if you have late work or extensions. There is one creative project and one close reading paper. I will say there is quite a bit of homework but as long as you do the readings by each class session you should be good. Attendance is taken during lectures so I would recommend going.

Dr. Brokaw was a great professor and I really enjoyed taking her class. There was a lot of reading but everything was super enjoyable. Her lectures are very engaging and fun. There was weekly quizzes but they were simple if you did the reading. As long as you put the time into the reading and writing you will have an easy time.

Dr. Brokaw is a really amazing professor! She presents the material in a super caring, smart way. She knows a lot about the subjects and shares her knowledge super well. She's very cool about making concessions as far as excuses abscences, and is a super kind professor overall. Plus, she's pretty funny!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Recommend any class with her. As long as you try and engage you will have a lot of fun. She's by far the goofiest Professor I've ever had. She's extremely passionate about the topics she teaches and definitely shows. Reading before class is necessary but other than that the class shouldn't be too hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: I highly recommend taking any ENG/LIT classes with Brokaw. Even when reading very obscure old texts she is very good at giving you a funny/modern spin on the material which helps those who cant assimilate the material as readily. And, if you are looking to go deep into theme and meaning she will go there with you and bring the whole class as well!

She's a really awesome teacher! The tests are pretty easy: Quote identification, multiple choice and short essay. Make sure you go to the lectures and discussion. And always bring your book with you and do the readings. As long as you read its an easy A.
She was amazing I felt in an engaged classroom setting! Super nice and made me want to come to class.

Amazing professor and super interesting class!!! Every topic for each week is interesting and the grading criteria is clear. She is very understanding, caring, and woke. Take this class if you want to learn about social issues and go to class once a week because everything else is online.

Tanya is an amazing person! She truly does care about society overall. Her class and the topics were super interesting. The text book used was written by her so that was pretty cool to experience. We only had weekly writing assignments, she is a very easy/reasonable grader, as long as you answer the questions being asked.

Professor Golash-Boza is amazing! There is readings ever week, no exams, weekly questions for count 85% of you grade and attendance matters. As long as you pay attention in lecture, attend the discussions and do all the weekly questions, it should be an easy class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Good at what she does, easy class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Her lectures were fantastic and I loved reading her stuff for the required readings. She knows what she is talking about and makes her discussions interesting even though it's a 2 hour class. Overall I would say she is kinda easy but only because as long as you understand the lectures and do the readings for the paper  it is possible to get an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is very helpful and was very knowledgeable about the topics in class. tells you exactly what to write in your papers and the weekly quizzes on the readings but she went over the book before we took quiz.

She is a wonderful lecturer and the class is very clear, fun,  and organized. The language itself can be pretty challenging and requires extensive studying outside of lecture. Despite the overall difficulty of the class she gives good feedback and is always available to help. Tutoring is also available at UCM. An amazing class to learn Japanese

Worst professor ever. Won't help you even when asked. Embarrasses you and makes you think you should have taken years of Japanese before taking this introductory class. Will not recommend this professor.
She was a great professor, very passionate about the topic and easy to approach with questions. Study and do the homework and you'll pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Such a caring professor, the class was fun but challenging, there will be times you will feel stuck when you can't remember the appropriate terms, but she offers to help, and does so.

Class is fast-paced and may be difficult for anyone who doesn't know any Japanese at all, but it's possible to still do well. Teacher is helpful and approachable. She is always well prepared. Sticks to the syllabus schedule. Tests and homework are very straightforward. Get extra help from the tutor or teacher if needed.

The only class i failed after 1 year of college. I studied harder and longer for this 2.5 unit class than i did for my other two classes ( including another foreign language class that was 5 units ) and i still failed this class, yet i passed my other classes with flying colors.  Study Japanese on your own for about a year before taking this class.
Miki Ishikada was a very helpful teacher for Japanese 1. She was very clear cut and provided a lot of useful information for people who's only experience with japanese is anime.

Often felt patronizing in lecture, went over easy and difficult ideas at the same rate which wasn't great. Didn't really explain why we were doing the things we were doing sometimes. Thankfully very generous grades and easy-ish midterms and final. Very good TAs, helped a lot, but I don't think I got a great understanding of the ideas in the class.

Prof. Khatri is a great professor who makes differential equations and linear algebra seem like a breeze. She has weekly quizzes in discussion, and weekly extra credit quizzes in lecture. Khatri posts videos for most of her lectures, so make good use of those.

Pretty good class actually. Lectures are pretty useful to attend but they're not really mandatory to passing the class. I did pretty well just doing the lecture videos and attending office hours. Discussion classes will also really help you more than the lectures in my experience, but you will benefit from going to the lectures regardless.

Weekly quizzes in discussion and homework wasn't turned in. 2 midterms +  a final. Gives many example problems, posts her notes, and is easy to talk to. Is very accessible with fast emails and office hours. Her exams are based off of in-lecture examples problems, they're easy if you pay attention. Overall, a great professor.

Must have access to the textbook for homework questions. Hw wasn't turned in, but there were weekly discussion quizzes. We had 3 exams total during the semester, the third one was during our final, but each one was non-cumulative (check the syllabus). Pay attention & attend lectures, take notes well, do the homework, and you'll do well.

She is a great professor and always allows questions during lecture. She is extremely helpful during office hours as well. Her exams are not hard if you study, but since many people do not do so well, the curve is always really good. However, just try to stay above the curve to ensure an A.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I think this was Professor Khatri's first semester at UCM, but she hails from UNC and she knows diff eq's like the back of her hand.  Incredibly clear lecturer, willing to take time to answer questions and even helps outline topics to focus on for exams.  Very helpful, and she actually made the class a lot of fun when I was scared to death of it!

I really loved Professor Van Bebber's class for Writing 1. I was expecting to get a mediocre grade in writing because I didn't pass the writing exam given by all UC's. This class was very interesting to me because we discussed meaningful issues that are prevalent in society. Overall, you will will get a good grade if you follow essay guidelines
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I had her for a mandatory class that i was not happy to be taking. However, if you go to her office hours and take her feedback into consideration when writing your essays she'll see that you're putting in work and give you fair credit.
No standard syllabus, unclear assignment postings on wiki.
Nice, understanding and extremely helpful with feedback. Just follow her feedback directions exactly and you'll get a good grade. Reccomend her 131 class for an easy 2 units and good grade booster.

Is a bit disorganized but knows how to teach. Approachable and loves to find ways to help students learn, both one-on-one and in the classroom. Takes and uses input from students for class. Group work was difficult but the syllabus is the same for all Wri 101 classes. It was designed by the Writing Program and the Psychology Department combined.
She, I swear to God, asked me if I was trying to be existential or, "was just a bad writer."  She chooses favorites.  Just watch out and show up.
Not too hard of a grader on essays and easy to approach for questions. Class is long but helpful.

This class is difficult but he gives you everything you need to pass. You have to want to pass and do the work. You have to show up and study. There is a lot of information that you need to learn. He does give extra credit and there are study sessions that you can attend. Content is sometimes boring but he explains it if you ask.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: LECTURE HEAVY. And he has a mono-tone voice. This was the most boring class i have taken. I would show up just for his "pop quizes" and work on other classes homework during his class. Learned more by reading the textbook than listening to him lecture.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He expects the class to know things he literally just brought up in lecture. Also, test material contains information only found in his lectures as well. I learned more by reading the textbook and taking notes from that rather than listening to his lectures. I passed with an A somehow. He put in attendance and clicker Q as extra credit which helped
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I was one percent from passing and he didn't want to curve me. His grading system is tough he makes it sk that everything counts.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Good professor but just a difficult class. Attending office hours was really helpful
omg this class was so boring i passed somehow but this guy is so boring with that monotone voice
The class was really difficult. I barely passed. Going to lecture was useful but he always uploaded the slides to CROPS.
Excellent teacher. Clear in her expectations, and very interested in the opinions of her students. Really cares.
She is the best for discussion for Core1. Reading is crucial. Her quizzes are easy if the readings are done. She's absolutely mellow and hippie status!
she is awesome!!!! best english teacher ive had and really helpful in essays!!! highly recommend her!!!!

One of the best professors I've had. She is pretty helpful and knows what she's talking about. She's also somewhat lenient with assignment deadlines if the class has trouble with them. I highly recommend her.
No Comments

Beasley is really nice, understanding, and is great at discussing topics in a fun and interesting manner. She is a great critic of your work and respects each student. She uses the book and gives great essay topics; this class is worth it.
One of the most amazing teachers I've had. Seriously excellent instructor. You will not regret classes taken with Professor Beasley.
He's an awesome professor and is super nice. Definitely would recommend taking any of his classes.

Has wealth of knowledge, can answer any question or problem in a proactive clear manner. Helped me understand an manage academic writing, and by extension all writing and expression. Very bright and witty, makes one feel capable and knowledgeable.

Amazing teacher, makes you feel like a scholar and encourages thoughts and opinions.  He's formed me into a better literary critic and world citizen.  Class is not difficult at all, very easy and the lessons you get from it are priceless!
His classes are fun and pretty easy.
very nice, funny, and smart. i enjoy listening to him talk, although sometimes it is hard to focus. he puts all the readings online, no textbook
Very capable of drawing your interest in. He lets you formulate your opinion in writing assignments and does his best to help your writing become better.

The man is first class. Very humorous take on the works studied, and makes them seem much more interesting than they are. One setback is that a TA holds discussions and grades the papers. But the class itself is so small that he still knows everyone. He is not a "uc merced" caliber teacher; prior to merced he taught at UPenn for several years.

Dr. Murti Hali gave me a new perspective on a current issue we are facing. Her readings were relevant to not only her course but, to our society. Take her if you are serious about learning. She isn't a tough grader but she isn't going to cut you any slack.
Wonderful experience learning with her. She is always very well prepared and talks to the point.
helpful and clear about what she wants. overall, pretty nice and reasonable, just do some skim reading before class
chill cool, friendly, explained things well, smart, intelligent, lenient in most regards.  read the book and show up to class. talk and get to know her

I had Dipali for Core 001. She seems strict, but she's really intelligent and knows what she's talking about. She is chill so it's okay to crack a joke. She's always clear about what she wants and willing to help. She's nice!
A very hard grader, and the class is super boring. If possible try to get a different professor. Very strict

I had her for Core 001. She is an intelligent lady. Always clear about what she wants. She's strict, but she's cool. She knows what she's doing and teaching therefore, a great teacher. She's very helpful too.

Lectures are mostly examples from book which seems good, but confusing when you don't understand the concepts. She doesn't really explain how she does things in a way that is easily digestible. Her handwriting is tough to read which is hard because she writes so much.

Very helpful professor, she was always available in office hours.(In fact she does long office hours) I do agree, that the lectures can be kind of dry at times, but still lit is important to attend the lectures. Her practice midterms are really helpful. Put in the work, pay attention, do all your work, and you will certainly excel in her class.

This class is not hard to pass. She gives a lot of easy extra credit on homework and tests. Lectures are boring, but should take notes for homework. Office hours are very useful when it comes to homework, so take advantage. Tests aren't hard if u study the homework and practice midterms.

As an Econ major the class/lecture itself was boring and dry (peers tend not to be vocal and/or involved) however when I went to office hours she was much more clear and helpful. Definitely cares about the students if you SHOW that you care about the material. Do the HW, show up for class (easy credit) and lowest exam is thrown out. Tests are hard
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT OFFERED

comment: Professor Gawn is very helpful. She gives quite a few quizzes and tests, but there is always an opportunity for extra credit. She tends to go pretty fast with her slides, so if you have any questions ask in section, look at the book or go to her office hours. She is there to help the students, it just seems no one took advantage of that resource.

She's a great professor.  Very nice and knowledgeable about the material.  She's just bad at teaching to the class as a whole.  If you ask her for help at office hours, for some reason she's able to explain things better than during lecture.

This course was spectacular! The instructor is as sweet as can be and is willing to clarify anything the student finds confusing. There are three exams (and a final) in this course and the lowest exam is dropped! The assignments are long, however, if you complete one problem, the others are similar to it. I highly recommend this course.

Great professor, sad he left the UC but happy to have had his class because it was great, he read papers, graded them with constructive criticism and he gave great lectures with great examples and always answered questions.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: honestly i would not take him again. idk what got into him but before his office hours use to be helpful now they are not. i would go and he would say my work is good, and then when he would grade it i would get C's. i don't understand the necessity to lie and say my work is good then give me a poor score. he use to be helpful, but not anymore.

I've taken other classes with Professor Kroeger, do the assigned readings, ask questions if you're not sure, when it comes to reaction papers be direct, and explain why, his office hours are really useful.
This professor is hilarious to talk to even in his lectures. His lectures are straightforward and if there is something you don't understand, he is easily approachable!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Great Professor. Show up to lectures, stay on top of the readings and you should easily pass the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very straightforward professor go to lecture and do assigned readings and you'll do good in the class.
Alex is a straightforward professor. Show up to class, take notes, pay attention and you will pass. He keeps the class very interesting.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: I don't think it was his fault, I feel like he was just told to teach this course, not having any idea what it was about beforehand. He would start trying to explain a concept, but then confuse himself and try to rationalize it out loud, which just made things more confusing. Overall, the content was pretty easy though.

Newsam is a pretty cool professor, however sometimes he struggles to explain his own explanations and confuses himself, causing his students to be confused along with him. This is not great especially considering this class is a little more abstract for a math class. Despite this, the class is very easy as long as you do the homework.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Took Shawn last semester and now as graduating undergrad, I can say he was one of the best professors at UCM, if you pay attention and read over his notes(posts them online) you will have a deep understanding on image processing. We used python, and because of his class I feel confident in topics in image processing(p.s take math141 too).

His lectures were boring and he struggled to explain his own examples. Besides that, the class is easy. You don't necessarily need to go to lectures because it is logical so it's easy to learn on your own. You are expected to know some python, which I had never done before. The homework and study guides are similar to quizzes/final, so do homework!
Newsam's class for DIP is interesting, and easy as long as you pay attention and/or read the lecture slides. It's a laid back class for the most part and he's a laid back professor

He's nice but you would expect a professor to know how to do his examples. Most of the time is struggling to figure out his own examples and asks the students for assistance. So be prepared  to learn on your own.
just go to class and pay attention or read the lecture slide. his teaching is very clear. he is nice so ask questions if you don't understand.

He is very knowledgeable. Homework is too time-consuming (based on toughness), compared to other courses I took at that semester. His slides are very informative. He also inspires to work for paper from the project - which I am mostly interested in. He is very helpful in office hours as well. He loves teaching.

He cares about weather or not his students are understanding the material although some of his explanations may not seem that easy to understand, especially when going over how to do a problem. He goes over problems a bit fast but overall it is easy to keep up.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Test are nothing like the practice exams (Midterms and final). There's 2 midterms and a final. Doesn't explain problems and topics clearly. The T.A. was great, I learned everything from him and khan academy. I learned nothing from the professor. I would get confused with questions that I asked him help on. He is bad at explaining topics.

Avoid him. Whatever you do, avoid him. I shouldve listened to the past reviews. The tests had nothing to do with the material he gave us (except for maybe a few questions). I shouldve done my best to get a different professor but all the slots were full. Listen to me, dont take him.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The worst prof I've had at UCM, he is one of the most confusing lecturers ever. Once he goes over something once he assumes that you have learned it, and never revisits the topic again. The homework is long and tedious. The midterms have nothing to do with the homework or quizzes, and seem to be a completely different entity altogether.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Strubbe messed up on all three of our midterms and just overall, could not teach effectively. I really hope he improves, one could easily tell this was his first semester teaching.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Never have I ever been more confused by a teacher. I took physics in high school and was somehow able to be more confused by him. My TA Jussi should have taught the class instead. Strubbe gives out tests with material that is irrelevant to topics in his lectures and homework assignments. Complete disappointment in a teacher I really tried hard for.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Definitely do not recommend this professor. Prepare to learn everything by yourself because she won't teach you. She expects self learning and coming to class with the knowledge already. Also is not helpful if you ask for help, you'll receive unfriendliness.

CHEM 112 (Quantum Chem) was the class that brought me to my knees. It almost killed me, however Professor Inborn was amazing. This class is probably the highlight of my undergraduate. The homework is relentless , the quizzes are hard, the exams invokes the wrath of the gods, and still I would do it all over again. Thanks you Professor!

She does not know how to teach. I literally taught myself throughout the semester. She definitely is not understanding!! You cannot openly ask her questions because either she will respond with another question or just attitude. I do not recommend her. If you want to do well, do not take any class with her.

She's a good lecturer, relates topics to real-world, provides worksheets students utilize to follow throughout the class and chapters, well-organized in semester schedule, understanding of students' situations. Available outside of class. She's great, I'm just really bad at taking exams but she helped me pass!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Isborn is not approachable at all and is very rude. She is not understanding and gives hard exams. No curves. She is just copying calculations during the entire lecture. Random clicker quizzes that she has not even taught. Expect to learn on your own if you want to pass the class. Worst professor I have taken at UCM.

This was Christine's first semester teaching, and with that in mind, I think she rocked! She was very energetic, fun, and very helpful. Would go back and review if we were lost. Definitely prefer her teaching styles over Lair's. Grades were just as stated as in the syllabus, no grade bump/curve. Loves giving clicker quizzes, so show up to class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She doesn't curve the class like other professors do. She also makes the quizes and midterms nearly impossible. The average on most quizzes are below failing along with low averages on midterms.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: THIS IS FOR BIO120L. The professor is terrible at replying back to emails, he never responded after he changed my grade last minute at midnight before grade submissions. The grading system is unfair and the professor didn't even stick to his own class schedule. They gave a quiz to everyone that wasn't on the schedule.

His lectures were very boring and he rushed through all of the content. The homework although it was doable it was extremely time consuming and it was all due the same day. He would sometimes even assign three chapters worth of homework at a time. You're better off taking another class, I personally don't think it's worth it.

Lectures get pretty boring as he reads over the slides, discussions are mandatory, and lots of heavy homework can take up a lot of hours depending on the number of concepts. Did not follow through with his own syllabus and increased the worth of the final exam right before the exam.

Does not curve any exams and has a cumulative one. Content heavy and based on memorization. Had to have knowledge of 15 different chapters to prepare for the exam. Does not give a study guide, expects you to come to class and write everything down instead of providing whatever he's reading off.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Doscher is an OK professor. He makes discussion mandatory and his tests are very difficult. His final is cumulative and his homeworks can take from 2 hours to 4 hours depending on the criteria.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: He rushes through chapters, in lectures which is very annoying as one time there were only 7 minutes of class left and he decided to start an entire new chapter, although we had already finished 2 that week.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Professor gives good lectures and is engaging during class. He provides a detailed syllabus and if you miss an assignment, he is usually pretty forgiving and works with you well. Overall, with this being a STEM class this guy is a pretty good instructor and knows his content well. Would Definitely Recommend him for those who need help learning bio.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Amazing lectures

comment: Attendance is taken once a week, but you never know what day it is. Very kind and always avaliable outside of class. Textbook is free. Study the pre-quizzes and post-quizzes as those are what her test are on. Her dog Kona is so cute too!
Great explanations and lectures

I loved this woman and her teaching strategies, easy to pass however, you still need to put in some effort. The textbook is free and very useful. If you study you will do great. I loved her dog, Kona!

Professor Kranzfelder is knowledgeable about everything that relates to her field, whixh is evolution and ecology. All three professors are well-organized about the lectures. If you're stuck on something, don't be afraid to go to office hours to ask for help.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. K was one of the best co-lecturers for BIO 001. She breaks down concepts nicely and is easy to understand. Read the book before lectures so that everything will be second nature. Her clicker questions help consolidate and narrow down what you should be studying. You will enjoy class! Go to office hours too, she's a great resource.

Really enthusiastic professor. Respected among other students. As long as you can keep up with the weekly homework, and quizzes, you will be good. Office hours are always fun time, not your usual monotone study time.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Great course!! I actually had lots of fun attending the lecture. Professor Kranzfelder made the lecture fun and enjoyable. You have to put in effort into this course, but as long as you attend lectures and do your work/study, you will be fine!! By the way, I took this course remotely! :)
Wonderful teacher, would highly recommend taking it. He goes over some very important stuff, and the class itself is not hard.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Workload is difficult & directions on assignments were hard to understand; found myself confused on what exactly he wanted you to turn in. Has no tolerance for life situations or mental health affecting your work, so he's not very understanding. Seems to be an okay grader as long as your work is done correctly, wouldn't take again, though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Great professors, as long as you TIME MANAGE writing your essays you should be good. Follow up the instructions given becomes very clear and straightforward. Would need to write a 2,000 word essay but fairly easy. No finals but enjoy this class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: He'll have you writing a minimum of 750 word papers every week

Follow the golden rules, submit 300 word essays about chapters each week. Must get the textbook to pass otherwise you'll fail. He will state " there is no wrong or right answer" but you must say "why" to your response.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Grading is fair as long as you follow his golden rules and keep up with the textbook readings. However, he does not believe that life circumstances/mental health has an impact on academic performance and they should be treated separately. This is a very bad take and it stigmatizes mental health issues. I dont recommend taking his class

His assignments are given ahead of time and the course guidelines give a clear idea as to how he will grade assignments. He is really organized and as long as you abide by the assignment descriptions and the golden rules he has, you will pass with an A.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you don't want to get bored in the class don't take it, be prepared to heard a nonstop lecture of about an hour and read the book on your own, the rest of the class you will be hearing people presenting about news articles, why? Unnecessarily, I would never take a class with her again. No extra credit offered, nothing at all just hw every week.
Having to learn a chapter a day is insane, no other summer course I have ever taken has been like this especially not an introduction course.

Shes nice. Her lecutures don't help as she basically simplifies everything without going into depth on the concept. This makes the homework difficult as you have to put in the extra work to teach yourself. The homework problems are also really complicated. But the homework doesnt really matter considering tests are worth more than half your grade.

She is very sweet and caring but her way of teaching is a bit different. Her lectures are pretty much useless since the homework problems are wayyy different than the practice problems. She is also very test heavy which shows no point of doing the homework assignments.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Shes really nice and the class isn't too hard some concepts are a bit hard to understand but once you do a few practice problems it becomes very simple. There is a lot of homework due however about four chapters of work a week.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: She seems sweet and has a great personality but her teaching format is really bad. I can't really understand her sometimes because of her heavy accent but I can look past it. She also is very unorganized I would AVOID taking her and take Jason Lee instead
Her lectures were asynchronous. 1 lecture video per chapter. The usual homework amount would be 2 chapters due at the end of every week on Cengage and tests were created by her on canvas.

Confusing instructions, shifts the goalpost often, difficult to work with.
This was my opinion of Prof Ryskin a few years back and happy to see the ratings confirm this

You will have five exams and they are all going to be 40 questions so good luck with that. The only good thing would be that you have 3 tempts to do it. 
When you get the writing assignment she will want you to write a lot 
Very little extra credit
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: She is a very difficult teacher to listen to and has super long slides that throw information at you. If you read the book it's even worse making it really hard to know what you'll be tested on. We were tested 5 times and we all struggled so she basically let us cheat to save our grades which made attendance in class meaningless. Had to pay $30 too

Ryskin is one of my most challenging professors throughout my first year. It's also pretty ridiculous how we have to spend money just so that we can get credit for attendance when we're already spending money for the textbook. Her expectations for writing assignments are unclear and exams go super in-depth. I'd suggest taking a different professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Ryskin is an excellent teacher.
Weekly 10 sometimes 20 page articles. Her quizzes felt almost impossible to complete because of how hard they were. I wouldn't recommend this class to anyone.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Difficult class. Articles dont match quizzes. Tough grader. Unclear instructions. Unhelpful.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He is not as bad as people make him out to be! He really does care about helping and it's a pretty easy class to pass with a good grade! He curves which is really helpful. Yes, he can be boring but the class overall is not bad. He really makes it so that if you want to pass you will :)

Bland lecture. He makes you read ahead and he "lectures" on the material. The lecture usually consists of him asking questions and having students answer. He usually doesn't teach the material, just goes over what it says on the slides. If a student asks a question, don't expect him to answer the question either.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Extremely boring class. The slides that he used were from the book's company. There was  A LOT of online homework from the book's website, which is a useful for studying for tests. The tests were hard and very specific, you really need to know the material.

I don't think he is as bad of a professor as everyone makes him out to be. I took his class over the summer and it was relatively easy. He makes sure everyone understands a topic before moving on, which is helpful for people who are too afraid to ask for help. He does go off on sailing tangents a lot, but he is funny and very personable.

He's a nice guy and he means well but he can't teach to save his life. Does not make his own slides and teaches straight out of the book with little to no additional information. All homework is in an annoying online webprogram. I did enjoy his sailing stories however.

Use the book! This professor truly does suck! He doesn't create his own presentations, which is probably one of the main reasons he can't explain them clearly. Homeworks are online through the connect website. He takes attendance every day. HE comes LATE to class EVERYday. He also spends at LEAST 15 min setting up/looking for his presentations.
The actual course was not difficult, one of the easiest classes material wise I have taken

By far it was one of the easiest BIO classes I've taken at UCM. I found it to be a mix of MATH015, a little PSY010, and a little BIO141, but it was pretty easy. The R coding assignments had the instructions clearly laid out and the answers for quizzes were usually very apparent after reading the slides once. Do the study guides, go to review OH!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She's a very sweet professor and is readily available for questions. As for the class itself it felt as if the material wasn't necessarily taught it was almost word for word fill in the blanks handouts from the book.

Emily is a kind, caring, individual. However, she's not that good of a professor; she's boring. She gives you handouts to fill in the blank(as notes) and I didn't find this method particularly useful when studying for exams. Her exams are hard, the FRQs go way more in-depth than what she covers in her notes. It's not a hard class to pass. No curve.

Great Class! Professor Reed is a very kind and knowledgeable individual. Her class was in no way intimidating or unnecessarily challenging. Lectures can be boring at times, but thankfully most of the information mentioned during lecture is provided in the notes she provides to you. Make sure to go over the notes and book to be successful in class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Speaks clearly in class. Always available for help.  Try not to add to many words to your answers; she takes out little points.  Overall, she's a great instructor.
prof garcia is hecka chill and gives super good feedback, you kind of just need to go to office hours to get over the steep learning curve
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: A genuine professor who cares for the education of his students. Course do the reading and assignments. But he's an understanding professor who is as free as the wind. Lectures always felt like a new experience. Incredibly engaging professor as well!

Humberto's a gem. He's so passionate about teaching and is willing to take students' considerations into the way he teaches his courses. This is my second time taking him, and I'm more than excited to take him again next semester.

A true facilitator of free thinking, Professor Garcia seeks to help students find their voice when it comes to reading a source text and extrapolating an argument. When it is done and the student shows the progress to the professor, instead of outright telling the student they are wrong and he, the professor, is right (Hakala) he attempts to help

Professor Garcia is one of the best teachers I've ever had. He changes his teaching style to best fit what the class wants while making us very interactive. You do need to read the material, he really loves having group discussions and pop quizzes from time to time. He really cares about his students and is very approachable.

Garcia is a really enthusiastic educator. Professors like him are a reminder that educators deserve a raise. He really puts a lot into his discussions, and most of the work is enjoyable. I would say get a head start on the papers and go to office hours and you'll be sure to get an A. I definitely could not foresee English being so enjoyable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Awesome class. Organized, current, and engaging are the three words I'd describe this class with.

Clear expectations, Professor is prepared and professional. Content is interesting. The hw and quizzes are consistently scheduled so I know how to prepare days before. I like the topics that we cover and how participation questions are relevant to what we are learning but also allows us a little freedom in terms of having our input involved as well
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: I regret taking this class. It is quiz heavy. This wouldn't be a problem if the quizzes were well written and based on the lectures, but this isn't the case. Quiz questions are worded weird and some are not even covered at all in class. He also doesn't answer any questions we ask in zoom chat. I would right more but I don't have any characters left
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: I really regret taking this professor. He assigns way too much homework. He assigns assignments before the semester even begins. There is no need to have 2 page papers weekly. If you can avoid this professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: The class grades consist of quizzes and participation so you have no room to mess up a lot. The lecture provides a lot of information so you should definitely go if not you probably wont do well on the quizzes. The participation also relies on lectures at least for us because it was taken during covid so it was online. Do well on quizzes!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Professor Ghosh is an amazing professor, he is very passionate about the courses he teaches. Make sure to read the material before attending class to get a better understanding of the lectures. There are weekly assignments that go along with lectures and reading material. Overall great instructor.

She is funny and sweet. Lags on uploading syllabus, hw,  etc. You have to attend lectures to not fall off in the course and the hw can be very time-consuming/hard even though there are like 4 problems. She didn't spend a lot of time on the coding & have assignments on it so it was basically self-study in that aspect. Wouldn't mind this course again
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She is a very difficult professor but she knows her stuff. Her exams are pretty tough but she explains them in proficient detail. Get ready to work if you take her, however you will learn the material.
This is  one of poor receive as a business owner  a fraud.
Always there to help

When the class did badly on a midterm, she took the questions that most of us got wrong and gave us an extra credit midterm. She tells jokes that make the class more interesting. She will stop and go back if somebody doesn't understand. This was one of the best classes that I have ever had. Definitely try to get her.
Definitely a worthwhile professor for any class.  Lectures are clear, and the material is connected to earlier subjects really well.  Overall one of my favorite professors at UC Merced.

I took her for Spark 010: Thinking with Data. I had no prior knowledge of coding beforehand, but she and the other instructor were very helpful and explained the content clearly. She is an amazing lecturer. For the class, you have plenty of enough time to finish any coursework, and the professor is more than happy to help if you need it.

She made Linear Analysis easy to learn and understand. Her lectures were always clear which made it easier for me to learn the difficult topics in Linear Analysis. She also accommodates for students and cares about them. There was three exams in the class and she gave the option to drop one of the exams, which was really cool. 10/10 Math professor
Highly recommended, specifically for Complex Analysis, the material is concise and clear. She is highly motivated and willing to provide the necessary help

This prof was amazing in my opinion. The only thing negative I could say about her is that she talks too fast lol.. but she is always excited to teach and makes classes interesting with her funny personality. She will help you succeed if you ask for help as usual. Like any prof she likes to see her students work hard. Good professor overall!
She cares about students and wants to see them not only succeed but learn the material.

Sindi is arguably one of the sweetest and most caring professors at UCM. Very approachable, and always makes herself available for her students. Her class is very organized and clear. Her sense of humor makes the class enjoyable. She is funny and very passionate.

The beginning of the semester starts off pretty heavy but the essays get easier throughout the semester. She gives amazing feedback. Is very picky when grading your essays. She mentions you can either get one of both textbooks for the course, says it's "mandatory" I have not used the textbook and did well, textbook is useful just for citations.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I would say this class was average overall. Prof. Block is nice and wants you to do well but she is kind of picky about random things in your papers. The workload was manageable just tedious. The papers had word requirements and she always gave a rubric on vaguely what she wanted in your paper. As long as you follow her feedback you should be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: The beginning of the semester starts off pretty heavy but the workload increasingly decreases throughout the semester. She gives amazing feedback and is pretty caring. She's slightly unavailable outside of class but as long as you show up everything should be fine. Overall a great teacher.

Dont get me wrong shes a very nice professor and she seems caring. However, no matter how hard I tried, I couldnt get an A. I guess thats just how writing is. You must conform to what the reader wants. I think she grades based on the individuals improvement. Just pay attention to what shes looking for and youll pass

I usually hate writing classes but I didn't mind this class. Professor Block is a fair grader and is clear on what she wants out of your papers so you know what you need to do to get an A. Basically the only assignments graded are papers and as long as you somewhat put effort into them the class is an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: I had Alex Block as my TA for Core, a general education class here. Admittedly I was not too happy to take this class, but it is required. At first I was unhappy to have quizzes in this class, seeing as none of the other Core Discussions seemed to have them, but in the end it was more points in the gradebook and they weren't too hard. She was nice.

I took him for 160 which is a modern lab, meaning there were a lot of formal lab reports. The first part of the course was presenting one of the experiments which we only worked on for 2 days which in my opinion wasn't enough time as we needed to set the experiments up. The second part was easy as it's relativistically common sense.
rating_tags: So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: He is great! If you get him for quantum, you've lucked out! I thought quantum would be hard but he does baby steps and ensures everything is explained & doesn't lose any one. Although he simplifies the math, the concepts get explained in depth so you understand the foundation of QM. He made quantum seem so simple and lecture was really fun too.

Dr. Scheibner is a hilarious professor. Cool dude with a cool attitude! You will pass this class so easily and learn so much from the easy to follow lectures. Before this class I considered changing majors but he is really inspirational. I don't know why there are so many bad reviews of him, he's great!

This is my worst class ever. Yes, the subject is challenging but Dr. Scheibner does not make it accessible. Lectures are long derivations without context or explanation. Constant dread among students and the average grade on exams is around a D. Lectures are confusing. Makes you feel bad for asking for help. He seems nice but you lose confidence.

PHYS105 is a world you need to prepare before going in. He will lecture from a sheet of note and expect you to know everything from your former physics class. If you missed some material in your previous physics class, prepare for defeats. However, on the good side. He is nice and things can be negotiated. make sure to tell him stuffs ahead of time
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He is a really nice person, but cannot teach as the most of the class doesn't understand his lectures nor what he is talking about. Expect to know Math 21 prior to taking this class, don't believe you can take Math 21 concurrently as he dives into later Math 21 concepts so early into the class. Tests are all free response with no equation sheets :(

His classes aren't always very organized and his expectations aren't crystal clear, but he gives a lot of freedom with what students want to write. He gives very thorough feedback and can really talk you through his comments if you go to his office hours. Great teacher who is very knowledgeable while also being very kind.

Robert is a very helpful teacher, and he gives really good explanations of how the answers come about. But at the same, he's not really clear about how he wants the essays since it's basically free-style. Sometimes he changes up his answer, and he may confuse you, but he's very nice in answering your questions. Also quizzes/tests are open notes :D

VERY awsome professor. He makes jokes in class, and you can tell that he is very very sharp. He will give many comments on your papers, even if your paper doesent need it, to let you know how to make your essay's even better. It is clear that he spends a lot of time with reading his students work.

Even in the worst class in the school, he can make it interesting.  8 am every Monday for 2 hours and it really isn't bad.  He's helpful with assignments and his discussions are interesting.  I was really not looking forward to this class, but its better than most sections

Very very smart professor. He knows his stuff and never makes you feel dumb even if you ask dumb questions. Very credible and helps you out a lot with essays. Personally one of the smartest people you will ever meet.
His comments on your essays are extremely useful, so take advantage of them.  You'll have to work a bit, but the class is managable.

I took this class as a sophomore and she was awesome! We honestly only had about 4 writing assignments. There was also a couple presentations but she grades very easy on those! This class is easy to pass if you show up to class, buy the books, and turn in your assignments on time. She is very helpful in office hours.

Be prepared to write a lot. You will have to write more than other Writing 10 classes but your writing style will improve. She is a nice person but her teaching style can be a bit confusing. Also make sure she signs your grade sheet so you have proof if she messes up your grades.

Useless teaching and worst person to go to for writing assistance. Rough Draft 1 grade is 80%, after consultation and comments and professor assisted revision, Rough Draft 2 grade is 70%, another revision with the help of the professor, Final Grade on paper is 60%...so if you want inconsistent grading based on her mood, go ahead and take her.

A syllabus is "contract" of the class policy, if you are going to provide details on your syllabus, I would expect you to be held accountable to what is stated on the Syllabus, and shame she calls herself a professor, or even an educator. Worst professor I have had. I would not wish any one taking a class with the lady! #NoHope

My recommendation is to NOT take a course with this professor, she if VERY unorganized, her grading is VERY inconsistent. I would turn in a paper and get an 80%, revise it with her help and her recommended corrections, turn it in for a regrade and I would get a score of a 70%. This shows how bad her grading is. Honestly the worst professor at UCM!

The theme of her class is very interesting and the books relate to actual situations which can be really interesting but she is not an easy grader. Make sure you work ahead in the class and bring all the materials required with you everyday or you won't get a participation grade for the day.

Bodo is one of the best professors on campus! His lectures are very entertaining and he's really enthusiastic about the subject. He adds humor to his lectures and makes math seem fun. He's really helpful and really easy to reach and replies back to your emails immediately!

I knew of Professor Bodo Winter's research before taking this class, and had the pleasure of seeing him give some talks before I decided to enroll. He is a fantastic public speaker, very engaging and thorough, and takes the time to include creative facts and information that get everyone thinking. I would love to take another class with him.

Great lecturer! Very intelligent and each of the lectures were quite interesting. Although I despise math, the class was amazing. No math background required or needed. I would take this class again in a heartbeat.

Bodo is a great lecturer he is very specific and he gives greats examples to ensure the class understands the concepts. He assigns assignments but they are all very interesting. Bodo encourages participation  and to question him and be skeptical about what we are learning. His class was one of my favorites because i was always learning new things.

Bodo is an excellent professor. He's funny and his lectures are very informative and interesting. I took his mathematical cognition class, which would be a relatively boring topic if taught without the enthusiasm that Bodo puts into his lectures. He's very thoughtful towards his students and very approachable! You got to work for your grade though!
Bodo Winter was the BEST instructor I have had. He makes things crystal clear, homework assignments aren't too difficult but they keep you engaged, and readings are a must.
The class overall was alright. I didn't like the form of teaching Professor Shih used. I would get so lost in her lectures and discussions didn't help much either.
The quizzes make or break your grade so study for those. Especially for the midterm and final. Was a fun class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Shih was great. Shes very quirky and was always enthusiastic and seemed happy to be there and happy to teach. There are quizzes each week at the beginning of lecture, and those can be tough, but other than that, the class was pretty easy.

This was not an easy class, you really had to work for it which made it rewarding in the end. Lectures are fun and interesting, but the midterm and final are very difficult. The semester-long project was hard; the "this is fine" meme sums up the project. In the end, you truly understand the material given how intensive the class was.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Considering COGS 5 is not a requirement for any major, Stephanie makes the class quite stressful with weekly quizzes whose averages are around 60%. Lectures are only an hour and fifteen minutes but they feel a lot longer as the professor  is not really funny and the information is just thrown at you with little interaction. DONT TAKE COGS 5.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures are only an hour and 15 minutes long, but a lot of info is given. Sit close to the front because she writes out all her notes on the whiteboard. She is a very quirky professor who at times may come off as boring, but the material is really interesting. Be prepared for weekly quizzes.

She is kind, helpful, & motherly. She will always tell you you're doing great if you try your hardest, even if you mess up. She answers questions & is available; she gives her phone number on the first day of class so you can also contact her. She makes class engaging, although there is much group work & calling on people in class. 100% recommend ♡

Madame Guidone is simply an amazing professor. Her grading system is designed to allow you a good grade through various assignments, and a few off-days won't bomb your grade. She is easy-going after tests, and gives you time to recharge for the next set of French. (Also provided croissants, yum). Overall, she made learning French a fun experience!
Great!

Absolutely loved taking Guidone. She is an amazing teacher, very caring and understanding. Her teaching style is great for learning a new language. She gives multiple quizzes to ensure you are caught up with the vocab but they do not impact your grade. Grading is straightforward. No reason you do not pass the class with a B or better.

I took Madame Guidone my first and second semester of college for French 1 and 2. I was scared coming into the class to learn french but she made it so clear and understands that we are at a kindergarten level. Her exams and oral midterms are straightforward and you expect what to see on exams. She also gives extra credit and drops your lowest exam

Madame is very nice, funny, and not intimidating. The book is very clear and useful. What makes this class very interesting is that she teaches about French culture and she even brings french foods to class. With every chapter in the book, a test will follow but don't worry bc her lectures review over confusing aspects of the language.

Took his stats class Fall 2020. He was really understanding of any extenuating circumstances people had. Made class enjoyable, thoroughly explained everything, and frequently asked the class if they had any questions. Exams were open-book. Study guides + study sessions were beneficial. Fair amount of assignments. You can tell he really cares!

This class was one of my favorites! I was nervous about taking it but Prof Eaton was very helpful, patient, & ALWAYS asked if we understood the material. Very understanding especially during COVIDhe granted extensions and shortened exams. All 3 tests are open-note and the study guide is very similar to the exam! Hands down one of the best profs!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Always asked if we understood things and if we didn't, he wouldn't mind reteaching and always available for additional help or questions outside of class time.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He doesn't really do much teaching. The class was a lot harder than it actually needed to be. I don't recommend taking him, he was condescending. He also makes you do a lot of group work and calls on people at random.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He's cool but does not really explain the material well. His grading is very easy and all the exams are open notes!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria
