comment:
Dope professor and she hella chill too.

On god bruh if you mess up on something, she'll guide you through it again with better clarity.

Professor Gunn was genuinely a really cool professor, and she really cared for students and what they were going through. You definitely need to go to class, but she's very accessible when it comes to questions and gives us her office hours. 10/10 would take another of her classes.

Ethics in Tech is a new subject within the discipline and Dr. Gunn, specializing in epistemology and ethics, teaches it extraordinarily well. Filter bubbles, biases in development, automated decision processes, privacy, and mass surveillance are all topics discussed at length and prompt students to investigate the world in which they're situated.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I have an AA in philosophy and have studied under many philosophers but none parallel the passion and pedagogical approach Dr. Gunn employs. By assigning canonical texts and encouraging student engagement on material in-class, her approach is a step above the rest, suitable for majors, non-majors, and those interested in graduate studies.

If you are intrigued to know why ethics is important in our modern world, then this is the class you want to be in. She elaborates the different concepts surrounding ethics and technology and will get you thinking about it. If you don't understand something she will help you. Expect to write weekly journals of 500 words min each.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Honestly one of the best professors at UCM. Just do the readings and follow his clear instructions. If you put in the work you will succeed. His lectures are really informative and he always has time for every question/ comment!

comment: I have had Professor Thompson twice, one for Globalization Anthropology and Economic Anthropology. . He is very caring and takes the time to give you good feedback on papers.  The quizzes are based on the concepts of the readings so it is required. Overall he is a great professor and his lecture are always interesting but there are dense readings.

Best professor hands down, very down to earth, extremely knowledgeable and super caring of his students. The class itself was incredibly interesting and all information provided during lecture was relevant and on quizzes or exams. Super cool class and professor!

Professor Thompson and his Anthropology 001 staff are very understanding as well as accessible. Great professor, I would take his class again. As long as you take notes, you will pass. Not much homework, only readings. he's a professor that lets the students talk about the lecture and their beliefs. Not much of a workload. Exams pretty easy if you read the readings that are assigned

comment: keeps blaming bad performance of students on their background and other professors. Can be quite rude during office hours.

Professor Wan is a cool guy who genuinely wants his students to pass. Unfortunately, he teaches Vector Calculus, and writes extremely difficult tests. Between three midterms and a final, tests make up 66% of your overall grade. The class average was in the 40s for all three midterms.
Professor Wan is good, this is just an extremely difficult class.

Dr. Wan emphasizes that he wants us all to pass while acknowledging the class is very difficult. He tries to answer questions when it's not cutting on time (lecture is 50 mins) and gives "reflection" assignments on low average-score midterms (25% XC on exam), and he curves. 3 midterms. Final is worth 36%. Weekly quizzes in discussion, hw is graded.
Massive curve

Professor Wan is not as hard as people say. This was his first time teaching at UC Merced so I would understand why some people view it as tough, however he is teaching Calculus 3 which is a hard subject. He is a bit mean when you ask questions, however make sure you study ALOT before his exams as they are tough. Average on midterms was a 30%.

I had him for phil 126 and he's an understanding professor. He just assigns 4 essays, and it very open to feedback about his rubric. Just read his essay rubric really carefully as he is really picky about your premises and conclusions.

comment: He's an okay professor. Gives a lot of essays and wants participation all the time. Easy class but has a lot of readings.

comment: The weekly quizzes were really confusing and they (they/them pronouns) were not able to explain or be clear. comment: Very informed and reasonable.

Do not take this class unless you are absolutely sure that you will be able to read comprehensive papers, which can be very complex. Pick a different class that meets the requirments don't take his

If you don't understand something, show up to his office hours or email him. He is very responsive with his emails.

Possibly one of the greatest professors I've met.

Exams were tough for me but hes very willing to curve if he notices a trend with the class, and gives study guides. Seems really passionate about what he teaching. comment: This was Dr. Holbrook's first semester teaching at the University, let me start by saying he is a Caring, Hilarious and Helpful professor. The class itself is tough.. comment: Cancels classes frequently and didn't talk much about assignments when they were almost due, but he is a very passionate and interesting professor. Very good professor and will definitely take a class with him. He uses a lot of examples to clarify the material and is also really passionate about what he's teaching.

Excellent professor with a lot of visual examples to understand the material. There is a lot of reading in the class, but I mean, this is a University. The material and the class overall is easy to pass if you stay on top of your game and stay responsible.

Tests aren't bad as long as you read, teacher is very enthusiastic however throws a lot of information your way. If you're lost of behind he is more than willing to help, just show up at his office hours.

Great Professor! He is really passionate about literature, participating in his class is easy and not forced. He throws out jokes, and puts on movies or plays to watch. comment: The best professor in Chemistry 10 at El Camino. I recommend everyone.

What I liked most about this course instructor is that he goes into detail on why some reactions occur the way they do. This is because many times professors only give you examples but don't explain the background so after some time you forget why these reactions happens.

I liked how the course was organized in a manner that was simple to learn where questions were asked and responded to. Assigned material was straightforward and up to us to make sure we kept up with the material. Also was helped with any type of question asked when I needed it. Explained things in a easy to understand way, made things clear.

Professor Alvarez is awesome. She is very good at explaining assignments and helps whenever needed. Really great informative class!

Professor made the class remote. For the material she taught, it felt like it wouldve been better in person bc of how dense it was. Only has 2 assignments, weekly quizzes (4 qs), a short presentation, and a research paper. If you put the effort, should be an easy A.

Professor does not input grades until the last week of semester. Locks grades and will only show what if grades. Tried to contact and ask questions regarding my grades, but said it was too late to do anything since she had already locked them the day they were due.

she is very helpful when it comes to explaining how the problems are solved, and will have an affect on how well you do in the class. I wouldnt have passed if it wasnt for her

comment: Professor Sigmon is a nice guy. However, lectures are boring, and it's difficult to hear him half the time. The essential thing to focus on is to study for the two exams: midterm and final. Good luck!

He is such a sweet soul! He is so knowledgable and really loves to teach, he will answer any and all questions you have and is open to talk in office hours about pretty much anything. He really is one of my favorite professors yet.

comment: There is homework assignments and quiz's scattered through out the semester but not too many, its manageable. The quizs are taken online and timed. Show up listen take notes read the textbook its not hard really. Its lecture and lab he gives no homework so just show up and do it. comment: Out of all my professors for this semester, she was my favorite. Very rude and non approachable. She would often criticize you for not understanding something, when maybe it was her teaching style.

She really is as bad as everyone says she is. You do have to do the work and prove you deserve a good grade, but the way she goes about treating students and her attitude isnt good. comment: shes just.. so rude and expects you to know everything. Do not take her if she doesn't have a TA or else she will be grading it and she is the most obnoxious and difficult grader there is. 0/10

comment:
Yes you are a great professor and all, until I saw your recent article in Scientific American and discovered your website. 
You are a scientist, and you teach us to follow the evidence!!
In that case, you should have no issue with the UAPDA Schumer amendment passed, because it will surely give us the information publicly for us to judge it fairly.

I decided to retake anatomy and chose Professor Cayetano. Best decision I ever made. He actually cares about his students and makes everything clear and simple. Only assignments are answering questions and exams every other week. Just watch the lectures study and you will for sure pass! I definitely recommend him best Professor I've ever had!

This was the best class I have ever taken. A lot of the assignments were extra credit or no credit-but not doing them seriously hurts. His assignments generally take 1-2 hours, but the knowledge sticks. Read the books, do the assignments, and take quizzes. Most important: watch his lectures. Hes a fantastic teacher, and made anatomy understandable

Professor Cayetano was a great professor. He was very laid back and lenient with grades. Attendance was important because it counted towards your grade. The lectures lasted at most 40 minutes. The class does get boring from time to time but it was an interesting class overall.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He was really laid back gave like maybe 5 extra credit assignments. Show up and you recieve points. All quizzes are online and at home and super easy. Lectures were only 20-30 minutes long and he only took the entire class time when he was reviewing for the final. Review guides are notes for the entire year. Labs took me half an hour to complete.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Luis is a great professor, but the course can be boring. There is a lot of information given to you each lecture and it is overwhelming. Tests are difficult.
Avoid this Person!!!!!!!
Not worth the money. Take other courses to gain real knowledge.

Nice professor. Very caring and lenient to his students. Helped relieve stress over this class. Generally speaking, learned more from his slides and other students than from the professor himself. However, he always made himself available for help.
Goated with the sauce. W
He's compassionate and doesn't hold having brain dead group members against you. Exams are most important so study the homework and get at least 60% on each to not have to worry

comment: You learn nothing in this class. Lectures are copied from Internet.

(Course PSY 200A) Fan is a nice person. However, for those who do not have a statistical background, it did feel a bit rushed to me. Fan does a good job of explaining concepts, but sometimes they were a bit esoteric for me. She also made comments that were a bit patronizing and demeaning, which unmotivated me to learning the material.

Fan Jia was great! She uses slides but these slides are posted before the lecture. They are also pretty long. I really liked that she used in-class assignments, which we went over them after. The exams are a bit hard but studying the content a lot should be easy. She gave extra credit toward the end of the semester!

Great professor. I thought my grade was going to drop, but she gave us up to 20 points extra credit which raised my grade 5%, which let me have a comfortable barrier for the final. The concepts can seem confusing at first so I do suggest taking the time to practice outside of class. The exams can be tough as well.

Jia is a sweet Professor, she cares about her students and doesnt assign extensive amounts of homework. However, her lecture slides are long and its hard to write down everything shes typing because she goes fast. I recommend you take notes before lecture if possible. Lectures are a bit boring, she has in class hw assignments.

I loved professor Jia. She really cares about her students and she teaches the material in a way that makes it easy to understand. She gives great example problems and posts all powerpoints online. She also allows you to use a full sheet of notes on all exams!
Lectures are long but she covers the topics needed really well and provides a lot of examples. The ICA also is the reason to attend lectures for participation. Easy stats class.

comment: Very interesting and intelligent. He's mildly boring but that's ok. No essays, one online exam, and some group projects. One of my favorite professors tbh. comment: Dr. Bradman has a genuine passion for his work and you can see it clearly in his lectures. comment: He's a passionate teacher. He knows his information and is very involved with his projects and class. However, his class tends to get long and boring since he lectures 90% of the time. The rest are just group and individual presentation. Good thing about him is that he brings fruits to class and his test are open book. An easy, but boring class.

Great professor, very accommodating. 10-page paper final is the hardest thing about this class, but he gave us weeks to do it. Midterms were changed to debates but that is subject to change because this class is very new. Assignments are very easy. TA David Snyder is amazing, go to him for help in the paper final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Try to see through his small stature and you'll grow to appreciate him. There is a lot to this man. You rarely see a professor so passionate about his work. He moved here from UC Berkeley because he believes in this program. It is easy to get good grades on any writing assignment, despite a 10-page paper. One of the few good ones here at UCM.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Lectures very verbose without any actual substance. Questions are very vague never straightforward. When this was brought up justified it by saying that he means this and we should remember that for future reference. Talks about research every chance he gets. Definitely would never take this course again. Not worth ruining my mental health.

Absolutely loved Prof Paine. He helped me out so much and was really understanding about my life outside of class. He's a great professor and loves what he teaches. You can also tell he cares about students. The only thing that could be improved in lecture is his timing with the slides. A lot of the times he can go through them a little too quick.

Overall Professor Paine is a very good professor, He appears somewhat shy sometimes but he does know what he is doing and covers material well and helps his students as much as possible. He does post his lecture slides after every class and provides a exam-review before each exam which has been helpful. He's also very easy to talk to.

Lectures can feel heavy, especially because he tends to talk the whole time. Slides are posted in files, but attendance is highly encouraged if you want to better to understand the material. He seems very shy, but you can tell he knows what he's talking about and is very understanding.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: I really enjoyed learning from this professor. I'm currently taking 2 classes with him this semester (SOC 15 and SOC 20), and I have taken another one in the past (soc of work). He is new so he is still getting used to teaching but overall, he was a great professor, and he knows what he's talking about.

Very mono toned & goes thourgh like 30 slides every lecture & keeps every slide up for like 10 seconds. pretty much he talks a lot during lecture & goes through up to 40 slides a day i think its just too much info for 1 hour plus his notes are very unorganized. Your better off just sitting in lecture & listening rather than taking notes.

This was his first semester teaching so you can kinda tell he isnt sure of himself yet. He reads the lecture slides really fast and you barley have time to write anything down. Also this is more of a history class than a sociology class so beware. it was easy esp since exams are open note and we're given the whole class time to complete.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor cares for what he teaches, lectures consist of interesting material but can feel lengthy, especially as an early am class. 3 noncumulative open note exams, go to lecture & exam reviews and you'll do good.

She was a great professor at UCM. She was organized with her class lectures and discussions. Student expectations were clearly stated and she was always there to help a student with their questions. I learned a great deal about Africa, the role of Colonialism, and better writing. I am sure that her current students are very fortunate to have her.
Professor Gleason was one of the best professors I have ever had. She is crazy passionate about her subject and her lectures are great. She keeps every class interesting.
Prof. Gleason is by far one of the best professors of history I had in UCM. Unfortunately she is no longer a professor there. She was helpful, insightful and was always on top of her game.
Mrs. Gleason is a great lecturer and her expertise on Africa is evident in the lectures. She is also very helpful in office hours. I greatly recommend this class.

Reading is typically light (a few chapters online, etc.) and covered in lecture. Papersquizzes were minimal, with no group projects. As a history major, I learned a lot in her class and greatly enjoyed it; Prof. Gleason's research was in Africa, so she has a lot of knowledge to share that you won't find in a Western-narrative history class.

I had Prof. Gleason for Decolonization. Her lectures were clear, organized,  and well presented. Assignments were clear and she would provide clarification if requested. It was important to come to class having read the assigned material for discussion. Participation does matter. Prof. Gleason is a fair grader. A student earns their grade.

Took his class for Adv. writing. Was expecting another boring writing class but he was very engaging. Gave great tips for not only writing, but reading and critical thinking. He is also very helpful at office hours. A real smart, down to earth kinda guy. Tough grader but he only wants you to do better. Follow his guidelines and you will do well.
I love him!

He is very intelligent and wants you to do well. He will do anything to help you, you just have to ask. He is chill and relaxed but he means what he says. Follow the syllabus, do the reading and put effort in it will pay off.  But don't let his cute smile or perfect hair distract you too much :)

He wants you to do well and will give you help if you ask for it. He is very chill but sticks to his rules. Follow his Syllabus and you're Golden. He is overall an intelligent and nice professor to look at.

Nick is an amazing teacher. Very funny. I dislike writing because I simply am not good at it. But he was extremely helpful and very open-minded towards the type of papers you want to write. Don't underestimate his gradings. They're TOUGH!!! He also give lots of feedbacks for improvements though. Beware of his smile ;)
Great professor, makes class interesting and fun, bring books to class!!!
Extremely articulate and accurate in lectures. Best lecturer I have ever had in mathematics.

He was my discussion instructor and he made math seem pretty easy. If you asked him a question he will answer it and show you how to do it. He also is very funny when he is explaining how to solve a problem.
Good teacher, very easy TA. Quiz every week so don't skip class.
Lectures are hilarious, very quirky. makes learning very easy, simplies the hardest concepts, makes it great.   LOVES THE CLASSROOM LIKE ANTARCTICA SO BRING A JACKET

Greg was my TA for my Numerical Analysis Class and though my professor was difficult I was able to pass due to Greg. He always made himself available during the week for office hours and have great feedback on old exam and homework problems. He was also very good with his explanations in ways the average person could comprehend. Would recommend!

Professor Hogan is a great guy. He's pretty quirky but all in all a good professor. Occasionally he will mess up but that happens to everyone.. and sometimes he takes a long time to grade quizzes or tests. But despite that he's a great professor and I enjoyed his class.

I had Dr. Reyes for BIO 12 this summer; she was an amazing professor. Attendance was mandatory but included extra credit points in each lecture, she was also very kind and easy to reach out to outside of class hours. 
Overall 10/10 W professor

I had Professor Sanchez-Reyes for BIO 012, overall an amazing professor. Very caring and kind. Her lectures were interesting and engaging. She graded fairly easily and gave great feedback. Every lecture she would offer extra credit and extra credit to make up for problems missed on any exams. We need more understanding professors like her!

Professor Luna is probably the best professor I have ever had she's so patient and nice I took sustainability science class with her and her teaching style was fun and engaging. We had in-lecture activities which were easy. There is a good amount of homework assignments and discussion activities but as long as you do the work you will pass for sure
In my opinion, her class is really easy and she offered a zoom alternative for lectures. You also don't have to be in the classroom to take her exams. If you just do the work you'll pass easily
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Luna is a great professor. Lot's of homework assignments but overall easy homework. She is super sweet and cares about biology but tends to talk very low so hearing her is kinda hard. overall nice professor.

I took her bio 005: concepts of living cells. The work is fairly easy (as long as you did it which I clearly did not ). The professor is very nice and helpful! there is good amount of assignments but it is not a class you worry about! She does have actives to complete during lectures as well as participation quizzes but nothing to hard!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment:
She is the sweetest as long as you turn in your assignments you will receive an A, there is no quizzes/final exam, u basically grade yourself since u can choose what your final grade is. She is very understanding 
& is not like those other professors that will grade u based on the quality of your paper she actually wants u to understand the reading

Professor Koehler was amazing!  She is very caring, and her Spark 001 class was very entertaining.  As long as you do the work, it is an easy A.  You have one group project in this class, but no tests.

Such a positive and happy professor, her laugh cracks me up. Prison Literacy spark class, very interesting class to take with her, she makes sure that you understand the material before moving on. Is very lenient if you have a specific reason. You decide your own grade in this class so if you keep up with work you are guaranteed an A.

Dr. Koehler is amazing and truly cares about her students, that does not mean she isn't a tough grader or her class will be easy. Be ready to read and write alot! Overall, she is a great professor and cares about her students. FYI, took her during the COVID-19 outbreak and wish I would have had her for normal session.
Does not give good feedback, so you won't be sure where to improve your papers. Mostly busy work in class. No extra credit.
Professor Koehler was awesome. She was super engaged in her class discussions and class content was interesting.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Llach was great! His syllabus was easy to follow and he was not a hard grader but rather wanted students to actually learn something. His bigger assignments were fun and he provided great feedback. He is accessible outside of class and extremely understanding. I took his summer class for CRES 072B 01/GASP 072B 01.

The lectures were never really prepared for and this course definitely did not pass the vibe check. Its not a hard course by any means, but the professor has standards without letting you know what they are?
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Most of the time me and my classmate had no idea what was going on. The class is messy, clumsy, and doesn't make sense. He set a day aside for 1 on 1 talks. Called me in to tell me he's going to give me a bad grade because I didn't buy a splitter cable or download an app that could be used on browser. I can't recall any cool songs we played either

Great teacher, i wad able to step out ny comfort zone and met a lot of great people in his class and made some great friends with similar music interests. Theres a presentation you have to fo at the end of the semester absolutely loved it i got to listen to some great creations and the teacher introduced us to many great songs. Great teacher overal

This professor did not teach anything, in my opinion. He'd try to demonstrate how to do some things for our projects but in the end, no one in my class knew what to do; very pointless. He only graded 10 assignments for the entire semester. Be prepared for a final project that'll require you to know how to do everything he was supposed to teach.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Attendance is graded by a sign in sheet; do with that what you will. Projects are really important as they are the only assignments but also graded on effort and have nothing to do with the lectures. His lectures are interesting to some people but I wouldn't say you need to hear them to pass. Be prepared to perform songs for the class!

He would post a quiz to make sure you understood what he was talking about last class. His lectures do get boring but other than that the information given is decently interesting. It does feel like Google may help with some answers to the quiz questions but not all of them.

Very knowledgable and willing to answer questions. The final assignment was based on small assignments done throughout the course of the semester, so there wasn't much work to do in the end. His lectures were entertaining, though he often ran out of time and had to keep people for a few minutes after class.

James is very dedicated to ME and knows what he's talking about. He has experience in the field and accurately answers any questions you ask. Since the Intro to ME class is new for Fall 2021, he was a little all over the place when teaching. Sit in the front b/c his writing is small on the whiteboard at times.

To preface, this professor is very willing to teach and very helpful. His lectures consist of reading off of slides copied off of the textbook making lecture somewhat very boring. He does not work through any problems and instead gives theoretical examples that is often confusing to understand in terms of applying homework problems.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: The class isn't hard at first but gets intense. Honestly sometimes lecture is boring but the concepts are cool. He was always willing to help. Very nice person. Tests are long but curved. If you actually listen you'll learn a lot and be amazed how you can solve complicated problems. Transition to online was okay. Midterm over 5 days was nice haha.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Basically rewrites the book on the board. No clear examples during lecture. No structure to lecture. Sidetracks a lot. You teach yourself or you wont pass. He does highlight the equations you need but thats it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: One of the best Professors in the school of engineering. She displays enthusiasm and is very knowledgeable.
I took the python class with Prof.Shrinivasan. Her teaching is phenomenal and she is always positive and polite with her s

Prof.Shrinivasan's classes are clear, informative and helpful. She is very knowledgeable and knows what's she talking about. Accessible outside of class for answering questions. Cares for her students. Looks for interesting ways to engage her students in the material. Overall, highly recommend her classes if you are curious to learn and grow.
Enjoyed the class. Very enthusiastic and could see her passion for teaching. Had an interactive in person coding lectures and related fun real life applications.
The GOAT. Prof.Shrinivasan is one of the best in school of engineering. Very knowledgeable and caring.

Great professor, very clearly articulates what she wants you to learn and why its important to your major. Her course is only as hard as you make it. Just study her material, understand her work , attend lectures and do her homework; I promise you you'll learn the material and do well. Overall great, and highly recommend her
Clear lectures. Enthusiastic. Very knowledgeable and knows what she is talking about. I took various classes with this instructor and she taught them all very well.

Prof.Shrinivasan is an amazing instructor. I enjoyed her classes and learnt a great deal. She cares for her students and is available to answer questions. She provides real life applications for the concepts covered in class that makes the class more interesting. I enjoyed her teaching style. Had clear grading criteria, clear communication.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Gonzalez is an okay professor and the TAs seemed nice. The course was interesting, but she drags out the lectures. The class is composed of 4 midterms, 2 projects, a quiz every week, and participation points. She sometimes seems unapproachable and annoyed. She is very respectful to other views and controversial topics. Grading was fair.

The comments that lectures can be boring are kinda true. Lectures feel unnecessarily long and drawn out. They are very information heavy and include long, monotonous videos. She assign much homework besides the essays and weekly quizzes. For success, you should go through the book and learn where certain information is available for the exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures were extremely boring to begin with even though the material was interesting. Class wasn't very active so you mostly sat and listened to her talk. Herself and the TAs would give you different information when it came to assignments so a lot of miscommunication. I hope to never take a class with her again.
Her directions are never clear. Mind as well go to the TAs to clear everything up. Although you can use your book for the test. There is that.

Show up to class you get participation points. Extra Credit is given in each midterm so don't worry if you mess up a midterm. You can use your book in midterms. Instructions for projects aren't always the clearest but the TA's are amazing to help you with certain projects.

Attend lecture, you get points if you show up to lecture. You can use your book on your midterms  so you need to study where all the information is at. You write an essay on about 1 of 3 possible books you read. A Final that consist of an essay. You also get a group project

If any questions, this professor is willing to answer them after class or over the email provided. This professor can be accommodating to certain things. Just be prepared to read in order to prepare for class and understand material. Also, prepare well for exams! Tips and office hours offered.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor for both Bio 011 and Bio 012. The class is pretty easy as long as you do the homework. Most of the midterms are based on the homework and the quizzes. She's also the more interesting professor in the group of professors that teach.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Findlater is a passionate professor! I had her BIO 043 Conservation Bio class and I LOVED IT! She had me inspired and I found fun in doing assigned work. What she gives out is engaging and the discussion classes are chill, in my opinion. The lectures are interesting as she makes it so. I would absolutely take her class again!

Pretty good professor. Had Prof. Findlater for BIO011 and her lecture method makes learning fairly easy if you work on it outside of class. I'll say though she teaches genetics and punnet squares but refuses to use male and female in a bio class. Made it a little difficult to learn that way but she is amazing nonetheless. Would recommend taking.
Findlater was super cool and gives really good lectures. All in all, one of the better biology professors I've had.
Good professor
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment:
Structured like a high school course. 
4 at-home assignments a week, graphic organizers or paragraph summaries due at the end of class. More busywork than learning. Free textbook though, which I used a lot!
He is sooo funny. Makes class very interesting. Can be boring sometimes but if you pay attention and participate in class, it will go fairly quickly
Boring....
No Comments
very intereseting excersizes
No Comments

Professor Van Dyke is a really awesome professor. She is caring and is accessible outside of class. She has interactive lectures where she expects students to participate and engage in class. Participate as it's part of you participation grade. Make sure you review the reading prior to class and keep up with them as she expects you to know readings
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: An alright teacher. She's pretty nice and funny during lectures but tends to go on tantrums at times. For Social Theory be prepared to read A LOT. She assigns many pages per class and it can be hard to manage if you have other classes that also have a large reading load. Go to class and pay attention, take notes and you should be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Professor Van Dyke is the best sociology professor at UC Merced. She uses power-points, writes down notes on the board, brings in articles related to class materials and uses videos and movies. She is very charismatic and helpful. You can tell she loves teaching. Don't be late to her class! Do the work and you'll do fine!
she doesnt post her slides but as long as you go to class the tests are super easy and she is very entertaining
Most boring class ever. Tries to stretch a 3 page reading into a 75 minute discussion. Easy, but seek other professors.
Amazing Professor I would definitely recommend. Super kind. Attendance not mandatory and he posts the lecture slides. Quizzes during discussions which are not too hard.
He is a pretty chill professor. The class is light work. The Delta math problems are helpful, but can be a bit tedious. He is pretty funny too. He does use ChatGPT during lectures, but it is helpful.
W Proffesor

You can tell that he actually cares about your learning and will take to any feedback positively. In our class (which was fairly small) he made an effort to learn everyone's name. Very chill and all around a cool guy- glad I took this class with him.

He was one of my instructors for spark 010; Thinking with Data. I had no prior knowledge of coding beforehand but he along with the other instructor were very helpful. The work is very straightforward, attendance is graded. For the midterm and final they are projects. You have plenty enough time to finish coursework during lecture.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Adrien was my TA for Math 011 a few semesters ago! He is super cool and always willing to help!

Blois was one of the co-lectures for BIO 1. She's kind and spends the whole lecture talking so it gets kind of boring. Read the book well! Her lectures don't really prepare you well for her quizzes/midterms, the book and office hours will help. Her section wasn't super hard but she does throw in trick questions so make sure you know your content.

She assigns way to much homework for the week, about 7-10 pages when she was profesor for Biology. Her lectures are interesting, although they can get boring because she just lectures throughout the whole 50 minutes, with barley any participation. Other professors made us do activities which made us stay interested in their lectures but she did not
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Blois was a pretty good professor. She's nice and willing to help you with the course material or with questions. Take time to study for the midterms as they're critical to your grade. The class is mostly a lot of facts and memorization. Also, she can be picky about free response questions on the homework and midterms, so be detailed.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Do NOT purchase the book, it is NOT necessary at all. The midterms and final are solely based on lectures. Focus on memorization in this course. Go to office hours, especially for homework and field trip report help.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Overall Blois was a great professor. Super nice and willing to meet at office hours. I would suggest studying a least a week in advance for midterms since the majority of the class was based off lecture material. Don't bother buying the book, complete waste of money didn't help nor was it actually mandatory for the class like she said it was.
Not too bad but also not too great at explaining things. Lab reports.

He is a great professor his only downfall is that sometimes he assumes we understand things because he understands them. He covered a lot of material but he did it in a way where I felt like I go something from each topic. Overall really great professor.
One of the best physics professors at UC Merced.

He is an awesome professor that really inspired me in lecture. At times the subjects are extremely difficult to grasp. All in all, I don't think anyone could've taught it better. He is dedicated to helping you learn and he even posted explanations to stuff he didn't know in lecture. He's a quick grader and also pretty funny at times.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I have never had lectures this confusing. He literary reads from the slides and sometimes derives equations that according to him we do not need to know.

Obviously cares about what he is teaching but not so much his class. He is incredibly difficult to reach and he repeats himself often. If you are looking for an easy A, this class is great, but not if you want to figure out if CogSci is for you. Often cancels a class or just uses a 60-question Kahoot to take up class time.

He was not specific about any grading policies. I was going through a family emergency but he just disregarded that fact when I emailed him for accommodations. Also when I got 79.97% he rounded my score down instead of rounding up to a 80%..
overall lectures and the courses are ok, but kind of difficult to get alone with, taking too long to replay students' email. His tests are all pretty easy though.

Dr. Croom loves cognitive science especially when it comes to linguistics. He has a crazy passion for it. He is a very laid back teacher and presents his lectures for you to know the information now but also to help you prepare for future research writing. He is very encouraging and understanding definitely an optimist.

Mathematical cognition over the summer. One quiz a week (six in total; open book/note/everything; untimed), one "quiz pass" (lowest score becomes 100%), one paper. Interesting lectures! Can be hard to power through though because of the length of the classes. But still a solid choice for an instructor. Ask about his research + his dog Loki!
Definitely knows his field, taught his own research in a very fascinating way. Inspiration for future researchers!

Does not know how to teach the course of the material. It seems he circles around students questions in which leaves people unclear. Needs improvement on teaching strategies for this material. Claimed to never taught this course and it is very obvious. He needs to show more practical examples instead of slides.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Overall he was a good professor. Made Math 24 pretty easy to understand. He is also very fair with grading, dropping one of the three midterms. Also, there is no final. A big part for my success in this class is also due to my TA, Andrew, who really did well explaining all the concepts and doing various examples as well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Nice teacher who really wants you to grasp the material well. He can be difficult to understand in lecture since he tends to jump around topics when teaching. The book we use doesnt teach well, but the hw problems are helpful. Tests can get very specific with T/F questions that require you to understand specific concepts. Hes a great professor.
No Comments
Very interesting and into his work. Extremely helpful.

Honestly I learned nothing about c++ from this guy, he's cool and everything but not a good teacher. I've learned more about C++ from online tutorials than I have from him. He just doesn't explain everything thoroughly enough and doesn't give you enough code examples on the lectures and you have to figure out how to do everything in the labs.

He's a funny guy, but honestly doesn't teach well on C++. He doesn't really know how to teach good. He just doesn't explain everything on C++ throughouly and well enough and doesn't give enough code examples or anything. I didn't learn much about C++ from him. Honestly, I've learned more about C++ from online tutorials than from him.Tests were ok.

Cool guy, but when it comes to teaching, he isn't the best. He forgets to put up necessary materials for lab unless he is personally reminded several times. Relies on google to teach us foundations of CS. Some of his lectures a good, some bad. Overall, you have no choice but to stick with this professor for CSE30/31.

This guy's cool, but his teaching is not that good. He hardly gives you any code examples on lectures and on labs. You pretty much have to figure things out on your own and the only problem with that is that you won't know what to look for 90% of the time if you don't have any experience with C++. His tests are ok, though.

Really Helpful when asked questions in person. However, he doesn't reply to emails unless the TA told him to check his inbox or the students email him 3 or 4 times a week. Other than that, one of the professors who knows the language and can explain without any confusions. I wanted the prof to get into more advanced topics in C but never happened

His lectures are interesting, and he is very passionate on the material. Unfortunately, he is a very tough grader, and his exams are ridiculous. The class average was around 70 percent for exams, and the exams ask a lot of essay questions. The class only had a few assignments, so passing the exams/papers is necessary.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Amazing professor, midterm/final consists of specifics from readings he assigns throughout the semester I would say its mandatory to read all of them. The group project wasn't my favorite, but it wasn't too bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is a solid professor and may actually be my personal favorite so far. He is clear, well prepared and often explains complicated concepts with ease. I learned a ton in his class. He is a tough grader, the midterms demanded a fair amount of studying. The group paper may not be the best, but it works.

Professor Hibbing is an interesting professor to me. His lectures are actually pretty interesting and he's pretty engaging.. It could be his voice... but when he talks, I listen. Essays are pretty straightforward.. their argument papers rather than research... which I personally prefer. He sometimes get a little boring but he's chill
He is very easy to understand, and clearly loves the material. He makes sure to make the material understandable and comprehensible.
Best Professor at UC Merced. Very detailed lectures and exams are difficult only if you don't pay attention in lecture.

The class was challenging because it involves learning concepts typically solved with code, but you have to solve on paper. The exams allow all resources except communication with others. The homework was demanding, but study groups were helpful in collaborating with fellow students. The instructor was a nice guy, but the course content is no joke.

His lectures are quite boring, mostly goes over equations and examples. No notes are posted on Canvas. All HW is based on textbook questions, PDF online. Exams are open everything (syllabus states this and he encourages it). Heavily curved at the end of the year and dropped one of every assignment. Quizzes are harder than expected, study for those.

He is very well organized and knowledgeable. He taught CFD in graduate level and covered the most important parts of the textbook. However, I was not able to attend his office hours most of the time but whenever I showed up and asked him questions he clearly and comprehensively explained.

Professor Ayyaswamy has been one of my favorite professors at UC Merced. He is a really good lecturer and always takes feedback really well. He is  always available if you need any additional help. I highly recommend taking him for Fluid Mechanics and Aerodynamics. Also, he is way better than Professor Rice.

If it wasnt for Arthur, Dulai was not going to change my grade. Arthur is definitely the better half in Bio 2. He explains the materialwell without picking on you and being rude. He is very caring for students and tries his best to help. Only thing is, don't bother emailing. He will almost NEVER email back. try visiting during his office instead.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: One of the best upper div professors Ive had. Super chill when it comes to asking questions. Wish he taught all of my bio classes!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: Though I did not personally do really good in this class and was not the best student, he was definitely the best professor I have had throughout my whole undergrad career! I hope he continues to teach more students and inspire them the way he did with our class :)
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: Good prof, lectures are interesting and easy to understand. He is approachable and friendly when you ask questions.

Awesome professor to have, very relatable and friendly. Lecture is really helpful and helps a lot during office hours. Very kind and understanding and is also a very funny person. I would love to take another one of Professor Arthur's taught courses. Lectures are very descriptive and not that difficult for non biology major students.

Don't let the difficulty of his class sway you he's a genuinely great guy. Really enjoyed his class and you learn a lot and never really feel fatigued. His class is something you can look forward to. Highly recommend his spark class to other freshmen.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--So many papers

comment: Many papers and readings are assigned but as long as you complete them an A is guaranteed. Group work is almost always guaranteed. Great professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--So many papers

comment: Best professor ever! If you can, always take a class by him. Definitely cares about his students and makes class interesting with his rants.
I actually took him for quantum. Pay attention to lecture, read, and you will do great. He gives you a page, front, and back for a cheat sheet.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: Very enthusiastic teacher. Loves not only teaching chemistry, but also the history behind the subject. Very easy to confront during office hours or after lecture.
The tests are difficult and curveballs are thrown on the tests. Not a lot of problems on them (No room for partial credit) so your grade heavily depends on getting everything nailed perfectly.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Petra is one of the best professors I have had. This class is indeed pretty difficult but Dr. Petra is such a nice and sweet person that she will work with you and is super helpful in office hours. This class also has a few matlab problems that can be complex so if you don't know matlab before it would be helpful to have some background.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I had her for MATH 132 Spring 2015 ( her first time teaching her own class). In the beginning it was rough , but as the semester wore on it became clear that improving her lectures was of the most importance. By the end of the semester she was really good. Her lectures became more concise. She does look at how you improved overall. Organized.

Very clear explaining the material, example problems, and concepts. Tests problems primarily come from lecture notes and homework problems. Takes time to see where the class Is to adjust for the better. Many quizzes but well prepared by lctr notes. Grades exams by considering what work you have shown not so much by rightness. Excellent teacher!

The comprehension level of the material isn't difficult but she makes it unnecessarily complicated. Too much busy work and she can't really teach. If this weren't required, I wouldn't be here. HIGHLY recommend taking it with someone else.

I feel fortunate to have had the opportunity to learn under Prof JBJ. He's nothing short of awesome; his dedication to both his teaching & students creates a great educational experience that goes beyond textbooks and exams. By creating a sense of collaboration and mutual respect, he empowers students to actively participate in their own education.

Helped me understand music analysis through different perspectives. Discovered huge variety of music from different times and places. Coursework is in-class which makes time management easy. Midterm covered topics discussed in lecture so take notes! Got scared I didnt understand software for final podcast, ended up using iMovie, turned out fine!

In the time/course that Professor Beaster-Jones taught us, I learned a great deal from him and am heavily inspired by his knowledge, passion and experiences. Spark lectures are longer classes so it may feel tiring at times;, but Professor JBJ's lectures and course content are always great and produce lots of room for curiosity to learn more :)

His energy matches his students' energy but at times it can be too much. As a music teacher, you are supposed to help students grow more as a musician but he doesn't even do that. He is kind, talented, and consistent. If you want to take this class, go for it but just know that there are times where you feel that this class is a waste of your time.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great class, very interesting, was passionate about what he taught

Professor Todd is alright, but you need to take his class seriously. He's not an easy professor if you're unwilling to learn new concepts or tend to daydream during lectures. If you do, you'll quickly fall behind and might end up complaining, as many students did during the first month before dropping the class. Best of luck if that sounds like you
great professor, I have taken multiple classes with him and plan to take more next semester. Definitely recommend. if you don't pass in his class you just didn't try.

When I took his course, he tried to make it engaging and fun for students. He would crack dad jokes, but our class was so quiet that it probably felt awkward. Despite that, he did his best and was open to questions throughout the lecture. Our class had a discord server where we would compare notes, make study groups, etc., which was helpful.
Lectures were pretty boring but he's very passionate about econ. There are 2 midterms worth 15% each and a final that's worth 25% of your final grade.
uses terrible textbook that talks about nothing about what he teaches in class. made into to Econ harder than it should be

Professor Theodoridis was a great professor this semester. Im a little confused on why people believe his course was difficult but as long as you do the reading and take good notes in class, you should be able to get a B or even an A. Such an interesting course, he is really engaged in what he teaches and is always open for feedback and discussion
He's a really nice guy! Theres a lot of reading, but if you pay attention you will get an A theres few quizzes, the midterm was an essay and there are 1-2 group projects!

Professor Theodoridis is a cool professor and all but I swear I find myself soooo bored. He's pretty monotoned and its pretty easy to lose focus... The test are alright too... Make sure you actually study... I suppose you can get away with not reading but study those notes! His TA is cool though. He's very lenient & grades everything.

He is a great professor. His lectures may be boring sometimes but he knows how to dazzle you with his smile. He is a great person and interesting to get to know him. He has a lot to say about Virginia.
This is the man to take for POLI...

She provided great feed back on essay. She was extremely open and loving with her students. She was really nice, and always there for you when you needed her. Her essay were interesting to work on. She was enthusiastic about teaching and going to class.

Linda is great!Extremely funny. She makes discussions interesting. If you ask her for help she will gladly help you :) I love her way of teaching. ALSO, she is very understanding and will accept late assignments.

Linda is very helpful--and promotes discussions, mediating so that everyone has a voice. She encourages participation and has an amazing good humor. She is open-minded to varying ideas and very interactive. She gave me great confidence when writing papers that helped me survive my other classes. Linda's candor is a breath of fresh air.
SHE'S AWESOME! Very nice and funny. Treats you as a being and not as a student. Helpful with work. I wish I had her for Writing. GO LINDA!
i love this teacher. EASYYY A!!
i didnt like this professor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I wasn't really looking forward to the class since I had to enroll in an elective and this was my only option. However, the clicker questions that she had during the lecture really aided in my learning. I would recommend for an easy A class.

Although her lectures will never make you fall asleep due to her positive vibe teaching, she goes through the lecture speedily expecting you have read the chapter prior to attending the lecture. You will not have enough time to jot ideas word for word and she often says points aloud that aren't on her slides. Keep up! Her pace is too fast at times.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Professor McTavish is really an amazing professor. She's greatly passionate about the subject and it shows in her lectures, she tries really hard to keep it interesting. She's also a great person; very approachable. In terms of the class, it was a tough class. Lectures definitely helped, going to office hours helped, too. Very minimal curve.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: really cares about the students, not much of a work load pretty easy class
This class is so awesome because Professor Sandoval is very understanding and she cares about your learning. If you get the chance, take her and you will pass.

Professor Sandoval cares for what you have to say and is very understanding. There was group work almost every class but it was amusing and helped create friendships with the people around me. As long as you don't slack off you should be able to pass the class easily.
A1 teacher

Shes a really great teacher who does what she can to help you succeed. Professor Sandoval motivated us to get outside our level of comfort and in the end we all bloomed our of our shells and created a bond with other students through partner work and projects. I really enjoyed her class and will miss the discussions the most
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Yoshida is great. There is a lot of reading involved, but all of the papers are really fascinating and well picked for the class, although may be a little difficult for people who are not used to reading more theoretical literature. He is also very funny too, making frequent remarks during class to liven it up a little.

He isn't a bad guy, he does his job well and has extra readings and media for those who want to get more involved. The class requires some reading and participation helps grades. It helps if you interact with the class and have fun.

Professor Yoshida is very knowledgable in visual evaluations and cinema. He is a very understanding and informative professor who cares about the growth of his students. His lectures are very philosophical and he is enjoyable to listen to. There were readings but the readings assigned were entertaining and had a definite purpose.

Absolutely hated the structure of this course! Be ready to speak up or else he will call out you during class. The class consisted of 4 quizzes (only highest 2 counted) and 3 essays. Very laid back professor, however he's a fairly tough grader. The class is mainly led by student discussions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Seemed like an uninteresting class at first. Prof is pretty chill and makes lecture less boring. Gives you the ACTUAL tests ahead of time to study. papers are easy if you pay attention to his description of what he's looking for. let class out early often. makes sure everyone understands. attendance matters. young, understanding, and caring.

The course is useful if you don't know anything about computers but if you do save yourself the trouble. Another thing is that he doesn't grade often. I knew someone who had an accident but instead of helping him, the professor told him to discuss it with someone else. Last thing is that he moved the due dates from sunday to friday. Not recommended
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Susa complained about students who'd wait till the weekend to get help w/ work and their lack of time management. Some points were valid but the whole class was punished by making due dates from 11:59pm Sunday to 12:00pm Friday. Taking away 60 hours is very significant & it feels like he doesn't have his students' best interests in mind.
He is the worst Professor ever. He speaks English very poorly. In addition, he is very full of himself.

He won't give any extensions for labs or homework. You have to know the future for him to give you an extension. If your internet goes out on the day its due 0. If you do it and the documents states you did it on the due date 0. If you want late credit 0. Basically you have to be perfect with due dates or else it is a 0. Doesn't care about students

Professor Susa is an amazing instructor, you basically only have to attend the lecture on Monday for credit, you dont have to attend the labs if you know how to do them which is cool. His quizzes and tests are easy if you do the readings or pay attention in class. Easy A! You do a lot of group work so make sure you choose your group wisely!
worst professor i have ever taken.
this is my first time writing a review on this website, I had to do it so other people can prevent taking her classes. Todays the last day of her class, thank god its over

Professor Hong has been one of my favorite professors here at UCM by a long shot. You can tell that she truly cares for her students and is incredibly understanding. I would 100% take any class taken by her if given the chance. :)

Professor Hong was one of the best professors I've taken at UCM! She was immersed into her coursework and always encouraged her students to participate in class. She cared about her students a lot and is one of the sweetest professors to engage with. If you ever have the chance to take her class, do it! You won't regret it.

I really enjoyed Dr. Hong's class. There is a lot of reading but everything was very interesting. The classes mostly consisted of class discussions and some group work. She is very passionate about literature and wants every student to succeed. As long as you complete the assignments it is an easy course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: In the beginning of the year I would have given him a 1, but in time he became a bit more flexible. Your grade is dependent on attendance, turning in homework on time, and overall effort. One thing the professor has to improve on is clarity and communication, but other than that he was good

Bro changed the finals date on the week of finals. The time conflicts with another final that I have, so I emailed him if I could have accommodations. The mf gives me a one sentence response that didn't even answer my question. If this gave me more letters I would complain even more.

He did not seem to know what he was doing and would backtrack or change his mind about things he already said. He also was not able to clearly communicate what he wanted us to do on assignments and would say that the class did something wrong.
Not great, he's pretty confusing

Class is kind of confusing. He didn't really give any instructions on anything, so you have to figure it out yourself. The class is also not really discussion based, and is more writing based for research type stuff.

Katrina Hoyer is a respected and experienced immunologist and her class is no joke. Go to her office hours and read the book and you'll do fine but this is not a class you can get behind in if you want to do well or even pass. Dr. Hoyer is very passionate about immunology and genuinely cares about your success and understanding in her class.

Katrina expects a lot from her students. Which she should, because this is a UC! Bio151 with her is one of the harder classes here because of the sheer quantity of material covered but you get a very in depth introduction to immunology. Good explanation for VDJ recombination and she likes to skip the complement system when teaching which is A-OK!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Tough class for an intro series.  Do ALL of the reading and study if you want to pass.   Professor is a scientist with complete mastery of the subject, she seems to have high standards for herself and demands the same of students. Do the work, don't slack off and you should be fine.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Terrible person/teacher One of the worst professors Ive had in my life

She expects short, concise responses (2-3 sentences) on exams (keywords). She lectures pretty quickly so best to read up ahead of time or afterwards to remember info taught in class & correspond to textbook. Only 3 quizzes (huge chunk of your grade) so need to ace them!! ALWAYS 1 question about a paper on exam (talked about in discussion).

Completely useless. Had to learn from the book since he cannot adequately instruct a class. When the class all received poor grades on quizzes he blames all of the students for "not paying attention" rather than changing his teaching style.

This was my easy class. I started to not go to lecture towards the end (7:30 am). Basically he explains everything you need to know. He bases everything off of the homework. He also is super helpful in office hours. Did I mention he curves? Yeah, easy...
As long as you try you and pay attention to class you should do okay. The examples in class are helpful too. Make sure to do and study the problem sets they are really helpful for the quizzes.

It's his 1styr here.  He needs feedback2improve. During lecture, he tries2explain formulas in the best way possible. He recently started to include more exs.  He asks if any1 has ?s or if they don't understand. He standardizes quizzes&tests (i.e. 84 could mean A- depending on how the class did and what he sees fit) Office hours help+attending class

This professor expects us to learn from him regurgitating equations he puts up on a PowerPoint. He does not explain anything clearly, and when you ask him to explain anything he will tell you 'This is easy'. His quizzes are hard because the problems in the book do not reflect the difficulty of the quiz, will confuse you. He's a BAD teacher.

Great lecturer! He is very passionate about teaching so you will not get bored. Focused on Latino and women's studies for class materials, which expands your educational experience from the bland Euro-male focus in other classes. Great opportunities to voice your opinion's in class and compare with other students.  Meets with students in groups.
AWESOME professor!  the classes ACTUALLY challenges you  think!!! IF you loveeee sociology and enjoy talking TAKE THIS CLASS!!! love his structure!

As long as you read the assigned books, and make sure to always answer the reading points and concepts memos and go to class you will get above a B. His papers are reflective so very easy and not too much graded hw. His tests are straightforward, keep your quizzes he often puts the same questions again. I have an A in his class and I'm not a genius

His material is very interesting and he is passionate about what he teaches. He does have a lot of readings and expects you to come to class prepared but his class is easy to follow. Few papers but mostly on your opinion and fairly easy to get all the points. Drawbacks include no slides being posted up, everything is in class and comes from lecture
Very difficult. Exams do not relate to lecture. Gets confused at his own information. When someone asks questions he tells you to refer to his notes. Not an easy class. Good Luck!
Show up to class and you'll pass!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Would take again

comment: He has an incredibly strong accent and it is very difficult to understand him as he speaks, even when it's for a brief introduction to another speaker (Core).

He has an accent so it is a bit hard to understand him but all of the things on the slides were in the book and his TA helped a lot during Discussion. He didn't give a lot of extra credit but when he did it was a lot, Always very helpful and gave study guides.
He is not a nice person nor does he answer questions in a clear manner. He says things that don't make sense often. I do not recommend him as a professor. DANGER, AVOID HIM!
Wil is a great professor!  I took him for astrobiology, and I was not disappointed.  His lectures go at a slow pace, but if you review the slides before the test you will be fine.

Professor Harmon was by far one of the best professors I have ever had. He is a good lecturer and is always willing to help students outside of class. He held a lot of additional office hours too. His exams were fair for the most part he really emphasizes learning the material over getting a good grade. Would highly recommend.
very informed
No Comments
No Comments
Thanks Tom.

Really nice and great professor, seems to love teaching. He does tend to mutter and may need to speak up but has lots of great info to share. Lecture slides are useful and great reviews of the book. He also offers an extra credit. Tests are easy, read the book and if you can answer the questions in the back you'll be more then prepared.

He is very nice, his lecture slides are clear and the txtbook choice is good but i cant help it but fall asleep every time in lecture. It would greatly help if he spoke louder and explained things faster. I really hope David will read this because it would really help students!

It's the fairest class I've ever taken at the university. If you read the book in detail and cover the lecture slides, you should be fine. He's very helpful and posts even sample exams so you can have an idea of how he assesses the material.
Great class learn the fundamentals and remember them
No Comments

He is a great lecturer and very engaging, but the class is very test heavy, as in there is one other assignment in the gradebook besides midterms and participation. Make sure to go to class and do all the extra credit, including writing extra on midterm free response because that will help your grade so much.

Absolutely one of the best professors I've ever had. He's lectures don't feel like lectures. It feels as if he's just telling you a story. He cares deeply for his student's success and goes far and beyond most.
I recorded lectures and it worked best for me. Also, the practice exams are life savers so make sure to study them.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Saha is one of the best professors out there. He truly cares about his students' success and really makes sure everyone understands if not he will explain it in a different way. Everything on his power points is tested so if you understand the slides you'll do fine.

Professor Saha teaches and demonstrates through powerpoint only key points the students need in preparation for exams. Its easy to just attend his lectures, actively listen, and go back through his powerpoints as a reviewer and easily pass the exam.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Saha is a gem all around. He is so compassionate about the material he teaches & his students. His lectures progress as students understand the material. He is always available outside of class & has taught me a more effective way of learning. He provides a perfect classroom environment that allows you to succeed in all aspects of life.

Fantastic lecturing and only assigns strictly relevant reading material. Easy to follow along in class.

Class work and writing assignments are very relevant and effective.

4/5 because she has a tendency to excessively cancel class and hold class online. This occurred more than once a week for the back half of the semester.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Conrad is really nice and cares about her students. Be sure to attend her office hours (will round your grade if you participate/visit her in office hours) She also gives out extra credit. She does not post her lecture slides and group projects are in class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Really Great Professor, enjoyed her class. Tests were easy as long as you attended all lectures and read the book, not heavy reading about a chapter (40-60) pages a week . Very clear, tests were mostly based off lectures. Gives about 2 extra credit papers.
Easy teacher that will teach you a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Easiest A in Poli. The professor is super flexible and caring.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Boring and monotone lecturers. Handwritten notes and too many readings. Run.

I think the professor is ok, but the thing that really frustrated me was that you didn't know what your grade was for the majority of the semester. He does not update your grade or anything on cat courses. He also does not let you take notes on your computer. It's very difficult to know if you are doing well in the course without knowing your grade

Professor was literally scared of technology. We had to hand write notes and turn them in after every lecture which was so absurd. Claimed that the lecture slides would not have enough information, yet he would write whole essays on every slide making it impossible to write down everything(everything on the slides is valuable for tests).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: lectures were sort of boring since it was mainly reviewing the readings. 11 major assignments that are turned in throughout semester for portfolio. group work about certain topics. TA was much more helpful than the professor. attendance was mandatory for discussion but idk about lecture

Many readings that are difficult to understand. Boring lectures; only somewhat helped the readings make sense. Three papers, attendance, and participation: 20% of grade each. You don't know what your attendance and participation grades are AT ALL, which makes it stressful at the end for your final grade. No feedback from him on essays (just TA).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Overall, I love this professor. He cares a lot about his students and is easily accessible outside of class. He is very passionate about what he does. He is a super easy A but you do need to do all the readings for this course. Don't bother buying the textbooks, you most likely won't use them. I recommend sharing instead.

He decided to change the curriculum halfway through the semester so if that tells you something, there it is. It WAS textbook heavy in the beginning, but I guess he started slipping with the grading and he switched the class to being groupwork heavy and there weren't many quizzes or tests. There were maybe 10 assignments throughout the semester.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: It's just coding but he is also a very lenient teacher and is always willing to help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: The professor goes through the lecture very quick and is very unorganized. He's confused at some of the questions we ask, and he sometimes give vague answers. He also expects you to know some background information on the topic before teaching the topic. Professor should've taken care of certain personal issues before the semester.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: I already knew coming into this course would be difficult but this professor just didn't make it any better. His teaching structure is rushed and almost had to reteach myself for hws or rely on my ta to help. The professor also seemed to disregard any questions asked during lecture... If you want to pass you better teach yourself the concepts well.
New professor, the class was behind by almost an entire chapter and had to rush the last weeks through the material.

The professor is pretty chill I guess. He has a thick accent and rushes through material. The class is gonna be hard, I mean you signed up for Calc 2 fam but as long as you do the homework and practice outside of class you'll be fine. He's relatively nice and he comes off as relaxed. Overall, the class with him wasn't necessarily terrible or great.

Took GASP over summer online. Prof Tonya is so kind! Projects were fun, gained good introductory understanding of the design process and what it takes to create professional work. Course is structured so lectures are at the beginning of the semester and projects later; wish it was more integrated to keep concepts fresh and workload manageable.

The class is fairly easy, but it is time consuming. The collages are very time consuming, and she gives you a week to turn in, but each assignment is straight forward. I had a hard time since I had other homework to do but it was fun creating all the pieces. I would def take another art class with her.

An intresting class filled up with way too many time consuming projects in a short period of time! Great instructor but overloads you with projects. She is willing to work with you every step of the way with you which is nice! A very time consuming class though!

I absolutely LOVED Tonya as an instructor. She was very knowledgable and helpful to students in this class. She is sort of a stickler for following rules, you can do well if you just read the rubrics and make sure you have all of the requirements for projects. I liked that you don't have to be an amazing artist for this class, you just have to try.
Tonya is a great professor and she is very helpful.

I took GASP 1 and this professor is just rude, he's very disrespectful to students if you ask him to repeat anything that he said during the lecture. Isn't clear with instructions, then he proceeds to set his rules but without warning he will change his rules and then get angry at students for not following these new rules that he never announced.

Really fun class to take for badge requirements or if you need a mental break from STEM classes. Relevant and interesting material for pretty much every lecture. Only downside is that I bought an Adobe student plan b/c the main lab computers are built for coding and CAD - not very color accurate for video editing and inconvenient if off campus.

some of the things he's said in class: "your life is a lie" "we live in a simulation" "humans are cyborgs" "i don't have favorites, im not 6". these would all be better w context, but it's funnier this way

I took Swing Dance Ensemble. If you have a good grasp for rhythm and can easily memorize moves, this class will be a breeze. Grading consists of weekly video assignments of combo routines, and the two finals which were two publicized dance party events. As a warning, you have no breaks, so you'll be dancing the entire hour and a half of class.

I absolutely *loved* Intro to Music with Professor Kaminsky. He made everything really enjoyable and fun, integrating music theory and concepts from around the world in along with easy to understand modern references; highlights include learning the meaning of "Chandelier". If you need to get your art credits, there's no better choice.
