easy class as long as you do the work. keep all the quizes. they help with the final. try to keep  yourself busy during lectures....

VERY EASY CLASS. Open notes on quiz/final. Labs don't need to be done, just need to show up for points / take quiz. You just use Excel and R (program similar to Excel). Don't really need to attend lecture, but he gave us extra credit for going one time though, and gives answers in his slides for the quiz / final. Just sit in lectures with laptop.
Awesome guyy ... easyy class ... attending is not mandatory.  Failed everything, yet aced the final and got an A in the class.  overall...pretty cool!!

THIS GUY IS THE BEST PROFESSOR AT THE SCHOOL! ATTENDANCE IS NOT MANDATORY. YOU DON'T EVEN NEED TO GO TO CLASS. YOU CAN JUST TURN IN YOUR WORK AND LEAVE. SAME WITH THE LABS. ALL YOU NEED IS A 75% FOR AN 'A' IN THE CLASS.
Class is so easy, and labs arent even mandatory, you can finish them before hand and turn it in and leave.  Quizzes are open book.  Easy A

Great professor, has an accent but teaches great nonetheless. Really nice and helpful during OH and very passionate about chemistry, you can tell he loves teaching. Read the book and do the hw he assigns and you should be good to go, lectures he offers potential extra credit as well so dont miss.

I LOVE HIM! He is so nice! One of the nicest person I've ever met. He is so helpful and is willing to do anything he can to help you get the grade you want. He does have an accent like others said but you can still understand what he's saying and he makes funny jokes here and there :] Best professor ever!

He is the genuinely most caring teacher and really loves the subject matter.  He will do anything he can to help students who want to do well in his class.  If you care, he will also.  Chemistry is hard enough as it is, know that this professor will not make the subject any more difficult by trying to be tricky or asking hard to interpret question

Great professor. Has an accent but speaks clearly through what could be seen as a barrier. Gives good explanations in office hours and his research on protein modification for the treatment of cancer is really cool.
Lectures right from the book. Test questions right from the book. You can ace this class reading the book. Very helpful guy as well. Final just like the quizzes throughout the semester.

She is always unclear of what she's trying to say. She'll tell the class to do something, but deduct points because she didn't like it later.She takes forever to answer what you need, and time is limited with her assignments. She crams everything last minute. Be prepare to be disappointed with your grade in her class!
She was a very easy professor to deal with. Basically, if you go to her office and dont sound incompetent, everything becomes much easier
please expect heavy and intense works with this class.

Two words for you. DROP IT. You do not know what you have learnt for the entire semester. She gives tons of assignments such as journals, essays, project, in-class works, etc. She tries to help students but her effort is not related to your grade. If you finish the project asap and satisfies her standard, you may receive a good grade.
No Comments

She is amazing!! I love singing and I love this class. It's a little slow in the beginning but it picks up eventually. For students with a musical background it drags on a bit when she is teaching sight reading and other things I personally already know, but the overall class is great, plus the concert and reception  afterwards is fun.
Fun class to take. Good alternative to take for Arts requirement if you are not tone deaf or absolutely terrible at singing.
I have had this teacher three times. She is very good at instructing students and is very passionate about teaching singing.
loooove her!!! she's awesome! totally cool and very passionate about music and teaching, she is wonderful and completely understanding,...she has a beautiful voice!
i'm in her choir class, she's amazing! she is really passionate about music and loves to teach us everything she knows! super nice and understanding!
The best lecturer at UC Merced hands down.  UC Davis is lucky to have him.

Had him at UCD filling in for another professor. Favorite professor so far! Everything my terrible 2A prof. (Roth) is not. Humorous, engaging, effective teaching, clear, posts podcasts and lec. slides, fair tests so no need for curve. Wish he taught a UCD permanently!

Great teacher and is very enthusiastic about teaching evolution. Really patient and is willing to help you if you need it. Hes clear about what he wants and expects you to learn, attend lectures and go to OH. Book isnt necessary, just always attend lecture and ask lots of questions cause he doesnt curve.

He is one of the best Professor I had, he is really enthusiastic in teaching Evolution and it is really evident in his lectures. Tips for success: 1) ATTEND EVERY LECTURE. 2) ATTEND LAB LECTURE  3) OFFICE HOURS
patient, speaks good english, is nice, wears nice clothing, is sometimes kinda funny, is obsessed with fish.  All in all a wonderful lecturer whose class I am thoroughly enjoying.
Really caring, good feedback, and makes class enjoyable!

Andrea is an excellent professor. She was always clear with her instructions and explained throughly what she expected. She provided writing feedback and revision strategies.  I really enjoyed her class by far one of my favorite professors.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Andrea is very nice and outgoing. She was always very optimistic in class and always found ways to interact with us. I really enjoyed her class. She provided lots of tips for better writing practices.

Dr. Mele is a good professor. She understands the level she is teaching and doesn't try to make the courses too difficult too handle. Her essays were not too difficult, but not too easy. Plan to spend at least a couple hours on her papers but it  isn't super bad or too long. I would definitely recommend her.

She is a very sweet and helpful professor. One of my favorites! Though she assigns many readings, they are all interesting and beneficial to help you in the class. Some of the assigns are really engaging and fun to do. The assignments include literature reviews, reading logs, and a nonfiction essay. Would definitely take another class with her.

ECON172 is truly a hidden gem. Probably the easiest class I have ever taken, Professor Butler is very relaxed, most of the class is just discussion about current topics that relate to the course. There is one research paper as a final assignment but he is an easy grader.

Beware, every day in class there is a possibility of a pop quiz based on random chance. He makes you read the entire chapter before coming to class. very dry class, does a few examples on the board but mostly just lectures, hard to follow if math isn't your thing. If there is another teacher available opt for them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Bless him, this academic semester was obviously his first. His lectures consisted of mostly talking/rambling about statistics and did not consist of many example problems. I recommend using Chegg for his homework problem sets in order to boost grades. Study guides given were exactly the same as the exams. Just busy work and some memorization. Easy
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: His first year teaching and he didn't give a study guide for the first midterm. Constantly asks how he could improve
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Do not take Econ 10 with him. If you are trying to learn without teaching yourself every day, do not take this class. He is not college worthy

1 thing that is good is the EC. Thats it. She actually believes that people like her when the reality is comical. I smoked her in an argument once and she ignored it and moved on. Has been passive-aggressive since. Getting full points is legit hard, you won't even know what you missed. Dumb lectures, even her voice is annoying.

If you can DO NOT take any class with her. She is so rude and is not accesible outside of class. She publicly humiliates people in class when they want feedback. Its her way or no way. She assigns assignments but does not explain how to do them then grades harshly. I shouldve listened to earlier rate my profesor reviews!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She was the WORST professor I have taken in UC Merced. She disrespected my class a lot inside and outside of class. She was never in office hours. Whenever we asked a question it was "Look at the syllabus" even though it didn't answer our question. For a group project she publicly humiliated a lot of groups because of their grade.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She does not care about her students. If you go to her office hours and ask a question, she will tell you to read the book. She's truly rude and thinks she is always right. She needs to focus on research, instead of teaching.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: ONLY persons point of view that matters is the professors. Forget about attempting to propose an idea outside of the box. HARSHLY grades any assignment and has unrealistic standards and expectations of her students.

I took tribology with Prof. Martini in my last semester of undergraduate studies. Martini always answered emails promptly and was available after hours to discuss any questions. She was kind and basically hands her students everything they need to get a good grade. 10/10 would recommend taking any class she has to offer.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Martini has a clear and concise way of teaching, providing lots of examples and can be seen out of office hours for good feedback if you need help. However, this isn't a class you can give little effort in and do well. If you disrupt or class or show up late she will call you out. Do your work and be respectful and things will work out
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took Martini's class not too long ago & I hated it! So many people failed her class to the point some students had to stay an extra semester for this course! She's a horrible instructor & I'm glad I don't have to take class anymore. If you fail the first midterm, good luck to you.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Martini is smart and really cares about her students. This class is meant to prepare you for designing and analyzing mechanical parts. Take it seriously. Even with the Covid-19 transition to online Martini did well. ALWAYS available and even upgraded her internet for the class. Sometimes she messes up but with the hard concepts it's understandable.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She's a scary professor. One time a student came to class late & she called them out on it! Good luck if you're taking her for ME120 in Spring. She also has a project which I think is difficult. This class is basically the last class you need to take Capstone.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Exams are 60%, offered extra credit. The rest of the assignments were 10% of your grade. There's 1 midterm, the final, and four assignments which were very simple. As long as you do good on the exams you are good. He curved my grade. 10/10
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Monroe is very nice and cool. He takes time to make sure you understand what you are reading and makes lectures fun by letting us play games related to the lecture. These games really helped me have a deeper understanding of what he meant when we was teaching us. He barely gives work, Take him you wont be disappointed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: I took his spark class and this one. He is an easy professor and the class is also easy but I didn't really like the group project (whole class) where you portray a senator and vote on bills created by your peers and debate on it. The class was heavily weighted on that but the tests are easy so if you get good grades on test you're good.

Prof. Monroe is a great POLI teacher at UCM. He does a great job in engaging with the class and establish a healthy, open learning environment. He makes his lectures fun, his grading is very clear, and is always accessible to his students. Taking his course during COVID-19, he was very understanding and assured flexibility in his office hours.

Politics of reform is a chill class. Ask for help and do the work and youll pass with a good grade. Graded by research paper, research paper presentation, debate, and short paper. Work hard on the research paper and dont do it last minute ( its a big part of your grade) Would recommended professor Monroe
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is such a hard grader and is rude while grading your papers or test. I would not take her again that was the worst class I have ever taken.

Kayla Canelo is now teaching at University of Texas at Arlington. Take notes on the lecture and read the book. She's objectively a great professor, but it's a lot of work for a General education class. If you want to be a political science major, take her. If not, see if you can find an easier professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Canelo is known for being strict but she is so respectful to students and you learn a lot of great material in her class. She is very engaging and tells students exactly what she expects from the beginning of class. She is very knowledgable about the subject matter she teaches and is a great resource.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Canelo is by far the best professor I've had at UC Merced. I took a course with her last semester and did not hesitate to take another with her this semester. She gives very clear expectations from the first day and her lectures are clear. She's always available and answers questions thoroughly. Bonus points for her sense of humor!

DO NOT TAKE HER!!! I took her online class at Fresno State and this class was so hard for it just being a GE class. Her exams consist of essays and there is NO multiple choice. She genuinely does not care about her students at all. She is so rude and don't bother asking her to check your assignments because she won't. You will stress out so much!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Veloz is an amazing instructor. He cares about his students and wants them to be better. This class was researched based but fairly easy. Just do the work and listen to his feedback. In class participation is graded so do show up to class but that shouldn't be hard because he is a cool and funny professor.
Lots of extra credit. Just pay attention and study.

Dr. Veloz makes sure that lectures are entertaining; He consistently tries to get students to engage and although his lectures may be long, they aren't difficult to learn. He'll stay after class if anyone has questions or concerns. By far, one of my favorite professors. Assignments are considerate and aren't overflowing. Projects are manageable.
Professor Veloz will sometimes not add dates to assignments so you will frequently need to be checking the syllabus for the assignments. This class is honestly the easiest to past but very boring
Would not take this class again. Professor does not make assignments clear on how to go about doing them.

took this as an elective. even outside of my major this class was fun and easy to understand. she is very lecture heavy and her slides won't make much sense if you skip so attendance is key. she also does daily participation which will add up over time. her homework is a bit challenging but she is willing to help during office hours.
Super chill, and cares about your well-being. (I had her for ISM but it's not listed.)

Sarah is a fantastic professor and really cares about her students. She's super enthusiastic about her work and is very passionate during lectures. She is always there to answer your questions and help out if you are in a pinch.
Super cool class, she made everything really interesting. one of the best professors forsure

I took professor Loebman last spring semester in her Phy 004 class and let me tell you she was amazing! Shes pretty helpful and very understanding of personal problems and will do anything to help you pass the class if I could go to her class again I would!

Although the topic of the class is hard, she made it a bit easier to pass the class. Her lectures are basically slides, but she would hint at problems that would be in the exam. Her exams are 3-4 questions, easy if you put the correct information in your cheat sheet, similar to lecture problems. Coding lab is harder but focus on the coding homework

You have 2 midterms on midterm week one is a coding exam and the other is a written math exam thats my only problem with this class feels like she could either make the coding exam more intuitive or remove it all together. Grading is pretty lenient and also idk why she does the weird grading system with no +\- entire sem and adds +\- at the end

Professor is pretty nice but can be a bit iffy about some things. Class wasn't too hard, most of the math concepts are things you've learned before or applications of things you've learned before. The matlab part is harder than the math. No final. 3 midterms (both coding and written) taken in class, online. Study the quizzes and you'll be fine.
lectures only have like half the math and the book the rest but variables are different and hard to compare and follow between the two
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: While her lectures are usually her reading off her lecture notes, she explains her lectures pretty well and answers your questions about the material so that you learn to do it. Her coding exams are tough but her written exams are pretty simple if you study. Studying for her written exams is pretty straightforward and she also does partial credits
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Well, honestly, this class has got to be the most hardest and complicated class I have ever taken in my life. I love writing but this class made me feel very discouraged about it. I would not recommend because she is very unorganized and when it comes to asking for help, she is not good at giving any. So I highly recommend choosing another prof..
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: This class was one of my least favorite class to go to. She was not clear on the assignments, went to her office hours and received little feedback. Her grading is not clear and grades very tough, especially on the essays. I wouldnt recommend.

Professor Van Bebber's class is the most ridiculous class you'll ever choose. She only gives two days to write an essay and she will make you print your essays. Turning the essays online counts for plagiarism only. Her way of style is so confusing you will need to ask for help after class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Gives little to no feedback, very unorganized when it comes to grading, gives assignments that have nothing to do with the course.
Very honored to have had her spring 2017 semester. Her class isn't hard, but rather it's finding new ways to say the same thing. When writing her essays, you have to be original!

I have had this professor for several classes and her structure is always the same. 3 exams, non cumulative, 3 activities (discussion, a writing piece, or documentary depends on the class) some quizzes but not usually. Exams focus mostly on the lectures and are pretty easy.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Her Exams are brutally hard. She gives a study guide with 70+ topic and questions and only 25 of them will be on exam. No multiple choice, No matching. It is ALL short answer questions and extremely difficult. if you are up for a challenge take her class but do not take it if you are expecting an easy class for credit, shes a tough grader. 5/10
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I didn't like how she lectures. Very boring, sometimes unfunny jokes. You have to go to class/most of them to get material for exams since she doesn't post the slides. I've gotten through missing many lectures since I already took a few bio classes before and was familiar with the material, but I kept up with reading the tb/my own online studying.

The professor cared that we as students understood the material, often revising her lectures and offering several extra credit oportunities when needed. When in office hours, she did her best to help me in the most effective ways possible.

The material for the class is great, however, the professor could do a better job in engaging and allowing her students to understand the topic better. Labs are 50 minutes and that is not enough time for students to fully understand what was discussed in lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took this class for WRI001 and Sam was amazing! She truly cares about her students, is funny and offers valuable feedback on Canvas and during her office hours or writing conferences. would 100% recommend taking her classes if you have the chance.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She one of the most amazing professors I have had since I've been at this school. She's super kind and understanding. You can tell she is very passionate about writing! Her assignments are fun and extremely creative! I definitely recommend taking her class!!!

Professor Sam has been one of the best professors I have come upon at Merced. She is caring and is always open to many points of views. She makes your writing stronger by asking you questions to help you analyze what is it exactly you are trying to say, rather than giving you the answer straight forward.

Professor Ocena has been one of the best professors that I've come across. She's very approachable and her class isn't too hard. If you put in the work and ask her questions then you should be able to pass her class. Her feed-backs are very helpful and she's clear with her directions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I had her for Writing 10 and she was one the best professors I have ever met at UC Merced. Participation matters and you have to show up to class in order to pass the class. Professor Ocena's lectures are really fun and she usually adds a lot of humor so it can be appealing to us University students. She will extend deadline if you within 24 hours.
She was an okay professor. It seemed as if she wanted us to plan our emergencies as I couldn't retake a quiz I missed while I was in grieving. Other than that the work was straight foward.
I took her for SOC 10 (NOT 185) little disorganized, but otherwise well taught! She's very caring and if you put in the effort, you will easily pass with a B or A!
Great teacher, and very clear with instructions. She offers office hours to students to help solve problems, and helped a lot during the quiz and essay.

great teacher. her lectures were interesting and she is very kind towards the class. instructions for assignments and quiz are very clear. do your best on the papers since they are the majority of the grade percentage. attendance not mandatory but go to lecture for notes that help with quizzes
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Devoto is truly an amazing person! This was her first year at UCM and she's very kind and respectful. very understanding and helped me with my schedule time conflict. she cares about her students and will put time out of her day to catch up on material. only 6 assignments total and 2 quizzes which are very well constructed and easy to do!
Even though it was an intro class, he made it so easy and interesting

i love prof. osterman! He makes learning about crime and deviance so interesting. He tells a lot of stories so it makes you want to pay attention. He is very direct in what he wants you to study so his exams are fairly easy. Best prof. i've had so far!

He's super helpful and always practically gives you the answers to the exams in his "study session." He's super passionate about what he does and his experience in the crime world really helps demonstrate his lectures.
Can be boring. Participation is a big portion of your grade not just attendance and he has everyone do a mandatory presentation which are actually fun to watch.
Great guy, very helpful and knows his stuff. Can be boring but tolerable. Projects/Assignments can be tedious but its not difficult and can be kind of fun.

Took cyber heritage with him. There's some textbook reading. A few boring PP presentations. Accent can make him sound unclear of what hes asking sometimes but hes a cool professor. The funnest part is doing 3D modeling and learning how to make videos of what you designed.
I took cyberheritage with him for a while and it wasn't an interesting subject, but he is hot and i love his accent. great professor but only take the class if you are interested in cyber stuff

Professor Lercari's class was very entertaining. I learned a lot of interesting things and new skills. He is very approachable and helpful.Also... I go to lecture to listen to his sexy Italian accent! HOT!!

Involved in her lectures and always willing to talk to students. She is very human and fair with her policies. Her homework load and essay load is much lighter than other teachers while giving you what was essentially the entire semester to perfect your essays before she officially graded them. Attend, participate, straightforward A.

She's very chill and an easy going professor. She tells you exactly what she's looking for so it's pretty easy to pass. As long as you do the assignments and pay attention to the instructions and samples you'll get a good grade.
Average professor with chill vibes. There is a lot of participation and intellectual conversations during class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: had her for COR, not the worse, she tell your what she wants so just so what she asks for ans youll pass the class.  pretty cool
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: He teaches and then pretends he is amazing at what he does. Old ratings of him was taken down due to how low his rate is. Gives you 4 midterms and a final which is most of your grade. Makes fun of students and gives pop quizzes every week. Then on top of all of this he expects you to do two presentations/summaries. just Don't take this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Grasis has a genuinely interesting class and is very passionate about virology. He cares about the success of his students and is always willing to work with you if you need help. Exams aren't too hard and he sends out a study guide before each one which is extremely helpful.

Can't answer questions about material. Did not vet readings which were poor. Couldn't explain graphs, laughed and said he just skips them. I honestly have no confidence in this professor. You won't learn anything. Grading is done at the 11th hour with no feedback.

Dr. Grasis is a real gem in the bio department. He is super fair, honest, and caring and not a jerk, which is rare. The class does take some level of effort but nothing too crazy. It is actually a very interesting class! He really truly just wants you to do well in the course and even provides you with study guides for every exam.

This class focuses on working in groups the whole semester! You stay in one group because you are all working towards group research. The guidelines for the group assignments are pretty clear and Chia is great at giving any clarification. She is also very caring and understanding. 10/10 recommend. Get ready to do work but know you got this!
She goes really fast through lectures but shes great.. very understanding and if any doubt she will explain topics more if you dont understand and seek for help
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She's really nice! Her exams are extremely difficult though so beware. I recommend studying more than just terms. I really enjoyed her as a professor. Her lectures are a little boring but they go by super fast.

She doesn't post lecture slides on CatCourses, so even more of a reason to show up to lectures. Tests were fairly challenging, but difficult only if you don't study or pay attention in class. There's a group project done throughout the semester so be ready to collaborate with others during the whole semester. Take good notes, and you'll be okay.

Does unannounced assignments so recommend going to class, it can overall help your grade. 1 final exam and 2 total papers. Weekly readings with one weekly quiz, along with a discussion post for the reading of the week. Not much feedback on papers or assignments given and was unprofessional through emails.

She gives 2 weekly reading with a 10 quiz and discussion. There is a group project not too bad. Two written papers that are honestly pretty straightforward. She gives second chances on work if you ask for it but with a good reason. Also, she does unannounced 5pts assignments so it is recommended to go to class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: I enjoyed Mrs. Bamaca! The topics that she went over were very interesting! She really cares about her students participating in class! She assigns class discussions and quizzes for each topic of the week! Although there was much reading/homework, it was still easy to do. You can tell that she cares about her students.
Professor Bamaca is truly inspiring and her lectures are very interesting. I learned a lot in her class.

Professor Bamaca is very genuine and caring. The class I took was Latinx Youth & Families which was a topic of my personal interest. There were a lot of readings though, usually 2-3 research articles per week along with a quiz (5 questions) and discussions. We also had to write 2 thought papers and a final essay in place of an exam.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Huang is a nice guy. His grading scale is fair for the most part and he offers extra credit on all labs that aren't too difficult. That being said, I truly don't feel like I learned anything in this class. A bunch of pop quizzes and all labs are just copy paste from the lab lectures and the goal is to solve any issues. Overall useless.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: For a mobile development class in android studio, we rarely get to understand or even do any projects about mobile development. The professor's main focus is on sensors and not how to create a decent app. The Labs are all copy and paste the code you see on the slides. Watch out for pop quizzes he immediately gives them at the start of the class.

Hua Huang might actually be the worst professor at UCM. Doesn't answer email. Pop quizzes that count for 5% of your grade that cover 3 weeks of content. Bad midterm review. Incredibly thick accent that makes it hard to understand him. You don't learn anything from labs, you copy paste code from a PDF. Reads off slides like a bot for an hour.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: midterm review is just speed run of slides and theres no written guideline or anything to what is going to be on the midterm so not very fun when you have alot of other classes to worry about to

Took this class as an elective and it was pretty good. For someone who's taking this class and Anthropology is not their major, the class may seem a bit hard but the professor is very clear in his lectures and provides very helpful tips. Class is mandatory to understand the class better and for it's midterm and final exams.

I found this class to be interesting and Duenas to be very nice. If you aren't okay with a very fast-paced lecture where the slides aren't posted(but pictures are ok), this class may not be for you. There are attendance quizzes, so class is mandatory, but there is little to no homework for this course. Exams are heavy on memorization but curved.

Very enthusiastic. He doesn't share slides after class but you're welcome to take pictures. Can tend to go on rants about the subject and can be repetitive but its a great class with helpful discussions if you're interested in Archaeology. He has questions (graded) at the end of each lecture so attendance is mandatory.

Great Professor, have taken him twice for upper division courses and I truly enjoyed them. Great guidance for career opportunities in the various fields of anthropology.  His lectures are always entertaining and address real-time and real-world topics that students aren't always made aware of. The assignments educational and provide useful skills

Hard teacher with a lot of expectations. She had a vast experience in different cultures and is very passionate about teaching, also a very great person. Be prepared to work hard and be honest, no BS work.
A little hard but you really do learn a lot!
All writing classes give lots of reading and writing. She is an excellent professor.
She gives alot of homework, lots of reading!
Oh, he knows his stuffs.  Very nice, enthusiastic, and hot too.

He is an extremely smart guy. True, he is not a native speaker . His accent may be a bit difficult to understand in the first place. But his explanations using examples and notes are crystal-clear. His notes are really helpful. He makes a potentially most difficult class a doable one.
He is one of the best teachers in my life. Know how to teach and make students study. If you want to really learn, you will like him. He can be difficult if you just try to pass.
Cant understand clearly. His test are really confusing and his slides are terrible. Dont recommend.

As a discussion teacher, he was helpful and funny. But you have to ask him about assignments or otherwise he forgets. He is pretty easy as a grader but expects good quality work so don't take advantage of his laid back personality.

Prepare to have several classes cancelled throughout the semester. He's hilarious, but he expects good work. Stay on top of your grade throughout the semester so you don't get surprised at the end. You might have to nag him, but do it anyway.
Awesome teacher, super funny, and enjoys telling random stories about his life. If you do all your homework and assignments, you will get a good grade.

He's a cool teacher, as long as you do your work and participate in class discussions he won't throw as many pop quizzes at you. He's reallly random at times too, so be prepared to be entertained. I liked his class, one of my favorite classes, minus the pop quizzes on the readings. He chooses pretty cool books too to read from.

Well since the class was a seminar at times I would get lost. She really does not give a lot of notes but more of oral notes, so put attention. If you attend her office hours she is very nice, helpful, and understanding. I would really recommend to go to her office hours.

No clear grading criteria! I received 1 of the highest grades on her memos & was not given a reason for being marked down. On another paper she had a 2 page max & then graded me down for not writing more even though I literally hit the full 2 pages. STAY AWAY IF YOUR GPA MATTERS TO YOU!

I had Daisy for Soc 115 and Soc 150. Read, go to class, do some participation/ask questions, and it's hard not to get an A.  Daisy was very clear on the exam materials and quite engaging in lecture.  Good energy; take a class with her and find out yourself.
Good energy which made for interesting discussions.  Doing the readings plus putting in SOME effort should make for a successful semester.

Worst professor I've ever taken, her lectures make no sense and she barely teaches. On top of that her tests are insanely hard. Half the class is failing her exams but she refuses to acknowledge it. Avoid taking her courses at all costs unless you're trying to fail.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Honestly one of the worst professors I've ever taken, she was rude & I even dare to describe her as arrogant. Keeping up with her lectures is quite difficult since she goes super fast & doesn't upload anything for later reference. Beware of the group projects the majority of your grade is based on this and she is a TOUGH grader. DONT TAKE HER CLASS
She does not teach at all. Grades very tough. No study guides or anything. Do not take her.

By far the worst professor I have ever had at any level of education. Her ability to explain class material is inept at best as she zooms through lectures with no regard for student learning. She uses TAs to grade the assignments and although I use Chegg for all my answers, I have never got a perfect score on a homework. Awful. DO NOT TAKE EVER!

A teacher that is actually interested in either his class or making his class interesting.  Stanley cares about how we spend our time rather than just going through the motions.  Slight warning: beware his laugh (nothing beyond getting used to though)

I hate everything about Core, but discussion was definitely worth it just because Jared made it so entertaining. And he actually WANTS to you pass and not have to take Core again, as opposed to not caring the slightest whether you pass or don't pass.
He is such a good teacher! Writing has never been so much fun! He does strange exercises that keep engaged in class and he;s a pretty cool guy to talk to. Extremely helpful and totally easy.
Super fun teacher, his class is worth going to.  He's so cool he writes his f's backwards, just the way that Fender writes their f's.  Pretty helpful too.

Professor was very caring and acceptable of anything that happened outside of class as long as it was communicated class material was not very hard she responds very well to participation and encourages it. most of our grade is determined by an essay and a group presentation.

Amazing professor, a good chunk of your grade is presentation and paper based though so be sure to do well in those assignments. She very much prepares you though and even makes it in class to do your thesis/hypothesis to show her and get instant feedback.

Most of what you need is on her slides. She uploads them online, so focus on what she says outside her slides for context. This class was extremely interesting and we'd have discussions about controversial topics that are unheard in many classes. Be ready to write a few analysis papers and participate in a group presentation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: The class is straight forward and I knew what was expected. My advice, make sure to do some hand exercises before taking the quizzes in the class. The quizzes are all writing based with short answers and mini essays. The quizzes are not hard so long as you are able to example and implement the material learned. Overall, pretty good class!

Professor Myers was able to create a foundation of the course from the beginning of the semester such as the expectations of class attendance and some key points that are highlighted for each week's topic of discussion. They overall had a good pacing of lecture materials referring to the readings and the quizzes once in a month were helpful.
Very monotone

No... Just No... Kit Myers can not go 10 seconds without choking on his words about the stuff he is supposed to already know. It makes listening to his lectures impossible. He has high standards on what you need to turn in, and if he is not satisfied, he will give you a zero. Critiques are hard on the group midterm. Honestly, pick someone else.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Kit means well as a professor but lacks thorough explanation most of the time. His lectures are kind of boring but necessary for writing assignments. Good thing is he is very accessible and willing to meet with students for anything!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Hardest class I've taken- content is simple but professor doesn't explain or go over homework answers which makes exams impossible. I went to all lectures & discussions, read the readings, took notes, and I still struggled. He is a tough grader, gives poor explanations, and doesn't help when class struggles. DO NOT TAKE! This class lowers your GPA!
He is a good guy but not for the weak. He never posts answers of his quizzes or exams because he thinks they might end up online. His homework are quizzes, all of his questions are low-key hard.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Loved the professor, really funny guy. Very engaging lectures with a lot of videos and graphs. Very math focused teacher so if that's not your forte, be prepared for a treat.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: All his lectures captivate the students and are basically free TED talks. He uses props and humor to illustrate his point and you can definitely tell he loves what he does. His tests are much more in-depth than his lectures so studying and reading the book is a must to get a good grade. Compared to Ardell, he is the Jurassic Park to his Bug's Life.

I'm about to complete my third year in a week, and I can confidently say that Dylan is THE best TA I've ever had and can ever ask for. He is able to explain concepts well in a class that is notoriously known for being difficult and is able to keep students engaged while doing so.

Dylan was my discussion TA for MATH012 spring 2022 and it was an overall good experience. Even though the class was always tired, he always tried to keep us awake. He explains difficult concepts well and his writing is really neat. He gives good feedback on quizzes and he goes above and beyond to help everyone by having extra office hours.

Everyone in my pre cal class absolutely disliked Dylan. He didnt care if he had to fail the entire class. We felt like we learned nothing. If you want your feelings hurt choose him, he doesnt care if he is rude towards you. Going to his office hours full of 100 students isn't helpful. Quizzes are ridiculously hard. Its a mess.

Dylan is really good at explaining concepts that would otherwise be hard to understand. He does a great job of explaining the reasoning behind anything and everything we learn in Calculus. He also holds a lot of office hours and is always willing to help.
Took her Cosmo course and loved it, physics heavy fs but concepts mattered more than grades.

The lectures are very hard to understand, she often goes on tangents and confuses herself on notes leading to confusion on what the formulas are and when to use them, the lecture problems do not match the homework or match the test problems. I do not recommend this class to anyone, should probably change majors to one not required to take physics.

I took Professor Nierenberg when it was her first time teaching PHYS009 at UC Merced. She had a hard time at first but she really cares about the students and if you go to her office hours she will help you a lot. Very friendly and approachable. PHYS009 is not an easy class for the average person so I would really recommend paying attention.

Her lectures are hard to understand sometimes as she goes very fast and the slides she uses are unclear. She is very kind and if you ask questions she will try her best to answer. She clearly knows what she is talking about, but fails to communicate the concepts well. Though any recommendations are taken in and she adapts well to her students.

Not a bad professor but you will have to teach yourself if you have never taken a physics class before at all. Hard when it came to adapting to her lecture style. Enjoyed her class towards the end of the semester because everything started to click. 2 midterms & can be retaken for partial credit boost! 1 final (10% of grade) and a final project.
kind of just a grind. sometimes she just pulls some bs like file upload exams. this is just for summer though

Overall she was a decent professor.The lectures were slow at times but I felt she explained things pretty well. There were random pop quizzes that had participation grade. Homework due by the end of each week. Your TA will change your perspective of this class. Depending on the structure of discussion you can learn a lot from it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She's not bad but she's an older professor and can be kinda mean sometimes. Your TA can make or break your experience in the class, as a lot of learning is done in discussions as well. Lots of homework that was due at 10pm instead of midnight. But her grading scale makes it so that you pass with a 66%. Hard, but passable if you do the work.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Stone was the only professor teaching PHYS008 for the semester. Unfortunately, this led to a very rough time, not only are lectures very confusing, but most of the learning is done poorly via videos that aren't even mandatory, its very lazy. Homework is incredibly tedious. My TA did a better job at teaching us than Stone herself.
Great professor, easy exams based on homeworks (literally copy and pastes over 50% of material) for 3 question examinations.

Not a bad lecturer - examples in class are clear and he's generally an approachable person. He's not very helpful during office hours though so you're better off going to his TA's office hours. His midterms are nuts but he has a pretty generous grading scale.
very good

He is hard to understand and the subject is hard to begin with. So a double negative. I was stuck with the mean TA for his class also, Jose. I practically didn't learn anything, and the HW was done using answers from the internet. He doesn't teach well, because no one answers his questions in lecture. Curve was great though.

Professor Wang is extremely knowledgeable in his field and is also a very approachable professor. He even took our class on an optional field trip to the SFMOMA for free. Just take notes and show up to class, and you'll pass. Oh, and do your TCME's every week! They are easy to forget about since they're due on fri but the points add up quickly.

The material of the class was boring at times but Professor Wang tries his best at making it fresh and exciting. Open notes on exams made it somewhat less stressful. As long as you pay attention and take notes, you'll easily pass. Mandatory participation & end of semester video project were the only cons of taking this course.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: At first I was intimidated by him but once you talk to professor Wang, he is a pretty nice guy!  I would recommend in general to either visit his office hours for clarification or work with other students in the class!  Overall, I would take any other classes that he will teach!

Great teacher, very caring, offers a lot of extra credit, do it all!  Study all of the big paintings discussed in class and all the vocab offered in class.  He is really nice the class is not hard if you study!
Professor Geery is probably one of the most organized teachers i've ever had. She is so enthusiastic about her work and keeps students engaged in duscussion. Overall, i really recommend her.
nice and helpful, i was in a very small class though

Honestly one of the best professors I have ever had! She makes you enjoy class and therefore want to come back. The only thing I didn't enjoy was waking up early. She only makes you read one book (not even the whole thing). She makes herself very available after calss and wants to help her student. I definitely recommend her!

Professor Geery was one of the best English instructors I've had. She encourages you to attend classes and is extremely organized. I really enjoyed the fall semester with her and I learned the fundamentals of writing. I encourage others to consider her Writing 001 course if your a morning person this class is perfect for you!
is very monotone and can make it difficult to pay attention. reading the book will help in passing the class

Very professional professor that is very clear. His exams and quizzes are problems directly from the book or lectures, so if you study those resources you are in good shape. His lectures are a bit boring, he is an old-school type of guy

He's a pretty good professor, one of my favorites by far actually. He makes the lectures worth attending. His tests are very straight forward if you know your material. Make sure to stay on top at all times-material definitly build on themselves.  Good luck!
No Comments

I've taken both her Photography History and her Intro to Photography and passed with a B+ in both. My grade is only that low because I did not study hard enough on the exam. She literally provides all material for you for the exams, study guide and all. Plus its all pretty interesting. I highly recommend taking a class by her.

I just finished my semester in this class and WOW. If it wasn't for her clear lectures and feedback, my photography wouldn't be where it is now. She was so engaging and she's so energetic and talkative (even when she lost her voice for a day lol). I would love to take another course from her! The class is simple and easy if you try! :)
Great professor! She really cares about her students and is clear on what she expects. I definitely recommend if you are interested in learning more about Photography and its importance in society!

Sita is not only adorable and funny but she is so down to earth and her lectures are AMAZING. I never had an interest in photography and expected to daydream in this class. However I found Sita''s lectures so engaging despite the fact that each lecture was full of information. But wow I actually learned a lot and left class feeling satisfied.

This class was a joke. Span and the TA's are super disorganized. We would spend the majority of lecture trying to fix the projector or figure out how to use clickers. I thought the material was interesting, but lectures were so boring. You absolutely need the book (open book and note for midterms). Overall she's nice and wants you to pass. Easy A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took Professor Sipan for PH1 in the summer of 2016.  It was a MW class and we covered 4-5 chapters per week.  She lectures about a lot of topics that some doesn't really need to be cover.  Just pay attention to the topics on the slides and look through it in the book.  For me those topics were in the exams.

Sipan is an overall good professor. She is however pretty unorganized and tends to always arrive late to class. She is very passionate about public health, therefore her lectures are good, but she can sometimes talk a little low so it is hard to hear. Gives a lot of extra credit so there is really no excuse to fail. Always helpful and accessible.
She really wants you to learn about the subject. Hard time listening as she speaks very low and she goes fast on lecture slides. She gives extra credit!

Dr. Dawson is one of the best history professors I have ever had. He lectures in a way that is understandable, yet interesting. I highly recommend taking his courses if you want to improve your historical knowledge and writing analysis skills.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: One of the most nicest professors I have ever met. He wants his students to participate, and gives out extra credit if students want it. He is easy to pass, his midterm is a take home essay. As well for his final, know what you're talking about cause he wants to have students participate in talking with him.

Dr. Dawson is an awesome professor. He assigned an essay for the midterm, and final exam. If you had questions on the readings or essays, he gave you multiply ways to reach him. He is very approachable. I didn't do well on the quizzes, but my essays were very strong, which helped my grade. A great starting class for a freshman.

Paper-based class. This class is a ridiculously easy A if you are starting as a strong writer. However, this class was very welcoming to non-history majors and seemingly non-strong writers, as long as you respond to new information by forming an opinion and trying to come up with reasoning. Lots of extra credit opportunities.
AN AMAZING PROFESSOR. I LOVED HER SHE WAS REALLY KIND AND WAS VERY PASSIONATE

This professor is extremely passionate and knowledgeable of what she teaches. There's no required textbook when I took it, so we did weekly assigned readings from excerpts or different passages. Although, each week always had interesting readings that keep you woke. It is a superb amount of reading, just to let you know. The A is there if you try!
Was very passionate about the subject and willing to work with me on things I didnt understand
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Vang was a great professor and taught me a lot. You can tell she is passionate about the material. There are a lot of readings though you discuss them to great lengths in class; if you skim them you'll be fine and be able to comment on something you'll be fine. Get ready to challenge the way you think!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I love Miss B. She's such a wonderful professor. She's very considerate and helpful. especially to ELL students. She's always willing to help! DEFINITELY TAKE HER! :)
She's a very interesting professor. Her class would have been more fun if you participate more.
she was very nice and very understanding, also very fun. she'll help you when you ask for it.
No Comments

This was the easiest class I've ever taken. Attendance is mandatory and checked through a canvas quiz with a code, but the code is easy to guess (I attended maybe 4 lectures total). HW is basically graded on completion. Quizzes are ripped straight from quizlet and you have 3 attempts. No exams. 1 final project that requires half a page of writing.

I would not recommend this professor to anybody. She has purposely failed so many students this semester as well as the last. She does not care to hear students out or listen to their needs. She fails 80% of the class then gets upset with us for being worried about our grades. DO NOT take this class here go to another professor who is caring
Prof Zoghbi is one of the better Biochem professors on campus. Her lectures are clear, and if you come to lecture it is easy to do well on her exams.
She has a really strong accent but she really cares about her students and their knowledge in biochemistry.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She grades on a labor-based system which makes it easy to pass. There are weekly 500-word papers & sometimes discussion boards but that's pretty much it. She requires books but we only read portions of each so try finding a pdf. There's a group project for the final & it gets worked on throughout the semester.

Professor Antoine doesn't get enough credit. She gives a clear rubric on how she grades and usually gives GREAT feedback in order to improve your score, if you take that advice, the class is not hard. She is so passionate about what she is teaching it makes for a wonderful class. P.S, most of her required materials can be found online for free.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Topic: Promise of America. Read 4 "easy-read" books, but heavier topics. Very thankful she graded several late weekly essays (500 words each). Consistent office hours outside of class. Course was very discussion-based and you get graded on participation at the end of the semester. Make sure to read before class. Also offered some extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class--Gives good feedback

comment: This was a mandatory sparks class and the professor required a lot of books for the course. We were required to read bits and pieces of each of these books which was a waste of money. Actual material was easy but graded on a few writing assignments.

Had Martin for science of behavior change. He fostered a great class environment and played inspirational music about change in the minutes preceding class. This is the type of teacher that wants you to take away a few topics that can actually benefit your life. Martin is a highly respected researcher on campus and an overall solid lecturerRecomend

I enjoyed Haggers class and can appreciate the realistic workload. Not homework or test heavy and that is super important to me. The only thing I could see being improved are how the TA's grade. This fall semester I have had two different TA's grade my work, and they both expect something different. That is frustrating as I never know who's grading

Took Psy190 Theories of behavior change with him Fall 2020. He's an amazing professor, the short answer assignments are easy to do if you attend his lectures and read the material, they're 70% of your final grade! He also reviewed every week and he took part in the free class book used so don't just copy off the book. There's 2 exams, 50 q's each.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: If you do all the assignments you're guaranteed to pass. The assignments every week are pretty easy just make sure you pay attention to the lecture. He explains everything really good. You'll pass the exams if you study and listen to the lectures. No quizzes. No essays. I recommend this class.
Goat.
ME021 is VERY tedious and takes FOREVER, but as a professor he teaches great and provides quick and very good feedback when emailed. 100% worth putting in effort in his classes, they're easy anyway.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Amazing professor. Very lenient regarding extensions on a particular assignment. Projects are pretty simple. Professor Pandey will respond to you at 4 AM if you were to email him. Very accessible.

One of the best and most flexible professors on campus.  Asked him for multiple extensions throughout the semester, and he willingly granted them.  One of the few teachers who actually understands what students have on their plate.  Responds to emails withing a minute, even during the middle of the night.  Definitely would take him again.

This class is incredibly hard to learn even with previous knowledge, this professor is very clear and precise with talking about the material. Unfortunately he makes typos and mistakes sometimes which are often distracting so you have to really follow and understand what he's talking about.

Rube makes it harder than it is. The professor will not teach you to code, so you better know how to code. Exams are difficult, with averages in the 60%s. You can do well in quizzes, homework, and computer labs, however, one bad exam grade will tank your grade. He offers no extra credit whatsoever. Lectures are useless since he is a heavy lecturer.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: He really cares about you learning the material and makes lecture enjoyable with jokes. Tests honestly aren't difficult. However, this course is content heavy, so attend lecture and do the work; you'll be totally fine. Lecture quizzes are also very easy, as he does an EXTREMELY SIMILAR exercise immediately before; he'll even tell you beforehand

Homework seems doean't really help understanding. Solutions to homeworks are only posted after whole class takes quiz so takes time. No solutions even when exam is coming up. Has random lecture quizzes sometimes only open for a few minutes. Does not annotate lectures and focuses more on concepts so attend and pay understand to succeed.
This class requires you to study A LOT, but it is easy to pass because she offers a lot of extra credit opportunities.
Just one of those classes where you will get a good grade but will learn NOTHING. Makes biology boring.

Gets off topic easily. Averages 7-8 slides per lecture for a chapter with 20+ slides. Talks clearly, but extremely slow. Often bored during lecture. Had interest in biology before attending, have no interest during lecture.
LOVED the class

Gives good critique in order to improve your work. Is knowledgeable and able to troubleshoot any problems quickly to move the class along. She is kind but often forgets student names, at times too quick to speak, cannot hear low volume communicators at times and sometimes confusing. She will help you do great in the class though and is generous.

Her photography class was very unorganized with due dates and projects. The syllabus was not followed and dates were switched, moved, and forgotten. When you hear the work load was heavy, it is A LOT of work. Lectures are hard and boring to follow along. Would not take again.
I agree, lots of work. But overall easy to earn an A. You will be lost if you don't attend regularly and don't take notes.

Lesha's photography class consisted of many projects and assignments. If you put in your effort and try your best, you'll get an A. Beware though,it's ALOT of work. She can come off as somewhat boring but she tries her best. She also lacks a lot of clarity when explaining things. She is nice, but not the best for teaching photography, sadly.

This professor gives many opportunities for a student to be successful but, there are a few things that she would say that were not so motivating. On my first essay I received a "D" and later I was told that if my writing was that bad I would never be able to be an "A" writer which literally brought my hopes down.

Mary is such a wonderful professor, she really tries to engage with the class and not make writing boring. Discussions were interesting. We had about 4 essays and a final e-Portfolio to complete, those were the major projects. There were also many little, easy assignments to complete. Usually one per class meeting. She's a very  nice lady.
She truly cares about her students! Great professor and don't be afraid to visit her office hours for a good chat. Really enthusiastic and helpful. She made my toughest subject easy as can be!

WRI001 with Mary was not a burden. She is kind of a tough grader, but she is pretty clear as to what she wants in your papers. We had homework almost every class, but it was mostly readings. Class meetings were interesting for the most part, and we would get out early almost every class. Very good professor. I will take WRI10 with her again.

Gets distracted easily and is hard to follow because he mumbles and stutters every now and then. Everything is related to the book you can just read the chapters and know the lecture without going because his powerpoints are copied off the textbook. There is class work in lectures to mark participation so just go or you lose easy points.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Participation matters

comment: Richard Rios is a new professor at the university after being retired for years. The lectures does not prepare for midterms. He is constantly late to lectures and easily goes off topic when lecturing. Rios is slow on grading assignments and is hard to access out of class. He also said there will be extra credit, but none was given.
Even though he's a new professor he was great with understanding students and also is always willing to help you outside of class.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Newer Professor at this campus just getting started in his teaching career. However, he can teach well and follows the typical class lectures/textbook content for his exams. Easy class overall as he is friendly, easy to talk to, communicates with the TAs often, and makes sure every student knows what's going on throughout the semester. Great class!

I took his class at Cuyamaca College. He is patient and helpful; answers all your questions. He does Zoom workshops on weekdays that you can attend for extra credit. Grades are mostly based on personal reflection essays, small projects, and a large PowerPoint presentation that students turn in at the end of the semester. A truly phenomenal course!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Franco was an incredible teacher. I took his class in person at Cuyamaca College and was extremely impressed by him. He was helpful, kind, extremely prepared, and knowledgable. He puts your success ahead of anything else! I definitely recommend taking one of his courses if you get the chance!

So far, I took an online class with him at another college, and he is awesome! He really wants you to learn and attends to your questions, grades fairly, and also gives feedback to why he graded your assignments the way he did.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: He is an awesome professor! Really cares about his students.

Professor Lawrence is a great person and a good teacher. He gives out lots of extra credit, makes it super easy to understand how he grades stuff, so you know what's going on. Plus, he's really nice and actually listens to his students. I've learned a lot from their class and really appreciate how much they want us to do well.
Gives a lot of work outside of class but you get to leave class early most of the time. We did a lot of reading and a few essays, but he is a good down to earth teacher who will help you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Hilarious

comment: There was a disconnect between what we were doing in class and for homework; Most assignments were brought over from other courses without changes. His assignments were repetitive and felt more like busywork than useful material. He would dominate the discussions, and it often seemed more like he was trying to convince us of his opinion on a topic.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Professor Lawrence is a great man. He is sure indeed weird at times but he is great overall. Do the assignments, actually try on the material, and you will pass with an A. Even if you tried with minimal effort, you will most likely pass. Good luck!
He challenges you to think outside the box. Brings controversy topics to a safe environment. Very sarcastic but funny. Life time favorite professor!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Her class had a lot of content, many assignments it but went smoothly. I gained a lot of knowledge, she became one of my favorite professors ever.

Prof Fortier is a great person and a decent instructor. Took this class Spring 2020 and she adapted fairly quickly when we went remote. The lectures are long and she does repeat what's on her slides yet they are important to know. There's a group project at the end. Be prepared to read! This class is an easy B.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: To start off, she is really nice and a good person. However, for some reason it seems like she is trying real hard to make ENVE 160 as hard as possible. Her work assigned to us are really hard and it is not a cake walk. Lectures are boring and stale. She reads straight off the powerpoint and lectures are really long. Course is very dense.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: She is really hardworking and compassionate. She understands everyone's situation and makes great decisions.

This professor is extremely kind-hearted and his class is fairly easy. But work has to be put in. If you miss lectures or don't read the book, you'll fall behind (so do either or). Grading is quite simple for assignments, but it will be the tests that get you. So make sure to prepare yourself (book or lecture).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Stephan is truly an understanding and wonderful teacher to take at UC Merced. The class in itself was not difficult if you attended lectures and worked on the extra credit worksheets given before the midterm (HINT: they are very similar to the midterms you will take). Materna lectures heavily on figures in the book. Pay attention and you'll pass.
Horrible Professor, does not explain things enough for you to make your way theough homework and exams. Also he could turn a horrible attitude towards you (unless you are one of his minions).
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: One of the best professors on campus! Genuinely cares about student's success in the class. No way to fail a class with him with all the resources he provides and his accessibility outside of class. Also lots of extra credit and the final replaces lowest midterm at the end! Midterms are fair and very doable, mix of MC and FR. Loved this class!
helpful and funny, good professor and easy going.
He's a very chill professor. Do your work and you'll get a good grade. He is very caring so if something is going on just talk to him.

He doesn't like being called a professor. He likes anime and dress up as zenistu from demon slayer for Halloween in my first year. He did had mandatory but he usually just said to stay for at least 20 min and you can leave. Project was easy and he has trust in my group.

Jonathan is a great professor who is caring and does his best to understand his students. He does group projects and is always open to talking to students whether it's about school or just needing to talk. He has a great sense of humor and he makes assignments and classes entertaining.
Great Professor and had a lot of communication and very flexible with the schedule.
great professor. easy to talk to. made me realize i was interested in history. def recommend him!
It was seriously the easiest class I have ever taken in my life. Easier than high school. He did have a really refreshing view point on american history though. good sense of humor.
No Comments

Dr. Joyce is super kind and did a wonderful job at making insects interesting. She had 3 exams (including final) and they were all online; her assignments were also easy! if you just pay attention and refer to her lectures. She let us take home leaf footed bugs for our project and it was pretty interesting. She also brought pizza to our final!

Professor Joyce is such a wonderful professor! She has her students in mind with everything that she does. The projects sound a lot more difficult than they actually are and they are a lot of fun. The first exam is difficult, but the other exams get easier as the class progresses and you learn more. If you don't go to class you will be confused.

Professor Joyce is great at what she does. She made a class about insects interesting, and tried to get to know her students. Her class is a breeze if you pay attention, and it's not hard to get an A as long as you put in the effort. I actually looked forward to going to class. I highly recommend taking a class with her.

Super easy class, lots of extra credit and she takes you on field trips to a lot of different places. Probably one the most fun classes I've had so far in college. She is also super helpful and nice. The lab was really easy and at times fun too. Definitely recommend taking her classes if you can.
Such a fun and engaging professor. Highly recommend if you want to learn and not just coast by. Very accessible and willing to help. Will take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Fortunato is a great professor who cares about his students. He's very smart and passionate but in no way smug or condescending. He cares about what you have to say and is very accessible. It is not an easy A class, but if you do the readings and attend lecture it's also not a hard A. He gives you all the tools you need to succeed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Well rounded accessible professor, great interpersonal warmth in class and out. You get what you put in, fair and forgiving. Imminently human and reasonable. Crazy smart in tons of published articles for someone who seems so lively, energetic and youthful, but doesn't seem to weld his brain over us. Wants us to learn and gives a crap about us.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Way too much focus on programming that is many times not even connected to the class
One of the better professors here. Class participation is generally a must, he will call on you a lot about readings. Lectures are completely based on readings so be prepared to read.

Don't take this class. So hard to understand his broken english and when you ask questions he doesn't give a specific answer because I don't think he understands. Tests are hard and this class in general is a drag. Pop quizzes all semester.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's the type of professor that will not forget who you are if you talk during his lecture. The lecture is very bland and when you ask questions, he answers it demeaningly, as if we were supposed to master the material after going over it just once.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I took psych 10 with him, and I must admit, the class was difficult. He gives weekly homework, which is graded very harshly. If you attend his lectures, or make sure you know the lecture slides very well, you will do well in the class. Also, there was a pretty generous curve for each exam and the class itself was also curved.

This class was by far the worst class I have ever taken. The Teaching Assistants were  all over the place, hardly helped at all. The professor himself had a temper, which made it nerve wrecking to even ask for help since he didnt have patience. I spoke to  good majority of the class and only about 10% of the people I talked to knew the material.

Samper is a great professor! He's funny and has the best discussions! His way of grading essays was different from previous professors I've had but if you go to to his office hours and ask him for help it will benefit your grade so much! Participation matters a lot to him as well!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I was really hesitant in taking this class because I am not good in writing papers. But this class helped me learn how to read original research articles. Throughout the whole semester, you choose a specific topic to work on. The papers you write weren't too bad. He also does mandatory conferences where he peer reviews your paper which helped me.

he is a very helpful teacher and does a lot to make sure students get the best grade possible. you can also tell he has a passion for what he does since he still teaches even when going through chemo therapy and heart issues.

He is very clear of what he wants in the class. Conferences for the essays are very helpful, the feedback he gives is very useful. Very enthusiastic with his teaching, you can tell he really loves writing and reading.
She taught well.
Fun
Khine is a great professor. She makes class fun. Plus she's really HOT, too!!!
No Comments
It was a bit hard to focus in his class because he's so damn cute!!!! I kinda sorta fell in love with him. But anyways, take his class. You'll enjoy it very much!
A real cool professor but even better person.

His teaching is uncommon but simple to follow. He connects with the students well since he has just graduated from Graduate School. He understands the difficulties of every student and tries to incorporate everyone not just one student. His test are easy if you read, come to his A1 lectures, do his assigned homework, and do his study guides.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Fresh out of graduate school. He makes the lectures funny, lets us out early due to lecture being smooth & easy going. Requires you to read but he's always a delight to go to. Understands us & gives premidterm q's so the midterms are easy if you study . he expects us all to pass & he mind blows us daily. He responds asap & is like a friend. Unique.

If you do the work the class is easy. The professor has an amazing accent, but tends to speak slightly monotone so it is not hard to doze off. However, the view is nice. :) He is easy on the eyes if you know what I mean...

very easy class.the answers for in class quizzes are mostly online. midterms and final are straight from homework problems.gives extra credit. most people dont pay attention in class because it is pretty boring but we go because of the quizzes! he's really nice and chill! take him!!

Overall decent class but the professor is the worst part.  His powerpoint slides are impossible to read at home.  Clicker quizes and multiple choice exams make it easy but you won't learn much.  The homeworks are wayyyyy too long and mastering engineering blows.  I definitely recommend avoiding this course if possible.
super helpful and super nice guy.

I Enjoyed learning a lot of fundamental concepts in cell biology, such as membrane potentials and the cytoskeleton. Exams have a good mixture of multiple choice, free response and word bank questions. Expectations were well communicated, Had an awesome TA who made discussions really felt like an extension of the lecture.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The midterms carry most of the weight and they are so harsh with the grading, they only look for key words in the answers and if that's not there, you get a zero. She is not helpful in office hours, she gets confused herself when you ask her a question. Also in lecture she pretty much reads off the slides. If there was a rating lower than zero...

Simple lectures, easily understandable; however, midterms were all free response. They were insanely difficult because they were graded on keywords, which is outrageous because if these keywords were not added then you would receive zero points. Multiple times a knew how to explain an answer but if it was not to their like I was docked off points.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Woo is a bad lecturer. She doesn't seem to know what she's talking about half of the time and says "Uuhm" every 3 seconds, causing a lot of distraction.
