Even in office in hours, she's not helpful. The exams are hard. You will get points taken off for not writing the exact words on the answer key. Grading is inconsistent. She doesn't curve.

Professor Gao is a great professor. He is really engaging. The lectures were always thought-provoking and fun. He is available for any help with any questions you may have and will help with your papers. As long as you do your work and attend class you will pass his course. I always looked forward to his classes.

The class wasn't my cup of tea, I found it a little boring. This class is more of a discussion between students than a regular lecture given by a professor. There is a lot of reading and talking involved so be prepared for that. The professor was a little rude after I asked for clarification on something. Other than that the class was alright.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Wow, I honestly looked forward to his class every week last semester. The discussions during class were amazing. He knows how to teach, really kind, understanding, patient and gives good feedback. I always avoided Dracula, but in his class, I actually liked the book and found it interesting. The readings and movies we watched were amazing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: I really enjoyed the class. The professor was really into the subject which made the class much more enjoyable
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Ricardo De Castro is an excellent professor. He very clearly tells you what he wants you to learn, how to do it, but also teaches you that what he is teaching is learnable. Just understand KCL,KVL, and Ohms law. Your grade does hinge heavily on two exams, otherwise just homework and labs. While its tight grading, its manageable. I'd take him again
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Castro is an amazing professor. He took extra steps to make us understand the material. He would go over the practice exams and tells us what to study giving us hints of what to expect. Attendance wasn't mandatory but the labs are. He gave us an extra project that bumped up our grades at the end of the semester. Definitely would take it again.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Castro is amazing. He gives difficult homework, but you could always go to once of the TA's office hours or go to him after class for his office hours or just to ask a question. The tests are much easier than the homeworks. He corrected our test scores to get more credit that the TAs didn't give us. He's very helpful with the homeworks if you ask
Circuits hard he makes them harder

I wish I could take him next semester. I love the pain he put me through the entire time and overall, best experience I have ever had from a professor. He would put you down, spit on you but I love that. PhD type of midterms. Through all the hardships he gave the class, with an average of 38%, I love him. Bowdown best professor in the school.

This dude's class is so light but he is 27 chasing young prospective girls like he is pre ordering on Amazon. I always feel scared around him but his friend Otoniel Valencia scares me even more. He always has a flock of young children around him when he is 10 years older than Professor Flores. Stay clear.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not pick him. I did not have a parttime job when I took him and he drained the ever living soul out of me. I remember that multiple times he used go back and talk about Andrew Dowan from like ontario hs. This was like 1/3 of the class, just talking about the funny moments that happened. Other than that, his pop quizes are harder than the final.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He weighs pop quizes 50%. I felt as if most of his quizes were on short parts of his lectures. The long parts are pretty useless. And attendance is very mandatory, he weighs it like 30%. If you dont talk to him before being late or even absent, he'll tick off 5% of your grade. Very difficult class to pass, pick another professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Huang is hard to understand he has a thick accent and mumbles under his breathe when lecturing. All his students tried to tell him that hes hard to understand and he basically blames it on us. He never uploads grades as well. I would not take this class again because the material is doable but not with him as a teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: It is very easy to follow the course material and he is really simple about it. He uploads a lecture every week explaining everything and regularly makes us watch documentaries. It's a very relaxing class there isn't a lot of work to do and the few exams they are aren't difficult specially if one did the work.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Huang is fantastic. He expects a lot from his students but he is fair. The information is fascinating and I learned a lot in his class.

He is obviously very enthusiastic and passionate about the subject he is teaching. He is fair and you can talk to him easily, although, there is never class discussions really. Downside is that he doesn't post grades on Crops so you don't know what you have throughout the entire semester.

I love Yehuda's class definitely would recommend. He is super caring and flexible. His lectures are very intriguing and important attendance isn't mandatory but If you don't go you'll be lost. Super easy load work as well.

Took his Gasp001 class for Fall 2023. Pretty chill guy, homework assignments were mainly just canvas posts, besides the two projects he gave us for the midterm and final (making a video/short film). Class should be an easy A, if you just do what is asked.

Although Yehuda cares a lot about his students, he tends to give a lot of false hope. He makes students feel empowered yes. But his lesson plans are all over the place and his office hours are not concrete. His TAs were always scrambling trying to figure him out. His lectures were nice but his grading was horrible.

Had him for my first semester of college. Fall twentytwenty. Literally the best professor on campus. I dont even know where to start because that's how amazing he is. He is literally super down to the earth. He will stop lecture just to check up on you and make sure you are ok. No other professor will do that. The films we watched were amazing too.
She was so very easy! She pretty much tells you what to have on your essays... and you only take like one vocal test.. which is super easy. And the group work is not hard at all!

She was a great core instructor! VERY easy I wrote all my essays the day before they were due. She's very helpful and kept the class engaged. Half the time we listened to her talk, other times it was a lot of group work! I RECOMMEND HER
Super fun class, she is very easy and does not really bother trying to get the class to interact.  Just complete the assignments, and go to office hours and study the vocab. and you are set.

Terrible communication, none of the assignment descriptions are clear. It is never actually made clear what is expected of you in the class. She is not lenient. I turned in all my assignments and she gave me marked down points because my work was "superficial", which to me does not seem fair.
This course is easier than most believe. The instructor is very "laid back." Do the work, put in some effort, and you should get a decent grade.
If you do the work you will get an A.

He is really bad at teaching and it doesn't help that his slides aren't very clear or useful either. His slides aren't very detailed, which makes answering the top hat questions very hard. He also assigns alot of questions for sapling. Hes not very nice either, especially when you go to office hours, he won't be very helpful.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hard to understand in lecture and skips key concepts that are necessary for understanding material. I took physics before in high school and still felt completely lost on homework because it was wildly different than what was lectured on.
I had Liu for Analytical Mechanics, he is very patient at helping you understand whatever concept you are struggling with. He is outstandingly smart!
Very rude and boring professor. Will call you out for any little thing you do in class. I had to learn the material by reading the textbook because his lectures were super boring and confusing.
Graded only on Test they are multiple choice. I really enjoyed his class he is very laid back but knows what he is teaching.

Understanding the Federal Reserve System, Bond Market, and the National Monetary Base is a difficult subject to master. Professor Cook's lectures cut through the academic and industry terminology making the concepts clear and understandable. Attend lecture, take good notes, do the practice exams. Use his office hours, very accessible & friendly.

Hes a pretty chill dude, his lectures were somewhat interesting, but sometimes monotone. He curved our exam grades so the chances of failure is low. The only issue is that the class addresses many new topics, so in order to pass you need to make an effort to properly learn the material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Professor LeVeck is such an amazing professor, I would hear students complaining that his lectures were boring but I always caught myself paying attention and taking notes in his class. I took poli 172 and it was such an interesting class! Definitely recommend him.

His lectures to many students are boring and not as interesting. I believe the experience for me was the opposite. His class was really fun to learn about and was very interesting. He is very awkward but in a really funny way. He is a great professor. You do not necessarily have to read but it is helpful. You just must understand his lectures.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took his Art of Buddhism class and it was very insightful. His lectures are a bit dense and heavy, but other than that he is a very knowledgeable person with a very interesting background. As long as you attend classes, write a 10-page research essay, and give a short presentation towards the end of the semester, you'll get an A.

The Spark: Comic Art class, is more of a lecture-based class. If you think it is an opportunity to make comics, it's not. A lot of peers spent their time listening to the 4-hour seminar and did other assignments instead of engaging with Ryavec. He's very passionate about comics so only join if you are interested in all things comics.
Dr Ryavec keeps the discussions interesting and does a great job of explaining the more difficult parts of the readings. Hes very patient with his students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Fantastic teacher who really cares about the subject. STUDY FOR YOUR MIDTERMS THOUGH, they are tough if you don't!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: LOVE THEM! So understanding and they are so passionate about CHEM! Hardly went to class, but when I did it was worth it. Although Aurora creates challenging assignments, they really are helpful and not fillers. Highly recommend, just don't be like me and skip a whole semester of class and you'll avoid the stress of this course.

Dr. PJs lectures makes would-be difficult concepts super easy. Workload is about average, and they're very understanding of difficulties. Accepts late work w a penalty, drops lowest scores, easy to reach if you're having trouble. Inspires you to think about science outside class. Labs vary in difficulty but always fun. Exams relatively easy.

Excellent professor, you learn a lot if you attend the lectures. Even thought everything is on the slides he shares, attend to learn the terms to use in the real world. Quizzes and exams are easy since they are open note. This is why it's important to take notes during class. A really chill professor who is there to help you when you ask for help.

Hes a good Professor. Wants you to for sure understand the material and is very open to questions. No homework which is great but your grade depends on midterms and quizzes. Midterms were 13 points which kind of suck. Just make sure you understand. Course isnt difficult
Professor Fons had a clear class and only relies on midterms and the final.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: I almost discussed many problems with her during the Office Hour, but my homework still got a relatively low score. There was no Curve and no extra points.

I found the course demanding regarding reading and APA work, but I managed to handle it well. The instructor was considerate and allowed us to engage in discussions before class. For the final assignment, I chose to write about the psychological impact of makeup, which I found fascinating.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: There's a lot of work in this class. Even if you don't see any assignments due for that day, you will have one due by the end of class. She is a tough grader but gives good feedback if you ask. The course is rigorous but you learn a lot. If you want to challenge yourself then I suggest taking it. It is not an easy A.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Writing 101 was filled with too many essays that had no rules or regulations to them in the prompt but severely graded if you had missed something that you should have known. Often times it was hard to keep up with assignments because they would be clustered one after the other. Only take this class if its necessary.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Hands down the best English teacher I've had. Funny, explains difficult philosophical works extremely well, and understanding. However, be prepared to put in the work. He is a tough grader but is more than happy to help you improve if you put in the effort. Focusses on literary argumentative essays rather than grammar.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Koontz is truly a great professor. He is a tough grader and is honest on your work which is helpful if you ask me. He is funny when he lectures and is always making sure we understand the material. He gets straight to business and knows his stuff. I would take his class again.

Very passionate and funny during lectures. Overall, a cool guy. However, his work can be difficult. He's also a pretty tough grader. Great content though, if you love philosophy and don't mind participating in class discussions, then his spark is a great one to choose.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Decent prof for a class that isn't an introductory course. This class was. Lectures require prior understanding of the philosophical and sociopolitical trends of western culture to be fully appreciated. Grading standards and work policies were overzealous for this type of course. Prof is also needlessly arrogant about his subject. 4/10.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is probably hands down the best Math 24 professor I have ever taken. Everything just clicked when he explained. The way the class is structured promotes such a great learning environment as well. The exams were similar to haik's grading scale, but if haik had a brain. Overall amazing and 100% would recommend this guy to teach you Math 24

hybrid class. doesn't really take attendance. Show up day before quiz for group quizzes. Explains things very good. Doesn't belittle. Very fair with grading. Alek is hella annoying tho. As long as you get you ALEKS done and somewhat study you should be fine. DO YOU ALEKS!!!

This was a linked course provided by David Hambley, and it is a hybrid course. he gave hw that wasn't due but was a precursor what's on the test, and while the hw had multiple questions, the tests had 2-4, and were pretty easy if you did the hw.  We use Aleks, but I cheated on that. explained problems well, and had no problem repeating explanations
She is a terrible professor. Avoid taking a class taught by her if possible. Otherwise, good luck.
Gross. Very unprofessional.

Very clear in her lectures, which lectures followed the book to a tee. Too bad she really did not know the subject very well on her own so she was always dependent upon the solutions instead of being able to just explain a problem without them.

Pretty good professor, he worked hard to make this new class interesting. He did assign a final that wasn't in the syllabus, but it didn't seem to affect our grade much. He was very vague on what the prerequisites for the class were since they weren't officiated yet. Though I did fine without them, it caught me off guard since he didn't mention it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Seemed like he was teaching on auto-pilot. Boring teaching style, routinely late to class, basically read lecture slides, and always seemed like he didn't have enough material prepared. Didn't even show up to the final, and left his 2 TAs to watch the entire 100 person class (during a TA strike). Class wasn't too hard, but I still hated it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: nice professor, very helpful

Hands down the best writing teacher I have ever come across. One of the few people who I have felt excited to receive feedback from. An amazing writer and passionate instructor who never fails to keep the classroom engaged. Taking a class with Orisa as your teacher is an honest blessing you will not forget. Every course should have a Mr. Morrice.
He is very helpful and cares about his students being successful in his class. He makes the class fun and is very flexible with his time.
Very engaging. Clearly cares about his students and actively shows he values input. Nice guy, and altogether a righteous dude.

At first I wasn't sure how this class was gonna go but, professor Carvalho is super nice and so helpful. This class is already difficult as is but she really did her best in helping us learn and gave us so many opportunities for a grade we deserved.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Very good professor. Make sure to participate in class and to ask questions and you would surely pass. She also gives study guides which are similar to the midterms. I would recommend to attend lectures and to actively participate if you want to pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Not the best professor, she leaves whenever she wants and leaves us with TAs. Was not even there on finals. Would not take again, take the other lecturer.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: Gives unclear instructions, avoids answering questions, extremely harsh and subjective grader. Overall L professor and never responds to emails.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Terrible professor, didn't respond to any of my emails, and he grades terribly. Don't reccomend

Less assignments worth 20% of your grade so if you mess up it's hard to get your grade up. He's a nice professor but the class material was difficult to comprehend and complete. There was a 2/3 page single spaced research brief, community interview, pitch video, and group project. Usually lets class out early and stays for questions.

Kim is a very good professor. He offers a lot of extra credit TAKE ADVANTAGE. There are quiz and midterm study guides that are almost EXACTLY like the real thing DO THEM. This is a very easy class if you just do the study guides for quizzes and midterms and is the easiest math class esp with Kim. Would definitely take again. 10/10

Midterms are pretty much exactly like the study guides. He explains concepts extremely well in lectures. Always has Math Dances. Homework is not mandatory. He does take attendance every lecture and grades you on attendance. One of the best profs I've had so far.

I loved Changho. He always tried his best to help his students out and understand the material. Although he does have a slight accent, I could still comprehend what he was saying. He made lectures very engaging and interesting, and he's also super sweet. He gives extra credit to boost your grade, and he understands if you're going through something
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: I had him for math 12 and had no problems with him although, his lectures are pretty bad because he doesn't really explain much unless you ask questions but my TA helped a lot with understanding the material. The way his grading system is set up it is pretty easy to pass. You get a cheat sheet on the exam so that helped a lot with acing the exams.

He's awful at lecturing. Had him for MATH 011 and his class has not changed for the better. He doesn't teach the class. Rather, he speaks to himself while solving problems and fails to explain anything. He goes through the problems very fast and his work is usually messy and not legible enough for anyone to understand. Better off teaching yourself.

Honestly worst calculus class I've ever taken. SO MANY homework assignments and what's worse is that they're all Knewton Alta, a flawed platform that measures your "progress." If you're stuck on one problem, you're screwed. His lectures were terrible and not interactive at all. Exams are full of word problems and will destroy your grade :(

A caring professor who wants the best for students, bringing a good energy to class which makes you engaged. There are sparse assignments, with only 2 exams, being critical to pass. However, she does offer support for them which is helpful. Recommend attending lectures as she goes in-depth on the slides and provides examples.

Overall it was a good class but she only has a midterm and a final that are half of your overall grade. You really have to study for the midterm and final because it is cumulative. She has one writing assignment and three group discussions. My TA wasn't a hard grader but you do have to pay attention because everything will be in the final.
Great professor. Love the representation she offers to POC and women. This woman deserves a RAISE!

Personally, Bogdan is a nice person but his exams are too theoretical and complicated for a subject that really is easily understandable. His lecture slides are easy to understand and study but his exams do not fully depend on lectures like that. It took him until the 3rd midterm to adjust to a teaching system so I don't fully blame him.

Professor Gavrea overall very nice person in terms of personality. He is very understanding in terms of stuff going in your life. At the same time, however, his tests consists of 4 questions, which were very vague. His final is cumulative. Attendance in discussion is mandatory. Overall, don't take this professor please.

As a person, Bogdan is a pretty cool dude. Although he was new during my year, I felt that it took a while for his teaching style to come in. His lectures can be a bit confusing, but whenever he does example problems on the board the subject does seem a lot better. Overall he is a great guy but his lectures can be a hit or miss.

Very kind professor. Although she can talk a lot during the lectures, she is very understanding when it comes to the class. She tries to make things easier for the class by letting us out an hour early or shortening the lectures and assignments, little things like that.
Bad professor. Makes you not want to learn. Easy class but lazy grader and is very rude at times.

I took this professor for a sparks course Global Grand Challenges. Most of the work you must do in this class is to prepare you for the final.  There are a lot of group projects. There was no mandatory attendance but when we started working on the final it became mandatory. Some of the work she would let you resubmit to get a better grade.

Only problem with this class are the quizzes and planning to be honest. He doesn't plan due dates very well you can go a couple of weeks with barely anything due and then you have a week where theres a project checkpoint a quizz and a lab due all in the same week if he just spread out the due dates more it be nicer.
Class is fine.

With the pandemic all courses went online, but Professor Rusu went a step further and taught the class asynchronously. Each week he'd release lecture videos, the lab and any other information we needed to know. You'd do everything at your own pace and time. I thought it worked well. I learned a lot during this course, definitely worth taking.

CSE 111 is an awesome class; take it if you have the chance. I'm pretty sure Rusu is the only one who teaches it. That's not a problem tho since Rusu is an awesome professor. The labs and HW can be tough, but only because they take a long time and most people didn't have time to finish the midterm. I liked that the class is point based.
No, just don't.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Let's just say that she wasn't the best, her homework is very easy, however, she likes to call everyone out, which makes you get out of your comfort zone a lot. Two papers are expected from you which is 50% of your final grade. My class only had two people who got As :(
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Do not take this professor if you have another option! She can very rude and make you not even want to learn the language. A lot of homework, classwork, quizzes, and two exams.

This class taught me a lot but it was a lot of work. She gives you so much work but wont really explain how to do it, so you kind of just have to figure it out on your own. There are so many categories that contribute to youre grade in this class, so make sure you understand what to do or you will fail.

As long as you participate and show improvement of your writing, you're guaranteed an A-. Rex is an amazing professor, kinda strict but you benefit in the long run. He schedules conferences and gives amazing feedback, take advantage of that time to ask for any help. I would definitely take him again.

Rex is a cool professor! He's a bit strict and grades a bit harsh but he will help you out! go to office hours and talk to him about your writing he will give you a lot of feedback which is really helpful. Show him that you care about your grade and work for it! Participation matters so, talk in class part of your grade. I would take him again!

He is very nice and helpful if you put in the effort to show him you care enough. If you show him you want to learn and are willing to do whatever it takes to pass his class. I took him for CORE and he was very helpful when I needed it.

Marc is a good professor! anyone who says other wise  just didn't put enough work into the class. He does not really go by the book but his ways of doing problems are often times better than that taught in the book. His test are difficult but fair.
Nice guy, good intentions, but if a lecture goes off tangent its hard to get back on track. Reading the textbook is very useful because if not the material can get confusing.
Very nice guy but he sometimes can make things confusing for students. Rushes through some lectures.
Very boring lectures.  Basically reads off slides.  Not a warm, fuzzy feeling.  Wish I took the course from a different professor.
Didn't take COGS180 but a Spark class, have to say that he's a good professor
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Alex is cool and friendly as well as enthusiastic. However, his lectures tend to not be the most interesting since he mostly just reads off the slides. The class is an easy A since you're mostly graded on presentations and giving peer feedback. Not much work. Don't buy the book since you won't be tested/quizzed on anything.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Johno sensei is a passionate Professor. Her lectures are informative and important. Does give out a lot of hw but it's beneficial to you since this is a language class. Presentations based on text from book. However if you find it difficult to understand someone's accent and are impatient than this class is not for you. She tries her best to help.

You are expected to know the language after one week. Hard to keep up with her classes, she cannot answer questions properly. Shes is tough grader and her lectures are hard to understand with her poor English. I wish she taught slower and less rushed. She rushes everything and expects you to know Kanji by the 3rd week of class. DO NOT TAKE!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Learning another language is hard, but Johno Sensee is really there to help you everystep of the way. Funny woman

Most assignments given feel like busy work. After taking this class with another instructor I realized that she made the workload way more intense than it needed to be. Also she can be kinda belittling, and treats students as if they're young children.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Makes thing 10 times more complicated than it should be. Treats students like middle schoolers. You can even make a joke or have a laugh in class without getting screamed at and getting moved. Deducts points of the dumbest things ever. Stay away from her!!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Very tough grader. Assigns a lot of homework. But at the end of the day, very compassionate and understanding
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Exams are vital in the class. Puts out a lecture and hopes that we learn the lecture before every lab assignment and exam related to it. Provide little to none feedback for lab assignments. Practice exercises doesn't really help the students learn the concept besides asking for help most of the time.
Exams really matter in this class more than anything. Terrible communication when it comes to on day exam taking. Doesn't really teach but besides provide you a copy of the lesson and calls it a day.

The courses CSE 22 and CSE 24 are relatively easy. Even if you struggle with the midterm (which is common), the professor typically offers a retake, as has been the case almost every semester. If you attend office hours, the professor is very helpful and will walk you through any problems you're having.

Gio is really great, I emailed him about a month ago on how I needed help with my C++ and he replied with so many resources and offered extra office hours if needed. Lectures are long with lots of info but gio is always willing to help and explain even the most simple concepts. Extensions on assignments are rare. he is a reasonable fair professor.

The lectures were very easy to follow. Some of the assignments were tedious when it came to formatting, but they were otherwise very easy if you already have prior programming knowledge and took and passed the AP CSA exam.

Overall, she's a great professor and made this class very manageable. She did Tophat, but you only had to show up 70% of the time. She gives a lot of extra credit before each exam. 3 exams total and you can make your own cheat sheet for each one. Exams are mostly lecture-based and mostly multiple choice with some short answer questions.
This professor is super nice and will help you with any confusions you have. Lectures will get you there to about 80% but 20% will come from the readings.

By far, my favorite professor and class. If you take the time to attend office hours or to speak to her after/before class, you'll see that she is a very genuine and friendly professor. The workload was light and the textbook is helpful, but not mandatory. She will spend time to go over anything you have trouble with, all you need to do is ask!

Always gives last-minute announcements so you end up going to classes that are cancelled. Many grammar mistakes in his lecture slides lead to students having a hard time understanding what to do. Often gives quizzes when attendance is low at his lectures.
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Lecture notes are pre-written and given to the class. The professor doesn't take attendance, however, there will be quizzes that are taken at the beginning of the lecture. He is always accessible outside of class and is always approachable for any questions you have.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: This class is mandatory for BIOE majors. Be prepared to always try self-study the textbook as the professor only talks about what is in the textbook and expects all students to now already. Was harsh in grading at first but opened up eventually. He asked questions in class but would scoff if it was wrong answer. Quiz almost every class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Great professor, she is very kind and hilarious. She provides very insightful topics in the readings and she provided very interesting readings. I felt like I learned a lot in this class and it help me grew as a scientist. There was a handful of reading responses, a final essay, and a presentation. She is very laid back and not a harsh grader.

Dr. H-H is amazing! So nice and makes class fun. She is really passionate about her research and health psychology. She did a cartwheel in class! Hope to get to take her class again. You do need to go to lecture but if you do and study you will pass.
She once wore a dinosaur costume to class. She also hands out candy during review. Only bad thing was that the class was so early. But she had no control of that.

Professor Jeon gives amazing lectures. She always talks about new technologies in the industry and is always open to talk more about computer architecture than what is being covered in class. Quizzes and exams are easy. There's also an extra credit opportunity that doesn't take long to finish.

It was her first time teaching CSE 030, but I think she did a great job. She curated our Midterm(+8 points) and our final grade(by 5%). Going to her lectures helps you understand the basic principles in detail. It's important to take her practice quizzes seriously as they are graded. Study all of the slides for the tests! Especially the last few!!

Professor Jeon is a great instructor. Her lectures are well done and she always made sure to ask students if they were following along and understanding. You will have to study to pass with a good grade, but it's not a difficult course. The project is manageable and she gives practice exams before the midterm and final.

POLI 112- the prof is very understanding and will provide really good feed back in and outside of class. The work load is not heavy put attendance is not mandatory but there is a lot of participation done in class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Great teacher, interesting course - Poli 112
rating_tags: Group projects--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Denny has been one of the kindest staff ever. Her class is very balanced in the sense all assignments hold equal to low weight on overall grade so doing bad in one area will not end you. She is such a kind person and understanding, really wants students to do well. Also gives pretty informative and relevant lectures.

Lectures were mostly just the professor talking. There weren't presentations to go w/ the material, which made  the class seem thrown together. There was a lot of group work & "creative, fun" assignments. If you prefer a straightforward, formal class that has the classic exam/essay format, then I wouldn't recommend this course.
Group projects and attendance is important in this class. Homework isn't too bad and really interesting. Easy to follow lectures. Professor is very courteous and supportive.
Professor Van Natta is amazing! Lecturers are great, easy to follow and offers support to students when needed. Reading is always interesting and assignments aren't too difficult to follow.
He is one of my favorite TA's. Even if his discussions may seem a little boring I would go to his office hours before the midterm and they were incredibly helpful to my passing.

Shashwat is a great TA he's excellent at teaching, better than most professors. If you have any trouble or need any help he'll make it really easy for you to understand and solve. He also stays after his official hours sometimes to help people out.

Great TA for Calc I. He explained things in a way all the students would understand, and he never skipped steps when explaining. His discussion quizzes were okay, and he always posts the topics and videos to prepare beforehand. He Extended his office hours to explain concepts, and he's very knowledgeable of the content. Take him for your discussion
Truly the most unorganized teacher I've ever had. Due dates were a hassle. If it wasn't for this class, maybe I would've had a higher cumulative later on...

She is extremely helpful and applies everything to the interests of students. It may not seemed like it at first but her class is by far the most useful and interesting of all the CORE classes. If you are looking for an easy way out don't take her. If you are looking to learn, then she is the teacher for you.

She made this class definitely way more difficult than the school probably intended it to be. A really good teacher once you understood what was going on but she never e-mailed back and rarely made assignment due dates clear. However, if you need help in anything at all. She'll do anything to help you.
He was a great professor. very helpful and just great. i learn a lot more about writing from him. just do what he says and you'll be fine. but it is a challenging class

He is a really harsh grader. Do not count on his class being your "easy" class for the semester. He made us do a ton of group work, even a group 16-20 page paper. Try to avoid his class if you can. The essays  are take home, so that's helpful. Just get some feedback from him and do everything he says. Try to switch out if you can.

Do Not take Will if your not up for a challenge because he will Fail you! He is a really harsh grader if he thinks your capable of better work. He is a good person, but doesn't play when it comes to doing the work correctly.  Getting A C in his class is like a B in any other class live with it or don't take any of his courses.

Easy grader but creepy.  Kind of stares at you, like am I supposed to answer that rhetorical question, or what?  Never knew where he was coming from in his lectures.  Got a good grade, but definitely recommend taking the class from someone else.  I didn't learn much.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Loves to crack small jokes here and there during lecture. Grading: Short take-home quizzes, 4 papers, 2 exams, and 1 Final. The quizzes are extremely easy (get these points-they're freebies (just 1-2 sentences for them)). The papers are fairly graded (just back up your thoughts). Study lecture material and things on the study guide for the exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He's a good professor! When I took him for service innovation I felt engaged in the conversation and he provoked us to think differently.  There were online components to his course, like lectures, homework and exams, which I thought were easy to get through as long as you could justify your answers.
Wort professor you can ever have, would get frustrated when a student asked for help1. Horrible class to be in.
Professor Albert is a very helpful ! Office hours were helpful to me in understanding all about pre-calculus !
awful.

Professor Backer was without a doubt the best Professor I've had so far. She's amazing and genuinely tries to know the names of all of her students. Gives study guides before midterms which are extremely useful. Always available for office hours and tries her hardest to make sure that all of her students pass her class.

Professor Backer has an impressive teaching style. Always so enthusiastic and passionate talking about COGS. I had never taken a COGS class before, but her way of teaching made it easy for me to learn and not feel lost. Also, she cares a lot about her students and makes an effort to learn our names and review previous material before every lecture.
I took Audition with Dr. Backer and she was amazing! I loved the class and I loved her excitement and passion on the subject. There is weekly homework but its really helpful for exams.
Good choice for pol sci. Do your required work and you will pass!
Good professor with clarity in his teaching. Take his course and make notes! You will easily pass the course!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: GO TO OFFICE HOURS!!! He gives 2% extra credit if you go to office hours. For me, it was the difference between a B + and an A- :( . I would also recommend going to office hours before essays are due so that you can get feedback on them.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Waaay too much reading. Usually I do not mind reading for classes, but for Core this is ridiculous. For this week, I have had about 100 pages of reading to discuss. Besides, the amount of reading the class isnt bad, just another boring class.
Absolutely loved her. She is interesting and always keept my attention. I wish she taught upper Division. Hopefully she teaches some English classes now that they added the major
Great teacher. Doesn't end class early, but she is extremely easy and very helpful.

She based 75% of the grade on 3 exams which were very dense in textbook material. she often had questions on the exam that she never teached! although she is very knowledgable and teaches great its very hard to pass with a good grade
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: a 4/5 for this professor is not deserved. It should be a 6/5. Honestly, she is a great professor who is knowledgeable about what she actually teaches. She is approachable and very nice. Her questions on the exams are, for the most part, very well written and easy to understand, she also curves the exams.

I crammed for each midterm a day before by reading the slides, doing the problems in the back of each chapter, and reading all the definitions of each chapter. Got high 70s on both. For pop quizzes just look up the nurture shock chapter summary and you're good. Got 3/3 on all of them. She's very sweet, funny, and fair. The class is interesting too.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Amazing teacher, he would give us the quiz questions ahead of time. But becareful of his midterm and especially final, really really tough.

Lectures are extremely boring,talks the whole time while writing on the board,fell asleep a few times.Hw and quizzes are easy,not a quiz every week.Exams are rough only 3 problems so if you do bad on one your grade will be bad, can have a cheet sheet. Make sure to write every formula you can on yours and itll save you on the exams.

Prof. Mitchell is awesome. He is super intelligent but has never been condescending in lecture or office hours. The lectures are clear and concise. He is professional and widely admired by his students. The grades are based on homework and exams. The homework is a mix of basic skill building and challenges.

I have taken a class with her before and decided to again. She is not the worst professor, just very confused on the end goal. The papers felt repetitive like she wrote the same question 3 different times, overall wouldnt take again, and I would'nt take if you're not big on reading.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Literally the most unorganized and worst professor ever. I took her CRES 001 class and let me just say it was the worst thing I could've done. She expects so much from her students but doesn't give them the materials or help that we need. She is very unorganized and truly one of the worst professors ever. Do not take this class. Literally 0/5.

The most unorganized professor I've had thus far. The class is about "African history," yet what part of Africa and which period? I couldn't tell you. The first class ended with a student asking what the class is about and we still didn't get an answer. The class is now weeks in and we just got a syllabus. It seems to know nothing about the topic

Professor Horan is super great, he has given so many opportunities inside and outside of class for help. He also gives so many extensions if he sees that students are struggling or even if a few students show that they need extra time. He is also super helpful in office hours, one of the best professors I have seen utilize his office hours.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Sean is one of my favorite professors! Ive always struggled a bit with math but he made calculus easier to learn. You can tell he care about his students. He always asked if we had questions during lecture and offers test corrections for the midterms as well as extra credit. You do have to work for your grade but the class is very much worth it!

Professor Horan is by far the best professor I have taken. He's not one of those professors that will give you an A just for showing up but he will help earn it. He's pretty chill and will stay overtime to help if he can. Plus you can correct any errors on your test for 50% of the points back. Professor Horan is the first teacher to make class fun.

Prof. Xu is an amazing writing teacher! If you would like to take your writing to an advanced level, I'd absolutely recommend her. This class isn't stressful, Prof. Xu is an extremely patient teacher, and she gives incredible feedback.
she's amazing, she will work with you outside of class and help where needed.

I loved Professor Xu and her class. She is very understanding. She gives us assignments that are helpful and fun to do. She helps us get out of our comfort zone. I would take her class again if I could. I learned so much, and this class never stressed me out. She made sure all of her students were on board, always. Excellent professor.

Professor Xu is a very caring professor. She's very understanding and will not make you feel anxious to reach out with her. She cares a lot about her students and gives everyone an equal opportunity to succeed and will give you a second chance as long as you will put in the effort and time. 10/10 would take again.

I had Dr. Isbell for PSY 015 and she was awesome. We had a group project/paper due at the end of the semester and the assignments for it were spread throughout the semester which were easily manageable. Exams were also easy we were able to use a notecard and there's also a makeup exam you could take at the end if you don't like the score of an exam

Dr. Isbell is a good and caring professor! She is very passionate about the subject that she teaches. Her lecture slides are easy enough to be able to digest information. ATTENDANCE is MANDATORY. She uses the geolocation feature on tophat to check location. She plays things by the book, so if you have an excuse, you better have documentation.

This was one of my favorite classes so far! Professor Isbell is great and is very understanding of her students. She uses videos during her lectures which are very helpful. There are 3 exams and one optional final. She gives a quiz each week, but they are manageable. I would definitely recommend taking this course or any with this professor.
I loved her, she was sweet and funny. Understands life happens and is willing to work around things.

She was very caring and understanding toward her students. She was flexible and her assignments weren't too bad. I took her for WRI 110 with her which was a tutor training class and I thought it was fun. The assignments included some projects and discussion posts. If you're thinking of taking her, you def should, she's amazing!!! #slay

Erin is an amazing professor! She truly cares about her students and our success. She was very accessible and understanding so I would definitely recommend her. She's just a great person overall and is very relatable which is surprising for a professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I really enjoyed Kitazawa's class. He's a bit harder to understand because of his accent but if you pay attention in class it's not that hard. His exams are tough, but if you read the chapters in the book and pay attention/take notes in class it's manageable.

I really liked Professor Kitazawa, He's really nice and always eager to help. His tests are somewhat hard, but they are manageable. Just read the book before-hand and look at the figures. He also gives extra credit after each exam, so it's a plus.

His exams are all hard.. You have to read every little picture description, every slide.. EVERYTHING. He will put small things in the exam that you never thought would be in an exam. You can barely understand him during class so you have to read the book. Hes nice but thats not going to help you.

Film analysis, just the name brought me hope of at least getting to see movie clips in class. I was wrong, this class was literally Professor Mandierg lecturing for two hours with most of the class asleep. I sorely hope that he considers showing more clips or even movies in class, this will definitely bring the energy up in class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor knows what he is talking about but the energy level is terrible. I enjoyed the material of the course but that's about it. Get ready to read a lot. Professor does offer a couple of opportunities to better your grade.

He made the class somewhat boring , which is surprising since film is supposed to be exciting in my opinion. His tests are pretty difficult and he is a tough grader when it comes to assignments. Disliked the structure of the class! Nice guy and really knowledgable about film, but the course needs major improvement for the future.
Best teacher ever
GREAT PROFESSOR!  She knows what she's talking about and she just wants you to participate and be excited about it.  She's also an amazing artist.

Very intergetic teacher, great understanding of the topic and able to relate it. Lectures are off of overhead and are very quick but she will stop/repeat as needed to clarify. Very helpful in exam prep. Extremely easy on the eyes...Brains, Humor, and Beauty...woo hoo!

Anyone that can make a 7:30 am class enjoyable deserves an award. Professor Chao is a really cool person to be around. Her class is very open and welcoming. Group projects gave us opportunities to talk to others in the class. By the end of the semester, we had a little community in class. She doesn't assign a lot of homework, so you aren't stressed

Very nice and goes out of her way to help students. Go to her office hours if you are unsure about your paper or want a second opinion before you turn the papers in. She such a great and inspirational professor, and I love her creative assignments. She gives her students some space to be creative and branch off of ideas.
She is pretty funny and goes over everything multiple times so you don't miss much.

An absolute gem. It was asynchronous when I took the class. Grades pretty easy, just make sure you put effort into discussion posts + papers. Couple of papers that were really fun to do. Be sure to do all the extra credit. Always accessible if you need to meet with her. You can tell she wants her students to do well. One of my favorite instructors!

Amazing professor who cares about the holistic well-being of students! Her focus and passion for social justice is infectious and I enjoyed this class for allowing me to share my experiences and reflect on the injustices others have faced. It re-kindled my drive towards justice. Heavily focused on readings and a couple papers. Clear criteria. 10/10

Megan is a very kind and present professor. UC Santa Cruz is blessed to have her as a full-timer. Her love for the material is obvious. I took social justice with her and the way she taught the course was rejuvenating. She practices what she preaches daily and helps students without question. I hope she comes back and teaches F2020. 11/10 for her.

Best professor Ive ever had in my life, I felt like I could sit there and learn from his lectures without getting bored, and he made it so easy to understand O chem, Usually ill just go to class sit there and walk out learning nothing, but with him he genuinely makes it easy to understand and makes you want to learn.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I am currently taking Baxter for organic chemistry, Chem 008 specifically. He is amazing. Great teacher, very engaging and informational, and approaches his lectures as if he was a student as well. Poses problems and helps solve them as if he was a student learning it for the first time. Definitely would recommend him for any class you have to take

Took him for advanced organic synthesis. Rather than attempting to trick the students with challenging mechanisms, he worked with us to help us understand why certain reaction pathways proceeded in the presence of different functional groups. Was very accommodating with COVID and the class focused more on learning than testing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: She works with Madera county public health, which gives you access to real world experience. The course is designed in steps in order to ultimately achieve a final presentation. You get to pick a partner who you will be working for the remainder of the course. Easy to navigate and ample amount of time to do research and complete assignments.
Although, class was only held once a week, each week of lecture was very informative and she navigated throughout the courses material easily so we can later do our homework.

Professor Nathan was a very effective lecturer and gives you pretty much two weeks time to complete each assignment, which is plenty of time. You can always go to her for help and having her proofread your work will be beneficial to your grade. Her assignments are straightforward and easy to complete.

Professor Nathan is very knowledgable in real world public health experience. She works at a public health department & uses her real world experience to help teach the class. The class consists of 6 main assignments, a CITI training, & a guest lecture assignment. Each student picks a partner & they work with that partner throughout the class.

For a freshman, the workload from this class is so much. A lot of reading every week and essays about every two. However, he is flexible and if you have a lot of trouble, reach out to him and he will work with you. With the work you'll do in this class, you'll learn a lot of skills you'll be able to transfer out to other classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Hes a really nice professor and understanding  however the amount of reading we had to do made me want to cry every week. Also participation is important to him and youre graded on it which is really bad for me since Im a shy person and have bad anxiety. Hes a really cool prof and the work isnt that hard just the reads are a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Extreme workload, very misleading both unit wise as well as time wise. Comprised of non-scheduled recorded lectures, film watching sections, long essays weekly, long readings, discussion sections all with different criteria for grading. Not understanding, forgiving or realistic with other course loads
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Ojeda is filled with enthusiasm and is passionate at what he does. He does in-class activities at times during lectures. The lecture class does seem a bit slow-going and even though he is using a mic, there were times I could barley hear. Overall, I liked this professor and the things he gives out; I would take his class again. 10/10!!

Professor Ojeda is a great professor who puts passion into his lectures. He goes into detail in every slide. Attendence towards discussions are mandatory and go towards your grade. Overall he is good professor and love his class.

The lectures are very clear and understandable, if you took AP Gov in high school this class covers a lot of the same topics! Homework assignments are fairly decent to do, also your attendance goes towards your grade for discussion!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Carolyn Jennings was a good professor at teaching material, however the way in which she formatted the course sets students up for failure. 1.5 lectures a week, one in class 25 minute essay a week about the weeks reading, then a new topic and essay the next week is a horrible method for knowledge retention. More about memorization than learning.
Teacher is kind, patient, and knows her stuff! Easy workload for this Spark class.

This class was very interesting and she is a good teacher. It is obvious she really knowledgeable and smart, but sometimes what she says can be confusing. There is a good amount of reading each week and it's essential to the class and each week there is a 1 page paper on the reading. Overall it's a good class, but if you want the grade you earn it.

I do not recommend! Professor failed to post an assignment, then blamed the class for not completing it. Constructive feedback from SATAL reviews were ignored during discussions. She avoids accountability, is a harsh grader, and unwilling to explain her reasoning, hindering student growth. I came eager to learn but left feeling my time was wasted.

I understand that it is her first time in a lecturer's shoes as a doctor, so I give her that grace. She is amazing but strict. She appreciates when the class participates well before and during class. If you reach out to her, she will go out of her way to help you. I like her as a professor and will definitely love to be her student again😊.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: She made a couple of mistakes and then blamed students for not doing it even though she didn't put it where the homework goes. Also when one student did the homework, they got yelled at for not doing it correctly. They say that we are adults yet she treats us like children. She is a harsh grader and takes off points for the smallest things.

I would never recommend anyone take this professor. She is very disrespectful to students, she belittles them and makes them feel unintelligent. She is a tough grader and doesn't further explain the reasoning behind your grade. This class could have been fun if it wasn't for her. Do not take any class from her!
Knew material but not good at conveying it.
homework amnesty :D

Nagy is an okay professor. Students tend to dislike her, but I don't think she is as bad as they make her sound. I was lucky to have an TA who emphasized on important points for the exams. She is firm with her grading.
Avoid at all costs, great TA if you like to be treated like a 5 year old.  May know her stuff but not good at communicating it.  Plays favorites with students.

Overall, great instuctor. Tries very hard but sometimes has difficulty explaining in class. However, he is VERY helpful in office hours and absolutely willing to help. If he weren't leaving, I would definitely recommend taking his class for vector calculus.
sometimes a bit boring, or unclear. Lectures sometimes seem scattered. Lectures often don't match up with the book

Simon is one of the best professor. Not only is he a great professor to work with in the classroom, but any one who goes to office hours will get all the help they need. Dr. Weffer obviously has a passion for Sociology and inequality. Word of advice: DON'T SKIP YOUR READINGS. You'll get behind pretty easily.
funny and very interesting, you are always laughing

HARDEST Bioengineering class on campus! PROFESSOR Escobar is a genius, probably the smartest man on campus we are very lucky to have him. Granted the class is extremely demanding. It's a class where you must know everything. If you allocate the time early and study you will do well. Students must know EVERYTHING from the lecture slides.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: One of the most knowledgeable and toughest professors in UC Merced. He has very little on his lecture slides but talks a lot. Make sure to have good note taking skills and go to office hours! This class is anything but easy and his exams are tough. He loves when students ask him questions. DO NOT PROCRASTINATE!!! Make sure to study early.

Carles is really passionate about the course, he knows the material really good. He is always willing to answer questions. Lots of reading, but they are short. Random pop quizzes(but really easy if you read). 1 Midterm, 1 Term paper, and 1 Final, and 1 presentation. Attendance mandatory and participation as well. Can really help or hurt your grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's an amazing professor who shows real passion for the subject. I personally learned a ton from him and his teaching method is very efficient. You want to get points just by showing up to class? Well, don't even bother because he expects everyone to participate every single class, which I loved! He's inspiring!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: You can tell he is a really passionate professor, and his research is actually super interesting we read a piece in the works the semester I had him. However there was a lot of material to cover in 1 semester which wasn't bad but we went through a lot of slides in one class period. There is also like 4/5 papers, but he's more than happy to help!
Lectures are well structured and organized

During class one second she'd be joking with us and prompting discussion then the next she'd ask why we were still talking. She often didn't know the right answer to her own basic questions. She's very judgmental when you answer questions, even if you're right. She didn't give any feedback on our answers to worksheets if they were wrong.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Avoid getting her as TA. During lab she blew up at us for breaking lab equipment even though we couldn't have broken it (we just got there) then left the lab to get the professor to lecture us about respect and made us stay for the extra 20 minutes she just made us waste. She's very unprofessional but professional at making it seem like she is.

Professor Greenwood was a solid professor. Very Approachable and very understanding. Her class wasn't the most organized and she wasn't often fixing things along the way. However, she didn't make anyone pay for her mistakes and was very sincere and honest when explaining something that went wrong. Work is easy to follow and simple. Easy A

Class wasn't very organized and her lectures were very dry. No book needed, only articles provided. Multiple choice exam material is on lecture slides and articles. She wasn't clear on what we needed to focus on and doesn't give clear answers to questions.

Professor Theillard is a very hard professor and a tough grader. Nevertheless, he is aware of that and always gives huge curves for the class. The lectures can get pretty confusing since he goes over examples that sometimes don't relate to the material and also because of his accent and handwriting. Do well on quizzes and you'll be good!

This professor is very sweet and passionate about what he teaches however his writing isn't great so it's difficult to understand lectures. I felt like the grading for this class was not enough we only had 7 homework and 3 exams which made most of our grade.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Payan is a very sweet person but when it comes to larger projects or essays is a tough grader. It is a very passable class but you will have to put it a lot of work and engagement.

Professor Payan is very knowledgable in US health care policy. The class consists of 2 exams (multiple choice & free response), participation, & random in-class assignments. The exams are very straightforward if you have been attending class & reading the book. The random in-class assignments are worth a lot of points & cannot be made up.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Disorganized, unprofessional. I wish I could say she had a clear grading criteria but that would be a lie. One of the most arbitrary, obscure grading system, with no rubrics. One of the most stress-inducing professor I have ever had the displeasure of having. Making me reconsider anthropology as a major.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: The class is very hands-on, in a good way. professor Scaffidi is very flexible if you need extra time or help on an assignment she is available. She had a lot of guest speakers which was very informative. If you are looking to pursue Bio Anthropology or Bio Archaeology I really recommend taking her classes and get to know the professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: HANBO THE GOAT!! He always prints out a lab worksheet to fill out data during lab and has very clear instructions on the procedure. He answers any questions during lab and gives good feedback on the report. Hanbo is overall very knowledgeable about chemistry and cares about his students. He offered to write rec letters for people who need them.

I had Hanbo as a TA for Chemistry 2, he is kind and made chemistry easy to understand. He made review slides for every meeting and quiz. The feedback he gave for labs were very useful and fair. Also, don't be afraid to ask questions as he is very helpful.

Professor Sogin encouraged participation in this class by making students engage in group activities that were similar to what we get tested on in the exams. They provided many opportunities to help students by having early office hours during the week of midterms. If you pay attention during lectures and do the readings, you should be fine.

Difficult class in the sense of the professors teaching this subject. This course is mostly "learn on your own". You have to watch hrs of lectures and read before coming to class. In class, there were no lectures presented. Group activities and case studies are on exams. You take a quiz every day at the start of class, it's closed note.

Prof. Noelle helped create a comfortable learning environment for all of us students. Easy and clear explanation of assignments. She was understanding and caring, with great and applicable feedback. She was not a harsh grader. Gave examples of what she expected and all assignments served an actual purpose. Good class as a whole!
Was supportive and excited about class, just had her for lab though

The course was challenging. He often belittled us for not understanding certain concepts, causing the class to feel discouraged and reluctant to ask questions. Although he assured us that he wasn't angry, his tone remained consistently harsh and demanding. I only passed this class because I turned in everything even if it was incorrect.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: The first 2 weeks of lectures felt like high school or a warzone with constant lecturing on work ethic and life. Random pop quizzes were frustrating. Exams carry significant weight, and struggling with hw/quizzes makes the course challenging. Don't take this class unless ur good in Vector Calc, Linear Algebra, and Differential Equations (Math23,24)
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Class was interesting. Attend lecture, read the book, pay attention, take notes, and listen to the music examples. Do well on the quizzes and you should do well on the tests since they help prepare you for them. Lecture may be long, but she did her best. She gives out extra credit as well. Good simple class to take.
easy teacher just attend lectures and do well on your paper and final, also gives xtra credit

Very tough grader, but fair. All of the other TA sections had B's while his section had C's for mid semester. Dulai weighted the classes and added more points to Alex's section because he was stricter. Without that I wouldn't have gotten a B. Makes you work for the grade. Go to his office hours or fail. Mighty Bell is very helpful, go on it.
GO TO OFFICE HOURS IF YOU WANT TO PASS THE LABS..IF NOT YOU'LL GET AN F SERIOUSLY

Although he tries his best to inform the class of the techniques used behind each section of the course, he often leaves students confused and tends to mutter. Although not the best, he does try- his lectures tend to correlate to the quiz. Students should definitely learn to read the book regularly
if you have him or a teacher I hope you know how to teach youself

Sadly DImitrios isn't here any more but his class was very helpful. Many students complained about his heavy accent but if you go to his lectures and pay attention to what he is writing in the board, you;ll be fine.
Great teacher, a little bit hard to understand but he is willing to clarify if you ask him questions. Although, I've gone to his office hours twice and he wasn't there >.<!

She is a very nice lady. She does have an accent so you have to listen closely to her. Her explanations were alright. Her tests were hard but she had hw be 40% of our grade so it was whatever. She's a cool lady and all but it's better to read the book in my opinion.
I found this professor very useless.  She is as coherent as a babbling brook.  Class attendance often optional.  Expectations of students often higher than course level.
very clear, and finds ways to help you understand the material. it helps that shes hot too

Make sure you are willing to read the book if you are going to sign up for her class.  There is an effort put in on her part to make the exams as unnecessarily complex.  The questions she asks will heavily test you on your ability to decipher what she is trying to ask rather than the knowledge of the subject.  Don't take her if you can postpone it.

I love Professor Maples. She was very inspirational and really focused on bringing the material to life. She used personal examples and experiences that made you understand what was going on. She's very funny and completely honest. If you do not participate in group work and she knows it .. she has no problem calling you out.

I love this professor! She is so funny and her class is always interesting. She has a lot of notes and does not post them up so be ready to write as fast as you can, but it is all worth it because her exams come straight from her notes, word by word. Easy class to pass and she is very passionate about her material. Must take!

Awesome teacher. Definitely makes you work for your grade but the class was very easy going. Did not use the textbook very much though. If you go to her office hours or email here for advice on writing papers/ ideas you'll definitely pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Teacher is okay, not that great. If you don't bring hard copies to class on the day of peer review, then she will kick you out of class. Late work is not accepted and she's a pretty hard grader. Her class focuses on social justice, so if you're into that topic then I would recommend it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Extremely long and difficult exams. His slides don't match up with the textbook. He is all over the place. The only good thing about this course was the labs, but the write ups are quite difficult.
He keeps the class interesting by talking about fish and amphibians.

Dr. Jones is one of the most careless professors I've had at UCM he goes through the lecture slides way to fast and doesn't post them before hand to follow along. He has also made racist comments and he acts indifferent towards some students. he is very sarcastic and can be offensive sometimes towards students as well. would not recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The most rude professor I have ever had. Dr. Jones made an effort to be snobby and made unnesseary comments when you ask for help. Very unprofessional emails. I would never take one of his classes again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Stephanie is an excellent instructor whose course I almost did not get into, but with her help I did. She's very sweet and caring, and very understanding of absences. She does not take attendance but I'd recommend attending. The lectures were almost always great with very few being boring. I would take another class with her again if I could!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Her midterms/final were based of powerpoints given in class!! Super easy class and easy grader.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Co-lecturer with Dulai and Amemiya. Lectured for a few weeks in the middle of the semester. Lectures were somewhat dull with no enthusiasm compared to Dulai and Amemiya. Quizzes were somewhat easier than those during Dulais lectures however.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Just to be clear, this teacher was a co-lecturer in the class and I am unsure of how much authority he had. But in this class, he tended to be boring in his strait lectures-style and his voice felt like it droned on. However, when he was lecturing the reading was actually reflected in the homework, and it seemed he knows his stuff.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He is such a great professor, I wish he would teach all my courses. He's patient with students and explains things really clearly. Everyone should take his class!!
Not accessible outside of class. Very tough professor and will not be clear on material. Except students to figure out their own idea for the class

Guarantee you this will be the best economic professor you will have. He is patient and caring with his students. He will try his best to help you understand the concept. He makes you feel like you want to learn. I wished he taught more economics courses

The class I took was an intro class it was pretty easy, the work wasn't a lot although she can be picky at times. The lectures are mostly fun and interactive. My class required fieldwork I had to attend a local school once a week it wasn't bad if you are interested in teaching there are a few fieldwork reports due but they are pretty easy.

The class was difficult because she was not very clear on how she graded or what she looked for in the assignments. Assignments/group projects were worth a lot and not explained well so many students were lost on what to include and we had to just wing it. There was no sense of direction on anything and made class stressful for a lot of us.
Tough grader and was not clear on assignments. Do not take unless you have to.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: TA for the class. The instructor of the class was decent, but he as a TA had pretty rough grading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: The professor gave a lot of homework, but these are not graded, they are purely for teaching purposes, and the quizzes, midterms and final are all based on homework. I can say that it is a straightforward and average course to get high grade. Particularly, you should definitely attend the classes of TAs.
grades only based on quizzes, midterms, and the final exam so be well prepared. Lectures did help a lot so please attend

He used Matlab for everything. In previous semesters he used Python or no coding at all from what I heard. There were days when he would walk us through a problem step by step which was helpful - I feel like computationally heavy classes like this within engineering degree pathways need to be updated or have their content reviewed. Cool labs tho.
Outstanding.  He sent an email to entire class stating that those who got bad midterm exam grade could take another exam to replace bad midterm grade.  Pretty cool.
Very nice and great to work with! She made class easier for me and at any point I was confused I would always to to her for help. Even though Lisa was just a TA, class was fun with her around.

Worst TA to exist, highly unapproachable and mad with her life. Gets irritated at simple questions and is horrible at giving directions. Expects you to know everything before lab and will not help whatsoever. Worst experience so far made me hate bio labs.

Lectures aren't necessary to attend but the info is usually on the exams and can help a lot rather than just reading the lecture slides. She gives extra credit sometimes too. Discussion sections are very interactive, fun, and collaborative activities. Homework's were scarce and very simple but extremely interesting if you actually care about it.
Lectures are very informative and help prepare for exams. No quizzes and little homework. Discussions are based on ecological theory and r coding.

Tyler is, by far, one of the best professors I've had at UCM so far. His lectures are very engaging. He is very interested in the topics, listens to student feedback, and cares for his students. He has an amazing exam retake policy, the labs are due each week and don't take very long to do, and there are many extra credit opportunities. 10/10

This man is a great guy! He is one of the few reasons why I look forward to going to school. He is very passionate about what he is teaching, which helps me understand and learn the topics. He and his TA care about the students.
grade is heavily dependent on 2 projects which are really fun and interesting, but they will take all semester to do. Prof is super duper cool and so passionate about insects.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: This professor was amazing. His lectures might have been a little heavy, but there's a lot to insects so he summarized pretty well. This class's main grade changes are probably the projects.
