You have two big projects due at the end of the semester, both are pretty interesting and fun though. Just remember not to cram the two at the end of the sem.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Clarkson is amazing! She truly loves anthropology, it's so easy to tell. She's incredibly passionate about what she does. Everyone should take her class!
Awesome teacher.
Professor Wright is an overall great professor. He cares about what he is taking about and is very helpful. I would definitely take him again.
They can get lost with what they are doing from time to time. But they're pretty chill and the material is easy to understand, the exams are just like the practice questions.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: So I took this professor online and his class is very simple, the only way you would not pass his class is if you don't do the work at all, don't get to comfortable and do work last minute because it will pile up. Work is just watch videos that have to do with history do a 100 point discussion on what you learned and replying to 2 other students.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Eissinger can go on tangents, but gives enthralling lectures and expects high quality work. Great for a hist major who doesn't want to get lazy in writing. Study guides for exams were not explained- a list of terms to be found in the textbook and potential essay questions. If you work well on your own, you will shine in this class.
Not that interested in student issues..
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: Proffesor Sands is a wonderful proffesor shes always enthusiastic about the material. Her class is very difficult but with the help of the TA and proffesor Sands you will be able to pass. She really cares about students mental health and was always willing to improve her teaching style.

Even though this was a lab course, Dr. Xu mainly teaches you how to improve your public speaking skills during science talks. She definitely can put people on the spot, but she gives constructive criticism. She wants to hear from all students and cares about outreach. A big part of your grade comes from the TA reading lab reports.
Didn't learn much. More of a hands on for lab work in the physics field. Fun teacher.

She is so incredibly sweet. I had a family emergency and couldn't get documentation. She was incredibly understanding and helpful the entire time. This class is really hard to fail as she does everything in her power including giving extra credit for simply attending most of the lectures as well as additional extra credit throughout the semester.

The class follows a textbook where she creates a presentation highlighting what we need to know that we go over in lecture. Exams had everything we went over in lecture and there were little to no surprises(multiplechoice) Biggest contributor to grade was homework assignments which were easy they just took some time. Overall super sweet!!
No Comments
always helpful, very hot!
LIked his subject, but disliked the administration! Scares you into thinking he is going to fail everyone, but then passes everyone.

He seems to care about his subject. Funny and sarcastic, keeps lectures interesting. Talks a lot about sex. Well prepared, and knows his stuff. Hard tests but open about curving, so it is okay. Tests have really easy questions that seem really hard. Makes you figure it out yourself during the lab. Expects you to read a lot! Hates smartphones!

I recommend only taking songwriting if you have experience or want to learn about it. You will not like it if you have no desire to be there. He is a good and understanding professor and grades well. Almost everything you do in this class is group work and if you do your work correct, you will easily get an A.

provides no leeway in late work and will give you a zero for format errors. says he won't take attendance but does. He is very unnecessarily strict and unaccomodating for a lower division fine arts class which students pay thousands to just be required to take. will spend a few classes preaching his opinions about music's effect on society as fact.

People said I was crazy to take biochem over the summer but I survived. Aleksandra made the best of the given COVID situation and adapted quickly. I her lectures to be very helpful. Also, I know everyone says it but... GO TO OFFICE HOURS, you won't regret it. Aleksandra is one of the nicest professors I've met at UCM, I loved taking her class!

The class was challenging but very doable if you keep up with the work. There are two point quizzes at the end of every lecture but very easy questions if you pay attention in lecture. If you go to her office hours you will do good in this class since she goes over what to expect for midterms. Loved having her as a professor!
She was willing to help you whenever you were struggling to help make you understand and always encouraged you to voice your thoughts when it came to discussion time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: I liked the topics of the readings. Usually assigned readings tend to be very boring and long which only makes students forget about them or skim through the content but the readings in this course were actually interesting and thought me something new and showed me a different perspective of how I view certain things in the media.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I liked the material we learned with it was all very informative and to date.

Words can't describe how amazing she is! Truly a gem of a person. She's very understanding of the pandemic and provides very good feedback on the work. She's also lenient with the deadlines and understands that burnout is real, especially in an online setting. All assignments during the class are work for the final research paper. Highly recommend
Awesome and inspiring professor! Supportive of students and wants them to do well. Learned so much in this class.
Very kind, understanding, knowledgable and passionate!

Reo gave great lectures, but his exams were very difficult with class averages around 50% on all exams. Make sure to read the textbook, go to lectures/labs, and stay on top of the review paper deadlines. The lab portion of the class was more "busy work" than anything, felt pointless. Reo is really funny and knows how to people things in context.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Exams (2 Midterms & Final) are 70% of grade. Little/no true availability outside of class, just asks you about what YOU think is the right answer. A bit dismissive if you ask questions, lectures are very general, doesn't cover what's needed in homework. Must learn on your own. Reviewing hw & textbook helped the most with exams. No curve, ~ 5% e.c.

Lectures are boring; she only went through examples rather than explaining how to solve them, had to teach myself. Didnt give much study material or guides for tests. Midterms are weighed the most so make sure you study for them; there were no quizzes and HW is easy to complete. Avoid if fluid mechanics or calc isnt your strongest subject.
Best TA EVER.

TA for soc 100. Hardly provided feedback on papers (which is their job). Would post confusing announcements that made the essays harder to do (three papers for 20% of final grade each). It felt like the amount of feedback he provided was only enough for him to fulfill the "obligation" of providing feedback. Felt like grades were haphazardly given.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Professor Guan encourages in-class discussion. She loves to have her students conversate with one another and creates a good class atmosphere. She rewards students for showing up to class by giving extra credit. If you complete your assignments based on the rubrics she will give full credit. She gifted the best pitch video makers earrings.

Never gives clear instructions, so it always confuses everyone in the class. Sometimes, it feels as if I am not respected in her classes. Sometimes makes things seem more complicated than they should be. I would not recommend her to anyone.

He's a pretty chill professor. Class doesn't have the best formatting though. He doesn't focus on going over actual chemistry problems in lecture and focuses more on definitions and terminology in his slides. Class is exam heavy and worksheets aren't worth much. Get a passing score on all exams to pass the class. Attendance isn't mandatory.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: NO ACS, lectures are optional, replaces lower midterm with the final. 80% exams, 20% weekly problem worksheets. He is a great professor but it is very hard to pay attention in his lecture, sometimes makes funny jokes. A 61% is passing. Don't mess up on the first 2 midterms.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: His hair is marvellous regardless the length

overall organic teacher-meaning he's just there to educate and you can take what he has to say for your learning or not. Sometimes the material can be a little dry, but as long as you review slides and take notes, easy A.

Anne was a fair professor. Participation was very important and her projects were doable. I just didn't like that they were group projects, but besides that , everything was okay. She was very kind and understanding when I had to submit assignments and her feedback was great. I highly recommend her.

She's okay in terms of how she'll give clarity to most, but definitely not all, things. Her enthusiasm is okay, but she doesn't get back to you in time when it comes to giving back your essays.  Her course load is very doable but I always recommend emailing her constantly for clarity on assignments.

Never posted homework assignments and quizes when promised.  Made students peer grade homework because he claimed it was too much work for him.  Exams were unreasonable in difficulty.  Lectured only from book example problems which could just as easily be studied in your own time.  Overall didn't seem like he wanted to be teaching.

I took Dynamics his first time teaching it here. He expects a lot and says things like "come on this is an easy one" when the entire class is staring clueless at the question he's asking. It's the last week of classes, one person is on track to get an A out of 41. Throughout the semester he has adapted pretty well to how hard we feel the class is.
Not helpful teacher, tests were unfair. Would NOT recommend.
No homework, no quizzes. Grade consists of midterms, participation, and Lab.

She is really great with grammar, by making it not boring. Really wants to know her students understand the concepts. Is there if you need help. Amazing professor would take her again in any spanish class. Quizzes but they are like mini tests. Few midterms no homework.

One of the nicest instructors I've ever had.  She forces you to speak only Spanish due to the fact that she simply doesn't understand English.  At first this was frustrating, but it definitely helps your skills in the long-run.  Highly recommended!
great professor!

Schweizer-sensei is a magnificent teacher. She is extremely helpful and wants to make sure that you understand the comprehension of the language correctly. A bit of an accent but not thick enough to the point where you cannot understand what she's saying. She gives off a motherly vibe and is always there to help you.  Absolute sweetheart as well.

The professor rarely made himself available to students. However, he had his favorite couple students in the class that he would go all the way for. While there were students that needed guidance on the assignments, he would overlook the help they need.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Ask a lot of questions and study hard.

Most chill TA you will ever get. He's funny and easy going, you'll want to have him as your lab TA. Also make sure to attend his review sessions before midterms, most of the questions he reviews are on the test one way or another.
He held review sessions before exams. They totally helped and I felt more prepared for the tests. He asks if we understood the concepts or problems constantly. He cares about his students.

She posts possible short answer questions a week before each exam, so make sure you do those since it can be really helpful. I don't read the chapters much, but I still do fine on the exams and have an A right now. The lectures were interesting for the most part, make sure to pay attention since there will be pop quizzes.

The lectures were not too bad as long as you studied the lectures you could pass with an A. She also gives us the short answer questions before the exam so that was really helpful. Overall good class to take with her.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: The class is easy if you listen and take notes when he rubles. participate on days that you have reviews as he will put those in the tests. His rumbles can be boring but listen and the class will be an easy A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: This professor is "ok." Although I ended with a decent grade in the class, I did horribly on the first exam, which was way harder than I expected it to be. His lectures are plain, boring, and long, without any supplemental videos or pictures in his slides. Lecture attendance was mandatory as he doesn't post slides & randomly takes attendance.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Chris is a very good professor for this semester. He always made it know that you could go to him for help on certain assignments. When there were questions he would do his best to give an answer too. There would also be times where he would say a few jokes or make some of us chuckle which as a nice change of pace compared to what we usually do.
Tough graders so much work to do involves group project requires lots of time from your day.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--So many papers

comment: MGMT 191:  For some reason she quizzes us on chapters BEFORE lecturing us on them. We take the QUIZ right before the lecture for the same chapter. No need to pay attention during lectures because of this. There's midterms for this, not 124. You have to MEMORIZE a lot. Topics from the book are confusing because they're really similar to each other.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Test heavy

comment: Professor Langdon is an amazing professor and is very caring and authentic. Her class is not hard but very involved as the student. She is very informative for management seeking and business professionals. Take her you will not regret it.

She is honestly an amazing professor, in that she cares about you on what you are doing, and would help you out almost anytime in your writing or projects. Her instructions were pretty well because she gave you smaller tips and tricks on improving your writing. As well if you have her for writing 001 or other upper/lower division class, take her.

Prof Yia Lee does a great job explaining reading+writing strategies. Assigns thought-provoking reading. We worked on essays AND other applications of writing in media. My class was a quiet/shy group but she did a good job leading discussions regardless. Was understanding when I fell behind and helped me catch up. Felt challenged but not overwhelmed

This class was interesting to me, if you've already taken a Music Theory class then this one is a small review the whole class. The only thing bad was when I was creating a song as the final he was way more harsh then expected. Other than that it was easy as long as you did the homework given online and reply to other that did the same assignment.
Chill professor, easy class, attendance not mandatory and very understanding.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She's British. Just like my AP English professor. Just be sure to do well in your essays because those count towards your grades the most. She is really helpful but doesn't give a lot of comments on rough drafts so you have to edit yourself. But it helps because it pushes you to proof read again and again.

Dr. Bliss is so cool: she is British, used to teach at UC Davis, but came here to help develop UC Merced. I wanted to take her for core this semester, but unfortunately it didn't work out. If I had known better though, I would've taken it and figured something else out for my other classes.
This guy sucks at teaching! all he does is read is slides! sucks at explaining. and extremely harsh on grades
good teacher willing to help when you need it.

Whew, it's the end of the semester. I took organic chemistry with her and it was so tough, but she was always at her office hours if I needed to talk to her about lecture or lab. A lot of people had a tough time but I think they didn't go to office hours or shouldn't have been in the class yet.
It's a long lecture for the summer session but she goes too fast! Like PLEASE slow down! I can't get the information i need or understand anything because she moves too fast!
Not a bad experience in his Weeds class, just make sure to feverishly take notes. 80-85% of his test questions are from lecture.

Stoddard's a prof at the UC, I took him at the JC. He's probably a fantastic prof at the UC, but his class is really lacking at the JC. Taking notes is a sizeable challenge; prepare to circle paragraphs and draw arrows pointing to other pages of notes. No study guides. He never, ever, responds to emails.  Nice guy, but frustrating class.

Prof. Sigmon had a clear layout to his course. Information was easily presented and accessible. Out of class assignments were assigned to help students better understand their cultural surroundings through a sociological lens. New concepts were introduced through the use of videos. I was always treated with respect and am glad I took his course.

I had him for SOC 185 and SOC 134. His slides are clear and to the point, midterms were easy all you needed to study was slides. The final was just another midterm, and there was a pretty easy Term Paper. There was summaries you had to write each week on the readings. He is very enthusiastic and interesting.  Would take any class with him again.

I had him for physics 8 and now i have him for physics 9 since he was the only professor for physics 9 atm. He's horrible and he has a thick accent that is nearly impossible to understand. Avoid him if possible,  his test are stupid hard and final was even harder, his curve is set at 55% for passing and its 55% for a reason, the class is horrible.

If you have Gramada, RUN. He is totally unclear in his teaching, but his curve is beautiful. It takes a 55% to pass his class, and you need it. He never explains his work and if you don't answer his questions in lecture, good luck learning. His tests are painfully hard, and his final was even worse. So if you need to take him, good luck.

Econ 116. His exams are long and they are kind of confusing. There is no study guide and he teaches straight from the readings he assigns. The way he grades is kind of confusing, I never knew what to expect.

He clearly knows what material he should teach. Attending his lecture is not mandatory, but recommand attending it. Taking a note is the greatest source to prepare exam as well as homework and mock-test.

He doesn't have the friendlies look, but he is approachable and answers questions good in office hours. But his quizzes are beyond this class and he is a harsh grader. If you take him, make sure you are ready to study and not all from the possible quiz questions. Go to discussions and ask questions, otherwise you are not gonna know anything.
His Quizzes are super hard and he grades harshly, but he'll give enough extra credit to make up for it. Office hours are a big thing, and he explains simple and to the point . But the quizzes tho ...

Professor Beattie is very kind however I would not take her class again. She never posted anything on the grade book, EVER. You find out in your student record. There's a lot of reading for her class and I found lectures boring. She's kind of unorganized but you can still keep up with what's going on. Study guides were useless.

She has a lot of personal experience related to the material and includes masculinity as a major topic in the class which I greatly appreciated.  As a guy I was scared of taking a gender and society class because I thought it was gonna be hating on guys the whole time but it wasn't the case.  Definitely loved it but it took some work to get an A!

I took Ph001 for the spring term and did not enjoy it. The class was very boring and bland. I barely showed up to class because all the notes were straight from the book. Lectures were very dry. No extra credit or homework assignments to bring up grade. Barely passed her class. Do not recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Avoid this professor at all cost. Professor Manzo is nice, but not a very great professor. She refers all questions to the book. Lectures are repetition of the book, but she adds a few things that will be on the exam. There's 5 in class and 5 take home exams. Exams are mostly on the book and very specific. Read the book religiously no readno pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I had the privilege of having Dr. Naughton as my ENVE20 professor. Easily one of the best teachers I have ever had. Extremely knowledgeable, and cares about her students learning the material

Dr. Naughton was a phenomenal lecturer. We did in-class written notes from the whiteboard and it's important to participate. She's well organized and clear about grading. Also very good replying back via email and understanding to most circumstances.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Just read the materials and attend the lecture, you'll be fine The TA is tough on students and she is very caring and nice! Easy test though
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Alegria was great, she made the lectures super engaging, she would talk about current social issues. Would take this class again.

Lectures were long and packed with information. His quizzes were never consistent in difficulty level or format, which was a bit confusing. Very knowledgable in the material he taught. Had to read the book to understand the lecture material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Wolf is such a horrible professor... He doesn't teach, he speaks very softly even with a headset, and his exams have nothing to do with what we "learn" in class. He smirks at us when questions are asked. All he does is write things on the board and bore us to death... Nothing learned all semester long...

Exams in this class are unnecessarily difficult and homework assignments do not sufficiently prepare students for the exams. There are no study guides provided for exams, so be ready to get blindsided by topics that you did not properly study for. The exams have an average of about 58% which should tell you something.

She does not share or upload notes, she just copies the material off paper and makes us copy, She does not provide a study guide for the midterms and she expects you to learn everything on your own. She also misses class a lot and most of the homework material that she says we need to go over in order to pass the midterm is not relevant or related.
Horrible. The TA's teach better than she does, they're the only reason I'm passing the class at all.

If you're taking her for math 032 you better have an understanding of statistics language. She doesn't define terms, all her writing on the board is copying straight from the book. In good news, her homework/worksheets are pretty hard. but the midterms are extremely easy compared to them. Read the book before lecture and you'll be fine
Very fun and engaging. A lot of readings, but generally a fun class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Very involved and passionate in their work. A bit of a tough grader, but most assignments are easy to get by. Very lecture heavy so attendance matters. Interesting material and never found myself bored.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: He's clearly knowledgeable & passionate about the material. He seems a bit nervous & tends to jump around while lecturing, so lectures can be hard to follow. He gives good feedback on assignments, but it can be difficult to get a direct answer when asking questions. He brings in many guest speakers, which really adds to the experience in the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Shaver is a real dope teacher. The class was focused on 3 things, two papers, and weekly reading reflections. Both papers were semi-difficult but if you go to office hours he gives great feedback on how to do well. Overall, super friendly guy and really passionate about what he teaches which radiates onto students. 10/10 recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment: Had her for BIO 5, class was somewhat disorganized due to technical issues. Gives lots of extra credit throughout class. Midterms/tests are online and open books. You can see her fascination with biology in the way she speaks.  Very informative lectures. ATTEND to receive those extra credit opportunities.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: My TA was really helpful and gave really good feedback, the class is very disorganized, not because the material is not interesting, but there's just a lot of chapters that need to be covered. I feel like it would be great to have a Genetics 2 course so that BIO-140 doesn't cover 20+ chapters. Great professor, just exams are worth a lot, and hard.

Iolanda is one of the best professors I had this semester, the courseload was heavy, but definitely manageable. Every day I was looking forward to her lectures, her clicker questions which you DON'T have to pay for made sure you understand each topic, exams were online & open note/book. I definitely recommend taking Evolution with her.

Professor Grimes is a real great professor. He gives study guides before his midterms (For his Latin American politics class it's only one midterm overall!) The papers are straight to the point and he gives awesome feedback to fix it for final submission. I would definitely recommend him if you are interested in the Comparative Politics field.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Grimes is really passionate about the material but it's difficult for an intro course. I really enjoyed the topic of his lectures, but the readings were dry and hard to understand, and the papers were pretty challenging. Ask for help from your TA's and you should be fine most of the time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Lovely professor who is willing to help you out in anything! Always looking out for students and encouraging.

Really enjoyed this class! All of the readings are accessible online and the grading rubric is very clear! Make sure to take notes... there is a quiz at the end of the semester! Prof is very nice and understanding:)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: He does a good job of breaking down topics to make them easier to understand, and he doesn't just jump into a new topic with no basis. Is very helpful and available after class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: His lectures are incredibly incoherent, and the notes he writes down are also illegible. He does not care about it though and says it's "just how it is." Can be unprofessional and will threaten your future careers if he thinks you're cheating. Cares more about catching cheaters than actually teaching his students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His lectures are bad, I was able to pass the class due to the TA. He is very serious about cheating and WILL report you. He does not care at all and is very unapproachable.

Took her over the summer and she was such a fun teacher. She is in her 20s and laughs a lot. She takes the material seriously, but is open to new perspectives and loves to sit and talk to you in office hours. Her tests are multiple choice. Se doesn't take attendance, but red the book if you don't go. She also allows extra credit.

If you have Julie for Math 15 (Introduction to Scientific Data Analysis), I have to say is good luck. The instructor does not know how to prepare us for quizzes and she releases the lecture notes until after the quizzes. She is a very power point based person as well. Most of the things that we needed for labs were pretty much in the lecture slides

Professor Corona really tries to make the material understandable.  It's helpful, because it can be difficult to read sometimes. He is funny and not bad to look at. He does give out a lot of reading material so be ready to read A LOT. He's useful during office hours.  Overall, I had a good experience in his class and I'd take him again.

This professor only reads off of the textbook and expects students to do everything online. Her teaching is sloppy and instead of translating her words she jumps right into the textbook. A majority of students in French 01 took this language in high school so this class is an easy A for them. If you ask any questions she makes you look at the book.

Anna is a really good professor. She focuses on the most important points of immunology and I definitely have a better understanding of the field. She really cares for her students and offers extra review sessions before exams (super helpful). She does curve the class if needed, and looking at her lecture slides is the best way to study.

Dr Hoyt is a very cool guy. Extremely helpful both inside and outside the classroom. He is very accessible via email and will respond quickly. You have 10 homework assignments that are worth 1 point each, three midterms that are worth 20 points, a project worth 20 points, and participation is 10 points. Total 100. Tons of extra credit Easy A for me

He is by far the most amazing TA I have ever had at UC Merced, I loved showing up to the lab it was the highlight of my week. I am really going to miss having him as a TA. He will spend as long as it takes to understand any lab assignment. It is crazy how well verse he is in CSE... I wish I could have him for all my other class.

He's one of my favorites. He's kind of young for a professor but he worked for me. I like that he doesn't get up and lecture the entire class. He loves projects and simulations. You have to be responsible /he's not going to spoon feed the idiots; it's not hard. Come to class, turn your stuff in, participate... Easy to work with.

I took Professor Butterfield, and she is the most understanding person ever. She only has one midterm and the final. As long as you go to her and actually talk to her, you'll easily pass. She really cares about her students and wants them all to succeed. Stats is hard but I would take her class again.
She was really sweet and made puns about physics. Id love to have her again for another class.

Aldenderfer is really down to earth. His lectures are basically stand up comedy shows, which makes learning even the most dense topic enjoyable. Everything covered in his slides was on the exam, the book served as a good background info but reading each ch wasnt necessary; I just studied the vocab words in it for the exams. His TAs are great too!

nacho is cool. he is really nice just try not to make him angry. he is not too old and he acts as if he was our age and bonds with us. he does grade harshly he sticks to marks strict grading criteria so just follow rubrics and you will be fine.
Circular thinker and illogical.  I honestly couldn't understand anything she said and relied on reading.  Very emotional.  Take class from someone else.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I find Caine's lectures hard to understand, especially with how fast she moves and how disrespectful she can be to some students. Granted, I am taking this class during the COVID pandemic, so perhaps in person this class would be different. I also find her to be accommodating and has weird deadlines on canvas for assignments.

I love her. She is such a caring and compassionate professor who cares about her students and puts in the time to get to know them. She is there for academic help and she is there also to listen if you have any personal problems and want to talk it out. Her material and her lectures were great. the advice she gave us was absolutely helpful.

Always welcome to help and is easy to approach which can be challenging to find in University. Even after the class I continue to speak to him and have built an outstanding mentorship with him. You won't feel that he is speaking down on you which some professors do. Overall just a great person and an excellent professor.

She genuinely cares about your mental and well being. She is amazing at communication in and out of class. She has the class vote on decisions and assignments. She also chooses GREAT readings. You really learn a lot in this class.

I had Min Lee for 151 but the only option was 135. Anyways, his lectures were 80% examples which I found very helpful. His homework was quite difficult but it was a small percentage of the grade and was graded very nicely. But his exams were difficult and were 80% of the grade, but he does curve at the end, giving 25% - 30% of the class an A.

His lectures are rich with examples and important terminology. There are two midterms and a final exam. He supports students by sharing past midterms. He encourages class participation and is approachable. Attending lectures, asking questions, and engaging in class are key. I would definitely choose to take his class again.

She's nice and does try to help you understand the assignments, BUT she's extremely picky with grading.  If your answer and work weren't identical to the answer key, she'll give you 0 points.  Lectured us every time we didn't understand something during the DISCUSSION session and blamed us having a hard time on us not attending office hours.

Class is student centered, it requires a lot of group projects. There is a lot of assignments but most of them can be completed in class, the assignments are easy they won't take long, overall its an easy class as long as you attend the lectures.

She is willing to help you when you need it. The class requires 100% attendance or you'll seriously start falling behind on the work. The class may seem difficult at times because of the work but it actually helps you out a lot. I really enjoyed this class.

She was very helpful in the labs and was willing to meet with you outside of class to clarify any doubts students had. She does follow the rules exactly as instructed by the professor so her grading is pretty fair for the most part.

There's some pretty interesting topics in the course but there was absolutely no need to have a discussion after the lecture. Tests and Final were open note/open computer which was really helpful since there really is a lot of information packed into everything.
Awesome teacher, and very cute too.  This is a lab class, so you have to come every time, but if you can read and follow instructions, it is an easy grade.
An amazing TA I have ever had in Bio. Even though he only taught the lab, he made me get interested in the subject itself. I want him for every lab I take here.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Super easy class, show up every time and you'll pass. Homework is minimal, no exams. If you need upper division credit, take this class!

He assigns articles and I don't really read them, I skim and answer them somehow yet get a good grade for it. You have to be there in class for more than 50% of the class period otherwise you'll fail the class. He lectures so much it gets boring.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor is the best, seriously is the GOAT!!! You will not regret taking Todd's classes, he is very caring about all his students, and has a very fair grading system. He is knowledgeable about all things econometrics and more.
Great engaging lectures with real world application and a harsh grader but is fair

I found him to be a bit needy when it came to discussing the course material in class. Would cut me and others off while speaking and didn't manage his responsibilities well. The class isn't difficult but the grading is less determined by the work you do and more determined by how little you annoy him. Sad!

I took his class for summer school online. He' really nice and understanding, his lectures aren't boring and don't give a tone of work. Quizzes are unlimited time and chances, so it is easier to learn when you know that wrong answer. there are also group projects at the end of every lecture but you can do them solo. they are easy too.
Is a tough grader and very strict. There is no room for mistakes, and your grade will reflect that.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This class consisted of a group presentation and lots of presentations from other professors which he assigns homework for. He drops some assignments, even though attendance is mandatory, he excuses a few. He responds really quickly to emails, however, not very understanding. His accent is hard to understand.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Easy class to take. Your looking for the GPA booster, its right here. She isn't heavy on attendance, although recommended to go to class regardless. A lot of group work and group projects. Weekly assignments, but mostly graded on completion and effort shown. Overall easy class and manageable to pass with an A.
Great Professor. Learned a lot with his classes. Would take him for sure again.

He was y BIO011 lab instructor and he was terrible to deal with. He was super condescending and if you had any questions, he would either not answer them at all or rudely ask "did you read the lab first?" every time we had questions. He should not be a lab instructor. Avoid at all costs!
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Carey was a great professor. Easy class and lectures went smooth. Definitely would take any future classes with this professor again.
took this professor for Poli 190 and the class is overall good. there is homework every week linking to the textbook but the assignments are not hard to do.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: amazing professor, he really cares about how his students are doing academically. The homework assignments and exams are fairly easily, homework assignments are a bit heavy but can get done! exams are fair, and study guides do help you prepare for it. his lectures to go by fast and sometimes speeds through the slides but he posts them anyways.
Not very enthusiastic about teaching and the lectures are very dull...A chapter a day and you NEED to read the book in order to understand the concepts
Outside of the box thinking. Interesting assignments. Inspires creativity. Genuinely cares about students.

Professor Chittamuru is newer to UCM so my Health Promotion class was the guinea pig class. She is a great professor & knows the material very well. The only problem is there's so much material to cover in such a small amount of time. There are 3 exams, 2 group projects, participation, & SONA. Read the book & readings. She does have an accent.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Jendian is obviously passionate about what he teaches, which makes class really enjoyable!

Asmeret is a known across the soil science industry. This class was informative. Get your hands on old exams and you'll do well. Get ready to read the textbook. Lectures are heavily based on the textbook and what is deemed important to learn. There's also a group presentation towards the end of the semester. All-in-all a good teacher.

If you have the opportunity to get Cayce as your professor or TA, take it. He's a great lecturer, clear and concise, and will help you with your struggles. His feedback on your work is neither condescending nor sugar-coated, and genuinely helps you improve in future work. Go above and beyond in your work and he'll make sure it won't go unnoticed.

Professor is very down to earth and understanding. He makes it really clear what he wants us to take from his classes and he wholeheartedly believes in his students. His classes are not particularly easy by any means but he formats his classes so that everyone has a good chance at grasping the material. 10/10 would recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is very helpful and always available outside of the class. He treats with respect. The quizzes are not hard but straightforward and has fair reaction papers. He repond to the questions in Zoom chat very quickly and followed up the questions even after the class to make sure we have had a good sense of the materials. Also the textbook was great.

This professor is really nice and cares about the topic she teaches. Her classes aren't hard you just have to attend class and read a lot. There are 3 midterms, and 1 big group project that is mainly in the grade book. She gives several chances for extra credit. If you are interest in learning about how old media still relates to today.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Took her online for my methods class. With the class being online and how much she tries to cover in one class, it's hard to stay engaged. The TA Eliana Fonsah is such a hard grader and impossible to please.

Professor Liang is very chill and easygoing. He makes himself available outside of class via office hours and email and is very understanding and approachable in case students have difficulty/issues in the course or in their personal lives. He is lenient if you talk to him about your situations. I did occasionally begin to get bored of the lectures
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Easy class and amazing teaching.  Little work to do but make sure to complete everything or else your grade will suffer.  Most graded stuff is usually group work or group related activities so make sure to have clear communication with your group.  There were two individual presentations (few minutes) and one group presentation (10-15 mins).

He has an intimidating aura at first but he's actually really chill. Almost all of the work is done in class, and he usually lets us out early. Not many assignments/quizzes which is nice although it means every grade adds more weight. 11/10 teacher, he is very understanding and kind. All you need to do to pass is show up and pay attention.

Jordan definitely knows his material, but he is terrible at explaining the concepts to people who do not already know them. I took this class on accident because I forgot to do the math placement exam. The whole semester I felt like I was wasting my time relearning the concepts. He uses Aleks, similar to Khan Academy so you really teach yourself.

Professor Collignon, is a nice dude and all but he doesn't necessarily teaches the subject. He is used to student already knowing everything in Math-005 (Precalc) but because he usually teaches calculus and above he goes super fast and nobody understands what he is talking about.

I hated this class nothing what I expected it to be. Do not take her class! A ridiculous amount of work for a general ed class. Very inconsiderate of students, harsh grader. Wish I took a different gasp course! Oh yeah and 40 questions on a midterm what bs..
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Professor Alcocer is a great and chill guy. The course title is different from what we do, as we had three coding assignments but if you have someone to sit down and explain it to you, you will be fine. He answered all my questions when I attended his office hours and was very welcoming! Chill guy and chill class.

Professor Alcocer, for the most part is a kind and good professor. However, the class revolves mostly around coding, and he doesn't really properly teach you how. You'll be assigned a difficult individual final assignment if you've done well in the exams, where coding is heavily involved, while everyone else does an easier group assignment.

Don't take POLI with Marco he is a rude person. Go to office hours with him and need help on a assignment he will be very rude and look at you with a angry face. Also if you do too well on the exams he will give you a separate harder final assignment than the rest of the class and not tell you ahead of time. AVOID HIM AT ALL COST

Took CSE30 with Stefano Foresti in Fall 2012. Not enough time is spent on the slides (slides seemed too short). Somewhat evasive with questions, which makes it look like he does not really know C++. Questions in office hours were often deflected to the TA. Follows the book. Labs are hard. Homeworks and Exams were OK. Make sure you have a good TA...

He's very informative and interesting, but rude. Some students have good experiences with him, but he treated me like I didn't know what I was talking about. Seemed kind of arrogant to me and likes to talk about himself. He tends to talk throughout the entire class and enjoys calling people out. I would take him again only if I have to.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Mohammad is a great person to get feedback and help from because he wouldn't just give you the answer, he would help you visualize what should be happening with the code. I went to his office hours, not just to get help on labs, but also just to chat. There are times when his explanations are confusing, however, if you for clarification, it'll help
Willing to help, but he has trouble giving clear explanations.

Moore is a great writing professor for first year students. She is so kind and hilarious. There are no tests, and one facilitation for each student( power point on our assigned reading from the book). We could come up with any way to present our powerpoints, and ended up discussing and having  great time!

New teacher, has a Korean accent. He really cares about the attendance of his students even though it's not mandatory. No textbook. Weekly assignments based on online videos and readings. Grading: weekly assignments, 1 midterm (very applied to class concepts), 1 project presentation with a group and a report that goes with it. Great overall.

Now, I have had Moran for 2 semesters in a row. Once for Plant bio and the second time for evolution. All I can say is she is a very nice lady for starters and very approachable. Her lectures at point you're gonna find yourself to bored, but good new she leaves ppt notes. Jeff is best TA. Usually 2 papers per class, and her quizzes are lecture base
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Took Amir during his first semester. He graded the class on 4 midterms, 11 quizzes, and a final. The lectures were based directly on the book, right down to the example problems and the diagrams. Amir shows little emotion but is really helpful in lectures. Attendance is not mandatory, but if you go he will tell you what to study or to skip.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Absolutely wonderful TA for SOC 015. Makes sure everyone understands what is expected of them at the start of every discussion. Takes attendance as a part of your participation grade. Fairly easy grader. All assignments were done in a group, so be ready to work with other students. She really cares about her students. You won't regret taking her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Qattawi is very understanding and helpful towards working with particular students who need it during a semester. She has very informative and interesting lectures that are always accessible, covers all curriculum on quizzes and exams, and generate student critical thinking.

The homework is based on Solidworks and modeling but the lectures are completely different by talking about hydraulic circuits, some 3d printing methods, and other things that have some slight relevance to the homework. The homework is repetitive and weekly but can be done very quickly. Exams are quite easy.

All HW is SolidProfessor. Focus on first week of assignments, all the ones that follow are mostly repeat material. It kinda felt like multiple classes in one. He only covers the surface of Design, Manufacturing methods, etc. Don't slack on the final project - will be easier if you spread it out over a month. If you can think in 3D class is easy.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: He teaches a very informative and interesting web development class. His lectures and explanations are often very clear. One of the nicest and best professors in the CSE department. Also he plays funny videos in lecture. 10/10

Class is basically a long discussion section led by students, the TA and professor just sit there and watch, they but in when they don't like something. Students are expected to read long 19 page articles and watch 1 hour documentary every week, come to class and present this information. Discussion and quizzes every week are fairly easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: This class was actually a little difficult, but that was because of the content- not the professor. My personal situation made it difficult to attend most of the lectures but prof. Lu's resources allowed me to get a B anyways. I cannot recommend him enough, as he very clearly cares about his students' success, which shows if you speak to him.

He's a bit disorganized, but Prof Lu is such a pleasure to speak with, and his lecture slides are incredibly detailed, that I cannot possibly complain about him. He and all of his TAs were incredibly helpful and quick to respond to emails.
Professor Lu is so wonderful that I'm confused as to how anybody could possibly get below a B in his classes.

Professor Lu is amazing. I won't say he is the best in teaching, just okay. His handwriting is actually not good at all. However, he really cares about students. He understands how hard the course is and tries his best to find out ways to help. Collecting feedback and discussing with students how to make the course better for the future students.
amazing teacher, his handwriting is kinda bad though, only small complaint

The professor eloquently elucidates the concept of interconnected communication, providing easily comprehensible examples. He consistently engages in discussions with students to clarify any confusion they may have. Additionally, the assignments are incredibly beneficial in enhancing our understanding of the course material.

Zenaida is an amazing professor. She cares about her student's success. The class focused on a lot of writing assignments and exercises, so be prepared to do the work. The feedback received was sometimes helpful, confusing at others, but overall I enjoyed having her as a professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: prof lopez is a great professor if you participate and actually talk to her; she's super helpful and can cater to your needs if you talk to her, but i think it would've been a way harder class if i didn't actually participate

Good professor at UC Merced.  Works off of the slides, and provides good coding examples on the projector.  Exams are hard, but fair.  He is usually available for office hours, however, keep in mind that in order to get good and helpful feedback, to ask him specific questions about the projects.

He really specifies what students should pay attention to for exams. He focuses a lot on the big picture. He always encourages students to go to his office hours. IT HELPS. Book is not really required. Go to lecture because he has valuable information that shows on his tests.

The class is not a difficult one at all. If you need help, he always makes himself available when you need it, even outside office hours. He is a different person in office hours than in lecture so I say go if you need help. Overall, you should pass fairly easily.

This professor will really make you work for a good grade in the class, especially on exams, but she curves the exams if the class didn't do well as a whole which helps a lot. Reading is necessary/mandatory. Despite this, I'd take a class with her again because her lectures are interesting/funny and she makes otherwise boring material, relevant.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: Dylan Issac Moses is a great instructor. If you show up And participate youll have a good chance of receiving an A. Great with politics and makes it interesting and fun.

Professor Meyer is an excellent faculty member at UCM, although many undergraduates felt he is difficult and/or rude. He is neither and is actually great at office hours and goes over every critical detail in organic chemistry and mechanisms.
He's an interesting guy...

Professor Balandran-Castillo was a great professor in our Latin American history class. She's passionate about what she teaches and likes to hear students input during class lectures. Readings were interesting and are very important and evolve around the course curriculum/grading.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Co-lecturer with Dulai and Oviedo. Lectures for the last third of the semester. The videos he made were very helpful for studying. Seemed to understand that we were tested too much in the class. Quizzes were near identical to the practice when he did lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Ajay tries his best to make sure his students understand concepts. Sometimes, its difficult to understand him & he misinterprets questions. However, he is very caring and if you ask him questions or ask him for the worksheets ahead of time he will provide. He also helps with the labs and makes sure youre doing them right.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Participation matters--Caring

comment: Josh is a great professor and he's down to earth. There were 5 HW assignments in the first half of the semester and then we had guest lectures. Even though it's a 3 unit course, be prepared to work hard in the last 3-4 weeks of the semester. Two midterms, 1 final, a final paper and a final project. I learned a lot in the course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: She is the most difficult Professor I've ever had to deal with. She claimed that attendance was non-mandatory, and then graded us on attendance. Many students emailed her about grades and even then she refused to be more lenient. Did not take into consideration that Zoom classes are difficult as is, and made me feel helpless throughout the semester

Professor Kurtz gives easy to follow, simplistic lectures that clearly explain the subject at hand. Quizzes are not announced beforehand (terrifying) but it is possible to make them up in office hours. Labs make up the majority of class time, and you are expected to design your own experiments. Kurtz provides incredible feedback on labs.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Taylor was great. She is one of the professors that I'll remember the most. She left but when she did she still accepted emails from students at her new job. I liked he class alot. I had some trouble with it but she kept working with me. Never got mad or nothing.

This was China and the global order. 1 group project, 1 final paper, and discussions throughout the semester. Many readings but most are unnecessary (no quizzes/exams). You can tell he is passionate about the material, but it doesn't rub off on the students. Want an easy-ish A class that's boring with extremely leftist lectures? Take this class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: All assignments were helpful to reopen understanding about class and the professor is very approachable for any questions, really enjoyed learning from them.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Cisernos only gave three midterms and one group presentation project. Midterms are all online and he has no final. I would say the class was straightforward where it was only graded by a few things like 3 midterms and a group project, and attendance was taken at random so attend lectures. I would recommend finishing the group project early.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Very nice professor but can be hard to understand. Office hours are very useful because she will go over anything in extensive detail and work out problems step by step (you just have to ask). Bonus quizzes in lecture that could add up to 10% of your grade. Exams aren't bad, similar to practice, and you're able to bring a cheat sheet.
THe teacher englishg is very bed. but she did not support her student. do not recommend to be her student.

Our classmates call him the Greek prof; and so, there is a small language barrier. However, that is not really a big problem but still significant to mention. His format for exams help student to get good grades easier as long as they study. For the Matlab part, if you don't know Matlab or coding, you will need to put a lot of effort on this part.

She's a great math professor, her lectures are straightforward and really easy to understand. Her TAs and LAs are really helpful during discussions and office hours so shoutouts to them. Her test are mastery based so if you do happen to bomb one of the questions, you can always retake it during the exams.

The lectures were easy to follow, and the types of problems we worked on were very similar to what was seen on quizzes and midterms. There was little homework, and the problems were typically simple. She used a mastery system for midterms and final. Once you got a topic correct, you never had to do that type of question again.

Amazing professor that is kind and listens to her students, especially in office hours. Midterms and the final were short mastery questions that could be retaken. Handwrites notes and provides them after class. Recommend if u want easy-going experience with few HW and no lecture quizzes.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Awesome explaining. Super helpful
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Walks through a ton of examples during lectures, goes over the problem-solving process, and is extremely accessible to set-up office hours with him. He constantly motivates students to perform their best and as long as you put in effort, he is understanding and is not an extremely harsh grader. Two exams equal 80% of your grade (40% each).

okay so the total grade is exam heavy as its 40% midterm and 40% final, but i think prof really teaches well and he gives out quiz right before the exams, so you have an idea if you're prepared for the exam or not. he's not a tough grader at all and he actually cares about students. so as long as you're going to his lectures i think you'll be fine.

It's an easy class you'll be doing in-class group activities that are super easy and all his assignments are self-explanatory. If you need help or someone to talk to go to his Office hours because he cares about all his students and wants them to pass. Btw he'll eventually learn your name so he'll notice if you're not there.

His lectures were awfully boring. Sometimes we were given CW to do w help in the discussions, but it'd better if the entirety of the discussions were like that instead of being 90% lecture. Also, exams were too long to finish. Plus, we had a required in-person class during the week of Thanksgiving. He does give some extra credit and freebies tho.

Brian is a great professor who actually cares about how well you do in the class. He's always available outside of class if you need help understanding a topic. His midterms aren't too hard and are graded very leniently. He also curves which is very nice. I would recommend taking phys 009 with him if you get the chance.

Too quiet even if you sit near the front

Takes 5 to 20 % off per problem for the smallest errors

Does not work through problems in class

90% grade = exams
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy
